description: JVC America, Inc., of Mas peth, Queens, announced yester day the development of what it called the world's first four channel phonograph and sound reproducing system.

title: FOAM SEALS KEKICIFS VICTORY
description: Lindy McDaniel helped to make secure another victory for the New York Yankees yes terday, this one a 32 decision credited to Mike Kekich at the expense of Dave McNally, who had already won 21 games for the Baltimore Orioles. Before a crowd of 20,008, which brought Yankee Stadium attendance past the million mark for the 25th consecutive year, McDaniel took over after the Yankees had produced a threerun rally with two out and nobody on base in the sev enth inning. A tworun double by Horace Clarke provided the winning margin.

title: Lubovitch Dancers Perform Ecstasy At Festival in Park
description: Ecstasy is a number of things, one of which is a dance by Lar Lubovitch. Last night at the New York Dance Festival in Central Park's Delacorte Theater, Mr. Lubovitch present ed his company in the work for the first time this season.

title: Business Records
description: Business Records

title: STAR TO RECEIVE $125,000 SALARY
description: Rick Barry, who has spent more time in court than on the court the last three years, was traded to the New York Nets yesterday by the Virginia Squires for a No. 1 draft choice and an undisclosed amount of cash.

title: BRITISH RESERVES OFF LAST MONTH
description: LONDON, Sept. 2 (Reuters) British gold and dollar re serves fell by only 18million ($43.2million) last month de spite the adverse economic ef fects of strikes and pressure on the pound, it was an nounced today.

title: Books of The Times
description: The S. J. Perelman story, like the Godard film, is a mode of proof, an assertion of accuracy in the spirit of maximum vehe mence. The Perelman speech is purified and condensed by disparateness, a speech of need. The Perelman world is a world of aggression, beautiful as Lautreamont de fined beauty: The fortuitous encounter of a sewing machine and an umbrella on a dissecting table. Why, then, isn't Perelman taken seriously? He knows more about the instant character of Camp than Susan Sontag. He was throwing around the purely verbal artifact 20 years before Richard Gilman pumped The New Republic full of William Gass. Yet he is trivialized as a m ere humorist.

title: SANDERS IS NEXT; 5 ARE TIED AT 69
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Sept. 2 (UPI)  Lanny Wadkins, the Southern and Western golf champion from Wake Forest, shot an openinground three underpar 34, 3367 in the National Amateur today and took the lead by a stroke over Gary Sanders of Southern Cali fornia.

title: Black Gang Leader Held In a Chicago Police Killing
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 2 (AP) The police charged a member of the ruling body of the Black P Stone Nation street gang to day with the sniper murder of a Chicago policeman.

title: STOCKS IN LONDON CONTINUE TO FALL
description: The London stock market continued to decline yesterday as trading remained quiet.

title: Major League Box Scores
description: Major League Box Scores

title: Legion Bids Congress Propose Restrictions on Supreme Court
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Sept. 2 The American Legion's national convention urged Congress to day to propose constitutional amendments limiting the author ity of the Supreme Court.

title: Princeton Eleven's Chief Topic: How to Win With Limitations
description: BLAIRSTOWN, N.J., Sept. 2 It's centennial year plus one at Princeton's secluded summer football camp, and while things are not quite as hectic as last season, winning is still the No. 1 topic on the agenda of Jake McCandless, the Tiger coach.

title: Paul Crowell, Reporter, Dies; Covered City Hall for Times
description: SARASOTA, Fla., Sept. 2 Paul Crowell, who retired in 1965 after 36 years as a re porter for The New York, Times, most of the time at New York's City Hall, died yesterday of a heart attack while on a visit here. He was 78 years old and lived at 151 West 16th Street, New York.

title: Monetary Tensions
description: PARIS, Sept. 2Increasingly speculative money is flowing into Europe's hardcurrency centers as monetary officials, brace themselves for a tense autumn. As in many past autumns the pound sterling has again become a problem. Part of this reflects the drain on British reserves resulting from the seasonal needs of the sterling area, for which London still acts as banker. Part reflects the recur rence of domestic economic difficultiesthe dock strikes, auto strikes and inflation that weaken the British export performance.

title: L.I. Bank to Meet on Merger
description: The Security National Bank of Huntington, L. I., said yes terday a shareholders meetipg has been scheduled for Oct. 28 to vote on the previously pro posed merger of the Royal Na tional Bank of New York into Security National. Royal Na tional shareholders are also scheduled to meet on Oct. 28.

title: Connoisseur of Mayors
description: Paul Crowell saw a long line of Mayors come and go, having covered the administrations of all of them from James J. Walk er to Robert F. Wagner during his years on the City Hall beat.

title: Good Start on Desegregation
description: The heroes of this week's school opening in the South were a Republican Governor and a seventeen yearold Negro high school student. Virginia's Gov. Linwood Holton Jr. personally accompanied his thir teenyearold daughter to the hitherto allblack John F. Kennedy High School in Richmond; Gregory Thomas, commanding officer of the, school's corps of cadets, taking apprehensive white students in tow, told them: This is now your school, too.

title: Foreign Exchange
description: Wednesday, September 2, 1970

title: Bomb Threat Shuts Bridge
description: NYACK, N. Y., Sept. 2The Tappan Zee Bridge of the Gov. Thomas E. Dewey State Thru way between South Nyack and Tarrytown was closed at 9 P.M. tonight because of a telephoned bomb threat. All northbound traffic through Westchester was rerouted onto Route 9 to the Bear Mountain Bridge, and all southbound traffic on the west side of the Hudson River was rerouted on Route 9W to the George Washington Bridge. Tappan Zee was reopened at 11 P.M.

title: Census Bureau Explains Revisions for Connecticut
description: Revised counts in six of Confiecticut's eight counties were reported yesterday by the Census Bureau in Washington to explain the change from its first report of 2,990,196 resi dents in the state in 1970 to its latest tally of 2,987,950.

title: Home Builder Retrenches
description: GREENSBORO, N. C., Sept. 2 (UPI)The Key Company has closed its mobilehome plant in Clearwater, Fla., and consoli dated its operations into its Tampa, Fla., manufacturing plant, thereby cutting employ ment in its mobilehome oper ations by 100 to 150 people.

title: City Refuses Talks With 25 Physicians Still Off Their Job
description: Dr. Joseph T. English, presi dent of the city's Health and Hospitals Corporation, said yes terday that there would be absolutely no negotiations with the physicians who walked off their jobs at Lin coln Hospital until they are back on the job.

title: NATIVE PARTNER BELMONT VICTOR
description: The left hand made the difference, said Frank Wright yesterday after the Oxford Stable's Native Partner won the $28,800 Maskette Handicap at Belmont Park.

title: Chess:
description: During the recent 18man roundrobin hlternational at Buenos Aires, three players did not lose a game. The high scorer in this respect was Bobby Fischer of the United States, grandmaster extraordinary and the win ner of the event with 13 victories and four draws for a 152 score.

title: HOME DEVICE READY TO TAPE TV SHOWS
description: The Ampex Corporation, which first developed tape rec ording for the TV industry, an nounced yesterday a line of miniature tape recorders and playback machines for home or industrial use.

title: 3,000 Tickets Available For GiantsEagles Contest
description: There are still 3,000 tickets at $4 each left for Saturday's GiantEagle football game at Princeton, N.J., according to the New Jersey Jaycees, spon sors of the game.

title: New Books
description: Beyond This Point Are Monsters, by Margaret Millar (Random House, $4.95). Suspense.

title: 2 Sisters From Isle of Wight Here to Judge Kerry Terriers
description: So eager are fanciers of Kerry blue terriers to have Phyllis Parry judge their dogs that one of the largest en tries of the breed to compete in the East55will be seen at the specialty show Sunday at the Westchester Kennel Club event in Croton Point Park. CrotononHudson, N. Y. Miss Parry, a Kerry devotee for near iy a halfcentury, and her sister, Betty, world au thorities on the breed, are here from the Isle of Wight, England, on their first visit to America.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Angelo A. Simonetti Is Dead; A Tammany Leader 30 Years
description: Angelo A. Simonetti, a Democratic district leader in Manhattan for about 30 years and a senior administrator of lithe Board of Elections, died yesterday after a short illness at Harkness Pavilion, Columbia Presbyterian Medical Center. He was in his early seventies and lived at 765 Riverside Drive.

title: MUSEUM MAY KEEP DIALAPOEM PHONES
description: Public response to a novel telephone service, part of a current art show, Informa tion, at the Museum of Mod ern Art, may induce museum officials to retain the service after the show closes on Sept. 20.

title: A New Mortgage Venture Enters Housing Markets
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2A major new entity in the na tion's financial and housing markets came into being today.

title: U.S. Jet Explosion Kills 3
description: SAIGON, Thursday, Sept. 3 Three Americans were killed and 14 wounded In the fiery explosion of a Marine Corps Phantom jet fighterbomber at Danang air base, the United States command said today.

title: TODAY'S PROBABLE PITCHERS
description: Baltimore at New York (8 P.M.) Palmer (188) vs. Stottlemyre (1211).

title: Belmont Entries
description: Belmont Entries

title: Spending Plans for Year Cut by Business
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2As widely anticipated, business has again revised downward its plans for investment in plant and equipment this year, the Commerce Department and the Securities and Exchange Com mission reported today.

title: South Africa Seeks Nooses
description: PRETORIA, South Africa, Sept. 2 (UPI)A Government notice yesterday informed man ufacturers of hangman's nooses that the closing date for sub mitting bids to supply the rope is Sept. 28. Lhst year 107 per sons were hanged in South Africa for crimes.

title: ALLEGRA KENT BOWS IN JEWELS BALLET
description: Allegra Kent, who has been dancing particularly well in the current summer New York City Ballet season at the State Thea ter, made her debut in the Diamonds role of George Ba lanchine's Jewels at a spe cial matinee yesterday.

title: TOM EVANS, 74, DIES; TRUMAN COUNSELOR
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Sept. 2 (AP)Tom L. Evans, longtime friend of former President Hatry S. Truman and former owner lot the Crown Drug Company and KCMO Broadcasting. Com. pant here, died of cancer last night. He was 74 years old.

title: CITY SAYS NO JOB NEED BE DEAD END
description: Representatives of civic, trade and labor groups met with city administrators yes terday and declared that no category of job needs to be a dead end.

title: British Scientist Doubts Mass Higher Education's Aim
description: LONDON, Sept. 2A Nobel Prizewinning chemist tonight urged a strengthening of the academic elite and ques tioned the desirability of tradi tional mass higher education.

title: MITCHELL AIDES TO VISIT COLLEGES
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2 Teams of Justice Department officials will fan out across the country next month in an effort to convince college students that the Justice Department's policies are not repressive to ward criminal suspects or luke warm on civil rights.

title: Extortion Suspect Arrested
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 2 (UPI) An unemployed car sales man was arrested today by Federal agents on suspicion of threatening to blow up a Trans World Airlines plane unless he was paid $20,000. The F.B.I. said the suspect, Lowell Fran cis McDonald, 40 years old, had been arrested on the steps in front of Hollywood High School as he opened a T.W.A. flight bag supposedly filled with the money.

title: 2 Get 20 Days for Profanity
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., Sept. 2 Two young men who were charged with disorderly con duct for using profanity during the Billy Graham service at which President Nixon spoke at the University of Tennessee in May were sentenced today to 20 days in the workhouse. City Judge Jesse Butler denied mo tions for dismissal of the charges against Charles Conrad Browne and Terry Reynolds.

title: Jets and Giants, Floundering, Decide to Curb Experimentation
description: With both floundering after a month of camp, the Jets and Giants have decided that now is the time for all good players to come to the aid of their re spective teams.

title: ARTHUR J. COSTIGAN, RADIO INNOVATOR,76
description: GLEN COVE, L. I., Sept 2 Arthur J. Costigan, a retired vice president in the radio marine department of the RCA Corporation, died yesterday at the Montclair Nursing Home here. He was 76 years ald and formerly lived in Brooklyn.

title: Nixon's Housing Policy
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2  President Nixon's statement of last March 24 on school deseg regation is emerging as an ele ment of the Administration's policy for opening white sub urbs to poor blacks.

title: MRS. JOHN F. MURRAY
description: SOUTHAMPTON, L. L, Sept. 2 Mrs. Marie (Mimi) Harriman Murray, an artist and wife of John F. Murray, an author, died yesterday after a brief illness at Southampton Hospital. She was 45 years old and lived in Wainscott and at 108 East 82d Street, New York.

title: Eagles Release Baker
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 2 (AP) Sam Baker, the second lead ing scorer in National Football League history, was released by the Philadelphia Eagles today. The 39yearold Baker scored 977 points on 179 field goals, 428 extra points and two touchdowns to rank second behind Lou Groza, who scored 1,349 career points.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Veterans. The President, at the Western White House, signed a bill authorizing the Government to furnish head $tones for the graves of Medal of Honor recipients and a bill authorizing the presentation of a flag to the parents and spouses of de ceased servicemen.

title: ESSO UNITS IN LIBYA TOLD TO CUT OUTPUT
description: The Standard Oil Company (New Jersey) said yesterday that its Libyan affiliates had been ordered to cut oil pro duction by 110,000 barrels a day, or about 15 per cent.

title: HENRY VAN R. SCHEEL
description: EAST HAMPTON, Conn., Sept. 2  Henry Van Riper Scheel, a former vice president of Botany Worsted Mills and a consulting engineer, who had been active in the scientific management field, died Sunday. He was 88 years old.

title: PRICES ADVANCE IN AMEX TRADING
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange ended mostly higher yesterday as an after noon rally erased most of the earlier losses in slightly steppedup trading.

title: Deaths
description: Deaths

title: New Zealand Offers To Help Pay Fares Of U.S. Emigrants
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand, Sept. 2New Zealand officially opened her doors today to American migrants wishing to come under a subsidized immi gration program.

title: SENATE TO CONSIDER POPULAR VOTE PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2 (AP) A constitutional amendment to priavipe for the election of the President by direct, popular vote Was made the pending business today for the Senate when it returns Sept. 8 from Its Labor Day recess.

title: Pennzoil Develops Process
description: HOUSTON, Sept. 2 (UPI)  Pennzoil United, Inc., has de veloped a process for producing a new series of fertilizers, called potassium polyphosphate. It said the process allows eco nomic production of high grade potassium phosphate fertilizer compounds.

title: HIGHER CON ED RATES TO BEGIN ON TUESDAY
description: ALBANY, Sept. 2The Pub lic Service Commission an nounced today that it had au thorized the Consolidated Edi son Company to increase its residential electric rates next Tuesday by an average of about 4 per cent.

title: Extension of Debt For 18 Months Set By Conglomerate
description: The Commonwealth United Corporation, a troubled West Coast conglomerate, has staved off for 18 months payment on more than $50million in prin cipal and interest of its debts to major domestic and foreign secured lenders.

title: City Plans to Use Piers as a Cultural Playground
description: An experimental plan to transform part of New York's dowdy old waterfront tempo rarily into a cultural and rec reational playground was an nounced, yesterday by Mayor Lindsay.

title: 2 MOON LANDINGS DROPPED BY NASA IN ECONOMY MOVE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2The National Aeronautics and Space Administration canceled two lunar landings today in a move that NASA officials said would cut deeply into the scientific value of the Apollo program.

title: Bridg:
description: A new season is beginning for the three commercial bridge leagues in the metro politan area. The biggest of these is the Metropolitan Commercial Bridge League, which will operate on a new plan: teams will be of eight players, instead of 12.

title: Edinburgh Drama Recitals Evoke Lives of 2 Queens
description: EDINBURGH, Scotland, Sept 1  Theatrically, this seems to be Britain's yearfor Mary Stuart and Elizabeth Tudor. Not only has there been Robert Bolt's play at Chichester, now about to open in London, Vivat! Re gina! which lovingly ex plored the relationship be tween those royal ladies, but also now in Edhiburg both Queens provide the subject matter for a brace of recitals at this year's Edinburgh fes tivals.

title: Coast Forest Fires Curbed
description: WENATCHEE, Wash., Sept. 2 (AP)Forest Service spokes man said today that 700 fires sparked by weekend lightning storms had dwindled, leaving a blaze in the Wenatchee Na tional Forest as the only un contained major fire. Its con tainment was expected by Fri day, the Forest Service said.

title: Movie on Tchaikovsky Begins Run in Moscow
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 2 (AP) Tchaikovsky, a Soviet American movie production, opened to the Soviet public tonight after an advertising campaign the likes of which have rarely been seen in the press here.

title: U.A.W. Selects Both G.M. and Chrysler as Its Strike Targets
description: DETROIT, Sept. 2  The United Automobile Workers said today that Goneral Motors or the Chrysler Corporation or both would be struck at mid night Sept. 14 if the auto union did not have a new contract by then.

title: Foe Reinforces Srang
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Sept. 2 (UPI)Enemy reinforcements were reported to have moved through surrounding mountains into Srang, 26 miles south west of Pnompezili, in the fourth day of the battle for the town. The enemy was reported to have taken Srang Sunday.

title: I Charcoal Warning Proposed
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2 (UPI) The Food and Drug Adminis tration proposed today that charcoal and charcoal briquets be required to carry this label: Warqing, may cause death if used indoors or in confined areas due to formation of car bon monoxide.

title: Major League Baseball
description: Thursday, Sept. 3, 1970

title: Facts on U.S. Open
description: SITEWest Side Tennis Club, 1 Tennis Place, Forest Hills, Queens.

title: Goldberg Asks Labor in State TO Reject Recession Makers
description: KIAMESHA LAKE, N. Y., Sept. 2Arthur J. Goldberg, the DemocraticLiberal candi date for Governor, made a strong bid today for endorse ment, by the 1,500 delegates attending the annual conven tion here of the New York State American Federation of LaborCongress of Industrial Organizations.

title: Chanteymen Offering Audiences a Taste of the Sea at Pier on South Street
description: Every Tuesday evening since early summer, when ever the skies are fair, the sound of sea chanteys has been rising from the South Street Seaport pier at Ful ton Street and the East River.

title: Executive Changes
description: F. Joseph Van Poppelen Jr., has been named group vice president for the systems technology, space and defense systems, defense products, indus trial products, graphic equipment, DuMont electron tubes and controls divisions as well as the Electra. Metrics Corporation, a Fairchild Camera and In strument Corporation subsidiary. M. M. Atalla, named group vice president in charge of research and development while retaining his former divi sional responsibilities.

title: Stones Hurled at Pope; Suspect Hospitalized
description: ROME, Sept. 2A man threw two stones at Pope Paul VI today at the end of the Pontiff's general audi ence at his Castel Gandolfo summer home. The stones missed the Pope by three feet and hit the wall be hind his throne. Vatican of ficials said he was not im mediately aware of the inci dent.

title: Israel Said to Give U.S. 2 Weeks to Honor Pledge
description: JERUSALEM, Sept. 2Au thoritative sources said today that the divided Israeli Cabinet had decided, in a compromise, to wait about two weeks to determine whether the United States could fulfill its assur ances that the present cease fire would not bring military advantage to the Egyptians.

title: Marian Blum Bride Of Marvin Gruber
description: Miss Marian Blum, public ity director of the Girl Scout Council of Greater New York, was married here last eve ning to Marvin S. Gruber, assistant controller of the First Security Company.

title: COLT OVERCOMES A COUGHING SPELL
description: DU QUOIN, Ill., Sept. 2At noon today, Timothy T. was a coughing, red  throated colt with a worried driver (John Simpson Jr.) and an even more worried owner  trainer (John Simpson Sr.).

title: President Praises Smooth Transition In South's Schools
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Sept. 2  President Nixon today hailed the relatively smooth de segregation of hundreds of Southern school districts and, in the process, complimented the news media.

title: Doctor Named Assistant To City Hospitals Chief
description: Dr. Joseph T. English, presi dent of the city's Health and Hospitals Corporation, an nounced the appointment of Dr. Michael R. McGarvey as his principal assistant yesterday.

title: OutofTown Exchanges
description: OutofTown Exchanges

title: Cholera and Politics
description: Cholera has reached disturbing dimensions in many parts of the world. The Soviet Union has mounted an energetic campaign to confine the disease to its southern areas. Israel and its Arab neighbors have reported victims, as has South Korea which closed beaches near Pusan after several persons died of cholera. Cholera deaths are, of course, an old story in such other countries as Indonesia, India and Paki stan. Now health and immigration officials in Europe, the Americas and much of Africa are on the alert to try to prevent the ailment's spread.

title: F.D.A. TO ESTABLISH LEVELS ON NUTRITION
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2 (UPI) The Food and Drug Admin istration announced today that it would set nutritional guide lines for processed foods rang ing from breakfast cereal to frozen dinners.

title: 2 Armed Men Invade Ramapo Police Station
description: TALLMAN, N. Y., Sept. 2  Two armed men, their features disguised by ski masks, walked into the Ramapo Police Headquarters here early today, handcuffed the desk sergeant and hit him on the head.

title: Panama Tells U.S. That Proposed Canal Treaties Are Unacceptable
description: PANAMA CITY, Sept. 1 Panama has formally notified the United States that three draft treaties drawn up in 1967 to create a new status for the Panama Canal are unacceptable as a basis for resuming nego tiations.

title: Thuy Rules Out Plan
description: PARIS, Sept. 2 A recom mendation by 14 United States Senators for a ceasefire was virtually ruled out today by Xuan Thuy, head of the North Vietnamese delegation at the peace talks.

title: Braniff Airways Picks New Operating Chief
description: Braniff Airways, Inc., an nounced yesterday the elec tion of C. Edward Acker, 41 years old, as president and chief operating officer. Hard ing L. Lawrence who had held the posts continues as chair man and chief executive of ficer.

title: G.M.'s Public Role
description: If General Motors shows new concern for automobile safety improvements and antipollution devices sooner rather than later, the appointtnent of five of its own directors to a special public policy committee will be welcomed as an example of corporate responsibility. If the Company puts most of its concern into explain ing why deadlines for safer, smogfree cars cannot be met, the public is likely to dismiss the new G. M. com mittee as mere windowdressing.

title: Bonita Gail Zeese Is Engaged To Marry Dodge O. Dorland
description: HUNTINGTON, L. I., Sept. 2Mr. and Mrs. Herbert Hoffman Zeese Jr. have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Bonita Gail Zeese, to Dodge Oatwell Dorland. He is the son of Mrs. Joseph Warner Dorland of New York and Southamp ton, and the late Mr. Dorland, who was president and founder of Wade and Dorland, Inc., an insurance brokerage, and vice president of Davis Dorland, Inc., in New York. A December wedding is planned.

title: Mrs. Pogue, Wall St. Aide Marry Here
description: Mrs. Nancy Hadra Pogue and Michael Gourd were mar ried here yesterday afternoon in Christ Methodist Church by the Rev. George Teague.

title: Computer Show Fascinating to and by the Numbers
description: Twelveyearold Chana Stein crashlanded on the moon, Mrs. Consuelo Milner decided how to improve her mathematics classes and 13yearold William Gilson made a big impression with his computer bum skills.

title: Federal Reserve Approves British Bank's Stock Move
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2The Federal Reserve Board, in an unusual case under the Bank Holding Company Act, ap proved today the purchase of shares in one British bank by another.

title: Municipal Hospitals Issue Urgent Plea For Blood Donors
description: Blood for transfusions, chron ically in short supply here dur ing summer vacation months and long holiday weekends, was reported yesterday to be at a desperately low level.

title: Lindsay Apologizes for Remark About Bridgeport's Dirty Areas
description: Mayor Lindsay asked the Mayor of Bridgeport yesterday to forgive him for suggesting that the Connecticut city was as filthy as New York.

title: Chile Bars Times Reporter, Charging Hostile Articles
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Sept. 2 (UPI)The Government barred Malcolm W. Browne, a corres pondent of The New York Times, from entering Chile last night on the ground that he had written defamatory articles about the country.

title: Chrysler Recalls 1,278 Cars For Inspection for Defects
description: DETROIT, Sept. 2 (AP)  Chrysler Corporation announced today it was recalling 1,372 cars for inspection for possible defeats.

title: Pan Am Weighing Move From Midtown to Suburb
description: Pan American World Air ways is weighing the possibil ity of moving all or part of its administrative operations from New York City to the suburbs.

title: More Policemen Demanded in. Greenwich Village
description: Angry shopkeepers and resi dents of Greenwich Village, as serting they are suffering from rising crime in the area, de manded yesterday that the city give them more police protec tion and stop housing single men on welfare in local tran sient hotels.

title: Outlook at a Glance
description: PROSPECTSA winning season but not a Lambert year.

title: Delta Faces Rights Boycott
description: ATLANTA, Sept. 2 (UPI) The Southern Christian Leader ship Conference, pushing for the hiring of more black pilots and stewardesses, announced today an economic boycott against Delta Air Lines. Delta officials denied charges made by the conference that the com pany had systematically re fused to hire Negroes above the level of maintenance person nel.

title: Mayor Says Check Shows Census Missed Thousands
description: Mayor Lindsay made public yesterday spot reports from 24 areas in which 311 of 1,808 persons interviewedor 17 per centsaid they had not been counted in the Federal census. The same assertion came from 66 of 362 families questioned, or 18 per cent.

title: Yonkers Entries
description: Yonkers Entries

title: LATE SURGE TRIMS BIG BOARD LOSSES
description: Stock prices recovered from a sinking spell at midsession yesterday and managed to close only a shade lower. Volume on the New York Stock Exchange continued to ebb with the dip in prices.

title: Baruch Dean Accepts Post
description: The. Board of Higher Educa tion has appointed Dr. Jerome B. Cohen, dean of the School of Business and Public Admin istration of Baruch College, as the institution's acting presi dent. Although Dr. Cohen had earlier declined to serve as the college's fulltime president, he agreed to accept the acting position until a permanent president could be named.

title: Tentative Accord Reached In British Auto Plant Strike
description: LONDON, Thursday, Sept. 3 (Reuters)Union and manage ment officials today agreed on a formula to end the strike at the G.K.N.Sankey auto com ponents plant, which has seri ously disrupted the British car industry.

title: TAKES OVER CONTROL OF BANK
description: LIMA, Peru, Sept. 1 (Reu ters)  The Peruvian Govern ment last night acquired a controlling interest in a previ ously foreigncontroled bank, its second such move within a week in a quiet campaign of bank nationalization.

title: Bureaucracy May Drive Tavern Owner to Drink
description: ROCHESTER, Sept. 2 (AP) Vince Turiano, owner of the Towpath Inn, a tavern in downtown Rochester, re ceived two letters from the city this week.

title: Villagers Returning to Street Without Joy
description: TRUNGTHANH, Sputh Viet nam, Aug. 28The Street With out Joy is still not much fun, but at least it has begun to stir with village life again.

title: Upstate Board Validates McCarthy's Candidacy
description: BUFFALO, Sept. 2 (AP)The Erie County Board of Elections accepted today the nominating petitions of Representative Richard Max McCarthy, a Dem ocrat, who is seeking reelection in November as an independent.

title: Floods Kill 20 in Nigeria
description: CALABAR, Nigeria, Sept. 2 (AP)Twenty people have been killed in floods that have left tens of thousands homeless in Nigeria's SouthEastern State, officials reported today.

title: Weather Outlook: Month of September
description: Weather Outlook: Month of September

title: OnceBustling Rangoon Now Quiet and Crumbling
description: RANGOON, Aug. 22You can still ear their pad dies chunkin on the Rangoon River.

title: Dividends Announced
description: Dividends Announced

title: FORD CAPRI WINS CLEAN CAR RACE
description: PASADENA, Calif., Sept. 2 A 1971 Ford Capri, modified to reduce smog emissions, was declared the over winner of the intercollegiate cross country clean car race to night.

title: Kretchmer Promises Much Cleaner City in 60 Days
description: Jerome Kretchmer, the city's Environmental Protection Ad ministrator, said yesterday that the city was cleaner than it was a month ago and that within 60 days there would be such an improvement that it would be visible all over the city.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: To the Editor: It is long past the time to register dismay, anger, utter dis enchantment and moral revul sion toward the conscious choice of violent techniques and violence itself by extremists on college campuses. [Editorial Aug. 25.]

title: ARAFAT BERATES AMMAN OFFICIALS
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Sept. 2 Yasir Arafat, the principal Arab commando chief, today de bounced what he termed ugly gression by the Jordanian authorities. He spoke a few flours after the authorities had expressed a desire to strength en the brotherhood between the army and the commandos.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
CATHOLICS MAY TAKE WINE AT COMMUNION
description: ROME, Sept. 2The Vatican relaxed today the restrictions that prevented Catholic lay men from taking wine along with bread at communion, giving to local conferences of bishops jurisdition over what was once a major theological controversy.

title: First of Huge Buoys Is Installed Here
description: The first of seven buoys designed to replace lightships reported for duty off Sandy Hook, N.J'ester day.

title: Gatteridge Is Released As White Sox Manager
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 2 (UPI} Don Gutteridge was released as manager of the Chicago White Sox today at his re auest.

title: Nancy C. Dowling to Be Bride Of William C. Petty 3d, Yale 63
description: Nancy C. Dowling to Be Bride Of William C. Petty 3d, Yale 63

title: Jersey's Ocean County Not Surprised by Rapid Rate of Growth
description: TOMS RIVER, N. J., Sept. 1  If the people of Ocean Coun ty weren't shouting we're No. 1 today it was probably be cause virtually everyone here has known for years that, on a percentage basis, Ocean is the fastest growing county in the United States.

title: ROCKEFELLER PLANS ACTION ON WATER
description: SYRACUSE, Sept. 2Gover nor Rockefeller tonight identi fied seven major remaining challenges in the state's Pure Water program and promised fast action to overcome them.

title: SEAVER FANS 11 FOR 181 TRIUMPH
description: ST. LOUIS, Sept. 2St. Louis is having its troubles these days. The city has just been advised it fell from the top 10 in population in the census. A cobra escaped from the zoo this week and the New York Mets even beat Bob Gib son the other night.

title: Observer: A Tiny Dissent on Women's Lib
description: LONDON, Sept. 2One field in which the oppression of women has been healthy for the common good is the newspaper column. Here the rule that woman must be at least twice as good as a competing man to get the job they both want has spared the reading public at least a modicum of twaddle. The rare woman who suc ceeds to a newspaper column is so extraordinarily good that, unlike her male competitor who prospers on smaller ability, she never seems obliged on days when her brain is marking time to fill space with material about her pets, her family or her household.

title: Back in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, Thursday, Sept. 3Vice President Agnew arrived here early this morning.

title: CURBS IN PRISON FACE CHALLENGE
description: A New York State prisoner recently was punished for writ ing in his diary that he did not like the deputy warden.

title: Mrs. Gandhi Wins Crucial Vote and Rajas Will Lose Allowances
description: NEW DELHI, Sept. 2The rajas, India's princely former rulers, lost their battle with the Government today as the lower Muse of parliament voted to abolish their allowances and other special privileges.

title: Calm G.M. Negotiator
description: DETROIT, Sept. 2During the tense weeks ahead when General Motors and the United Automobile Workers will try to hammer out a con tract agreement, a gray haired man will pull his hat over his eyes, put his feet on a table and catnap during the caucus breaks. He is Earl Ralph Bramblett, director of bar gaining strategy for G.M., who has been in auto ne gotiations since 1947. And no one can re member him ever losing his temper.

title: Migrant Farm Workers Propose 10
description: TRENTON, Sept. 2Spokes men for migrant farm workers in southern New Jersey pre sented a list of 10 legislative proposals to the Acting Gov ernor today, seeking as key changes in the law a $1.75 anhourminimum wage and free access to workers camps by friends, relatives and other visitors.

title: WORLD EXPORTS RISE 13% IN 2D QUARTER
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2 World trade continued to boom in the second quarter of this year, the International Mone tary Fund reported today.

title: Rail Union Postpones Strike
description: DETROIT, Sept. 2 (UPI) The Brotherhood of Mainte nance of Way Employes, rep resenting 130,000 members, an nounced today that a strike set for Sept. 10 had been post poned because new wage talks will begin Sept. 8. The union members build and maintain the racks, buildings and bridges on the railroads of the United States and Canada.

title: SMITH BEATS LUTZ IN 4SET STRUGGLE
description: Reds flags flew at the United States Open tennis champion ships yesterday signaling the start of sudden death, but black flags would have been appropriate to mark the open inground exit of such favorites as Andres Gimeno and Marty Riessen.

title: SOVIET PRESS MARKS END OF WORLD WAR
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 2The So viet Union today marked the 5th anniversary of Japan's capitulation with articles de nouncing the United States and warning that militarism was on the rise again in Japan.

title: Scrooge Chosen as Music Hall's Christmas Film
description: scrooge, a Britishmade musical version of Charles Dickens's A Christmas Car ol, starring Albert Finney in the title role, will be the Christmas feature at the Radio City Music Hall. The program will include the 38th consecutive presentation of The Nativity, the theater's seasonal nageant.

title: Television
description: 7:00 (2, 7)News Report (4)Today: The Rev. David Wilkerson, author of The Cross and the Switchblade (8)

title: ERVIN SETS HEARING. ON DATA COLLECTING
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2 Senator Sam J. Ervin Jr. an nounced today the first legisla tive step in an attempt to create a Federal regulatory agency to curb what he called a com puterized threat by the Govern ment against Americans consti tutional freedoms.

title: Students Occupy Office of Training School's Chief
description: Thirty black and Puerto Rican students and several faculty members took over the office of the president of the small, Federally financed Col lege or Human Services for eight hours yesterday and de ncianded her resignation.

title: BANKER'S CONVICTION IS UPHELD BY COURT
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 2 (UPI)The United States Court of Appeals has upheld the em bezzlement conviction of Don C. Silverthorne, now 70 years old, the man who founded the San Francisco National Bank and left it broke 30 months later.

title: Safety Unit to Study Personnel Records Of Transit Workers
description: The Metropolitan Transporta tion Authority announced yes terday the appointment of a threeman panel to study per sonnel records and practices of, the City Transit Authority.

title: Olin and Dow Lift Prices of Chlorine And Caustic Soda
description: Prices were increased yester day on various forms and quan tities of caustic soda and chlo rine by two major producers.

title: Drilling for Oil Poses a New Threat to the Great Barrier Reef
description: HERON ISLAND, Great Bar rier Reef, AustraliaAustralian labor unions have joined with conservationists and other aroused citizens in a campaign to protect the worldrenowned Great Barrier Reef from men who drill for oil as well as from hungry coraleating star fish.

title: Pacifists and Panthers Get P.O.W. Letters From Hanoi
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, Sept. 3 (Agence FrancePresse)An 11member delegation from the Black Panthers and the Ameri can pacifist movement left here today for Peking and Algeria with 379 letters from United States prisoners of war in North Vietnam.

title: Weekend Fishing and Boating
description: AREA ABluefish, weak fish, kingfish and fluke ap peared in good supply in the area and crabs were abundant. Dick Meyers at Barnegat, N. J., reported the blues and weaks running well at Harzey Cedar inlet and at the light. Crab catches of two and three bushels were not uncommon. At Brielle, N. J., John Began said that excellent catches of bluefish were being made day and night and fishing for school tuna was fair. Bottom fish ing for sea bass and black fish was not particularly satisfying and porgies had not appeared, but were ex pected. John's Tackle Box on Long Beach Island, N. J., re ported the fishing on the spotty side, but the quality was good.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY TransAtlantic

title: Treasury Statement
description: Treasury Statement

title: Boy, 16, Accused of Murder In Slaying of Stamford Girl
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Sept. 3 (UPI)A 16yearold boy who was arrested last weekend for an assault on a 13yearold girl, was charged today with murder in the stabbing last February of the teenage daughter of a Stamford policeman.

title: U.S., With 670Pound Catch, Leads in Tuna Tournament
description: CAPE ST. MARY, Nova Scotia, Sept. 3 (Canadians Press)Premier John Robarts of Ontario landed a .532pound tuna here today, the second caught during the annual inter national tuna cup match off the southwest end of Nova Sco tia. The Premier hooked the bluefin at 5:30 P.M. and took 2 hours 45 minutes to bring it to gaff.

title: David Sylvan Fine
description: David Sylvan Fine, prob ably the most militant of the four alleged bombers, was known to his friends as Buzzy. Now 18 years old, he has said that he has been involved in the radical move ment since his early teens.

title: Bruce and Thuy Meet at Paris Talks for the First Time
description: PARIS, Sept. 3North Viet nam's chief negotiator, Xuan Thuy, ended his ninemonth boycott of the Paris peace talks today. But he declared that the United States position had not changed in that time, and he made it plain that the Commu nist bargaining position had not changed either.

title: Roundup: Smith's Value Rises in Boston
description: In view of the fortune that Tom Yawkey, the Boston Red Sox owner, is reputed to have paid for players, Reggie Smith is a bargain basment acquisition, who Is playing as though he had been la beled with a milliondollar price tag.

title: Costello Named Trustee
description: FRANCONIA: N. H., Sept. (AP)Dr. Timothy W. Costello, Deputy Mayor of New York City, was named a trustee of Franconia College here today. The appointment was an nounced by Leon Botstein, who at 23 years of age is the youngest president in the country of a fouryear accred ited college.

title: NEW YORK CLEARING HOUSE STATEMENT
description: NEW YORK CLEARING HOUSE STATEMENT

title: Open Interest
description: Thursday, Sept. 3, 1970

title: JerseyNew YorkParis Phone Calls Avert Suicide
description: A suicide in Paris was frus trated by a complex transAt lantic rescue effort involving a New York City patrolman, an overseas telephone operator and the Paris police.

title: JOHN A. SEXAUER, 891 PLUMBING SUPPLIER
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., Sept. 3 John A. Sexauer, chairman of the board of J. A. Sexauer Manufacturing Company of White Plains, producer of plumbing supplies, died at his home here yesterday after long illness. He was 89 years old.

title: 3 Die in Libya Explosion
description: BENGHAZI, Libya Sept. 3 (AP)A parcel loaded with ex plosives blew up today in the Benghazi post office, killing three persons and injuring four. A radio broadcast said the par cel was addressed to the man ager of a Libyan business.

title: Summaries of U.S. Open Tennis
description: Summaries of U.S. Open Tennis

title: PIANO DEBUT OCT. 13 FOR JOAN KENNEDY
description: Joan Kennedy, the wife of Senator Edward M. Kennedy, will make her debut as piano soloist with a symphony or chestra at the Philadelphia Academy of Music on Oct. 13. She will take part in a fund raising concert presented by the Arts Committee for Milton Shapp and Ernest Kline, Dem ocratic candidates for Governor and Lieutenant Governor of Pennsylvania.

title: SOVIET PUTS CASES OF CHOLERA AT 453
description: GENEVA, Sept. 3The So viet Union has informed the World Health Organization that its cholera cases numbered 453. The agency said there were 352 cases in the Astrakhan region, near the Caspian Sea, 63 at Odessa and 38 in Kerch, both on the Black Sea.

title: Executive Changes
description: John W. Hancock has been elected president of the Michigan Gas Utilities Company. He replaces George W. Loomis, who resigned.

title: Errors and Walks Help Orioles Trounce Yanks, 84
description: The Yankee Stadium ground crew received more applause than Horace Clarke last night. But then the crew, in putting the tarpaulin on after the game, covered the infield better than the New York second baseman.

title: SCIENTISTS DECRY MOON FLIGHT CUT
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 3 The National Aeronautics and Space Administration's deci sion to cancel two more flights to the moon was termed false economy today by three scientists connected with the Apollo program.

title: EXHIBITION FOOTBALL
description: TONIGHT'S GAME Atlanta at Buffalo.

title: Yost Discusses Crisis
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Sept. 3The United States delegate, Charles W. Yost, dis cussed the apparent impasse in Middle East peace talks in hur ried calls today on Secretary. General Thant and the United Arab Republic delegate Dr. Mohammed H. elZayyat.

title: CARLTON AVERTS A 4GAME SWEEP
description: ST. LOUIS, Sept. 3The ru mored revival of the New York Mets suffered a little setback here today when Steve Carlton, an 18game loser, pitched the St. Louis Cardinals to a 53 victory. The defeat was the first in four games here this week for the Mets, but it was a nagging one. It weakened their position in the freeforall with the Pitts burgh Pirates and Chicago Cubs at the top of the National League's East and with only 27 games to go, it sent them on to Chicago for three big ones starting tomorrow against the rising Cubs.

title: Mrs. O'Malley's Crew Wins North American Laurels
description: VICTORIA, British Columbia, Sept. 3 (AP)Mrs. Jan O'Mal ley, the defending champion, and her crew from the Manto loking Yacht Club of New Jersey gained two points to day and recaptured the Adams Cup in the 1970 women's North American sailing cham pionship.

title: Belmont Entries
description: Belmont Entries

title: News Summary and Index
description: American officials, fearing for the tenu ous Middle East truce that they had ini tiated, asked the Soviet Union and the United Arab Republic yesterday to stop vio lating the ceasefire. The United States also called for the immediate resumption of peace talks despite Israel's apparent decision not to participate until new missiles were re moved from the truce zone. [Page 1, Col. 8.]

title: India Curbs Foreign Filming
description: NEW DELHI, Sept. 3 (Reu ters)Foreign television crews making documentaries in India will have to allow Indian of ficials to examine their film and cut out parts considered objectionable, a Government Ispokesman said today. The Ishowing in Britain by the Brit hsh Broadcasting Corporation of a documentary series about poverty and religious rites in Indian has touched off criticism here and led the Government to order the B.B.C. offices in New Delhi closed.

title: Delegates Welcome Governor at A.F.L.C.I.O. Parley
description: KIAMESHA LAKE, N. Y., Sept. 3Delegates to the New York State A.F.L.C.I.O. convention here endorsed Governor Rockefeller for reelection tonight after a bitter and raucous debate. The standing vote was judged by Raymond R. Corbett, president of the federation, to be in favor of the endorse ment, which had been recom mended to the 1,500 delegates and alternates by the execu tive council.

title: Peter Pohly to Wed Miss Hallie Horn
description: FAIRFIELD, Conn., Sept. 3  Dr. and Mrs. Benjamin Horn have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Hallie Horn, to Peter Pohly, son of Mr. and Mrs. Nathan Hessberg Pohly of New York. The wedding is planned for Oct. 18 in New York.

title: Australia Bars U.S. Cleric
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Sept. 3 The Government has refused a visa to a New York clergy man, the Rev. James R. Mc Graw, who was to have ac companied Dick Gregory, the comedian, to Australia to take part in antiVietnam rallies at colleges later this month.

title: F.B.I. Detains Sliter
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Sept. 3 (AP) F.B.I. agents apprehended Mr. Sliter tonight as he was report edly preparing to leave Minne apolis. Mr. Sliter was expected to appear before a Federal grand jury in Madison, Wis., to morrow morning.

title: Hentz and Hendricks Penalized By S.E.C. for Violations of Rules
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 3 (UPI) The Securities and Exchange Commission has suspended the Miami Beach branch office of H. Hentz & Co., a New York brokerdealer, from trading on the overthecounter market for 30 days beginning Tuesday.

title: Touring U.S. Group Reports Big Gains in South Vietnam
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 3 (AP)A leader of an Ameri can young people's group tour ing South Vietnam said today that its members were astound ed by the difference between the country's image in the press and the reality of what we found here.

title: President Leads Tributes
description: Many notables paid tribute yesterday to Vince Lombardi, the pro football coach. Fol lowing are some of the com ments:

title: Lindsay's Apology Accepted
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., Sept. 3 (AP)Mayor Hugh C. Curran today accepted an apology from the Mayor of New York, saying that Mayor Lindsay has a high regard for Bridge port. The apology was made to Mayor Curran on Wednes day for remarks during an ex change in Washington with Senator Abraham A. Ribicoff, Democrat of Connecticut. Re sponding to the Senator's charge that the streets of New York were filthy, Mr. Lind say said the streets of Bridge port were no better.

title: Vince Lombardi, Football Coach, Dies
description: Vince Lombardi, the profes sional football coach who symbolized toughness and dedi cation in sports, died of intesti nal cancer yesterday in George town Hosiptal in Washington. His age was 57.

title: AUGUST SALES UP FOR CHAIN STORES
description: The nation's large chain store operators achieved gains in sales volume last month and, in most instances, their per formance was better than in the preceding month.

title: Army Reserve Aide Named
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 3 (UPI) Brig. Gen. J. Milnor Roberts was named today as deputy chief of the United States Army Reserve, effective Oct. 1. He is now commander of the 99th Army Reserve Command in Pittsburgh.

title: Aspen, Colo.: The Enduring Frontier Spirit
description: ASPEN, Colo., Sept. 3In this lovely valley of the Rocky Mountains, the old frontier spirit, believe it or not, still exists. Money from Chicago has turned it into an intellectual and sporting resort, where ski ers and professors slide and study, but outside these fash ionable seasonable pursuits, As pen is a community with a life of its own and it is doing things in its own way. For example, it has voted in the last few days to approve a 1 per cent sales tax to pur chase open land around the village. This will bring in about half a million dollars a year, which will be used to buy and save a greenbelt around Aspen from the real estate developers.

title: Lindsay Gives Blood In Appeal for Donors
description: Dramatizing an acute shortage of blood for transfu sions in local hospitals, Mayor Lindsay made a 15 minute stop at Bellevue Hos pital yesterday morning to donate a pint of his own.

title: Trading in Shares Of Unexcelled, Inc., Is Halted on Amex
description: The American Stock Ex change halted trading yester day in the shares of Unex celled, Inc., a maker of meat packing machinery and opera tor of discount stores.

title: McCormack Mass Tomorrow
description: A mass marking the 25th an niversary of the death of John McCormack, the Irish tenor, will be sung at St. Vincent Ferrer Roman Catholic Church tomorrow at 11 A.M. under the sponsorship of the John Mc Cormack Society of America.

title: U.S. Acts Against Whites In Alabama School SitIn
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Sept. 3 The Justice Department took action today in Federal court to block a group of white parents in a rural Alabama school district from interfering with courtordered desegrega tion there.

title: Impasse Rallies to Triumph by Nose and Returns $40.60 at Belmont Park
description: Impasse contributed a fine exhibition of courage in rally ing at the close to win the 1 16mile turf race that fea tured the program at Belmont Park yesterday.

title: Green Acquitted of Assault, Closing Hockey Brawl Case
description: OTTAWA, Sept. 3 (UPI) Ted Green, the Boston Bruins defenseman, was acquitted to day of an assault charge, bringing to an end the first criminal court action against professional hockey players for fighting on the ice.

title: 63 G.I.'s Are Listed as Killed in Week
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 3 (AP)Sixtythree Amer icans were killed in action last week in Vietnam, the United States command announced to day, but the total did not include 28 others killed when a helicopter was shot down last Wednesday.

title: L.I. School District Is Ordered to Admit 27 at Mitchel Field
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Sept. 3  The children of welfare fami lies living in barracks buildings at the former Mitchel Air Force Base were ordered admitted to the local public schools today by a State Supreme Court jus tice.

title: Duffey Says Foes of War Are Ignoring Other Issues
description: HARTFORD, Sept. 3 (UPI) The Rev. Joseph D. Duffey, Democratic candidate for the Senate who is an outspoken op ponent of the Vietnam war, criticized the antiwar move ment today for ignoring other issues and alienating working men.

title: Numbered Accouhts Adopted
description: SINGAPORE, Sept. 3 (Reu ters)The Parliament of this island republic approved a bill yesterday permitting banks to establish accounts identified by numbers only, similar to the system used in Switzerland.

title: STOCKS ADVANCE ON LONDON BOARD
description: The London stock market closed ahead yesterday as en couraging corporate reports by leading companies prompted selective buying.

title: Frances Hesterberg Is Prospective Bride
description: The engagement of Miss Frances Lauran Hesterberg to James Hall McDonald, son of Mr. and Mrs. James Mc Donald of Brooklyn, has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Alexander G. Hesterberg of Brooklyn and Quogue, L. I. A November wedding is planned.

title: Injured Students to Get Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 3 (AP) A group of students an nounced today a fundraising goal of $65,000 to help pay the medical expenses of 21 stu dints injured in the shootings last spring at Kent State and Jackson State Universities. Mrs. Jacqueline Stewart, secretary of the group, Kent Students Medical Fund, Inc., said, Few people are even now aware of the total number of students injured or the seriousness of these injuries.

title: SMITH WINS IN 400 AT WARSAW TRACK
description: WARSAW, Sept. 3 (AP) John Smith of Los Angeles and Jay Silvester of Spanish Fork, Utah, won the 400meter run and the discus throw, respec tively, at a track and field meet today.

title: Cambodia Calls on World To Back Her Just Cause
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Sept. 3The Cambodian Government moved on several fronts today to document its case against the Communist forces fighting in Cambodia, to underscore its assertions of a neutralist policy and to appeal to world opinion for support.

title: Yonkers Entries
description: Yonkers Entries

title: Pulford Traded to Kings
description: TORONTO, Sept. 3 (AP) The Toronto Maple Leafs trad ed a forward, Bob Pulford, to the Los Angeles Kings today for Garry Monahan and Brian Murphy, forwards.

title: CORNFELD IS BACK AS I.O.S. DIRECTOR
description: GENEVA, Sept. 3Bernard Cornfeld, founder of the Inves tors Overseas Services mutual fund empire, regained his seat on the board of directors today in exchange for his agreement to drop his fight to overthrow the new management.

title: Casey Turns in His Bat At Klemtner Ad Agency
description: Just before the Labor Day weekend two years ago Wil liam J. Casey became presi dent of the newly formed Klemtner Casey ad agency. Yesterday the agency an nounced that he'd quit.

title: Indians on Alcatraz Reject Effort to Win 5Year Lease
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 3 (UPI)The Indian occupants of Alcatraz Island rejected to day a selfappointed mediator's attempt to win them a five year lease on the former prison site in San Francisco Bay.

title: Goldberg Is Not Allowed to Speak at State Fair
description: SYRACUSE, Sept. 3Arthur J. Goldberg, DemocraticLiberal candidate for Governor, stormed out of the State Fair Oast night, demanding an apol ogy after being denied use of the main stage at the entrance gates to address the crowd.

title: Unionist for Rockefeller
description: Strikes of public employes can be legislated against but not prevented. When public employes consider their con ditions insufferable and a strike the only instrument of action available, they will avail themselves of it.

title: GEORGE KATZ, 97, ADVERTISING MAR
description: George R. Katz, a leading newspaper representative for 70 years, died Wednesday at his home, 784 Park Avenue. He was 97 years old.

title: SARTA'S 68 LEADS JERSEY QUALIFIERS
description: BOONTON, N. J., Sept. 3 Dick Sarta of Preakness Hills led 43 amateurs and profes sionals at the Knoll Golf Club today in qualifying for the 55th Metropolitan Golf Association open championship. The open will be played Sept. 29 through Oct. 1 at Ridgewood. Jimmy Wright of Inwood, L. I., is the defending champion.

title: 32 CARS WARM UP FOR 500 ON COAST
description: ONTARIO, Calif., Sept. 3  Thirtytwo cars of the 33car starting field ran through 2 hours of warmup and practice today, setting the stage for the California 500, the opening event of the Ontario Motor Speedway, 40 miles east of Los Angeles.

title: Schools Remain Closed in Summerton, S.C.
description: SUMMERTON, S. C., Sept. 3 It was late in the afternoon and in the classroom at the end of the long, dark hallway, Ruth Richardson was busy scrubbing the desks.

title: HICKMAN DRIVES IN 4 CHICAGO TALLIES
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 3 (UPI) Jim Hickman batted in four runs with a threerun homer and a single today while his Chicago teammate, Billy Wil liams, was ending a string of 1,117 consecutive games played as the Cubs stopped the Phila delphia Phillies, 72, behind the fourhit pitching of Ferguson Jenkins.

title: 7 in Chicago Street Gangs Indicted in Police. Killing
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 3 (AP) Seven members of the Black P. Stone Nation, a street gang con federation, were indicted today by a Cook County grand jury for the murder Aug. 13 of De tective James A. Alfano.

title: POVERTY AGENCY FACES FUND LOSS
description: Several Puerto Rican organ izations demonstrated noisily last night at Broadway and Leonard Street as a city wide panel of the Council Against Poverty considered a recommendation that funds for the Puerto Rican Family Insti tute be cut off on Dec. 31.

title: Pan Am Plans. Sale Of Loan Certificates To Buy Jumbo Jets
description: Pan American World Air ways, Inc., is planning an of fering next month of $81,550, 000 of 16year guaranteed loan certificates to help it finance five. Boeing 747 jetliners it is operating under lease. The cer tificates will be sold by an underwriting group headed by Lehman Brothers.

title: Reserve Presses Policy Of Monetary Expansion
description: The Federal Reserve System pressed its policy of monetary expansion during the last two weeks, banking data published yesterday showed.

title: Atlantic City Results
description: Atlantic City Results

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Activities. The President in San Clemente, Calif., met with members of the Senate Finance Committee. Later in the morning he flew by heli copter to the naval air station at North Island. Calif., where he welcomed President Gus tavo Diaz Ordaz of Mexico and they both motored through Coronado, Calif. Later in the afternoon the two Presidents and former President Johnson met for private discussions.

title: Neighborhoods: Serenity Of Marine Park Is Periled
description: For years, fishermen have caught flounders, snappers and eels off the sandy shores of Marine Park, in the south ern part of Brooklyn. Late ly their fishing lines have hooked into a new kind of catchrusted baby carriages, shopping carts and the stripped, mossy hulks of abandoned automobiles.

title: Sports of The Times
description: In the swirling, emotional frenzy that engulfed the Green Bay Packers after their outrageously dramatic victory over the Dallas Cowboys in the final 13 seconds of the 1967 championship playoff, the heroes were interviewed endlessly. No statement struck with more impact than that deliv ered by Jerry Kramer, whose thunderous block had cleared the path for Bart Starr's winning touchdown.

title: 80 Votes Separate Rivals For Dakota Congress Seat
description: FARGO, N. D., Sept. 3 (AP) Richard Elkin, running with his Republican party's endorse ment, held an 80vote margin over Robert P. McCarney today with all precincts reporting in the primary election for North Dakota's western district seat in the United States House of Representatives.

title: African Meeting Ends With Call For Support of Jarring's Effort
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Sept. 3 (Reuters)The seventh annual conference of the 41 nation Organization of Afri can Unity ended here today with a call to its member states to support the peace bid of Dr. Gunnar V. Jarring, United Nations mediator.

title: Market Place
description: Early in the summer, when brokerage firms seemed to be toppling almost daily, a raft of rumors circulated about Hayden, Stone, Inc., one of Wall Street's most troubled big houses. Some of the scut tlebutt came true, but most of it was not dignified with a response.

title: Jail Guards SickOut Spreads; City Orders Paychecks Held Up
description: As widespread sick calls by correction officers at the Rikers Island Reformatory continued for the second day yesterday and spread to the Women's House of Detention, George F. McGrath, the city's Commis sioner of Corrections, an nounced he was withholding the paychecks of the absent workers pending investigation of their professed ailments.

title: 8th Film Festival Opens Thursday
description: Richard Roud's chickens will come to roost in Lincoln Center starting next Thurs day, when the Eighth New York Film Festival opens at Philharmonic Hall.

title: $1Million Tennis Series Listed For Top 32 Players Next Year
description: A 20city international ten nis series in 1971 with more than $1million in prize money was announced yes terday by World Champion ship Tennis of Dallas.

title: M'CORMACK AIDE IS GIVEN 2 YEARS
description: Dr. Martin Sweig, who was the principal aide of Speaker of the House John W. McCor mack until Sweig was charged last year with defrauding the Government, was sentenced yesterday to twi) and a half years in prison and a $2,000 fine for lying to a grand jury.

title: Fine Backs and Strong Defense Give Boston College Top Rating
description: CHESTNUT HILL, Mass., Sept. 3Depth on both offense and defense, powerful running backs, a corps of talented re ceivers and the best quarter back in the East in Frank (Red) Harris give Boston College the potential for its best football campaign in recent seasons.

title: British Studies of Blacks and Police Show Tensions
description: LONDON, Sept. 3A deep mistrust of the British among young blacks herealong with an increase in conflict between immigrants and the policewas underscored today in studies on racial problems facing Brit ain.

title: FINAL 3 ARE FREED IN 69 CORNELL CASE
description: ITHACA, N. Y., Sept. 3 (AP) Criminal proceedings in the aftermath of Cornell Univer sity's racial turmoil of April, 1969, came to an end toddy with the unconditional release of the last three defendants charged after the incident.

title: PAUL D. WEATHERS, AMHERST TREASURER
description: Paul D. Weathers, treasurer of Amherst College from 1941 until his retirement in 1964, died yesterday in Jacksonville (Fla.) Memorial Hospital. He was 77 years old and since his retirement lived at nearby Ponte Vedra Beach.

title: Shoemaker Needs 2 More
description: DEL MAR, Calif., Sept. 3 (UPI)  Bill Shoemaker rode Haveago to victory in the feature event at Del Mar race track today, leaving him two short, of the record of 6,032 career victories held by Johnny Longden. Shoemaker had four mounts.

title: Bridge:
description: The Knickerbocker Cham pionships, the traditional La bor Day weekend tournament of the Greater New York Bridge Association, begins today at the New York Hil ton.

title: Mrs. Meir Pressing U.S. To Cancel Egypt's Gains
description: JERUSALEM, Sept. 3 Premier Golda Meir today wel comed Washington's acknowl edgment of an Egyptian missile buildup in violation of the threeweekold Middle East, ceasefire. But she pressed for further United States action to demand that the Soviet Union act to cancel Egypt's new military gains.

title: Two Textile Executives Indicted in Tax Bribery
description: Two textile industry execu tives were indicted in the al leged bribery of an Internal Revenue Service agent.

title: Big Board Will Process Amex Stock Certificates
description: The New York Stock Exchange and the American Stock Ex change announced yesterday that they planned to include approximately 850 Amex stocks in the Big Board'i Central Cer tificate Service beginning in November.

title: 2d Union Rejects Offer
description: DETROIT, Sept. 3 (AP)The International Union of Elec trical Workers, which repre sents 32,000 General Motors employes, formally rejected to day a new contract offer paral leling the one that the United Auto Workers rejected yester day.

title: Care Unit Plans Benefit Fashion Show in Westport
description: The newly organized CARE Women's Committee of Con necticut will sponsor a bene fit fashion show and luncheon on Wednesday at the Long shore Club in Westport, Conn. Mrs. J. Donald Kyser is chair man and Mrs. Chester Bowles, wife of the former Ambassa dor to India, and Mrs. Samar Sen, wife of India's represent ative to the United Nations, are honorary chairmen.

title: Australia Denounces a Times Report on Troops
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Sept. 3 William McMahon, Minister for External Affairs, said in Parlia ment today that an article in The New York Times asserting that Australian troops in South Vietnam are mercenaries whose costs are paid by the United States was scurrilous and in accurate.

title: Laura Kramer Is Bride Of Charles Seymour 3d
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Sept. 3 Miss Laura Dean Kramer, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Dan G. Kramer of Muttontown, was married in two civil ceremonies today to Charles Seymour 3d. He is the son of Prof and Mrs. Seymour Jr. of New Haven. His grand father, the late Dr. Seymour, was president of Yale Uni versity, where the bride groom's father is professor of history of art.

title: A Listing of New Books
description: Dunfords Travels Everywhere, by William Melvin Kelley (Double day, $5.95). A man on a circu lar voyage of selfdiscovery.

description: FRANKFURT, West Ger many, Sept. 3 (Reuters)The (Central Bank said today that West Germany's total monetary reserves rose in the week ended Aug. 31 by 105million marks to 39.088billion marks.

description: Minor Leagues

title: State Trooper Shot, 4 Youths Captured On the Jersey Pike
description: CHERRY HILL N. J. Sept. 3 (AP) Four young Negroes who had been traveling in a stolen panel truck containing Black Panther party literature were arrested today after a shootout and chase in which a state trooper was slightly wounded.
