description: Three hours after James L. Buckley's campaign manager declared that the Conservative candidate for the United States Senate hoped to raise up to $1.5million for his campaign, Mr. Buckley's running mate for Governor, Paul L. Adams, ar rived here quietly and said he would be happy to get $100,000 for his camoaien.

title: PAPER CONCERN SUED ON LAKE POLLUTION
description: ALBANY, Sept 4 (AP)The state has filed a suit to prevent the International Paper Com pany's Ticonderoga plant from further polluting Lake Cham plain, despite company assur ances that it already had agreed to halt pollution. Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz said today that the company had ignored an order to abate discharges of waste into a Lake George outlet that flows into Lake Champlain.

title: BEATTY DANCE PAYS A TRIBUTE TO KING
description: Gospel is a style of reli gious singing and Talley Beatty has decided that it can be a form of dancing as well. Last night his company presented Bring My Servant Home at the New York Dance Festival at Central Park's Delacorte Theater. The work, for want of a more precise name, is de signed as a folk religious dance.

title: Meg Newhouse Makes a Debut
description: SOUTHAMPTON, L. I., Sept. 4  Miss Margaret Mortimer (Meg) Newhouse made her debut tonight at a dance for 300 given by her parents, Mr. and Mrs. Clyde Mortimer Newhouse of New York, on the lawn at Hedge top, their summer home here. Private dinners preceding the debut included one given at the Meadow Club by Miss Newhouse herself.

title: For Lovie Brown's Pies or Roast Pig, They Come From All Over
description: MARBLE DALE, Conn. It's not unusual for a hostess in this beautifully green and quietly moneyed area to have her dinner guests gasp, That's a Lovie pie!

title: 2 Iraqi Leaders Visit Guerrillas in Jordan
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Sept. 3 Two Iraqi leaders paid a quiet visit to Jordan yesterday to strengthen the politically, im portant alliance between the Arab guerrillas and the Iraqi troops here, the Baghdad radio reported.

title: Lafayette to Rely on McKay, Star Passer, to Spark Offense
description: EASTON, Pa., Sept. 4. Lafayette decided to play an 11th football game this sea son. But the Leopards coach, Harry Gamble, decided not to start preseason practice any earlier than he has for past 10game schedules.

title: Hester Warns N.Y.U. Won't Tolerate Disruptions
description: New York University's presi dent, Dr. James M. Hester, is sued a strong warning yester day to faculty and staff mem bers and students that the uni versity would not tolerate ef forts by extremists to politi cize the school during its com ling academic year.

title: 4 Policemen Hurt In Brooklyn Street During an Arrest
description: Sniper shots were fired at the police and four patrolmen were injured by bricks and fly ing bottles in the Brownsville section of Brooklyn early to day.

title: STEP TO AID REBELS IRKS SOUTH AFRICA
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af ca, Sept. 4  Churchmen and politicians, including many crit ics of the Government here have expressed alarm and anger at the World Council of Churches plan to give $200,000 in finan cial aid to guerrilla organiza tions and antiapartheid groups working against white govern ments in southern Africa.

title: ALBERT E. KOEHL, 63, LED AD AGENCY HERE
description: Albert E. Koehl, chairman of Koehl, Landis & Landan, Inc., 41 East 42d Street, an advertis ing agency specializing in ho tels, resorts and travel, died of a heart attack Wednesday in Port Antonio, Jamaica, while on a business trip. He was 63 years old and lived in Ardsley onHudson. N. Y.

title: Bill Rates Register an Advance At Treasury's Weekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4 Treasury bill rates advanced at today's auction from last week's levels, the Government reported late this afternoon.

title: A Leading Soviet Ballerina Gets Asylum in Britain
description: LONDON, Sept. 4Natalya Makarova, a leading ballerina of the Leningrad Kirov Ballet, sought and obtained political asylum in Britain tonight. She defected to the West at the end of a sixweek season at the Royal Festival Hall here.

title: ROBERT W. POWERS
description: BARNSTABLE, Mass., Sept. 4.Robert W. Powers, presi dent of John 0. Powers Com pany, an advertising agency at 116 John Street, New York, died today at the Barnstable. County Hospital. He was 70 years old and lived at 3516 79th Street, Jackson Heights, Queens, New York.

title: Beard School Getting Man In Charge for First Time
description: ORANGE, N. J., Sept. 4 (AP) For the first time in 80 years, the all girl Beard School will I have a man in charge George Burr, a 35yearolc former teacher at Newark Academy, assumes the post of headmaster Sept. 15.

title: State Health Aide Named
description: ALBANY, Sept. 4 (AP)Dr. Peter Greenwald, a former United States Public Health Service officer and an authori ty on infections and commu nicable diseases, was named yesterday as the first director of the Burns Care Institute of the State Health Department. He was appointed to the $33, 615ayear post by Governor Rockefeller.

title: New Zealand Hints Racial Test for Immigrants
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand, Sept. 4The Minister of Immi gration has set off a contro versy here by suggesting that certain Americans might not be racially acceptable under New Zealand's program of subsi dized immigration.

title: Garelik Statement Assailed By Socialist Workers Party
description: The Socialist Workers party criticized City Council President Sanford D. Garelik yesterday for his statement Monday that Trotskyites and Maoists shared the responsibility for recent attacks on policemen.

title: Outdoor Art Show Opens Around Washington Square
description: The 78th Washington Square Outdoor Art Exhibit opened yesterday and will continue daily from noon till sundown, weather permitting, through Sunday, Sept. 20.

title: MRS. GERSON NONAS
description: Mrs. Marjorie Crystal Nonas, wife of Dr. Gerson Nonas, physician, died of cancer at her home, 405 East 54th Street, on Thursday. She was 45 years old.

title: Giant Step for South
description: NEW ORLEANS, Sept. 4It is true, as the dispatches from down here have been saying for several days, that more South ern children than ever before are going to desegregated schools this fall.If anyone should take the time to count, he would almost certainly find that the South now has a greater percentage of its children in deseg regated schools than have the urban North and West. This giant step has been taken under a Republican President, one whose Administration has been formally branded as anti Negro by the president of the National Association for the Ad vancement of Colored People.

title: Computer Keeps Tabs on Inventories
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4In an inventory system being patented by Luther G. Sim jian of Greenwich, Conn., a central computer will keep track of many different items in many stores or warehouses. The commodities be ing distributed are identified and measured with out the need of any written notations. The computer rec ords show how much is still on the shelves and reminds the management when it is time to reorder. Patent 3.528.177, which will be granted Sept. 15, is assigned to Gen eral Research, Inc., of which Mr. Simjian is president.

title: Gas Mask Group Stresses the Brass At Village Gate
description: Gas Mask, a jazzrock en semble with aboveaverage abil ities, is playing through tonigh at the Village Gate, 160 Bleeck er Street.

title: MSGR. JAMES S. TULLY
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4 Msgr. James S. Tully, who re cently retired as pastor of St. Monica's Roman Catholic Church, 413 East 79th Street in New York, died here today after a long illness. He for merly served on the staff of the Church of the Resurrection in Rye, N. Y.

title: ROBERT STERLING, 95, A FINANCIER, IS DEAD
description: Robert D. Sterling, a former real estate operator and finan cier, died Thursday in Lenox Hill Hospital, after a long ill ness. He was 95 years old and lived at 19 East 77th Street.

title: Five HardHit Cities Facing Problem of Jobless
description: WICHITA, Kan.  In this metropolitan area of heartland American more than 18,000 people are out of work. That is more than 10 per cent of the work forcethe largest unem ployment here since the Gov ernment began keeping sta tistics.

title: KITE'S 207 LEADS GOLF BY 2 STROKES
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Sept. 4 (AP)Tom Kite Jr. Shot a one overpar 71 today after hitting, a spectator on the head with his second shot of the day and held firmly to the lead after three rounds of the 70th United States Amateur golf champion shin.

title: Symbols Soon to Replace Word: On Signs in the National Parh
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4. The Interior Department will soon begin using picture sym bols instead of words on signs in National Park Service areas.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The United States is seeking rectifica tion of the situation arising from cease fire violations in the Middle East, the State Department announced yesterday. But a department spokesman repeatedly refused to say whether Egypt and the Soviet Union had been asked to withdraw new missiles from the truce zone. [Page 1, Column 8.]

title: Pitt Hires a Black Coach
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept. 4 (UPI)  Warren Sipp, 24yearold former fullback for the Univer sity of Michigan, became the first black coach on the Uni versity of Pittsburgh football staff today when he was named an assistant coach.

title: Obituary 4  No Title
description: Obituary 4  No Title

title: Bridge:
description: The Knickerbocker Cham pionships of the Greater New York Bridge Association con tinue today at the New York Hilton with attention focused on the Open Pair Champion ship scheduled at 1:30 P.M. and 7:30 P.M.

title: I.C.C. WILL STUDY RATES ON FREIGHT
description: The Eastern and Western railroads of the country were told by the Interstate Com merce Commission in Washing ton yesterday that it would not allow them to raise their freight rates again without an inves tigation.

title: MRS. VINCENT MARIN
description: Mrs. Elma Louchheim Marin, wife of Vincent Marin, died yes terday at Memorial Hospital. She was 68 years old and lived here and in Weston, Conn.

title: 13 Panthers Appeal To U.S. to Remove Murtagh From Case
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4 (AP)  Thirteen Back Panthers ap pealed today to Supreme Court Justice John M. Harlan to re move John M. Murtagh as the judge who is to preside at their trial in New York on charges of conspiring to blow up department stores, police and subway stations and the Bronx Zoo.

title: YANKEES WIN, 32, ON HITS BY GIBBS
description: A full night's work was put in by Jake Gibbs and Steve Kline, two New York Yankee parttimers, last night as the Bombers squeezed past the Cleveland Indians, 3.2, at the Stadium. Gibbs, a catcher relegated to duty mostly against righthand ers since the coming of Thur man Munson, knocked in two of the Yankee runs on a homer and a single. The homer was his eighth of the yeareight more than he hit all last season.

title: U.S. AUTO OUTPUT UP FOR THE WEEK
description: DETROIT, Sept. 4 (AP) Automobile production in the United States this week rose to 136,882 units, up from 112,361 last week and 133,627 in the corresponding week of 1969, Automotive News reported to day.

title: Israel Reports Jet Attack On Guerrillas in Lebanon
description: TEL AVIV, Sept. 4 (Reuters) Israeli Air Force planes at tacked Arab guerrilla targets today in southern Lebanon, an Army spokesman said here.

title: I.O.S. SIGNS PACT FOR $15MILLION
description: GENEVA, Sept. 4  Inves tors Overseas Services signed a $15million loan agreement to day with a subsidiary of the In ternational Controls Corpora tion. This provides that the sub sidiary, I.C.C. Investments, Ltd., will have two seats on the27member I.O.S. board and two seats  instead of the one originally envisaged  on its powerful executive committee.

title: NEW PARTY URGED FOR WORLD BLACKS
description: ATLANTA, Sept. 4  More than 1,700 delegates to the In ternational Congress of African People here were urged to cre ate a World African party. The proposal, on the second day of the fourday parley, was made by Imamu Baraka, the poet playwright; widely kown as Le roi Jones.

title: Karen Prendergast, Ithaca 70, Betrothed to Neil W. Kingsley
description: MASSAPEQUA, L. I., Sept. 4Mr. and Mrs. William A. Prendergast 3d have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Karen Hull Prendergast, to Neil Warren Kingsley, son of Mr. and Mrs. Michael Kingsley of New Rochelle, N. Y.

title: DUTCH SPURRING EXPORT OF FUNDS
description: PARIS, Sept. 4 Struggling against pressures for an up ward revaluation, Dutch au thorities have maneuvered the Netherlands into becoming one of the great capital exporters of Europe.

title: CITY'S POPULATION PUT AT 7.9 MILLION
description: The Regional Plan Associa tion said yesterday that it be lieved New York City had been undercounted by perhaps 200,000 people in the prelim inary census returns.

title: Udall Charges Hichel Tried To Smear Him in Interest Case
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4 (AP) Stewart L. Udall, former Secretary of the Interior, said today that he had been cleared by the Justice Depart ment of conflict of interest and charged that the investi gation had been instigated by the present Secretary, Walter J. Hickel, in a deliberate at tempt to destroy his reputa tion.

title: Dispute Over Mafia
description: Governor Rockefeller's recent order, in this election year, to state lawenforcement agencies to cease using the words Mafia or Cosa Nostra to identify a specific section of organized crime is an echo of a similar directive issued some weeks earlier by Attorney General John N. Mitchell to all Federal crime fighters. Both actions came on the crest of a wave of protest by Italian  Ameri can organizations and politicians that use of those terms was offensive to law abiding, hard  working citizens of Italian ancestry and that it over emphasized ethnicity in organized crime.

title: U.S. Navy's Visa Requests Worry Chile
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4The United States Navy has appliec for Chilean visas for 87 officers noncommissioned officers and civilian employes over the last eight months, a developmeni that has left the Chilean Gov ernment deeply worried.

title: TANNER IS APPOINTED WHITE SOX MANAGER
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 4 (AP) Chuck Tanner, the manager of the Hawaii Islanders of the Pacific Coast League, was nam ed manager today of the Chi cago White Sox.

title: City Council Will Sponsor Appeal for Blood Thursday
description: Taking note of the shortage of blood available for transfu sions in hospitals here, City Council leaders announced yes terday that the Council would sponsor a Blood Donor Day at City Hall on Thursday.

title: Credit Union Chief Named
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Sept. 4 (AP)Herman Nicker son, Jr., a retired marine gen eral from Lincolnville, Me., and a Vietnam veteran, was nomi nated today by President Nixon as head of the National Credit Union Administration. The new independent agency is respon sible for supervision and regula tion of the 12,689 federally Chartered credit unions with assets of more than $14 billion.

title: George Guerdan, 72, ExOfficer Of First National City, Is Dead
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., Sept. 4 George A. Guerdan, who started out as a mail clerk and subsequently became an officer of the First National City Bank of New York, died today at his home here at 2 Brassie Lane. He was 72 years old today.

title: Market Place:
description: In these troubled days on Wall Street, investors under standably are concerned about the losses that might be trig gered by the sudden insol vency of a brokerage house.

title: Italian Production of Hair Gets A Cool Reception From Critics
description: ROME, Sept. 4An Italian production of the American musical Hair, opened here last night to benign yawns from the critics and indifferent applause from an audience more inter ested in itself than in the play.

title: No Voice of Labor
description: The meaninglessness of union endorsements of political candidates has seldom been more glaringly demonstrated than in the socalled endorsement given to Governor Rockefeller by the New York State A.F.L. C.I.O. convention.

title: Today's Matches
description: (NoonNick) Pilic vs. Pancho Gonzales. Second MatchMrs. Margaret Smith Court vs. Patti Hogan.

title: CLEVELAND FACING ORCHESTRA STRIKE
description: CLEVELAND, Sept. 4 (UPI) A threatened musicians strike will probably delay the opening of the Cleveland Or chestra's fall season, negoti ators said today.

title: 15 Die in Bus Blast in Brazil
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Sept. (Reuters)At least 15 persons were killed today when dyna mite being carried illegally ex ploded on a bus traveling be tween Monteiro and Campina in the northeastern state of Paraiba, according to radio re ports.

title: FRANCIS H. BLAKE
description: ALBION, N. Y., Sept. 4  Francis H. Blake, a former mayor of this city, died today at Arnold Gregory Memorial Hospital after a short illness. He was 84 years old.

title: Ellington to Play Free
description: Duke Ellington and his or chestra will present a special Jazzmobile concert tomorrow at 5 P.M. on 129th Street be tween Fifth and Lenox Ave nues. Jazzmobile is an organi zation that presents free jazz concerts daily in various street locations in the late summer. Mr. Ellington will be given a Jazzmobile award, and the con cert will be free to the public.

title: Mets Score
description: Mets Score

title: Sports Today
description: SOCCER

title: HOFF IN SENATE RACE IN VERMONT PRIMARY
description: MONTPELIER, Vt., Sept. 5 Former Gov. Philip H. Hoff, under fire from conservatives in his own party, is seeking the Democratic nomination for the United States Senate in Ver mont's primary election Tues day.

title: Flutes, Furs and Funds
description: QVERY for an Idle holi day weekend: What great American for tune had its origins in the music business? The an swer is in the music encyclo ppdias for all to read, but surprisingly few people know or remember it. Give up? The Astor fortune.

title: NEW NAVY FORK LIFT WORKS UNDER WATER
description: SAN DIEGO, Sept. 5 (AP) The Navy says two men can now move 1,000 pounds under water with help of a newly desiened fork lift.

title: Malaysia, in Shift. Of Policy, to Seek U.S Pullout in War
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia, Sept. 5 (UPI)The man who is to become Prime Minister this month called today for the withdrawal of all United States troops from South Vietnam. This represents a major change in Malaysian foreign policy.

title: Observer: Father Did Better
description: LONDON, Sept. 5The mid dleaged gentlemen of the power structure to whom the war means World War II and who cannot abide the Mod ern draftdodger have perhaps failed to grasp that war has lost its most exciting attraction since 1945.This was not the opportu nity, which war afforded, to become a hero or to dazzle the girls with a smart uniform, and it certainly wasn't the op portunity to do something noble for the state. Many men who went to war between 1941 and 1945 may have been briefly moved by any or all of these motives, but what was truly exciting and even alluring about the prospect of military serv ice was something far more pleasurable. It was the chance to travel.

title: PADDY O'ROCK WINS SPRINT AT TROPICAL
description: MIAMI, Sept. 5 (AP)R. T. Orth's Paddy O'Rock got through along the inside turn ing for home today and went on to score a onelength vic tory in the Summer's End Handicap at Tropical Park.

title: PRACTICANTE CHOICE IN PRIX FOY TODAY
description: PARIS, SEPT. 5 (AP)French racegoers await tomorrow's Prix Foy at the Paris Long champs track to see how Prac ticante, a favorite from Ar gentina, stands up against some of the best thoroughbreds Eu rope and the United States have to offer.

title: Mrs. Johnson Recalls Fear Over New Term
description: I do not know whether we can endure another fouryear term in the Presidency. I use the word endure in Webster's own meaning, to last, remain, continue in the same state without perishing. I face the prospect of another campaign like an openend stay in a concentration camp. Thus did Mrs. Lyndon Baines Jonnson express in March, 1967, her feelings about her husband making another try for the White House in 1968. Her anguish was to continue until the President announced his decision to retire on the night of March 31, 1968.

title: Capitols Top Knights, 136; Bomb Scare Delays Game
description: HARTFORD, Sept. 5 (AP) Indianapolis did all its scoring in the first half tonight as the Capitols defeated the Hartford Knights, 136, in an Atlantic Coast Football League game in terrupted by a bomb scare.

title: HUNGARIANS GET CONSUMER ADVICE
description: BUDAPEST, Sept. 5 (UPI)  A consumerresearch magazine newly published in Hungary has already stepped on many toescapitalist and Communist.

title: Congram Is Named by Yale As Freshman Crew Coach
description: Yale University has named Walter (Buzz) Congram as freshman heavyweight crew coach.

title: Miss Waldinger to Wed
description: DOVER, Mass., Sept. 5 The engagement of Miss Dor othy Davidson Waldinger, daughter of Mrs. Robert H. Waldinger, and the late Mr. Waldinger, to John Charles Bentley Jr., son of Dr. and Mrs. Bentley of Elizabeth, N. J., has been announced by her mother. The future bride was graduated from the Bea ver Country Day School and Colby Junior College and at tended the University of Colo rado. Her fianc is an alum nus of the Pingry School and Tufts University.

title: Strong Dartmouth May Get Challenge From Cornell
description: Strong Dartmouth May Get Challenge From Cornell

title: Music
description: THE new music season is here, and opera launches it. On Wednesday the New York City Opera Com pany will lead off with its great hit of last season, Boito's Mefistofele, and five days later the Metropolitan Opera will lift its curtain with Verdi's Ernani.

title: I.L.O. to Consider Seamen's Raise
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Sept. 5Higher wages for sea men and new guidelines for the shipping industry will be pro posed at the maritime confer ence of the International Labor Organization opening in Geneva Oct. 14.

title: NASA REAWARDS SATELLITE PACT
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5The space agency reversed itself today and switched a $50mil lion contract for two experi mental communications satel lites from the general Electric Company to the Fairchild Hil ler Corporation.

title: SILLS TO PERFORM TWO TITLE ROLES
description: The New York City Opera will offer two performances of Massenet's Manon with Bev erly Sills in the title role dur ing the third week of its fall season at the New York State Theater.

title: Floridian Says Engine May Stop Auto Pollution
description: SARASOTA, Fla., Sept. 5 Wallace L. Minto came to Florida six years ago to write a book. The Dook is not fin ished yet, nut not because Mr. Minto has spent the time fishing.

title: EXPOS TOP CARDS ON SIXHITTER, 60
description: ST. LOUIS, Sept. 5 (AP) Bob Bailey drove in two runs, the first breaking a scoreless duel in the sixth inning tonight, as the Montreal Expos defeated the St. Louis Cardinals, 60, behind the sixhit pitching of Bill Stoneman.

title: To Love a Renoir Movie Properly
description: IF the movies are not too young, if they have really had a classic period, that pe riod must surely center in the years between 1950 and 1960. It was the time of the greatest Ford and Hawks and Hitchcock, when Sirk and Preminger and Minnelli flourished, when the color was rich and unreal, when screens grew wide and when, in a last push for salable vulgarity, film stumbled into such fabulous beauty that a generation of lucky scholars will be needed simply to sort it all out.

title: Summaries of Stamford Y.C. Vineyard Trophy Sailing
description: Summaries of Stamford Y.C. Vineyard Trophy Sailing

title: Ontario Speedway Treats Fans To Unsurpassed Views of Racing
description: ONTARIO, Calif., Sept. 5 One of the rare aspects of motor racing is that the spec tator, that putupon consumer who pays $5, $8, $10 or more to get into the premises, is so often treated as a burden. He is forced to park his car in a mud lot, frequently paying a dollar or more for the priv ilege. He walks through a half mile or so of dirt and poison ivy to a hard seat or a standing spot from which he can see little of the race. The publicad dress system assaults him with commercials, but gives him little or no information about how the race is going. The few scoreboards that do exist are inaccurate and be hind time. Toilets are seldom more than privies. The food sold at concesison stands is intolerable and overpriced. The wonder is that the racing business, abusing the cus tomer by piling one indignity on top of another, has come so far.

title: Point of View:
description: Being a leader of anything is tough nowadays, but be ing a labor leader is especial ly tough.

title: Maritime Examiner Retires
description: The Federal Maritime Com migsion has announuced the re tirement of Paul D. Page Jr., its chief examiner. A Federal em ploye for 27 years, Mr. Page was appointed thief examiner in 1969.

title: Television
description: DICK CAVETT has con quered the handicap of being a Yale Uni versity graduate on his evening talk show on the network of the American Broadcasting Company; since spring he has found himself in the milieu of the mass medium and has learned to have fun with trivia while now being much the most quoted of the midnight head waiters.

title: House Plant Vacations Are Over
description: HOUSE plants that spent the sum mer outdoors should be moved indoors before Sept. 15th. Cool night temperatures produce a chemical change in plant cells that may inhibit plant growth. Also, house Mints, have to readjust to the house environ ment before the central heating is turned on.

title: Blast Kills One in Ireland
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Sept. 5 (Reuters)  One man was killed and another serious ly injured last night when a power transformer was blown up, the police said today. The two were thought to be part of a gang that planted a bomb at the transformer. The police dis covered a car nearby containing a bomb and literature.

title: BARRY IS AMONG 17 CALLED TO NET CAMP
description: Headed by Rick Barry, the newly acquired superstar, 17 players have been invited to the New York Nets training camp next Sunday.

title: Customs Turns to Dogs To Halt Drug Smuggling
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 3 (UPI)  The Government is using specially trained dogs to sniff out marijuana and hashish that might get by hu man inspectors along the Mexico border, the Customs Bureau says.

title: Minor Leagues
description: Minor Leagues

title: Hollandia Farms Jump Derby Is Rescheduled for Sept. 15
description: The Hollandia Farm Jump ing Derby, which was post poned because of rain three months ago, will be held on Sept. 15.

title: What's New in Art
description: What's New in Art

title: Colorado College Is Victor In Football Opener, 3534
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, Sept. 5 (UPI)Colorado College beat South Dakota Tech, 3534, in the opening game of the Na tional Collegiate football sea son tonight. Tech's gamble for a 2point conversion failed with 46 seconds remaining.

title: Education
description: MONTREALStudent unrest is now a global movement. It is part of a social upheaval that envelops all countries  those which suffer from the crisis of poverty and those which suffer from the crisis of affluence.

title: Melinda Evans Becomes Bride
description: LOCUST VALLEY, L. I., Sept. 5  Miss Melinda In gram Evans, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Brian Douglas Evans of Locust Valley and Townshend, Vt., was married here today to Jay Charles Fantz, son of Mr. and Mrs. Bernard Fantz of Sarasota, Fla., formerly of Glen Ellyn, Ill. The Rev. John Dykstra performed the ceremony in the Reformed Church.

title: A September Serendipity to Assist Youth Service
description: The newly organized Junior Committee of the Youth Con sultation Service has planned what one of its members, Mrs. James Neil Baxter, terms something out of the ordinary for its first bene fit on Sept. 19.

title: Engagements
description: BERNSTEINVAN RAALTEMr. and Mrs. Leopold Van Raalte are pleased to announce the engagement of their daughter, Nancy, to Arnold Bernstein, son of Mr. and Mrs. Herman Bernstein.

title: Rindt, 28, Is Killed In Crash at Monza
description: MONZA, Italy, Sept. 5 Jochen Rindt, the 28yearold Austrian racer who was on the verge of winning his first world driving championship, was killed today when his Lotus Ford crashed during trials for tomorrow's Italian Grand Prix.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTON  The Gov ernment supplied further evi dence last week of a very substantial decline in the role of defense in the na tional economy, but the Ad ministration came under fire for blaming this otherwise desirable development for the rise in unemployment.

title: U.S. AGENCY ISSUES PHOSPHATE LIST
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5 (AP) The Interior Department list ed the phosphate content of 48 popular detergents today, af firmed that phosphates pollut ed lakes, and asked housewives to draw their own conclusions when they went shopping.

title: KOOSMAN IS VICTOR
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 5The New York Mets righthanded pla toon went to the rescue today and defeated the Chicago Cubs, 53, further congealing the situ ation at the top of the National League's Eastern Division.

title: Economic Indicators
description: Economic Indicators

title: Two Conservatives Open L.I. Campaign In Shopping Areas
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., Sept. 5 The Conservative party's can didates for Governor and Lieu tenant Governor officially opened their campaign today with a motorcade through western Suffolk County and a tour of Nassau County's shop ping centers.

title: Simpson Undergoing Tests
description: CINCINNATI, Spet. 5 (UPI) The Cincinnati Reds an nounced yesterday that Wayne Simpson, their 21year old rookie pitching sensation, was undergoing tests at Christ Hos pital to determine the cause of irregularities in his heart beat. Simpson's condition was discovered during the annual physical checkup for Reds players earlier this week.

title: Business Index Falls in Week
description: The New York Times Weekly Index of Business Activity fell to 347.6 from 367.9 a week earlier. A year ago it was 361.0

title: A Good and Bad Year
description: Robin Roberts of the Phila delphia Phillies gave up 46 homers in 1956. That year he won 19 games.

title: Columbia Defense Excels In Intrasquad Scrimmage
description: LAKESIDE, Conn., Sept. 5 Columbia's defensive unit domi nated the first intrasquad scrim mage, held at the Lions pre season training camp today.

title: Spotlight.
description: Last Monday, while many stockholders and nonstock holders were thinking ahead to their Labor Day weekend, an item in the financial news went largely unnoticed.

title: MetYank Castoffs Fill Cubby Holes
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 5They are as different as two men can be, Jim Hickman and Joe Pepitone. But the New York Mets were discovering this weekend that they also had a couple of things in com mon: They both were refu gees from New York base ball and they both were finding fame and fortune with the Chicago Cubs.

title: Houston Huelga Schools Open In a MexicanAmerican Protest
description: HOUSTON, Sept. 5  Seven huelga schools were opened yesterday for MexicanAmeri can students who are boycot ting the Houston public schools in support of demands that MexicanAmericans be treated as a senarate ethnic minority.

title: Suburban Schools Worry Over Funds but Plan New Programs
description: The school year in the suburban metropolitan area opens this week on a note of concern about money and continuing labor strife and cautious optimism about the chances of preserving peace in the classroom in the com ing term. Despite numerous school budget defeats or narrow victories throughout the area continuing a trend that be gan in the middle nineteen sixties  suburban schools continue to offer an increas ing number of innovative programs.

title: Top Drivers Test Coast Track Today
description: ONTARIO, Calif., Sept. 5 A multimilliondollar gamble to determine whether the Indian apolis 500 type of race can prosper outside of Indianapolis will be played out here tomor row with the California 500.

title: Townhouse Plan: From Conception To Completion
description: In September of 1968 I pur chased a 20  by  50  foot four story rooming house in the Stuy vesant Square  Gramercy Park area of Manhattan. The building had been vacant for over a year. It was the worst structure on quiet treelined street consisting mostly of owneroccupied town houses, or brownstones. The purchase came after a twoyear search for such a building for the purpose of acquiring or creating decent and economically viable housing accommodations in Man hattan.

title: Carol V. Nolan Becomes Bride
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Sept. 5Miss Carol Virginia Nolan and Dr. Francois Paul Rigo lot, an assistant professor in the modern languages depart ment at the University of Michigan, were married here today in St. Mary's Roman Catholic Chapel. The bride is a member of the faculty of Residential College, an experimental undergraduate unit at Michigan.

title: REDS RALLY TO WIN FROM PADRES, 62
description: CINCINNATI, Sept. 5 (UPI) The Cincinnati Reds, trailing, 20, hit five consecutive twoout singles for three runs in the fifth inning tonight and went on to a 62 victory over the San Diego Padres to give Milt Wilcox a triumph in his first majorleague start.

title: Metric Trend Leaves U.S. Kilometers Behind
description: In just a few yearsunless a current study by the Na tional Bureau of Standards sparks an American metri cation programthe United States will be the only coun try still using yards, quarts and pounds.

title: Cambodians Report Attack at Saang, Near Capital
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Sept., 5 Communist forces attacked the already devastated town of Saang for the second straight night last evening, the Cambodi an Army command reported today.

title: Mt. Athos Monks Bar Hospitality for Hippies
description: ATHENS, Sept. 3  The bearded monks of Mount Athos have regretfully barred hippies from the tra ditional hospitality of their community in northern Greece.

title: Miss Cynthia Hardman Collins Fiancee of Strother Randolph
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5 Judge and Mrs. Linton McGee Collins have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Cynthia Hardman Collins, to Strother Fitz Ran dolph, son of Lamed Don aldson Randolph of North Gardens, Va., and the late Mrs. Randolph, the former Miss Elisabeth Strother.

title: Joan T. Higgins To Be a Bride
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., Sept. 5Miss Joan Therese Higgins and Alexander John Chilko will be married on Oct. 10. Announcement of their plans has been made by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Walter Joseph Higgins of Larchmont and Palm Beach, Fla.

title: LOWER BIRTH RATE SOUGHT BY TAIWAN
description: TAIPEI. Taiwan, Sept. 5 Taiwan, which has a population density of 1,050 persons a square milemore than twice that of India and almost 20 times that of the United States is conducting a campaign to reduce the birth rate.

title: Allende, Chilean Marxist, Wins Vote for Presidency
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Sept. 5 Dr. Salvador Allende, a Marx ist who says he would like to see Chile follow the road of revolutionary Cuba, won first place in Chile's presidential election yesterday, it was an nounced today. Since he fell short of a majority, Congress will have to decide who will be the new President.

title: News of The Camera World
description: FEATURING an elec tronic, throughthelens exposure control sys tem that automatically provides the correct expo sure, a new super8 movie camera recently introduced has a motordriven dia phragm that responds instant ly to changes of light so that the user can pan from bright sunlight to deep shade without hesitation and get a per fect exposure in both areas. Manufactured by the Yashica Company, Ltd., and called the Super800 Electro, this movie camera also has a spe cial switch that can be set for backlighted scenes or spotlighted subjects.

title: Brezhnev Given Wide Publicity Again
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 5Leonid I. Brezhnev's preeminence in the Soviet leadership was further underscored this week by what appeared to be an effort to add) some color to his rather stiff) public image.

title: State U. Expecting 195,000 to Enroll
description: A total of 195,000 fulltime students are expected to enroll this month in the 69 colleges and universities of the State University of New York, the largest centralized system of, higher education in the United States.

title: Ominous Threat in Attacks On the Police
description: There had been warnings: the record of urban rioting over the last six years; the findings of Presidential Commission, and of a score of lesser studies, of a deepening gulf between black and white; the dire predictions of black moderates and the rhet oric of militants.

title: Accident Involving Bicycle Kills Two Youths on L. I.
description: WYANDANCH, L.I., Sept. 5 Two youths were killed here last night in an accident in volving two automobiles and a bicycle.

title: Radio
description: Talk, Sports, Events

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: To the Editor: It is to be hoped, of course, that the admirable efforts of Secretary of State William P. Rogers to settle the Middle East conflict by U.S.U.S.S.R. cooperation and third party U.N. intervention will succeed.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Article 1  No Title

title: 7 GOODELLS SEEK SUN AND VOTERS
description: Bathers and sunlovers were wooed yesterday by Senator Charles E. Goodell in a cam paign tour of public beaches and private clubs in Queens, the Bronx and New Rochelle.

title: MiniFolk Festival at East River Attracts Throng of MiniPeople
description: What Is a minifolk fes tival? A festival for small people? Or a small festival of folk music? On Friday evening, the first of two minifolk fes tivals scheduled for the South Street Seaport, Fulton Street and East River, (the second will be held next Friday) proved to be a hit of both.

title: Thomas Ranges, Artist, Marries Mrs. Howard
description: OLD WESTBURY, L. I., Sept. 5Mrs. Constance Pyne Howard, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Eben W. Pyne, was married in the garden at her parents home here this after noon to Thomas Albert Ranges, a portrait painter. The Rev. Dean Foose of the Broadway Presbyterian Church in New York per formed the ceremony. He was assisted by the bridegroom's brother, Charles Ranges, who is a brother in the Edmundite Order.

title: H. E. Cox Jr. Fiance of Julia Dempsey
description: HUNTING VALLEY, Ohio, Sept. 5Mr. and Mrs. James Howard Dempsey, Jr., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Julia Bolton Dempsey, to Howard Ellis Cox, Jr. of New York and Washington. A wedding in the fall is planned.

title: Food Spending Above Estimate
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5 (AP)The Agriculture De partment has published a revised estimate showing that consumers spent slightly more of their takehome pay last year on food than earlier predicted.

title: Dance Programs
description: Dance Programs

title: ETHIOPIAN WOMEN OFFERED NEW LIFE
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Aug. 31Rabia Abdelkader, like most of Ethiopia's Moslem women, was illiterate, obedient and se cluded until she came into con tact witii the Ethiopian Women's Welfare Association.

title: Emilie E. Dean Becomes Bride Of Stockbroker
description: COHASSET, Mass., Sept. 5  Miss Emilie Evans Dean was married here this after noon to Jonathan Evans Mc Bride. The Rev. Paul A. Clark performed the ceremony in St. Stephen's Episcopal Church.

title: Smoke From Fire on IND Forces Evacuation of Train
description: A fire on a 10car IND train forced passengers to leave the train north of the Gaston Ave nue Station in the Rockaways, Queens, yesterday, the Transit Authority reported.

title: Specific Wage Demands Given To G. M. and Chrysler by Union
description: DETROIT, Sept. 5Leonard Woodcock, the president of the United Automobile Workers, presented the Chrysler Corpo ration and the General Motors Corporation today with specific wage and pension demands.

title: The Week in Finance:
description: SUMMER ended last week as far as the world of bust ness is concerned, and now the crucial testing period for the nation's economy is at hand.

title: Lieut. David Lawrence, Marine, Fiance of Susan Leslie Hadden
description: JERICHO, L. I., Sept. 5 Mr. and Mrs. Hamilton Had den Jr. of Jericho have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Susan Leslie Hadden, to Lieut. Dav id Tuckerman Lawrence, U.S.M.C.R., son of Mr. and Mrs. John Endicott Lawrence of Hamilton. Mass.

title: TEAM OF STING RAYS WINS AT LIME ROCK
description: LIME ROCK, Conn., Sept. 5 A team of Corvette Sting Rays won today's seventh an nual 5hour relay race at Lime Rock Race Park. The Alto team of Bob Farrell, Tom Felton, Paul D'Amico and Charles O'Neil completed 263 laps over the 1.53mile road course for onelap victory over a team representing the New Jersey Scuderia X Motor Club.

title: AFRICA SURPRISES BLACK AMERICANS
description: ILE DE GOREE, Senegal, Sept. 5 (AP)A young black Ameri can visiting the remains of the appalling slave dungeon here reached down, scooped up a fistful of sand and told the cu rator: I've got to take this back with me.

title: Jazz To Suit All Factions
description: MILT JACKSON QUIN TET featuring Ray Brown: That's the Way It Is (Impulse 9189). Jazz has splintered into so many factionsDixieland, big band swing, bebop, the new thing, to cite a few  that it is almost impossible to find any performance la beled as jazz that will not outrage at least one faction of alleged jazz fans. This disk is one of those rarities. Be yond mere nonoutrage, it might even be actively en joyed by the full spectrum of jazz followers.

title: U.S. PROSECUTORS JOINED BY WOMAN
description: For the first time in more than 20 years, a woman has been admitted to the ranks of the criminal prosecutions sec tion of the United States At torney's office here.

title: Robin D. Frederick Is Bride Of George Robinson Whitten
description: SOUTHPORT, Me., Sept. 5 Miss Robin Dennison Fred erick, a 1970 graduate of Vassar College, was married this afternoon to George Rob inson (Robbie) Whitten, a senior at Middlebury College. The Rev. Samuel G. Hender son Jr. performed the cere mony in All Saintsbythe Sea, Episcopal summer chap el here.

title: FEATURE MATCHES TODAY
description: FEATURE MATCHES TODAY

title: MURPHY CARDS 132 FOR STROKE LEAD
description: WETHERSFIELD, Conn., Sept. 5  It was a clear day and Bob Murphy didn't have to look far to see some spectacular golf as he played himself into the 36hole lead of the $100,000 Greater Hartford open. While he put together his second con secutive 66 for an aggregate of 132, he watched his pairing mate, Charlie Coody shoot 63, or eightunderpar, at the Weth ersfield Country Club course.

title: FAUBUS UNDERDOG IN PARTY RUNOFF
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., Sept. 5 For the first time since his rise to political power in Ar kansas 16 years ago, former Governor Orval E. Faubus faces the likelihood of losing a Demo cratic primary.

title: Coins
description: NEW YORK will be host for the American Nu mismatic Associa tion's annual conven tion in 1976, when the bicen tenary of the signing of the Declaration of Independence will be celebrated in this na tion and in many other coun tries. The announcement was made at a recent conference of ANA leaders, including Adna G. Wilde Jr., executive director; Herbert M. Bergen, president, and John Jay Pitt man, vice president, who also is president of the Canadian Numismatic Association.

title: Free Lunches in Bay State
description: BOSTON, Sept. 5 (UPI) Massachusetts will become the First state to require freelunch programs in all public schools. Communities would also reim burse parochial and nonprofit private schools for free lunch programs. Gov. Francis W. Sar gent sighed a bill Wednesday under which the free lunch pro gram would be operable in all schools by 1973.

title: Jane Carew Riggs Bride in Baltimore
description: BALTIMORE, Sept. 5 Miss Jane Carew Riggs and Lucio S. GarciaMansilla of New York were married here today in the Roman Catholic Cathedral of Mary Our Queen by Msgr. Thomas A. Whelan.

title: Prepaid Health Program
description: BOSTON, Sept. 5 (AP) About 2,000 welfare recipients are expected to be enrolled in a prepaid group practice health program by the end of the year, according to Massachusetts Blue Cross, one of the underwriters of the program. Under the pro gram, called the Harvard Com munity Health Plan, the Depart ment of Public Welfare pays the Harvard plan a monthly fee for each person who volun tarily enrolls in the program. New York has a similar plan.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: Article 4  No Title

title: Personality:
description: William M. Ellinghaus re turned last Tuesday to the type job he likes besta line job I'll be working where everything is happen ing.

title: Barnett Newman: Aspiration Toward the Sublime
description: THE little memorial exhi bition of works by the late Barnett Newman in the lobby of the Museum of Modern Art isn't much. It comprises just four familiar 20yearold paintings and Here II, a sculpture from 1965. What's worse, the noisy, bustling location makes serious viewing of the show practically impossible. A half dozen museumgoers are for ever shuffling between one and the rich red expanse of Vir Heroicus Sublimis, and the brooding, blackonblack Abraham looks as if it were yearning to be somewhere else. Like many public ob servances in the wake of a great man's death, this one comes off mainly as a well meaning gesture. The Mod ern is presumably planning a more adequate exhibition for the near future.

title: Schoolboy Dies of Injuries
description: OGDEN, Utah, Sept. 5 (AP) A high school football player from Ogden died today of in juries suffered in a practice scrimmage Aug. 28. David Flet cher, 17 years old, from Odgen, suffered a broken neck when he became involved in a scramble for a loose ball.

title: Tydings Seeks to Counter Gun Lobby
description: BALTIMORE, SEPT. 5Sen ator Joseph D. Tydings and his aides hope that a backlash will develop in Maryland against the attempts by national anti guncontrol groups to defeat his renomination bid.

title: Brno Machine Fair Opens
description: BRNO, Czechoslovakia, Sept. 5 (AP)Nearly 1,600 exhibitors from 29 nations are showing their machinery, gadgets and techniques in the 12th Brno en gineering trade fair, which opened Friday night.

title: 500POUND LIFT IS GOAL AT MEET
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Sept. (AP)  A 500pound lift could become a reality when strong men from nearly 40 countries gather here for the world weightlifting championships starting Saturday.

title: McCormack Scores Nixon On Inflation and Job Index
Hard Times In Manhattan
description: MANHATTAN in the midst of a recession is a festival of con tradictions. The stock market tumbles, struggles to rise, then tum bles again. People are thrown out of work in record numbers. But still the island creates new jobs in different fields, and employs more people thus feeding inflation and prolonging the recession. Manhattan is both vic tim and culprit.

title: Some Changes In the Pattern of Violence
description: WASHINGTON  In 1967 and 1968, the nation was shocked by riots that occurred in large cities. Those massive, traumatic protests appear to have passed, but there are in dications that the violence that has occurred this year has been more pervasive and touched more people. Shock has given way to a deep malaise that goes with daybyday violence and mounting assaults against authority.

title: A Manager at 23
description: Roger Peckinpaugh, was 23 years old when he managed the New York Yankees in 1914.

title: Commodity Exchange Set in West
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 5  David Callahan and Associ ates have discovered a vast leak in the huge West Coast reservoir of capital. But they think they have found a patch in the form of the West Coast Commodity Ex change.

title: Schools 2: The Court Will Rule On Some Key Issues
description: WASHINGTONWhen the Supreme Court bestirs itself in the heat of the summer to act on pending appeals, the Chief Justice holds a background briefing for the press, and law yers are instructed to stream line their paper work in prep aration for early arguments on two school desegration cases, it is only natural to assume that the Supreme Court is about to do something rare.

title: Stamps
description: CHRISTMAS in Canada this year is strictly by children  philateli cally speaking, that is. Boys and girls from all over the dominion created the de signs for the annual Christ mas postage stamps, which will be twelve in number this year, instead of the normal pair. There are ten prov inces and two territories Yukon and Northwest  in Canada and children from each of the provinces are rep resented among design win ners. Three are from Mani toba, but there are none from either the Yukon or North west territories.

title: Sightseeing Cum Antiquing On a One Day Prowl in Jersey
description: STAKING OUT new territory to go antiquing in requires the planning skill of a Wellington, the audacity of a Napoleon and the sort of faith that I lost and regained all in one day only last week: the faith, namely, that good luck will turn up a splendid surprise or two en route. I discovered all this wheninstead of sticking to my usual turf, western Connecticut, where I've occasionally haggled over an old crock I slipped off with my wife for a one day prowl through New Jersey.

title: WOMEN CRITICIZE PSYCHOLOGY UNIT
description: MIAMI BEACH, Sept. 5  Charging that modern psycho therapy has perpetuated male supremacy and contributed to mental illness among women, a group of women psychologists has demanded $1million in reparations from the Ameri can Psychological Association, the profession's main organiza tion.

title: Cowboys Acquire Van Ness
description: ATLANTA, Sept. 5 (UPI) The Atlanta Falcons today sent Bruce Van Ness, a rookie tight end, to the Dallas Cowboys for an undisclosed draft choice. Van Ness, a running back at Rutgers, was the Falcons fifth draft choice.

title: The novelist is an extension of the columnist
description: Columnist Drew Pearson; who died last fall, made a career out of being where the news was hot. So naturally, he starts his second novel in a hot spot. The election is over, the votes are being counted, and Senator Benjamin Hannaford is in a neck  and  neck race for the Presidency of the United States. Naturally again, as Pear son wrote his columns from his firstperson viewpoint, he writes his novel from that per spective, with Hannaford's aide and confidant, Edward Deever, as narrator  the character who performed the same func tion in Mr. Pearson's earlier, bestselling pastiche, The Sen ator.

title: Hello, David, Must We Talk
description: INTERVIEWING David Merrick is not really difficult once you get past the preliminaries, which consist of (a) a pleasant, leisurely series of calls to his press people, who are gra cious and expansive, and present, even tually, a sort of bartering system, a list of subjectspermitted versus subjects forbidden (the latter include the place and year of his birth, his parents, ado lescence, education, college days, law degree, law practice, beginnings on Broadway, first marriage, second mar riage, children, addresses, hobbies, ec centricities, dreams, disillusionments, aspirations and politics, and the former include Hello. Dolly!). and (b) the reiteration, by Merrick him self, of whatever agreement has been reached. In his bloodcolored office above the St. James Theater, he stands at semi  attention beside his antique desk, Rasputin risen from the river. He offers his hand like a welldealt card and says, Hello. The things he is loath to discuss are sternly catalogued. I always lie about them anyway, he adds, as if serving a subpoena, they're boring, they've been printed so many times. But not with much accuracy, ap parently. Grimace, silence, blackout.

title: Building Will Rise In a Big Bathtub
description: Before there can be a build ing, there must be a founda tion.

title: Woodcock In Crucial Test in Auto Talks
description: There must have been times last week when Leonard Wood cock wondered whether the international executive board of the United Auto Workers did him a favor by naming him to head the union after Walter P. Reuther died in a plane crash four months aeo.

title: Plunkett and Stanford Stand Between U.S.C. and Rose Bowl
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 5 Contrary to popular supposi tion, the University of South ern California does not own the Rose Bowl.

title: Barbara Nicholas Dugan Is Wed
description: SHORT HILLS, N. J., Sept. 5Miss Barbara Nicholas Du gan, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John Leslie Dugan Jr., was married here this after noon in Christ Episcopal Church to Seaman 1st Cl. Ed ward Brown Southworth 3d, U.S.N., son of Mr. and Mrs. Kenneth Alden Southworth Jr. of Edgartown, Mass. The Rev. Richard B. Andersen performed the ceremony.

title: TwoOut Clout Decides
description: BOSTON, Sept. 5 (UPI)  Dave Johnson's homer in the ninth inning gave the Balti more Orioles a 32 victory over the Boston Red Sox to day.

title: Peter Elias Weds Cynthia Binkert
description: YONKERS, Sept. 5Miss Cynthia Ruth Binkert, daugh ter of Alvin J. Binkert, exec utive vice president of the Presbyterian Hospital in New York, and Mrs. Binkert of Yonkers, was married here this morning in the Asbury Methodist Church, Crest wood, to Peter Bernd Herbert Elias in the presence of the couple's parents by the Rev. George F. Weyand.

title: OTTINGER VISITS IN THE CATSKILLS
description: MONTICELLO, N. Y., Sept. 5 Representative Richard L. Ot tinger did what tens of thou sands of New Yorkers do on a Labor Day weekend  he went to the resorts in the Catskills.

title: Point of View
description: Can an industrious family of moderate means find an alternative to tenancy in New York City?

title: Paperbacks
description: FICTION

title: Ithacans Assert Aid for Marinaro is on the Way
description: ITHACA, N.Y., Sept. 5Ed Marinaro burst upon the Ivy League last year with such a startling performance that the Cornell tailback became the nation's second leading rusher as a sophomore with 1,409 yards. Yet, the Big Red fin ished with a 45 wonlost record and the fourth spot in the Ivy standings on a 43 league mark.

title: Miss Cutler Wed in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5 Miss Christine Whitridge Cutler, daughter of the Rev. and Mrs. Frederick Sanford Cutler of Morristown, N. J., was married here this morn ing to Allan Mark Tregidga, son of Dr. and Mrs. Angus Campbell Tregidga of Silver Spring, Md.

title: Repechage Is in Store For One Travel Agent
description: ST. CATHARINES, Ontario, Sept. 5 (Canadian Press) Rudolf Luethi, a reporter for a news service and two news papers in Switzerland, flew here for the world rowing championships from Zurich.

title: Pirates Turn Back Phils, 43 and 64,
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept. 5Willie Stargell drove in two runs with a single and triple to help Fred Cambria win his first major league game tonight as the Pittsburgh Pirates topped the Philadelphia Phillies, 64, after taking a suspended game car ried over from last night, 43.

title: U. Utah Phillips, Folk Singer, Gives First Local Concert
description: U. Utah Phillips, folk singer and political organizer, is mak ing his New York concert de but through tonight at the Gas light Cafe, 116 Macdougal Street.

title: Cholera Now It Has Spread in Africa
description: Cholera, scourge of the Middle Ages, destroyer of armies and killer of Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikowsky, is still very much with us. Al though considered a disease of primitive countries, seri ous outbreaks this summer in the Soviet Union, the Mid dle East, and northern and western Africa have shown that only occasional primi tive conditions or habits can contribute to its spread.

title: RIGGS IS OUSTED IN SENIOR TENNIS
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 5 Three times in four matches this week, Bobby Riggs of Plandome, L. I., rallied from the loss of a first set to remain in contention in defense of his United States Senior grass court tennis championship at the Germantown Cricket Club.

title: Device Made at Rutgers To Cut Drivers Drinking
description: NEW BRUNWICIC. N. J., Sept. 5An expert in the study of alcohol and its effects has rejected as unrealistic the ad monition If you drink, don't drive.

title: Recommended New Titles
description: BOUND FOR GLORY, by Woody Guthrie. (NALSignet, $1.25.) The poetfolk singer was 31 in 1943 when he wrote this colloquially phrased, evangelically moving account of riding the freights; plunking his guitar for nickels and dimes in sleazy bars.

title: LAKELAND IS BEST IN JERSEY SHOW
description: FAR HILLS, N. J., Sept. 5 Mr. and Mrs. James A. Farrell Jr.'s Lakeland terrier, Ch. Spe cial Edition, led the field of 1,819 dogs at today's Somerset Hills Kennel Club show. Not quite 3 years old, Mike as he is called, registered his 14th all breed top award. He was best in show at the International Show in Chicago, Trenton and Beverly Hills.

title: 200 WILL COMPETE IN CITY MARATHON
description: The jogging program Mayor Lindsay initiated two years ago in Central Park will produce some competitive action there next Sunday with the running of the first New York City Marathon.

title: Amazed Policemen Give Leary Praise
description: From patrolmen to an assist ant chief inspector, the men of the Police Department ex pressed amazement yesterday at the resignation of Police, Commissioner Howard R. Leary.

title: Dr. Leopold Levis, 86, Dies; Columnist of StaatsZeitung
description: Dr. Leopold Levis, a Column ist for 21 years for The Staats Zeitung and Herold, German language newspaper, died here Thursday. He was 86 years old and formerly lived at 1825 Riverside Drive.

title: Moscow's Ballet Drain
description: Natalia Makarova, star ballerina of the Kirov Ballet, has explained that her defection in London was not poltically motivated. Britain, she has announced, offers a brilliant dancer like herself more opportunities than does the Soviet Union. She has presumably been im pressed by the great fame and fortune her old dancing partner, Rudolf Nureyev, has gained since he defected in Paris almost a decade ago.

title: Wadkins and Kite Head U.S. World Cup Team
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Sept. (UPI)Lanny Wadkins, the new United States Amateur champion, and Tom Kite, the Tunnerup, were named today to head the fourman United States team that will com pete in the World Cup ama teur golf competition at Ma drid, Sept. 23 through 26.

title: Officials of Cities Urge New Census Procedures
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5Of ficials of a number of cities, skeptical of fresh reports of population losses that imperil their budgets and their pride, are beginning to press for new ways to count people, partic ularly in the densely populated ghnttos.

title: 83,043 FANS SEE SAN DIEGO RALLY
description: CLEVELAND, Sept. 5 (UPI) Fred Cox kicked a 12yard field goal with 3 minutes 40 seconds left for the winning points, and Ed Sharockman ran an inter ception back 98 yards to lead the Minnesota Vikings to a 2421 victory over the Cleve land Browns tonight in the sec ond game of the annual pro football doubleheader.

title: Job Changes:
description: BigelowSanford, Inc., a wholly owned subsidiary of the Sperry & Hutchinson Company, has named Robert B. Jennings chief executive officer. He has been presi dent and chief operating of ficer since 1968.

title: Who Won the War?
description: Old controversies, like old soldiers, never die. They fade away only to return years later to be reargued in the narratives of historians and the memoirs of participants.

title: Author's Query
description: I am writing a critical study of the Irish dramatist Paul Vin cent Carroll (190068), and would appreciate receiving any information regarding his plays, especially The Watched Pot, Kindred and The Chuckey head Story.

title: Caroline S. Reid Becomes a Bride
description: SAN MATEO, Calif., Sept. 5  Miss Caroline Stewart Reid and Bruce Hugh Mc Allister were married here this afternoon in the Epis copal Church of St. Matthew by the Rev. Lesley Wilder.

title: Hong Kong Tennis Set
description: HONK KONG, Sept. 5 (UPI) Hong Kong's first playfor pay international tennis tourna ment will be staged Dec. 15 to 20, it was announced today by the Hong Kong Lawn Tennis Association. The $13,500 tour nament is tentatively called Rothmans Hong Kong interna tional open tennis champion ships, pending confirmation from the International Lawn Tennis Feteration which will meet in London Sept. 24.

title: Nixon to Prod Congress Upon Return to Capital
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Sept. 5President Nixon will return to Washington late tomorrow to prod Congress on a host of measures still awaiting final leeislative action.

title: Gunther Schuller: Artist On a Hot Tin Roof?
description: WHAT strange itch is it that so often turns the promising mod ern composer into an artist on a hot tin roof? Beyond the primordial urge to earn the rent money, is it ego or greed that drives a Boulez, a Foss or a Bernstein to take on job after job, until Renaissance man begins to look like a monomaniac in compari son? Boredom, maybe? Power lust? Fear of an imminent drying up of creative juices? Simple, unconstrictable energy? All of the above?

title: INTREPID YIELDS TO AUSSIE PROTEST
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Sept. 5 The Australians appear to have won their protest, at least in part, that the America's Cup de fender Intrepid is not a 12 Meter yacht.

title: Deaths
description: ALBERTSMax M., beloved husband of Paula, dear father of Florence Teneberg and Audrey Cohen. Devoted brother of Nor man and Percy Cohen, and Lillian Siegel and loving grandfather. Serivces today 1:30 P.M. at Nieberg's Midwood Chapel, 1625 Coney Island Ave., Ave. M (Bklyn.).

title: Root Some Cuttings
description: I N spite of all the polyethylene house plants and flowers sold in the stores today, there are still many persons who prefer to grow their own. One good source of material is the garden. Early September is none too early to take cuttings from bedding plants to root for indoor growing.

title: DEATHS OF POLICE LINKED TO HATRED
description: SAN FRANCISCO. Sept. 5 While two policemen answered a burglary complaint in a hous ing project, a bomber destroyed their prowl car simply, the police say, as a target of op portunity.

title: ILLINOIS CHARTER IRKS DALEY BLOC
description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill., Sept. 5 The new Illinois constitution, proposed by the state's sixth constitutional convention, has angered the group that will per haps be the most needed to se cure its passagethe Chicago Democratic organization of Mayor Richard J. Daley.

title: Country Editor's Boy
description: Modern times keep a person so uptight with strident excite ments that it is a relief to find a personal history like this, to spend a few hours enjoying quiet things. Born at the cen tury's turn, Hal Borland has been enchanting readers with his books and essays on nature and folklore and people for a long time. Published in 1956, his High, Wide and Lonesome described his childhood on homestead in eastern Colorado.

title: Customs Receipts Drop As Air Imports Decline

title: De Beauvoir, Lessingnow Kate Millett
description: On the delicate skin of the Rokeby Venus in London's National Gallery are the slashmarks made by the suffragettes. The aggressive women, the odalisque represented, the model, the painter celebrating such form and flesh, and the consumers of such high pornography are all victims of cor rupted sex. Like race and class, sex is a subject we cannot simply write about, for it is our sex that writes. Aloofness is no merit, being inap propriately tolerant. Corrupted lovers all, we find it hard to keep heart and head in the right place.

Subsequently he moved to Britain, where he forged a brilliant career, partnered by Dame Margot Fon teyn. Miss Makarova continued to dance with the Leningrad bal let as it visited the United States, Italy, Austria and Britain.

title: Recordings
description: POOR Max Reger. After composing reams of music so thick with notes and chromatics as to be virtually unlisten able, he had hardly begun to emerge from that morass when he died of a heart at tack at 43. That was in 1916. Reger was by no means a modernist as yet, but in scraping away agglomerations that had choked his mu sic with almost cancerous prolixity, he had started to reveal a musical personality of true strength, sensitivity and, yes, charm that was promising indeed.

title: OHIO STATE NO. 1 IN PRESEASON POLL

description: ATLANTA, Sept. 5Whitney M. Young Jr. urged delegates to the International Congress of African People today to put the cause of our people ahead of any party and to be rela tively independent in voting patterns.

title: LOWER FOOD COST BELIEVED FAR OFF
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 5  Farm economists in the Middle West believe that the August decline in wholesale food prices, the sharpest drop in 22 years, oc curred without any help from President Nixon's antiinflation policies, and may be long in reaching the consumer. The sharp decline in the prices, which dropped 2.5 per cent at the end of last month, was largely caused, the econ omists say, by the oldest factor in farm econpmicsa steep rise in the supply of some farm products.

title: Autos Recalled
description: TOKYO, Sept. 5 (UPI) The Toyota Motor Company, Japan's largest auto maker, is recalling 838,000 of its passenger cars found to have a defective accelerator or brake. The company said the defects were found in its Corolla, Publica and Corona models.

title: Would a Spy in Vienna Ride a Blue Trolley?

Surrounding them were dozens of other trolleys, all painted redan other reminder of my young days in New York.

title: Patterson Is the Same Eager Boxer, Working Hard to Give Good Performance
description: NEW PALTZ, N. Y., Sept. 5Usually, when someone has been away from his trade as long as Floyd Patterson, he brought back with a flourish and the ad vance billing always includes the word new. A whole new publicity theme is designed for him and he goes along with it to a point where he actually begins to believe some of the superlatives that come out of the mouths of the promoters.

title: Jesus Christ as a crimsonspotted fungus
description: Philology, sexology and mycology are brought together here to produce an amazing result. Three thousand words are investigated in a dozen ancient languages. Among them is veritable glossary of sex and drugs. Sexual symbols are discovered ev erywhere, especially in the her maphroditic form (penis and vulva) of the mushroom.

title: Saigon Police Destroy Shanties of Refugees
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 5 (UPI)South Viet namese policemen tore down the shanties of 300 refugee families and arrested the wives and children of some disabled South Vietnamese Army veterans, authorities reported today.

title: Stories of naivete, irony and freewheeling narration
description: This collection of stories by writers from Trinidad. Jamaica, Barbados and British Guiana defines a culture that has often been known solely for its ex oticism and tourist beaches. These stories parallel what is known on mainland South America as cuentos criollos, tales of native life told by na tive writers. The oldest of the taletellers is C.L.R. James, 69, of Trinidad; the youngest, Don ald Hinds, 36, of Jamaica. Many of them live in England, some in Africa; practically none in the West Indies.

title: Soviet Scores Novelties, Coaching for Soccer Defeat
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 5 (UPI) Soviet soccer officials blamed poor coaching and a lack of tactical novelties today for their country's defeat in the World Cup matches In Mexico.

title: Looking Forward
description: What do you consider to be the mission of the dramatist of the fu ture? an interviewer asked George Bernard Shaw on the eve of the 20th century. To write plays. snapped G.B.S., who wasn't about to be trapped into any crystalball gazing.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Tales of the North Woods
description: CLAYTON LAKE, Me.  It was nearly midnight, rain drummed on the roof, and the tall, pointed spruces of the nearby forest were black against the sky when light ning flared.

title: What anonymous author was once the most famous writer of Europe?
description: There has never been anything like it, boom and bust. The Scottish lawyer's sickly child becomes the only British writer to earn enough from his pen to build a great coun try house set in its own broad acres, and with it the title of baronet to pass on to his heirs. Then, in the fi nancial crisis of 1826, the bust; at the age of 56 Scott suddenly finds himself some 127,000 in debtat least a million dollars today.

title: Census: The Suburb Is Where The Action Is Now
description: WASHINGTONIn that qui eter time not so many months ago when young rebels con fronted the system with taunts rather than demonstrations, a group boarded a sightseeing bus for an unusual tour. Out, out they went until they reached their goal  the suburbs. With mock incredulity, they marveled at the alien quietude, snapped tourist photos of men mowing lawns, and then hurried home to the city where, they said, the action was.

description: DALLAS, Sept. 5 (AP)The Kansas City Chiefs returned to their former home tonight and scored a 130 National Football League preseason victory over the Dallas Cowboys.

title: Marxist Victory in Chile
description: There is no point in trying to minimize the im portance of what has happened in Chile. In a free election with an unusually high turnout the candidate whose campaign was organized by the Communists has won the most votes. He has done so without soft pedaling the Marxist revolutionary program he hopes to carry out.

description: MILTON, Mass., Sept. 5 Miss Gail Putnam and Rob ert Emmet were married here today in St. Michael's Episco pal Church by the Rev. Sidney Lovett. The Rev. Norman Goehring assisted.The bride is a daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Robert Mitchel Putnam. Her father is an internist. Mr. Emmet is a son of Mrs. Richard Stockton Emmet of Glen Head, L.I., and the late Mr. Emmet, who was senior partner in the New York law firm of Emmet, Marvin & Martin.

title: Wall St. Influence Abounds At Westchester Show Today
description: Wall Street moves north to day to Croton Point Park, CrotononHudson, N.Y. How ever, the rings will not be filled with bulls and bears but with 2,514 dogs striving for the title of best in show at the Westchester Kennel Club's 53d annual event.

title: 10 JUMPERS INVITED TO $100,000 RACE
description: CAMDEN, S.C. Sept. 5 (AP) An Irishbased jumper and a champion Australian steeple chaser head a list of 10 for eignowned horses invited to participate in the $100,000 Col onial Cup Nov. 14, the richest steeplechase ever run in the United States.

title: Mideast 1: U.S. on the Spot Over Threat to Truce
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif.The White House is the sort of in stitution that routinely takes the offensive when there 3, some thing to be gained by attacking boldly. Even obvious setbacks are examined to see whether they can be made to yield po litical profit. But last week there was utter silence in San Clemente and with it the smell of wellintentioned plans gone wrong, of individual errors of iudement of helnlessness.

title: A Plan for Street Parking Put Into Effect in Boston
description: BOSTON, Sept. 5 (AP)  A new parking plan for Boston residents allowing them to park for extended periods on city streets has gone into effect.

title: Variation on a Spanish classic
description: Paella is quintessentially Span ish, but it has been adopted and adapted by many peoples. Like bouillabaisse (the ingre dients for which vary from port to port), paella varies from pan to pan. Even in Spain the in gredients vary from region to region, town to town and home to home. This variation, cooked in the American home of a former resident of the French Riviera, could be described as a paella twiceremoved.

title: Will a Marxist Become President Of Chile?
description: SANTIAGOChile has a justi fied reputation for genuine dem ocratic Government because over many years all sectors of the citizenry, rich and poor, conservative and radical, the young and their elders, have ac cepted the result of election as a national mandate.

title: Indochina 3: Enemy Keeps Up Cambodia Pressure
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia When Western diplomats and military observers discuss the Cambodian military situation, they sound like Vermonters talking about milk prices. Well, it's not as good as I'd hoped but then again things are better than I figured they'd be, said one knowledgeable American official, reflecting the general opinion here that even if all is not well in Cambodia, things could still be worse.

title: Fuel Imoprts Up
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5 (UPI)Dependence of the Eastern Seaboard on imports for its residual fuel supplies increased to 93.7 per cent of total consumption during the first five months of 1970, the Interior Department said this week. This compared with 89.8 per cent in 1969, 86.9 per cent in 1968, and 75 per cent a decade ago.

title: Miss Mary Lee Zimmerman Wed

Msgr. James A. Suddes performed the ceremony and celebrated the nuntial mass.

title: RANGERS TO OPEN CAMP IN ONTARIO
description: The New York Rangers, 63 players strong, will open train ing for the 197071 season Fri day at the Kitchener (Ontario) Memorial Auditorium.

title: Sports of The Times
description: No matter what happens to the New York Mets, the Chicago Cubs and the Pittsburgh Pirates from here on, the myth makers are home free. All the alternative explanations for the 1970 baseball season are already at hand, fully formed and burst ing with the interpretation of your choice. Whoever wins in National League East or for that matter, in American League West and eventually in the World Series the purveyors of the readymade view have an embarrassment of riches neatly lined up for their use. Suppose the Mets do win again.

title: GORMLEY, AT 55, VICTOR ON JUMPER
description: MIDDLE ISLAND, L. I., Sept. 5Hugh Gormley, who has been in the riding business all his life, and Scarlet Mex, com peting for about six months, combined to win the interme diate jumper championship at the Rice Farms horse show to day at Middle Island Arena.

title: CITY PAYS RESPECTS TO VINCE LOMBARDI
description: The body of Vince Lombardi arrived at the Abbey Funeral Home yesterday morning to give sports fans, admirers, and friends here an opportunity to pay their last respects to the man who said winning was the only thing.

title: U.S. Skippers RunnersUp In German Title Sailing
description: KIEL, Germany, Sept. 5 (AP) Lowell North and John Dane 3d of the United States finished second in their respective classes as the German sailing championships ended today.

title: Border a Battle Area
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  During the period of the ceasefire be tween Israel and the Arab regular armies, fighting has continued between the Israeli Army and Palestine guerrillas in a dead zone about 6 miles deep that the Israelis have created along much of Lebanon's southern border. Intended by the Israelis toy shield northern Israel from operations by the commandos, the zone lies inside Lebanese territory. According to com mando sources, the Israelis have built service roads along, the Israeli side of the border with branches hewn out by bulldozers actually extending, into Lebanon, these serve as points of departure for patrols that seek to head off the guer rillas before they reach Israel.

title: Great yachts in a glamour race
description: This is an America's Cup year. The New York Yacht Club is again defending the historic trophy that was brought back from England by the schooner America in 1851 and has never been won back by a challenger in 20 tries. Since the series was revived in 1958, after a 21year lapse caused by World War II and the demise of the mammoth yachts used in the competition in the 1930's, a policy has been es tablished of accepting a chal lenge no more frequently than every three years. The triennial cycle settled on 1970, and both the yachting and general pub lic are hearing more about the specialized sport than in other summers of lesspublicized activity.

title: The Merchant's View:
description: When retailers find them selves unable to meet their yearago figures, it is not likely that they are going to be optimistic about the fu ture. But a note of cautious optimism has crept into the retail picture based, no doubt, on the belief that the econ omy is poised for an unturn.

title: Five Killed and Five Hurt In Jersey Highway Crash
description: WINSLOW TOWNSHIP. N. J., Sept. 5 (AP)Five persons from Philadelphia were killed and five injured today in a collision involving a tractortrailer and four cars on a spur of Route 561 near the Atlantic City Expressway.

title: Bermuda Cricketers Win
description: The Somerset Cricket Club of Bermuda defeated Staten Island C.C. at Walker Park yesterday. Somerset had 191 runs for 6 wickets declared, Staten Island had 90.

description: Joe Cullman likes to call himself the No. 5 player on the Philip Morris tennis team.

description: FLEMINGTON, N.J., Sept. 5  Expressing bitterness over the opposition they have en countered, more than 100 road weary veterans continued their antiwar march through western New Jersey today.
