title: Lee B. Ravenel Marries Anne Dickson
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5 Miss Anne Allbritten Dick son, daughter of Mrs. Waver ly Walters Dickson and the late Mr. Dickson, was mar ried here this afternoon in St. David's Episcopal Church to Lee Benoist Ravenel, son of Mrs. Arthur William De fenderfer, also of Washing ton, and the late Henry Rav enel.

title: Mayor Gibson of Newark Welcomed by His Hometown in Alabama
description: ENTERPRISE, Ala., Sept. 5 Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson of Newark came home today to receive something of a celebri ty's welcome in this small southeast Alabama community that he left 40 years ago as lust another black boy among the thousands searching for a better Iife in the North.

title: Fordham Eleven Will Begin Practice Drills on Tuesday
description: James S. Lansing, the Ford ham football coach, will wel come about 65 candidates when football practice opens on the Rose Hill campus Tuesday. The camp will mark the official resumption of varsity football after a 16year lapse, and the 90th season of intercollegiate football for Fordham.

title: Opera Opening in Saigon On a Controversial Note
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 5The opera Hansel and Gretel will bring a large if controversial dose of culture to Saigon this weekend when it is performed under private Amer ican auspices  at a cost of nearly $71100.

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: A plan to convert a rent controlled Queens apartment house development to coop erative ownership without re quiring tenants who do not wish to buy to move out against their will has been cleared for offering by the office of State Attorney Gen eral Louis J. Lefkowitz.

title: Indians Will Field One of the Biggest Elevens in East
description: HANOVER, N. H., Sept. 5 In his 15 seasons as Dart mouth's head football coach, Bob Blackman has guided the Indians to two undefeated cam paigns, three Ivy League cham pionships, a share of three oth ers and an overall record of 97 victories, 37 defeats and 3 ties.

title: MILTON DOUGLAS
description: Milton Douglas, a former actor and a retired television producer for Dumont and the Columbia Broadcasting Sys tem, died yesterday at his home, 880 Fifth Avenue. His age was 64.

title: A famous biographer's autobiography
description: The important thing, Maurois wrote concerning these memoirs, is to leave a true picture of myself. In that purpose he has succeeded perfectly. He has revealed himself without exaggeration or extenuation and in Coto; the portrait is as bal anced as the man himself. If any thing, he might be charged with excessive modesty, if it were not that modesty seems to have been an essential part of his make  up. He would have been more than human had he not delighted in the well earned honors heaped upon him, but he arrogates no undue credit nor spares admission of his shortcom ings.

title: SUIT BY CALIFORNIA CITES NAVY OIL SPILL
description: SAN DIEGO, Sept. 5 (AP) The state of California has filed suit against the Navy, contend ing its ships polluted the Los Angeles, Long Beach and San Diego harbors.it is our contention that the Navy is subject to the laws of the state regarding pollution, Deputy Attorney General Charles O'Brien said after an nouncing the suit Tuesday.

title: Wynne Starr Hutchinson Wed To John H. Phelan, Bank Aide

title: Mideast 3: Egypt's View Raises Questions
description: CAIROThe American initia tive for a settlement in the Mid dle East, accepted warily, at best, by the Egyptians in July, was acclaimed during the first flush of success for having clev erly broken an almost hopeless deadlock through generalized proposals rather than detailed commitments.

title: Somali Junta Urges Sacrifices to Help Develop Troubled Nation
description: MOGADISHU, Somalia, Aug. 25  The redbrick Parliament building on African Solidarity Square, which used to be the center of political life here, has been turned by the revolution:. ary Government into the Na tional Security Court. since April; corruption and espionage trials have been held there as part of a drive by the, military regime, which took power in a bloodless coup d'dtat last Oct. 21, to expung musugmasug from this Mos lem East African country of about 2.5 million people. Musugmasug is a newly in vented Sornali, word for a whole body of ills, from mismanage ment and corruption to injus tice and ordinary mistakes, and it is used to describe the reason for the revolution.

title: Microwave Contract

title: Dr. Cyril M. Hetsko Weds Mary Wright
description: MADISON, Wis., Sept. 5 Miss Mary Wright and Dr. Cyril Michael Hetsko were married here today in the Su preme Court Chambers of the Wisconsin State Capitol by Justice Nathan S. Heffernan.

title: PRAVDA ACCUSES U.S. ON TRUCE CHARGES
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 5 (UPI) Pravda, the Soviet party news paper, accused the United States and Israel today of sab otaging United Nations peace efforts with unfounded charges that Egypt had vio lated the Suez Canal cease fire. In a visit to the Foreign Min istry on Thursday, Ambassador Jacob D. Beam expressed United States concern over the report ed violations. Informed sources said he had been told that the Soviet Government would study the matter.

title: Democrats Are Expected To Retain House Control
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5As the fall campaign opens, it ap pears likely that the House of Representatives that will be elected in November will look very much like the present House, not only in relative party strength but also in the actual members.

title: September Morn
description: The chill of dawn seems even colder when one remembers the hot days of only a month ago. Then one remembers the past week's warm noons, hot, lazy afternoons, and one thinks that, after all, it now is September. One watches the mist over the water, gauze of the day's wakening.It is quiet. No dawn chorus of songbirds. In the distance two crows caw, not yet arrogant but defi nitely selfassured. The world doesn't yet belong to the jays and crows, but it will before long. No sign of the flickers this early in the day, but by midmorning they will be around, restless and in loose flocks of a dozen or more, almost ready to go south. Not a swallow in sight either, though ten days ago they were lined up, practically queued up, on the telephone wires, ready to leave but lingering another hour, another day.

title: Yugoslav in Round of 16; Ashe and Smith Triumph
description: Nikki Pilic, who grew up be hind the Iron Curtain but cherished Richard (Pancho) Gonzales as his idol, sent the 42yearold Californian to the sidelines yesterday in the third round of the United States Open tennis championships.

description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5The summer is over and the first major political test of the Nixon Administration is coming up in the Congressional election. This should bring the country back to the gigantic ordeals and menaces of the war, crime, in flation and unemployment.

description: BOSTON, Sept. 5Rabbi Mar tin E. Katzenstein, Acting Dean of Students at the Harvard Divinity School, died yesterday at his summer home in Sun apee, N. H. He was 47 years old and lived in Lexington. Mass.

title: SON OF AGNEW SAYS HE HAS LEFT WIFE
description: TOWSON, Md., Sept 5 James Rand Agnew, the 24 yearold son of the Vice Presi dent, has separated from his wife and 3yearold daughter and is working as a weightlift ing instructor in a health center here, he said today.

title: BacktoSchool Buying Picks Up After Initial Lag
description: The week before last if you had called me about backtoschool business, wouldn't have talked to you, said a prominent chainstore executive the other day. Now, I'm happy to tell you there has been big pickup in the last week.

title: Three books that suggest a radical critique of modern America
description: During the 1960's, it was the lot of Americans to live in mounting his torical crisis, but not to understand it. The symptoms of the crisis were everywhere: deepening involvement in a war most Americans believe we should never have entered; poverty and urban deterioration in the world's richest nation; persistent racism in a society committed for two cen turies to human equality; the grow ing disaffection of the best educated generation in history. But when it came to defining what was the mat ter, most have not even tried. As result, the symptoms of the crisis have constantly been confused with its causes, while the best efforts of both young and old have been wast ed in episodic attacks on these symp toms.

title: United States Tuna Team Recaptures Sharp Trophy
description: YARMOUTH, Nova Scotia, Sept. 5 (UPI)The United States bluefin tuna fishing team regained possession of the Al ton B. Sharp Trophy from Mex ico as the international com petition ended today.

Bahnsen had scattered five hits and was on his way to his seventh complete game until the ninth when Graig Nettles and Eddie Leon singled and Manager Ralph Houk took him out.

title: For Young Readers
description: For those on the American racial firing line, there are times of creep ing despair when there is fear that all has been sound and fire and no movement, that perhaps the elusive moment came and was lost. Then along comes a Lucille Clifton with profoundly simple way of saying all that is important to say, and we know that the struggle is worth it, that the all  important battle of image is being won, and that the future of all those beautiful black children out there need not be twist ed and broken.

title: His lifepulse was la cavale, the getaway
description: Tiger cages in Con Son. Torture tactics in Brazil. Father Berrigan in Lewisburg. Louis Wolfson and Willie Sutton testifying to the subzoo con ditions in American prisons. The time is clearly ripe for Papillon, the memoirs of a Frenchman who spent the years from 1933 to 1945 either in the penal colonies of French Guiana or on the lam from the camps. His obsession, his watchword, his life pulse during those years in the In ferno is la cavalethe getaway, the escape.

They had sailed 119 miles since late yesterday afternoon and that many miles remain.

title: School Prayer in Cambridge
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Sept. 5 (UPI)The School Committee has ordered principals in the city's 19 public schools to al low prayer before school. The action Tuesday night instructs the principals to allow the more than 20,000 pupils to pray five minutes before the official open ing of the school day. Teachers will not be permitted in the classrooms at the time. The prayers, according to Mayor Alfred E. Vellucci, will be strictly voluntary.

title: The Vietnamization Of General Di
description: SAIGON. ASIDE from being an ungainly word, Vietnamization, re peated here, can sound some thing like an Insult. What does it mean, this turning of the War over to the Smith Vietnamese? With 100,000 Vietnamese soldiers dead, cities razed, crops destroyed, whole villages obliterated, the Americans can talk about insisting that this country bear the brunt of the war? Vietnamization becomes an other catchword, like strategic ham let, pacification, revolutionary developmentphrases that rang re assuringly in Washington and never mind how they jarred the people who live here.

description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5 Serious civil disorders in the cities in the spring and summer declined for the second con secutive year, but an increase in bombings and scattered dis turbances in smaller communi ties have kept domestic vio lence at a high level.

title: Chess

title: Panther Trial in New York Will Be Different
description: There it was, a slap on the face for all the people who had said a black revolutionary couldn't get a fair trial in Ameri ca. There was Lonnie McLucas, a Black Panther, acquitted on three counts, convicted on one, grinning when he heard the jury's result; there was the jury itself, 10 whites and two blacks, handing in a verdict that McLucas's lawyer called a vic tory for the defense.

title: Navy Remembers Maine
description: PHILADELPHIA Sept. 5 (AP) The Navy has donated a re tired patrol escort vessel to Maine for use as a nautical school ship. The Ely was pre sented in ceremonies on Thurs day at the Philadelphia Naval Base.

title: Ruth Victoria Martin Is Married
description: HARRODS CREEK, Ky., Sept. 5Miss Ruth Victoria Martin, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Emmett Martin of Louisville, was married here today to William Samuel Kies 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Kies Jr. of Greenwich, Conn. The ceremony in St. Francis intheFields Episcopal Church was performed by the Rev. Stephen Davenport.

title: Letters
description: To THE EDITOR: Sam Blum's article on mari juana smoking (Marijuana Clouds the Generation Gap, Aug. 23) may have pointed out a serious trend in today's society, but shows an abysmal ignorance of recent scientific work. There is no question that a lot has yet to be learned about this drug, but a great deal has been learned. Any one who thinks marijuana or hashish or THC (the active in gredient of these drugs) is not a powerful, potentially dan gerous material is mistaken. There seems to be a fad to poohpooh the deleterious ef fects, and a cross section of articles written in popular magazines gives to marijuana whatever properties the user wants: euphoriant, depressant, analgesic, aphrodisiac, sensa tion heightener, etc. Thus, marijuana becomes a truly marvelous drug.

title: GOTHAM TROT SET FOR FRIDAY NIGHT
description: Une de Mai and Fresh Yan kee, the undisputed trotting queens of two continents, are expected to head a field of eight of the world's best trot ters Friday night when Yon kers Raceway will be the scene of the $50,000 Gotham Trot.

title: Federal Commission on Pornography Is Now Divided on the Easing of Legal Controls
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5A federal commission that once almost unanimously favored re laxing legal regulation of por nography is now widely divided over whether those laws apply ing to adults should be erased from the books.

title: Kathleen Sullivan Wed in Roslyn
description: ROSLYN, L. I., Sept. 5 St. Mary's Roman Catholic Church here was the setting this morning for the wed ding of Miss Kathleen Ann Sullivan to Harry Leroy Baugher. The ceremony was performed by the Msgr. Ed gar P. McCarren, pastor of St. Ignatius Martyr Roman Catholic Church in Long Beach.

title: Horton Hanover Captures Freehold Pace by Length
description: FREEHOLD, N. J., Sept. 5 Horton Hanover, owned by the Armstrong brothers of Bramp ton, Ontario, and driven by George Phalen, unleashed a final 29second quarter to win the featured $10,000 New Jersey pacing series at Freehold Race way today. He won by a length in 2:01.1.

title: Passenger Ships Still Reign on the Rhine
description: COLOGNE, West Germany,  Steamboat Bill and the speedy Robert E. Lee are just misty memories on the Mississippi where the passen ger ship has all but disap peared, but here on the Rhine they seem to be reincarnated, updated and multiplied.

title: Jets Provide a Telethon Team On Muscular Dystrophy Show
description: NEW ORLEANS, Sept. 5 Gathered by Jim Turner, nearly a dozen members of the New York Jets will devote part of their Labor Day to working at the Muscular Dystrophy tele thon.

title: Outlook at a Glance
description: PROSPECTSCould win Ivy cham pionship.

title: Bomb Rocks Manson Trial Building
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 5 (AP)  The Los Angeles County Hall of Justice, where the Sharon Tate murder trial is being held, was rocked by a bomb explosion on its sixth floor early to day.

title: Killer and decoy in the gay world
description: Cruising, in case you're not up on gay lingo, means dawdling by a homosexual  in Central Park, the Village, or wherever in the hope of making a pick up. We follow two cruises: one by a psychopath, a killer who has murdered five men and hacked up their bodies; the other by a detective assigned to nab him, and acting as decoy. We get an hourbyhour (al most minutebyminute) account of the doings of this pair: their comings, goings, and standing stills; their getting into cabs and getting out their getting into bed, sleeping, and getting up; their eating, breathing and drinking; their urinating, defe cating and masturbating; their thinking, if that's what goes on in their heads.

title: U.S. Embassy in Saigon Seeks Name for Its Boat
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 5 (AP)The United States Embassy's weekly bulletin is running a contest for a name for the embassy's new pleas ure boat.

title: Andre Simon, Author of Works On Food and Wine, Dead at 93
description: LONDON, Sept. 5Andr Simon, one of the world's lead ing authorities on food and wine, died today at Middlesex Hospital here. He was 93 years old and had lived in Britain for 63 years.

title: Jordan Announces Troop Pullback From Capital
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Sept. 5  The harried Jordanian Govern ment, bowing to Arab guerrilla demands, announced today that it had ordered the pulling back of military units around the canital.

title: Major League Baseball Sunday, Sept. 6, 1970
description: Major League Baseball Sunday, Sept. 6, 1970

title: BROOKLYN TURBINE CLOSED FOR REPAIR
description: Consolidated Edison said yes terday that a 110,000kilowatt turbine generator at its Hudson Avenue station in Brooklyn had been closed for repairs since July 25 and would not be back in service before No vember.

title: Remember Dada Man Ray At 80
description: VENCE, France. IN 1957, a LeftBank Paris art gal lery organized a Dada retrospec tive, as if to demonstrate that the most outrageous antiart movements eventually become a part of that which they seek to destroy. Extravagant objects made ul the twenties by Dadaists like Man Ray, Max Ernst and Francis Picabirt, to expose the absurdity of artistic creation, were now being praised in learned journals and bought by collectors at high prices. Although Dada's cutting edge seemed blunted by its passage from antiart to art, proof that its conten tious spirit was not dead arrived in the form of youthful antiDada dem onstrators from the neighboring BeauxArts school.

title: Warrants Are Issued by Canada For Arrest of Bombing Suspects
description: MADISON, Wis., Sept. 5 (AP)  The Canadian authori ties have issued warrants for the four young men sought by the Federal Bureau of Investi gation in, the bombing of a University of Wisconsin build ing, the state and local author ities said today.

title: Container Cargo Used For Individuals Baggage
description: Containerization, the magic word in recent years for in ternational commercial cargo shipments, has now been brought into play for inter national shipments of such modest items as personal lug gage.

title: Bethtem Steel Promotes
description: The Bethlehem Steel Corpo ration has announced the elec tion of Walter F. Williams as a vice president and his assign ment to the company's ship building activities. According to Edmund F. Martin, Mr. Wil liams, until yesterday assistant vice president for shipbuilding, will succeed Daniel D. Stro heimer upon Mr. Stroheimer's retirement next April 30.

title: WEST GERMAN SOCCER
description: WEST GERMAN SOCCER

title: Elizabeth Ann Skillin Is Married
description: UPPER MONTCLAIR, N. J., Sept. 5Miss Elizabeth Ann Skillin and John Augustin Flanagan were married here this afternoon in St. Cas sian's Roman Catholic Church by the Rev. Philip Kaufman.

title: Comedy Dead? Some Nights You Could Die Laughing
description: EVERYWHERE I go to day I hear people be moaning the fact that comedy is dead and that Americans don't know how to laugh any more. Re cently a national magazine devoted an entire editorial to an analysis of the sad state of the sense of humor in America.

title: Art Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR: I FIND it particularly un heroic when an art au thority takes the liberty to decimate the sincere efforts of a group of nonpro fessional artists. That John Canaday sought out the most vulnerable of all exhibitors for a sarcastic review is tantamount to the nocturnal mugging of a paraplegic. I am, of course, referring to his ar ticle, Nobody Except Me Likes It MuchBut I Do, in which he mace a specific point of vilifying the current Art of the Elders of Brook lyn arts and crafts exhibit in the Community Gallery of The Brooklyn Museum.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing Passenger and Mail Ship

title: Crew Abandons Greek Ship
description: HAIFA, Israel, Sept. 5 Reu ters)The crew of the Greek freighter Christina Maria abandoned ship today when she caught fire about 40 miles off the coast of Israel. They were picked up by Israeli coastal vessels, first reports reaching here said.

title: Katherine Griffith Wed
description: ATLANTA, Sept. 5Miss Katherine Scott Griffith, daughter of the late Mr. and Mrs. Robert Sherrill Griffith, was married here this after noon to Henry Armand Ter jen Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Terjen of Louisville, Ky. The Rev. Donald Daughtry of the First Congregational Church performed the ceremony at the home of Robert Sherrill Griffith Jr., brother of the bride.

title: With the National Geographic On Its Endless, Cloudless Voyage
description: WHILE some publishing em pires, their readers and ad vertisers lured away by the siren song of television, break up on financial shoals, and others, exhaust ing themselves in the grim effort to be more relevant than their rivals, barely stay afloat, and still others are plagued by strikes and Innen nialistic demands by the inkstained wretches and braless female militants who man the oars, The National Geo graphic glides on under spreading sails in a cloudless, endless summer of everincreasing prosperity.

title: DUNWOODY GAINS SOLING TRIUMPH
description: OYSTER BAY, L.I., Sept. 5 William McComb Dunwoody's Chances R captured Soling honors today as 64 boats sailed with the Seawanhaka Corinthian Yacht Club in its 98th annual fall regatta on Long Island Sound.

title: NONALIGNED NATIONS PREPARE FOR TALKS
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, Sept. 5 (Agence FrancePresse)A se ries of informal meetings was under way here today as dele gates to a conference of non aligned nations worked to set tle delicate procedural prob lems before the nations foreign ministers meet here tomorrow.

title: Yonkers Results
description: Yonkers Results

title: Operation Reported Ended
description: TEL AVIV, Sept. 5A mili tary spokesman said here this evening that the last of the Is raeli ground forces engaged in what he termed a search oper ation in southeastern Lebanon were on their way home. He said that they had suffered no casualties in the twoday foray.

title: There's Just No Relief for Those Labor Day Pains
description: THE month of August is the Sahara Desert of the art season, with Labor Day looking all green and wet and soft and palmy on the horizon. When Labor Day comes late, as it does this year, you can get pretty thirsty for something to write about. What looked like an intermediate oasis, but proved to be a mirage, took me to the Philadelphia Museum of Art last week to see an exhibition of paintings by Arthur B. Carles. Announced seduc tively in the museum's press release, the exhibition turned out to be a meager group of paintings (the 15 owned by the museum) hung in an unattractive passagewaystandard August fare, and I wouldn't think of suggesting that any one go see it.

title: The AirConditioned Census
description: The census of 1970 was the census of the astronaut and the airconditioner.

title: Allied Mills Lease
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 5 (UPI) Allied Mills, Inc., has an nounced it has signed an agreement for construction and lease of a $3.5million canned dog food plant at Se bring, Ohio. Allied said the new facility would be com pleted in August, 1971.

title: JETS WIN, 27 TO 14; NAMATH STANDOUT
description: NEW ORLEANS, Sept. 5In his first appearance as a start ing quarterback this year, Joe Namath displayed tonight the precise passing that typified the New York Jets ascent to the world championship in 1968 but was missing last season in their fall from glory.

title: Braves Sweep Giants, 52, 53
description: ATLANTA, Sept. 5 (AP)  Bob Tillman hit a pair of hom ers tonight, accounting for four runs in the Atlanta Braves victory over the San Francisco Giants in a rainplagued first game of a doubleheader.

title: Trainer and Rider Account For Triple at Rockingham
description: SALEM, N. H., Sept. 5 (AP) Pilot Knob, a 31 second choice, completed a triple for Vinnie Blengs and Bob Casey when he won the $6,000 Ches ter Purse before a crowd of 17,492 today at Rockingham Park.

title: Conservationists Fight Wisconsin Utility
description: MILWAUKEE, Sept. 5  A group of conservationists in northern Wisconsin is organiz ing for a battle next year that may have national implications in the control of public utilities.

title: EXHIBITIONS
description: EXHIBITIONS

title: Pearson to Start From Rail In Southern 500 Tomorrow
description: DARLINGTON, S. C., Sept. 5 (UPI)David Pearson, who says he has the right combination for getting around this old track, will start from the pole position tomorrow in his quest to win Southern 500 stockcar classic.

title: Police May Learn Chinese
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 5 (Reuters)Police Chief Alfred Nelder, with only three Chinese on his 1,800member force, has proposed sending six non Chinese officers to school to learn the Chinese language.

title: Margaret Snyder And Peter Fox To Be Married
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Sept. 5 Announcement has been made of the engagement of Miss Margret Snyder, daugh ter of Thomas S. Snyder of Wayzata and Mrs. Anne Bushnell Snyder of La Jolla, Calif., to Peter Fox, a pre medical student at the Uni versity of Utah.

title: PLAN FOR VENICE HEED INADEQUATE
description: VENICE, Italy, Sept. 5The Italian Gvernment has finally committed itself to aid the sinking city of Venice. But the head of UNESCO has politely criticized the declaration as in sufficient, and Italians have charged the Government has so diluted its commitment as to make it meaningless.

title: Belmont Entries
description: Horses listed In order of Post Positions FIRST$6,000, mdns., 3YO and up, 6f.

title: Joseph W. Garton Weds Deirdre Mary Wilson
description: ROCHESTER, Sept. 5Miss Deirdre Mary Wilson, daugh ter of Joseph Chamberlain Wilson, chairman of the board of Xerox Corporation, and Mrs. Wilson, was married here this noon to Joseph Walter Garton, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert E. Garton of Sheboygan, Wis. The bride's parents gave a re ception at their home here.

title: Astros Rout Dodgers, 72
description: HOUSTON, Sept. 5 (AP) Jim Wynn walloped a tworun homer, his 25th, in the first inning tonight to start the Houston Astros toward a 72 victory over the Los Angeles Dodgers. Larry Dierker notched his 13th victory with a four hitter.

title: SECURITY COUNCIL DEMANDS ISRAELIS END LEBANON RAID
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Sept, 5An Israeli raid into guerrilla area in southern Leba non brought a Security Council demand today for complete and immediate withdrawal. Israel's representative, Shah tai Rosenne, twice told the council that Lebanon's urgent plea for United Nations action was only a dramatization of a minor patrol action and that all troops had already been withdrawn from Lebanese ter ritory.

title: Bayh Foresees Passage Of Direct Vote Amendment
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5 (AP) Senator Birch Bayh, Demo crat of Indiana, said today there were now 55 to 60 solid Senate votes for a constitu tional amendment providing for the election of the President by direct popular vote.

title: For Squares: Open House At Synanon
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  The winding hill side drives here afford the visitor an awesome, soulinviting panorama of the harbor and hills of San Francisco. If grand vistas are all he seeks, it will suf fice. But should he have a taste for more meaty fare, for a soulstretching, close in view of another, more relevant sort, the visitor might well descend to Clay and 13th Streets in a seedy section of downtown Oakland. What he sees and experiences within the 12story building that is Synanon House will remain with him long after all memory of the pano rama has vanished.

title: MATKOVIC CAPTURES RESOLUTE LAURELS
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., Sept. 5Gino Matkovic took Resolute Class honors today in the first of three holiday week end Cow Bay area Yacht Rac ing Association of Long Island Sound regattas conducted by the Manhasset Bay Yacht Club.

title: Police Classify Leary As a Missing Person
description: By last night, when every news medium in the metro politan area had reported the resignation of Police Com missioner Howard R. Leary, it still had not been carried on the police radio and tele printer circuit.

title: Miss Joan K. Lutz Married on Coast
description: PASADENA, Calif., Sept. 5 Miss Joan Kelley Lutz of Pomona, daughter of John Gorman Lutz, managing di rector of Ingersoll Rand Co., Ltd., of London and vice president of Ingersoll Rand, New York, and Mrs. Lutz of London, formerly of Garden City, N. Y., was married here this afternoon to Richard Lee Winegar, son of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Carrol Winegar of Orange.

title: Nancy McCaffrey Wed to S. E. Rathmell
description: BRUNSWICK, Me., Sept. 5The marriage of Miss Anne Marie (Nancy) McCaf frey to Stephen Edward Rath mell took place here this afternoon in the chapel of Bowdoin College, where the bridegroom is a senior. The ecumenical ceremony was performed by the Rev. John P. Davis of St. Charles Roman Catholic Church here and the Rev. John Wild of the First Congregational Par ish Church.

title: Carol's Prime Time
description: LONDON. IT isn't easy to get a couple of British theatrical knights to make clowns of themselves on television. Inten tionally, that is. But Carol Chan ting did it.

title: GIANTS TRIUMPH OVER EAGLES, 277
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Sept. 5 The Giants escaped the ulti mate humiliation today when they outscored the Philadelphia Eagles, 277, at Palmer Stadium in Drinnatnn N. J.

title: Manpower Group Helps Students on G.I. Bill Get PartTime Jobs
description: James McFadden, president of the Manpower Education Institute, announced yesterday that his organization had worked out arrangements with a group of business concerns in the city to provide parttime jobs for veterans enrolled in college programs under they G. I. Bill of Rights.

title: U.S. Business:
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept. 5 The image of this city that is maintained in some cir clesthat if there is a na tional business tremor Pitts burgh's economy will plunge downwardis just not true, Norman Robertson, a vice president and chief econo mist of the Mellon National Bank and Trust Company, said this week.

title: 30c Fare Safe Through 71, Beame Says After Audit
description: The City Controller's office has audited the Transit Au thority's books for the year ended June 30, 1969, and con curred with what the authority announced in July: that the 30 cent fare is safe through 1971.

title: GABRIELFEIGENBAUM, REALTY EXECUTIVE
description: Gabriel Feigenbaum, a retired New York and Ohio realestate executive, died Wednesday in London, where he had been vis iting. He was 67 years old and lived at 146 Central Park West.

title: U.S. BEATEN, 7871, BY SOVIET QUINTET
description: TURIN, Italy, Sept. 5 (AP) The Soviet Union basketball team upset the United States, 7871, tonight, lifting the Soviet's goldmedal total to a leading 23 in the World Univer sity games.

title: Use of Mobile Homes Gains in New England
description: BOSTON, Sept. 5  New England's six states vary widely in the growth of mo bile homes to relieve hous ing shortages resulting from high land and mortgage costs and rising apartment rental rates.

title: Worry About John Simon
description: Drama Mailbag

title: MISSILE BELLE, 81, SCORES IN GAZELLE AT BELMONT PARK
description: Missile Belle displayed the ?? form that she showed ear ?? in the season yesterday as he won the $58,200 Gazelle at Belmont Park.

title: Fear and Tension Grip Salinas Valley in Farm Workers Strike
description: SALINAS, Calif.  Red Lewis flicked his cigarette butt toward a field laden with ripe green cauliflower. I'm harvesting my crops, he said grimly, that's what I plant ed them for. His partner, Joe Violini, spat into the dust and said: You're god damn right, that's what we're doing.

title: 7 Found Shot to Death In Canadian Farmhouse
description: CRESTON, British Colum bia, Sept. 5 (UPI)Seven per sons, members of two fami lies, were found shot to death today in this small lumbering and farming community near the United States border, the Royal Canadian Mounted Police reported.

title: Maybe a Slow Start Will Bring a Better Season?
description: HERE it is Labor Day and not a play in sight. We do have a few Off Broadways scheduled for later in the month, and of course the coffee houses are brewing more than coffee all the time, but it doesn't look as though the current season was about to take off with anything like wingedhorse speed. Last season didn't, why should this be pushy?

title: Third World Seeks Unity at Conference
description: Atlanta, Sept. 5  Bruce B. McGuinness is a fair skinned man with a slight beard and straight hair who came to the international Congress of African People here from Vic toria, Australia, because he feels that aborigines like himself must make alliances with other people engaged in liberation struggles or face extinction.

title: Indochina 1: Senate Foes Lose but Message Is Clear
description: WASHINGTON  After hun dreds of speeches and months of often bitter argument, the Senate rejected the HatfieldMc Govern Amendment to End the War last week and brought to an end the long hot summer of Congressional debate over the Adm'nistration's Indochina pol icy.

title: Reds Anderson and Aides Signed to Contract for 71
description: CINCINNATI, Sept. 5 (UPI) The Cincinnati Reds announced today that Manager George (Sparky) Anderson had been signed to a oneyear contract for the 1971 season, along with his entire coaching staff.

title: COUNCIL LIBERALS SEEK TO END RIFT
description: Eldon R. Clingan the mi nority leader of the City Coun cil, expects to meet with his three Liberal party colleagues the next three weeks in an at tempt to end a bitter dispute over leadership.

title: Home Improvement
description: WATER that comes cascading off the roof of the house aft er a rainstorm can be a frequent cause of wet basements, flooded window wells, eroded lawns and washed out foundation plant ings. As the rain water is caught by the roof gutters (it is even worse if there are no gutters) it is drained off by the vertical downspouts which all too often then dis charge their flood into the ground right next to the house. This water seeps down to saturate the soil alongside the basement walls and fre quently builds up enough hy drostatic pressure to force its way in through cracks, holes and porous sections in the foundation. In addition, the washouts that occur can cause the soil to settle and form pockets that further in crease the chances of future washouts and basement flooding.

title: Science
description: WASHINGTONWhen Amer ican politicians, goaded by So viet space successes, first pro claimed the national effort to land men on the moon many of the country's most influential scientific leaders scoffed. At least four Science Advisors to the President raged against the Apollo program, calling it a scientific luxury, a weight lifting contest with the Russians and a plan that won't work.

title: Agriculture College Backs Continued Use of Parathion
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Sept. 5  The University of Kentucky Col lege of Agriculture will continue to recommend the use of the insecticide parathion, a highly toxic cmemical that is reported to have caused several deaths in the South.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: Article 3  No Title

description: The addresses of the Synanon Foundation houses referred to in the article are as follows:

title: Photography
description: LONDON DOWN a long suite of galleries at the Vic toria and Albert Mu seum, past gilded Ti betan gods, Javanese gamelan instruments, Balinese shadow puppets and Persian paint ings of acrobatic dancing girls, is the office of Charles Harvard GibbsSmith, Keep er of the Department of Pub lic Relations. Thirtyeight years ago, when Mr. Gibbs Smith joined the Victoria and Albert, he was merely asked to catalogue the Museum's photography collection  he wound up doing much more.

title: Hospital Target For a Test by Radicals
description: A potentially historic ex periment has been made this summer to see whether ghet to hospitals could be used to radicalize poor blacks and Puerto Ricans much as leftist students have used the uni versities to radicalize other students and faculty. So far, the experiment has not gone well for the radical cause.

title: Card of Chanks
description: HOLDER. The family of Joan Geffner Holder thanks the myriad of relatives and friends sincerely for their kindness and sympathy at a time when It was deeply appreciated.

title: PAPERS PROTEST THAI PRESS BILL
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Sept. 5 Four 'f Thailand's 33 news papers reported Vice President Agnew's visit to Bangkok last week. The rest, to protest pending legislation regulating the press, joined in a blackout to show their displeasure.

title: Flatlands Industrial Park, Year Old, Making Strides
description: The last grade crossing in the New York City rapidtransit system will soon be consigned to history, and its passing will signal another step in the transformation of a oncerundown sec tion of Brooklyn into an industrial park.

title: Barely Once Is First
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 5 (AP) Barely Once, the 1110 favorite, outgamed Kerry's Time today to win the $27,400 Illinois Own ers Handicap by a neck before 27,069 at Hawthorne.

title: 2MILE ATTEMPT BY KEINO FAILS
description: LONDON, Sept. 5 (UPI) Three world records fell at an international track and field meet at Crystal Palace Stadium today but, Kipchoge Keino the Olympic champion, failed in his attempt to set a world twomile mark.

title: Substitutes For the Nonmower
description: WHERE a lawn doesn't grow well, try a substitute groundcover. But before taking the step, learn why the grass failed. Was the area excessively wet or dry, too shaded, too steep or rocky, or was just too much lawn to mow? The answers to these questions will influence choice of substitutes.

title: O'Connor Gains 4Shot Lead With 214 in Rich Tourney
description: HOLLINWELL, England, Sept. 5 (AP)  Christy O'Connor, Irelead's 45yearold golfing maestro, conquered gale force winds today and took a four stroke lead after three rounds in the. John Player golf tourna ment, which has the richest first prize in the game, $58,000.

title: Letters:
description: I am a registered repre sentative with Bruns, Norde man & Co., a New York Stock Exchange member. Daily I am asked to com ment. How is that report from XYZ? Is it good? Is it bad? Will the stock go up or down? At best, it's a guesti mate, even when earnings are reported as increasing. It's expectancy and the ability to hit that target by XYZ that counts.

title: Pace Sluggish In Purchasing
description: Purchasing executives have had what they generally de scribe as normally sluggish business this summer, but they say business in July and August was better than in most of the first half of this year, according to the Na tional Association of Pur chasing Management.

title: 2 Priests and Man Jailed For Peace Protest at Fair
description: SYRACUSE, N. Y., Sept. (AP)Two Roman Catholic priests and a former semi narian were arrested and sen tenced to jail today after paint ing peace slogans and symbols on displayed Army equipment at the State Fair.

title: Ford, as Businessman, Finds Social Challenge
description: DETROIT, Sept 6 (UPI) Henry Ford 2d says he be lieves that the freedom of big business in the years ahead depends on how it re sponds to the changing spirit of the public.

title: Israeli Envoy Calls U.A.R. and Soviet Guilty of Duplicity
description: Itzhak Rabin, Israel's Am bassador to the United States, accused the United Arab Re public and the Soviet Union last night of duplicity, double talk and sheer conspiracy for attempting to hoodwink the United States in its peace initiative.

title: Yanks Rally Downs Indians, 41
description: Another prize was added to Fritz Peterson's locker yester day. After his 41 victory over the Indians, the Yankee left hander tucked the baseball he used to get the final out into his locker shelf.

title: Other Developments
description: In Washington, United States officials said they were hopeful that Israel's withdrawal from talks meant only a delay and not a final breakdown. Page 2.

title: ZALMAN ARANNE, EXISRAELI AIDE
description: JERUSALEM, Sept. 6 (Reu ters)  Zalman Aranne, a former Israeli Cabinet minister and a longtime labor leader, died last night after a brief illness. He was 71 years old.

title: CORE Gives Up Integration to Back Separatism
description: MOBILE, Ala., Sept. 6The Congress of Racial Equality, an established force in black Amer ica's pursuit of equal oppor tunity, has officially forsaken integration as an effective tech nique for achieving that goal.

title: German Girl Sets Mark
description: BERLIN, Sept. 6 (AP)East Germany's Burglinde Pollak set a world record in the women's pentathlon today, the official press agency ADN reported. The 19yearold Potsdam girl scored 5,406 points to better by 54 the previous mark set by Liese Prokop of Austria.

title: 19 Hurt as Bus Overturns
description: CROSSVILLE, Tenn., Sept. 6 (UPI)A Continental Trailways bus bound from Dallas to New York City with 24 passengers overturned near here this after noon. At least 19 persons were injured. The driver said a shoul der of the road collapsed as he tried to avoid an auto.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: ANTIPOVERTY UNIT WEIGHS CUTBACKS
description: A citywide panel of the Coun cil Against Poverty is reconsid ering proposals from the Com munity Development Agency that would drastically cut back antipoverty programs directed at the city's nearly one million Spanishspeaking residents.

title: Nuptials for Elizabeth Zoob on L.I.
description: ROSLYN HEIGHTS, L. I., Sept. 6 The marriage of Miss Elizabeth Gale Zoob and Robert Lawrence Fisher, graduates of the University of California at Berkeley, took place here this after noon at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Mortimer Zoob, parents of the bride. Rabbi Donald N. Gluckman performed the ceremony.

title: Ceylon: Native Films Are Catching On
description: COLOMBO, CeylonLester James Peries, Ceylon's finest film director, whom Satyuajit Ray has called my only rela tion east of Suez, has to make documentaries in be tween feature films in order, as he puts it, to bring in the rice and curry. Although his simple, realistic films have finally be come safe at the Ceylonese box office in the last three or four years (his early films were financial flops), they are by no means big money makers.

title: DRAFT FILES TORN IN ROCHESTER RAID
description: ROCHESTER, Sept. 6 In truders broke into the Federal Building here today and ran sacked the offices of the Fed eral Bureau of Investigation the Selective Service System and the United States At torney.

title: CHICAGO CONTEST IS SHIFTED HERE
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 6.  the seasonal rain crisis began Ito materialize in the National League today when the New York Mets and Chicago Cubs were rained out of the final game of their series in Wrig ley Field.

title: Threat Delays Mrs. Gandhi
description: BOMBAY, India, Sept. (UPI)Mrs. Indira Gandhi's journey to the conference In Lusaka was delayed today by a telephoned bomb threat. The Air India Boeing 707 carrying the Prime Minister had been airborne for about 10 minutes when it was ordered to re turn. A search of the plane produced no bomb.

title: Swidler Says Local Phone Users Subsidize LongDistance Calls
description: ALBANY, Sept. 6.  The chairman of the State Public Service Commission said today that local telephone users in the state were being forced to sub sidize longdistance calls.

title: CASTER LOCKS UP SPOT WITH JETS
description: The Jets have found the wide receiver who will replace Don Maynard eventually, if not now.

title: Clemente Put in Traction After Spraining Back
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept. 6 (UPI) Roberto Clemente, Pirate star, entered the Presbyterian Hos pital tonight. He was placed in traction for a sprained lower back, which he injured Friday night swinging at a pitch. The club physician, Dr. Joseph Fein gold, said, it [the injury] hadn't gotten any better and we felt he had to be placed in traction and receive physio therapy to reduce the muscle spasm.

title: CALIFORNIAN WINS BY 64, 46,75, 64
description: If you fretted over not hav ing seen the Wimbledon tour nament this year, fret no longer: 10 of the men's singles players who reached the round of 16 in England several months back still are in contention for the $20,000 top prize in the United States Open tennis championships.

title: Auto Hulks Go to Deep Freeze In Salvage Process for Scrap
description: DUISBURG, West Germany, Sept. 6Like meat await ing its ultimate fate in the deep freeze, future generations of automobile wrecks are to be deep frozen prior to fragmentation with a novel scrap ping technique developed by a West GermanBelgian con sortium.

title: CARINA TRIUMPHS IN VINEYARD SAIL
description: STAMFORD, Conn., set. 6  In June, Richard S. Nye's 48foot sloop, Carina, from the Indian Harbor Yacht Club be came the offshore yacht of the year by winning the Newport Bermuda race. Today she sailed down a lesser but also important distance competitive honor.

title: International Loans Listed for Week
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6The following is a list loans and other aid extended last week by United States and other international lending agencies here:

title: Miss Cathy Balshone Married To Peter Alan Kellner, Investor
description: BEXLEY, Ohio, Sept. 6 Miss Cathy Susan Balshone, who expects to receive an M.S. degree in library science from Columbia University next month, was married this afternoon to Peter Alan Kellner, senior vice presi dent, equity investments, with the Heritage Mortgage Corporation in Miami.

title: BRANDT DEFENDS PACT WITH SOVIET
description: BERLIN, Sept. 6Chancellor Willy Brandt flew into West Berlin today to stress that the need for a settlement for this divided city was an inalien able part of his new Eastern policy.

title: Policeman Injured As Bomb Explodes Under Patrol Car
description: A 33yearold policeman was badly burned last night when a firebomb exploded under his patrol car at Broadway and 68th Street.

title: FLORIDIAN CARDS 7 BIRDIES, 9 PARS

title: Fort Wayne Radio Station Knocked Out By Firebombs
description: FORT WAYNE, Ind., Sept. 6 (AP)The WLYV radio station was knocked off the air early today when its transmitter was struck by firebombs and a police car was hit by gunfire. The incidents occurred during a dusktodawn curfew imposed after a series of firebombings early yesterday. No injuries were reported.

title: Columbia Expects to Have Fine Season
description: LAKESIDE, Conn. Sept. 6 Columbia University's football fortunes, which have sagged badly in recent seasons, may be on the upswing. That belief emerged today as Frank Na varro discussed the 1970 foot ball season.

description: ST. LOUIS, Sept. 6 (AP) Bob Gibson hit a tworun single during a sixrun splurge in the seventh inning today and later became the first St. Louis Car dinal pitcher to win 20 games in five seasons as his team whipped the Montreal Expos, 72.

Cahill of New Jersey arrived at Kennedy International Airport last night after a week's businesspleas ure trip to Irelund, where he and three other Governors were guests of the Irish Agricultural Wholesale Society. The other Governors were David Cargo of New Mexico, Warren Knowles of Wisconsin and John Dempsey of Connecticut. Mr. Dempsey remained in Ire land to visit his birthplace in County Tipperary.

title: 4 Jets Hijacked

Three of the flights were diverted to the Mid dle East; the fourth landed at London after a gunfight in which a hijacker was killed.

description: OAKLAND, Calif., Sept. (UPI)John Odom, going the distance for the first time since leaving the disabled list Aug. 4, pitched a twohitter and cracked a homer today in lead ing the Oakland Athletics to 71 triumph over the Kansas City Royals, their sixth straight.

title: Elisabeth Miller Wed
description: LAKE SUCCESS, L. I., Sept. 6Miss Elisabeth Ruth Mil ler, a sophomore at Barnard College, was married here to day to Ernest M. Post, a senior in electrical engineer ing at Columbia University. Rabbi Robert Widdom per formed the ceremony at the home of the bride's parents, Dr. and Mrs. Newton F. Mil ler. The bridegroom is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Herman D. Post of Great Neck. His fath er is president of Robins In dustrial Corporation and Con sumer Electronics Data De vices of Whitestone, Queens. Dr. Miller is a physician.

title: Walinsky Lays a Serious Decline in Police Quality to the Mayor

title: Browns Run Into DoubleHeader Jinx Again
description: The annual pro football dou bleheaders in Cleveland's Mu nicipal Stadium have been a financial success since they were begun nine years ago but a flop on the field for the Cleveland Browns and their fans.

title: Nixon Views Auto Race And Visits Ailing Aunt
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Sept. 6 (AP)  President Nixon wound up his 18day stay at the Western White House today with a helicop ter trip over the California 500mile auto race at Ontario. The unscheduled trip came shortly before his 4hour jet flight back to Washing ton.

The strike, by members of Local 504 of the International Alliance of theat rical Stage Employes, was called Friday over wages.

description: ATLANTA, Sept. 6A Har lembased Black Muslim min ister told the Congress of African People today that his religious group now owned thousands of acres in Georgia, Alabama and Mississippi and was negotiating for the pur chase of jet aircraft.

title: ITALY IMPORTING CHEESE FROM U.S.

A statement made on behalf of the political parties and in dependent organizations that supported Mr. Alessandri, a former President running as an independent, noted that the process of electing the next President of Chile had not been completed.

title: Rise Seen in Fringe Benefits

title: Books of The The Times
description: Its a striking idea that William Melvin Kelley has come up with in his new novel, Dunfords Travels Everywheres. That is, to use a black form of the dreamlanguage of James Joyce's Finnegans Wake (Haveth. Children Everywhere) to escape the strictures of the conventional (white) novelstrictures that Mr. Kelley had been finding progres sively more con fining, to judge from his first four works of fiction. Certainly, the idea has released in Kelley a creative exuberance that was being choked with bitterness in his last book, dem. Certainly, in Dunfords Kel ley has made a number of inter esting points about the American blacks language. And certainly he has produced novel as fascinating (and frustrating) as threedimensional chess. But whether the idea is finally successful, I honestly can't say, because, as with Finnegans Wake, the parts of Dunfords Travels Every wheres don't make complete sense until one understands the whole, and one can't understand that whole until one makes sense of the parts. Moreover, to make com plete sense of the parts demands a familiar ity with black argot that only certain blacks, and precious few whites, possess. Not to mention one's need for at least a casual acquaintance with Bantu, Coptic, Pidgin English, creolized language and God knows what other languagesalthough here, I admit, I'm purely guessing.

title: The Leary Resignation
description: The resignation of Police Commissioner Howard R. Leary is a distinct loss for the city. Since coming from Philadelphia four and onehalf years ago, Commissioner Leary has proved himself a capable administrator, resolute in his leadership and yet sensitive to the many different values and competing human needs which a good policeman in a big city has to take into account.

description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 6 Torsten Johansson gave a mas terly shotmaking performance today as he won the United States senior grasscourt ten nis championship at the Ger mantown Cricket Club.

description: BOSTON, Sept. 6 (AP) Tony Conigliaro scored on Pete Richert's basesloaded wild pitch in the 11th inning today, giving the Boston Red Sox 98 victory over the Baltimore Orioles.

title: Labor Day: The White House Becomes the House of Labor
description: The White House is being turned into the House of Labor this Labor Day, a transforma tion never effected by such union favorites as John F. Ken nedy and Lyndon B. Johnson or even by the father of the New Deal, Franklin D. Roose velt.

CATHARINES, Ontario, Sept. 6The magnificent crews from the sportsminded nation of East Germany won three first places and four seconds in the sevenevent finals of the World rowing championships today. title: Anything From Doorstops to Dog Collars Can Be Found in Needlepoint Shops
description: Needlepoint covers for ten nis racquets, needlework vests for women, needlework belts for men, and needle work collars for dogs. Of course, one can still make the traditional itemsthrow pillows, eyeglass cases, wall hangings, purses and so forth. Women just Rot tired of making lug gage rack straps, said Lukie Reilly, coproprietor with Nina Mortellito of an airy second floor shop that opened a few weeks ago at 860 Madison Avenue (70th Street). The in viting shop, with a whole walls of windows overlooking some tender young trees on Madison Avenue, is chalk white with touches of bright pink and bitter green, and is decorated with white Victor ian wicker furnishings. The selling quarters are on one side and across the ball is a studio, where about halfa dozen seriouslooking hippie elves trace and paint the original designs on needle point canvas.

description: Israel has made a serious mistake in pulling out of the preliminary peace talks at the United Nations. The better tactic would have been to continue dis cussions with Ambassador Gunnar V. Jarring pending completion of. Washington's effort to obtain a rectifi cation of the situation arising from Egypt's movement of additional Soviet missiles into the Suez Canal zone.

title: 40 Harlem Families Are Left Homeless By Tenement Fire
description: A threealarm fire in a tene ment in East Harlem yester day afternoon left 40 families homeless and eight firemen slightly injured.

title: Action Urged to Spur Research On New Birth Control Methods
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6  The birth control methods available in 1984 may not be much better than those avail able today unless strong steps are taken to bolster research and development, an expert in the field believes.

title: Kathy Kram Bride Of David P. Dobkin
description: ROSLYN, L.I., Sept 6  The marriage of Miss Kathy Ellen Kram, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Harvey Kram, to David Paul Dobkin, son of Mr. and Mrs. Ben Dobkin of Pittsburgh, took place here today.

title: U.S. Charge of TV Dumping Dismays Japanese
description: TOKYO, Sept. 6Japanese television manufacturers have been dismayed by dumping charges leveled against them recently by the United States Treasury Department, but they say they have no present plans to change their prices or sales policies.

title: STEEL PRODUCERS LOOK TO DETROIT
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept. 6Steel producers are looking to the automobile industry for clues to their market future.

title: CHABLIS CAPTURES HORSE SHOW TITLE
description: WESTON, Conn., Sept. 6 Sherry Pearlman, who is plan ning to retire from competition in another month at the age of 17, rode Chablis to the open jumper championship today at the Nimrod Farms Horse Show.

title: Louis Brenner, 87, Maker of Women's Wear, Is Dead
description: EAST ORANGE, N.J., Sept. 6 touis Brenner, a retired manufacturer of women's wear, died, today in East Orange Gen eral Hospital. He was 87 years old and lived at 377 South Hairlson Street.

title: Major League Leaders
description: Major League Leaders

title: Chile's Leading Marxist
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Sept. 6 As a medical student 40 years ago, Salvador Allende discovered in MarxistLenin ist criticism of capitalist so ciety a revolutionary re sponse to the social and eco nomic ills of Chile.

description: Yacht Racing Results

title: ISRAEL PULLS OUT OF PEACE PARLEY UNTIL MISSILES GO
description: JERUSALEM, Sept. 6The Israeli Government decided to day to withdraw from the Unit ed Nations peace talks with the United Arab Republic and Jor dan until the new missile instal lations reportedly established in the Suez Canal area have been removed.

title: La Mama Books 2 Plays
description: Gertrude, a new play with music and dance by Wilford Leach, will open the new sea son for the La Mama Ex perimental Theater Club on Wednesday. John Vacarro's Playhouse of the Ridiculous will perform Night Club, a new play by Ken Bernard, at mid night from Sept. 17 through Sept. 20 at the club, 74A East 4th Street.

title: Lorrenzacio Wins Paris Race
description: PARIS, Sept. 6 (AP)Lor renzacio, ridden by Lester Pig gott, won the Prix Foy, a tune up for the Prix de l'Arc de Triomphe, at Longchamps to day. The Irish horse covered the 2,200 meters (about 1 3/8 miles) in 2:15 3/5 and finished half a length, ahead of France's Beaugency.

title: Irish Setter Best at Westchester
description: CROTONONHUDSON, N.Y., Sept. 6Ch. Major O'Shannon, the topwinning Irish setter and the second leading sporting dog of 1969 added to his impressive record late this afternoon when he was named best in show in a field of 2,509 dogs at the 53d annual fixture of the Westches ter Kennel Club at Croton Point Park. The dark mahogany dog is owned by Albert N. Green field of Glen Moore, Pa.

title: American Air Set For Early Merger
description: American Airlines is hopeful that its planned merger with Trans Caribbean Airways can be consummated before the end of the year, Donald LloydJones, senior vice president of Amer ican, said in an interview over the weekend.

title: DODGERS TOP ASTROS ON RUN IN NINTH, 43
description: HOUSTON, Sept. 6 (AP)I Ninthinning singles by Billy Grabarkewitz, Torn Haller and Manny Mota produced the tie breaking run today and gave the Los Angeles Dodgers a 43 victory over the Houston Astros.

title: Meadowbrook Polo Team Sets Back Bethpage by 75
description: BETHPAGE, L.I., Sept. 6 John Whittemore scored four goals to lead Meadowbrook to a 75 polo victory over Beth page today at Bethpage State Park.

title: Arab League Asks End of Jordan Strife
description: CAIRO, Sept. 6All 14 coun tries in the Arab League put their weight today behind an endeavor to find a formula to end the strife in Jordan be tween the Palestinian com mandos and the Jordanian armed forces.

title: ISRAEL WILL ASK FOR EXTRADITION
description: TEV AVIV, Sept. 6Israel will ask Britain to extradite the woman hijacker caught in the unsuccessful attempt to seize an El Al airliner today.

title: Nelson Takes Auto Race
description: DU QUOIN, Ill. Sept. 6 (AP) Norm Nelson of Racine, Wis., won the United States Auto Club's 100mile national cham pionship stock car race at the Du Quoin State Fair today in 1 hour 21 minutes 3.4 seconds. Nelson, driving a 1970 Plym outh Roadrunner, had an av erage speed of 84.438 miles an hour.

title: Dance: Choreographers Have Their Day at Park
description: The concerns of the van guard choreographers are generally divided between formal explorations of space and innovative use of the atrical means. The New York Dance Festival at Cen tral Park's Delacorte Theater presented a selection of the newer choreographers work on Saturday evening.

title: Teaching Methods Challenged
description: As September settles over the land and 60 million pupils re turn to elementary and second ary schools for the new fall term, public education in the United States finds some of its most persistent postWorld War II problems less difficult. But at the same time, it is awaken ing to what is widely inter preted as a grave new challenge of the most fundamental sort.

title: Israeli Ship Lines Seeking to Double Their Fleet by 75
description: Israeli shipowners are chal lenging tourism as their coun try's chief earner of foreign exchange.

title: Data Products Names 2
description: The Data Products Corpora tion said yesterday it has ap pointed William N. Mozena and Graham Tyson as senior vice presidents. Mr. Mozena, a di rector and one of the com pany's founders, formerly was a vice president and treasurer'Mr. Tyson, also one of the founders, previously was a vice president.

title: GEORGE CARROLL, C.I.A. AIDE, IS DEAD
description: George A. Carroll, a scholar, educator, and highly placed security assistant in Washing ton, died Saturday, apparently of a heart attack, in Santa Barbara, Calif. He was 54 years old.

title: FELIX P. CARRIO DIES; URUGUAYAN ENVOY
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6 (UPI)  Felix Polled Carrio, Uru guay's Ambassador to the Or ganization of American States, died here early today.

title: Bridge:
description: The Open Pair champion ship at the Greater New York Bridge Association's Knicker bocker sectional tournament at the New York Hilton was won Saturday by Norman Kurlander and Eugene Neiger, both of New York. third round and played an other diamond. His only hope was that the diamond ace would appear and that the defense would be unable to cash the thirteenth spade.

title: HARRY A. WOHLMUTH
description: Harry A. Wohhnuth, an auc tioneer at 236 Seventh Avenue, and a former city marshal, died yesterday in Lenox Hill Hos pital. He was 65 years old and lived at 303 West 66th Street.

description: The Summaries MEN'S SINGLES

title: More Textile and Retail Diversification Is Forecast
description: An executive who for almost two decades has interpreted textiling to retailing and re tailing to textiling is con vinced that the current trend of diversification in both in dustries will expand greatly in the next decade.

title: Columbia County's Best Is at the Fair
description: CHATHAM, N. Y.  Frank Cappozzo, a friendly purveyor of sundries ranging from beer to boot polish, made a sure flicking motion with a fly swatter the other day and sealed the fate of a buzzing pest that had landed on his cash register. My family remembers when you came through in a horse and buggy with of a lunch and Columbia spent the whole Fair day, he said as the swatter just missed a second fly. It was a real outing.

title: Zionists Elect a Lawyer Here To Head National Organization
description: Herman L. Weisman, a New York lawyer, was elected head of the Zionist Organization of America yesterday and called on the Nixon Administration to exercise its influence to gain the removal of Soviet missile sites from the Suez Canal zone.

title: TV Will Drip Social Significance
description: Youth and contemporary rel evance are the targets of the new television season, which starts next Sunday, but the bearers of those hopes for the most part will be dressed in the traditional garb of lawyers, doc tors, policemen, adventurers, career girls and young marrieds.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: To the Editor: Harry I. Subin, in his Aug. 31 letter, rightly attacks the inequity of a money bail sys tem which imprisons the poor largely because they are poor. Affluence and its lack are too often the only distinguishable factors between those who sit in detention facilities awaiting trial and those who sit at home.

title: ROBERTSON CLOUT PROVES DECISIVE
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept. 6 (AP) Bob Robertson hit a leadoff home run in the 10th inning today to give the Pittsburgh Pirates a 43 victory over the Philadelphia Phillies.

title: Msgr. O'Keefe Named by Cooke As New Secretary of Education
description: Msgr. Joseph T. O'Keefe, who has been associate secretary of education in the New York Archdiocese since 1968, has been named secretary, assum ing full responsibility for co ordinating all educational ac tivities in the system.

title: U.S. to Give Seven States $25Million to Make Jobs
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6 (UPI) Secretary of Labor James D. Hodgson announced today that the Federal Government would make available $25million to help create jobs in the seven, states hardest hit by unemploy ment.

title: Union Chiefs Will Meet With President Today
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6All of a sudden the politicians have rediscovered the working man, with his worries about, crime, his fear of unemploy ment and his revulsion at stu dent dissent.

title: More Negroes Vacation as Barriers Fall
description: OAK BLUFFS, Mass.  Zaida Coles Edley, a black television actress, was loung ing on the beach here on Martha's Vineyard with her husband and a couple of guests. Watch what happens to this scene, she said. In just about an hour you'll be in for a surprise.

title: Joan Paulson Wed To Nicholas Gage
description: WORCESTER, Mass., Sept. 6In St. Spyridon Greek Or thodox Church here this afternoon, Miss Joan Paul son, a member of the staff of The Ladies Home Journal, was married to Nicholas Ngagoyeanes, a reporter for The New York Times, known professionally as Nicholas Gage. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Solon Tsandikos.

title: Endemic Inflation
description: The start of the Labor Day weekend was marked by a Government report that the nation's jobless rate last month rose to 5.1 per cent while the average worker's purchasing power declined. The Administra tion has hailed the report that the wholesale price index declined in August by 0.5 per cent as a dra matic sign that it is winning its battle over inflation. A long list of earlier disappointments makes it ad visable, however, to reserve judgment on whether price stability is really on the way.

title: International Conference on Commodities Set Here
description: A threeday international commodities conference will be held starting Sept. 28 at the New York Hilton Hotel.

description: CHESTER, N. J., Sept. 7 Mrs. Nina Supino took to the strange surroundings of the hunter course at the Chester Rotary Horse Show today, but still piloted Sterling Silver to the championship for regular foxchasers. Mrs. Supino, who resides in Englewood, N. J., has been the most successful rider in the 15year history of the show. In 1961 she retired a challenge trophy. Then she rode Good enough to the open jumper championship four years in a row, 1964 through 1967. In 1968, Goodenough was the re serve jumper champion.

description: JERUSALEM, Sept. 7 The Israeli Government told its ambassadors in Washington and major European capitals today to urge government firm ness against guerrilla demands. Officials deplored the Swiss and West German Governments ap parent willingess to free Pal estinian prisoners in exchange for the passengers of two hi iacked planes.

In the Flight A Mas ter Pair Championship, one of the major events in the Greater New York Bridge Association's Knickerbocker Tournament, the winners were Lawrence Berkley and Didier Maniel, both of New York.

description: TOKYO, Sept. 7 (AP)Com munistled forces in Indochina now seem to be trying to de velop the strength to make major effort in Cambodia, Gen. William C. Westmoreland said today.

description: DU QUOIN, Ill., Sept. 7 (AP) With his brother, Bobby, close behind, Al Unser gunned his car to a firstplace finish today in the $25,000 Ted Horn Memorial 100mile race at the. State Fair.

title: City Bank Appoints 2
description: The First National City Bank has announced the appointment of Anthony G. Mantzavinos and John P. Rudy as vice presidents in the European division of the bank's international banking group. Mr. Mantzavinos directs the bank's activities in Greece from headquarters in Athens. Mr. Rudy directs the bank's op erations in Italy from head quarters in Milan.

title: Heads of Nonaligned States Gather in Africa
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, Sept. 7 The meeting of chiefs of state of nonaligned nations that will open here tomorrow will focus new attention on the problems of southern Africa. Thirty heads of state or chiefs of government and representa tives from at least 52 neutral nations will be called on to in crease pressure of all kind against the white minority re gimes of Rhodesia and South Africa and against Portuguese Africa.

title: U.S. TEAM ADVANCES IN CHESS OLYMPIAD
description: SIEGEN, West Germany, Sept. 7The United States chess team moved strongly through the opening rounds of the 19th Chess Olympiad pre liminaries here yesterday and today.

title: Mrs. Ann Gray, Adman's Widow, Wed in London

Gray, who was a vice presi dent of Batten, Barton, Durs tine & Osborn, was married yesterday at the South Ken sington Registry Office in London to Nicholas Lechmere Spaulding Kirkbride, presi dent of the SovereignAmeri can Arts Corporation of New York and London.

title: U.S. Officials Unavailable
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 United States officials who deal with East German affairs were not available for comment today on the report of a deci sion by the Ulbricht Govern ment to ease tensions in West Berlin.

title: Held in Killing of Guard
description: MACON, Ga., Sept. 7 (UPI) The police charged a union worker in the fatal shooting early today of an Armstrong Cork Company plant guard. They said William Avera, 23 years old, had been arrested in connection with the sniper slaying of Donald Stickney, 24, an employe of the Palmetto Detective Agency.

description: CHICAGO, Sept. 7 (AP) Coaches Les Moss and Hugh Mulcahy of the Chicago White Sox tendered their resignations today, effective at the end of the season.

description: In a memorable funeral for sports personality, Vince Lom bardi was eulogized for his dynamic Christian spirit by Cardinal Cooke yesterday at St. Patrick's Cathedral.

title: Smoke Bomb Breaks Glass
description: A smoke bomb exploded last night in the doorway of a store in the Parkville section of Brooklyn, shattering the glass but causing no injuries, accord ing to the police. The explo sion in the L. H. Martin Value enter at 1417 Newkirk Ave nue, near Marlborough Road, was being investigated by the police Department's bomb sec tion, the Fire Marshal's office and detectives of the Parkville squad.

title: Police Search East River For 4 Rikers I. Prisoners
description: Police launches searched the waters of the East River early this morning for four missing prisoners who the Department of Correction said might have escaped from the Rikers Island prison.

title: Fulla Napoleon Sets Mark Of 1:58 at Freehold
description: FREEHOLD, N. J., Sept. 7 The Red Sheep Stables Fulla Napoleon, owned by Frank 0. Fredericks of New York City, clipped 1 15 seconds from the Freehold Raceway track record today when he was timed in 1:58 45 in winning the feature $25,000 American Pace before 13,651 fans. The 5yearold son of Dale Frost bettered the mile record of 2:00 set by Peers wick in 1967.

title: Gibbs's 3 Hits Help Yanks Top Senators, 43, for 4th in Row
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 It was the kind of day that was more conducive to boating on the Potomac, or stretching out on the grass around the Washington Monument, or dip ping one's toes in the reflecting pool across from the Lincoln Memorial.

title: Registration for School Opens Here Tomorrow
description: Public elementary schools throughout the city will be open tomorrow and Thursday and Friday to register chil dren for kindergarten and the first grade. Classes do not be gin until Monday.

title: Condors Sign Lewis, Hentz
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept 7 (UPI) The Pittsburgh Condors of the American Basketball Associa tion have announced the sign ings of Mike Lewis, center, and Charley Hentz a rookie, to 1970 contracts. Hentz was drafted by the San Diego Chargers of the American Football League last year but decided to play professional basketball.

title: Some Hijacking Victims Begin To Reach Amman From Desert
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Sept. 7 (AP) Tired, dusty and thirsty, some of the women and children pas sengers of Swissair and Trans World Airlines jets hijacked yesterday began arriving in Amman tonight after being freed by their Arab guerrilla captors.

title: Colorado Is Booming and Worried About It
description: DENVERIt was a lovely daythe sky a cobalt blue with white fleecy clouds showing clear above the downtown streets. The blind. woman who plays accordion hymns at 16th Street and Glenarm Place was up on her feet next to her folding chair struggling to play Mockingbird Hill.

title: Health Agency, Expecting Cholera to Spread, Begins to Train Doctors in Black Africa
description: GENEVA, Sept. 7With chol era afflicting subSaharan Af ricans for the first time in century, the World Health Or ganization today began teach ing a group of 102 doctors from 34 African countries the recently developed techniques that prevent the disease from being the scourge it once was.

title: $670,000 Race Won By Rocket Wrangler
description: RUIDOSO, N. M., Sept. (UPI)Rocket Wrangler beat Bunny Bid by a nose today to win the 12th running of the $670,000 All American Futurity for quarter horses, the world's richest purse in racing. His winning time was 20.09 seconds.

title: Bolivia Sets Gulf Oil Award
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia, Sept. 7 (AP) The Bolivian Government an nounced tonight it would be gin to pay Gulf Oil Company more than $100millian for its unrecovered investment in nationalized facilities.

description: BROOKSIDE, N. J., Sept. MacNeil, parents of the future bride. Her fianc is the son of Mr. and Mrs. James G. Gordon of Ridge wood and Mantoloking.

title: Sports of The Times
