He has probably established an a11tackle record for the spe cies.

title: Stanton Calls on Congress To Televise Live Sessions
description: MIAMI BEACH, Sept. 7 (UPI) Congress should let the na tion's networks televise live sessions from Capitol Hill, Dr. Frank Stanton, president of the Columbia Broadcasting System, said yesterday. In a speech to the American Board of Profes sional Psychology, Dr. Stanton said that no single spokesman could fairly represent the di versity of opinions in Congress. He urged Congress to recon sider its ban on live broadcast ing of its sessions.

title: Hijackers in Cairo Say They Blew Up 747 in Retaliation for. U.S. Support of Israel
description: CAIRO. Sept. 7Lettwing Palestinian guerrillas who hi jacked a Pan American jumbo jet to Cairo and blew it up on the runway minutes after land ing this morning told passen gers the action was in retalia tion for support of Israel by the United States and warned that American  operated oil wells would be next.

title: THOMAS CANFIELD
description: Thomas Canfield, a night makeup man in the composing room of The New York Times, died Sunday at St. Clare's Hos pital after surgery for cancer. He was 66 years old and lived at 60 West 75th Street. Mr. Canfield had been with The Times for 40 years.

title: Marie Silveira Is Wed
description: The marriage of Miss Marie Silveira to Frank Hughes, son of Mr. and Mrs. Edward A. Hughes of Astoria, Queens, took place here yesterday afternoon at St. Anthony's Roman Catholic Church. The Rev. John Roderick per formed the ceremony. The bride is a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Leo Silveira of Faial, the Azores. The bride groom's father is secretary and treasurer of Local 51 of the International Printing Pressmen and Assistants Union.

title: Television
description: 7:00 (2,7)News Report (4)Today: Harry Ashmore, Journalist (8:30)

title: Antiwar Vietnam Veterans Finish 4Day March
description: VALLEY FORGE. Pa. Sept. 7 Chanting What do you want? and answering Peace now, more than 100 veterans of the war in Vietnam arrived here today after a fourday march and led 1,500 other peo ple in demanding an immediate American military withdrawal from South Vietnam.

title: TIGERS BEAT PALMER OF ORIOLES, 5 TO 2
description: DETROIT, Sept. 7 (AP)Jim Northrup knocked in four runs with a double and single to pace the Detroit Tigers to a 52 victory over the Baltimore Ori oles tonight and thwart Jim Palmer's attempt to gain his 20th triumph.

title: Jack Jones Weds Azain
description: HOUSTON, Sept. 7 (AP) Jack Jones, the singer, and Gretchen Roberts, a Braniff International Airlines steward ess, were married Saturday night at the Park Place Meth odist Church here.

title: STOCKS IN LONDON TURN DOWNWARD
description: Stocks turned downward in relatively sluggish trading in Britain and on the Continent yesterday.

title: The 7 Stars Who Played Title Role on Broadway
description: The following is the per formance record, in order of appearance, of the seven stars who have played Hello, Dolly! on Broadway.

title: Yankee Records
description: Yankee Records

title: Economists in Survey Foresee Gradual Recovery for Business
description: Economists in business, gov ernment and the academic world foresee a very gradual recov ery from the sluggish business conditions of the first half of this year, according to the American Statistical Associa tion's economic survey for 1970's third quarter.

title: TODAY'S PROBABLE PITCHERS
description: Montreal at New York (2:05 P.M.) Ronko (109) vs. Gentry (98).

title: Outgoing Passenger and Mail Ships
description: Outgoing Passenger and Mail Ships

title: Phils Down Cards Twice
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 7 (AP) Larry Bowa rapped a run scoring single with two out in the 13th inning tonight that gave the Philadelphia Phils a 12 triumph over the St. Louis Cardinals. The Phils had won the first game of a twilight night doubleheader, 51, ending a fivegame losing streak.

title: Myles D. Perrin, Partner With Investment Bankers
description: Myles D. Perrin, a partner in Salomon Brothers, an invest ment banking concern, died Saturday in his home at 898 Park Avenue, apparently after a heart attack. He was 71 years old and lived also in Palm Beach, Fla.

title: AT RIVERSIDE Y.C.
description: LUDERS16 CLASS (6 started)1, Arthur H. Boultbee; 2, Souther Whlttelsey; 3, Jacques F. Bulterman; 4, Joseph F. Stautner; 5, Theodore Fuller; 6, Francis P. Beattie.

title: Pedestrian Killed in Nyack
description: NYACK, N. Y., Sept. 7 (AP) A New York City man died early today of injuries suffered yesterday when he was struck by a car as he walked across Route 59. The police identified the man as Patrick Oakley, 34 years old, of 354 East 77th Street. No charges were lodged against the auto driver.

title: One Killed and 2 Injured In West Side Collision
description: One man was killed and four persons slightly injured last night when two cars collided at Central Park West and 100th Street, the police said.

title: ExLobbyist for Shipping Lines Is on House Marine Panel Staff
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 (AP) A former top lobbyist for pri vate shipping concerns getting $200million a year in Federal aid has become a key staff member of the House committee that approves the subsidy pro grams.

title: Dividends Announced
description: Dividends Announced

title: Politicians Turn to Direct Mail to Bring In Campaign Funds on a Large Scale
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7  Political fundraising by direct mail, a technique traditionally scorned by most candidates, is growing in popularity and gen erating hundreds of thousands of dollars for campaigns across the country this year.

title: Y.R.A. Regatta
description: AT LARCH MONT

title: U.S. Quits a Signal Base In Temples of Vietnam
description: QUINHON, South Vietnam, Sapt., 5A United States Army signal unit, installed for more than two years at the base of two ancient tem ples, hurriedly evacuated its hilltop position today after Oen. Creighton W. Abrams reportedly expressed concern over possible desecration of the monuments.

title: Aerial Blackmail
description: Only the most uninformed can have been surprised by the latest aerial hijacking and by the ordeals of the unfortunates on the three planes seized by Arab ter roristi. The fanatical commando group, involved was earlier responsible for many similar outrages. Seven weeks ago these criminals demonstrated the political profitability of hijacking by extorting a promise from the Greek Government to release their jailed confederates. Buoyed by past successes, the Arab gunmen had every reason to suppose aerial blackmail would work against other states. Their judgment appears to have been sound. This outcome can only encourage more acts of piracy by political zealots in every part of the world.

title: Memphis Residents Are Split by the Magic Circle
description: MEMPHIS, Sept. 7Children call it the magic circle. Teach ers call it a helpful teaching tool. But a number of other people, including some parents, the Ku Klux Klan and one mem ber of the school board, call it Communistic brainwashing.

title: CONTINENTAL RACE TAKEN BY HOBBS
description: LIME ROCK, Conn., Sept. 7 (UPI)Dave Hobbs of England, who started the Sports Club of America's continental series late, continued to make up for lost time today. He won the $35,475 lnverhouse Grand Prix by almost a lap over the 1.53 mile Lime Rock road course.

title: BAKER'S DODGE WINS SOUTHERN 500 RACE
description: DARLINGTON, S. C., Sept. (AP)  Buddy Baker of Char lotte, NC., without a victory for two years, piloted his Cotto Owens Dodge to victory today in the 21st Southern 500 stock car race. He won handily after accidents late in the race elimi nated his closest competitors, Donnie Allison and Cale Yar borough.

title: Football Transactions
description: Football Transactions

title: Constitution Builder
description: Like redecorating a cathe dral, putting together a new Constitution for the United States is no job for a timid soul. And before taking on the assignment, a man had better have a pretty good idea of where he is going. In these particulars, no one need have any doubts about the qualifications of Rexford Guy Tugwell. Cherish ed traditions and institutions that no longer serve the needs of modern society are to him like so many totem poles that must be pulled down as impediments to progress.

title: FULBRIGHT SCORED BY MRS. MITCHELL
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 (UPI) Mrs. John N. Mitchell, who first denounced Senator J. W. Fulbright for his opposition to a Supreme Court nominee, G. Harrold Carswell criticized him again today for his opposition to the Vietnam war.

title: After the Doctors Return
description: Countries with systems of socialized medicine have long been accustomed to the idea of physicians strik ing in much the same manner as other unionized workers. The potentiality for similar tactics by doctors employed in the Governmentfinanced sector of American medicine has now been pointed up by the recent tenday walkout of Lincoln Hospital's ob stetrical house staff.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today

title: ATTACKS SLOW UP DRAFT PROCEDURE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7When vandals broke into the Federal Building in Rochester early yes terday and damaged the draft records of several thousand men, it was only the latest in a series of attacks on Selective Service headquarters around the country.

title: Paris Season Beginning; Familiar Names Onstage
description: PARIS, Sept. 7The curtain is about to rise on the new season in Paris, which is off to an early start this year. Estab lished Gallic dramatists to be represented by new works are Jean Anouilh, Marcel Achard, Eugene Ionesco, Francoise Sagan, Frangoise Dorin, Marc Gilbert Sauvajon, Robert Thomas and Francis Veber, as well as Andre Roussin, Francois Billetdoux and Romain Wein garten.

title: Shoemaker Breaks Record
description: DEL MAR, Calif., Sept. 7 (AP)  Bill Shoemaker, after an guishing days of trying, broke the world riding championship record today with a smashing victory in the fourth race at Del Mar. The 39yearold jockey post ed victory No. 6,033 by boot ing home the solid favorite, Dares 3, by a convincing mar gin. Shoemaker went one ahead of the world record set by Johnny Longden at Santa Anita in 1966.

title: Grote Singles in the Eighth Inning of First Game and Clendenon Scores Winning Run
description: Grote Singles in the Eighth Inning of First Game and Clendenon Scores Winning Run

title: SHOTGUN WOUNDS 7 IN BROOKLYN FAMILY
description: Seven members or a Brook lyn family, including a six yearold child, were wounded last night when a male friend of one of the women in the family fired a shotgun during a dispute, the police said.

title: Global Student Unrest
description: The discussions at the meeting of the International Association of Universities in Montreal last week ought to dispel any lingering doubts that student unrest is a global rather than an American problem. Youth alienation is turning on the authority of institu tions everywhere, and the universities are not only readily available but also peculiarly vulnerable as targets for any antiestablishment attack.

title: Longines Is Ticking With Taped Tunes
description: It isn't often that a purely advertising effort turns into a diversification of a prod uct that eventually accounts for a predominance of sales. That rather strange develop ment involves the Longines Wittnauer Watch Company, whose longtime sponsorship with the Longines Sym phonette concerts on radio and television in the nine teenthirties and forties has resulted in a tape, cassette tape and record venture that now provides more than 50 per cent of the company's sales.

title: Observer: New Man in Antiques
description: LONDON, Sept. 7A person can get an understanding of antiques after a few weeks in London, particularly if he is traveling with someone deter mined to lead him through each of London's 1,234 miles of street markets where this pre cious debris of the past is sold.

title: Telethon Raises $5Million For Muscular Dystrophy
description: The Jerry Lewis Labor Day telethon for the benefit of the Muscular Dystrophy Associa tions of America ended last night with a recordbreaking $5,093,385 pledged, an associa tion spokesman said.

title: Airlines Set for Meeting On International Fares
description: Officials of more than 90 scheduled airlines will begin a monthlong meeting in Hono lulu tomorrow that will almost certainly result in higher fares for millions of international air travelers next year.

title: I.O.S. CASH OUTFLOW WIDENED IN AUGUST
description: GENEVA, Sept. 7The 19 mutual funds administered by. Investors Overseas Services had a net negative cash flow in August of $35.9million bring ing the total outflow, for 1970 to nearly $100million, I.O.S. re ported today.

title: 2 Die as New York City Cab Crashes in Catskill Town
description: GARDINER, N. Y., Sept 7 (AP)A New York City taxicab missed a curve on Route 32 to day in this Catskill community west of Poughkeepsie killing two passengers from the Bronx and critically injuring the driver.

title: Militants Occupy a Church To Raise Funds for Needy
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Sept. 7 (UPI)After getting assurances from two churches of donations of $30,000, a group of militants occupied another church today in a campaign to raise $100,000 to buy school clothing for chil dren in welfare families.

title: Panel Asks Slum Reforms To Cut Black Crime Rate
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7A Government study panel has concluded that the rate of vio lent crime by urban blacks ap pears to be markedly higher than that for whitesand that blacks also constitute a major ity of the victims.

title: $173Million U.S. and State Aid Is Allocated to Schools of City
description: The Board of Education yes terday announced its 197071 proposals for district alloca tions of more than $173million in Federal and state funds for programs to aid economically disadvantaged pupils.

title: ACCOUNTING RULE EVOKED DISSENTS
description: The American Institute of Certified Public Accountants, in a published report of its Ac counting Principles Board, dis closed yesterday the identity of six members of its 18man board who had opposed a highly controversial new ruling on accounting for corporate mergers. The board, In a ruling adopt ed as final late in July, elimi nated an earlier proposal re stricting the pooling of inter ests method of accounting to mergers in which one of the companies was at least one ninth as large as the other. It did, however, reaffirm limiting the use of the method to com bination's that were arranged through an exchange of com mon stock and met other re strictive conditions.

title: Adm. Donald MacMillan Dies; Pioneer Explorer of Arctic, 95
description: PROVINCETOWN, Mass., Sept. 7Rear Admiral Donald B. MacMillan, the Arctic ex plorer who was the last survivor of Robert E. Peary's history making expedition to the North Pole in 190809, died here today in a nursing home at the age of 95.

title: Carswell Faces Another Key Vote in Primary Today
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Sept. 7  G. Harrold Carswell, who rose from obscurity to be come a central figure in a his toric test between a President and the United States Senate, faces his second crucial vote in less than five months tomorrow.

title: Cambodia Reports New Offensive Along Route
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Sept. 7 (Reuters)  The Cambodian Army was reported today to have begun its first major of fensive against the Commu nist troops by driving north along Route 6 from Skoun, 45 miles north of Pnompenh.

title: Couple to Play a Couple
description: Claude Horton and Jean Cameron, who are husband and wife, will play a couple in the Norman Wisdom comedy, Not Now, Darling, which will open at the Brooks Atkinson Theater Oct. 22. This will be their first Broadway appearance together.

title: Congress of African People Ends Session in Atlanta
description: ATLANTA, Sept. 7A reso lution to create a black political party was adopted here tonight by the International Congress of African People.

title: Bank of England Supports Pound as Its Price Drops
description: LONDON, Sept. 7 (AP)The Bank of England was forced to support the pound sterling in the foreign exchange market today to keep it from dropping to dangerous levels.

title: C.A.B. Accused by Nader Of Conspiring With Airlines
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 (AP) Ralph Nader, the consumer advocate, accused the Civil Aeronautics Board today of conspiring with the airlines to impose a hidden, inflationary and illegal fare increase of some $50million a year.

title: Top Officer to Quit City's Police Force For Job in Industry
description: Chief Inspector George P. McManus, the city's top uni formed police commander, is planning to leave the Police De partment. Commissioner How ard Leary has already resigned, effective Oct. 1.

title: Copter Runs Animal Travelers Aid in Los Angeles
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 7 Despite its growing ranks of skyscrapers, Los Angeles is still close to the zoological frontier.

title: Advertising: Continental Baking Adds Grey
description: It's not a gray day for Grey it's a great day and it is being made possible by the advertising moguls of the ITT Continental Baking Company who have decided to push some $5million in billings the agency's way.

title: Moscow Seems to Support Cairo's Denial on Missiles
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 7The So viet Union appeared today to endorse the United Arab Repub lic's rejection of American and Israeli charges that the Middle East ceasefire had been vio lated by the movement of So viet antiaircraft missiles into the standstill zone on the Egyptian side of the Suez Canal.

title: Panthers to Reconvene in Capital To Ratify Their Constitution
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 7  The Black Panther party and members of the Women's and Gay Liberation Movements ended today their weekend meeting to rewrite the United States Constitution. They will reconvene in Washington Nov. 4 to ratify their document.

title: Books of The Times
description: William Crawford Woods has chosen the perfect title for his fine first novel. A killing zone is an area covered by machine guns fixed into overlapping tra jectories; so long as both machine guns are working, anything that moves is dead. The motion of the characters in Mr. Woods's novel is inevitably toward that killing zonefrom the moment a young lieutenant, fresh from writing his mas ter's thesis on Supervisory Programing Techniques for Small Unit Actions, ar rives to take command of an Army com pany in basic training.

title: Happy Passengers From 2 Planes Reach Kennedy
description: Happy and relieved passen gers from two airliners hi jacked Sunday by Arab guer rillas over Europe arrived at Kennedy Airport yesterday.

title: NIXON HAILS LABOR IN A CAPITAL FETE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 President Nixon received nearly 75 labor leaders and their wives at the White House tonight for dinner, a round of friendly toasts and a torchlit military pageant on the South Lawn. In 89 years of Labor Day observ ances, it was the most elabo rate holiday gesture that a President had made toward labor.

title: U.S. and 4 Nations Seek Joint Stand on Detention
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 Secretary of State William P. Rogers met urgently here to day with diplomats from four other governments whose air craft and citizens were in volved in the Arab commando hijackings yesterday.

title: Chile's Winning Coalition
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Sept. 7 Chile's multiparty system is democratic, but it makes for strange and shortlived alliances at election time.

title: ShopRite's Account Goes to Keyes, Martin
description: Keyes, Martin & Co., which says that it is New Jersey's biggest ad agency, is even bigger todaythanks to Shop  Rite Supermarkets, which just entered the fold.

title: Mete Records
description: BATTING

title: NEWCOMBE WINS FROM GRAEBNER
description: A crowd of 13,826, the big gest so far, had some tough decisions to make yesterday at the United States Open tennis championships at Forest Hills, Queens. Like a three ring circus, extraordinary matches kept popping up all over the place at the same time.

title: Box Scores
description: FIRST GAME

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: Rockefeller Patronizing Jews, Goldberg Asserts
description: Arthur J. Goldberg charged here yesterday that Governor Rockefeller was patronizing Jews in the state by talking to them only about the crisis in the Middle East.

title: Percy Spencer, Inventor, Dead; Retired Raytheon Executive, 76
description: NEWTON, Mass., Sept. 7 Dr. Percy L. Spencer, retired senior vice president of the Raytheon Company in Lexing ton and a wellknown inventor, died today at NewtonWellesley Hospital. He was 76 years old and lived in Waban.

title: Sinatra Faces Questioning in Casino Dispute
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Sept. 7 (UPI)  Frank Sinatra was asked today to have a little talk with the district attorney about his alleged underworld connections after the singer was involved in an argument early yesterday with a casino executive.

title: ISRAEL TERMED OPEN TO NEW TRUCE PACT
description: PARIS; Sept. 7 (AP)  A senior Israel Cabinet Minister said today that Israel would consider negotiating a new ceasefire agreement if the present accord could not be carried out.

title: U. S. AIDE SEIZED IN JORDAN CAPITAL
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Sept. 7 Reuters)An American ser geant assigned to the United States Embassy here has been kidnapped, the embassy an nounced today as new violence flared in Amman between Arab commandos and Jordanian troops.

title: Wallace Urges Defiance of integration Order
description: MOBILE, Ala., Sept. 7For mer Gov. George C. Wallace urged the white parents of this city tonight to defy a Federal court order that assigns their children to racially balanced schools.

title: SENATE ASPIRANTS SEEK OUT VOTERS
description: Labor Day, the traditional oc casion for the start of full scale political campaigning, brought out the state's three major candidates for the United States Senate yesterday, in search of crowds.

title: Toilers and Lollers Agree, Labor Day Was Beauteous
description: For tens of millions of Americans yesterday was the last big day off before the endofvacation, backtowork and backtoschool move ments pet under Way.

title: Study Center Offers New U.S. Constitution
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 On the theory that one way to stimulate thinking about the shortcomings of the present United States Gov ernment is to conceive a plan for a better one, the Center for the Study of Democratic Institutions has suggested new Constitution for the United States.

title: MURPHY IS VICTOR IN HARTFORD GOLF
description: WETHERSFIELD, Conn., Sept. 7 Bob Murphy won the Greater Hartford open golf tournament today with a score of 267. The 17underpar ag gregate by the redhaired, cigar  smoking 27yearold Floridian is the best 72hole total on the pro circuit this year and only Dave Hill, in winning the Memphis open, has matched it.

title: Sirhan Has Expected to Be Traded
description: Sirhan Bishara Sirhan whose release was mentioned in some accounts yesterday as an Arab commando de mand in return for the free dom of some 150 hijacked passengershas said in in terviews that he expected to be freed at some time in sim ilar fashion.

title: Miss Guterman Wed To Asadur Azapian
description: SEARINGTOWN, L. I., Sept. 7Miss Shelley Lynn Guter man, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Reuben Guterman of East Meadow, was married here today to Asadur Aza pian, son of Mr. and Mrs. Ohanes Elmassian Azapian of Montevideo, Uruguay.

title: Passengers on T.W.A. Jet
description: Following is a list of the passengers aboard Trans World Airlines Flight 741 when it was hijacked to Jordan Sunday. The names of passengers on another plane hijacked to Jordan, a Swissair jet were not available. According to reports from Jordan, about 80 women, children and old people have been freed and some male passengers will be released later. Their names were not disclosed.

title: ASTROS VANQUISH PADRES, 105, 94
description: SAN DIEGO, Sept. 7 (AP) Joe Morgan got seven hits as the Houston Astros routed the San Diego Padres, 105 and 94, in doubleheader today.

title: STUDIES DISCOUNT EFFECTS OF SMUT
description: MIAMI BEACH, Sept. 7A panel of psychologists reported today that several independent scientific studies had produced little or no evidence that ex posure to erotic material had any detrimental effects on char acter, moral values and marital behavior or caused sexual devi ance.

title: Columbia Names Entry Chief
description: Michael J. Lacopo has been appointed director of admis sions of Columbia College, it was announced yesterday. Mr. Lacopo, who is 35 years old, has been associate director of admissions since 1967. His pre decessor, John Wellington, has been named director of alumni relations for the university.

title: TAXES MAIN ISSUE IN NEW HAMPSHIRE
description: MANCHESTER, N. H., Sept. 7After a campaign obsessed with the issue of taxes, voters will measure the job done by the incumbent Republican Gov ernor, Walter R. Peterson, in a state that remains the last stubborn holdout against either a sales or an income tax.

title: Cherry Lane Opens Sept. 23
description: The Cherry Lane Theater at 38 Commerce Street will reopen on Sept. 23 with a new play by Dennis McIntyre, Children in the Rain, with Elizabeth Harry man, Frank R. Giordano and Jock McNeill. Mr. Giordano is staging the production.

title: PEKING SAYS HANOI FIGHTS IN CAMBODIA
description: The broadcast, which the Cilmbodian Government said was made July 28 from Peking, vas a plea to the Cambodian people on behalf of Prince Nor 13310M Sihanouk, Cambodia's de posed Chief of State, to coop erate with the North Vietna mese troops and to forgive them any hardships caused by their presence in Cambodia. United States Embassy offi dals said this morning that the broadcast had not been picked up by the United States Gov ernment's normal monitoring of Communist radio stations.

title: Women Tennis Stars Threaten Boycott Over Unequal Purses
description: Some of the world's leading women tennis players threat ened yesterday to boycott fu ture tournaments because men get more prize money.

title: Diebold Computer Elects
description: Diebold Computer Leasing, Inc., said yesterday it had elected Paul Vincent, director general of Banque Rothschild in Paris, as a director.

title: A'S POST SWEEP, RUN STREAK TO 8
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 7 (UPI) Vida Blue hit a threerun homer in the first game and Joe Rudi and Sal Bando each drove in three runs in the sec ond game today as the Oak land Athletics beat the Chicago White Sox, 74 and 75.

title: Book Clarifies Roosevelt View of Japan
description: In the fall of 1941 President Roosevelt, contrary to wide spread speculation, was deter mined to avoid war with Japan while eagerly seizing on every incident that would draw the United States nearer to war with Nazi Germany, according to a forthcoming Roosevelt bi ography.

title: PovertyFund Cut Perils Jobs of Legal Assistants
description: Pete Perez, 34 years old and the father of eight children, is in danger of losing his $6,500 ayear job as a dispenser of elementary legal guidance to people who cannot afford a lawyer.

title: New Books
description: The Election, by Sherwin Markman (Random House, $6.95). A third party vote for President throws the country into turmoil.

title: Summaries of U.S. Open Tennis
description: Summaries of U.S. Open Tennis

title: Sister and Brother Among 4 Killed in Jersey Car Crash
description: RAHWAY, N. J., Sept. 7 Four young persons, including a brother and a sister, were killed early today when their car sideswiped a pole and crashed into a tree at Inman and Madison Avenues here.

title: Innovator Is Appointed to Direct Moscow Art Theater
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 7Oleg N. Yefremov, the actor and director who rebelled against conservative traditions to form a new Moscow theater in 1957, was named chief di tector of the venerable Mos ormvArt Theater today in an effort to restore vitality to that once worldfamous show place.

title: Troop Level Below 400.000
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 7 (AP)With fighting at a slow pace, United States troop withdrawals from South Viet nam moved ahead today, with American manpower reportedly falling below 400,000 for the first time since early 1967.

title: ELECTION AFFECTS CHILE'S ECONOMY
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Sept. 7 Depositors formed sometimes unruly lines to withdraw their money from at least one pri vate Chilean bank today, the first working day since Dr. Sal vador Allende, the Marxist can didate of a leftist coalition, won a plurality in the presi dential election Friday.

title: Dodgers Set Back Braves, 43, 61; Crawford Connects
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 7 (AP) Willie Crawford celebrated his 24th birthday tonight by blasting a tworun homer in the first game as the Los An geles Dodgers swept a double header from the Atlanta Braves, 42 and 61. Wes Parker hit a tworun double and two singles in the second game.

title: INDIANS WIN, 82, AFTER 43 DEFEAT
description: CLEVELAND, Sept. 7 (AP) A basesloaded triple by Larry Brown and Vada Pinson's three run homer powered the Cleve land Indians to an 82 victory over Boston in the second game of a doubleheader today after the Red Sox won the opener, 43.

title: Campbell Assumes Lead In SingleHanded Sailing
description: NEW HAVEN, Sept. 7 Argyll Campbell of Newport Beach, Calif., held the lead to day after the first of four days of competition in the North American singlehanded sailing championship off the Yale Co rinthian Yacht Club. Campbell had two first places and a third for 5.7 points.

title: Restaurant Loses $25,350 In Kennedy Airport Holdup
description: Two men held up the chief cashier of the restaurant and bar complex at the Trans World Airlines terminal at Ken nedy International Airport yes terday and escaped with $25, 350 weekend receipts after handcuffing the cashier to an opened safe.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: To the Editor: Your Sept. 1 editorial Now, Food Stamps made a very valid pointthat there is con siderable inconvenience and waste in the new food stamp program. However, I totally dis agree with your solution of simply liberalizing cash wel fare payments.

title: Cross Bay Blvd. Repaving
description: The east roadway of Cross Bay Boulevard in Queens will be closed to traffic for about four months from the North Channel Bridge to Shore Park way beginning at 8 A.M. to morrow, according to the city's Traffic Department. While that part of the boulevard is re paved its west roadway wil be used both ways with twc lanes of traffic in each direc tion, separated by a temporary center line.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: Obituary 1  No Title

title: Dolly Replacing Liza as Fairest Lady
description: By tea time tomorrow, Eliza Doolittle is going to have to step aside and watch that bumptious widow, Dolly Gallagher Levi, pass her by.

title: TV: Historian Brings an Era to Life
description: Producers and directors sit up nights trying to devise ways of sugarcoating educa tional material. Then every once in a while along comes a man who makes their ef forts seem futile boondog gling. If a teacher enjoys mastery of his subject and zest for its telling, the per sonality is sufficient unto it self and the props can be forgotten.

title: In Memoriam
description: In Memoriam

title: Belmont Park Entries
description: Belmont Park Entries

title: JAMES E. FINAN, 61, OF READERS DIGEST
description: CHAPPAQUA, N. Y., Sept. 7 James Edward Finan, a de partmental editor of Reader's Digest, died today of emphy sema in the Northern West chester Hospital, Mount Kisco. He was 61 years old and lived here at 1193 Hardscrabble Road.

title: TRAPP AND HAYES ALSO ARE LET GO
description: Harry Theofiledes, a quarter back, and Paul Seiler, an of fensive tackle who was the team's firstround draft choice in 1967, were among seven players dropped by the New York Jets yesterday.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Demanding the release of other guerrillas, Arab commandos held as hostages yester day about 150 of the passengers from two of the four jets they hijacked Sunday. The passengersor at least the American, Brit ish and West German menwould be held until the commandos demands are met. The deadline for accepting the demands is 10 P.M., Wednesday. description: Yonkers Results

description: Yachting Results

title: British Football
description: RUGBY MATCHES

title: HENRY L. STEITZ
description: Henry L. Steitz, a New York lawyer, died Sunday at the home of his daughter Mrs. Eleanor Howe, in Chevy Chase, Md. He was 86 years old and lived in Garden City, L. I.

title: Jobs vs. Careers
description: Mayor Lindsay has performed a useful service by emphasizing his belief that the key to solving urban poverty lies in jobs and a healthy metropolitan econ omy. That is a truism scarcely in need of affirmation, but it has not always seemed to have much accep tance among some of the Mayor's aides concerned with manpower, welfare and antipoverty programs.

title: Federal Labor Data Available by Phone
description: The Federal Bureau of La bor Statistics announced here yesterday that the agency had installed an automatic message service to supply recorded data to satisfy a rising volume of requests for information.

title: GIVE TO FRESH AIR FUND.
description: GIVE TO FRESH AIR FUND.

title: Proposals on Constitution
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7The following table compares key provisions of the present Constitution with provisions proposed by the Center for the Study of Democratic Insti tutions.

title: Chinese Army Gets an Ideological Chief
description: HONG KONG, Sept. 7Pe king has disclosed a new senior appointment within Communist China's armed forces that came as a surprise to specialists in Chinese military affairs here.

title: National Newark Elects
description: The National Newark and Es sex Bank has announced the appointment of Bruce Alexander to the board of directors. Mr. Alexander is president of the Howard Savings Institution of Newark.

title: 2 CRAFT IN JORDAN
description: Arab commandos held as hos tages in the Jordanian desert yesterday at least 150 of the passengers aboard two of the four New Yorkbound jetliners they hijacked Sunday. As ran som, the commandos demanded the release of Arab guerrillas held prisoner in Israel, Britain, Switzerland and West Ger many.

title: Sports Today
description: Mets vs. Montreal Expos, at Shea Stadium, 126th Street and Roose velt Avenue, Flushing Meadow, Queens. 2:05 P.M. (Radio  WJRZ, WNBCFM, 2 P.M.).

title: Tennis Writers Association Reelects Amdur President
description: Neil Amdur of The New York Times was reelected president of the Lawn Tennis Writers Association of America yester day during the annual meeting at the West Side Tennis Club, Forest Hills, Queens.

title: NEW FINANCINGS WILL PACE BONDS
description: The credit markets, which became a little shaky late last week, face a moderately large volume of new financing this week. One leading corporate underwriter described this week's schedule as healthy but not overwhelming. About $300million of corporate bonds are scheduled for sale, along with $850million of Govern ment agency financing, $235 million of taxexempt bonds and $645million of local gov ernment shortterm issues.

title: COAST BANK UNIT LISTS HEAVY LOSS
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 7The United California Bank, Los Angeles, the nation's 15th largest commercial bank, dis closed today that its Swiss operating unit had incurred losses that may aggregate $30million.

title: Cooking Classes Should Please Armchair Travelers
description: Ballard School, Y. W. C. A., Lexington Avenue at 53d Street, 7554500. Be advised that the classes here are for both men and women. The classes range from the es sentiali of modern cookery (from soup to nuts, as the brochure points out), appetiz ers, menu magic, buffet en tertaining, fondue, souffles and so on. There are nine series in all, and they are scheduled to begin in the fall and continue into January.

title: Dr. Jessie Wright Is Dead at 70; A Leader in Therapy for Polio
description: ROYAL OAK, Md., Sept. 7 Dr. Jessie Wright, an ortho pedist whose work in physical reficbilitation brought her inter national recognition, died yes terday in her home here. Dr. Wright, who was 70 years old, had suffered from a heart ail ment for some time.

title: REIN ON INFLATION CALLED CRUCIAL
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7  The International Monetary Fund said today that control of inflation in the United States was crucial to the future of world prosperity, but it had few ideas on how the United States could do a bet ter job.

title: Yonkers Entries
description: Yonkers Entries

title: Giants Sweep Reds On 3Run Rally, 43, After 63 Victory
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. (UPI)  Tito Fuentes's infield hit and a throwing error by Darrel Chaney helped the San Francisco Giants to three runs in the eighth inning today and a 43 victory over the Cincin nati Reds. The triumph gave the Giants a sweep of a double header as they had won the first game, 63.

title: Tough Rules Saving a Dying Oregon River
description: PORTLAND, Ore.  One day last week, the fall Chinook sal mon began to flow out of the Columbia River into the Wil lamette, swimming 25 miles through a highly developed portindustrial complex at Port land Harbor reach, struggling up a manmade fishway over the 50foot falls at Oregon City, and finally fighting their way to the upstream headwaters where they will spawn.

title: Yonkers Drivers
description: Yonkers Drivers

title: Banker Is Optimistic
description: TOKYO, Sept. 7 (Reuters) The president of the Bank of America, A. W. Clausen, said today he believed the American economy had turned the corner in its current downturn. He said at a news conference here, I am hopeful that in a few more weeks we will be able to look over our shoulders and say the economic corner was turned in July.

title: Russian Meets Pompidou On Development Projects
description: PARIS, Sept. 7 (Reuters)A Soviet Deputy premier, Vladi mir A. Kirillin, today conferred with President Pompidou on the possible joint exploitation of the Udokan copper field in Siberia.

title: METHODS TO AVERT HIJACKINGSTUDIED
description: The perfection of several de vices to intensify the screen ing of passengers and baggage during loading of airliners is just around the corner, the director of security of Pan tkmerican World Airways said yesterday.

title: ROYALS SCORE, 41, DROP ANGELS TO 3D
description: KANSAS CITY, Sept. 7 (AP) Bob Johnson checked Cali fornia on three hits and 10 strikeouts and stroked a two run single tonight as the Kan sas City Royals dealt the An gels flag hopes another blow with a 41 victory. The loss was the Angels fourth in a row and dropped them to third place, 7 games behind Min nesota.

title: TWINS TURN BACK BREWERS, 76, 83
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Sept. 7 (UPI)Brant Alyea hit two homers and drove in nine runs as the Minnesota Twins swept a doubleheader from the Mil waukee Brewers, 76 and 83, today, extending their winning streak to five games.

title: Meeting Reset to Sept. 22 By Moody's Capital Fund
description: Moody's Capital Fund, Inc., has adjoined until Sept. 22 its stockholders meeting, origin ally called on Aug. 25 to ap prove a transfer of manage ment and distribution of the fund to Vance, Sanders & Co., of Boston. The present manager is a subsidiary of Moody's In vestors Service, Inc., which it self is a subsidiary of Dun & (Bradstreet, Inc. The postpone ment is the second for the meeting.

title: Denmark Won't Extradite Pole Who Hijacked a Plane
description: COPENHAGEN, Sept. 7 (AP) The Danish Government de cided today against extraditing Zbigniew Iwanicki, a 29year old Polish butcher who hijacked a Polish airliner with 23 pas sengers and forced it to land in Copenhagen on June 5. The de cision was made in the face of official pressure by Poland.

title: Suspect Arrested in Deaths Of 8 in British Columbia
description: CRESTON, British Columbia, Sept. 7 (AP)  Dale Merle Nel son, a 31yearold parttime log ger, was subdued by a police dog and arrested yesterday on the killings of eight Canadians, including five children.

title: Gottchee 41 Soccer Victor; Ukrainians Play 22 Tie
description: Four of the GermanAmeri can Soccer League's strongest teams saw action in exhibition games yesterday in prepara tion for the coming season. Gottschee defeated the Ger manHungarians, 41, while the New York Ukrainians and InterGiuliana fought to a 22 tie.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Article 1  No Title

title: Entertainment Events
description: Concerts

title: MCA Officer Resigning
description: Berle Adams, executive vice president and director of MCA, Inc., an entertainment concern, said yesterday he would resign effective next January. He said he had no present plans.

title: Accidents Are Main Cause Of Young Deaths in U.S.
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 8 (UPI) Accidents are the leading cause of death for persons between the ages of 1 and 37 in the United States and the fourth leading cause of death for all United States age groups, ac cording to the National Safety Council.

title: Woman Hijacker Feels Engaged to the Revolution
description: LONDON, Sept. 8She sits in a heavily guarded police station in West London wear ing a ring with a bullet on it. I am engaged to the revolu tion, she once said.

title: Glimpse of Royal Danish Ballet's Latest Offerings
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, Sept. 5The saddest thing about ballet is how few good choreographers there are in the world, and the happiest thing about ballet is how if we are being honest little it comparatively mat ters. Dancers ca nhandle al most any situation, and choreography doesn't always have to be that good, just as long as it is theatrical.

title: KimberlyClark to Expand
description: NEENAH, Wis., Sept. 8 (UPI) KimberlyClark of Australia, jointly owned by the Kimberly Clark Corporation and Austral ian Paper Manufacturers, Ltd., said it will spend $16million to expand a mill near Sydney.

title: Quarry Stops Harris in 6th
description: MIAMI BEACH, Sept. 8 (AP) Jerry Quarry, weighing 203 pounds, scored a sixthround knockout over Stanford Harris, 233, of Jamaica tonight. After 11:14 of the round, Harris, who had taken a beating but had not gone down, said to the referee, Dick Tobin: I've had enough.

title: LEARY SEES MAYOR THEN GOES ABROAD
description: Mayor Lindsay and his out going Police Commissioner, Howard R. Leary, met privately at Gracie Mansion yesterday morning.

title: TWO TEAMS TIE AT 61 IN WYKAGYL TOURNEY
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., Sept. 8  The home club team of Bob Watson and Gregory Cornell, with 33, 2861, and Harvey Lannak and Louis Buchanan of North Hills, with 32, 2961, tied for net best ball honors at Wykagyl Country Club today in the $5,000 pro amateur for the benefit of the New Rochelle Hospital Medical Center.

title: Mondale Sees Tough Race
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (UPI) Senator Walter F. Mondale, Democrat of Minnesota, a lead ing Congressional liberal, con cedes that the Democrats are in for a tough, tight race to keep control of the Senate. Senator Mondale was inter viewed Sunday by Metromedia radio news on its Profile pro gram.

title: Saluting Flag at Meetings Ruled Not a Prerequisite for Speaking
description: TRENTON, Sept. 8 (AP) A Federal district judge ruled today that a local governing body could not require a man to salute the flag as a condi tion of letting him speak at public meetings.

title: CON ED GAS RATES UPHELD BY STATE
description: ALBANY, Spet. 8After twoyear investigation, the state Public Service Commis sion announced today that had concluded that the Consolidated Edison Company did not re ceive excess earnings through gas rates, as Mayor Lindsas charged in 1968.

title: KENNEDY BACKER WISCONSIN VICTOR
description: MILWAUKEE, Wednesday, Sept, 9Patrick J. Lucey, once the leader of the Kennedy forces in Wisconsin and later a supporter of Senator Eugene J. McCarthy for President, was an apparent victor early today over Donald O. Peterson in the Democratic governorship pri mary.

title: Advertising: Computer Services Plan Set
description: If there's enough interest out there in adland, there should be an agencyowned computer services center in operation early in 1971.

title: CREDIT MARKETS LACK DIRECTION
description: The credit markets yesterday gingerly probed to determine how interest rates would move next, and the results were not conclusive. Different parts of the market moved in different directions, but none of the moves was very dramatic.

title: Clemente Leaves Hospital
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept. 8 (UPI) Roberto Clemente, the Pirate outfielder, was discharged to day from PresbyterianUniver sity Hospital where he had been under treatment for muscle spasm in the back.

title: Walinsky for Enforcing FlagDeiecration Laws
description: United Press International has issued a statement clarify ing a UPI dispatch from Syra cuse on Aug. 14 that reported that Adam Walinsky, Demo cratic candidate for Attorney General, would take a dim view of enforcing flagdese cration laws if he were elected in November.

title: Rise in Venereal Disease Alarms Doctors in Poland
description: WARSAW, Sept. 8 (AP) Doctors fear that venereal dis ease is reaching epidemic pro portions in Poland.

title: 90 Believed Dead in Burma In Flood at Bridge Project
description: RANGOON, Burman, Sept. 8 (AP)Nearly 90 persons were believed to have drowned after being swept away by flood waters near the Burmese town of Pyinmana, the stateowned newspaper The Mirror reported today.

title: Senate Gets Bill to Insure Minimum Pension Benefits
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (AP) Workers enrolled in private pension programs would be guaranteed some minimum ben efits after 10 years of service under a bill introduced in the Senate today.

title: ASTRONAUT IS LISTED IN SOVIET REFERENCE
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 6 (AP) Neil A. Armstrong, the first man on the moonalong with a oncepersecuted poet, Anna Aphmatova, and a former un person, Isaac Babel, the late Jewish author  rises to the status of a historical figure in the new, rewritten version of the Big Soviet Encyclopedia. The encyclopedia is coming out in Moscow one volume at a time.

title: Metered Madness
description: Seven taxi drivers and one dispatcher have been killed so far this year, as against three drivers killed in all of last year. More than 1,500 cabbies were robbed in the first six months of this year, double last year's rate.

title: Herbert Emmerich Dies at 73; Teacher Wrote on Government
description: CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va., Sept. 8Dr. Herbert Emmerich, professor of government and foreign affairs at the University of Virginia, died last evening after an operation. He was 73 years old.

title: Fire Damages an Old Prison
description: SUNBURY, Pa., Sept. 8 (UPI) A fire that was touched off accidentally by a prisoner try ing to escape today extensively damaged the 94yearold Nor thumbetland County Prison here. Thirtyfive inmates were led from the building by guards and were not injured. The prisoner who had tried to es cape was taken from the roof by firemen and policemen.

title: U.S. to Pull Out 9,800 Men From Thailand by Next July
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Sept. 8 (AP)United States military strength in Thailand will be reduced by 9,800 men within al year, a joint ThaiAmerican announcement said today.

title: Faith in His Ability To Take U.S. Open Spurring Dennis On
description: All along, Dennis Ralston was telling anyone who would listen that he was in great physical shape, mentally keen, and eager to compete in the richest tennis tournament in the world, the United States Open.

title: Fatal Crash of Plane Attributed to Liquor
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (AP)  Use of intoxicating liquor by the pilot caused the lightplane crash at German town, N. Y., last Sept. 14 in which both occupants were killed, the National Trins portation Safety Board said today.

title: Alaska's Natives Uneasily Await House Action on Land Claims
description: ANCHORAGEAlaska's 60, 000 natives are waiting uneasily while their fate is debated more than 3,000 miles away, in Washington.

title: Ivory Coast Convinced That It Is Doing Things Right
description: ABIDJAN, Ivory Coast, Aug. 27  Early this month the Ivory Coast observed the 10th anniversary of independence, with the reappraisals and self examination that are cus tomary.

title: BECK IS GIVING UP DISCOFAIR UNITS
description: Beck Industries, Inc., which acquired 10 of its 12 DiscoFair stores from Vornado, Inc., from April to October last year, has sold the 12unit chain back to Vornado it was announced yesterday by Freder ick Zissu, chair man of Vomado and Manuel F. Rothberg, presi dent of Beck.

title: CHILE VOTE LIFTS COPPER FUTURES
description: The announcement over the weekend of the election of Dr. Salvador Allende, the Marxist candidate of a leftist coalition, as president of Chile sent cop per futures up yesterday on the New York Commodity Ex change. Chile is a large pro ducer of both copper and silver.

title: Roundup: Carlton Takes Turn Off the Road to Ruin
description: Steve Carlton, the St. Louis Cardinals big lefthander, signed a twoyear $40,000 contract last spring after a holdout battle that so in censed Gussie Busdh, the club owner, that Busch said: I don't care if he pitches an other ball for us.

title: ROY A. M'DONALD, 55, OF RISK ASSOCIATION
description: DARIEN, Conn., Sept. 8 Roy A. MacDonald, president of the Life Office Management Association, died here yester day at his home. He was 55 years old and lived at 10 Beach Drive.

title: Business Records
description: FRANK DAVID PHILLIPS, truck driver, Lasher Road, Tivoli, N.Y.Liabilities, $14, 489; assets, $500.

title: ColumbusNew York Ruling
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (AP)  A Civil Aeronautics Board examiner recommended today that authorization to operate nonstop between Columbus, Ohio, and New York without restrictions be granted to American Airlines but denied to Allegheny Airlines. Current ly only Trans World Airlines holds unrestricted nonstop authority between Columbus an New York.

title: Danny Doyle, Who Brightened Christmas for Children, Is Dead
description: Danny Doyle died Monday evening following an operation in the City Hospital Center, Elmhurst, Queens.

title: 5 Are Killed by Wasps In France in 10 Days
description: PARIS, Sept. 8 (AP) prance is upset about wasps. A 46yearold farmer in cen tral France was stung in the head and died last night, be coming the fifth person to be killed by wasp stings in 10 days.

title: Amex Prices Inch Up as Volume Rises
description: Prices edged ahead yester day in active afternoon trad ing on the American Stock Ex change.

title: W.H.O. Committee Backs Curbs on Pacific Pollution
description: MANILA, Sept. 8A pro gram to control environmental pollution in the Western Pa cific was endorsed today by the World Health Organi zation's regional committee at the close of its 21st session here.

title: Archibald Davidow, Headed Women's Fashion Concern
description: Archibald Davidow, a manu facturer of women's coats and suits, died in Lenox Hill Hos pital Sunday. He was 79 years old and had been ill since an accident last December.

title: Yale Eleven Rated Good Chance to Win Ivy League Title
description: NEW HAVEN, Sept. 8 In the Yale University football locker room there is a small cardboard sign with the numer al 4 on it. It means that the Bulldogs are going for a fourth successive Ivy League title or a share of it. No other league team ever has accomplished that feat.

title: Gretel Defeats France in TuneUp
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Sept. 8 Gretel II defeated France to day in the first of a series of tuneups before meeting Intrepid in the America's Cup challenge next Tuesday.

title: MRS. HOFMANN
description: BOONTON, N.J., Sept. 8 Mrs. Phyllis Moorehead Hof mann, who retired as superin tendent of the speech depart ment of the New York City high schools in 1965, died yes terday in a nursing home here. She was 84 years old. Her hus band, Eberhard Hofmann, a screen actor who had appeared with Pearl White, died in 1957.

title: Cosmos 361 Orbited
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 8 (UPI) The Soviet Union today launched an unmanned earth satellite in its Cosmos series. Tass, the official press agency, announced that all instruments on the satellite, Cosmos 361, were functoning normally. The craft was placed in an orbit ranging from 202 miles to 129 miles above the earth's surface and was makng one complete revolution every 89.6 minutes at an inclination of 72.9 degrees to the equator, Tass said.

title: CUSHING RESIGNS; SUCCESSOR NAMED
description: ROME, Sept. 8The Vati can announced today that Pope Paul VI had accepted the res ignation of Richard Cardinal Cushing as Archbiship of Bos ton.

title: Open Interest
description: Tuesday, Sept. 8, 1970

title: Tuesday Night Scores
description: Tuesday Night Scores

title: A.E.C. Officials Discount Fears of Nuclear Wastes
description: CLEVELAND, Sept. 8 (UPI)  Two officials of the Atomic Energy Commission say fears that radioactive discharges from nuclear generating plants would cause increased threats of cancer and other diseases are unfounded. Paul Tompkins, executive di rector of the Federal Radiation Council, which sets radiation standards, said Sunday, that hazards from nuclear power plants are being badly over painted.

title: Ray Scott Signs Contract With the Virginia Squires
description: NORFOLK, Va., Sept. 8 (AP) The Virginia Squires of the American Basketball Associa tion announced today that Ray Scott, a veteran of the Na tional Basketball Association, had signed a multiyear con tract with the Sauires.

title: SCHOOL TALKS FAIL IN PHILADELPHIA
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 8A breakdown in negotiations for a new teacher's contract made, it virtually certain today that Philadelphia's 270 public, ele mentary and high schools will not reopen on Thursday as scheduled.

title: VARIAN ASSOCIATES DEVELOPS PRINTER
description: Varian Associates of Palo Alto, Calif., announced yester day development of a new com puter output printer that it says is four times faster [and at] onehalf the cost of existing mechanical line printers. The new unit operates at 5,000 lines a minute, the equivalent of an entire page of computergener ated text every second. It will cost $15,300 in a complete con figuration.

title: Miss Susan Roberts Betrothed
description: PELHAM MANOR, N. Y., Sept. 8Miss Susan Louise Roberts and David Bearce Rogers plan to be married here Nov. 27.

title: Revson Receives Special Prize As Top Performer in Coast 500
description: ONTARIO, Calif., Sept. 7 The awards dinner of the Indianapolis 500 usually is held the day after the race because officials need that much recapitulation time to sort out the confusion of a race so complex, to tidy up loose ends and to catch up with matters overlooked on race day. Often there are differ ences between t h e provisional results of race day and the of ficial results the next day, after scoring tapes have been audited and all the prizes ac curately totaled and al located. Tonight's awards dinner of the California 500, opening event of the new Ontario Motor Speedway, followed the Indy pattern.

title: Alexander Cohen Lists Starting LineUp for Season
description: After a season's hiatus dur ing which he presented five shows in London, Alexander H. Cohen is returning to Broadway as the sponsor of musical and a romantic comedy.

title: 34 FIRE BOMBS ERUPT IN SEARS STORE HERE
description: Thirtyfour fire bombs went off in quick succession last night in the Sears, Roebuck department store in the down town shopping area of Brook lyn, the police said.

title: FRANKHAUSER SET TO MOVE TO COGAN
description: Mahlon M. Frankhauser, former regional administrator for the Securities and Exchange Commission and now a vice president of the New York Stock Exchange, will leave the exchange to become general counsel and secretary of Cogan, Berlind, Weill & Levitt, Ins. the brokerage house.

title: Cash Prices
description: Cash Prices

title: HondurasSalvador Link
description: SAN SALVADOR, Sept. 8 (UPI)Honduras and El Salva dor agreed today to reopen telephone lines between the two countries next Tuesday. The two countries, then briefly at war, severed all communi cations last year.

title: EXHEAD OF LORDS BACKS HIS OUSTER
description: Felipe Luciano, former chair man of the Young Lords, a militant Puerto Rican organ ization, said yesterday that he had agreed with last week's decision by the group's cen tral committee dismissing him as chairman.

title: PRICES ARE MIXED ON LONDON BOARD
description: Prices on the London Stock Exchange closed mixed yester day after initial dullness.

title: SOUGHT IN DEATHS, MAN TO BE DEPORTED
description: HACKENSACK, N.J., Sept. 8 (AP)  A Federal inquiry of ficer today ordered the de portation to Italy of a 42year old man wanted for his alleged role in the 1963 slaying of 10 persons in Palermo, Sicily.

title: Junius S. Morgan 2d Marries Patricia A. Milton in Georgia
description: Miss Patricia Adele Milton, whose father, Lieut. Gen. Theodore Ross Milton is for mer controller of the Air Force, was married Aug. 28 to Pvt. Junius Spencer Mor gan 2d of the Army, bearer of the name of his ancestor who founded the Morgan banking enterprise.

title: Frogtown Frolic Scheduled for Sept. 26 in Holmdel
description: HOLMDEL, N. J., Sept. 8 The Frogtown Frolic, a pet show and fair, will be held at the Cross Farm in the Frog town area of Holmdel from 10 A.M. to 4 P.M. on Sept. 26.

title: 4 NATIONS AGREE ON JOINT EFFORT TO FREE HOSTAGES
description: As some 200 passengers from two hijacked jetliners waited out their second day as hostages in the Jordanian desert yester day, Britain, Switzerland, West Germany and the United States agreed to coordinate efforts to obtain their release.

title: British Heavyweight Stops Wepner on Cut in 3 Rounds
description: LONDON, Sept. 8 (Reuters) Chuck Wepner, a heavy weight from Bayonne, N. J., was stopped by Joe Bugner of Britain after three rounds of a scheduled 10round fight to night.

title: Rhodes Sued in Kent Deaths
description: CLEVELAND, Sept. 8 (UPI) A $1million damage suit was filed in Federal court today al leging that Gov. James A. Rhodes and other state officials engaged in reckless and wan ton actions that caused the deaths of four students at Kent State Universty. The suit was filed by the American Civil Lib erties Union on behalf of the mother of Sandra Scheuer, one of the students killed during a confrontation with Obio Na tional Guardsmen on May 4. According to the suit, Governor Rhodes deliberately engaged in rhetoric and gave Guard offi cers orders which substantially increased the isk of unnecessay violence.

title: South African, 19, Skates 1,000 Miles For Record
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Sept. 8 (AP)Andre van Zyl, 19 years old, a South African Army corporal, has laid claim to a world record after a 1,000mile roller skat ing jaunt from Capetown to Johannesburg that took him 19 days.

title: Murtagh Admonishes Lefcourt as Panther 13 Trial Opens Here
description: Despite stern admonitions from State Supreme Court Jus tice John M. Murtagh, a defense lawyer at the trial of 13 Black Panthers here per sisted yesterday in introducing statements concerning a 20 year old accusation against the judge.

title: Woodcock Says Auto Talks Have Now Ground to a Halt
description: DETROIT, Sept. 8 (UPI) Leon ard Woodcock, president of the United Auto Workers said today that contract nego tiations with the union's strike targets, the General Motors Corporation and the Chrysler Corporation, had ground to a halt and that the companies had to come up with another offer quickly to avoid a strike Sept. 15.

title: GENERAL DISMISSES ONE SONGMY CHARGE
description: FORT HOOD, Tex., Sept. 8 (AP)The commander of the First Armored Division today dismissed one charge of assault to murder against S. Sgt. David Mitchell in connection with the alleged massacre at Songmy, South Vietnam.

title: Belmont Jockeys
description: Belmont Jockeys

title: 2 Deny Abduction Charges
description: CLEVELAND, Sept. 8 (AP) A New York man and woman accused of abducting two per sons as hostages during a serv ice station holdup in suburban Rocky River pleaded not guilty today in Rocky River Municipal Court. A hearing was scheduled for Sept. 17 and bond for Gerard Blekicki, 35 years old, was set at $50,000. Mrs. Bar bara Ann Kocherkevich, 28, is being held under $20,000 bond. Both are from Nassau County.

title: Court Allows City to Sue Car Makers on Pollution
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8A Federal court has ruled that New York City and other parties may bring tripledamage suits against the major automobile manufacturers for having allegedly conspired to prevent the development and installa tion of antismog devices.

title: New Books
description: Adam and The Train, two nov els by Heinrich Boll, translated from the German by Leila Ven newitz (McGrawHill, $6.95).

title: Space Aide at Houston Wins Transport Award
description: The American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronau tics has named Christopher C. Kraft Jr. as this year's winner of the Louis W. Hill Space Transportation Award.

title: Stark Successor Up for Election Today
description: Brooklyn's 12 City Council men will meet today to elect an interim Borough President to succeed Abe Stark, who is ill and whose resignation took ef fect yesterday.

title: ROBERT TEICHMAN, HEADED ARCHITECTS
description: FORT MYERS, Fla., Sept. 8  Robert Teichman, a New York architect, died here yesterday. He was 89 years old.

title: KY RECONSIDERING PLAN TO VISIT U.S.
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 8 (AP)Vice President Nguyen Cao Ky is reconsidering his scheduled trip to the United States next month, a Govern ment spokesman said today.

title: A White House Reception
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (AP) Mrs. Richard M. Nixon will give a White House reception Friday for the 50 citizens who volunteer their skills in the Na tional Reading Council to strengthen reading programs.

title: Deaths
description: Deaths

title: Executive Changes
description: Edward H. Crawford has been appointed execu tive vice president and treasurer, and W. J. Adams and D. M. Ellis were named senior vice presidents at Canada Life Assurance Company.

title: BIG BOARD POSTS A RECOVERY HIGH
description: Wall Street celebrated its first session after the Labor Day weekend yesterday with booming volume, a surge in speculative and glamour favor ites, and another recovery high in the climbing DowJones industrial average.

title: YANKEES WIN, 73, FOR FIFTH IN ROW
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8  A sudden thought struck Ralph Houk after the Yankees had battered Washington with 16 hits and a 73 victory tonight.

title: Yonkers Results
description: Yonkers Results

title: EARNINGS PLUNGE AT COLLINS RADIO
description: Earnings of the Collins Radio Company in the fiscal year ended July 31 plunged to $432, 000, or 15 cents a share, from $8,932,000, or $3.01 a share, earned in the preceding year, the Dallasbased compa ny reported yesterday. Sales declined to $348,957,000 from $400,233,000.

title: Protest Blocks Ceremony
description: NEW BEDFORD, Mass., Sept. 8 (UPI)A small band of young protesters prevented today groundbreaking ceremonies for a community center near the site where a black youth was slain during riots in July. There were no errests.

title: MINIONS OF ORDER CLUB EACH OTHER
description: Mayor Lindsay was there. Teams representing two bor oughs of the city were the con testants. At stake was a trophy for the winner of the deciding game of a season's series.

title: 3 More for Shoemaker
description: DEL MAR, Calif., Sept. 8 (AP)  Bill Shoemaker, who broke the world riding record yesterday, had three more win ners today at Del Mar, raising his career mark to 6,036 vic

title: SEATO Aide Hopeful on Talks
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Sept. 8 (Reuters)Jesus Vargas, sec retary of the Southeast Asia Treaty Organization, said to day in an annual report that there was hope for an interna tional conference on Southeast Asia if the Soviet Union be came more concerned over Communist China's role in the region.

title: 6,000 Commuters Are Delayed by Penn Central Fire
description: The sixth major fire in two months delayed 6,000 Penn Central commuters from West chester and Connecticut for up to 73 minutes during the morn ing rush hours yesterday.

title: Wings Unger Hospitalized
description: DETROIT, Sept. 8 (UPI) Gary Unger of the Detroit Red Wings has been hospitalized with a back injury suffered in a swimming accident. The Red Wings 22yearold center, who scored 42 goals and had 24 assists in 76 games last season, received the injury yesterday.

title: Football Shrine Picks 11 Players of Early Era
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., Sept. 8 (AP)Eleven players who performed round the turn of the century were named today to the National Football Foundation's Hall of Fame in the pioneer player category.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Activities. The President toured downtown Washing ton in connection with plans to refurbish the area for the 1976 bicentennial celebration. He met with Dwight Dickin son, Ambassadordesignate to the Republic of Togo, and Nicholas Thacher, Ambassa dordesignate to Saudi Ara bia. The President designated the week beginning Oct. 4 as National Employ the Physi cally Handicapped Week.

title: City Will Require All Taxis To Install Cash Lockboxes
description: Mayor Lindsay announced yesterday that all 11,700 taxi cabs in the city would be re quired to have locked money boxes secured to their frames to help discourage holdup men.

title: U.S. INVESTIGATES ALLEGED DUMPING
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (UPI) The Treasury Department be gan an investigation today to determine if electronic com ponents imported from Japan were being sold at illegally low prices.

title: HOWARD SELSAM, MARXIST SCHOLAR
description: Dr. Howard Selsam, a Marx ist scholar and an author, lec turer and educator, died Mon day evening on Fire Island, where he had been vacation ing. He was 67 years old and lived at 100 West 94th Street.

title: ROBERT WEISS
description: ARDSLEY, N. Y., Sept. 8 Robert Weiss, senior vice presi dent of the Dollar Savings Bank of New York, died yester day at his home here after a brief illness. He, was 55 years old and lived at 87 Beacon Hill Road.

title: GOLDBERG ISSUES CALL FOR DEBATE
description: Arthur J. Goldberg yesterday challenged Governor Rockefel ler to debate campaign issues, and the Governor promptly ac cepted.

title: Poles Assail Danes Refusal To Extradite in Hijack Case
description: WARSAW, Sept. 8 (Reuters) Poland said today that Den mark's refusal to extradite a 28yearold man who is ac cused of having hijacked an airliner would not contribute to combating air piracy.

title: Foreign Affairs: The Enemy Who Is Us
description: ASPEN, COLO.One has be come accustomed to gasping through today's gray and brown cities, defined accord ing to the order and type of their polluted atmosphere.

title: Harvard Loses Quarterback
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Sept. 8 (AP)The number of quarter back candidates on the Harvard squad dropped to four today when Joe Roda, a senior, quit the team.

title: Sargent Nominates Judge
description: BOSTON, Sept. 8 (AP) Gov. Francis W. Sargent nominated Judge G. Joseph Tauro today to be chief justice of the Supreme Judicial Court, succeeding Justice Raymond S. Wilkins, who recently retired. Judge Tauro since 1963 has been chief justice of the state Superior Court system.

title: TAX AUDIT DELAYS F.C.C. NOMINATION
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8The White House confirmed today that it has stalled the nomina tion of Sherman E. Unger to the Federal Communications Commission until the Internal Revenue Service completes a routine audit of his tax re turns.

title: Bleier, Steeler Back, Faces More Treatment for Wound
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept. 8 (UPI) The Pittsburgh Steelers said today a war wound suffered in Vietnam by Rock Bleier, a run ning back, was not healing properly and more medical treatment would be needed.

title: Doyle of Harvard Captures SingleHanded Sailing Lead
description: NEW HAVEN, Sept. 8 (AP) Robbie Doyle of Harvard, the intercollegiate champion, took the lead in light winds today in the North American single handed sailing championship.

title: Plane Delayed in Geneva
description: GENEVA, Sept. 8 (Reuters) A Coronado jet airliner of Middle East Airlines was de layed for nearly six hours here tonight after a telephone caller said there was a bomb aboard. Its 56 passengers and crew of 4 were evacuated as police searched the plane. Nothing was found and the plane took off for Beirut.

title: Charts of Races at Belmont
description: 1970, by Triangle Publications, Inc. (The Morning Telegraph) Tuesday, Sept. 8. Eighth day. Weather cloudy, track fast.

title: Gen. Mariano Castaneda Of Philippine Resistance
description: MANILA, Sept. 8 (UPI)Maj. Gen. Mariano N. Castaneda, a military hero who saved the life of the republic's first president, died here yesterday. He was 76 years old.

title: Arrests for Prostitution Show Decline Here of 18%
description: Arrests for prostitution here decreased by 18.2 per cent in the first seven months of this year compared with the similar period a year ago, the Police Department reported yesterday.

title: U.N. Council Defers Action On Thrust Into Lebanon
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Sept. 8The Security Council today postponed indefinitely a scheduled meeting to debate Israel's incursion into south eastern Lebanon last weekend.

title: A.E.C. Detects Soviet Test
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (AP) The United States recorded seismic signals on Sunday, presumably from a Soviet un derground nuclear explosion, the Atomic Energy Commission said today. The signals orig inated from the Semipalatinsk nuclear test area.

title: John Takes Opener of Series For World OneDesign Crown
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., Sept. 8 William E. John Jr., the tall, 255pound chairman of the Long Island Sound Fleet, had the best start and, more im portant, he had the best finish today in the first race of seven for the world championship in the International OneDesign Class.

title: DISSENTER SEEKS SMUT REPORT BAN
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 A dissident member of the Federal Commission on Obscen ity and Pornography disclosed tonight that he would seek a court order tomorrow to pre vent publication of the commis sions report on smut in America.

title: Neutral Nations Open Parley in Zambia
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, Sept. 8 President Kenneth D. Kaunda of Zambia called on nonaligned nations today to establish new means for collective political and economic action in a world that he said was dominated by the big powers.

title: Clinics Aid Singapore Poor
description: SINGAPORE (UP)  Sing apore has 79 Governmentrun dental clinics catering mainly to her poor citizens and pris oners.

title: 15HITS BY CHICAGO STOP PITTSBURGH
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept. 8The Chicago Cubs further tightened the National League East pen nant race today by walloping the Pittsburgh Pirates, 103, at Three Rivers Stadium.

title: MacDonald's Lawyer Says Tests Find Hair Dissimilar
description: FORT BRAGG, N. C., Sept. 8 (AP)  A defense lawyer said today that tests of Capt. Jeffrey R. MacDonald's hair showed it did not match hair found in the hands of the officer's slain wife.

title: Anniuersaries
description: LOBSENZ BenHenrietta (Pelz) grateful for being fortunate enough to be together for fifty happy years. Celebrating with children grandchildren In California and Hawaii.

title: Israelis Want a Joint Hijacking Stand
description: JERUSALEM, Sept. 8Prem ier Golda Meir met with key ministers today to align Israeli policy on the hijackings Sunday with that of Britain, Switzer land, West Germany and the United States, the other states concerned.

description: Belmont Entries

title: Julie Eisenhower to Attend Catholic U. Teaching Class
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (UPI) Julie Nixon Eisenhower en rolled today in Catholic Univer sity's School of Education here, where she said she would work for two semesters to get her teaching certificate.

title: PLEA ON HOSTAGES IS MADE BY ROGERS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8The United States appealed today to 10 Arab countries, including the United Arab Republic and Jordan, to assist on humani tarian grounds in obtaining the release of the hostages held by Palestinian guerrillas in Jordan.

title: List of Passengers on Swissair Flight
description: Following is a list of the pas sengers aboard Swissair Flight 100 when it was hijacked to Jordan Sunday, with places where they purchased their tickets. A list of passengers aboard Trans World Airlines Flight 741, also hijacked to Jordan, appeared in The New York Times yesterday.

title: U.S. Concerns Agree to Buy Liquefied Gas From Algeria
description: Subsidiaries of the Columbia Gas System, Inc., and the El Paso Natural Gas Company an nounced yesterday that they have reached a definite agree ment for the purchase by Co lumbia of liquefied natural gas (LNG) to be imported from Algeria.

title: Severe Tests for Chile
description: Chile's democratic system, one of the more durable in the Americas, now faces its most severe testing time in decades. Great responsibility and restraint will be required from disparate groups not noted for those qualities if the country is to avoid constitu tional crisis or even civil war.

title: LOUISE E. OCKERS
description: OAKDALE; L. I., Sept. 8  Louise E. Ockers, a director of the Oystermen's Bank & Trust Co. of Sayville, died today at her home here. She was 82 years old. Despite a long illness, she had regularly attended meetings of the bank's board.

title: Books of The Times
description: The ethologists have just got to get a grip on their impulse toward selfaggran disement. A decent reticence is in order. Maybe it was inevitable that studies of animal behavior should excite the Ameri can intellectual appetite in the late 1960's, much as years ago we pounced so vora ciously on the Freudian bone. After a dec ade of assassinations, war and civil strife, with which neither systems analysis nor traditional pieties can cope, we don't feel very much like children of the Enlightenment any more. The irrational demands an ex

title: Theme of Black Parleys
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 8, The meetings of three black groups over the Labor Day weekend point up the growing ethnic nationalism of a wide spectrum of black Americans as frustrations continue to grow over the slowness of change for most blacks.

title: Miss Yoblon Fiancee Of Richard Kronhaus
description: SEARINGTOWN, Sept. 8Mr. and Mrs. Marvin M. Yoblon have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Olivia Yob ion, a senior at Mount Hol yoke College, to Richard Kronhaus, who attends the University of Vermont. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Henry Kronhaus of Roslyn.

title: Mobile Officials Apprehensive As Schools in City Open Today
description: MOBILE, Ala., Sept. 8 Schools open here tomorrow under a new desegregation plan that has prompted rumors of boycotts, demonstrations and violence in the state's largest public education system.

title: Secret NATO Papers Reported in 747 Debris
description: CAIRO, Sept. 8The semi official Cairo newspaper Al Ahram reported today that secret documents of the North Atlantic Treaty Or ganization had been found in the debris of the Pan American World Airways 747 jet destroyed here by Palestinian commandos.

title: 6 TIGER OFFICIALS CALLED BY KUHN
description: The baseball future of Denny McLain will be on the line again today when the slender Detroit Tiger pitcher appears before Commissioner Bowie Kuhn to explain his conduct of recent weeks.

title: The Summaries
description: MEN'S SINGLES

title: Sirhan Lawyers Charge U.S. Thwarts Their Flight to Jordan
description: The mother of Sirhan B. Sir han and her two lawyers were thwarted in an attempt to fly to Jordan last night to try to seek the release of 180 hostage air passengers.

title: Sports Today
description: Mets vs. Philadelphia Phillies, twi lightnight doubleheader, at Shea Stadium, Roosevelt Avenue and 126th Street, Flushing Meadow, Queens, 5 P.M. (TelevisionChannel 9, 8 P.M.) (Radio  WJRZ, WNBCFM, P.M.)

title: 2 Black West Point Cadets Win Top Training Honors
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., Sept. 8 (AP)Two black cadets have won top summer training honors in their respective classes at the United States Military Academy, a West Point statement said today.

title: Body FOund in Burning Car Near Holland Tunnel Entry
description: A body burned beyond iden tification was found in the rear of a blazing car on the Lower West Side early this morning, the police said.

title: At BedStay Theater, Theme Is Now
description: BedfordStuyvesant, as one of New York's most de pressed areas, would seem to be the last outpost in which one would choose to establish a legitimate theater. But it was Delano Stewart's first choice, and after two years of continuing opera tion, he can justifiably say of his BedStuy Theater, we exist and we are an institu tion. The worst is over.

title: Football Transactions
description: BUFFALOAsked waivers on Bill Maddox, Dave Farris and Billy Bob Barnett, tight ends, Steve Starnes, linebacker.
