description: Radio

title: Mets Thrash Expos, 105, and Trail by HalfGame as Cubs Beat Pirates, 103
description: The New York Mets, gather ing steam for the final surge, won their fourth straight game yesterday when they defeated the Montreal Expos, 105, and moved to within half a game of first place.

title: Pan Am Hopes Federal Insurance Will Pay $9.6Million in Destruction of Its
description: Pan American World Air ways said yesterday that there was a possibility that the Federal Government would pay the company slightly more than 40 per cent of the loss of its 747 jet. The value of the jumbo jet, blown up by Arab guer rillas in Cairo Monday, had been put at $23million but Pan Am now puts it at $24million.

title: SENATE DEBATING DIRECT ELECTION
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 The Senate opened today a his torically significant debate on revamping the nation's Presi dential selection system. There was a spirited flurry of talk among a few Senators but no prospect of action for some days, perhaps weeks.

title: Two Cambodian Factions Clash in Paris
description: PARIS, Sept. 8The apart ment of the Cambodian, mili tary attach here has become the prize in a struggle between the embassy and supporters of Prince Norodom Sihanouk, the deposed head of state.

title: Youths Meet Prospective Employers in Armory
description: Thousands of high school students looking for parttime winter jobs crowded into a makeshift employment center yesterday. They filled out doz ens of application forms and sat through many interviews, but few got jobs.

title: Capital Spending Slowdown
description: Businesses are still trimming their plans for invest ment in new plant and equipment this year. Last February the Commerce Department and the Securi ties and Exchange Commission found that businesses were planning to boost their outlays in 1970 by 9.7 per cent. A May survey found this figure had been revised downward to 7.8 per cent; now the Government reports that it has been shaved to 6.6 per cent. Since prices of capital goods have been rising, the latest figure represents little or no real increase in capital spending for 1970 over 1969.

title: L M. F. TO DISCUSS EXCHANGE. RATES
description: The International Monetary Fund will report next week on the results of its yearlong study of greater flexibility in foreign exchange rates.

title: Sanitationmen Here Aggrieved By Abuse and Changing Hours
description: The morale of the city's 10,100man sanitation force is critically low.

title: Tupamaros Steal Dynamite
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept: 8 (Reuters)Eight Tupa maro urban guerillas, including two women, overpowered workers at a quarry explosives store today and drove off with 176 pounds of dynamite and dozens of detonators. The armed commandos of the left wing guerilla organization, which holds a kidnapped United States AID official and a Bra zilian diplomat, hoisted a Tupa maros flag before fleeing in three stolen trucks.

title: Two Terrorist Suspects Slain by Argentine Police
description: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 8 (UPI)The police reported to day the slaying of two men sought for the kidnapping and murder last May of formet President Pedro Eugenio Aram buru.

title: Cramer Beats ExJudge
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Wednesday, Sept. 9  Florida Republicans rejected yesterday G. Harrold Carswell's bid for nomination to the Senate.

title: Police Chase in Queens Cuts Off Power on IND
description: Power on the IND subway in Queens was shut off for more than an hour last night while the police chased suspect through tunnels un der the Elmhurst section.

title: G.O.P. State Legislators Here and Some County Chiefs Deserting Goodell at Polls
description: With the United States Sen ate campaign barely under way, virtually every Republi can state legislator from New York City and half the Repub lican county leaders in the metropolitan area are openly hostile to the candidacy of their fellow Republican, Sena tor Charles E. Goodell.

title: Pan Am Ad in Beirut: 747 Easiest to Catch
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Sept. 8 (Reuters)How to Catch a 747 was the headline on a Pan American World Airways advertisement today in The Daily Star of Beirut. The air line's hijacked jumbo jet re fueled here Sunday before flying to Cairo, where it ex ploded.

title: MOSCOW STUDYING U. S. MANAGEMENT
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 8In an ef fort to improve their own econ omy, Soviet management spe cialists these days are paying increased attention to the way American big business is run.

title: Leary Got New Job at A.&S. Through Executive Recruiter
description: Howard R. Leary, who has submitted his resignation as the city's Police Commissioner to become operating vice presi dent of security for the Abra ham & Straus department stores here, got his new job through an executive recruitment com pany, officials of A. & S. said yesterday.

title: Sale of Livestock Vaccine By Two Makers Is Barred
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (UPI) The Agriculture Department said today that two manufac turers of livestock vaccines and similar products had failed to comply with Federal Produc tion regulations and had been ordered to halt sales of their products.

description: Tuesday. Suet. 8. 1970

title: Jersey Central Petition Opposed
description: The Chesapeake & Ohio and Baltimore & Ohio railroads have asked the Interstate Com merce Commission to dismiss a petition of the trustee of the Central Railroad of New Jersey asking the regulatory agency to require the C.&0.B.&O. sys tem to take over the bankrupt line.

title: Airports Tighten Security, Intensify Luggage Search
description: Travelers boarding jetliners at airports around the world were met yesterday by security agents who searched carryon bags, poked through women's purses and, in a few cases, searched the passengers.

title: G.M. REBUTS NADER ON CORVAIR TESTS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8The General Motors Corporation acknowledged today that Chev rolet Corvairs had overturned in secret tests but said the rollovers had been intentional.

title: Miss Sonya Sedure Prospective Bride
description: TROY, N. Y. Sept. 8Dr. and Mrs. Vladimir Ilyich Sedure have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Sonya Sedure, to Herbert Starr, a news cor respondent for WTEN, an Albany television station.

description: Major League Leaders

title: Cushing: Ecumenical Leader, Kennedys Friend, Communists Foe
description: BOSTON, Sept. 8Richard Cardinal Cushing is the product of a subculture developed by the Irish Catholics of Boston at the turn of the century to insu late themselves from the cold Yankee Protestant atmosphere of a city that had been the cap ital of Puritanism.

title: W.C.T.U. Against Marijuana
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 8 (AP) Delegates to the 96th annual convention of the Women's Christian Temperance Union unanimously opposed legalizing of marijuana today.

title: Buckley Directs Appeal to Voters Who See Liberty Besieged
description: ROCHESTER, Sept 8 James L. Buckley, Conservative party candidate for the United States Senate, appealed tonight for the support of millions of New Yorkers who see Ameri can freedoms in a state of siege.

title: SKI UNIT STRESSES DOWNHILL EVENTS
description: GENEVA, Sept. 8 (AP)The International Ski Federation an nounced today changes in the rules of the Alpine World Cup competition.

title: New Hampshire Governor Has Lead Over His G.O.P. Opponent
description: CONCORD, N. H., Wednes day, Sept. 9Gov. Walter R. Peterson pulled slightly ahead in the Republican gubernatorial primary early today. He faced stiff challenge from a conserva tive, Meldrim Thomson of Or ford, a oublisher of law books.

title: Yellow Jackets Invade Yellowjackets Domain
description: ROCHESTER, Sept. 8 (AP)  Unwanted yellow jackets invaded today the equipment room of the Yellowjackets, football team of the Univer sity of Rochester.

title: Outrage Is Voiced By Church Groups; Banditry Charged
description: Religious organizations in New York voiced outrage yes terday at the hijacking by Arab commandos of airlines Sunday and the continued detention of passengers and crew members in Jordan.

description: New York 10, Montreal 5. Chicago 10, Pittsburgh 3. Atlanta 3, Los Angeles 2 (n). Cincinnati 5, San Francisco 2 (n). Houston 8, San Diego 7 (n).

title: Administration Is Stressing Political Loyalty for Jobs
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 The Nixon Administration is unusual in its boast that the hallmark of its appointment policy is political empha sis. It also shows open con cern about political loyalty.

title: Ogilvy Offers Services Separately
description: Ogilvy & Mather, New York, which has already made its media department available as an independent service, is willing to do the same with its other departments.

description: Listing of Prices of Commodity Futures

title: 30 Professors Urge Nixon To Keep Faith With Israel
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Sept. 8 (AP)  Thirty professors at Harvard, Massachusetts Insti tute of Technology, Princeton, Chicago and other universities called upon the Nixon Admin istration today to keep faith with Israel.

title: Outlook at a Glance
description: PROSPECTSA winning season more the result of high morale than blocks and tackles.

title: Washington: The Paradox of American Politics
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8One of the odd paradoxes in America today is that there is more grumbling about the political life of the nation and yet rela tively less voting in this year's primary elections than in many years. In short, it isn't only the young who are copping out of the political system, but also their elders who seem to feel that voting is not the answer to their grievances.

title: 28 FROM ROCHESTER ON SWISSAIR FLIGHT
description: ROCHESTER, N. Y., Sept. 8 Twentyeight of the 155 peo ple aboard the Swissair DC8 that was hijacked by Arab guer rillas to the Jordanian desert are connected with a Rochester choral group.

title: School Bus Hits House; 29 Hurt in Birmingham
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Sept. 8 (AP)A churchowned bus taking children to public schools missed a turn and slammed into a house today.

title: Treasury Statement
description: Treasury Statement

title: HAROLD PITMAN, 82, GENEALOGIST, DEAD
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., Sept. 8 Harold Minot Pitman, a gene alogist, died yesterday in a nursing home. He was 82 years old and lived at 88 Summit Avenue.

title: Flight Accord Held Up
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (AP)  The Civil Aeronautics Board deferred action today on an agreement by the three largest domestic airlines  American, Trans World and United  to avoid excessive scheduling on major transcontinental routes. The board asked for comments by Sept. 21 as to whether such an agreement could be ap proved without contravening antitrust laws, and as to what conditions should be attached if the agreement were approved. Reply comment must be filed by Oct. 1.

title: Court Allows Yippie Tour
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 8 (UPI) The United States Court of Ap peals for the Seventh Circuit today granted the Yippie leader Abbie Hoffman permission to spend two days in Canada on a speaking tour this week. Hoffman, 33 years old, is free on $5,000 bond after his con viction in the Chicago Seven riot conspiracy trial.

title: Fire Bombs Slightly Damage Garage of Police Aide
description: The home of First Deputy Police Commissioner John F. Walsh was firebombed early vpctprclav morning.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing Passenger and Mail Ships

title: U.S. Organizes a Special Unit For Enforcing Securities Laws
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8Creation of a special new unit in the Justice Department to handle criminal cases involv ing violations of the securities laws was announced today by Attorney General John N. Mitchell.

title: HOFF WINS EASILY IN VERMONT RACE
description: MONTPELIER, Vt., Wednes day, Sept. 9 (AP)Former Gov. Philip H. Hoff scored a land slide victory over tow oppon ents yesterday in the Vermont Democratic Senatorial primary and will face Senator Winston L. Prouty, a Republican, in November.

title: Indians Say Pakistan Gets Military Aid From Peking
description: SRINAGAR, India, Sept. 8 Indian sources said today that Pakistan in recent months had obtained substantial military aid from Communist China.

title: L.S.U. Quarterback Dies; Brain Damage Reported
description: BATON ROUGE, La., Sept. 8 Harmon J. (Butch) Duhe, a 21yearold junior quarterback at Louisiana State, died today in the university hospital.

title: July Retail Sales Up 1% to a Record; Price of Newsprint Raised in Canada
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 Retail sales rose one per cent in July to a record total, sea sonally adjusted, of $30,739, 000,000, the Commerce Depart ment reported today.

title: The BlueCollar Blues
description: A generation ago, during the great organizing drive of the American labor movement, bluecollar workers could say, with G. K. Chesterton, And we were angry and poor and happy, and proud of seeing our names in print. Today, after three lecades of eco nomic growth, the workers song should be re written to go, Still we are angry but now we are middle class and unhappy, and longing to see our names in print. Now they feel that they have become forgotten Americans, and they want more attention paid to their grievances. In creasingly, as at the White House on Labor Day, attention is being paid.

description: Dividends Announced

title: Board Meets in London; State Department Cool
description: An Israelibacked suggestion for an aviation boycott of Arab countries was taken up yester day by officers of the world pilots organization and debat ed in many other segments of the industry.

title: Olin Company Tells Court It Cuts Mercury Pollution
description: BUFFALO, Sept. 8A vice president of the Olin Corpora tion testifed in Federal Court here today that the company had spent more than $200,000 since last April to reduce mer cury discharges into the Niagara River from its chlorine plant in nearby Niagara Falls.

title: Coleman Declines a Seat, Delaying Betting Agency
description: ALBANY, Sept. 8 (AP)The state commission to oversee offtrack betting plans in the state faced a delay in organiza tion today after the loss of one of the commission members.

title: Rail Negotiators, Still Far Apart, Face Strike Deadline Tonight
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (UPI) Union and railroad negotia tors resumed negotiations to day under Government prod ding, but one union leader said we are further apart than when we started on a new contract to avert a threatened strike at midnight tomorrow.

title: Market Place:
description: If you're one of First Dev onshire Corporation's 4,100 customers, you're probably confused and not a little an noyed that the New York Stock Exchange chose to sus pend this member firm and not back up its customers with its celebrated trust fund.

title: New Czech Envoy to Soviet
description: PRAGUE, Sept. 8 (Reuters)  Bohuslav Chnoupek, director general of Czechoslovak radio, was named ambassador to the Soviet Union today. He re places Vladimir Koucky, who was reported to be in line for appointment as ambassador to Belgium.

title: Korean Red, in Truce Unit, Assails Agnew's Asian Trip
description: PANMUNJOM, Korea, Sept. 8 North Korea asserted today that the only way to bring peace in this nation was the withdrawal of all American troops.

title: Outlook at a Glance
description: PROSPECTSYale is seeking a fourth successive league title or a share of it. It is a strong pos sibility based upon the talent and experience of the seniorjunior squad.

title: Goodell, in Hudson Area, Urges a Hijacking Curb
description: KINGSTON, N. Y., Sept. 8 Senator Charles E. Goodell, the Republican  Liberal candidate for the United States Senate, campaigned in low key in two midHudson Valley counties today, visiting an urbanrenewal project, an apple orchard and a community college, but greet ing relatively few voters.

title: M. Lowenstein's President Is Named Chief Executive
description: Robert Bendheim has been elected chief executive officer of M. Lowenstein & Sons., Inc., textile manufacturer. He will continue as president, a post he has held since 1964. As chief executive officer, Mr. Bendheim succeeds Leon Lowenstein, who continues as the concern's chairman. Edward Goldberger, treasurer, has been elected vice chairman.

title: A.E.C. Awards Contract
description: The Atomic Energy Commis sion has awarded a contract for an undisclosed amount to Com bustion Engineering, Inc:, for re search and development work on a steam generator design for a liquid fast metal bredder nu clear reactor.

title: 11 KILLED IN CRASH OFJETATKENNEDY
description: A fourengine jet with 11 crew members aboard, but no passengers, crashed and burned on takeoff from Kennedy In ternational Airpqrt yesterday. Everyone on the plane, includ ing seven stewardesses, was killed.

title: Old Meters Profitable
description: MADERA, Calif. (UPI) Parking meters never collected enough coins to pay for them selves in this farming com munity but the city announced it had made a profit on them anyway by the sale of 400 meters as novelties or souve nirs. The city realized $2,205.

title: KENNEDY TO ARGUE YOUTHVOTING CASE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 Senator Edward M. Kennedy, a former Assistant District At torney in Boston who has not argued a case in nine years, will argue for the constitution ality of the new 18yearold vote law in the Federal District Court here Thursday.

title: Ralston Upsets Layer in 5Set Struggle and Reaches Quarterfinals
description: In his finest hour as an ama teur or professional player Dennis Ralston eliminated top seeded Rad Laver from the United States Open tennis championships, yesterday at the West Side Tennis Club in For est Hills. Oueens.

title: EDMUND P. FLYNN, 71; HEADED AD AGENCY
description: Edmund P. Flynn an editor and publisher, died of cancer yesterday in St. Vincent's Hos pital. He was 71 years old and lived at 31 East 12th Street.

description: Minor Leagues

title: PENTAGON TO CUT USE OF DRAFTEES IN FAST BUILDUPS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8De fense Secretary Melvin R. Laird has directed the armed forces to plan to meet future emergen cies like Vietnam by calling up the reserve forces quickly rather than by relying on draftees.

title: FREI PARTY VEERS TOWARD ALLENDE
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Sept. 8 The leadership of the govern ing Christian Democratic party has cautiously indicated sup port for Dr. Salvador Allende, a Marxist who won a plurality in Friday's Presidential elec tion.

title: 134 South Vietnamese Reported Killed as Foe Attacks 2 Bases
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 8 (AP)  More than 200 North Vietnamese commandos smashed their way into a dis trict headquarters and a ran ger camp south of Danang to day, reportedly killing 34 South Vietnamese soldiers and wounding 42. An American ad viser was also reported killed and three were injured.

title: $7Million in Tickets Sold For State's Special Lottery
description: ALBANY, Sept. 8 (UPI) More than $7million in lottery tickets have been sold in New York State's first milliondollar special summer lottery, it was announced today, a week be fore final ticket sales.

title: Mormons Restore Illinois Villa
description: NAUVOO, Ill.The Utah Mormons, who were driven from here 124 years ago, have come back. As a result, this western Illinois village of 1,000 people will never be the same again.

title: EXPERIENCE CALLED TOTS BEST TEACHER
description: UNIVERSITY PARK, Pa.,(UPI) A 1yearold child is going through a stage when every thing he does can be a learn ing experience, according to James E. Van Horn, a family life specialist at Pennsylvania State University.

title: Commodity Trading Linked to Bank Loss
description: BASEL, Sept. 8 (Reuters) United California Bank in Basel A.G., in which the United Cali fornia Bank of Los Angeles has a majority stake, today said its recent substantial losses proba bly were largely because of un authorized commodity trading.

title: U.S. Will Seek to End Bias In Ads For Older Workers
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (AP) The Labor Department has announced that it will seek to eliminate advertising that dis criminates against the hiring of older workers.

title: Mets Records
description: Mets Records

title: $20Million Drugs Seized
description: Customs officials seized more than $20million worth of smuggled drugs and arrested 1,361 persons between June 1 and Aug. 22 of this year, Myles J. Ambrose, United States cus toms commissioner, said yes terday. The figure reflected drugs seized and persons ar rested at ports of entry and border points all over the coun try, the announcement said.

title: TUGWELL BORROWED IDEAS FROM BURGER
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8Rex ford G. Tugwell, the former New Deal brain truster who has drafted a proposed new Constitution for the United States, said today that he had borrowed some of his ideas from Warren E. Burger before he became Chief Justice.

title: Precious Relic Takes Hurdles Race at Belmont
description: I guess experience finally paid off for my mount, said Jerry Fishback yesterday with a grin, but it certainly took its time.

title: Fun for Children
description: WHICH WAY TO THE FRONT? with Jerry Lewis, at neighborhood theaters.

title: New Director Will Take Over At Vienna State Opera in 72
description: VIENNA, Sept. 8A new director for the Vienna State Opera was appointed today. He is Rudolf Gamsjaeger, who as secretary general of the prestigious Gesellschaft der Musikfreunde built up a wealth of musical contacts and international goodwill for 25 years. Mr. Gamsjaeger takes over officially in 1972.

title: TV: A Masterful Series on Rise of Western Man
description: Kenneth Clark's widely her alded film on 1,000 years of Western man made a re markable hour last night on the network of the National Broadcasting Company. As an entity the program stood on its own feet, yet for the view er there was the happy reali zation that only onethirteenth of this forthcoming season's treat was being shown.

title: SYRACUSE ELEVEN FACING HANDICAP
description: SYRACUSE, Sept. 8Syra cuse University's football suc cess this season and for seasons to come may not depend on how many linemen and backs perform well. It may depend on how the university community lives with or solves the serious rift between some black athletes and the athletic department.

title: Bolivia Plans Payment to Gulf
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia, Sept. 8 (AP)A year after Bolivia na tionalized the United States owned Gulf Oil holdings, this country's revolutionary regime is now proclaiming it is prepar ing to reopen the doors to for eign oil operations.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Britain, Switzerland and West Germany agreed yesterday to join United States ef forts to obtain the release of the 200odd airline passengers held hostage in their hijacked jetliners in the Jordanian desert. The three countries delayed the release of the Arab guerrillas they hold pending the joint diplomatic effort. [Page 1, Column 8.]

title: Life on Jets Held in Desert Is Harsh
description: EL KHANA, Jordan, Sept. 8  Hostage crewmen of the two airliners being held in the desert by Arab hijackers said today that living con ditions on board were bad and growing worse.

title: Amulets Are a Vital Part of a Cambodian Soldier's Equipment
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Sept. 8During a battle two weeks ago, a young Cambodian com pany commander found half of his men pinned down behind road embankment and afraid to counterattack enemy forces firing from a treeline a hundred yards away.

title: Dry Dock Savings Picks 2
description: The Dry Dock Savings Bank announced yesterday the ap pointment of John W. Petrusky as vice president and comp troller and Norman L. Snow Jr. as treasurer.

title: Suburban Cooking Classes Go International, Too
description: The pattern remains much the same this year as last. Food from around the worldand the preparation thereofcontinues to be the predominant idea the cooking schools of the suburbs as well as in Manhattan. There are many new recipes in the various kitchens, and there are more kitchens where those who want to cook well may go for instruction. We say again (as it was said in yester day's edition that listed Manhattan cooking schools) that the listing of schools here does not necessarily constitute an endorsement. It is rather as complete listing as could be gathered of cooking schools in the nearby suburban area.

title: SAUL KORNREICH
description: Saul Kornreich, president of Saul Kornreich & Sons, Inc., an insurance concern of 200 Park Avenue, died at Mount Sinai Hospital of a muscular disease on Monday. He was 77 years old and lived at 150 East 69th Street.

title: Milton M. Bergerman Is Dead; Citizens Union Chairman, 67
description: Mr. Bergerman was John Q. Public or Mr. Average Citizen in person, with a quick mind, a sharp tongue and a resonant voice to duel, parry, feint and thrust on behalf of better gov ernment.

title: Hickel Is Urged to Save A Phosphorescent Bay
description: SAN JUAN, Sept. 8A biol ogist from Johns Hopkins Uni versity has appealed to Secre tary of the Interior Walter J. Hickel to convert a large area on the southwest coast of Puerto Rico into a national park in efforts to preserve a very rare phosphorescent bay.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: To the Editor: Although the obstetrics and gynecology service at Lincoln Hospital is functioning again after more than six weeks of disruption, the events of the past month at the hospital raise some disturbing questions about the direction of our na tion in the next decade. [Edi torial Sept. 8.]

title: Hnueilings
description: ALPERNMary N. The unveiling of The Mauseoleum in memory of Mary N. Alpern will take place on Sunday, Sept. 13, 1970 at 1:30 P.M., New Mount Carmel Ceme tery, Brooklyn, N. Y. No Postponement.

title: GREEKS HOLD 2 ARABS IN EXPLOSIVES CASE
description: ATHENS, Sept. 8Security guards at facilities of El Al, the Israeli airline, were reinforced today as Greek security men questioned two Lebanese men charged with illegal possession of explosives.

title: Two Hurt by Fire Bombs
description: NARRAGANSETT, R. I., Sept. 8 (UPI)  Two Molotov cock tails were thrown into Police Headquarters early today, injur ing two policemen. The police charged Walter J. Baker, 18 years old, of Narragansett, and Mark C. Donovan, 18, of War wick, with statuatory burning.

title: Mountain of Waste to Make Problem an Asset?
description: City Council President San ford D. Garelik believes that Pelham Bay Perk swamp land in the Bronx would be an ideal site for a 2,500foot high mountain of compacted and sanitized refuse.

title: Miss Casals Gains Semifinals; 8 Women to Shun Coast Event
description: Still resentful that women's tennis was not receiving the appreciation she felt it war ranted, Rosemary Casals went on the court yesterday in a angry mood and scored a 64, 46, 64 victory over Kerry Melville in the quarterfinals of the United States Open cham pionships at Forest Hills, Oueens.

title: Kirk Asks Supreme Court To Reject Racial Balancing
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (UPI) Gov. Claude R. Kirk Jr. of Florida invoked President Nixon's call for a rule of rea son in urging the Supreme Court today to reject the con cept of racial balance in schools.

title: New G.M. Minicar $2,091; Tops Volkswagen by 10%
description: DETROIT, Sept. 8  The General Motors Corporation to day priced its new mini car, the Vega 2300, about $200, or 10 per cent, above the present price of the major import, Volkswagen. The car goes on sale Thursday.

title: Copper and Other U.S. Holdings Await Chile's Moves With Gloom
description: Worry about the future economic policy of Chile was evident yesterday in United States financial and commodity markets, as well as in the comments of American businessmen with investments and commercial interests in the South American nation.

title: FRESH YANKEE 45 IN $50,000 TROT
description: YONKERS, Sept. 8In rac ing, a morning line is intended to indicate to the bettors which horses will be favored and at what probable odds. It is not designed to pick the winner.

title: A. W. HERRINGTON, RACING AUTO MAKER
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Sept. 8 (UPI) Col. Arthur W. Herrington, who teamed with Walter Mar mon to build the Marmon auto mobile in the nineteentwen ties, died here Sunday. He was 74 years old.

title: KENNY SUMMONED BY CRIME INQUIRY
description: TRENTON, Sept. 8John V. Kenny, the Democratic leader of Hudson County and one of the most powerful local politi cal figures in the United States, has been subpoenaed, along with nine other top Democratic county officials, by the state wide grand jury that is investi gating organized crime and of ficial corruption in New Jersey.

title: War Casualties
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (UPI) The Defense Department an nounced today that the follow ing servicemen from the New York area had been killed in Southeast Asia:

title: 60 From Queens Picket City Hall To Save Homes Due for Razing
description: Sixty householders from Corona, Queens, picketed into the night yesterday at City Hall to protest a proposed plan to tear down 69 homes and use the land for a new high school and athletic field.

title: Parents, Take Heart Not All the College Costs Are Going Up
description: Enter the class of 74, same 1.7 million strong, to Ivy League college and state university, to country cam pus on grassy hill and city school tied to subway line. As the academic year begins, mothers fret over how many sheets and towels to give their sons, how many pairs of shoes to buy for their daughtersand fathers won der where all that money will come from.

title: Successor to Cardinal Cushing
description: BROWNSVILLE, Tex., Sept. 8For the last four years, the Most Rev. Humberto Sosa Medeiros, the Roman Catholic Bishop of Brownsville, has spent Christmas and Easter in Texas jails.

title: Jordan and Commandos Sign ShortLived Truce
description: AMMAN, Jordan. Sept. 8 (Reuters)The Jordanian Gov ernment and the Central Com mittee of the Palestinian com mando movement agreed today to an immediate ceasefire, their second in four days, but the guerrillas called it off to night.

title: Ordeal in the Desert
description: United Nations Secretary General Thant spoke for the conscience of civilized man yesterday in denounc ing the Arab hijackers for their savage and inhuman actions. U Thant, certainly no enemy of the Arab world, voiced a universal demand when he called for prompt and effective measures to put a stop to this return to the law of the jungle.

title: British Football
description: British Football

title: Sports of The Times
description: The chances are that not even those closest to Vince Lombardi had a true ap preciation of the greatness of the man nor a proper realization of what a towering public, figure he had become. But his tragic death from cancer last week brought a new appraisal and Vince began to as sume even larger and more heroic di mensions.

title: In Memoriam
description: ALPERNMary N. Treasured years and pre cious memories.

title: In Berlin, Hill Made From Junk Has Become Popular Ski Area
description: BERLIN, Sept. 8West Berlin's Mount Junk, the artificial hill built of war time bombing rubble, has something for almost every body.

title: Teachers Begin Strikes in New York, Connecticut
description: With the fall school term starting this week in many northeast communities, school districts in upper Westchester County, Niagara Falls and southern Connecticut were faced with strike action by teachers demanding better pay and improved working condi tions.

title: Bridge:
description: George Tornay of New York, who did particularly well in the Spingold team event last month in Boston, led a team of young experts to victory in the open team championship that concluded the Knickerbocker Sectional Tournament of the Greater New York Bridge Association at the New York Hilton Monday.

title: Cleveland Orchestra Sets Up Picket Line
description: CLEVELAND, Sept. 8 (AP) Striking members of the Cleveland Orchestra set up a picket line today at Severance Hall, home of the orchestra that gained world renown un der the direction of the late George Szell.

title: Shelling by Arabs Reported
description: TIBERIAS, Israel, Sept. 8 (Reuters)Several Israeli bor der villages were shelled from Lebanese territory during the night, but there were no casual ties or damage, Israeli sources announced here.

title: GEORGIANS TO VOTE IN TWO PRIMARIES
description: ATLANTA, Sept. 8 (UPI) Georgia voters, apparently not greatly aroused by their first statewide twoparty primaries, select Democratic and Republi can candidates for Governor and other major offices tomor row.

title: Robert College Plans To Show Turkish Art
description: The Alumni Association of the American Colleges in Is tanbul, Turkey, and trustees of Robert College of Istanbul are sponsoring a champagne gala at an exhibition of works by contemporary Turkish ar tists in the United States from 9 P.M. to midnight next Wednesday. Proceeds will go to scholarships.

title: Credit Men Elect
description: Albert G. Ferris, vice presi dent and credit manager of Deering Milliken, Inc., yesterday was elected president of the New York Credit Men's Adjust ment Bureau, an affiliate of the New York Credit and Financial Management Association.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Poseidon Missile Launched
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Sept. 8 (AP)The Daniel Boone today became the second nu clear submarine to launch the new Poseidon missile, unleash ing the multiwarhead weapon while cruising submerged in the Atlantic 40 miles offshore.

title: Piers for People
description: The International Longshoremen's Association, which has been trying with varying degrees of success in recent years to prove it has developed a sense of public responsibility, is reverting to its old troglodyte habits in its battle to keep Mayor Lindsay from turning idle Hudson River piers into cultural centers.

title: Suspect in Tate Case Loses Extradition Appeal in Texas
description: NEW ORLEANS, Sept. (UPI)  The United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit denied Charles D. Wat son a rehearing today on an extradition appeal and refused to give his attorneys more time to get the case before the Supreme Court.

title: White and Bill Johnson Are Among Six Players Placed on Waivers by Giants
description: The New York Giants cut six players yesterday, includ ing Freeman White, a fiveyear pro, and Bill Johnson, a rookie punter, to get down to the 44 player quota required by the National Football League.

title: Matthes Sets World Mark In 100Meter Backstroke
description: BARCELONA, Spain, Sept. 8 (AP)Two world records were set by East Germans tonight in the European swimming championships.

title: Jim Bouton in TV Job
description: Jim Bouton, author of Ball Four, a highly personalized view of professional baseball, will join the local news staff of WABCTV next Monday.

title: Al Ahram Says Hijacking Harms Guerrilla Cause
description: CAIRO, Sept. 8 (UPI)The semiofficial Cairo newspaper, Al Ahram, said today that the hijacking of four airliners by Arab guerrillas tended to turn world opinion against the Pal estinian cause.

title: DR. RICHARD P. HARMON
description: MAMARONECK, N. Y., Sept. 8Dr. Richard P. Harmon, associate professor of educa tional administration at Long Island University, died last eve ning of a heart attack at the Shore Acres Point Club here. He was 57 years old and lived at 730 The Parkway.

title: Yonkers Entries
description: Yonkers Entries

title: NARCOTICS ACTION SOUGHT BY ADAMS
description: Dr. Paul L. Adams, the Con servative party candidate for Governor, called yesterday for breaking diplomatic relations with France unless the French Government cracked down on narcotics processing facilities in Marseilles and other French cities.

title: Bumpers Wins Runoff
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., Wednes day, Sept. 9Former Gov. Or val E. Faubus, once a symbol of Southern intransigence on the race issue, was defeated yesterday in a runoff for the Democratic nomination for Governor of Arkansas.

title: President Supports Rehabilitation Plan for Historic Pennsylvania Avenue
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8  Richard M. Nixon today be came the third consecutive modern President to display personal support for the re habilitation of Pennsylvania Avenue, the historic thorough fare linking the Capitol and the White House.

title: Atlantic City Results
description: Atlantic City Results

title: Television
description: 7:00 (2, 7)News Report

title: Homer Jones Will Be Receiving
description: Homer Jones, trie mercurial receiver who kept the Giants alive during five of their darkest seasons by catching 34 touchdown passes, returns to Yankee Stadium on Satur day night in the uniform of the Cleveland Browns. Blanton Collier, his coach, said yesterday that Jones would start as a wide re ceiver against the Giants in the fi nal preseason game of the year. The contest will lack the usual revenge mo tif of the traded athlete be cause the phegmatic Homer says he had no feelings when the Giants traded him to the Browns last winter. Rather, Tones needs the game to so lidify his job.

title: Bangor Punta Sued by S.E.C. On Disclosure of Railroad Sale
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission announced yesterday that it had brought suit in the Federal District Court here against the Bangor Punta Corporation, a conglomerate concern, for alleged violation of the securities laws.

title: 2 ExS.D.S. Men Sentenced
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 9 (UPI) Two former members of the Students for a Democratic So ciety were sentenced today to five years probation each for their part in a windowsmash ing rampage through Chicago's Near North Side last October. They were Arthur Hochburg, 21 years old, of Chicago, and Robert Burlingham, 24, of Boston.

title: Taken Aback, $4, First With Late Belmont Run
description: The Hobeau Farm's Taken Aback contributed one of her exciting late rushes to win the feature race at Belmont yester day. The rainyday crowd of 19,822 made the daughter of Carry Back the evenmoney favorite against eight rivals in the mile race, fully aware that she would apparently be away out of it in the early stages.

title: PHILHARMONIC WINS AN OVATION IN TOKYO
description: TOKYO, Sept. 9 (AP)  For the overflow audience that ap plauded nearly 15 minutes for the New York Philharmonic, it was a concert to remember. Leonard Bernstein tossed his baton to the crowd in exulta tion.

title: Television
description: 7:00 (2)News: John Hart, Ber nard Kalb (4)Today: S. J. Perelman, author, Baby.It's Cold Inside (7) (7)News Reports.

title: California Is 120
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Sept. 9 (AP)California celebrated today the 120th anniversary of its admission to the Union.

title: Cultural Center Shows Hitler's Architectural Designs
description: The gyrations of contem porary culture being what they are, it was perhaps in evitable that the most de monic political enemies of modern art would sooner or later be given equal billing with their victims. After all, celebrity is celebritythis is the iron law of modern cul tureand it makes little dif ference if this celebrity is acquired by means of a su preme artistic accomplish ment or the execution of the most extreme crimes against mankind. Our modern curios ity, with its eager appetite for all that is atrocious, is, in this respect, egregiously democratic and unprejudiced.

title: Betsy Lipman, Brndon Reid To Be Married
description: Mr. and Mrs. David Lipman of New York have announced theengagement of their daugh ter, Miss Betsy. Ann Lipman, to Brandon Reid, son of White law Reid of Ophir Farm in Purchase, N. Y., and Mrs. Joan Brandon Reid of New York The announcement was made here last night at a party at the Sign of the Dove restaurant.

title: Clay Will Face Quarry in Atlanta on Oct. 26 in His First Bout Since 1967
description: Cassius Clay, stripped of his world heavyweight boxing title when he refused military in duction in April of 1967, is going back into the ring.

title: Mobile Teams Add 136,282 Voters To the Rolls Here
description: A special mobile summer reeistration drive conducted with vans by the Board of Elec tions has added 136,282 new voters to the election rolls, Commissioner of Elections Maurice J. O'Rourke announced yesterday.

title: DEMOCRATS INVITE DODD TO HEAD TABLE
description: HARTFORD, Sept. 9Sena tor Thomas J. Dodd, a Democrat who bolted his party to seek reelection as an independent, has been invited to sit at the head table at the traditional Democratic party state cam paign kickoff dinner here Sat urday night.

title: Restaurants Getting Close Health Check
description: Many of midManhattan's fanciest restaurants, along with some of the plainest about 750 in allare under going unusually intense in spections by a special corps of Health Department sani tarians.

title: Phillips Exeter Goine Coed
description: EXETER, N. H., Sept. 9 (AP) Phillips Exeter Academy, an exclusively a boys school for 189 years, announced today that 40 girls will be admitted at the opening of school Mon day. The girls, all from New Hampshire, will be day stu dents, whilg the majority of male, students board at the school. In addition five wom en teachers will be added to the staff.

title: soviet Naval Unit in Cuba
description: MIAMI, Sept. 9A Soviet naval squadron arrived this morning in the Cuban port of Cienfuegos, the Havana radio announced. The visit of the squadron, made up of two anti submarine ships, a submarine tender, a supply ship, a hydro graphic vessel, an oiler and a tug, is the second such call this year and third in the last 14 months.

title: Drama: State Theaters
description: LONDON, Sept. 9 Occa sionally, both on Broadway and in London's West End, it is permissible to wonder just how shrewd socalled com mercial managements are. In London most of the enter prise is left to the major subsidized groups, the Royal Shakespeare Company, the National Theater and the Royal Court Theater.

title: Western Union Expands
description: The Western Union Telegraph Company has filed with the Federal Communications Com mission a proposed tariff for a new service, called Datacom, for handling of businesses bulk information  transmission. The tariff, which would go into ef fect Oct. 1, would link 45 large cities across the enlintru

title: and Registering the Voters
description: Who me? I'm not going to vote for nobody with all these dope addicts on the street. I'm not a member of the system. Take up a gun and kill the politician pigs.

title: Margin Put at One Vote In North Dakota Contest
description: BISMARCK, N. D., Sept. 9 (AP)A difference of a sin gle vote appears to have giv en Robert P. McCarney the Republican nomination for United States Representative from North Dakota's Western District.

title: Kuhn's Statement
description: I have granted the request of counsel for Denny McLain for an adjournment cf to day's hearing, which was scheduled to determine whether McLain's recent con duct was consistent with his probationary status.

title: DESERT JET DEADLINE IS EXTENDED; GUERRILLAS HIJACK BRITISH PLANE, RAISING TOTAL OF HOSTAGES TO 300
description: Negotiators working to save the lives of hundreds of hos tages held by Arab hijackers in the Jordanian desert won a last minute extension of their dead line last night.

description: ency Names tions Director

title: BARON LI LJENCRANTS
description: TRENTON, Sept. 9  Baron Johan Liljencrants, a former psychologist at St. Elizabeth's Hospital in Washington, and a former editor of The Swedish American Monthly in News York, died Saturday. He was 84 years old.

title: Two Buyer Regulations Go Into Effect in City
description: Two city consumerprotec tion regulations went into effect yesterday.

title: Kennedys Help Kent State Fund
description: McLEAN, Va., Sept. 9 Joan Kennedy was at Hyan nis Port with the children, but her husband, Senator Ed ward M. Kennedy was host to 1,150 people at their home on Chain Bridge Road for a benefit for the Kent Students Medical Fund, which is to aid the nine Kent State Univer sity students and the 12 Jackson State College students wounded by National Guard fire last snrinn.

title: Lower Manhattan Parking Ban Is Ordered to Ease Congestion
description: Mayor Lindsay yesterday an nounced a ban on parking in 50block area below Fulton Street in an attempt to break lup the Lower Manhattan traffic bottleneck.

title: Miss de Cozen's 74 Leads by 4 Strokes After First Round
description: PELHAM MANOR N. Y., Sept. 9Charlottz de Cozen of Westchester Country Club, a former winner, scored 37, 37 74 at Pelham C. C. in damp weather todayfor a fourstroke lead after the first round of the 41st annual Elizabeth Wheeler Trophy Memorial Tour nament of the Women's Tri County Golf Association.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Activities. The President saw Representative Paul Find ley, Republican of Illinois. He signed a bill to extend through Sept. 7, 1975, the authority to provide aviation war risk insurance. He also approved a bill to authorize the appro priation of $75,000 more to continue operation of the Franklin Delano Roosevelt Commission.

title: A CAMBODIAN FORCE REACHES KEY CITY
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Thursday, Sept. 10 (Reuters) A military spokesman said flotilla of Cambodian boats and troops reached Kompong Thom last night, breaking a three month siege by the Communists of the provincial capital 88 miles north of Pnompenh.

description: Atlantic City Results

title: Woman in Tunnel Delays Service on Penn Central
description: Thousands of railroad com muters were delayed about a half hour last night when serv ice on Penn Central lines at Grand Central Terminal was suspended after a woman ap parently jumped from a pas senger car in a tunnel near 59th Street.

title: Opera: Resplendent Legacy of Boito
description: As in previous seasons, the New York City Opera picked the best of its recent suc cesses to open the season. Last night the 52d New York season got under way (it must be remembered that the City Opera has a fall and spring season, so divide by two for the approximate age of the company). The choice was Boito's Mefistofele, to the evident enjoyment of the ??? house.

description: Box Scores of Wednesday's Major League Baseball Games

title: Japanese Ring Victor
description: TOKYO, Sept. 9 (AP)Kuni aid Shibata, Japanese feather weight champion, won a unan imous decision from, Kim Hy On, the South Korean title holder, in a 10round nontitle bout today.

title: Kenny Will Testify Today In Jersey Crime Inquiry
description: TRENTON, Sept. 9  The statewide grand jury that is investigating organized crime and official corruption in New Jersey is scheduled to hear testimony here tomorrow from John V. Kenny, the Hudson County Democratic leader, and nine other to pHudson Dem ocratic officials.

title: President of M.I.T. Leaves Post And Is Named Board Chairman,
description: Howard W. Johnson, presi dent of the Massachusetts Insti tute of Technology for four years, announced his resigna tion yesterday and urged a re assessment of the M.I.T. gover ning structure.

title: 3 Resignations Announced By Beck Industries,
description: Beck Industries, Inc., yester day announced the resignation of Bertram H. Slater as finan cial vice president and a direc tor and the resignations of Harold K. Ross and John I. Taeni as directors. Beck, parent company of the A. S. Beck shoe chain and owner of varied other merchandise operations, gave no reason for the resignations.

title: BUCKLEY PREDICTS SPLITS ON BALLOTS
description: BUFFALO, Sept. 9James L. Buckley, the Conservative party candidate for the United States Senate, said today that he anticipated all kinds of vote splitting in the Nov. 3 election.

title: Slayings Set Off Tax Scandal in Rome
description: ROME, Sept. 9National and city authorities are investigat ing a tax scandal with political overtones that followed a sen sational murdersuicide drama among Rome's superrich.

title: Beame to Get Plaque
description: The Wall Street division of the B'nai B'rith Youth Services Appeal will present its first award, a plaque, to City Con troller Abraham D. Beame at a dinner Sept. 23 in the Wal dorfAstoria Hotel. Mr. Beame has been active in B'nai B'rith as an officer of the Brooklyn College Hillel Building Fund and a member of the advisory board of the AntiDefamation, League.

title: Fanny May Results Listed for Week
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9The Federal National Mort gage Association said today that interest rates rose slightly in this week's auction.

title: Charts of Races at Belmont
description: 1970, by Triangle Publications, Inc. The Morning Telegraphs Wednesday, Sept. 9. Ninth day. Weather showery, track fast.

title: House Delegate for Capital Wins Approval in Senate
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9 (UPI)  The Senate approved and sent to the White House today a bill to give the District of Columbia's 764,000 citizens a nonvoting delegate in the House of Representatives.

title: 6 U.S. TRANSPORTS WAIT IN TURKEY
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9 The United States ordered six Air Force transport planes to iday to carry medical teams to a base in Turkey for a possible evacuation of the hostages held in Jordan by Palestinian guer rillas.

title: Farrelly Apparent Victor In Virgin Islands Primary
description: ST. THOMAS, V. I., Sept. 9 (AP)In the Democratic party primary for the first elected Governor of the United States Virgin Islands, Senator Alex ander Farrelly appeared to have won today the nomination by a comfortable margin.

title: Mr. Leary's Glass House
description: The inexplicable refusal of New York Police Com missioner Howard R. Leary to offer the public any reason for his decision to resign has unfortunately per mitted wild rumors to flourish, some of them unflatter ing to Mayor Lindsay who accepted the commissioner's resignation with a glowing letter of commendation for services rendered, some of them unflattering to the commissioner himself. The resignation has come just as an independent fiveman investigating body begins sifting reports of widespread police corruption.

title: EARLY POLISH PACT FORESEEN BY BONN
description: BONN, Sept. 9A spokes man for Chancellor Willy Brandt declared today that West Germany foresaw that a treaty with Poland to nor malize relations would be con chided before the end of the year despite substantial diffi culties.

title: Wendy Nathan To Be a Bride
description: EATONTOWN, N. J., Sept. 9Mss Wendy. Ann Nathan; a graduate last May of Bos ton University, plans to be married next June to Wilfred Rolfe Shrigley Jr. of Marble head, Mass., assistant to the president of Great Northern Industries in Boston.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: FRANCE (French), Southampton Sept. 15 and Havre 15; sails 12:30 P.M. from W. 52d St.

title: Black Musician to Be Foreman In the Trial of 13 Panthers Here
description: A 57yearold black musician who lectures at universities on African music and composes symphonic music was sworn in yesterday, afternoon as fore man of the jury to try 13 Black Panthers acused of plot firm to bomb public places.

title: Columbia's New Head Reports University Is $11Million in Red
description: William J. McGill, the new president of Columbia Univer sity, said yesterday that the university was overextended financially and would have to cut administrative and academ ic costs substantially.

title: Holy Cross Loses Tackle
description: WORCESTER, Mass. Sept 9 (AP)Bill Moncevicz of Brock ton, a senior offensive tackle, has been lost to the Holy Cross football team for the season be cause of recurrence of an old head injury, the school reported today,

title: British Football Results
description: British Football Results

title: Theft Attempt Turns Sour
description: ROANOKE, Va. (AP)  The thieves who broke into an ap ple product company here did not find anything worth steal ing. In a sort of sour grapes gesture, they opened valves to the vinegar tanks, draining 6,000 gallons, worth about $2,000.

title: WORLD BANK LOANS OUTSTRIP U.S AID, EXCEED$2BILLION
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9The World Bank reported today that its annual aid to developing countries had passed the $2 billion mark, exceeding the United States foreign aid pro gram.

title: GLAMORS LEAD MARKET DECLINE
description: The stock market, psycho logically buffeted by possible strikes and by jetliner hijack ings, nosed downward yester day. But it was a gentle de scent that saw the largest de clines in recent glamour favorites.

title: Hong Kong Freighter Sinks
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Sept. 9 (AP)A Hong Kong freighter carrying a load of lumber from the Philippines to Taiwan rolled over on her right side, exploded and sank today with in sight of the Taiwan port of Kaohsiung. All 31 crewmen reached shore safely. The 3,716 ton vessel was owned by the Reward Shipping Company of Hong Kong.

title: Thai Students Protest; Premier Meets Demand
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Sept. 9 (AP)  More than 2,000 Thai students stormed into Parliament today and occu pied the chamber until Pre mier Thanom Kittikachorn met with them and agreed to their demands for the sus pension of three top univer sity officials.

description: The Security Pacific National Bank of Los Angeles announced yesterday the election of Rich ard J. Flamson 3d as executive vice president and member of the bank's managing commit tee. He succeeds Norman R. Rehn, who will retire Oct. 31

title: THOMAS J. O'CONNOR, MOBIL OIL AIDE, 691
description: Thomas Joseph O'Connor, re tired financial adviser to the controller of Mobil Oil Company died Monday at ColumbiaPres byterian Medical rcenter, after heart surgery. He was 69 years old and lived at 12 Doris Drive, Scarsdale. N. Y.

title: Scaasi From Mini to Maxi Prices
description: Maybe it was the fringe. Or the low necklines. Or the costumefoolery. Or the in souciant air. Anyway, Ar nold Scaasi's custommade fall fashions, shown yester day at the Plaza Hotel, didn't have the genteel look indige nous these days to clothes with price tags in the thou sands.

title: GIVEAWAYS BACK AT SAYINGS BANKS

The intensity of the advertising, however, is not ex pected to be sogreat as it was last spring.

title: JUDGE SUGGESTS A SUBPOENA CURB
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 9 (AP)Newsmen may have to be given immunity from grand jury subpoenas in times of stress so that lines of com munications can be maintained with militant groups, a Federal judge suggested today.

description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9 (UPI) The Western Union Tele graph Company asked the Fed eral Communications Commis sion today to approve the dos ing of 241 of its offices to cut annual operating costs by $2 million.

description: AMMAN, Jordan, Sept. 9 Living conditions improved a bit today for the airline pas sengers held hostage in the Jor danian desert. But their fellow passengers who had been re leased spent a tense day in hotels in Amman as Jordanian troops and Falestinian comman dos battled around them.

title: Goheen Asserts Princeton Won't Condone Force
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Sept. 9 Robert F. Goheen, the president of Princeton University told freshmen today that although the university was a place for diversity and dissent, it would not condone destructive ac tions or the use of force.

title: U.S. Says jersey Man, 21, Swindled 90 of $750,000
description: A 21yearold New Jersey man was accused yesterday of swindling almost $750,000 by convincing people that he was an investment wizard.

title: A. DEAN DUDLEY
description: SYRACUSE, Sept. 9A Dean Dudley, honorary chairman of the Lincoln National Bank and Trust Company, a division of Lincoln First Banks, Inc., and former president of the Syra cuse Lighting Company (now Niagara Mohawk), died Sun day. His age was 92 and he lived here.

title: GOVERNOR RAISES CAMPAIGN TEMPO
description: HORNELL, N. Y., Sept. 5 Governor Rockefeller, who has been holding his campaign down to a leisurely two days a week, began this week a five  day  a  week stumping schedule. The Governor, who is seeking a fourth term, is re serving a sixth day each week for office work.

title: Strikes by Teachers Are Continuing in Connecticut, Westchester and Upstate:
description: NEW HAVEN, Sept. 9 Teacher strikes continued today in seven of 'onnecticut's 173 school districts with little hope of contract settlement by to morrow morning, when classes were scheduled to begin.

title: Official Arab Views Mixed on Hijackings
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Sept. 9 Official Arab opinion is divided on the hijackings and their con sequences but even persons hostile to the commandos agree that the Arab man in the street highly admires what he regards as the courage, lan and skill of the perpetrators.

title: Market Place
description: Okay, so you're patting yourself on the back that you called the rise in bank stocks, and now you're think ing about locking up those summer rally profits.

title: Church Unit Honors Mayor
description: The Council of Churches of the City of New York an nounced yesterday that it would honor Mayor Lindsay with its annual Family of Man Award. Mr. Lindsay, who will receive the award Oct. 26 at a dinner in the New York Hilton is being recognized, the council said, for a career de voted to the uplifting of his fellow citizens and particularly for his continued efforts to ward solving what has seemed to many the massive problems of the inner city and urban living.

title: Raiders Have Punch
description: HAMILTON, N.Y., Sept. 9 Colgate decided to join the group of college football teams playing 11 games this season and as a result the Red Raiders got a pickup game with Navy at Annapolis for this Saturday. The Middies might just receive a shock from the bunch of Raiders from the quiet little valley in upstate New York.

title: Octopus Gives Birth To Hundreds Here; Startles Aquarium
description: The New York Aquarium's 40pound Pacific octopus has given birth to several hundred wriggling babies, but aquarium officials have been unable to track down the father.

title: SCHOOLS WARNED ON CUTS IN FUNDS
description: Representatives of the newly formed Emergency Citywide Committee for the Public Schools warned yesterday that there would be turmoil in the city schools this year unless additional funds were provided for education.

title: Use of Armed U.S. Guards Expected as F.A.A. Sets Up Task Force on Hijacking
description: The Federal Aviation Ad ministration set up a task force yesterday to work out more stringent measures to prevent the hijacking of airliners.

title: A Correction
description: A Man in the News sketch of Bishop Humberto S. Medeiros that appeared in yesterday's New York Times stated errone ously that the New York Arch diocese of the Roman Catholic Church was the largest in the United States. The Chicago Archdiocese is first, Boston is second and New York is third.,

title: FIRST SUIT IS FILED IN CRASH FATAL TO 7
description: The first suit arising from a bus crash last July 15 along Route 22 near Allentown, Pa., where seven Long Island chil dren lost their lives, was filed yesterday in Federal Court in Brooklyn.

title: Wednesday Baseball
description: Wednesday Baseball

title: Landon Turns 83
description: TOPEKA, Kan., Sept. 9 (AP)  Alf M. Landon turned 83 today. Telegrams from Presi dent Nixon and Vice President Agnew were among the con gratulatory message he re ceived.

title: The Screen: 2 Rated 'R':'Swappers' Shares Bill With 'Venus in Furs'
description: "The Swappers" and "Venus in Furs" are R-rated exploitation films in a double bill that opened yesterday at neighborhood theaters in New York City, on Long Island, in nearby New Jersey and in Westchester. Considering the bland nature of the sexual infusion in these movies, it seems to me that there is less harm in what sin may do to the suburbs than in what the suburbs are doing to sin.Jess Franco's "Venus in Furs," title by Sacher-Masoch, story, alas, by Mr. Franco, concerns Jimmy, a young trumpeter (James Darren), and a beautiful blonde named Wanda (Maria Rohm) who, some years after she has been murdered at an orgy in Istanbul, begins turning up in odd places wearing a fur coat and not much else to seek revenge on the evil three (Margaret Lee, Dennis Price and Klaus Kinski) who did her in.A sexually active ghost, Wanda manages to drive Jimmy wildand away from Rita (Barbara McNair), the black nightclub singer who loves him. Since Jimmy first sees Wanda as a corpse washed up on a beach, his later involvement seems irrational until at the end he discovers another body, notes with some dismay that it is himself, and cries, "Oh my God! It's me! I'm dead! I've been dead all the time." The conclusion does not really clarify the plot, but it will at least reassure the members of the audience as to their own responses.Venus in Furs" features much inept fancy moviemaking (including echoes of "La Dolce Vita" and even "Vertigo"), some semi-nudity, and virtually endless confusion. "The Swappers," on the other hand, features some semi-nudity, no fancy moviemaking, and much literalistic simplicity. It is study (he! he!), illustrated with dramatized vignettes (thus the cast of characters), of the world's No. 1 urban ill: wife swapping.Actually, wife-swapping hasn't always been so poorly thought of in the movies. Only a few months ago, Drs. Eberhard and Phyllis Kronhausen in their epic "Freedom to Love" intimated that it might be a pretty healthy idea. But the eminent psychiatrist, who is master of ceremonies of "The Swappers," doesn't like it. And indeed, prolonged exposure to it seems to lead most of the jaded couples in the film down the primrose path to marital fidelity.Although the eminent psychiatrist is American (there is room, I feel, for a piece on styles in eminent psychiatrists in sex-lecture movies), everybody else in "The Swappers" is British, with a gratifying concern for high-class syntactical regularity typical of much recent film pornography.At a time when serious British cinema seems committed wholly to people who at best will not graduate from public school, or who at worst sound as if they have never gone to school at all, it is comforting to know that in skin flicks there is a last refuge for the accents of Oxford and Cambridge, and for the diction of the B.B.C.

title: A Tradition On Way Out At Contest?
description: Which of the following tra ditions will probably soon be eliminated from the annual Miss America Pageant in At lantic City?

title: 980Pound Tuna Landed
description: NORTH LAKE, Prince Ed ward Island, Sept. 9 (Canadian Press)A 980pound bluefin tuna was landed yesterday in waters off here by Lee Coffin, mate of the vessel Aquarius, after a 60minute battle in rough seas.

title: Nightingale Takes Trophy In Tempest Class Sailing
description: NOROTON, Conn., Sept. 9 Steven Nightingale of the host Noroton Yacht Club won the 22d annual Associate Cham pionship of Long Island Sound for the Jesse A. B. Smith Trophy by 6% points today in a threerace regatta sailed in Tempest Class sloops in a strong southerly wind of 8 to 20 knots.

title: Warning from the IMF
description: In its annual report the International Monetary Fund has sharply criticized the Nixon Administration for its economic policies. The IMF states that the Administration's approach has permitted too much price and cost inflation and has had a more severe impact on unemployment and real output than it ex pected.

title: Woman Unionist Scores Equality Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9A representative of workingclass women told Congress today tha the proposed equal rights amendment to the Constitution would bring to women such as herself only an equality of mis treatment by employers.

title: Yonkers Drivers
Coast Riot Toll at 3
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 9 (AP) A youth injured in an explo sion in the East Los Angeles riot Aug. 29 died today, bring ing the death toll to three. Lynn Ward, 15, years old, whom the police said had tossed a tear gas canister into a burningtrash bin, died in a Los Angeles hospital.

title: Heavy Fighting in Amman; Hussein Orders CeaseFire
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Sept. 9Heavy firing between Pales tinian commandos and Jordanian troops turned Amman into a battlefield today, according to reliable reports from the isolated Jordanian capital.

description: WATERTOWN, N.Y., Sept. 9 (AP)A Jefferson County De deputy sheriff was fatally wounded today while attempt ing to protect a wife from her estranged husband.

title: JOSEPH A. ESTES
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Sept. 9 (UPI)Joseph A. Estes, former editor of the Blood Horse, the thoroughbred breeders maga zine, died today after an illness of several months. He was 68 years old.

title: Confusion Marks Opening Day For the Schools in Mobile, Ala.
description: MOBILE, Ala., Sept. 9  Faced with stiff but peaceful resistance to a new deseg, rega tion plan, the Mobile County school board placed the burden's of the plan's enforcement on, the Federal authorities whom they blame for the confusion that accompanied the opening of school this morning.

title: Doyle Wins Twice and Lifts SingleHanded Sailing Lead
description: NEW HAVEN, Sept. 9  Robbie Doyle of Marblehead, Mass., took a commanding lead today after the seventh and eighth races in the North America singlehanded sailing championship. Doyle won both races today for a total score of 21.4 points on a lowpoint system.

It's there, says old Papillon, showing him the bowl. Not to be believed. There's Papi with a tubeful of money secreted in his lower intestine, getting beaten unconscious without losing a cen time. title: A Dedicated Chef, at Home and at Work
description: MASTIC, L. LOrdinary husbands, Roger Fessaguet was reflecting this week as he lifted a lobster from a steaming kettle, ordinary husbands don't cook. The wife takes care of the cook ing while the husband goes out to sea wth his friends, and when they come back the meal is ready. But when I take my friends out sailing, I come back and I have to start cooking.

title: Phillips Plans Oil Production
description: The Phillips Petroleum Com pany announced yesterday that It has applied to the Norwe gian Government for permis sion to start oil production's from four wells in the Ekofisk area of the North Sea.

description: The board of directors of The New York Times Company de clared yesterday a quarterly dividend of 15 cents a share on the Class A and Class B com mon stock, payable Sept. 28 to stockholders of record Sept. 21. The company has paid 15 cents in each quarter this year.

title: Baron Tries Again With France Against Gretel and Loses Again
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Sept. 9 Baron Bich's bluehulled yacht France was given a decisive defeat today by Gretel II, this time in the rain.

title: Mayor Urges a Revision of the AbandonedBuildings Program to Cut Delays
description: Calling abandoned buildings There symbols of decay, danger and despair, Mayor Lindsay announced yesterday that he had directed a city planning unit to review and revise procedures to accelerate the sealing and demolishing of such structures.

title: Pacific Football Star Out
description: SAN DIEGO, Calif. Sept. (UPI)  Tom Reynolds, who set a major college record with 18 touchdown receptions for the University of Pacific last year, said today he would not play this season because of a knee injury. He is a junior.

title: Little Progress Is Reported In Philadelphia School Talks
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 9 (UPI)Little progress was re ported today as negotiations continued between a teachers union and the board of educa tion in a contract dispute that will delay opening of public schools for 290,000 pupils.

title: Disaster Aid Bill Voted
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9 (UPI) The Senate approved today legislation to consolidate in one law all Federal programs geared to aid areas hit by disasters such as hurricanes; tornadoes and floods. The measure, passed 64 to 0 and sent to the House,

description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9A rationwide railroad strike scheduled for midnight tonight was postponed today for five days after the Government asked four unions to keep talking in hopes of reaching a peaceful wage settlement.

title: LEONE IS ELECTED TO SUCCEED STARK
description: Sebastian Leone, little known outside of Brooklyn Democratic circles, was elected interim Borough President of Brooklyn yesterday at a special session of the 12 Brooklyn City Coun cilmen.

description: LONDON, Sept. 9 UPI)The British pound came to life to day, rising about three quarters of a cent in its best single day's increase in many months.

description: They finally found a way yesterday to stop Mrs. Mar garet Court's inexorable drive toward a tennis grand slam rain.

title: Gas Dumping Ban Sought
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9 (AP) Legislation to prohibit an other dumping of nerve gas in the ocean was introduced to day by Representative Paul G. Rogers, Democrat of Florida. Under the measure, the armed forces would be required to catalog all chemical and biolo gical weapons and provide demilitarization process for all new weapons. It would prohibit the disposal of chemical and biological substances in the ocean.

description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Sept. 9 (UPI)A Cambodian army officer convicted on charges of high treason for helping Com munist forces was executed to day by a firing squad.

description: Mrs. Helene Brandstatter Jacobs, wife of Stanley R. Jacobs, a member of the New York Stock Exchange and a trustee of Eisenhower College, died yesterday in Lenox Hill Hospital after a short illness. She lived at 1130 Park Avenue.

description: The president of the Ameri can Newspaper Publishers As sociation said yesterday that dark days are ahead for many United States newspaper pub lishers if newsprint manufac turers follow the $10atori in crease announced Tuesday by AngloCanadian Pulp and Paper Mills. Ltd.

title: Mucci Paces Qualifiers
description: WOODMERE, L. I., Sept. 9 Pat Mucci of Wayne, N. J., led four sectional qualifiers for places in the United States Golf Association's senior amateur championship today. After 18 holes on the 6,113yard, par 70 Woodmere Country Club course, Mucci, Lloyd Ribner of White Plains, Jim Paul of Del Ray Beach, Fla., and Dr. Milton Maloney of Paramus, N. J., all finished with 77's. Mucci scored a par 4, while the others quali fied with 5's in a playoff. The championship starts Sept. 21 in San Francisco.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: MONTAUK, L. I.  While salmon fishing in Scotland recently I had grown accus tomed to rising at 8 A.M., eating a leisurely breakfast and arriving at my beat on the river at 9:30. But Gerry Ruschmeyer, proprietor of Ruschmeyer's Hotel and Motel, quickly shattered any notions I might have had of performing similarly at Mon tauk.

title: 4 New Diphtheria Cases.
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Sept. 9 (AP)Four new diphtheria cases were confirmed today, raising the year's total to 90, and a third suspected polio case was reported. Two of the new diphtheria victims were a boy, 15 years old, and a man, 28. No details were released on the others. A girl, 5, became the city's third suspected polio

title: INTERPOL WARNING REPORTED SATURDAY
description: BRUSSELS, Sept. 9  In terpol, the international police organization, is reported to have broadcast a warning to all European security services before the hijacking last Sun day of four airliners by Arab terrorists.

title: Secret Files Show Illegal Gifts to Congressmen
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9 (AP)  Secret Justice Department files show that two ship lines gave nearly $6,000 in illegal campaign contributions for key members of Senate and House committees that control a rich flow of Federal subsidies for the lines.

description: Open Interest

description: By combining global obser vations of the manner in which ocean floors are spreading, two American geologists have drawn a series of maps showing how a single continent gradually di vided into the many continents that now exist.

title: Shakespeare, Festival Will Open on Sept. 29
description: On Sept. 29 the New York Shakespeare Festival will open its fourth season at the Public Theater with The Happiness Cage, a drama by Dennis Reardon.

title: Telephoned Threats Close Bridgeport Circuit Court
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., Sept. 9 There were no sessions of, Circuit Court here today as a result of two bomb threats and a threat on the life of a judge.

title: Sports of The Times
description: One of Commissioner Bowie Kuhn's early extrava ganzas was the 1969 AllStar Game in. Washington. There was a Presidential reception, a number of parties and the official start of what seems to have become a wholehearted relationship between baseball and the Administration. Scheduled to start for the American League was Denny McLain of the world champion Detroit Tigers, the Cy Young awardwinner as the game's top pitcher, and most recently winner of 31 games. But the game was rained out, and McLain had a dental ap pointment the next morn ing. Although he flew back and forth between Wash ington and Detroit in his private plane, he was 20 minutes late for the start of the rescheduled game. He pitched only the fourth inning, gave up a run, then jumped back in his plane for a trip to Florida. Al though no public statements were made at the time, it was just the beginning of the entertaining relationship between the unstatle, emo tional, talented young play er and the conservative, imageobsessed lawyer.

title: Customs Sale Draws Crowd
description: Almost 2,000 people crowded into the United States Customs stores and public auction areas at 201 Varick Street yesterday to examine more than 1,700 lots of abandoned, forfeited and un claimed merchandise to be auc tioned by Customs today. The auction will start at 9:30 A.M.

title: Councilman Urges Inquiry on Leary's Resignation
description: A City Council investigation of a possible dispute between Mayor Lindsay and Police Commissioner Howard R. Leary leading to the Commissioner's resignation was formally pro posed yesterday by Council man Matthew 3. Trov Jr.

description: LONDON, Sept. 9It was just a bit of desert that the boys named after me, Sir Walter Dawson said today from his home at Sunning hill, near Windsor.

title: Cocaine Seized on Ship
description: WASHINGTON, Sept 9 (Reu ters) United States, officials seized today more than 13 pounds of cocaine, valued at about $120,001), aboard the Chilean ship Aconagua in Bal timore. The cocaine was found by Customs.and Bureau of Nar cotics and Dangerous Drugs agents. No arrests were made and the investigation was con tinuing.

title: Direct Election at the Top
description: The Senate debate on direct election of Presidents and Vice Presidents recalls once more the bitter sweet mixture of conservatism and liberalism that marked sessions of the Constitutional Convention and produced a basic compact of government founded on compromise. It is a reminder that the long march toward a broader franchise and a more repre sentative government has at least a few steps to go.

title: T.W.A. Flight From Athens Delayed by a Bomb Scare
description: ATHENS, Sept. 9A Trans World Airlines Boeing 707 with 143 passengers aboard was emptied and searched at Athens Airport today after two anony mous telephone calls warned there was a bomb on the New Yorkbound jetliner.

title: Executive Changes

title: In Memorial
description: BERMANSidney. Our beloved brother left us September 10, 1956. His sterling charac ter and devotion always in our memories.

title: Marine Sought in Hijacking
description: SAVANNAH, Ga., Sept. 9 (UPI)  A 21yearold marine absent without leave from his unit at Parris Island, S. C., has been charged with hijacking Delta Air Lines jet to Cuba. A warrant sworn out by the Fed eral Bureau of Investigation, disclosed today, named Gregory Alexander Graves of Kansas City, Mo., as the Man who hi jacked the ChicagotoSavannah flight Aug 20 by saying be had a bomb in his brief case.

title: Goodell Denounces Nixon on Mideast
description: Senator Charles E. Goodell charged yesterday that the Nix on Administration had jeopar dized the Mideast peace talks by closing its eyes to the SovietEgyptian buildup of missiles in the Suez Canal ceasefire zone.

title: CHILEAN RIGHTIST WON'T TAKE OFFICE
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Sept. 9 Jorge Alessandri Rodriguez, the rightist candidate who ran sec ond in Chile's presidential elec tion last week, declared today that he would not accept the presidency if he was offered it when Congress chooses the winner.

title: Defeat of Faubus a Sharp Break With Political Past in Arkansas
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., Sept. 9 I want to change the polit ical climate of Arkansas, Dale L. Bumpers told crowds all summer, and he appeared to have done just that yesterday in a manner that astonished al most everyone.

title: Mrs. Farley and Royal Firrnan Jr. Disclose Wedding Here on July 28
description: PALM BEACH, Fla., Sept. 9 Royal Firman Jr. and his bride, the former Mrs. Joan Loew Farley of New York, are sending out announce ments of their marriage, which took place in New York on July 28. State Supreme Court Justice Theodore R. Kupferman performed the ceremony at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Herbert F. Milley.

title: Brooklyn's President
description: Back in 1950, a young law yer in search of a new suit made it a habit to patronize a particular Brooklyn store.

title: AUTO PACT TALKS EVOKE PESSIMISM
description: DETROIT, Sept, 9  The almost standard phrase Just because we're far apart doesn't mean we can't reach a settle ment without a strike no long er rolls easily off the tongues of the negotiators here.

title: SHIELDS IS SECOND IN RACES ON SOUND
description: LARCHMONT, N.Y., Sept.9  Stuart Rowe Jr., commodore of the Horseshoe Harbor Yacht Club and one of the three rep resentatives of Long Island Sound in the world Internation al OneDesign Class champion ship, won twice today in races that were virtually carbon copies so far as he was con cerned.They were the same in that Rowe led around all three marks of a short course to beat the 14 others involved. They differed at the starts. The 1970 Yacht  Racing Association of Long Island Sound champion in the class (he clinched a suc cessful defense of the title last weekend) got a soso start in the morning and a good one in the afternoon.

title: Dog Owner's Perseverance Is Rewarded
description: The combination of a chest nut mare, Queen's Lady, and her owner, Joan Broughton, was a winning one on the horse show circuit in 1958, the Queen having been one of the top green working hunters in the East. Then her owner married Michael Cam sone and moved to Glens Falls, N.Y.

title: Tuesday Night Fights
description: LONDONJoe Bugner, 215 pounds, England, knocked out Chuck Wepner, 224 Bayonne, N. J., 3 rounds; Basil Sylvester Sterling, 159, England, knocked out Mark Rowe, 157, England, 4.

title: Rev. Loyal L. Adams Dies; Candidate's Father, 89
description: READING, Pa., Sept. 9 (AP) The Rev. Loyal L Adams, whose son, Dr. Paul L. Adams, is Conservative Party candidate for governor of New York, died today in a hospital here. He was 89 years old, and suf fered a fractured hip Saturday at his home in Mertztown, Pa.

title: Addressograph Earnings Down For Fourth Quarter and Year
description: Despite increased sales, earn ings of the Addressograph Multigraph Corporation fell 69.9 per cent in the fourth fiscal quarter and 69.6 per cent in the fiscal year ended: July 31, the manufacturer of duplicating and datawriting equipment re ported yesterday.
