title: Popular Front Most Militant Commando Group
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Sept: 9 The name of the Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine, the most militant of the 10 ma jor Arab commando groups, has become synonymous in re cent months with the hijack ings of international airliners.

title: Lucey's Victory in Wisconsin Governor Primary Leaves Democrats Apparently United
description: MILWAUKEE, Sept. 9 Former Lieut. Gov. Patrick J. Lucey's solid victory over Don ald O. Peterson in yesterday's gubernatorial primary has left Wisconsin's restive Democrats without any visible scars and apparently as unified as they are likely to be.

title: Patterson, Green Pass Physicals for Bout Here
description: Floyd Patterson and Charlie (Devil) Green underwent pre fight physicals yesterday at the Felt Forum for their 10 round heavyweight fight Tuesday night at Madison Square Garden. Dr. A. Harry Kleiman, one of the New York State Athletic Commis sion physicians, found both boxers in excellent shape.

title: Judge Asks for and Gets Armed Guards in Court,
description: HORNELL, N. Y., Sept. 9 (AP)Justice Austin W. Erwin Jr. of; the State Supreme Court has asked for and received pro tection of armed guards in court sessions here, but de clined today to say why.

title: DR. MANUEL BARKAN, ART EDUCATOR, 57
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Sept. 9 Dr. Manuel Barkan, department chairman and professor of art education at Ohio State Univer sity, died today. He was 571 years old.

title: PHILIDOR'S DEFENSE
description: PHILIDOR'S DEFENSE

title: East Side May Get Six New Theaters
description: Five or six new motion picture houses and a legiti mate theater may be built on one East Side block owned by Joseph E. Levine, a major film producer and president of Avco Embassy Pictures.

title: Newsweek Chief Editor Named Vice Chairman
description: Osborn Elliott, editor in chief of Newsweek magazine, has also been named vice chairman of Newsweek, Inc.

title: SPACE CUTS FOUND GROUNDING PILOTS
description: HOUSTON, Sept. 9 (UPI) Donald K. Slayton, the former astronaut who is now chief of flight operations, said today that the nation had a lot of space pilots with no place to go because of budget cutbacks.

title: NIXON'S HELP HELD ESSENTIAL TO WIN DIRECTVOTE RULE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9 Backers of the proposal to substitute direct popular elec tion of the President for the Electoral College have con cluded that the plan cannot pass the Senate without inter vention by President Nixon.

title: FRENCH INCREASE SCHOOL SPENDING
description: PARIS, Sept. 9The Cabinet approved the national budget for 1971 today with higher spending on education than on defense for the first time in French history. This was seen as further evidence of the em phasis the French have given to domestic problems since the workerstudent riots in May and June, 1968.

title: Amex Stocks Mixed in Active Trading
description: The American Stock Exchange ended mixed yesterday in ac tive trading after an afternoon rally erased most of the earlier losses.

title: PHILLIES LOSE, 31, AFTER 32 VICTORY
description: The happy shout, We're No. 1, echoed through soggy Shea Stadium last night a trifle prematurely as the New York Mets tied for the lead hi Na tional League East by splitting a doubleheader with the Phila delphia Phillies.

title: Bridge
description: Players who always bid what they've got sometimes miss opportunities. It is some times safe to bid what you have not gotif the previous bidding has made it clear that you cannot have it.

title: P.&L.E., PENNSY UNIT, WILL PAY A DIVIDEND
description: The Pittsburgh & Lake Erie Railroad, a 93 per centowned subsidiary of the Penn Central Transportation Company, yes terday declared a $1:50 dividend on the capital stock payable, Oct. 15, to holders of record Sent. 25.

title: City Plan Commission Approves Modular Housing for Brooklyn
description: The City Planning Commis sion approved a firstofits kind housing program yester day involving the erection of 27 largely prefabricated apart ment buildings on scattered sites in the BedfordStuyvesant and Brownsville sections of Brooklyn.

title: Gimbels Takes On the Look of Spain
description: Gimbels, which last year concentrated on Italy as a focus for the introduction of new fashions and furnish ings, has switched this year to Snain.

title: Cambodian Aide Says War Has Turned Against Foe
description: PNOMPENH. Cambodia, Sept. 9  At the sports field in the center of town today, Cambo dian soldiers filled an old bus with mortar shells just arrived by way of Vietnam from the Army Ammo Depot, Milan, Tenn. A few feet away, recruits were running around pretending they had guns.

title: Cuba Gets Heavy Rains
description: MIAMI, Sept. 9 (AP)  A tropical depression formed in the northwest Caribbean today, and dumped heavy rains over much of Cuba. The National Hurricane Center said that conditions favored intensifica tion and warned all interests in the northwestern Caribbean and southern Gulf to be alert.

title: Girl Guerrilla Hid Grenades
description: TEL AVIV, Sept. 9 (AP) The Israeli state radio said to day that Leila Khaled, the 24 yearold guerrilla captured Sunday after an unsuccessful at tempt to hijack an Israeli jetliner, apparently boarded the plane with two hand grenades hidden in her brassiere.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Article 1  No Title

title: 'Mefistofele' Is Opener Of City Opera's Season
description: At Lincoln Center last night, a bunch of kids standing to gether in a tight group had their eyes glued on a television set, but they were not watch ing Where's Huddles? They were backstage at the New York State Theater where the New York City Opera was per forming Boito's Mefistofele, but they were not watching that either.

title: MacNeil Named Assistant
description: MONTREAL, Sept. 9 (AP) Al MacNeil, 35yearold coach, of the American Hockey League's Montreal Voyageurs last season, was appointed assistant coach of the Montreal Canadians today.

title: U.S. LEADING GROUP IN CHESS OLYMPIAD
description: SIEGEN, West Germany, Sept. 9  The United States chess team swept all boards, 4 to 0, in its fourthround pre liminary match with Mexico in the 19th Chess Olympiad at Siegerland Hall here today.

title: fmproventent Is Found in Consamer Attitudes in Michigan Survey
description: A positive improvement in consumer attitudes, the first in more Than a year, has been found by the University of Michigan's survey research cen ter. The center's indey of con sumer sentiment rose to 77.1 Per cent of normal in the third quarter from a low point of 75.4 per cent in the second quarter.

title: Chess:
description: The recent death of Samuel Reichman is a great loss to the metropolitan chess world: With his passing, the last link between East Side coffeehouse chess and the general New York chess scene has vanished. For more than 25 years Reich man made the New York Chess and Checker Club on 42d Street his headquarters.

title: $3Million Jewelry Theft
description: BOSTON, Sept. 9 (AP)More than $3million in gold and, jewelry was taken in a breakin over the Labor Day weekend at Shreve Crump & Low Com pany, it was reported today. The police said that the thieves had entered an adjacent cloth ing store and used power tools to break through an 18inch masonry wall to the second floor office of the company president; Richard Shreve.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The Arab guerrillas holding hundreds of hostages in the Jordanian desert granted lastminute extension yesterday to their deadline for an agreement releasing other guerrillas held prisoner in several nations. [Page 1, Columns 58.]

title: Sports Today
description: Mets vs. Philadelphia Phillies, at Shea Stadium, Roosevelt Ave nue and 126th Street, Flushing Meadow, Queens, 2 P.M. (Tele visionChannel 9, 2 P.M.) (Ra dioWJRZ, WNBCFM, 2 P.M.)

title: Crippled Jet Lands Safely
description: DETROIT, Sept. 9. (UPI) An American Airlines two engine jet with 70 persons aboard landed safely at the Detroit Metropolitan Airport today, after having blown a tire on takeoff. A spokesman said that Flight 564, from Detroit to Hartford, blew the tire on takeoff shortly after 6 P.M. The jet circled the airport for about 30 minutes to use up fuel before returning to land.

title: REPORT ON SMUT HELD UP BY COURT
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9 A Federal District Court judge issued a temporary order today to restrain the Commission on Obscenity and Pornography from publishing its final report, which details the extent and effects of smut across the na tion and recommends actions to cope with it.

title: Roundup: Pirates, Cubs Lose, Pitchers Off Mark
description: The Mets have to be wild about Joe Gibbon, Fred Cam bria, Randy Hundley and Ken Holtzman. After all, those Pirates and Cubs certainly were wild enough yesterday to merit the Mets affection.

title: More Aid Awaited for the New Havenl
description: Federal officials agreed yes terday to consider making an emergency grant to New York, and Connecticut to help the states meet a $25million de ficit in their program to take over and modernize the Penni Central's New Haven commu terservice.

title: TIMES GUILD CHIEFS ASK STRIKE POWER
description: Leaders of The New York Times unit of the Newspaper Guild adopted a resolution yesterday calling on its mem bers to authorize a strike against The Times. The full membership of the Times unit is to vote at a meeting on Sept. 24.

title: Extradition Delay Sought For Accused in Tate Case
description: WASHINGTON, Sept 9 (AP) Lawyers fig Charles Denton Watson appealed to Supreme Court Justioe Hugo L. Black today for More time to press their contention that he cannot receive a fair trial in California in the Sharon Tate murders.

title: U.S. Switches to a Debtor Status With Foreign Banks
description: The United States switched from a creditor to a debtor status in its dealings with for eign central banks during the last six months, the Federal Reserve System reported yes terday.

title: Mrs. Charles F. Wolff, 85, Had Leads in Early Films
description: MATAWAN, N. J., Sept. 9 (AP)Mrs. Laura S. Wolff, who as Laura Sawyer took leading roles in early movies, died in the Emory Manor Nurs ing Home here Monday. She was 85 years old, the widow of Charles Frederick Wolff. She moved here two years ago from St. Petersburg, Fla.

title: Cabs Will Get Locked Strongboxes Within 30 Days
description: Within 30 days, 7,000 fleetowned taxicabs in the city will have strongboxes bolted to the floors of their cabs in an effort to thrwart holdups, an industry spokes man said yesterday.

title: Fire Kills Queens Man
description: A 70yearold boarder in a Bayside, Queens, home was killed early yesterday morning as fire swept the secondfloor rear bedroom in which he was sleeping. The police tentatively identified the man as Jack Weir of 3516 216th Street.

title: Outlook at a Glance
description: PROSPECTSA winning season despite longer and more im pressive schedule.

title: Money
description: Money

title: Radio
description: Radio

title: SENATE PANEL BACKS JOB SAFETY MEASURE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9 The Senate Labor Subcommit tee approved a job safety bill today that would give the Sec retary of Labor broad authority to set industrywide safety standards and to enforce corn pliance.

title: Saudis Report Cholera Cases
description: JIDDA, Saudi Arabia, Sept. 9 (Reuters)The Saudi Health Ministry today announced that some cholera cases had been diagnosed in the eastern city of Hofuf. It urged anyone not yet innoculated to get a shot immediately.

title: Priest Heads Church Group to Improve East Side
description: Cardinal Cooke said yesterday that one of his priests had been detached from his regular parish duties to become a full time battler of bureaucracy.

title: U.N. Council Demands Release of All Persons Who Have Been Seized in Air Travel
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Sept. 9The Security Council called unanimously today for the immediate release of all passengers and crews held as a international travel. result of hijackings and other international travel

title: Impact of White Boycott Unclear as Charlotte Schools Begin Busing Program
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C., Sept. 9  The largest public school system in the Carolinas took its first hesitant step toward complete desegregation today under a Federal Court busing order that the Nixon Adminis tration and most community leaders here have repeatedly opposed.

title: Clemente Goes to San Juan
description: Roberto Clemente, the star right fielder of the Pittsburgh Pirates and the National League's leading hitter, left for San. Juan, P. R., yesterday to consult his personal physician about a back Injury that put him out of action Friday night. He was expected to rejoin the Pirates in Chicago on Saturday, but it was not known when he would be able to play again.

title: Carswell's Loss Blocks Kirk's Bid for Party Control
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Sept. 9The gamble by Gov. Claude R. Kirk Jr. to take un challenged control of the Re publican party in Florida lay in ruins today along with the brief political career of G. Harrold Carswell.

title: Mets Box Scores
description: Mets Box Scores

title: No Clues Turned Up In Kennedy Crash; Recorder Is Found
description: Federal investigators said yesterday they had no clues yet to explain why a Trans International Airlines DC8 jet liner crashed at Kennedy In ternational Airport on Tuesday shortly making a strange, steep takeoff maneuver. All 11 per sons on the plane were killed.

title: New Bond Issues
description: New Bond Issues

title: Brooklyn, C.C.N.Y. Nines St. John's Tourney Victors
description: St. John's University's cen tennial baseball tournament started yesterday in Queens with Brooklyn College defeat ing C. W. Post, 30, and City College beating St. Francis, 82. The game between St. John's and Manhattan was canceled because of rain.

title: WHEAT ADMICES ON EXPORT HOPES
description: Reports of substantial wheat exports sent futures prices of that commodity up yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade with all contracts scoring sea sonal highs.

title: Senator Calls for Ouster Of Radicals by Colleges
description: WASHINGTON Sept. 9 (AP)  Senator Robert C. Byrd, Democrat of West Vir ginia, said today that colleges should oust radical professors and students and then adopt policies to keep them out.

title: Racial Marriage Curbs Opposed in Poll
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Sept. 9 Views on interracial marriage have undergone a dramatic change in the last five years, with a clear majority of people surveyed nationwide, 56 per cent, now disapproving of laws, that prohibit marriage between whites and blacks, the Gallup Poll reported today.

title: KY REITERATES PLAN FOR A VISIT TO U.S.
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 9In the latest episode of a controversy that is fasci nating and amusing the South Vietnamese, Vice President Nguyen Cao Ky today reiterated his intention to visit the United States next month despite some official American and South Vietnamese efforts to discour age him.

title: Police and Coast Indians Clash Over Fishing Rights
description: TACOMA, Wash., Sept. 9 (AP)Gunfire broke out today as a group of Tacoma police men and other law enforcement officers closed in on Indians along the Puyallup River in an attempt to clear it of fishing nets. The legality of the nets used by the Puyallup Indians is in dispute.

title: Ethics Hearing Delayed
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9 (AP) A House ethics committee hearing on lobbying practices in Congress was postponed to day to early October. The hear ing was to have begun to morrow, but Representative Melvin Price, Democrat of Illinois, said that witness rep resenting several unnamed or ganizations had asked for more time to prepare their testimony.

title: Sergeant in Songmy Case Says Westmoreland Must Take Blame
description: FORT McPHERSON, Ga., Sept. 9 (UPI)  A sergeant involved in the alleged Songmy (massacre charged Gen. William C, Westmoreland today with dereliction of duty and said that the general, now the Ar my Chief of Staff, must shoul der the blame for whatever happened in the Vietnamese vil lage.

title: Grace Huffman Makes a Debut In Mount Kisco
description: MOUNT KISCO N. Y., Sept. 9Mss Grace Huffman was presented this evening to 130 guests at a dinner dance given, by her mother, Mrs. Grace Ewing Huffman, on the terrace of their home here They were joined on the receiving line under a white and gold marquee by the debutante's six sisters and brother.

title: Tax on Lead in Gasoline Called a Key to Clean Air
description: WASHINGTON,. Sept. 9 Administration witnesses testi fied today that a proposed tax on the lead in gasoline was an essential step toward clean er air.

title: Football Transactions
description: Football Transactions

title: Derailment in Danbury
description: Danbury, Conn., Sept. 9 (UPI) Two freight cars on a New Haven division train of the Penn Central derailed near Li berty Street in Danbury early today, disrupting service on the onetrack commuter line for more than two hours.

title: Boycott Needed
description: The continuing ordeal of an augmented company of international air travelers held captive on the Jordanian desert by Palestinian desperadoes is the savage consequence of the failure of the community of nations to have acted decisively long ago on the crime of aerial hijacking.

title: Mets Records
description: Mets Records

title: PATMAN ASKS CHASE TO CUT PRIME RATE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9 (AP) The chairman of the House Banking Committee, Represen tative Wright Patman, said to day that the nation's major banks raised their prime lend ing rate after President Nixon's election for their own profit taking.

title: Rochester Families Pray for Hostages
description: ROCHESTER, N. Y., Sept. 9 On Lake Meadow Drive in the Rochester suburb of Greece there is a mustard yellow house with a swing in the back and three bicycles in front. A plas ter crucifix hangs inside the door.

title: POLICE ENJOINED ON FORCED LINEUP
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 9  Federal District Judge Harold K. Wood enjoined the Philadel phia Police Department today from compelling citizens to par ticipate in police lineups.

title: Soviet Says Egypt Has the Right To Shift Missiles in Truce Zone
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 9The So viet Union said today that the United States had been in formed that although the Egyptians had not introduced any Soviet missiles into the Suez Canal zone since the ceasefire began, they had the full right to redeploy mis siles already there.

title: EUROPEANS PUSH REGIONAL PLANS
description: BONN, Sept. 9Alarmed by increased crowding, land hun ger and traffic density, Cab inet ministers of 17 Western European countries and ob servers from three more met here today to consider methods of coordinating their regional planning efforts.

title: Birth Control Pills Now Carry Warning on Their Side Effects
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9 (UPI)  As of today, birth con trol pills  used by 8.5 million women  now come with 150word package insert that warns of the drugs side effects.

title: AGNEW TO START ON STUMP TODAY
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9 Vice President Agnew will set out tomorrow in pursuit of an objective that the White House is said to regard as unlikely a Republican majority in the Senate.

title: Major League Baseball
description: Philadelphia 3, New York 2 (1st, twi.).

title: The Assets and Liabilities of Banks Reporting Weekly to the Federal Reserve System
description: The Assets and Liabilities of Banks Reporting Weekly to the Federal Reserve System

title: WALL St SEEKING ES. TAX BENEFITS
description: The president of the Asso ciation of Stock Exchange Firms predicted yesterday that 50 more brokerage firms would disappear in the next six months and estimated that the securities industry was losing money faster today than during the Depression.

title: AN ELEGANT WAY TO SERVE WHOLE LOBSTERS IN THE SHELL
description: First stick a paring knife between the eyes of the cooked lobsters and hang them head side down to let the water drain out. Do not tear off either the lobster claws or tail.

title: Red Cross Aide Far From Bland
description: GENEVA, Sept. 9  The 45 yearold Swiss who has been trying to beat the deadline for ransoming the hostages held by the Palestinian guerrillas is per haps the most flamboyant and controversial figure in the staid history of the Red Cross.

title: YOUTHS OPEN PARLEY OF CONSERVATIVES
description: HARTFORD, Sept. 9 (UPI) Young Americans for Free dom which calls itself the na tions largest conservative youth organization, opened a fourday convention at the Uni versity of Hartford today to celebrate its 10th anniversary.

title: Outlook at a Glance
description: PROSPECTSThe Bruins will be rugged as usual, talented and experienced, but a lack of depth or injuries could impose a se vere burden.

title: DECISION REACHED IN 3HOUR MEETING
description: The suspension of Denny McLain, the controversial De troit Tigers pitcher, was re instated for an indefinite pe riod, including at least the rest of the season, by Bowie Kuhn, commissioner of baseball, yes teday.

title: Business Records
description: Business Records

title: Nijinsky to Run in St. Leger on Saturday
description: LONDON, Sept. 9 (AP) Nijinsky, the Ainericanowned, Canadianbred, unbeaten: 3 yearold, will put his super horse status on the line Satur daY in the English St. Leger.

title: WELLO, DOLLY! CUTS LONGESTRUN CAKE
description: Hello; Dolly! edged past My Fair Lady yesterday as the longestrunning musical in Broadway show history.

title: Soviet Cheers First Output of Fiats by Big Car Plant
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 9 (AP) The first Soviet Fiats have rolled off the assembly line at the huge new plant in the new Volga River town of Togliatti, Pravda reported to day.

title: Though Still Polluted, Jamaica Bay Is Reviving
description: Jamaica Bay is the only environmental success story in New York City so far, Dr. Rene Dubos, the Rocke feller University biologist, said yesterday as he stood in the gray drizzle and ate oys ters from the half shell at the bay's wildlife refuge.

title: Bruins Are Seasoned
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Sept. 9 The talenthunt begun by Len Jardine at Brown University four years ago is expected to come to full fruition on the gridiron this fall.

title: China Plans To Convene Legislature
description: HONG KONG, Sept. 10 Communist China announcec preparations today for an earls meeting of the National Peo ple's Congress, the country's legislature It last met more than five and a half years ago A meeting was proposed in a communiqu of a plenary session of the Central Commit tee of the Chinese Communist party, held from Aug. 23 to Sept. 6. The communiqu was transmitted abroad by Hsinhua, the Chinese press agency.

title: Mrs. Daphne MacLaury Bride Of Dr. Edgar A. Riley, Internist
description: Mrs. Daphne Nowed Mac Laury and Dr. Edgar Alsop Riley, an internist and pul monary spedialist at Cornell. University Medical College, were, martie'd yesterday after noon in, the. Dana Chapel of the Madison Avenue Presby terian Church by the Rev. William McQuoid. A reception was given at the Colony Club.

title: CARTERGAINS LEAD IN GEORGIA RACE
description: ATLANTA, Thursday, Sept. 10 Jimmy Carter, a colorful for mer State Senator who veered to the right in the final days of his campaign, built a command ing lead over eight challengers this morning in Georgia's Gu bernatorial primary.

title: Basel Bank's $30Million Loss Attributed to Its Cocoa Trading
description: PARIS, Sept. 9  Auditors examining the books of a Basel bank that reported a $30mi lion loss last year have dis closed that some of the dif ficulties arose from trading in highly volatile cocoa futures the bank's American manage ment disclosed today.

title: Bernstein Rites Tomorrow
description: WHITE PLAINS, Sept. 9A memorial service for Daniel J. Bernstein, formerly a member of the New York Stock Ex change, a trustee of Antioch College and a founder of the Africa Fund, will be held at 8 PM Friday at the West chester Ethical Society, Saxon wood Road. Mr. Bernstein died Aug. 20 in White Plains Hospi tal. He was 51 years old and lived at 385 Fort Hill Road, Scarsdale, N. Y.

title: 2 Concerns Join in Study Of IronOre Pellet Plant
description: The Bethlehem Steel Corpo ration and Pickands Mather & Co said yesterday they had commissioned a study that might lead to the building of a major complex to produce iron ore pellets at Hibbings, Minn.

title: Thieu Said to Plan Strengthened Voice For Local Councils
description: SAIGON. South Vietnam, Sept. 9President Nguyen Van Thieu briefed and entertained 537 elected city and provincial councilmen today and said he planned to give them a larger share in local government.

title: STATE INQUIRY SET ON TWO INSURERS
description: The Great American Insur ance Company and the Con stellation Reinsurance Corpora tion, a subsidiary, were charged here yesterday with violating the investment and holding company provisions of the New York Insurance Law.

title: Dividends Announced
description: Dividends Announced

title: Jersey Recount Is Urged
description: TRENTON, Sept. 9 (UPI) Senator Joseph J. Maraziti, the chairman of the. State Senate Committee on Institutions and Welfare, today requested an extensive recount of New Jer sey by the United States Bu reau ofthe Census. The Morris County Republican called the mailback system responsible for a number of errors.

title: B.O.A.C. JET JOINS OTHERS IN JORDAN
description: LONDON, Sept. 9  Arab guerrillas seized a London bound British jetliner with 117 people aboard today and land ed it on a desert strip in Jor dan near two other hijacked jets.

title: Apartment Strike, Affecting 160,000 Tenants, Is Threatened Today
description: Apartment Strike, Affecting 160,000 Tenants, Is Threatened Today

title: Court to Get Request for Aguirre Condemnation
description: Governor Luis Feud of Puerto Rico declared in a tele phone interview yesterday from San Juan that the Government would go into court within the next 48 hours to make an offi cial request for the condemna tion of vast sugar properties in that island owned by the Aguirre Company.

title: TV: Guests Are Best at Carol Channings Tea Party
description: Sir John Gielgud and Sir Ralph Richardson would nor mally seem to qualify as rather sturdy supporting players, but to be on the safe side Carol Channing and the National Broadcasting Com pany also engaged Fred Mac Murray and Art Carney for her taped London outing called Carol Channing's Mad English Tea Party. The precaution, known in the trade as midAtlantic casting, proved quite unnec essary last night as the pro gram, seen from 9 to 10 P.M., was a Lower Thames deriva tive of LaughIn. The two titled London residents pro vided what surcease there was from the American tour ist.

title: PARTIES ARE WARY IN NEW HAMPSHIRE
description: CONCORD, N. H., Sept. 9 Gov. Walter R. Peterson, a moderate Republican, has turned back a strong conserva tive bid to unseat him in his party's gubernatorial primary.

title: 3 Nations Assure Israel on Hostages
description: JERUSALEM, Sept. 9Brit ish, Swiss and West German diplomats assured Israel today that their governments were in sisting that all airline passen gers held hostage by Arab guer rillasand not just their own nationalsbe released in a bloc, the Israeli Foreign Min istry said today.

title: Blues Sign Berenson
description: ST. LOUIS, Sept. 9 (UPI) Red Berenson, the star center, signed his contract today with the hockey St. Louis Blues.

title: Msgr. Timothy F. Herlihy, ExChaplain on Intrepid
description: Msgr. Timothy F. Herlihy, pastor of St. Joseph's Church at Waverly Place and Avenue of the Americas, died of can cer yesterday at St. Vincent's Hospital. He was 62 years old and lived at 371 Avenue of the Americas.

title: Portland Cement Seeks Mangurian's
description: The General Portland Cement Company, one of the nation's largest producers of cement and concrete products, an nounced yesterday that it plans to enter the home furnishings field. The company said it has agreed in principle to acquire Mangurian's, Inc., a Fort Lau derdale. Fla home furnishings retailer. Under the agreement, Man gurian sharehold ers would receive two shares of Portland's com mon stock for each three of Mangurian's common held.

title: South Vietnamese General Predicts Enemy Offensive
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 9 (AP)A senior allied commander said today that a North Vietnamese force equal to five divisions was poised for a thrust against the popu lated coastal lowlands in South Vietnam's northern provinces.

title: Columbia Holds Scrimmage
description: LAKESIDE, Conn., Sept. 9 Columbia's offensive unit was limited to one touchdown to day during the team's second major intersquad scrimmage, held in a steady rainfall at Co lumbia's preseason training camp here.

title: Bid of $3Million for Elizabeth Appears Likely to Be Accepted
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Sept. 9A bid of $3.2million from C. Y. Tung of Hong Kong and Taipei for the former Cunard liner Queen Elizabeth, appeared tonight to be the most likely to be accepted. The ship has been moored here since the end of 1968 as an unsuccessful tourist attrac tion.

title: Goldberg Denounces Rockefeller as Snide in Refusal to Debate
description: ALBANY, Sept. 9  Gover nor Rockefeller's admonition to Arthur J. Goldberg that he be come sufficiently briefed on the issues was denounced by Mr. Goldberg today as a snide and evasive refusal to debate.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: I fear that your wellmeaning but ambivalent Aug. 31 editorial Sound Motive, Dubious Meth od helped doom the needed HatfieldMcGovern amendment. You are correct in quickly dis missing the Vice President's charges that its sponsors are pacifist, isolationist, and defeatist. Yet you leave un answered the more serious charge that passage of the amendment might have inad vertently prolonged the war by removing any incentive for Hanoi to negotiate. I also fail to see the value of a ceasefire in Southeast Asia, in view of the difficulties experienced in the Middle East.

title: U.S. COURT WEIGHS A TOTAL DDT BAN
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9The United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia heard final arguments by con servationists today on a move to force the Secretary of Ag riculture to ban all uses of DDT.

title: Hickel Says Charge He Tried to Defame Udall Is Ridiculous
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9 (AP)  The Secretary of the Inte rior, Walter J. Hickel, said to day that a charge that he had tried to destroy the reputation of his predecessor, Stewart L. Udall was ridiculous.

title: Rain Postpones Golf
description: PURCHASE, N. Y., Sept. 9 The Westchester sectional qualifying round for the Metro politan. Golf Association's an nual open championship was postponed by rain today.

title: STOCKS IN LONDON ADVANCE QUIETLY
description: The London stock market closed firmer yesterday In quiet trading.

title: INTEREST RATES OF BONDS CLIMB
description: Interest rates moved upward decisively yesterday as a heavy volume of new bond issues was marketed to raise funds for corporations and local govern ments.

title: The Casts
description: The Casts

title: Yonkers Results
description: Yonkers Results

title: Nixon on Charity Program
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9 (UPI)  President Nixon and his daughter Tricia appeared on na tionwide radio and television to night to appeal for funds for the United Way of America. The President, in a prerecorded statement, praised the charita ble drive. He was introduced on the United Fund Appeal by his daughter.

title: Couple Plead Guilty In Starvation Death Of 7MonthOld Son
description: A 27yearold woman, Who was taken from her parents when she was a year old and placed in a foster home be cause she was a neglected child, pleaded guilty with her husband yesterday in the Bronx to criminally negligent homicide in the starvation death of one of their four children.

title: Weekend Recipes
description: Spiced ground beef casserole* Corn on the cob Mixed green salad Sherbet with crme de menthe SPICED GROUND BEEF CASSEROLE

title: Radio
description: Radio

title: ONE RAIL UNION SETS A STRIKE DEADLINE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10 (UPI)  Four unions resumed con tract talks with the nation's railroads today after postpon ing a scheduled strike, but one of them set another strike dead line in two weeks over a sep arate issue.

title: W. H. O. Indicates Both Iran and Iraq Have Cases of Cholera Despite. Their Silence
description: GENEVA, Sept 10  The World Health Organization strongly hinted today that Iran and Iraq had cases of cholera.

title: Nearby Golf Results
description: Nearby Golf Results

title: Agnew Asks Workers to Vote G.O.P.
description: CASPER, Wyo., Sept. 10 Vice President Agnew, appeal ing to the workingmen of the country to give President Nixon a Republican Congress, lashed out today at the Demo crats as radical liberals.

title: America's Cup Losers Go Oat for a Final Sail
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Sept. 10 Two unsuccessful America's Cup contenders, France and Valiant, and Chancegger, the French yacht's trial horse, sailed together for two hours today, first on a long wind ward leg that lasted an hour and then reaching and run ning.

title: U.S. DEFENSE AIDES IN GREECE FOR TALKS
description: ATHENS, Sept. 10G. War ren Nutter, the United States Defense Department's assistant secretary for international se curity affairs, arrived here to day from Turkeywith a large party of military and civilian aides for talks with Premier George Papadopoulos and other leaders.

title: The Impotence of Power
description: The supreme irony of this age of power is its impotence to deal with determined or fanatical minorities. Mr. Jeffer son, who had very little mili tary power, could deal effec tively with the Barbary pirates early in the nineteenth century, but Mr. Nixon, who has apoca lyptic power, cannot handle the Arab pirates without risking the lives of the Americans he wants to rescue.

title: R. H. Saunders 3d of Bowdoin Is Fiance of Barbara Williams
description: DEERFIELD, Mass., Sept. 10Mr. and Mrs. Arthur S. Williams Jr. have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Barbara Fox Williams, to Richard Henry Saunders 3d. He is the son of Dr. and Mrs. Saunders Jr. of Grafton.

title: Thant Criticizes the Israelis for Holding Two Algerians Seized From an Airliner
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Sept. 10  Secretary General Thant criticized Israel today for having ignored two ap peals he had made for the re lease of two Algerian officials arrested during a stopover at Lydda Airport Aug. 14.

title: Witness Says He Saw Manson With Gun Like Murder Weapon
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 10A bearded man, wearing a sweat shirt and blue jeans, told a jury today that he had once seen Charles M. Manson carrying a .22caliber pistol similar to the one that the police have said was used in the murders of Sharon Tate, the actress, and four other persons.

title: Roundup:Walker Shutout Lets Pirates Stay Even
description: The Pittsburgh pitching staff is a much maligned group of players, very often deservedly so.

title: Major League Baseball
description: YESTERDAY'S GAMES

title: Stamford Teachers Vote To Resume Work Today
description: STAMFORD. Conn., Sept 10 (AP)  Teachers here agreed today to return to work tomor row in the first major break through in teacher? strikes that had been disrupting normal classroom operations in eight Connecticut communities.

title: Met to Gain On Sept. 25
description: The performance of Gluck's Orfeo ed Euridice at the Metropolitan Opera on Sept. 25 will raise money for the company's production fund. The benefit was arranged by the Metropolitan Opera Guild, which stilt has tickets from $10 to $50 available at its office at 1865 Broadway.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Award. President Nixon awarded the Presidential Unit Citation for extraordi nary heroism to the Eighth Tactical Bombardment Squad ron of the Air Force. The award was made in connec tion with operations against the enemy in Southeast Asia from Nov. 15, 1968, to May 31, 1969.

title: Political Scientists Parley Is Challenged by Revolt
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 10 Blacks, Chicanos, women and advocates of a new political science were in revolt this week as the American Political Science Association held its annual meeting here at the Bilt more Hotel.

title: Bronx Marine Killed in War
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10 (UPI) The Defense Department to day listed Cpl. Guillermo Valle of the Marines, from The Bronx, as having been killed in Indo china.

title: Public Health Sanctions Imposed by 16 States
description: Sixteen states have for mally designated mercury pollution a hazard to public health by actions ranging from banning of fishing in certain waters to cautioning the public about eating ques tionable fish or game birds too frequently. In some cases initial stringent restrictions have been reduced.

title: HIT OFF HOERNER. SENDS AGEE HOME
description: Deprived of victory in regu lation time by an umpire's judgment on a possible home run, the New York Mets held first place in the National League East yesterday by hanging on until a triple by Cleon Jones in the 14th inning gave them a 32 decision over the Philadelphia Phillies.

title: Boating Outlook
description: The United States Weather Bureau issued this forecast at 6:30 P.M. yesterday for New York Harbor, Long Is land Sound, Long Island south shore and nearby coastal waters:

title: Shoemaker Scores Triple
description: DEL MAR, Calif., Sept. 10 (AP)Bill Shoemaker regis tered a riding triple today to lift his record total to 6,039. Shoemaker won on Rocky Mound ($7.20) in the first, Chain and Mace ($4.60) in the sixth and Snow Man ($9.60) in the ninth.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Article 1  No Title

title: Hatfield May Rule Out ReElection Bid in 72
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10 (AP)Senator Mark O. Hat field, Republican of Oregon, said today that, for family and economic reasons, he might not seek reelection in 1972.

title: Blood Emergency Is Declared Ended After 8 Days Here
description: The city's bloodshortage emergency, which lasted for eight days, was officially de clared to be over yesterday with the city's blood reserves finally back at an acceptable level.

title: Press Agency in Soviet Gets New Chief
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 10Novosti, the Soviet Union's press and information agency, announce4 today the retirement of Bo:is S. Burkov, who guided the agency since Its formation in 1961 into one of the world's largest operations of its kind. Mr. Burkov, 62 years old will be replaced by Ivan I Udaltsov, 52, a historian and party official.

title: MYRON ARMS WICK, REPUBLIC STEEL AIDE
description: Myron Arms Wick, retired vice president in charge of fi nance and a former director of the Republic Steel Corporation, died Monday in BadenBaden, Germany, while on a visit. He was 87 years old and lived at 655 Park Avenue.

title: GOODELL INSPECTS HIJACK BARRIERS
description: Senator Charles Charles L. Goodell toured Kennedy International Airport yesterday and inspect ed weapondetection devices used by Pan American World Airways.

title: Mrs. Meir Indicates Israel Won't Free Guerrillas
description: JERUSALEM, Sept. 10  Premier Golda Meir strongly indicated today that Israel had no intention of releasing any of the Arab guerrilla prisoners now held captive.

title: British. Petroleum Profit Down 48.3% for the Second Quarter
description: Earnings of the British Pe troleum Company in this year's second quarter fell 48.3 per cent, bringing the sixmonth profit 30.5 per cent below the yearearlier level, the company reported in London yesterday. The sharp drop in the face of higher sales reflected the rise in tanker rates to the highest levels in history.

title: Thursday Baseball
description: Thursday Baseball

title: Aide for Aged Named
description: ALBANY, Sept. 10 (AP) Gustave L. Levy, a Manhattan financier, was named today by Governor Rockefeller to be chairman of the New York Committee for the 1971 White House Conference on the Aging. Mr. Levy is a partner in the in vestment firm of Goldman, Sachs & Co.

title: Football Transactions
description: Football Transactions

title: The Theater: Risky Atlantic Crossings
description: LONDON, Sept. 10This is the time of the year when Broadway and West End pro ducers are flying backward and forward like swallows or even larger birds. The one thought in their nobly avian minds is whether this Broad way hit might prove too American for London audi ences, or that West End hit too English for the Ameri cans.

title: VIGNETTES ENHANCE NEWMAN SONG STYLE
description: Randy. Newman is a young song writer from Los Angeles, and rather special.

title: Sirhan TearGassed In Cell After Having A Temper Tantrum
description: SAN QUENTIN, Calif., Sept. 10 (AP)Sirhan B. Sirhan, con victed of assassinating Senator Robert F. Kennedy, was given a mild teargassing by guards after throwing a temper tan trum in his cell on San Quen tin Prison's Death Row, Warden Louis S. Nelson said today.

title: JOHNSON CAMPAIGNS FOR SENATE HOPEFUL
description: HOUSTON, Sept. 10 (UPI) Former President Lyndon B. Johnson campaigned tonight for a Texas candidate for the Senate, but said he did not have any unpleasant words for the Republican party.

title: Concrete Honeycomb Dedicated at N.Y.U.
description: A $10.5million engineer ing building that looks like a wellfortified honeycomb was dedicated yesterday on New York University's Bronx campus.

title: LeadPoisoning Tests Scheduled in Brooklyn
description: The City Health Depart ment will conduct leadpoi soning tests on children from the Park Slope section of Brooklyn next Sunday.

title: Open Interest
description: Thursday, Sept. 10, 1970

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: To the Editor: The rapid decline in New York City's population, report ed in an Aug. 22 news story, is not news. Population de cline in New York City has been going on, according to a pre dictable and regular pattern, for sixty years or more.

title: Ingrid Matsner Is Married Here
description: Miss Ingrid Digby Matsner, an editor at Harcourt Brace Jovanovich, Inc., was mar ried here yesterday afternoon to Arthur William Einstein Jr., a partner in the New York advertising firm of Lord, Geller, Federico & Partners.

title: Books of The Times
description: What we have here are two survival manualsfor the soldier and for the citi zenand the memoirs of one survivor. GI RIGHTS AND ARMY JUSTICE: The Draftee's Guide to Military Life and Law. By Robert S. Rivkin. 383 pages. Grove Press. Hard cover, $8.50, paperback, $1.75.

title: Manhattan Without Cars?
description: Plans for doing something meaningful about auto mobile traffic in Manhattan have remained like the automobiles themselves, parked at the curb and ignored for too long. The result of perennial inaction has been impossible traffic conditions in the city's streets and contamination of the air to the point of danger.

title: New Figures in South's Politics
description: ATLANTA, Sept. 10V. O. Xey, the eminent, political sci entist, concluded 25 years ago that Southern politics was es sentially a politics of personali ty, conducted within narrow ideological boundaries. That judgment, challenged in recent years by Republican advocates of a Southern strategy, ap pears to have been borne out by this week's primary elections in Flori da, Georgia and Arkansas. If there was one thread that ran through the voting patterns in the three states, it was the elec torate's receptiveness to new faces and styles of political be havior. The voters were apa thetic, with turnouts as small as 25 per cent in some pre cincts. But those who went to the polls seemed bent on over turning the old order.

title: Scotland's. Nationalists Are Planning To IncreasePressures on London
description: EDINBURGH, Scotland, Sept. 8In cellars and small shops the young men and women write pamphlets through the night to send to towns in the highlands and villages along the barren northern coast.

title: Officer Is Elevated by Chemical Bank
description: Donald C. Platten, executive vice president of the Chemical Bank, was elected yesterday as first vice president, a new posi tion, making him heirapparent to William S. Renchard as chair man of the $10.3billion in stitution.

title: Phil Jackson Ready to Work Out As Knicks Rookie Camp Opens
description: Phil Jackson bent over and touched his toes with ease straightened up and smiled.

title: Bolin Sold to Red Sox
description: BOSTON, Sept. 10 (AP)The Boston Red Sox announced to day the acquisition of a pitch er, Bob Bolin, from the Mil waukee Brewers in exchange for cash and a minor leaguer to be named later. Bolin, righthander, has a 511 won lost record with a 5.10 earned run average.

title: Canadian Bill Rate Falls
description: OTTAWA, Sept. 10 (Canadian Press)The Government of Can ada auctioned $150million in 91day Treasury bills today at an average price of 98.653 and an average yield of 5.48 per cent. The price was 98.645 and the yield 5.51 per cent last week.

title: Aguirre Action Filed
description: SAN JUAN, Puerto Rico, Sept. 10 (AP)The Puerto Ri can government filed a court action today to expropriate the central Aguirre sugar mill and deposited $1.1.6million with the court as the estimated value of the Aguirre Company's holdings.

title: President's Post Is Vacant At Restaurant Associates
description: Joseph H. Baum, 50 years old, a founder of Restaurant As sociates, Inc., in the early 1950's, is no longer president of Restaurant Associates Indus tries, as the company is now known, it was learned yester day. He will continue as a con sultant to the operator of the chain, including such well known establishments as Char ley O's, the Four Seasons and Mamma Leone's, according to Martin Brody, chairman of the board.

title: JAPANESE SEEKING U.S. NUCLEAR DATA
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10 The Japanese defeiise chief has asked the United States to lift the secrecy surrounding the production of enriched uranium enough to enable Japan and other countries to build a plant to produce fuel for the genera tion of electric power. The United States now supplies such fuel to Japan.

title: BOOKS OUT AND IN AT JACKSON, MISS.
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10 The Jackson, Miss., public school system has withdrawn 800 textbooks it had trans ferred to a new segregation academy, apparently averting the loss of a $1.3million Fed eral grant for easing desegrega tion.

title: Sports Today
description: Mets vs. St. Louis Cardinals, at Shea Stadium, Roosevelt Avenue and 126th Street, Flushing Mead ow, Queens, 8 P.M. (Television Channel 9, 8 P.M.) (Radio WJRZ, WNBCFM, 8 P.M.)

title: Jaycees Bear U.S. Flag
description: ELMIRA, N. Y., Sept. 10 (UPI)Members of the Elmira Chapter of the Junior Chamber of Commerce began a walk around the state today, carry ing a United States flag. The flag will be passed among walk ers from a total of 80 Jaycee chapters on its trip around the state before its return here by Columbus Day.

title: France of Bygone Days Caught in Photographs
description: There is nothing primitive about the 250 photographs in French Primitive Photogra phy, a new exhibition at the Pierpont Morgan Library, 29 East 36th Street, except from a strictly technical point of view having to do with the types of lenses, sensitized emulsions, and the like, that were in use between 1820 and 1865, the limiting dates of the show.

title: DoubleBarreled Labor Crisis
description: Two major industrial disputes, each with potentially explosive implications for the economy, are heading toward the showdown stage at midnight Monday. One could shut down all the nation's railroads; the other could halt production at either General Motors or Chrysler and perhaps at both.

title: Dr. Samuel Shenkman, 62, Dies; Neurosurgeon at Hospitals Here
description: Dr. Samuel Shenkman, for mer chief of neurosurgery at Harlem and Sydenham Hospi tals, died Wednesday night in Norwalk (Conn.) Hospital. He was 62 years old and lived at 870 United Nations Plaza and in Weston, Conn. His office was at 135 East 83d Street.

title: Virginia Scott Becomes Bride
description: ROWAYTON, Conn., Sept. 10  Miss Virginia Wilmer Scott and John Charles Dev lin Jr. of New Canaan were married this afternoon in the garden of the bride's parents home by the Rev. Donald Emig, pastor of the United Church of Rowayton.

title: Senate Votes Pay Increase For 850,000 U.S.Workers
description: WASHINGON, Sept. 10 (UPI)The Senate approved pay rise today for 850,000 blue collar Government workers.

title: Abrams Scores GarbageMound idea
description: Bronx Borough President Robert Abrams yesterday as sailed the idea of having a 2,500foot mountain of com pacted garbage in Pelham Bay Park swampland as an unthink able Matterhorn of muck.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Article 2  No Title

title: School Busing Put to Queens Test
description: A community school board in Queens is resisting pressures, from authorities at the Board of Education to make room in its junior high schools for 64 black and Puerto Rican students from Brooklyn. The local board's stand is a test of the new decentralization law and its impact on school integra tion.

title: PANTHER DEFENSE BARS BLACK JUROR
description: Defense lawyers exercised their first peremptory chal lenge yesterday to keep a Vir giniaborn black man, 52year old Ulysses Dane, off, the jury that will try 13 Black Panthers accused of plotting to bomb public places.

title: SHADOW BROOK 2D IN $17,850 EVENT
description: Wustenchef of the Augustin Stable won the $17,850 Rouge Dragon Hurdle Handicap, the feature on the card at Belmont Park yesterday. Carrying 143 pounds under Michael O'Brien, Wustenchef took the 21,4mile contest by nine, lengths over Stephen Clark's Shadow Brook, with Allison Stern's Hippo campo next in the field of eight.

title: Market Summary
description: Thursday. Sept. 10. 1970

title: ROCHE ALSO GAINS SEMIFINAL ROUND
description: Sudden death trapped Ar thur Ashe yesterday in the United States Open tennis championship, but Cliff Richey rolled on as the tournament were being played on a clay court.

title: Federal Reserve Relaxes Its Credit Policy Further
description: The Federal Reserve Sys tem's credit policy eased further in the last two weeks, banking data published yesterday showed.

title: NEW YORK CLEARING HOUSE STATEMENT
description: WEEK ENDING SEPT. 9. 1970

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY

title: EAST'S TITLE EYED BY WEST VIRGINIA
description: MORGANTOWN, W. Va., Sept. 10West Virginia is an added starter this year in the race for the Lanibert Trophy, the award that signifies the out standing major college football team in the East. The Moun taineers rejoined their Eastern playfellows after spending more than two decades as a member of the Southern bloc.

title: Weekend Fishing and Boating
description: AREA A  Fair to mid dling is the report along the Jersey coast, with the catch es of blues, weakfish and bass along the beach seem ing to improve the farther north you go. John Falkiew icz called the surf picture fair at Surf City, with the bay area a bit better. Snap pers, some weakfish and fluke were biting at the south end of the bay, he said, although the big story was crabbing, which was very, very good.

title: KUHN AUTHORIZES PLANS FOR SERIES
description: Six major league clubs were authorized yesterday to print World Series tickets by base ball Commissioner Bowie. Kuhn.

title: RADICALS ON CAMPUS SCORED AT MEETING
description: HARTFORD, Sept. 10 (UPI) Former Texas Attorney General Waggoner Can urged members of Young Americans for Free dom yesterday to take the of fensive against campus radi cals and tell them to hit the books or hit the road.

title: Court Orders Rise In Relief Payments For Upstate Areas
description: New York State has been ordered by a Federal judge to grant an estimated total of $11 million annually in additional benefits for upstate welfare families.

title: A HOTEL COMPLEX TO RISE IN ALBANY
description: ALBANY, Sept. 10  Gov ernor Rockefeller announced to day plans for the demolition of the vacant Ten Eyck Hotel and buildings on three adjacent blocks in downtown Albany to make way for a new hotel office buildinggarage complex and for a new bus terminal.

title: HOME LOAN BOARD SETS NEW METHOD
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10 (UPI)  The Federal Home Loan Bank Board today announced a new mortgage purchase procedure intended to stabilize interest rates and increase the available funds for home loans.

title: CITY ACTS TO TEST LEGALITY OF WAR
description: After two hours of heated de bate, during which 36 City Councilmen professed opposi tion to the war in Vietnam, the Council adopted a resolution, 324, directing the Corporation Counsel to test the constitu tionally of the war in behalf of any New Yorker ordered to combat duty in Southeast Asia.

title: Passengers on T.W.A. Jet
description: Following, as issued by Trans World Airlines, is a revised list of passengers aboard its jetliner hijacked to Amman, Jordan, on Sunday. Asterisk indicates that a pas senger has previously been identified as one of the hostages moved from the plane to a hotel in Amman.

title: 2d Bank in Michigan Is Sold By Parsons Group in 2 Days
description: DETROIT, Sept. 10The fur ther dissolution of the group of banks led by Donald H. Parsons, who resigned a month ago as chairman of the Bank of the Commonwealth here, was dis closed today.

title: TURKEY REBUFFS U.S. ON OPIUM POPPY BAN
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Sept. 10 Turkey has decided to refuse to ban the cultivation of opium poppies despite appeals during the last three years from the United States, Turkish officials said today.

title: AMOS BATES FOY, EXBANK OFFICER
description: Amos Bates Foy, an interna tional banker, died Wednesday in New York. Hospital after a short illness. He was 74 years old and lived in Montvale, N. J. He was a regular winter visitor to Sarasota, Fla.

title: $7MILLION GIVEN TO ARTS BY STATE
description: ALBANY, Sept. 10Gover nor Rockefeller today announced the awarding of grants of more than $7million to 134 cultural organizations throughout the state.

title: Israel Viewed as Key To Deal on Hostages
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10As now perceived by an anxious and frustrated government here, the negotiations for the release of about 300 hijacked airline passengers from the desert in Jordan hinge on the willingness of Israel to pay some kind of ransom to her enemies.

title: Primary Loser to Aid Rival
description: CONCORD, N. H., Sept. 10 (AP)Melglrim Thomson, who lost to Gov. Walter Peterson in Tuesday's Republican primary, said today that he would cam rnign for Mr. Peterson in the gene al election, but added that he infended to run for Governor again in two years.

title: TRANSPORT NOTES: PACTS ON RAIL LINK
description: The Metropolitan Transpor tation Authority yesterday re tained two engineering con cerns to draw final design plans for extending the Long Island Railroad to Kennedy Interna tional Airport.

title: Petroit Police Head Wins Praise
description: DETROIT, Sept. 10 Police Commissioner Patrick V. Mur phy had three main goals when he took the job here last De cember: to bring more police men out on the beat, to improve relations with the black com munity and to make the top administration of the depart ment more efficient.

title: Swiss Arrest Four In Inquiry Into Loss By Coast Bank Unit
description: GENEVA, Sept. 10  Four persons have been arrested by Swiss authorites in connection with the investigation of the $30million loss incurred by the Swiss subsidiary of the United California Bank, Los Angeles.

title: City Bank to Pay 4% Interest On 71 Christmas Club Accounts
description: The First National City Bank announced yesterday that it planned to pay interest of 4 per cent to members of its Christmas Club for 1971. It be came the first of the major commercial banks in New York City to break with a long no interest tradition for such ac counts. However, some of the area's 45 savings bank do pay interest on such accounts.

title: Mets Records
description: Mets Records

title: City Unit Managing 1,000 Old Buildings Struck in Pay Fight
description: Management and clerical em ployes in about 1,000 apart ment buildings that are slated for demolition went on strike yesterday morning in all bor oughs of the city except Rich mond.

title: Books of The Times
description: Here is a charmer: a 19thcentury book in a 20thcentury world. It will beguile an hour of your time and put you in tune with mankind. It will do more. It will provide an emollient for the spirit and a sheath for the exposed nerve. And it will restore your vanishing faith that something can be done against the encroachments of the com puterized society. Everyone whose hu manity has been reduced to a hole in punch card will cherish this 20year ex change between an American woman of unlimited (and unfettered) exuberance and a London bookselling firm of sustained reserve and impeccable manners.

title: SENATE UNIT EASES POLLUTION DEADLINE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10 (AP) A Senate committee agreed to changes in a pending air pollu tion control bill that could re sult in a oneyear suspension of a proposed 1975 leadline for the production of nonpol luting automobiles.

title: G.M. OVERSEAS UNIT REALIGNS OFFICERS
description: The overseas operations divi sion of the General Motors Cor poration announced yesterday a major realignment of executive responsibilities.

title: Japanese Defense Chief
description: TOKYO, Sept. 10During World War II a young lieu tenant in the Imperial Japa nese Navy was given com mand over a 3,000man construction crew and told to go islandhopping across the southwestern Pacific, build ing airfields as he went.Yasuhiro Nakasone, now Minister in charge of defense in the Cabinet of Premier Eisaku Sato, looks back on that experi ence as a crash course in the art of handling people. Among the rough, tough crew were tattooed gangsters and for mer convicts so that their leader, a recent graduate of Tokyo Imperial University, an elite institution, had to learn fast how to get them to do what he wanted.

title: SCIENCE FASHION CALLED HARMFUL
description: FONTANA, Wis., Sept. 10 (AP)A LatinAmerican scien tist attacked scientific fash ion today and said it often resulted in the wdong kind of research in underdeveloped countries.

title: Jordan a Minefield for Hussein Because of Commando Clashes
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10 Two months ago King Hussein observed that the situation in Jordan was like a minefield. More than 10 Palestinian com mando organizations were op erating in his countryall bent on destroying the state of Israel and some bent on chang ing the government of Jordan.

title: Major League Box Scores
description: Major League Box Scores

title: Publication Date Changed On ShortInterest Reports
description: The New York and the Amer ican Stock Exchanges yesterday announced a change in the pub lication date of the monthly re ports on short interest.

title: Heather MacRae Arrested
description: MIAMI, Sept. 10 (AP) Heather MacRae, the 23year old daughter of Gordon and Sheila MacRae, was arrested here yesterday and charged with disorderly conduct. Miss MacRae, who is a star of the road show of Hair, was ar rested with seven other cast members in an incident the po lice said stemmed from a con frontation with plainclothes of ficers. The policemen had been watching two narcotics sus pects in a park where the group was gathered, the police said.

title: Building Crane Crumples
description: A crane operating on the 34th floor of the 54  story Standard Oil Company (New Jersey) Building at 50th Street and the Avenue of the Ameri cas crumpled yesterday. No in juries were reported.

title: Buckley Hailed in Goodell's Home City
description: JAMESTOWN, N. Y., Sept. 10James L. Buckley pion pro longed applause here today When, invading the home city of Senator Charles E. Goodell, Wham he seeks to unseat, he asked for election as a sup porter of Nixon Administration policies.

title: Color It Red
description: Red flags have been known to enrage bulls. They also have been known to pro duce wrathful indignation among toprank ing tennis players. But when a red flag suddenly sprouts atop an umpire's stilted chair during the United States Open tennis championships at the West Side Tennis Club in Forest Hills, the fans come running in joyous anticipation.

title: 8 Designers Pat Each Other on the Back
description: Eight American designers perused each other's work the other night at Bonwit Teller and found it good. Oscar de la Renta thought everybody's clothes looked absolutely marvelous, Paul ine Trigere said, It keeps you on your toes to see such fab ulous competition, Bill Blass was impressed with everybody's gaiety and vivac ity, Adele Simp son liked the qual ity of the fabrics. Both Donald Brooks and Chester Weinberg commend ed Victor Joris's designs (he happened to be standing near by when they were asked), and Mr. ions returned the compliment.

title: Town house Rises Overnight On Rather Improbable Site
description: Everything about this ad vertisement could be true, but there is a catch. The townhouse's address is 945 Madison Avenue, at 75th Street, which happens to be the site of the Whitney Museum of American Art.

title: 5 SHOW VICTORIES SCORED BY JENKINS
description: STONY BROOK, L. I., Sept. 10Rod Jenkins, who returned to the ring last week after a fourweek vacation, dominated the opening session of the North Shore Horse Show today by riding the winners of five classes. The show, first of the two major Long Island fall events, is being held at the Old Field Club and will end Sunday.

title: Airline Hijacking Insurance Rates May Soar
description: The airline industry faced the strong possibility yesterday that the cost of insurance cov erage against damage caused by politicallymotivated hi jackers might go up by as much as 100 per cent or be come completely unavailable.

title: 62 Players in Rangers Camp Preparing for Longest Season
description: KITCHENER, Ont., Sept. 10 Still wearing their summer tans, the New York Rangers opened training camp today for their longest National Hockey League season.

title: SPECIAL BUS LANE BACKED IN JERSEY
description: Tests of an exclusive bus lane to speed 35,000 New Jer sey, bus commuters to work in Manhattan each day were authorized yesterday by the TriState Transportation Com mission.

title: Nonaligned Parley Ends; Liberation Groups Backed
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, Sept. 10 The conference of the heads of state of nonaliened nations ended today after adopting resolutions supporting the Pales tine liberation movement and similar movements in South east Asia and southern Africa. The conference also called for the economic liberation of de veloping nations from the big powers. President Kenneth D. Kaun da of Zambia closed the three day conference with the an nouncement that the 54 nation: meeting here had achieved an unquestionable identity of views despite basic differ ences.

title: All Finds Crown Fits and Wears It
description: Semantics complicated the return of Muhammad Ali to boxing yesterday.

title: Deaths
description: Deaths

title: Yonkers Entries
description: Yonkers Entries

title: True Shifted in Account Conflict
description: The Lorillard Corporation is moving True cigarettes from Foote, Cone & Belding to Lennen & Newell because F.C.&B. has Kent and the new management doesn't want brands in the same competitive category in the same agency.

title: HIGH CAIRO OFFICIAL CRITICIZES HIJACKING
description: CAIRO, Sept. 10A high of ficial source here, reflecting Government opinion, criticized today the hijacking of airliners.

title: Nederlanders Acquire National Theater
description: The Nederlander family of Detroit, which has emerged as the first new theatrical empire since the Shubert family establisbed its domi nance in the 1920's, has ac quired the historic National Theater in Washington.

title: Restyled Toronado Highlights 1971 Oldsmobiles
description: ROYAL OAK, Mich., Sept. 10The Oldsmobile Division of General Motors displayed its 1971 models at a news preview today. They include a drastically restyled front wheel drive Toronado and a modest revamping of the rest of the 28model line.

title: Yonkers Drivers
Call to Congressman
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10 Over a faltering telephone line from Amman, Jordan, a 17yearold Long Island girl told Representative Ogden R. Reid today that she and two companions on the Trans World airliner hijacked by Arab guerrillas were safe and were being well treated.

title: U.A.W. CHIEF HINTS G.M. WANTS STRIKE
description: DETROIT, Sept. 10Leonard Woodcock, the president of the United Automobile Workers, said today that one automobile company had decided to take strike rather than make a con tract offer that could lead to settlement. He left little doubt that the company was General Motors. When asked at a news confer ence in the G.M. building which company had made that deci sion, he replied, You wouldn't have to reach far to touch their property.

title: Treasury Statement
description: Treasury Statement

title: Bad Day for Nonsense
description: Old demagogues like old prizefighters keep coming back for more. When Orval Faubus retired in 1966 after six terms as Governor of Arkansas, most Americans were more than content to see and hear the last of him, but there was no way of telling for certain whether his fellow Arkansans shared that view. On Tuesday evening he found out that they do.

title: William Findley Plans to Marry Miss Beneventi
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., Sept. 10 Dr. and Mrs. Francis Anthony Beneventi have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Lucinda Lockwood Beneventi, to Wil liam Robert Findley, son of Mr. and Mrs. Floyd R. Findley of Toledo, Ohio.

title: Exchange Affirms Its Support Of Bills on Investor Protection
description: The New York Stock Exchange reaffirmed yesterday its support of the investorprotection legislation that is now pending in Congress. In an unusual action taken in response to what the exchange called misleading reports, the board of governors formally passed a resolution endorsing the bills that would provide for a securities investor pro tection corporation to be used in case of brokeragehouse failures.

title: SOUTHERN ROADS TO SEEK RATE RISE
description: The Southern railroads of the country have decided to ask the Interstate Commerce Commission for an interim gen eral freight rate increase of 6 per cent, to become effective. Nov. 18 and to expire next Feb. 28.

title: Chicago Broker Suspended By the S.E.C. for 30 Days
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10 (AP) The Securities and Exchange Commission suspended today the brokerdealer registration of Richard L. Kamen, a Chicago stockbroker, for 30 days begin ning next Monday.

title: Goldberg Promises a New Labor Law
description: BUFFALO, Sept. 10Arthur J. Goldberg, the Democratic gubernatorial candidate, told state employes here today that if he was elected, the Taylor Law will be replaced by a law that mandates genuine col lective bargaining for govern ment employes.

title: ROWE KEEPS LEAD IN TITLE SAILING
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., Sept. 10Stuart B. Rowe Jr. of the Horseshoe Harbor Yacht Club of Larchmont, who won twice yesterday to take the series lead, pulled up from last place to 10th in today's second race, the fifth of the regatta, to re tain first place in the Interna tional OneDesign Class world championship.

title: Dow CHEMICAL SETS PRICE RISE
description: New tags were an nounced yestdrday fora variety of widely used chemicals. Most of the changes were upward.

title: Woolworth Set to Open Its Largest Store
description: BOSTON, Sept. 10  The F. W. Woolworth Company, the originator of the 5and 10cent store, will come, full circle here tomorrow. It will open its largest and poten tially most profitable store in downtown Boston, where the retail giants are already jos tling one another on major traffic arteries. Woolworth's nationwide chain has about 5,000 stores.

title: Judge Urges High Court To Rule on War's Legality
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 10 United States District Judge William T. Sweigert issued to day a memorandum decision urging the Supreme Court to rule on the legality of the Viet nam war.

title: Peter Gaillard to Wed Miss Cynthia Dudley
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10 Mr. and Mrs Robert Whittier Dudley have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Cynthia Copello Dudley, an 11th generation descendant of Gov. Thomas Dudley of the Massachusetts Bay Colony, to Peter Stanton Gaillard, a greatgrandson of the late Col. David duBose Gaillard, U.S.A., the engineer for whom the Gaillard Cut in the Panama Canal is named. The prospective bridegroom is the son of Mr. and Mrs. David duBose Gaillard 2d. Both families live here.

title: Melendez Knocks Out Ortiz In 6th Round at Sunnyside
description: David Melendez knocked out Ricky Ortiz last night in 1:22 of the sixth round of their scheduled 10round welter weight bout at Sunnyside Gar den, Sunnyside, Queens. Melen dez dropped his rival with a left hook to the chin.

title: MONETARY RESERVES UP IN WEST GERMANY
description: FRANKFURT, West Germany Sept. 10 (Reuters)  West Germany's monetary reserves rose by 630million marks to 37.719billion marks in the week ended Sept. 7, the central bank said today.

title: Son of Dr. Fiedler Charged In 2d Marijuana Incident
description: BUFFALO, Thursday, Sept. 10 (AP)Michael Fiedler, the 22yearold son of Dr. Leslie Fiedler, has been ordered to ap pear today before a suburban town justice on charges of possessing a dangerous drug.

title: In Memoriam
description: KRAFCHICKSamuel and Rose. In loving memory of dear parents and grandparents, on your first Yaherzelt. NATHAN and SHIRLEY KOPMAN and Grandchildren.

title: Rozelle Tells Halos Not to Play Hunch, Good Cause or Not
description: Commissioner Pete Rozelle turned down with regrets yesterday a wagering scheme of George Halas, the 75year old president of the Chicago Bears, that could have con tributed $3million to charity. For the coming National Football League season, the Bears are listed in Las Vegas as 2001 to win the Central Divi sion title in com petition with the Detroit Lions, the Minnesota Vik ings and the Green Bay Packers.

title: RACE CLASH ERUPTS AT MOBILE SCHOOL
description: MOBILE, Ala., Sept. 10 (AP)  A pushing, shirt  pulling brawl erupted today between groups of white and Negro youths in the Murphy High School campus.

title: $3.2MILLION WINS LINER ELIZABETH
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Sept. 10 (Reuters)A Chinese millionaire, C. Y. Tung, flew out of here today after buying the former transAtlantic liner Queen Elizabeth for $3.2mil lion.

title: WHEAT FUTURES DECLINE IN PRICE
description: Heavy profit taking sent prices of wheat futures down yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade. The loss was offset somewhat, however, by good commercial support, generated by large export sales.

title: 2 IN HOUSE FAVOR 50 DETENTION ACT
description: WASHINGTON, Sept 10 (AP)Support by the Nixon Administration for repeal of the Emergency Detention Act was criticized today by two mem bers of the House Internal Se curity. Committee.

title: sREASON IS URGED ON SEX EQUALITY
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10  A University of Chicago law professor urged Congress to day to make clear, if it insists on passing an equal rights amendment to the Constitution, that some legal distinctions could still be made between men and women if they were based on reason.

title: JAPANESE OFFER A TRADE PACKAGE
description: TOKYO, Sept. 10 (Reuters) Japan today offered a package of trade and economic conces sions designed to offset criti cism from its main trading partners and its economic aid clients.

title: While Jordan Burns
description: There is an Arabic saying: He who warms himself at a fire should know that it burns. Arabs who continue to warm themselves at the fire of Palestinian extremism should know that they are fanning conflagration that could consume their best hope for peace with justice in this generation.

title: FOOTBALL TONIGHT
description: Home teams listed first

title: Bomb Call Empties Offices
description: ROCKVILLE, Md., Sept. 10 (AP)  Weather Bureau and Census Bureau facilities here were briefly evacuated today after a telephoned bomb threat was received.

title: Summary of Lawsuits On Mercury Discharge
description: AlabamaDiamond Sham rock Corporation, Muscle Shoals; discharge reduced; trial date pending.

title: Big Cable Blows, Dimming the Lights In MidManhattan
description: Lights flickered and some electric motors stalled momen tarilrin parts of midtown Man hattan just after noon yester day in a brief, but hardly comparable, replay of some of the City's more serious power crises earlier this summer.

title: Baptist Leader Asks Separatism On Basis of Character, Not Race
description: NEW ORLEANS, Sept. 10 The Rev. Dr. Joseph H. Jack son, spiritual leader of more than 6 million black church goers and the chief spokesman for Negro conservatism, said to day that he favored polariza tionbut only on the basis of character, not color.

title: Dr. Arthur L. Swift Jr. Is Dead; Former Dean at New School, .78
description: The Rev. Dr. Arthur Lessner Swift Jr., a leader in church community work here for many years, died yesterday in Red lands, Calif, where he lived. He was 78 years old.

title: SENATORS AGREE ON 5WEEK DRIVE TO CLOSE SESSION
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10 Senators of both parties infor mally agreed today on an im posing work schedule for the next five weeks that could per mit them to adjourn for the political campaign by midOc tober.

title: ORIOLES TRIUMPH OVER YANKEES, 21
description: BALTIMORE, Sept. 10 Beaten by the Yankees a lit tle more than a week ago in his effort to achieve a 10game winning streak, Dave McNally got some measure of revenge tonight.

title: 3 of Chicago 7 Lose Plea
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 10 (UPI) Three defendants in the Chicago Seven riot conspiracy trial have been refused permission by the courts to travel to Algiers to seek the possible release of American prisoners of war. They are Tom Hayden, Rennie Davis and John Froines.

title: Swissair Sets Up Link to Passengers
description: A New York man sent a message to his boss from the Intercontinental Hotel in Am man, Jordan. It read: Sorry. Unable to be at work Monday morning. Delayed by hijack ing.

title: The. Proceedings In, the U.N. Today
News Summary and Index
description: The Middle East The United States, Britain, West Germany, Switzerland and Israel rejected as unac ceptable last night the unspecified demands of the Arab guerrillas holding three plane loads of hostages in the Jordanian desert. The five nations, acting through the Inter national Committee of the Red Cross, sent a set of counterproposals as the guerrillas new deadline for an agreementsometime tomorrow night, New York timeneared. [Page 1, Columns 68.]

title: TV: We and the EskimosViewpoints in Contrast
description: The contradictions of the American ideal were ironical ly brought out last night in an evening of many television specials. One was The Ice People, a study by Craig Fisher of how the white min's culture had under mined the nobility of the Es kimo and had reduced him to welfare peonage. The other was A Salute to the U.S.A., a melodic ode to a country having no problems that love couldn't conquer.

title: High Thai Aides Now Rule Out Any Manpower for Cambodia
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Sept. 10Two leading Thai officials have declared that their Gov ernment will not send troops to Cambodia. This decision also covers the 3,000 ethnic Cam bodians who have been in com bat training since July 2, they said:

title: Federal Reserve System Statistics
description: Weekly Averages of Daily Figures

title: Hodgson Asserts Philadelphia Plan Exceeds Its Goals
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10 (UPI) Secretary of Labor James D. Hodgson said today that Fed eral, construction contractors had exceeded their firstyear goals for employment of crafts men from minority groups un der the Philadelphia plan four months ahead of schedule. In some trades, he said, they have surpassed their fourthyear quotas for 1973.

title: ATOMIC PLANT STIRS DEBATE IN VERMONT
description: MONTPELIER, Vt., Sept. 101 (AP)  An economist warned) today that unless the Vermont Yankee Nuclear Power Corpo ration, state regulatory agen cies and environmentalists set tled their differences over Ver mont Yankee's $130million atomic power plant in Vernon, the outlook for the plant was grim.

title: It's the Fashion Gamefor Men
description: Well they're in for it. It was inevitable, once men strayed from the sanctified sack suit and buttondown shirt look. They're now up against the same ceremonies women have long undergone. Fashion Shows. Fashion show commentators. Hemlines ris ing and falling. Even fashion influential films.

title: U.S. SCORES 2D WIN IN CHESS OLYMPIAD
description: SIEGEN, West Germany, Sept. 10The United States team scored a second victory in the 19th Chess Olympiad at Sieger land Halt here last night when it defeated the Virgin Islands, 30, with one game adjourned in the fifth preliminary round. Thus, the Americans have posted 17 points out of possible 20, with one game ad journed.

title: Dividends Announced
description: Dividends Announced

title: MARYLAND CHOICE OF SCHOOL STAR
description: MANSFIELD, Pa., Sept. 10 (UPI)Tom McMillen, 6feet11 inches tall, considered the top prize in the country's college basketball recruiting scramble, decided today to attend the University of Maryland instead of the University of North Car ]olina.

title: International Paper To Pare Operations
description: The International Paper Com pany, the world's largest paper making enterprise, announced yesterday that a number of its primary paper and paperboard mills were operating on a cur tailed basis because of the con tinuing decline in business ac tivity. A spokesman for the company said that early this year when prices were still firm the mills operated on a sevenday basis, but now some mills are working five days and others six days a week. No layoffs are involved, he said.

title: Kenny Testifies in Corruption Inquiry
description: TRENTON, Sept. 10  John V. Kenny, the powerful demo cratic leader of Hudson Coun ty, and nine other leading Dem ocratic party officials testified for nearly six hours today be fore the statewide grand jury that is investigating corruption and organized crime in New Jersey.

title: NEW DEADLINE SET
description: LONDON, Friday Sept. 11 The Governments of the United States, Britain, West Germany, Switzerland and Israel rejected last night as unacceptable de mands that Arab guerrillas have set for the release of air line passengers they hold in the Jordanian desert, informed sources here reported.

title: Crime Rise Is Reported During July
description: For the sixth consecutive month this year, in July, re ported crime has increased in New York City over the same month of the previous year, ac cording to statistics released yesterday by the Police Depart ment.

title: Hostages on B.O.A.C. Jet Say Food Is Not Provided
