title: Mrs. Carner Wins Coast Golf, Beating Miss Smith in Playoff
description: OCEAN SHORES, Wash., Sept. 12 (AP)Mrs. JoAnne Gunderson Carner won the $40,000 WendellWest women's golf tournament today with bogey on the first hole of a sud dendeath playoff as Marilyn Smith had a doublebogey. The two had carded 69's for today's 18hole round and were even at 214 for 54holes.

title: Villanova Scores 3 Touchdowns After Fumbles by Maryland and Wins, 213
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md., Sept. 12 (AP)Villanova scored three touchdowns after Mary land fumbles, the last recov ered in the end zone, and whipped the Terps, 213, in a collegiate football opener today.

title: Darleys Have a Child
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Sept. 12A daughter was born on Aug. 21 to Mr. and Mrs. John M. Darley in Princeton Hos pital. The child has been named Lea Shannon. Her father is associate professor of psychology at Princeton University. Her mother, the former Miss Susan Ancell of New Rochelle, N. Y., is a lec turer in psychology at Princeton and associate mas ter of the Princeton Inn College.

title: Roffmans Have a Child
description: STONY BROOK, L. I. Sept. 12A daughter was born on Aug. 28 to Mr. and Mrs. Eric H. Roffman in Sy osset Hospital. Mr. Roffman is assistant professor of physics at City College.

title: Shelley Plimpton: From Hair to Maternity
description: SHELLEY PLIMPTON has put on weight. The tiny, 23yearold ac tress weighed only 85 pounds when she created the part of Crissy, the teenybopperwaif who searches forlornly for Frank Mills, in the very first production of Hair in October, 1967, at the Public Theater. And she weighed only 85 pounds when she did the spoofy commercial for FaceOff pimple  remover in Putney Swope, which showed her romping in a wispy green glade with a black boy friend (Ronnie Dyson). And she weighed only 85 pounds when she played the peabreasted groupie in Alice's Restau rant who wanted to make it with Arlo Guthrie because she figured he might be an album someday. And she weighed only 85 pounds when she and her actor husband, fuzzyhaired, 24 yearold Steve Curry, whom she met in Hair, made a movie together called Glen and Randa on the West Coast last spring.

title: The British Drug System
description: The socalled British Sys tem for dispensing heroin, morphine and other drugs to addicts does not exist and never has existed as a true system. In reality, it has been a series of humane medical and administrative responses that followed passage of Britain's Dangerous Drug Act of 1920. This act placed stringent restrictions on the import, export, manufacture, sale and possession of nar cotics.

title: Crabapples Are Colorful
description: WHEN we recently moved into a six room bungalow from a 21room house, we were pleased at the smaller garden that went along with it. Pleased, that is until we began listing the trees we wanted to plant for shade and enjoyment. Then the smaller size of the garden and house really became evi dent to us. If it were not for crabapples, and a few other trees of their proportions, we might not have been able to mould a beautiful, propor tionately scaled landscape.

title: Car Derails Into Canal
description: UTICA, N. Y. (AP)Eight een freight cars on a 40car Penn Central freight train de railed 6 miles east of here to day, sending one car into the Barge Canal running parallel to the railroad tracks. No one was reported injured in the mishap and the cause was not determined. The accident blocked both eastbound and westbound tracks. Railroad of ficials said they hoped to clear one pair of tracks by noon to permit traffic to re sume.

title: A war has many battles
description: A Winter in the Hills is a pleasant work, pleasanter than it should be. Roger Furnivall, a British philologist and would be lecher (he feels he carries his seed around like a con vict), comes to Caerfenai, Wales, to stuay the language. He hopes for a university job in Sweden, where the female philologists are tall and blonde, with perfect teeth. Just about the first thing Furnivall does in Caerfenai is to pick up a girl; she ditches him in the course of what was supposed to be a mountain idyll. The angry, rainsoaked Roger comes upon a dark and driverless bus. In larkish desperation, he re leases the hand brake, and coasts the bus into the village.

title: SAMUEL K. LIPKOWITZ
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 12  Samuel K. Lipkowitz, an eco nomic adviser with the World Bank, died of a heart attack yesterday.

title: Prague's Whispering Gallery
description: PRAGUE. GAZING up onto the dim roof of this Czech baroque church, you cannot see where the sculp tured figures of writhing saints end and the painted ceiling of archangels begins. The same confusion between shadow and substance is the fabric of living in Prague today. Trompe l'oeil: the eye is deceived, the ear puzzled, and the mind waits, bewil dered. In a labyrinth, all conclusions are provisional. There are too many interpretations. I record from a whis pering gallery echoes, murmurs of people waiting.

title: Radio
description: Talk, Sports, Events

title: STUDENTS PUNISHED IN ILLINOIS PROTEST
description: CHAMPAIGN, Ill. Sept. 12  The University of Illinois Sen ate Committee on Student Dis cipline at the Urbana Cham paign campus has expelled 10 students for their participation in campus disturbances last spring but suspended the pen alty for nine.

title: The Pennant Season
description: Pennants are won in Sep tember, or in the first few days of October. Many base ball fans don't realize how thoroughly this old saying is borne out by events, year after year. The threeteam race in National League Last, among the New York Mets, Chicago Cubs and Pittsburgh Pirates, is in the process of provid ing an example. There are, bas ically, two types of pennant win ners. One type, represented this year by Baltimore and Cincinnati, is simply much stronger than any other team in its league (or divisional); it establishes dominance early, opens a sizable lead in the standings, and holds it from midseason on with no real threat to its position. Its final victory margin doesn't mean much, whether it shrinks or expands during the last month, because for all prac tical purposes the matter was settled in the first half of the campaign.

title: Letters
description: To THE EDITOR: Hooray for Dr. Ackerman and his family therapy (To Treat a Disturbed Person, Treat His Family, by Sara Davidson, Aug. 16). In the tradition of the socalled help ing professions, the treatment is great for daddy and the (male) kids, but mommy had better watch out.

title: WEST VA. ROUTS W. & M., 43 TO 7
description: MORGANTOWN, W. Va., Sept. 12 (AP)Displaying an awesome offense on the ground and in the air, West Virginia crushed William and Mary 43 7, in the football opener for both teams today.

title: SHORT DISPLAYS THE VOICE OF OLD
description: Bobby Short returned to his familiar position behind the piano in the Cafe Carlyle last week with a new mustache and his old voice. The voice was more of an event than the mustache.

title: Schools Designed For Those From Many Nations
description: When C. Y. Tung, the Hong Kong ship owner, successfully bid $3.2million, for the former transAtlantic liner Queen Elizabeth last week, he talked of making the aging linerturned bankrupt tourist ship into a float ing international university, per haps under United Nations aus pices. It would cost, said the owner of 100 other ships, only about $4.5million to refit the Queen, after towing her from Fort Lauderdale, Fla., to the Orient.

title: Maria B. Hincks Becomes a Bride
description: FARMINGTON, Conn., Sept. 12Miss Maria Birch Hindu and Peter Lord Milliken were married here this afternoon in the First Church of Christ, Congregational, by the Rev. Harland G. Lewis.

title: Time of Bounty
description: A late Labor Day made the season deceptive. The full moon Tuesday will be the Harvest Moon, and the autumn equinox, official turning point into the year's last quarter, occurs a week from Wednesday. September is almost half over. And we feel as though we had leaped from midAugust right into autumn.

title: Dance
description: LONDON. ALTHOUGH in the West we have had visits from individual Soviet dancers  during the nineteen thirties even the great Chabukiani danced in New Yorkit has been fewer than 15 years since fullscale Soviet ballet companies have been regularly coming to the Western world.

title: What Can Be Done To Prevent Hijacks?
description: History's first multiple hijack ingraising to 43 the hijacked planes in 1970  triggered fresh demands for action and raised anew the question of what can be done in preventive action. By week's end, American aviation authorities and the White House. had put into action a triple pronged plan.

title: V.M.I. Beats Furman. 130, After Losing 12 in a Row
description: LEXINGTON, Va., Sept. 12 (AP)Virginia Military Insti tute's Keydets ended a 12 game losing streak extending hack to 1968 with a convinc ing 130 opening game South ern Conference football vic tory today over Furman's Pala din's.

title: Instant Weather Data For Motorists Weighed
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 12 (AP)The Federal Communi cations Commission is con sidering allowing three New England states to set up radiocontrolled signs along major highways to flash in stant reports on the weather and road conditions to motor ists.

title: Sammartino to Oppose Mongol in Garden Feature
description: Bruno Sammartino, a 265 pounds, will oppose Bepo Mon gol, 305, in the feature of to morrow night's wrestling pro gram at Madison Square Garden. Ten exhibitions involving weights totaling 4,871 pounds supposedly the highest on a single card in New York annals are scheduled.

title: Indians Beat Yanks, 43, On Sims's Homer in 1 1 th
description: CLEVELAND, Sept. 12Three homers, two off the bat of big Duke Sims, proved the undoing of the Yankees today as they went down to their fourth straight onerun defeat. Sims's second circuit cloud was the clincher.

title: Movie Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR: VINCENT CANBY does not seem to have a real complaint against Sidney Poitier in They Call Me Mister Tibbs, so he has manufactured one. He credits Poitier with the emergence of such actors as James Earl Jones and the pro duction of such pictures as Cotton Comes to Harlem. He states flatly that this emergence would not have oc curred had not Poitier insinu ated his blackness in such pictures as The Defiant Ones, Guess Who's Coming To Dinner, etc.

title: Authors Queries
description: I am gathering material on the Extralegal Committees of Safety or Committees of Obser vations which operated to en force the Articles of Associa tion adopted by the First Con tinental Congress in the pre Revolutionary years 17741776. Any information on official records or private papers on the subject will be appreciated.

title: BAY STATE AWAITS TUESDAY PRIMARY
description: BOSTON, Sept. 12Political strategists for both major po litical parties will be carefully watching this Tuesday's pri mary elections in the Bay State for signs of emerging sentiment.

title: Patman Criticizes Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 12 (UPI)  Representative Wright Patman, Democrat of Texas, ac cused President Nixon today of serious omissions in the Ad ministration's list of priority legislation. He cited a House passed bill to break up socalled onebank holding companies, which are Individual banks that control several other unrelated businesses.

title: 3 AIRCRAFT INSURED NEAR TOTAL VALUE
description: All three airliners blown up in the Jordanian desert yester day by Arab commandos were insured at or near their full value, officials of the airlines involved said.

title: 4Day Weekend, Starting Friday, Gets 182Game N.F.L. Season Under Way
description: It will take a fourday week end beginning on Friday to open the National Football League's 51st season. The first of 182 games will come Friday night in Los Angeles when the St. Louis Cardinals oppose the, Rams, one of the favorites to reach the Super Bowl next Jan. 17.

title: Iowa Dean Resigns
description: IOWA CITY, Sept. 12 (UPI) David H. Vernon, dean of the College of Law at the Univer sity of Iowa, submitted his res ignation to the Iowa board of Regents yesterday. Mr. Vernon, dean of the college since 1966.

title: BROWNS SUBDUE GIANTS BY 3029
description: Don Cockroft kicked a 31 yard field goal with four sec onds left last night as the Cleveland Browns edged the Giants, 3029, in the last pre season game of the summer.

title: PARK GATHERING MARKS YOGA DAY
description: They did the cobra, the lo cut and the Hon in Central Park yesterday afternoon.

title: If You Can't See em, Can You Still Laugh at em?
description: THE Theater Recording Society of Caedmon Records specializes in studio recordings based on actual theatrical produc tions. Its three new releases, of plays by Moliere, Con greve and O'Neill, range in date from 1668 to 1933, but all three have certain things in common. They all deal with young men and women who are trying to figure out how to gratify their sexual and romantic feelings within the limits set by the social orderin other words, they are about young people who want to get married. They all have happy endings. And all of them were intended to make audiences laugh. In other words, all three are comedies.

title: Cynthia Kroll Wed To Andrew Dwyer
description: PLAINFIELD, N. J., Sept. 12Miss Cynthia Knox Kroll, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Alexander Kroll, was mar ried this afternoon to An drew Thompson Dwyer, son of Mr. and Mrs. Martin Dwyer Jr. of Laurel Hollow, L. I., and Hobe Sound, Fla. The Rev. Dr. Charles L. Mead performed the ceremony in the Crescent Avenue Presby terian Church.

title: A shrink at work
description: The Couch Trip is osten sibly a satiric novel about a lecherous advertising execu tive who has an affair, is threatened by his wife with di vorce, becomes distraught and looks up a psychiatristwho, it turns out, has just died. The wouldbe patient suddenly de cides to take on the psychi atrist's identity and job. All of this information we learn in the course of the narrative. What we see right away is the bogus shrink at work with the Reverend Becker (sex prob lems), Mrs. Lukens (sex prob lems), Chick Nolan (dope prob lems), Shirley Page (all kinds of problems, including that of identity, but I don't want to give all the mystery away).

title: Texan Wins Miss America Contest
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Sept. 12  Phyllis George, Miss Texas, was named Miss America of 1970 in the an nual pageant here tonight.

title: CAMBODIAN DRIVE HALTED IN NORTH
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Sept. 12 (Reuters)  A Government force of eight battalions pushing toward the provincial capital of Kompong Thom is reported to have come to a halt about 35 miles from its objective.

title: A radical strategy
description: THE United States may well come apart at the seams unless there is a new, radical political party, but the worst way to get one at this moment is to start one.

title: A Bulb Primer For New Gardeners
description: HARDY bulbs are those that are planted in the fall to root and bloom in spring. Many multiply and persist for many years.

title: Personality:
description: G. F. Steedman Hinkley, chairman and chief executive officer Of Overseas National Airways, is one of those earnest people who embraces an idea and sticks with it if it kills himand some times it almost does.

title: U.S. Apprentice Program Enrolls 3,000 in a Year
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 12 (AP) The Labor Department said today that more than 3,000 Ne groes and other minority group youths became construction ap prentices through Project Out reach in the last fiscal year. This brought to 6,900 the number who have entered building trade union apprentice ships through the program in its three years.

title: MAYOR NAMES GROUP TO ADVISE ON CENSUS
description: Mayor Lindsay, who has sharply criticized the 1970 Federal census as not being porough, announced yesterday the appointment of a 17mem ber advisory committee to evaluate current census pro cedures, point up any weak nesses and recommend changes.

title: World Bank Changing Foreign Aid Picture
description: WASHINGTONIn a rural Congressional district in Illinois, the Republican challenger to the Democratic incumbent this year is using as one of her four main charges that the incumbent voted for loans to Communist Yugoslavia. The incumbent, Rep resentative George E. Shipley, was puzzled for a while, because he had consistently voted against all foreign aid bills. But then he recalled that he had cast what he regarded as a routine vote for a bill to increase the United States contribution to the World Bank  which did, indeed, later make some loans to Yugoslavia, its only Communist member country.

title: POLICEMEN HURT IN ATTACKS HERE
description: Five policemen were the tar gets of violence here in sep arate incidents over a 24hour period ended last night. Two were beaten, two were shot but not seriously injured and the fifth was slightly hurt by a man with a knife.

title: WINNERS ANNOUNCED FOR DRAMA AWARDS
description: Winners of the 196970 Dram Desk Awards, voted by New York's drama critics and edi tors, were announced Friday, The awards, based on a per centage system, go to outstand ing theater artists on Broad way, off Broadway and in rep ertory theaters.

title: 3DAY HIFI DISPLAY OPENS FRIDAY ON L.I.
description: The 1970 New York High Fidelity Music Show will be held Friday through Sunday at the Island Inn Motel, West bury, L. I., near Roosevelt Raceway.

description: 30 The Yachtsmen Of Seawanhalas Are Different From You and Me

description: BASEBALL

title: On Microsonic Horizons
description: The emerging technology of microsonicssurface waves at microwave frequencies involves the newest form of energy, besides electrical, that the electronic engineer can exploit.

title: RUSSIANS LAUNCH LUNAR EXPLORER
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 12 (Reuters)  The Soviet Union today launched its first unmanned moon flight in more than a year to study the earth satel lite.

title: A study of a playwright and his plays
description: Martin Esslin is a critic whose usefulness lies less in original thinking or insightful ness than in lucid exposition, the kind of critic who possess es thoroughness in place of brilliance, breadth instead of depth. His book The Theater of the Absurd (which gave that unfortunate term its cur rency) may have made every interesting play of the century seem to have been written by the same person, as a fellow critic observed, but it had value as a source of informa tion and as raw material for the gaining of perspectives on a phenomenon more complex than Esslin knew. The same thing was true of his long study of Brecht, a work mostly firm and reliable as long as it dealt with the facts of the plays and the life, but often soggy and unconvincing whenever it turned to exegesis and inter pretation.

title: Kate Ganz Married To Fellow Student
description: Miss Kate Spencer Ganz and Richard Gerard Dorment, candidates for Ph.D. degrees in baroque art at Columbia Uni versity, were married yester day afternoon in the Roman Catholic Church of St. Thomas More by the Rev. John C. Calhoun.

title: Alaska
description: Norma Spring, a good egg, and her children have followed Father around Alaska for years while he photographed the place. Going north from their Seattle home in all seasons, the Springs have traveled our larg est state from end to end with out losing their solidarity or even getting grumpy, bless them! Anyway, that's what Mother says.

title: McMallen Is Middie Star
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., Sept. 12 Navy, which won only one game last season, opened its football season today with a devastating display of passing and running power that carried the middies to a 4822 victory over Colgate University.

title: Strife in Europe, Where Money Is
description: PARIS  To alleviate the financial squeeze in domes tic operations, American companies have been tapping European resources to an un paralleled extent. This has brought them into occasional conflict with European au thorities.

title: THAT'S RIGHT WINS TITLE IN JUMPING
description: STONY BROOK, L. I., Sept. 12A change of riders apar ently has had no effect on the performance of Mr. and Mrs. Patrick Butler's That's Right.

description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Sept. 12 (UPI)Sam Cunningham's run ning and the deft ballhandling of Jimmy Jones, the quarter back, carried Southern Califor nia to a 4221 victory tonight over Alabama.

title: War Protests in 20 Cities Are Planned for Oct. 31
description: CLEVELAND, Sept. 12 (AP) Plans for peace demonstra tions on Oct. 31 in 20 cities in the United States have been announced by the National Peace Action Coalition, which has headauarters here.

description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 12After more than week of controversy and con fusion over whether Vice Presi dent Nguyen Cao Ky would visit Washington, it became clear today that he would make the tripunless he changed his mind.

Samuel Richey Weds June Ailing
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., Sept. 12Miss June Wood Ailing was married this afternoon to Samuel Hunter Richey. The Rev. Dr. Charles Leonard Copenhaver performed the ceremony in the Reformed Church of Bronxville.

title: Yesterday on the Left
description: The socialist revolutionary is often a literary recidivist: Harvey Swados's new novel is an old  fashioned panoramic one. Its locales range from Buf falo to Panama, from a village in the Philippines to a kibbutz in Israel. It spans the auarter

title: Movies
description: WHO in the hell is Carrie Snodgress? I'm sure I don't know, but I like what I see: a jumping grouse of a girl, eyes like clear gum drops, staring giddily from behind plumtinted granny glasses, highhurdling her way through a bland little suite at the Drake with Diary of a Mad Housewife posters Scotchtaped over the picture frames, hypoed with enough vitamin C to get the first man on Venus without a spaceship. She is about ten times prettier than she looks in photographs or on the screen in Housewife. Her hair is soft as corn silknot that long, stringy, straw mattress stuffing that stares out from the pages of Vogue on girls who look spray lacquered for the day but ginger  peachy spry and bouncing up just above the shoulders of her gingham shirt. She has a precocious pink mouth that always seems to be on the verge of saying Ooohh and when she moves she floods the room with midwestern sun shine that seems about as out of place on East 56th Street as peonies in Decem ber. And the voice, the voice. It's the kind of nutmegand vinegar voice most actresses spend years drinking good Scotch to cultivate. Half Mar garet Sullavan, half Sally Bowles after prairie.

description: STATISTICS OF THE GAME

title: Water Main Break Stops Service to Grand Central
description: Service into and out of Grand Central Terminal was disrupted for nearly twO hours late last night and early today by watermain break that flooded an electrical substation of the Penn Central.

title: Stanford Conquers Arkansas by 3428
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., Sept. 12 In the nationally televised opener of what has been adver tised as the year of the quar terbacks in college football, two linebackers made the key play in the closing seconds to night as Stanford defeated Ar kansas, 3428.

title: U.S. AIDS SECURITY FOR U.N. JUBILEE
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Sept. 12  Confronted by mounting acts of violence across the United States, Fed eral and local authorities ars mapping extraordinary security measures to protect visiting officials at the United Nations 25th anniversary celebration.

title: JoEllen Yale to Wed
description: ANSONIA, Conn., Sept. 12 Miss JoEllen Yale and Keith Yackee, doctoral candi dates at the Ohio University, will marry on Friday. The future bride is the daughter of Dr. Irving Yale, a past president of the American Podiatry Association, and Mrs. Yale. Mr. Yackee is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Warren Yackee of Napoleon, Ohio, where his father has his own insurance agency.

title: GREEK OARSMEN WIN THREE RACES
description: The national rowing team of Greece won three of four races yesterday in the 70th annual metru, olitan championships of the New York Rowing Associa tion. Greece scored in the elite pair with coxswain 400meter and 2,000meter races and then combined with a New York Athletic Club crew to take the elite eightoared title.

title: EAST IS BYPASSING COMMON MARKET
description: PARIS, Sept. 12  It was bizarre item on the books that caught the attention of a Dutch Socialist, Hans Vredeling, and led to revelations about a little known aspect of West German trade with the East.

title: Aussies Banking on Experience and Luck in Cup Races
description: It's a tough act to follow, Emil (Bus) Mosbacher's walloping fourrace victory over the Aussies in the 1967 America's Cup. For, even though he is sailing basi cally the same sloop and against the same adversary, there is no set assurance that Intrepid's new skipper, William Peter Ficker can come up with the same result.

title: A dream house come true
description: Whatever features one decides a dream house must have, both inside and out, they often fade away when reality and the estimates come in. But the lavish weekend retreat shown here is owned by a man who knew what he wanted since childhood, and saw that he got it. Henry Glazier, now the successful head of a men's jewelry concern, has built on the property that adjoins his childhood summer home in northern Westchester County, a happy blend of architectural inconsistencies that serves as a background for his fine collection of antiques. A couple run the house and care for his needs, and a bloodhound and three other roaming guard dogs protect the dream.

title: ARRAIGNMENT IS SET FOR WATSON SEPT. 28
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 12 (UPI)Charles a Watson, who fought extradition from Texas to California for 10 months, appeared in Superior Court here today and was or dered to return Sept. 28 for formal arraignment in the slaying of Sharon Tate and six other persons.

title: Art Mailbag
description: IWAS surprised and dis tressed to read in the let ter from Alan J. Marks published August 30 that the series of National Exhibi tions of Prints at the Library of Congress is now seeming ly defunct. Mr. Marks is a frequent visitor to the Library of Congress, and I am at a loss to explain how he arrived at his erroneous conclusion.

description: Out of the Kitchen, Ladies

title: Saints Sink Chargers, 2014
description: NEW ORLEANS, Sept. 12 (AP)Billy Kilmer tossed three touchdown passes, one for 92 yards, in the first half tonight to spark the New Orleans Saints to a 2014 preseason vic tory over the San Diego Chargers.

title: T.V.A. Spends Outside Its Region
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., Sept. 12A total of $3billion has been spent by the Tennessee Valley Authority over the years for purchases from varied businesses outside the sevenstate region served.

title: PHONE RISE OPPOSED BY STATE, COMPANY
description: State Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz and the New York Telephone Company ob jected for different reasons last week to the recent $120.8 million telephone rate increase authorized by the Public Serv ice Commission.

description: STRATFORDONAVON, England.

title: METS BEAT CARDS, 30, AND PIRATES DOWN CUBS, 54; ROSEWALL AND ROCHE GAIN U. S. OPEN TENNIS FINAL
description: The decades change, the hem lines dance up and down, the Mets move from last to first, but Australian tennis players make off with the big money in American tournaments.

title: U.S. Archers Lead Mexico In Eagles Cup Competition
description: NEW ORLEANS, Sept. 12 (AP)The United States took the lead in every division today in the bow and arrow competi tion between Mexico and the United States for the Eagles Cup.

title: And Don't Call Them Lady Composers
description: WHY have there been no great women composers? The ques tion is often asked. The answer is no mystery. In the past, talent, education, ability, interests, motivation were irrelevant because be ing female was a unique qual ification for domestic work and for continual obedience to and dependence upon men.

title: ARNOW CONSTABLE 5TH. AVENUE
description: It's a very special event just twice a year when our beautiful Grandini pumps are offered at this marvelous savings price. Grandinia name famed for fit, quality and fashion. Every pair of shoes is a masterpiece of design!

title: The Army as one of life's awful necessities
description: This taut, soldierly, professional story is something of a stranger among American novels about war making. Angry civilians have writ ten most of the best fiction on the subject, from Three Soldiers through Catch22, to make the point (with a good deal of literary overkill) that wars are mass insanity and that armies are madhouses. Granted. But it is for this very rea son that most American novels about military life and death fall short of the whole truth. They are so roman tically partisan toward the rebellious, escapee protagonists that other fig ures tend to become simple cliches (the tough, sadistic sergeant; the stu pid colonel). As in Schweik, the only good soldier is a bad soldier.

title: White Sox Set Back Twins, 543, as O'Brien and Hopkins Wallop Home Runs
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Sept. 12 (UPI)Home runs by Syd O'Brien and Gail Hopkins and tworun double by Bobby Knoop provided the Chicago White Sox with a 53 victory today over the Minnesota Twins.

title: Silverman to Resign Surrogate's Post For His Old Bench
description: Samuel J. Silverman, the state judge who was elected Manhattan Surrogate in 1966 after a fight with the Democra tic party regulars on a pledge to reform the court, will resign his post and return to the State Supreme Court.

title: Nuptials Held for Miss Susan W. Mead
description: HANOVER, N.H., Sept. 12 Miss Susan Ward Aitken Mead, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edwin Chester Mead, was married here this after noon to Andrew Collis Har denbergh, son of Mr. and Mrs. Collis Morgan Harden bergh of Wayzata, Minn., and Quogue, L. I.

title: NEGRO BAPTISTS DISCUSS AMERICA
description: NEW ORLEANS, Sept. 12I would caution young people young blacks, especially against being too hasty, the 27yearold youth worker from Philadelphia said. Things will work out, but some of the rot ten things about the system will always remain.

title: Marine Science Building Set
description: CHARLOTTE AMALIE, St. Thomas, V. I., Sept. 12 (UPI) The College of the, Virgin Is lands, which has long played a prominent role in marine re search, has announced plans for a $1million marine science building.

title: White House Turns Off Legislator's Bike Plea
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 12 (AP)A West Virginia state legislator who pedaled his bicycle nearly 300 miles to present a petition to the White House was turned aside at the gates according to a White House spokesman.

title: UTAH STATE LOSES TO KANSAS STATE
description: MANHATTAN, Kan., Sept. 12 (UPI)Kansas State, its pass ing game curtailed by a stub born Utah State secondary and a chilling wind, utilized the tal ents of Mike Montgomery at fullback and a stout defense to post a 370 intersectional foot ball triumph today.

title: Rosewall, Gorman Receive Awards for Sportsmanship
description: Ken Rosewall of Australia yesterday received the Harold A. Lebair Memorial Trophy awarded annually by the Uni ted States Lawn Tennis As sociation to the player who, by his sportsmanship and con duct on and off the court, best exemplifies the traditions of tennis.

title: Swede Clips Swim Mark
description: BARCELONA, Spain, Sept. 12 (Reuters)Gunnar Larsson of Sweden broke the men's 200 meter individual medley world record today when he won the gold medal in 2 minutes 9.3 seconds at the European swim ming championships. Larsson, who had already won two gold medals, clipped onefifth of a second off the monthold mark set by Gary Hall of the United States.

title: Washington: First and Last Things
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 12In the next few days, the univer sities will be back in session, and many of the leading states men of the world will be gath ering in New York to celebrate the first quartercentury of the United Nations.

title: INSURANCE CRITIC TO SEEK CHANGES
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 12 Legislation to scrap the present automobile liability insurance system and substitute a nation al nofault, guaranteedcov erage plan has been drafted by a leading Senate critic of the insurance industry.

title: Canadians Use Peat Moss To Absorb Oil in Atlantic
description: OTTAWA, Sept. 12 (UPI) Canadian fisheries and coast guard vessels are pouring peat moss into the Atlantic Ocean off Prince Edward Island in an attempt to absorb 800,000 gal lons of oil let loose last week when a barge sank.

title: Stupefying peep show
description: Read any dirty books lately? This one is about the making of a dirty movie called The Faces of Love, but faces are the least of it. Genitalia is more like it, and of course it's a satiremostly on itself. Al

title: The Yachtsmen of Seawanhaka Are Different From You and Me
description: OYSTER BAY, L. I. BACK in West High School, in Rockford, III., reading F. Scott Fitzgerald behind my American Problems textbook, I drew a map of the United States in my imagination: it was bounded on the west by Holly wood, of course, and on the east by that slender riotous island which ex tends itself due east of New York into the great wet barnyard of Long Island Sound. When I finally came East, therefore, I was as eager to write about a yacht club on Long Island as I had been to sneak into a movie studio, when I was 17.

title: Soviet Restores, River Vessel On Which Lenin Sailed to Exile
description: A historic river boat has turned into a floating museum piece as part of a memorial complex dedicated to Lenin's exile in Siberia at the turn of the century, the Fairplay Inter national Shipping Journal re ports.

title: 4 Youngsters Congratulated By Mayor on Winning Medal
description: Four youngsters who won medals in the international finals of the Special Olympics for the Mentally Retarded, in Chicago, were congratulated by Mayor Lindsay at a City Hall ceremony last week.

title: U.S. to Investigate Housing Authority In Niagara Falls
description: NIAGARA FALLS, N.Y., Sept. 12The United States Depart ment of Justice has announced that is will investigate the Ni agara Falls Housing Authority.

description: 100 A Walk On London's Wild Side

title: Democratic Caucus Set On 18City TV Circuit
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 12 (AP)  The Democrats an nounced plans today for what they called a political cam paign innovationa strategy conference on closedcircuit color television linking 18 cities.

title: Moonlight
description: P.M. writes: I have been trying to identify, without success, the following fragment from a 20thcentury American poet, possibly Wallace Stevens: Should  at that moment the full moon/ Step forth upon the hill/ And memories hard to bear at noon/ By moonlight harder still/ Form in the shadows of the trees,/ Things you could not spare/ And live, or so you thought, yet these/ All gone and you still there,/ A man no longer what he was/ Nor yet the thing he'd planned.

title: Security douncil Aide
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 12 (AP)  The White House has an nounced that Dr. K. Wayne Smith of Newton, N. C., has poined the staff of the Na tional Security Council as ats sistant to coordinate program nalysis.

title: Michigan Tech Wins. 270
description: HOUGHTON, Mich, Sept. 12 (AP)Ben Haller, reserve quar terback, ran for two touch downs and kicked two extra points today as Michigan Tech trounced Northland of Wiscon sin, 270. The sophomore play ed all but five minutes of the second half.

title: Comecon Reports Increase Of 8.7% in Industrial Output
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 12 (Reuters) Industrial production in Com econ, the East European eco nomic grouping, rose by 8.7 per cent in the first half of this year compared to the same period in 1969, the Tass press Appnrv has reported.

title: Miss Sigrid Olson to Be Married
description: ROCKPORT, Mass., Sept. 12Mr. and Mrs. Melvin A. Olson have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Sigrid Elizabeth Olson, to Stephen T. Lindo of Cambridge, son of Mrs. S. Griffin Lindo of Watertown, N. Y., and Col. Richard J. Lindo, Army Reserve, retired, of Fayetteville, N. Y. The wedding is planned for. Feb ruary.

title: Indicates Resumption of Economic Assistance
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 12 Secretary of State William P. Rogers said today that the United States was planning to resume economic aid to Israel and to increase military as sistance.

title: Coins
description: Lyman J. Gage, who served as Secretary of the Treasury under Presidents William McKinley and Theodore Roosevelt (18971902) is pictured on the new $15,000 Treasury bill issued recently. Accord ing to Mrs. Dorothy. Andrews Elston, Treasurer of the United States, the bill was authorized for transactions effective Sept. 1. The blank space on right side of the bill is for date of issue and maturity datesuch stamping being required for validity.

title: St. Joseph Routs Olivet
description: OLIVET, Mich., Sept. 12 (AP) George Vozza and John Hiltz scored two touchdowns each today to lead St. Joseph of In diana to a 397 football victory over Olivet College.

title: The Nonaligned at Lusaka
description: The first question a disinterested observer might raise about the summit conference of nonaligned nations just concluded in Zambia is: What do they mean by nonalignment? On their performance Lusaka it is clearer than ever that they do not mean to signify a neutral or evenhanded stand on some of the world's most complicated problems.

title: 34 Prague's Whispering Gallery
description: 34 Prague's Whispering Gallery

title: niniums Seek Reforms
description: MIAMIA sense of discontent among many of the owners of condominium apartments in southern Florida is forging efforts at change in the industry at time of slower sales.

title: A celebration of pleasure imbued with a sense of loss
description: Although Donald Hall's new book offers work both recent and early (the latter somewhat revised) and although it clearly shows his poetic manner shift ing to accommodate, or at least to accompany, the changing styles of 20 years, certain fea

title: Electoral Reform Is in Deep Trouble
description: WASHINGTON  Two weeks ago, one of President Nixon's top domestic advisers was meet ing informally with a group of reporters, and one of them asked him about the President's current stance on the question of substituting direct popular election for the Electoral Col lees machinery. The White House aide, who had been rang ing freely and informatively over a wide variety of national issues, had to confess in embar rassment that he did not know Mr. Nixon's position on the con stitutional amendment that was about to reach the Senate floor for final Congressional approval or, alternatively, oblivion.

title: Spotlight:
description: The stock market has dem onstrated anew how develop ments abroadfrom Chile to Libya and Indonesiacan af fect prices on Wall Street with dramatic impact.

title: East Germans Free 4
description: BERLIN, Sept. 12 (Reuters) The pilot and three passengers of a British light plane forced down in East Germany yester day were returned to West Ger many today, the East German press agency, A.D.N., reported. A British Embassy spokesman in Bonn said yesterday that the plane had apparently strayed into East German territory.

title: Instant Weather Data For Motorists Weighed
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 12 (AP)The Federal Communi cations Commission is con sidering allowing three New England states to set up radiocontrolled signs along major highways to flash in stant reports on the weather and road conditions to motor ists.

title: Seascape and Lofty Appeal Lure Fashionable Germans to Cliquy Kampen
description: KAMPEN, West GermanyWhen said I was going to Kampen 20 years ago people used to ask me where was, the middleaged Hamburg woman said. Now they wink slyly and say, Aha.

title: ThreeMonth Strike At Atom Test Site Thwarts Mediators
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Sept. 12 A 103dayold strike that has stalled the nation's testing of nuclear weapons and devices for peaceful purposes here is continuing with no indication of a settlement.

title: Hair Rule Is Upheld
description: SAVANNAH, Ga., Sept. 12 (UPI)United States District Judge Alexander A. Lawrence has upheld a school board rule against long hair for students but he urged the plaintiffs to take the case to the Supreme Court.

title: Elaine Solari Is Bride of a Lieutenant
description: MANHASSET, L. I., Sept. 12Miss Elaine Solari, lawyer formerly with the New York firm of Davies, Hardy, Ives & Lawther, was married here this afternoon to Lieut. Conant Atwood, son of Eugene At wood 2d of Salt Lake City and the late Mrs. Atwood.

title: Handicapped Week Is Set
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 12 (UPI)  President Nixon hzis designated the week of Oct. 4 as National Employ the Phys ically Handicapped Week.

title: Music in a Renaissance Setting
description: LUCCA, Italy  Behind their solid 16thcentury walls, the citizens of Lucca have been making music together since the town trumpeters formed a band in the 1500's. From this developed one of Italy's first civic orchestras and, in Lucca, an incredibly active music life that lasted three centuries and produced five generations of Puccinis.

title: 200 at Conservative Picnic Upstate Attend Buckley
description: MARCELLUS, N.Y., Sept. 12 Standing this afternoon on flatbed truck festooned with bunting, James L. Buckley, the Conservative party candidate for United States Senator, bore down on histraditional themes of guns, big government and crime at a Conservative party picnic in this rural park near Syracuse.

title: Lions Down Bengals, 3114
description: CINCINNATI, Sept. 12 (UPI) Greg Landry and Bill Munson threw touchdown passes to Larry Walton tonight in pacing the Detroit Lions to a 3114 triumph over the Cincinnati Bengels.

title: Guide to Australia
description: This is a handsome book with the title on the cover right side up and upside down, in honor of the headsdownward position of the antipodeans. My copy fell open at a color photo of a bend in the River Mur ray near Mildura  bluegreen water calm between sparsely wooded red banks under a hard blue skythe river mentioned in The Summer of the Seven teenth Doll. The harvest work er's up the Murray after the grapes has stuck in my head ever since. Flipping back, the first photo in the book shows a kangaroo in midbounddig nified, even stuffy as it hur tles forward; a beast as excel lent as the idea of making him a continental symbol. The other picturescattle drovers, sheep shearers, gum blossoms, a suc culent seaside girl, the Edward ian urbanity of Bourke Street, Melbourneare handsome and appetizing.

title: U.S. 144 Lacrosse Victor
description: DUBLIN, Sept. 12 (UPI) Jackie Pitts scored almost half her team's point total today as she accounted for six goals in the United States's 144 rout of the Irish lacrosse team.

title: L. I. Homeowners Are Found Cheated By Lending Deeds
description: A scheme in which a num ber of financially strapped Long Island residents report edly have lost their homes and hundreds of others have found their deeds transferred to mortgage manipulators, is un der investigation by the state and by the Nassau County dis trict attorney.

title: EXHIBITIONS
description: KODAK GALLERY1133 Avenue of the Americas. More than 80 scenes from National Parks In the U.S. Indefinite run. Hours, 10 to 5:00, Monday through Saturday.

title: The Pennant Season
description: Pennants are won in Sep tember, or in the first few days of October. Many base ball fans don't realize how thoroughly this old saying is borne out by events, year after year. The threeteam race in National League Last, among the New York Mets, Chicago Cubs and Pittsburgh Pirates, is in the process of provid ing an example. There are, bas ically, two types of pennant win ners. One type, represented this year by Baltimore and Cincinnati, is simply much stronger than any other team in its league (or divisional); it establishes dominance early, opens a sizable lead in the standings, and holds it from midseason on with no real threat to its position. Its final victory margin doesn't mean much, whether it shrinks or expands during the last month, because for all prac tical purposes the matter was settled in the first half of the campaign.

title: A FOE OF REGIME FREED IN TAIWAN
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Sept. 12 Lei Chen, a former member of the National Assembly and a onetime high official of the Kuomintang, received privi leged treatment during his 10 year term, which ended last week, in an armyrun political prison.

title: Alberta P. Reath Married to Grant Coffin Married
description: WAYNE, Pa., Sept. 12 Miss Alberta Pancoast Reath and Grant Coffin Manheim, who is with the London mer chant bank of N. M. Roths child & Sons, were married here this afternoon in Old St. David's Episcopal Church.

title: LEGISLATOR PLANS PRIVACY GUARANTEE
description: ALBANY, Sept. 12A legis lator said this week that he would propose an amendment to the State Constitution, spell ing out guarantees for individu al right of privacy.

title: Baron Replies to Critics
description: To THE EDITOR: My attention has been called to the press interview of Com modore Horn published in the Sept. 2, 1970 issue of The New York Times. Instead of using the press to make public in temperate and libelous attacks against me personally, he should have confined his re marks to an objective discus sion of my claim that the In ternational Race Committee has failed to comply with the appli cable rules. That is the least that one might expect from a member of a quasijudicial body of sportsmen.

title: Authors Queries
description: Under the auspices of the Friends of the Pacific North west Indian Center, Spokane, Washington, I am preparing an Indian foodbook, and would like to correspond with anyone who has an interest in or know ledge of American Indian foods and their preparation.

title: Criminals At Large
description: James Fraser has shown un usual talent and freshness in his Inspector Aveyard series, the third of which is DEAD LY NIGHTSHADE (Harcourt Brace Jovanovich, $4.95). You might call them English village procedurals, but whatever you call them, for their sharp cha racterizations, their impressive rural atmosphere, their ingen ious deployment of situation and incident, you must read them. In Nightshade the vil lage poacher's dog wanders in to the police station in Bent with a human jawbone in its mouth. Aveyard, roused from a delicate task in his bachelor flat, is off to the scene with Sgt. Bruton. And greeted is he by a multiplicity of peculiari ties, a weaving and shifting and wholly fascinating revela tion.

title: Raye Bashover to Wed
description: UNION, N. J., Sept. 12 Mr. and Mrs. Heroert Bash over have announced the en gagement of their daughter, Miss Raye D. Bashover, to Rodney Krich, son of Mr. and Mrs. Ben Krich. The brideto be is a freshman at Douglass College. Her fiance is a sen ior at the Newark College of Engineering.

title: Harold Lubell, 49, Is Dead; Writer and Editor in Jersey
description: BELLEVILLE, N. J., Sept. 12 Harold Lubell, telegraph edi tor of The Jersey Journal in Jersey City and a news writer for the last 29 years, died yes terday afternoon at Clara Maas Hospital here, an hour after suffering a heart attack at his home, 185 Hornblower Avenue. He was 49 years old.

title: Harris Captures Ensign Class At 17 R.A. WestofRye Regatta
description: SEA CLIFF, L. I., Sept. 12 Five general recalls tended to slow down the Long Island Sound Yacht Racing Associa tion, WestofRye starting pro cedure for 125 yachts today but definitely failed to put a damper on a fine sailing after noon.

title: Pat Nixon Is the Ultimate Good Sport
description: WASHINGTON. MORE than 30 years ago, in an amateur theatrical produc tion in California, Richard and Pat Nixon made their public debut as an acting team. Although the talent that won them parts in The Dark Tower has been lost to Hollywood and Broadway, it appears to be alive and flourishing in the White House. Indeed, there are those who would say that the Nixon? current fouryear engagement is a tribute to their consummate skill as performers.

title: Men's Field Hockey Race Will Be Resumed Today
description: The men's field hockey sea son will resume today after the summer recess when Field Hockey Association of America championship games are held in Cos Cob, Conn.; Rye, N. Y.; Wayne, N. J.; Philadelphia; Baltimore and Washington. Leading the Northern Division is Westchester I, with 14 points for 9 games, followed closely by Now York I and Greenwich I each with 13 points in 8 games. In the Southern Division, the lead at the halfway stage is held by the Washington club.

title: Winds Fan Forest Fire
description: POLLACK PINES, Calif., Sept. 12 (UPI)Gusty winds pushed a forest fire over more than 300 acres near this Sierra resort community today and forced evacuation of 1,000 resi dents.

description: Best Seller List

title: METS LIST ROSTER FOR FLORIDA LEAGUE
description: A 27man squad has been named to represent the New York Mets in the 14team Flor ida Instructional League, which gets under way Sept. 28, it was announced yesterday by Joe McDonald, the Mets director of minor league operations.

title: Elementary School in China Combines Tributes to Mao with Mathematics and Basketball
description: CANTON, ChinaThe teach er, Mr. Chang, kept his fifth year class alive with instruc tions and questions, correction and encouragement, as he led it through a mathematics prob lem.
