description: Article 1  No Title

title: Pamela Schick, John Kelsey 3d Wed in Jersey
description: MADISON, N. J., Sept. 12 Miss Pamela Mildred Schick and Specialist 5 John Forsyth Kelsey 3d, U.S.A., were married here today in the Presbyterian Church by the Rev. Dr. John Parks. There was a reception at the home of the bride's mother and stepfather, Mr. and Mrs. William Lord Lyall Jr. of New Vernon.

title: lona Nine Turns Back N. Y. Tech by 10 Twice
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., Sept. 12Iona College won two games from New York Tech yesterday by 10 scores to open the fall baseball season at Haag Field on the Iona campus.

title: CHAPARRAL GAINS POLE FOR CANAM
description: GAINESVILLE, Ga., Sept. 12 (UPI)Vic Elford and the Chaparral 2J won a duel with the onceinvincible cars of the McLaren team today to take the pole position for tomor row's $80,000 CanadianAmeri can Challenge Cup race at Road Atlanta.

title: LONDON IS WILLING TO FREE HIJACKER
description: LONDON, Sept. 12The Brit ish Government announced to night that it was prepared to hand over Leila Khaled, the 24 yearold woman hijacker, as part of a settlement with Arab guerrillas.

title: STANDING OF THE LEADERS
description: STANDING OF THE LEADERS

title: LOS ANGELES AREA SHAKEN BY QUAKES
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 12A series of sharp rolling earth quakes caused widespread but mostly minor damage in South ern California today. Three per sons weer injured.

title: Remember Songmy
description: The original disclosures, almost ten months ago, of the massacre at Songmy sent a tremor of shock, shame and revulsion through the nation. Most Amer icans, regardless of their general attitude toward the war itself, saw the wanton, paintblank killing of defenseless civilians as an assault on principles for which Americans have traditionally lived and occasionally died.

title: ARABS BLOW UP 3 JETS IN DESERT AFTER TAKING OFF PASSENGERS; HOLD 40 AS HOSTAGES IN JORDAN
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Sept. 12 Palestinian commandos blew up the three hijacked airliners today and announced that they were holding 40 passengers as prisoners of war for the ex change of captives of imperial ist and Zionist powers.

title: The fat child (cont.)
description: Should simply forget about their weight. The guilt and selfhatred associated with chronic failure to stay on a diet may be even more psychologically damaging than the overweight is physically dam aging. It may be too late for adults to reprogram their bodies at least according to present knowledge. But those fat and skinny rats have shown us a road to prevention of overweight changing children's present eating patterns.

title: Military Police in Boston Won't Carry Gun on Patrol
description: BOSTON, Sept. 12 (UPI) Armed forces policemen in a 25mile radius of Boston have been ordered to perform rou tine patrols without firearms but will continue to carry nightsticks and handcuffs, the Navy said yesterday.

title: GIANTS TRIUMPH OVER DODGERS, 83
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 12 (UPI)Willie McCovey drove in four runs today with his 36th homer and a basesloaded sin gle and Don McMahon saved Skip Pitlock's fifth victory as the San Francisco Giants de feated Los Angeles, 83, and ex tended their winning streak to four games.

title: A New Leader For the Boston Diocese
description: Four years ago, Pope Paul VI announced a policy of retirement for bishops at the age of 75, and Richard Cardi nal Cushing wasted little time in making it known that, although as a cardinal he was theoretically exempt, he was ready and willing to take up the Pontiff's offer.

title: Lumbering Concern Seeks 121.5Million In Redwoods Claim
description: MENLO PARK, Calif., Sept. 12A lumbering concern that gave up 11,000 acres of tim berland for inclusion in the Redwoods National Park two years ago has filed a claim for $121,585,000 with the Interior Department as compensation for the property.

title: NEWSMEN URGE CARD FOR WAR PROTECTION
description: PARIS, Sept. 12An inter national conference of journal ists, seeking to protect re porters on dangerous assign ments has proposed the issu ance of an international press card that would be recognized by all governments or authori ties in effect implicated in conflicts.

title: AARON LASSER
description: NEWARK, Sept. 12Aaron Lasser, senior member of the law firm of Lasser, Lasser, Sarokin & Hochman here and former vice dean of the Univer sity of Newark, now part of Rutgers University, died today at his home, 42 Troy Drive, Springfield. His age was 75.

title: Pro Football Alignment for 1970
description: Pro Football Alignment for 1970

title: John Henry Strohmeier Weds Suzanne Chandler in Vermont
description: BOMOSEEN, Vt., Sept. 12Miss Suzanne Barbey Chandler, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Merritt C. Chandler of Neshobe Island, Vt., and Rochester, was married this afternoon to John Henry Strohmeier. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Daniel D. Strohmeier of Scarsdale, N. Y., and Nonquitt, Mass. The ceremony, with a text written by the couple, was performed by the Rev. Robert Hundemann of the Methodist Church of North field in the Woods at the Chandler home on Neshobe Island. The bride's family owns the island, which had been the property of the late Alexander. Woollcott, jour nalist and critic.

title: Wien Adds To Holdings In Texas
description: In deals totalling about $16million, Lawrence A. Wien has purchased 10 gar den apartment developments in Dallas and Houston with a total of 1,218 rental unit.

title: Roosevelt: The Soldier Of Freedom
description: The biographer of Franklin D. Roosevelt in World War II confronts a formidable assigninent. His account must range from frozen Murmansk to the tropical Solomons, from the assembly line at Boeing to the Livadia Palace at Yalta. He must be equally adept at military history and political analysis, attuned to the nu ances of diplomacy in foreign chan celleries and to the explosive social disruptions in this country.

title: Suffolk U. Chief Resigns
description: BOSTON, Sept. 12 (AP) John E. Fenton has resigned as president of Suffolk University, the university announced Thursday.

title: Sweater girls, 1970 version
description: This is shaping up as the year of the sweater. Shortshort, and combined with a skirt, or long long, which makes it a dress, the sweater that clings reflects fash ion's current bodyconsciousness.

title: Subways in Europe Booming, but Softly
description: Officials in Frankfurt, West Germany, with an eye for fig ures have put up a big sign on a tornup downtown street showing a shapely girl in top less attire.

title: Favored Horton Hanover Wins Cardigan Bay Pace
description: FREEHOLD, N. J., Sept. 12 Horton Hanover, the favorite, led from wire to wire at Free hold Raceway this afternoon in winning the $10,000 Cardigan Bay Pace by two lengths in the time of 2:003/5 for the mile.

title: Courses and Classes
description: THE Garden Club of New Jersey will hold its sixth annual Sympo sium at the Governor Morris Inn, Morristown on Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday. The sessions will run from 9 A.M. to 4 P.M. the first two days and from 9 A.M. to noon the third day.

title: SHARP RISE CITED IN SHELTER COSTS
description: The cost of shelter has in creased rapidly in the last five years, in sharp contrast to a slower rise in the 10 years be tween 1955 and 1965, a United States Labor Department offi cial reported last week.

title: Anemia Group Sets Fete
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., Sept. 12The ninth annual lunch eon and fashion show of the Long Island chapter of the Cooley's Anemia Blood and Research Foundation for Children will be held at the Garden City Hotel on Sept. 24. Mrs. Joseph Brazzamano is chairman for the event. Tickets are 6.50 a person.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: To the Editor: Ghastly as the kidnapping of innocent travelers to the Jordan desert must seem to all humane persons, there is an aspect to this event that re quires special attention. We refer to the fact that the Arab revolutionaries [at first] al towed nonJewish women and Children to leave the captive planes and go to a hotel in Amman, while forcing all Jew ish women and childrenThe Geneva Conference re jected Washington's terms and Washington was compelled to pledge not to disturb the ac cords, acknowledging its U.N. obligation to respect Vietnam's territorial integrity and inde pendence. But it had already initiated unilaterally its policy of partition and of imposing Diem upon the south. Disregarding the Conference accords, the will of the Viet namese, its own pledge and the U.N. Charter, it has persisted right up to the present in trying to disrupt Vietnam's territorial integrity and to yoke the south with unsavory, unpopular regimes. The absence of enforcement powers does not exempt na tions from the obligations of international law, nor does it modify the criminal character of our war in Vietnam as juridi cally defined at Nuremberg. Moreover, the lawlessness of U.S. behavior in Indochina does not place Mr. Nixon in a posi tion to exhort Americans to respect law at home. His only course now consistent with law is to get out of Vietnam, and to leave political resolution tothe Vietnamese and the inter national community.Max GORDON New York, Aug. 1970CeaseFire Opposed To the Editor: Your Aug. 30 editorial Talk or TalkFight in Vietnamurged that the Unite& States propose a standstill ceasefire. A standstill ceasefire pro posal could signal weakness. The people of South Vietnam may feel that the initiator isno longer able to carry on the struggle. Popular support could move toward the other side. Enforcement of a standstill ceasefire would be extremely difficult, especially in the rural areas. The activities of the allied forces are relatively openand easy to see. Communist activities are well camouflaged and difficult to see. Even if military activity could be controlled, Vietcong and North Vietnamese political terror would continue as it has in ceasefires. Themoves into allied territories by night and returns to his sanctuaries before dawn. Negotiations following the ceasefire would be long and drawn out. The terrorist assault on South Vietnam would continue. The Government's posi tion in the South would begin to erode and its negotiating would be weakened.power CARL S. TRIMBLE East Lansing, Mich. Sept. 3, 1970 Poverty Lawyers To the Editor: We in the Office of Economic Opportunity Legal Services program currently have two urgent concerns. One is our very limited budget, which youyour Aug. 11. Millions of poor peo pie live in areas where no Legal Services lawyers are available. Even those living where projects exist arc finding it in creasingly difficult to obtainservice because the attorneys are carrying such heavy case loads. Federal funding must be increased substantially in fiscal 1971.

title: Robert S. Salant Weds Miss Moffat
description: LOCUST VALLEY, L. L, Sept. 12Miss Marilyn Mof fat and Robert S. Salant were married here this after noon in St. John's of Letting town Episcopal Church by the Rev. Charles Harrah of the Reformed Church of Brook ville.

title: Major League TeamAgainstTeam Records
description: Major League TeamAgainstTeam Records

title: They survived a nuclear war
description: Angela Carter's new novel is set in the future, in an un named country peopled by sur vivors of a nuclear war. The land is now thickly wooded, and there are wild beasts, lions and tigers, descendants of those that escaped from zoos during the war. Presumably as a re suit of genetic mutations caused by radiation, the species Homo faber has split up, and there are now also other genuses of man, such as Homo praedatrix and Homo silvestris.

title: Nigeria Plans Celebration
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Sept. 12 (Agence France  Presse)  All the leaders of Independent African states have been in vited to attend celebrations of Nigeria's 10th year of independ ence on Oct. 1.

title: Flatbush Streets Blocked To Protest Heavy Traffic
description: Residents of Brooklyn's Flat bush section continued today to block streets to protest the increased flow of traffic as a result of the new Kings Plaza Shopping Center.

title: Auto Union Cuts FirstYear Wage Demands but Remains Firm on Other Issues as Strike Deadline Nears
description: DETROIT, Sept. 12  The United Automobile Workers came down in their wage de mands for the first year of a threeyear contract today but remained firm on other issues in an effort to reach a settle ment before the strike deadline set for midnight Monday.

title: In Memoriam
description: Announcements of deaths, marriages, births and enaagementa may be tele phoned to Oxford 53311 until 11 P.M. in suburban offices; 9:00 A.M. to 4:30 P.M. Monday through Friday Newark (2M) Market 33900; White Plains White Plains 95300: Hempstead 010 Ivanhoe 36660: Commack (516) 5435400; Stamford (203) 3487767.

title: VERMONT APLANT CALLED A THREAT
description: MONTPELIER, Vt., Sept. 12 Vermont conservationists ap pealed to the state today to order construction halted on a 1135million nuclear power plant at Vernon on the Con necticut River, arguing that radiation emission from they plant woutcr emitinger human life.

title: School Talks in Toledo
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, Sept. 12 (UPI)The Toledo Federation of Teachers and members of the school board will resume contract negotiations Monday with the help of a mediator in an attempt to solve a pay dis pute that set off a strike by the city's 2,500 teachers. The teachers refused to begin classes Wednesday after reject ing a contract offer calling for a scale of $7,100 minimum to a $12,200 top.

title: jersey City Gets A Modern Look
description: JERSEY CITY  On a gray day, much of Jersey City tends to be depressing. Grimy industrial buildings are land scaped by weedgrown lots that adjoin halfused railroad yards where a reconditioned passenger car dating to the early years of the century points up the shabbiness of decadesold loading platforms and crumbling freight cars.

title: PRINCETON SPLIT ON BUILDING PLAN
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Sept: 12 A dispute over the proposed construction of an 11story lux ury office building on Mount Lucas Road in Princeton Township, about three miles from the Center of Princeton and the university, has split this quiet community.

title: LONDON IS WILLING TO FREE HIJACKER
description: LONDON, Sept. 12The Brit ish Government announced to night that it was prepared to hand over Leila Khaled, the 24 yearold woman hijacker, as part of a settlement with Arab guerrillas.

title: Orioles 3 Homers Sink Red Sox, 51; Phoebus Triumphs
description: BALTIMORE, Sept. 12 (AP) Homers by Mark Belanger, Frank Robinson and Boog Powell paced the Baltimore Orioles to a 51 victory over the Boston Red Sox tonight. Tom Phoebus gained his first triumph in more than four months.

title: Now Mama and Papa Sell Prints
description: ONE of the surprising developments on the American art scene for the past few sea sons has been the flourishing trade in the graphic arts. Artists of all persuasions Abstractionist, realist, Pop have taken to the various print media in increasing numbers. Many galleries Marlborough, Pace, Richard Feigeff, among othersin ad dition to their normal trade in painting and sculpture, have opened galleries spe cifically devoted to contem porary prints.

title: Mrs. Susan A. Evans Is Married to William Aldrich
description: SANTA BARBARA, Calif., Sept. 12Mrs. Susan Albert son Evans, daughter of Mrs. Gilmer Olney of Pacific Pali sades and the late Myron Charles Albertson Jr. of Los Angeles, was married here last night to William Mc Laughry Aldrich, a son of the film producer and director Robert Aldrich and of Mrs. Geeorge Drazich, both of Los Angeles.

title: Mideast Missile Madness
description: While the lawless and inhuman acts of Palestinian extremists draw the censure of a horrified world, the Soviet Union and Egypt are compounding the damage to their own credibility, to the prospect for a Mideast settlement and to the future willingness of others enter agreements with them by claiming that Egypt's massive missile buildup in the Suez area was permitted by the language of the standstill ceasefire pact.

title: For day games, pants suits
description: One of the consequences of Women's Lib is that more women are visiting baseball stadiums and, in the company of their husbands, are spend ing more time in front of TV watching the game. But base

title: STATE SEEKS TO END PHILADELPHIA STRIKE
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 12 (UPI)The chief state media tor, Philip Curran, entered teacher contract negotiations here today in an effort to break a deadlock before a P.M. Sunday deadline set by Gov. Raymond P. Shafer.

title: Shuttle to the Rockaways Closed for Over 6 Hours
description: Train service on the HH shut tle line to the Rockaways over the Broad Channel Bridge and trestle was suspended for more than six hours yesterday when the rear car of an empty threecar train became derailed on the bridsze.

title: Ellen Goldsmith, W. A. Blumstein Wed in Suburbs
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., Sept. 12The Westchester Reform Temple was the setting here this evening for the marriage of Miss Ellen Alice Goldsmith and William Alan Blumstein, 1970 graduates of Pace Col lege Westchester. Rabbi Jack Stern Jr. performed the cere mony, he was assisted by the Rev. Dr. Nathan A. Perilman. The bride, who attended Lake Erie College and re ceived a degree in nursing from Pace, is the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Harry Price Goldsmith. Her father, former president of the Hess,. Gold smith division of Burlington Industries, Inc., is a partner in Rothschild & Co., stock brokers.

title: AL UNSER TAKES HOOSIER HUNDRED
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Sept. 12 (AP) Al Unser beat back an early challenge by A. J. Foyt Jr. to day and won the rich Hoosier Hundred auto race at a record greed of 97.944 miles an hour.

title: TAGGE STANDS OUT AT QUARTERBACK
description: LINCOLN, Neb., Sept. 12 (AP)  Ninthranked Nebraska, combining the sharp passing of its quarterback, Jerry Tagge, with the running of a bevy of fleet backs, overpowered Wake Forest, 3612, today in the football opener for both teams.

title: Nell Cross Holloway to Be Wed To William Jay Iselin on Oct. 24
description: SUMMIT, N. J., Sept. 12 The engagement of Miss Nell Cross Holloway to William Jay Iselin has been an nounced by her parents, Dr. and Mrs. Frederic Ancrum Lord Holloway of Summit and Stratton Mountain, Vt.

title: Science
description: Who has not wondered what thrust up the moun tains and carved out the ocean basins? For thousands of years men have pondered these questions and the more they learned the more diffi cult did the answers seem to become.

title: SAMUEL H. GIANGRECO
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., Sept. 12Samuel H. Giangreco, di rector of physical education at Albert Leonard High School and former city Superintendent of Recreation, died today in Mount Vernon Hospital. He was 63 years old and lived at 29 Lee Court.

title: A Bigger Role For the Reserves And Guard
description: Guard and Reserve units  will be prepared to be the initial and primary source of augmen tation of the active forces in any future emergency requiring rapid and substantial expansion of the active forces.

title: Cardinal Suenens Urges New Ecumenical Council
description: BRUSSELS, Sept. 12Leo Cardinal Suenens, the Roman Catholic primate of Belgium, opened a major theological con gress here today, declaring that it was time to move beydnd Ecumenical Council Vatican II and to prepare the next phase in the history of the church.

title: 25 Pat Nixon Is the Ultimate Good Sport
description: THE COVERThe First Lady shares front and center with the President at a White House reception this summer for Mr. Nixon's Whittier College class of 34. Her handling of such obligatory performances has helped to earn her kudosand some criticism as the pluperfect political helpmate.

title: Headliners
description: Controversial Trip

title: Maritime Aide to Speak
description: James F. Fanseen, vice chair man of the Federal Maritime Commission, will be the princi pal speaker at a luncheon to be held Sept. 29 at the New York Hilton Hotel in conjunction with the Third International Ship ping and Containerization Ex position and Congress at the New York Coliseum.

title: Decentralized City Schools Begin Classes Tomorrow
description: The city school system will start its first year of decentral ized operations tomorrow with a new Chancellor, a new net work of elected community school boards, a record number of pupils1,140,575and a host of persistent problems.

title: Courses and Classes
description: THE Garden Club of New Jersey will hold its sixth annual Sympo sium at the Governor Morris Inn, Morristown on Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday. The sessions will run from 9 A.M. to 4 P.M. the first two days and from 9 A.M. to noon the third day.

title: Joan U. Harwood Bride Of Lieut. John Hazelton
description: ROSLYN, L. I., Sept 12 Trinity Episcopal Church here was the setting this after noon for the marriage of Miss Joan Underwood Harwood, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Raymond Charles Harwood of Roslyn. Estates, to Lieut. John Douglas Hazelton, U.S.A.F., son of Mr. and Mrs. Harry B. Hazelton Jr. of Plandome and Hilton Head, S. C.

title: Advertising:
description: Man for man, the members of the medical profession must be the targets of more advertising and promotional dollars than almost any other group. Especially, if you nar row the field to those in pri vate practicethose who write prescriptions.

title: The Heart of Portugal:
description: CASCAIS, PortugalTires squeal as minicar drivers rip around the bend that winds past the little fishing harbor. On the terrace of the hotel across the road, the visitors sip their coffee and gaze at the fisherfolk at work amid the jumble of brightly painted boats, nets, grappling hooks floats and oars.

title: Hnueilings
description: Hnueilings

title: Robert Lux Fiance Of Miss Newcomb
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., Sept 12Miss Nancy Newcomb of Arlington, Va., an assist ant underwriter with the North America Life Assur ance Company in Washing ton, plans to be married Dec. 19 to Robert It Lux of Mercerville, N. J., a regional support engineer for the midAtlantic region of the Digital Equipment Corpora tion of Princeton, N. J.

title: Theater at StratfordonAvon
description: STRATFORDONAVON, Eng. IT BEING staged by Peter Brook, famed for Marat/ Sade, it goes almost without saying that this is a defoliated Midsummer ' Night's Dream. Gone from the Royal Shakespeare Com pany's production are the terpsichorean fairies, the vernal glades, the mischievous woods. In their place: white, gymnasium  styled quadrangle hung with swings and ropes and surmounted by a metal catwalk from which hovering actors emit sounds, throw confetti, burble, heckle, kibitz and brood.

title: Chess
description: GRANDMASTER Bent Larsen of Denmark, scoring 101, cap tured first place in the recent 71st U. S. Open at the Parker House in Boston. From all sections of the nation and from Canada, Denmark, England and Brazil, 307 players at tendeda record for the event.

title: PORT ACCIDENTS ON DECLINE HERE
description: Continued efforts in the field of safety have enabled the New York port's longshore industry to buck the national industrial trend toward more onthejob accidents.

title: Yuli Daniel, Soviet Writer, Free After Completing 5Year Term
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 12Yuli M. Daniel, the Soviet writer whose arrest and conviction for pub lishing works in the West helped draw attention to the dissident movement, was re leased today after serving his fiveyear term for slandering the Soviet state.

title: Adioo Bob, $29.20, Captures New York Sire Pace by Head
description: YONKERS, Sept, 12Adioo Bob paced fourwide through the stretch and just got up to beat Arrnbro Kodiak by a head in the $26,225 New York Sire Stakes onemile event tonight at Yonkars Raceway.

title: Can TV Save Opera?
description: IT seems that TV is here to stay. But what about opera? Is opera dead, as some people like to think? Dead enough to be ceremoni ously exhibited in a mauso leumsometimes called mu seumof the Metropolitan La Scala type, at least so long as these houses are not burned down, as prescribed by Pierre Boulez?

title: BULLDOG IS BEST AT LEHIGH VALLEY
description: EMMAUS, Pa., Sept. 12A 2yearold bulldog, Ch. West field Flying Colors, owned and bred by Charles and Virginia Westfield of Huntington, L. I., gaited to bestinshow honors over 1,411 rivals today at the 42nd annual Lehigh Valley Kennel Club event.

title: New Atlanta Track Is Gamble To Sell Road Racing to South
description: GAINESVILLE, Ga., Sept. 12Tomorrow's CanAm race here will introduce the coun try's newest roadracing fa cility, Road Atlanta, a $1.3 million project that provides most of the amenities that racing fans have a right to expect. Although the circuit is not yet finished, this 380 acre plant already shows what kind of gem it should ofin a couple of years. It is 2.5 mile layout that loops round two treestudded hills and cruises below gras slopes. Road Atlanta is

title: Drake Sinks Idaho State
description: DES MOINES, Iowa, Sept. 12 (AP)Mike Grejbowski threw) five touchdown passes today, and Drake gained a 3910 foot ball victory over Idaho State. All of Drake's scoring came by passing.

title: 100,000 POPULATION TOPPED IN 25 CITIES
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 12 (AP) The Census Bureau has an nounced that at least 25 cities grew to more than 100,000 pop ulation in the nineteensixties and that five dropped below that size.

title: Ballerina Says She Left Soviet for Art Reasons
description: LONDON, Sept. 12  Na talya Makarova, the Russian ballerina, said today in a statement that she defected to the West to win the free dom of choice she needed to develop as an artist.

title: HusbandWife Teams Entered In Marathon Run Here Today
description: Nearly 200 entrants were ex pected to show up in Central Park at 11 oclock this morn ing for the running of the first New York Marathon.

title: DR. JACOB MINER, ECONOMIST, DEAD
description: PRINCETON, N.J., Sept. 12  Dr. Jacob Viner, an economic adviser to Government agencies for four decades and Walker Professor of Economics and In ternational Finance, emeritus, at Princeton University, died today at Princeton Hospital. He was 78 years old.

title: Canada Names Balding, Cox
description: TORONTO, Sept. 12 (AP) The Canadian Professional Golf ers Association today named Al Balding of Toronto and Bob Cox of Richmond, British Co lumbia, to represent Canada in the World Cup matches at Bue nos Aires, Argentina, Nov. 12 to 15.

title: Article 24  No Title
description: One little dress.

title: Margaret Stone Becomes a Bride
description: NEWFANE, Vt., Sept. 12 Miss Margaret Ann Stone, a magna cum laude graduate of Radcliffe College, was mar ried here this afternoon to Lane Eaton Jennings, a cum laude graduate of Williams College with a master's and a Ph.D. degree in German liter ature from Harvard Univer sity.

title: Couve May Visit Peking
description: PEKING, Sept. 12 (Agence FrancePresse) Former Premier Maurice Couve de Murville of France will pay a private visit to China soon, probably next month, diplomatic sources said today.

title: The Merchant's View:
description: Cooler weather and the late pickup in backtoschool buy ing brought an improvement in retail sales last week. Re ports from most areas of the country indicated that consumers are showing more willingness to buy after a month of lagging sales.

title: Field Of Travel
description: WHEN THE Boeing 747 Jumbo jet first appeared, it was thought in many circles to be a gigantic fly ing white elephant. Now, after eight months of regular service, the elephant shows signs of changing its color at least according to its keepers.

title: 16 Named to State Health Ad visory Unit
description: ALBANY, Sept. 12 (UPI) The appointments of 16 new members of the Advisory Council to the State Health Planning Commission were an nounced this week by Governor Rockefeller.

title: Dig a Big Hole First
description: KEEP the tree planting job simple by focusing on the basic idea the roots should be in as healthy a state as possible during and after transplanting.

title: A Red Cross Greeting Is Sent to New Mother
description: GENEVA, Sept. 12The head of the International Committee of the Red Cross took time out from the ne gotiations for the release of the hostages to send his best wishes to the woman from the United States who gave birth to a baby on one of the hijacked planes.

title: Virgin Islands Inquiry
description: CHARLOTTE AMALIE, V. I., Sept. 12 (AP)Gov. Melvin H. Evans ordered today an investi gation of possible irregularities in last week's Democratic pri mary election in the Virgin Is lands. Senator Alexander Far relly won the Democratic gu bernatorial nomination by 342 votes out of 6,960 cast, defeat ing former Attorney General Francisco Corneiro. Mr. Evans said he asked Attorney General Peter J. O'Dea to conduct the investigation to preserve the integrity of the voting process.

title: No time for humor
description: After 26 years of continuous publication The Carolina Israel ite ceased publication a couple of years ago, thereby ending the most notable adventure in highly personal journalism since Ed Howe's, a generation earlier. Harry Golden, editor (Abee Gezundt.) and proprietor, assigned several reasonsill health, decreasing vigor, expanding costs and shrinking revenuesbut in the volume of his works immediate ly preceding this one, he as signed another reason, more profound than the rest and, un fortunately, one instantly under stood by nearly all Americans.

title: ENGLISH BEAT U.S. IN COURT TENNIS
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 12 England rallied to defeat the United States, 32, and retain the Van Men Cup after eight hours of competition today at the Racquet Club in the bien nial court tennis series for players 25 years of age and under.

title: Miss Betty Jane Sittman Married
description: MORRIS PLAINS, N. J., Sept. 12  Miss Betty Jane Sittmann, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Walter G. Stitt mann, was married here this morning to Gregory John Gotlinger, son of Mr. and Mrs. John I. Gotlinger of Short Hills. The bridegroom's fa ther is president of the Peck & Peck stores.

title: Booklet Tells Students How to Disrupt Campus
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md., Sept. 12 (AP)A leftist undergrad uate group at the University of Maryland has published a booklet that tells incoming students how to organize and carry out campus disorders.

title: A Contrast on Court
description: The, style of the two prota gonists in the final of the United States Open singles today at Forest Hills will be as contrasting as a black smith and a cellist. Tony Roche's serve fully fits the role of a hammer docked to strike down Ken Rosewall's precision ground strokes.

title: The Public Wants Only
description: WE hear dire reports these days that the recording of serious music is soon coming to an end. Increasingly, news circu lates that this or that large record company is about to discontinue serious recording. Obviously, friends of con temporary music must be concerned with such trends, especially since new music is still so dreadfully underrepre sented on records. And thus, when we are told that no one cares about serious music any more, that the industry must follow, the market, and that our recorded future will contain only the groovy, we experience a concern greater than that of the record collector whose main less will be deprivation of his twelfth version of Beethoven's Seventh.

title: UNRULY LAWYERS SEEN AS COURT ILL
description: LAKE PLACID, N.Y., Sept. 12 Several lawyers and Federal Judges sai dtoday that ob streperous lawyers sometimes posed greater court problems than did crowded calendars or other court difficulties.

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: For the first time in a year, improvement has been noted nationally in the rate of payment on home mort gages.

title: Perry's Lightning Leads
description: NOROTON, Conn., Sept. 12 David Perry of the Pequot Yacht Club, of Southport, sailed, Bullitt into a 4point lead today in the fifth regatta of the new Northern Circuit for the Lightning Class on Long Island Sound.

title: European Notebook
description: A new novel by Herve Bazin of the Academie Goncourt, Les Bienheureux de La Desolation, stands out as the most original work of French fiction in an otherwise undistinguished sea son. Based on fact, this adven

title: the traveler's world
description: THERE WILL be speechifying Thurs day near the hamlet of Milesburg in the middle of northern Pennsylvania, Gov. Raymond P. Shafer will cut ribbon and the Keystone Shortway, better known as Interstate 80, will be officially opened for carrying traffic 313 miles between the New Jersey border at Delaware Water Gap near Stroudsburg to the Ohio line between Sharon, Pa., and Youngstown.

title: Miss Sharon Merel Fiancee of Student
description: HIGHLAND PARK, N. J., Sept. 12Mr. and Mrs. Lee P. Merel have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Sharon F. Merel, to Barry Alan Kronman, son of Mayor Samuel J. Kronman of Highland Park and Mrs. Kronman.

title: History Colonial, Civil and Natural All Together
description: SHEFFIELD, Mass.The Colonel Ash ley House: where the first American declaration of independence from Eng land was drawn up; home of Mum Bet, a slave whose successful bid for free dom in a Massachusetts court marked a milestone in the early antislavery movement.

title: Unaligned Find Common Cause In Africa
description: LUSAKA, Zambia  Slowly the infectious rhythm of a Zam bian freedom song, with its re frain Let's go forward together with one heart, filled the mag nificent copperlined Mulungushi Hall. Zambian President Kenneth Kaunda led the song in a clear, sure Voibe and was joined, first hesitantly, then enthusiastically, by the dignified monarchs, pres idents, princes and prime minis ters, clapping in unison.

title: Two Die in Plane Crash
description: BEACON, N. Y., Sept. 12 (AP) The wreckage of singleengine private plane with the bodies of an un identified man and woman in side was discovered today in the Clarence Fahnestock Me morial State Park east of here.

title: Mary Amon to Be Bride
description: RAHWAY, N. J., Sept. 12 Announcement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. William A. Amon of the engagement of their daughter, Miss Mary E. Amon, to Louis C. De Maria Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. De Maria of Roselle Park. The bridetobe is a senior at St. Peter's College in Jersey City. Her fianc, who is en tering his second year at Jef ferson Medical College, Phila delphia, is a graduate of St. Peter's.

title: It Looks Like A Big Season Ahead
description: WITH summer vaca tions behind them, most collectors are eager to resume their monthly club meetings and make plans for auctions, local shows, field trips and conventions during the com ing fall and winter season. Dealers, many with stocks replenished during shopping trips in July and August, share this enthusiasm, antici pating the big auctions ahead.

title: Economic Indicators
description: Statistics for commercialagricultural loans, carloadings, steel, oil, electric power and business failures are for the preceding week and latest available.

title: KANSAS OUTSCORES WASH. STATE, 4731
description: LAWRENCE, Kan., Sept. 12 (UPI)Dan Heck, the quarter back, threw three touchdown passes, including the game clincher with less than four minutes remaining, as Kansas fought off Washington State, 4831, today in the football opener for both schools.

description: YASUO KUN IYOSHIFar Gallery, 746 Madison Avenue. Graphics and draw ings. Through Sept. 26.

title: Article 19  No Title
Edith Smart Is Married To Eugene M. Moore 3d
description: GREENFIELD HILL, Conn., Sept. 12Miss Edith Min turn Smart was married here this afternoon in St. Timothy's Episcopal Church to Eugene Maxwell Moore 3d. The Rev. Jeffrey Kittredge performed the ceremony. The bride is a daughter of S. Bruce Smart Jr., group vice president, paper opera tions, of the Continental Can Company, Inc., New York, and Mrs. Smart of Fairfield. She is a granddaughter of S. Bruce Smart of Peru, Vt., retired chairman of Fruit of the Loom, Inc., New York, and of Mrs. Edwin K. Merrill of Bedford Hills, N. Y., and the late Mr. Merrill, who was executive director of the Children's Aid Society in New York.

title: Chinatown Festival Tonight
description: A free outdoor cultural festi val will be held in Chinatown, starting today at 8 P.M. The fes tival, organized by the China town Planning Council and the China Institute in America, is designed to promote Chinese cul tural activities, provide free en tertainment for the Chinese community and advance local Chinese artistic talent. The pro gram, which will include Chi nese music, operas, magicians and a fashion show, will be held on Saturdays and Sundays through Oct. 25.

title: AGNEW ATTACKS SENATE TARGETS
description: PALM SPRINGS, Calif., Sept. 12Vice President Agnew said today that in the coming ampaign he would designate the Senators and Senate candi dates whose defeat he would advocate.

title: CLEMSON DEFEATS THE CITADEL 240
description: CLEMSON, S. C., Sept. 12 (UPI)Ray Yauger scored two touchdowns today, one on a pass reception and the other on a plunge off tackle, to lead the Clemson Tigers to a 240 open ing victory over The Citadel.

title: National Charter That Would Abolish States
description: WASHINGTONIf the Found ing Fathers were to meet again 183 years after they completed their work on the Constitution, what kind of document would they draft for today's radically different nation? The members of the Center for the Study of Democratic Institutions in Santa Barabara, Calif., asked them selves that question and after six years of onandoff delibera tions and about 37 revisions, they have now published their answer.

title: Importing Liquor in Bulk Cuts Its Cost
description: More and more Americans who enjoy Scotch whisky are discovering the economy that comes from importing it in 5, 250gallon containers, rather than by the fifth or quart.

title: Business Index Rises In Week
description: The New York Times Weekly Index of Business Activity rose to 393.9 from 347.6 a week earlier. A year ago it was 359.5.

title: WOMAN IS KILLED IN SYRACUSE FIRE
description: SYRACUSE, Sept. 12  A young woman was killed late last night in a fire in a pre dominantly black neighborhood where fire engines allegedly rolled up 90 minutes after a teenager had called the Fire Department to report the blaze.

title: The Black Situation
description: In a survey conauctea sev eral years ago to determine which black writers, past and present, were considered most important among black writ ers themselves, a distinguished respondent of conservative stance pointed to a young uni versity lecturer and essayist named Addison Gayle Jr. as a bright new hope for literary achievement. The suggestion was that Mr. Gayle, a scholar who had pursued his creden tials through the proper edu cational channels, could be ex pected to give appropriate academic weight and emphasis to his literary efforts. Mr. Gayle, the eminent writer in timated, would sensibly paddle his budding career into the American literary mainstream.

title: The Ray Charles In Influence on Joe Cocker
description: JOE COCKER, MAD DOGS & ENGLISH MEN: Joe Cocker (A & M SP 6002). One of the measures of the ex traordinary talent of Ray Charles is the fact that it has been such a significant factor in the development of performers such as Joe Cocker and Tom Jones. Both are English, and although both have looked to Charles for inspiration, they have come up with markedly dif ferent personal interpreta tions of Charles's style. Where Jones is slick and plastic, Cocker is funky and rough; where Jones bases his visual appeal on overtly gross sexual posturing, Cock er's is in his almost spastic physical involvement with the rhythmic flow of the mu sic.

title: Article 11  No Title
description: Trailing, 90, after a quick Oregon State safety and touchdown in a 15second span late in the second period, U.C.L.A. marched 80 yards to its first score in the early mo ments of the third period.

title: Quebec's Premier Is Courting Business Investment From U. S.
description: QUEBEC, Sept. 12 .While other Canadians may deplore and fear the United States cul tural and economic impact, often called a takeover of their country, Robert Bourassa, the new Premier of Quebec, is aggressively wooing United States investment.

title: Sports of The Times
description: In moments of selfcastigation, Denny McLain had a favorite descriptive phrase: I'm double dumb. Denny underestimated the situation with so restrained a count. His dumbness is so monumental as to be beyond arithmetical calculation. It be gins to look as if he now has completed the job of destroying himself.

title: Shift in Arms Balance at Suez Canal Seen
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 12A growing number of senior Ad ministration officials now pri vately conclude that recent movements of Sovietmanufac tured surfacetoair missiles to ward the Suez Canal have shifted the military balance in the canal zone to the dis advantage of Israel.

title: Beverly Elga Johnson Engaged To Wed John Joseph Gellner Jr.
description: FAR HILLS, N. J., Sept. 12 Mr. and Mrs. Robert DeL. Johnson have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Beverly Elga Johnson, to John Joseph Gellner Jr. of Princeton. He is the son of Mr. Gellner of Flemington and the late Mrs. Gellner. A wedding in January is planned.

title: Eleanor Land Wed to Officer
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Sept. 12Miss Eleanor Louise Land, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Gay Vallee Land, was married here today in the United Methodist Church to Lieut. Stuart Ramsey Rus sell U.S.A., son of Mr. and Mrs. Harvey S. Russell of Verona. N. J.

title: BENVENUTI STOPS DOYLE IN THE TENTH
description: BARI, Italy, Sept. 12 (AP) The world middleweight cham pion, Nino Benvenuti of Italy, stopped Doyle Baird of Akron, Ohio, in the 10th and last round of a nontitle fight tonight.

title: Nijinsky Captures 11th Straight Race
description: DONCASTER, England, Sept. 12He was at least 30 lengths back, maybe 50, but it doesn't matter, since there are no of ficial charts in English racing. And it didn't matter that Nijinsky was that far back, either.

title: Lynda Barness Will Be Bride Of Evan Urdang
description: RYDAL, Pa., Sept. 12The engagement of Miss Lynda. Anne Barness, a student at Jackson College of Tufts University, to Evan Scott Urdang a senior at Tufts, has been announced by her parents, Mr. and Mrs. Her bert Barness of Rydal and Buckingham. Mr. Urdang is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Laur ence J. Urdang of Plain field N.J.

title: Gains Shown Here By Service Industry
description: New York City's economy, once dominated by manufac tiring, is shifting toward the service industries, according to recent data on employment trends in the last decade.

description: WILTON, Conn., Sept. 12 Andrea de Marco of Shelton scored an equitation double to day when she captured the medal class and the horseman ship championship at the Wil ton horse show.

description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark.Some old voting patterns were shaken up in a wide variety of races throughout the South last week.

description: DARIEN, Conn., Sept. 12 Miss Virginia KemballCook, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Denis Basil KemballCook of Darien, was married here this afternoon to Jonathan Charles Kirby Peake, who is serving in the Army. His parents are Mr. and Mrs. Kirby Peake of Bronxville. N. Y.

title: Leeds Suffers Its First Loss of Season in English Soccer League
description: LONDON, Sept. 12 (Reuters) Leeds United, the First Di vision soccer leader, suffered its first league defeat of the season today when it bowed to Stoke City. 30.

description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 12 (AP)The pattern of the war in South Vietnam con tinued in much the same pat tern today as it has in recent weeks, with most of the action in the northern provinces and in the Mekong Delta.

title: Patricia Coxe Patterson Is Bride
description: ROSLYN, L. I., Sept. 12 Miss Patricia Coxe Patterson, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edward Patterson of Glen Head, was married here to day to Robert Winthrope Kean 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Kean Jr. of West Orange, N. J. and New York. The cere money was performed in St. Mary's Roman Catholic Church by the Rev. Thomas Menoque. A reception fol lowed at the home of the bride's parents.

title: Movie Mailbag
description: Q. Why, in your opinion, Mr. Higham, did Peter Bogdanovich attack your book, The Films of Orson Welles, in The Times Arts and Leisure Section of Aug. 30 as a collection of halftruths, mis representations, mythical anecdotes, factual lapses, and conclusions based on false information?

title: A Bit of Good News From Madison?
description: IF everything went off as planned, the Univer sity of Wisconsin in Madison opened its new Elvehjem Art Center yester day. Seen last week, all ready to go except for the potted trees, which were still being carried into the skylighted central court the galleries seemed mercifully detached from the campus violence re flected in scarred buildings nearby and the air of tension throughout the city. The building itself, designed by Harry Weese of Chicago, has a reassuring serenity and confidence about it, and the two exhibitions, one of the university's permanent col lection, the other of 19th and 20th century art on loan from alumni and friends, are by their retrospective nature un impeachably divorced from the Political conflicts of the moment that erupted so tragically.

title: Biggest dictionary value ever wed In paperback
description: I Largest number of entries55,000

title: Wien Adds To Holdings In Texas
description: In deals totalling about $16million, Lawrence A. Wien has purchased 10 gar den apartment developments in Dallas and Houston with a total of 1,218 rental unit.

title: Young Conservatives End 10thAnniversary Meeting
description: SHARON, Conn., Sept. 12 The conservative campus or ganization Young Americans for Freedom wound up a gath ering marking the 10th anni versary of its founding here to day at the elegant country es tate of William F. Buckley Jr., the conservative political leader.

title: Start Is Scrambled In Overnight Race; Doric Finishes First]
description: A scramble on the line in the second division of a fleet of 30 cruising yachts marred the start of the City Island Yacht Club's 35th annual over night race on Long Island Sound yesterday.

description: Everybody respects an honest man with high standards, Orin New field tells us. It gives them someone to look up to. Hanging from the end of a roue.

title: Israel Frees Fourteen Egyptian Sailors Despite Anger Over Guerrillas Hostages
description: JERUSALEM, Sept. 12Is rael today quietly released 14 Egyptian sailors picked up in distress off Haifa a week ago when their ship caught fire.

title: A matter of pedigrees
description: Two generations of Philadel phia Burts have delineated the Old Philadelphians as a type of character, pointing out who they are and why they are: first Struthers Burt in Phila delphia, Holy Experiment (1945); then two decades later Nathaniel Burt in Tne Peren nial Philadelphians (1963). Now the latternovelist, poet, musicologist and historian having concluded that men who carry hereditary distinctions are just as representative of American life as is the self made man, has selected for in tensive study five political or service families which he con siders to be exemplars of a special kind of aristocracy pe culiar to this country. They are powerful yet private, lack any official certification, yet have proved themselves capable of remarkable feats of self renewal.

title: Bombing Arrest Made
description: GARDNER, Mass., Sept. 12 (AP)Ernest J. King, 26 years old, of Gardner, was arrested today in connection with an at tempted bombing of a garage at the Fitchburg police station last Sunday.

title: Man Found Dead in Street
description: Brooklyn firemen responding to an alarm at Hooper and South Second Streets in Brook lyn shortly after midnight today found a man lying in the street with a fatal shotgun wound in the chest. The police said that Encarnasio Agosto, 31 years old, of 258 Hayward Avenue, Brooklyn, was pronounced dead at the scene. Police officials said they had no immediate explana tion for the incident.

title: Lindsay to Get Award
description: Mayor Lindsay will receive the 1970 Family of Man Award of the Council of Churches of the City of New York at a din ner Oct. 26 at the New York Hilton hotel 'for his continued efforts toward solving what has seemed to many the massive problems of the inner city and urban living. Previous recipi ents include Presidents Eisen hower, Kennedy, Johnson and Nixon, Lester Pearson and Jean Monnet.

title: Article 20  No Title
description: appear in the shops and are as sud denly sold out and not reissued for a year; endless waiting for travel visas, which, once granted, entail Herculean effort to thrust through the constant throng at the issuing officeunless you can persuade the official to return the form to you at the side door after the office shuts. Nemdme, no more; nejede, out of order. Absenteeism is high, and the beer shops are full in the afternoons. Only 9 per cent of Prague workers are still party members: For a worker, expulsion is not so serious. He knows there's a need for labor, and he can always get another job.

title: The Urgency of Marxist Christian Dialogue
description: Among the many astonishing reversals in the direction of Christian thought in our time has been the changing attitude toward Marxism. The 20th cen

title: Then There Was Lully, Put a Baton in His Foot
description: TELL us about some more oddball deaths of composers, a reader urges in a letter commenting on the strange ending of the life of Francis Koczwara. (Those scholars who read this column will remember the discussion here about Koczwara, the composer of The Battle of Prague, who had himself hanged in a house of ill fame in London.) Surely there must be others in the history of music just as freakish.

title: Major League Baseball
description: National League

title: Nixon and Labor Rightists In Blue Collars
description: The Nixon Administration, elected over the almost unani mous opposition of the hierarchy of organized labor, has decided that labor can be made a princi pal building block of the con servative silent majority, on which it counts for a Republican election victory this fall. Presi dent and Mrs. Nixon welcomed hundreds of union chiefs and lesser functionaries at an un precedented White House recep tion on Labor Day. Vice Presi dent Agnew followed up three days later by addressing a verbal fusillade against the Democrat, calling them radical liberal enemies of the working man. The leaderless Democrats have thus far failed to mobilize any equally highpowered campaign batter ies to repel the attempted G.O.P. raids.

title: Nicole Szulc Plans Bridal
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 12 Mr. and Mrs. Tad Szulc have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Nicole Jean Szulc, to Stuart Bisohp, son of Mr. and Mrs. Edward Bishop of New York. The wedding will take place here on Oct. 18.

title: Pistons Release Four
description: YPSILANTI, Mich., Sept. 12 (UPI)The Detroit Pistons re duced their training camp ros ter to 15 today by cutting four rookies from the National Bas ketball Association club's squad. Coach Bill Van Breda Kolff cut Matthew Aitch, Sevira Brown of Depaul; Earl Hook of Hillsdale College in Michigan; and George Reynolds.

title: Education
description: For many children throughout the nation, schools opened last week only theoreticallythe doors were open but the teachers were on strike. The National Education Association (N.E.A.), whose local and state branches are probably responsible for as many strikes as its union rival, the American Federation of Teachers, estimated that more than one million school children would be affected by some form of school delays. To put matters into perspective, however, it must be remembered that the public elementary and secondary schools enroll 46million pupils.

title: Ohio State Hits Back At Playboy Magazine
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Sept. 12 (UPI)A spokesman for the Ohio State athletic depart ment charged today that Playboy magazine had not listed any Buckeyes on its football allAmerica first team because Coach Woody Hayes would not let them go to Chicago for photographs and a party.

title: Leematt Triumphs in $36,825 World's Playground Stakes at Atlantic City
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Sept. 12 (AP)  C. Oliver Goldsmith's Leematt led 13 rival colts and geldings in today's 25th running of the $36,825 World's Play ground Stakes at the Atlantic City race course.

title: Adding a yodel to the enchilada
description: Enchiladas in one form or another are basic to most Mexican menus. One of the most interesting is the one labeled Swiss. One food savant speculates that it might have been created by a visiting European chef, while others state that the only reason for the name is that the dish is made with cream and that cream is not a characteristically Mexican ingredient. There are many versions of this dish; the one that follows incorporates cream, tortillas, chilies, tomatoes and cheeses.

title: Spies of the Confederacy
description: The Civil War was made to order for spies and espionage: It was a war of movement, with armies scattered, often helter skelter, over wide areas; the border between North and South was full of holes; and th two sides had a common lan guage, in which even accents were no guide to allegiances, since many Northerners fought for the South and viceversa. The South outnumbered and operating usually on home grounds, seems to have found spying both more essential and more productive than did the North.

title: And Soon They Will Be Gone
description: SANTA CRUZ, Calif.Comical in their demeanor, as awkward on shore as they are graceful in the air, the absurdly ingratiating bagbilled brown pelicans have seemed as enduring an element of the Monterey Bay scene as the sea itself, the otters playing in the kelp, the gray whales spouting along the horizon. But the pelicans are diminishing at a shocking rate, and soon, scientists say, they will be gone.

title: BARRY TO JOIN NETS IN FIRST DRILL TODAY
description: The New York Nets, with newly acquired Rick Barry, seven holdovers from the squad that gained the American Bas ketball Assoiation playoffs for the first time last season and several rookie prospects, open their training camp today at St. Paul's School, Garden City, L.I.

title: GRANTS BY MARCOS CALLED POLITICAL
description: MANILA, Sept. 12When President Ferdinand E. Marcos signed into law last month a measure providing for constitutional convention, he pledged he would not interfere in an orderly election of dele gates.

title: Progress in Mt. Kisco Marches Into Traffic Snarl
description: MOUNT KISCO, N. Y. Every day when I'm ready to go home from work I say to myself, now why don't you just turn right and take the long way aroundin stead of even trying to make a left turn.

title: Anne U. Morgan And Craig Battle Marry in Jersey
description: PRINCETON, N.J. Sept. 12 The marriage of Miss Anne Underwood Morgan to Craig Llewellyn Battle took place here this afternoon. Dean Ernest Gordon of the Prince ton University Chapel, a Pres byterian clergyman, per formed the garden ceremony at the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Palmer Morgan. The bride groom is the son of Hyman Llewellyn Battle Jr. of New York and Mrs. James Francis Calvert of Annapolis, Md.

title: Calendar of Dog Show Events
description: Berks County K.C. allbreed and obedience, Reading Munic ipal Memorial Stadium, Route 61, Reading, Pa.; 1,295 entries; 9 A.M.

title: In Machine Tools. Now the Lean Years
description: Successful builders of machine tools need the steady nerves of a bombdisposal squad. They have lived through recessions before and they are about to do it again, expecting a 1970 sales decline of perhaps 12 per cent from last year's volume and 20 per cent from the record business they did in 1967.

title: Image and Role of Men in Blue Are Fading From the Police Athletic League Here
description: The 23d summer program of the Police Athletic League has ended for the season after two months of baseball, handball, theatrical presentations and even dancing in play streets. IAs the summer waned, how ever, a striking trend became increasingly clear. Uniformed policemen no longer play with the youngsters as they once did in the early days of the Police Athletic League.

title: Reflections on the Opening of School
description: I BLESS this country be this is cause country very kind to us: I came from Hon duras in South America. I'm very happy here. I feel secur ity when the children are in school. My daughter is going to graduate next year, and think they're learning things. They are very quiet, and rush them to do their home work. We're working very hard night and day to get money. My husband's niece is here. We brought her up from Honduras to help her. Sho doesn't speak English. We tried to bring her to pub lic school, so she went to Catholic school, and we paid everything. We don't have a lot of money, but we try hard to help people. We love this country, because if you work hard, you get anything you want.

title: School to Hold Ceramic Sale
description: The Greenwich House Pot tery School's 14th annual ceramic bazaar will be held Thursday through Saturday at the school, 16 Jones Street, in Greenwich Village.

title: St. Joseph's Admits Women
description: PHILADELPHIA Sept. 12 (AP)St. Joseph's College here has joined the list of tradi tionally allmale schools to ad mit women this fall. About 185 coeds enteredthe 120yearold Jesuit school Wednesday.

title: Deaths
description: Deaths

title: A Fall Foliage Calendar
description: ALONG with the color extravaganza of fall foliage that nature provides come fall events that mere mortals arrange. Once autumn leaves have changed their colors, the show is over in a few days; luckily, some of the manmade exhibits are not. A partial summary of scheduled autumn events in seven nearby states follows.

title: Article 8  No Title
description: Article 8  No Title

title: As Maine Grows, So Grows the Statewide Debate Over Ways to Preserve Its Environmental Resources
description: AUGUSTA, Me,Like a con tinental culdesac, the State of Maine perches on the north eastern corner of the United States, largely ignored for years by neighbors busy build ing and changing the face of the states below.

title: OTTINGER CHARGES LAG ON NARCOTICS
description: With schools reopening to morrow, Representative Rich ard L. Ottinger asserted yes terday, the city and state are no better prepared to cope with student narcotics addic tion than they have been In the past.

title: Prices Gain On Counter And Amex
description: Prices ended slightly higher in steppedupped trading last week on the American Stock Exchange and in the over thecounter market.

title: Landlord Gives Tenants Financial Data on Building
description: The landlord of a fivestory walkup apartment building on upper Broadway is sharing with his tenants financial information on the operation of his building to demonstrate to them its distressed finaricial plight.

title: France, With Strong Arab Ties, Seeks a Wider Role in Mideast
description: PARIS, Sept. 12The French have sold Mirage jets to Libya and have sent trade and cul tural missions over much of the eastern Mediterranean. They have restored relations with Morocco and warmed up to Tunisia. They are among the few Westerners with represen tation in Iraq. They have cor rect relations with the United Arab Republic and maintain in fluence in their former territo rieseconomic influence in Al geria and cultural influence in Syria and Lebanon.

description: Summaries of Races

description: Hnueilings

title: A Thousand Beggars
description: UNARM, IndiaThe route to the Vish wanath shrine, one of the holiest spots in this holy city of the Hindus, winds through tiny, narrow streets and is passable only on foot. Merchants sitting crosslegged behind mountains of shim mering Silk hold up a fantasy of woven gold and beckon as you pass. Known since medieval times for its exquisite silks and brocades, Banaras inspired Macaulay to write, From the looms of Banaras went forth the most delicate silks that adorned the halls of St. James's and Versailles.

title: Foreign Affairs: The Pied Piper of Peking
description: By their skyjacking opera tions Arab guerrillas have succeeded in dramatizing Pal estine as a code word repre senting a concatenation of headaches and potential cleav age that may soon be re flected by new difficulties in an uneasy American society.

title: 28 A Radical Strategy Don't Form a Fourth Party
description: 28 A Radical Strategy Don't Form a Fourth Party

title: Green Aims to Thwart the Sentimental
description: The sentimentalists will be cheering for Floyd Patterson on Tuesday night at Madison Square Garden, but his op ponent, Charlie (Devil) Green ignores the former world heavyweight champion's ap peal.

title: Author's Query
description: I would appreciate informa tion which would help me with a biography of John Rich (1682 1761), English theatre manager (Lincoln's Inn Fields and Covent Garden) and famous panto mimist.

title: Ice Cream Sells as Styles Change
description: Time was when only kids ate ice cream while walking in the streets. Adults envied them, but few had the gump tion to join in the fun, par ticularly if they considered themselves welldressed.

title: THOMAS ASSURED BERTH WITH JETS
description: DALLAS, Sept. 12  Of the seven rookies who appear likely to qualify for the New York Jets 40man roster, the only one who has established him self as a regular was perhaps the least likely to succeed Early Thomas, the cornerback drafted in the 11th round.

title: Penelope Pitstop Isn't Enough!
description: AID the more or less unanimous hurrahs for Sesame Street, there has crept in, almost unnoticed, a rather unique objection: the pro gram is deplorably maleoriented and its images of women tend to be insultingly stereo typed. Such criticism, I believe, is more than jus tified. Sesame Street does uphold the old sexist stereotypes, but what has not been mentioned that the rest of the television fare for kids is as bad or worse.

title: Spruce Up the Lawn With T.L.C.
description: DRY, hot summer weather causes most turf grasses in the North east to go into a dormant state. They turn brown un lesS there has been adequate rain fall or proper irrigation. As summer evenings become cooler toward autumn and there is more uniform rainfall, the bluegrasses and fescues wake up and lawns become green. September pro vides optimum growing climate for lawns and is a good month for major turf renovation and for planting, a new lawn.

title: MAYOR ALLOWS AIDES TO CAMPAIGN IN FALL
description: Administrators and commis sioners of the Lindsay admin istration are free to endorse publicly candidates of their own choice in the fall cam paign, and to take part in political activities on their own time, Deputy Mayor Richard R. Aurelio said in a memoran dum to all city officials last week.

title: CHICANOS DEPLORE HIGH DROPOUT RATE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 12 (UPI) A group of MexicanAmerican leaders told the President's Commission on Campus Un rest today that up to 80 per cent of all Chicano students drop out before they finish high school.

title: Stromboli's Ire Belies the Calm Of the Aeolians
description: MILAZZO, SicilyThe driver woke up when I climbed into his carriage; it took the horse a little longer. Behind me I heard the train for Palermo pull out of the drowsing Milazzo station. Its de parture inspired the horse.

title: Beame Seeking Envirmaids To Fight Litter and Pollution
description: A city corps of envirmaids was proposed yesterday by Controller Abraham D. Beanie.

title: Prague's Whispering gallery
description: This is how it's going to be. They'll round us up, pack us into trains, and send us to Siberia. But the optimist said: No. They'll make us walk to Siberia; by the time we get halfway, it'll all be over. And, finally, categorization breaks down: how to define the attitude of this, the only graffito I saw, on a wall on the way up to Hradcany Castle  WE ARE SORRY, TONDA (Tonda = Antonin Novotny)?

title: Russia's First Fiats
description: In an effort to meet increased citizen demand for private auto mobiles, the Soviet Union several years ago ventured outside the Communist world and enlisted the aid of the Italian Flat Company to build a giant new plant. Construction began in 1967 at a new town named Togliatti after the late Italian Commu nist leaderon the Volga River. Since then, $445million has been spent on the plant but serious construction problems have de layed its completion.

title: Indian Emerald Scores
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 12 (AP) Indian Emerald won the $34, 500 Sun Beau Handicap by three lengths at Hawthorne Park today.

title: College Football This Week
description: College Football This Week

title: Gretel Has Her Eye on Cup, but Intrepid Has Edge
description: Some year the America's Cup will leave its little round room at the New York Yacht Club and this may be the year, for all anybody knows. Perhaps in Gretel H Australia has caught up with the Unit ed States in equipment, de sign and personnel, but the chances still favor the latest defender, Intrepid. Only the match ahead can tell.

title: 1969 Dispatch in Times Censored in Transcript
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 12 (UPI)  Part of a dispatch printed in The New York Times on Dec. 14, 1969, was eliminated from a transcript of Senate hearings by Defense Department censors. The transcript made public today, dealt with aliled forces in South Vietnam.

title: HOUSING IS LINKED TO SCHOOL SKILIS
description: LONDON, Sept. 12Children living in homes without hot Water or indoor toilets lag far behind other children in reading and arithmetic ability, a group of scientists, teachers and so Ciologists was told this week.

title: Bridal Planned By Miss Nyere
description: WINCHESTER, Mass., Sept. 12  Miss Barbara Jeanne Nyere, a senior at Goucher College, and John Thomas Slevin, who was graduated this year from Johns Hopkins University, plan to be married here June 26 in the Episcopal Church of the Epiphany.

title: Robert Pease to Wed Miss Barton
description: BEL AIR, Calif., Sept. 12 Dr. and Mrs. Richard Thomas Barton have announced the engagement of their daugh. ter, Miss Hillary Anita Bar ton, to Robert Witbeck Pease, son of Mr. and Mrs. Alfred Morgan Pease Jr. of West Hartford, Conn.

title: Swift and Free Is Winner Of Breeders Futurity Race
description: CANANDAIGUA, N. Y., Sept. 12 (AP)Mrs. Thomas M. Wal ler's entry of Swift and Free and Gay Fellow proved too tough for the competition to day and ran away with the eighth annual New York Breed ers Futurity at Finger Lakes Race Track.

title: Bra Industry Reacts to Women's Lib
description: About a year ago, when women's liberation leaders were burning their bras and many of their sympathizers walked proudly up and down Fifth Avenue, the country's brassiere industry reacted in near panic.

title: Lehman Harriers to Run In 11 Meets This Season
description: Lehman College's varsity crosscountry team will com pete in 11 meets this fall, high lighted by participation in the Central Track Conference and City University of New York championships.

title: Indians Resist Integration Plan in Triracial County in Carolina
description: LUMBERTON, N. C., Sept. 11A complex ethnic kink in the Federal Government's de mand that Southern school dis tricts finally desegregate their classrooms is troubling this swampy tobacco belt country whose roots are in preColonial history.

title: More Cholera Cases in Israel
description: JERUSALEM, Sept. 12 (Reu thers)Seven more cases of cholera were confirmed in the Jerusalem area today, bringing the number of cases to 96 in Israel and Israeliheld territor ies.

title: How the Candidates Go After The Jewish Vote
description: Here Is a sampling of political headlines from New York news papers last week: Rockefeller Patronizing Jews, Goldberg As serts  Ottinger Visits in the Catskills  Israel Arms Bid Backed by Candidates.

title: Expos Turn Back Phillies, 43, on TwoRun Homers by Gosger and Bateman
description: MONTREAL, Sept. 12 (UPI) Jim Gosger and John Bate man each clouted tworun homers today as the Montreal Expos scored their fifth succes sive home victory over the Phillies, 43.

title: Bridge
description: IN tournament play it is not un common for partnerships to have special agreements about opening leads. Some favor the Rusinow idea of leading the second honor card in sequence  queen from kingqueen, jack from queenjack and so on. Some lead the ace from aceking combinations.

title: CANCER TREATMENT USES BOMBARDMENT
description: STAMFORD, Calif., Sept. 12 (AP)Stanford University an nounced today a new technique for treating cancer that uses subnuclear particles fired at diseased tissue by a new linear accelerator.

title: Miss Robinson Becomes Bride Of an Ad Man
description: HILLSDALE, N. J., Sept. 12The marriage of Miss Patricia Prial Robinson, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George J. Robinson of Hills dale and Hemlock Farms Pa., to Robert Michalowski, son of Mr. and Mrs. Peter. Michalowski of North Hale don, took place here today in St. John the Baptist Roman Catholic Church. The Rev. Edward Myers performed the ceremony and celebrated the nuptial mass.

title: Two political fictionsthe politics better than the fiction
description: Military justice is to justice as military music is to music, Robert Sherrill tells us. What, then, are po litical novels to novels? Too often, fear, they are romans a clay, and the two specimens under discussion are no exception. The authors of both books are knowledgeable about politics. Both served in the White House under President Johnson and each has other political credits as wellSherwin Markman as a mem ber of Adlai Stevenson's staff, Depu ty Director of A.I.D. and campaign manager for Senator Harold E. Hughes, while Douglass Cater was for many years Washington editor of The Reporter. But when it comes to translating political experience into fiction, the situation appears to be analogous to that facing all trans lators: It is more important to be expert in the language you are translating into than in the language you are translating out of.

title: Letters: Hostility At Home and Abroad
description: To THE EDITOR: It was with a sense of vicarious plea sure that I read the Ian Glass article headed Bahamas Push Campaign to Meet Tourist Complaints (Travel Sec tion, Aug. 23). I found especially ironic the line  visitors returned home to tell stories of their experiences with insolent, even hostile  taxicab drivers. The article went on to explore the dynamics operating in the increased political awareness among blacks, which, according to Glass, is manifested in hostility directed toward white Amer ican tourists visiting the islands.

title: Speaking of Books: Auden's Commonplace Book
description: What is a commonplace book? An annotated personal anthology, said William Cole some months back in these pages. What is A Certain World (Viking, $10), W. H. Auden's commonplace book? A map of my planet  a sort of autobiography, says Auden, adding a helpful word from Chesterton on what poets are really like:

title: Vermont and Connecticut Meet at Storrs Saturday
description: The last two Eastern College Athletic Conference Sopho mores of the Year will be on opposing sides when Connecti cut and Vermont open their football seasons at Storrs, Conn.

title: The Week in Finance:
description: THE great optimism that permeated the investment world in August seems to be withering somewhat the midpoint of September, as new strains and uncer tainties begin to surface in the realm of business, finance and international relations.

title: Watts 1970: Despite Changes, Much Remains the Same Five Years After Riots
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 12  Watts is not what it was five years ago.

title: Moss, Bow Merge Into 300Show Class
description: The Moss and Bow compa nies are merging to form the largest organization of Amer ican Kennel Club licensed dogshow superintendents in the United States.

title: Oklahoma Downs S. M. U., 2811, Despite Hixson's Passing Record
description: DALLAS, Sept. 12 (UPI) Chuck Hixson of Southern. Methodist University, broke the National Collegiate career passing record tonight, but had his thunder stolen by Jack Mildren and an explosive Okla homa running attack that routed the Mustangs, 2811.

title: GOODELL WARNS ON MIDEAST ARMS
description: Senator Charles E. Goodell asked the Nixon Administration yesterday not to make Israel accept what he called the ille gal SovietEgyptian missile buildup in the Suez Canal Zone as the price of obtaining new fighterbombers from the Unit ed States.

title: HOUSE LOSS SEEN NORMAL FOR G.O.P.
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Sept. 12 As the 1970 congressional races move into full swing across the nation, 56 per cent of the na tion's voters voice approval of Ptesident Nixon's performance in office, the Gallup Poll re puted today.

title: FAIR HILL TO CLOSE MEETING SATURDAY
description: A strong field is in prospect for the featured $5,000 added Manly Steeplechase Handicap on the Fair Hill (Del.) Race Meeting's program next Satur day, the last of the season.

title: Belmont Entries
description: Belmont Entries

title: This Child Has to Be Truffaut's
description: BY an odd coincidence in program ing, the eighth New York Film Festival, which opened Thursday night at Philharmonic Hall with Francois Truffaut's The Wild Child (L'Enfant Sauvage), recalls the festival at Cannes in 1959. That wad the year in which Truffaut's first feature, The 400 Blows, won the prize for best direction, in which Luis Bufiuel's Nazarin won the International Critics Prize, and in which the first feature by Alain Resnais, Hiroshima, Mon Amour, written by Marguerite Duras, was shown outofcompetitimi. It was just a year after Claude Chabrol had made his first feature, Le Beau Serge, and it was the year in which JeanLuc Godard made his first, Breathless, based, say the credits rather airily, on an idea by. Frangois Truffaut (which had simply been a ploy to secure fi nancing for the film).

title: An English colony in sunny Spain
description: This time around, Honor Tracy deploys her considerable cunning and craft to trap sit ting ducks. The province is Malaga; the butterflies are social onesso much heavier than air that on the instant of release they plummet to earth, never to rise again. The expatriates we meet (eccentric race of fiscophobes, English men who would do anything and live anywhere, no matter how bored and miserable they might be, rather than stay at home and pay English taxes) might have camped in any of the colonies the sun never set on, from Delhi to Delaware.

title: Billboard Ruled Safe
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Sept, 12 (AP)A billboard portraying the Foshay Tower, Minneapo lis's tallest building, lying on its side is on display again af ter the authorities decided it was safe for public viewing. The 42footlong billboard, part of a sculpture show, was taken down last week after area residents told the police it looked like a bomb threat.

title: Christie Ann Cusick Married in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 12 Miss Christie Ann Cusick and Robert P. O'Neill, an assist ant district attorney of Bronx County, New York, were mar ried here this afternoon by the Rev. John J. Slater at St. Matthew's Roman Catholic Cathedral.

title: ILLEGAL FIREARMS STILL WIDESPREAD
description: Two years after the enact ment of landmark gun control legislation, the regulation of private firearms remains a bit terly controversial political is sue and local officials across the country complain that ille gal gun possession is as wide spread as ever.

title: Rite Of Secular Chastity
description: From the earliest days, virginity has been a strong Christian ideal. St. Paul said that it was better to marry than to burn but clearly regarded celibacy as the preferable state.

title: Equal Rights: Who Is Against It And Why
description: WASHINGTON  Prof. Leo Kanowitz of the University of New Mexico Law School testi fied before Congress last week in favor of the equal rights amendment to the Constitution, but it was all a terrible mistake.

title: Kunstler Asks Court Changes
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Sept. 12 William M. Kunstler, proposed today that volunteers be ac cepted as jury members.

title: DARTS, LANCERS IN PLAYOFF TODAY
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 12For the first time in 28 years, a major sport championship might materialize for Washington, when the Washington Darts of the North American Soccer League meet the Rochester Lancers tomorrow in the sec ond, and decisive, game of the league's playoffs.

title: Miss Christine Ann Valentine Is Bride
description: GEORGETOWN, Conn., Sept. 12In the Sacred Heart Roman Catholic Church here today, Miss Christine Ann Valentine, daughter of Mrs. Richard Walter Valen tine of Wilton and the late Mr. Valentine, was married to Frans Jorgen Weterrings Jr., who is a senior at Bard College. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Weterrings of Englewood, N. J. The cere mony was performed by the Rev. Joseph Cleary.

description: 36 Out of My Mind On Bluegrass

title: In Brief
description: Back in 1955, when J. Cutler Andrews published The North Reports the Civil War, it was obvious that a companion vol ume on the South was inevitable.

description: ST. LOUIS, Sept. 12 (AP) McArthur Lane and Sid Ed wards socred two touchdowns each and Jim Hart threw two touchdown passes in leading the St. Louis Cardinals to a 3424 exhibition victory over the Kansas City Chiefs tonight.
