description: Borough President Percy E. Sutton of Manhattan took is sue yesterday with Mayor Lind say's plan to use several Man hattan piers for cultural and recreational events and urged him to reconsider.

title: 505 in 21 Parties Vie in Kerala
description: NEW DELHI, Sept. 17Kerala state, which has twice voted Communists to power in recent years of political instability held elections today.

title: STOCKS IN LONDON MOVE AHEAD A BIT
description: The London stock market ad vanced moderately yesterday in quiet and cautious trading.

title: Kings County Liberals Back Kirsch for Borough Office
description: The executive committee of the Kings County Liberal party last night endorsed Morris Kirsch, the Republican candi date for Brooklyn Borough President, as the Liberal candi date for that office.

title: Concannon Will Direct Bears In Giants Contest Tomorrow
description: The New York Giants are going to see Jack Concannon at quarterback for the Chi cago Bears in the opening game here of the National Football League season to morrow night. Concannon is the quarterback the Giants beat last season in the third game, and on that occasion

title: Rio Rightists Oppose Allende
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Sept. 17 Young members of a rightwing Catholic organization distrib uted a pamphlet in Rio's strets today, calling on Pope Paul VI to speak out against the elec toral victory in Chile of Sal vador.Allende, the Marxist can didate for president.

title: CeaseFire Is Proposed
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Sept. 17 Marshal Habes Majali, com mander of the Jordanian armed forces, proposed a ceasefire late in the day, following which the guerrillas would move out with their arms to bases along the Jordan River facing Israeli occupied territory.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Jordanian troops fought Palestinian guer rillas yesterday in a showdown battle in Amman and in other areas of northern Jor dan. The army was reported to be gaining the upper hand in the Jordanian capital, with the Amman radio announcing that the military were in full control of the city. [Page 1, Columns 68.]

title: TV: Flip Wilson, Supported by David Frost, Scores in His Premiere on N.B.C.
description: Flip Wilson scored last night as the television sea son's first new hit in variety. The impish comedian not only registered with his own resourcefulness but also was blessed with good material and singular support by David Frost and two of the favorite Sesame Street muppets. The show appeared on the National Broadcasting Company network.

title: ISRAELIS KEEPING WATCH ON JORDAN
description: JERUSALEM, Sept. 17  Is rael watched the longexpected civil war across the Jordan River ceasefire line today and waited.

title: M'ANDREW FACES PIRATES TONIGHT
description: The only pennant race in the four major league divisions gets down to an eyeballtoeyeball confrontation tonight at Shea Stadium, where neither the Pittsburgh Pirates nor the Mets need spend much time looking at outoftown results.

title: URUGUAY REBELS PROPOSE A DEAL
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 17 (AP)Tupamaro guer rillas sent an antigovernment manifesto to news media to day and demanded its immedi ate publication as ransom for Claude L. Fly, United States soul expert kidnapped in early August.

title: MARKET EXTENDS RISE IN BUSY DAY
G. M. CARS TO GET POLLUTION DEVICE
description: DETROIT, Sept. 17The General Motors Corporation said today it would begin in stalling a new type of antipol lution device in its cars in two years and all of its 1975 cars would carry it.

title: N.Y.U. Dismisses Teacher Linked to Computer Threat
description: An assistant professor of his tory, under indictment for al legedly threatening of destroy a computer installation at New York University last May, was dismissed by the school yester day for what was described as disruptive conduct.

title: Bullet Misses Policeman
description: LIVINGSTON, N. J., Sept. 17, (UPI)A policeman doing pa perwork here by the interior! lights of his patrol car was shot at late last night, the po lice said. The bullet cracked the car's windshield, but the policeman was unhurt. A search for the passing car from which the single shot came failed to turn up any suspects, the police in this Newark suburb said to ;day. The policeman involved was John Mesmer, 27 years old.

title: POLICE DATA SALE STUDIED BY JURY
description: A newly impaneled grand jury is trying to find out how many policemen are stealing and selling confidential infor oration of the city Police De partment.

title: City Center Lists Details For Its Annual Sampling
description: The City Center of Music and Drama, Inc., has announced plans for its third edition of A City Center Sampling, series of 16 events to be given from October through March. The programs will be presented at the New York State Theater, at the City Center's West 55th Street theater and at the ANTA Theater.

title: Israel's Role Held Vital
description: GENEVA, Sept. 17An au toritative source here said today that the question of Israel's direct participation in the negotiations for the hos tages release had become so critical that it would be re ferred to President Nixon and Premier Golda Meir for settle ment.

title: 40Acre Renewal in Brooklyn Approved
description: One of the most ambitious urban renewal plans in the city's history, covering a 40 acre area of downtown Brook lyn, was approved by the Board of Estimate yesterday after a raucous public hearing.

title: CONGRESS REFORM PASSED BY HOUSE IN 326TO19 VOTE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 17 Heeding demands of reformers the House passed by a 326to 19 vote today a bill to stream line Congressional procedures.

title: Pope Back in the Vatican
description: ROME, Sept. 17Pope Paul VI returned to the Vatican to day from Castel Gandolfo, his summer residence in the hills south of here, where he had spent two months.

title: Canadian Bill Rate Down
description: OTTAWA, Sept 17 (Canadian Press)  The Government of Canada auctioned today $160 million of 91day Treasury bills at an average price of 98.672 and an average yield of 5.40 per cent. Last week, it auctioned $150million at an average price of 98.653 and an average yield of 5.48 per cent. Also auctioned today were $40million of 182 day bills at an average yield of 97.317, up from last week's 97.248, and an average yield of 5.53 per cent, down from last week's 5.68 per cent.

title: INVESTIGATE CITY? GOVERNOR SAYS NO; Rejects a Walinsky Request for Inquiry into Police
description: LIVERPOOL, N. Y., Sept. 17 Governor Rockefeller reject ed another request today that the state investigate corruption in the New York City Police Department.

title: 2 NEW DETERRENTS TO ELM DISEASE SEEN
description: Scientists reported yesterday two new weapons that, it is hoped, can slow the Dutch elm disease epidemic, which has killed 12 million American elms since the nineteenthirties.

title: White House Portico Used For TV Film About Lincoln
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 17 (UPI)The front portico of the White House was transformed into a movie set today with all the trappings of the Civil War era.

title: DODGERS TOPPLED; REDS TAKE CROWN
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 17 (UPI)Bob Watson's tiebreak ing grandslam homer in the seventh inning gave the Hous ton Astros a 105 victory over the Los Angeles Dodgers to night. The outcome enabled the idle Cincinnati Reds to clinch first place in the National League West.

title: GARMATZ HELPED BY SHIP INDUSTRY
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 17 (AP)  The shipping industry and its unions have helped to raise a $37,000 campaign fund for the chairman of the House Merchant Marine Committee, who is unopposed for re election.

title: Saint Laurent, Valentino, Ungaro: 3 Avenues to High Fashion
description: Even Valentino liked the copies Lord & Taylor made of his couture styles. He stopped in to take a peek at them Wednesday before the store's special customers were invited to try them on and he was so delighted he promised to return to show his staff how it's done. The Rome de signer is opening his own Madison Avenue shop later this month.

title: TV FILM PRESENTED AT SONGMY HEARING
description: FORT HOOD, Tex., Sept. 17 (AP)  S. Sgt. David Mitchell listened intently today as he was accused on a television news film of ordering an old man shot during the alleged Songmy massacre.

title: New Books
description: Amalie's Story, by Julie McDonald (Simon & Schuster, $6.50). Growing up in 19thcentury Den mark.

title: Buckley and Adams Stand Firm On Opposing Sides of Drug Issue
description: The heads of the Conserva tive ticket openly differed with each other last night on the handling of the narcotics prob lem. The two candidates were making a joint appearance be fore Queens supporters at $100aplate fund raising din ner at Riccardo's Restaurant in Astoria, Queens.

title: A Chair With a Message
description: You don't have to be mod ernminded to find Love or Peace appealing as a furniture motif, or so W & J Sloane believes. Two wrought iron chairs incorporating the different messages in their Victorian curlicued backs are now available in the store's remodeled Young Sloane shop on we second floor. The chairs, available in seven colors at $35 each, are among the many mod eratepriced modern and tra ditional designs to be found in the new department. The furnishings on view include currently popular styles with the accent on price rather than on innovation in ma terials or shapes.

title: Hijacking Attempt Reported On an Egyptian Airliner
description: CAIRO, Sept. 17 (AP) The official Middle East News Agency said today that a young man attempted to hijack an Egyptian airliner yesterday be tween Cairo and Luxor.

title: TWO CAMPUS GUARDS SLASHED IN BUFFALO
description: BUFFALO, Sept. 17  Two State University campus secu rity policemen were slashed with razorlike knives yester day by youths.

title: Navy to Deactivate Carrier ShangriLa And 57 Other Ships
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 17  The Navy announced today plans to deactivate 58 ships including the aircraft carrier ShangriLa, currently operating off Vietnam.

title: Washington Reported Weighing $500Million in Aid for Israelis
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 17 The United States is consider ing providing Israel with up to $500million in financial assist ance by allowing her to defer payments on old and recent arms agreements, reliable Ad ministration sources said today.

title: Charles William Hagen Sr., Retired Admiralty Lawyer
description: PORT JERVIS, N. J., Sept. 17 Charles William Hagen, Sr., a retired New York admiralty lawyer, who had served as a special commissioner in connec tion with the claims filed in the Morro Castle disaster, died yes terday in Doctors Hospital. He was 81 years old and lived in Cahoonzie.

title: N.Y.U. Senate Rejects Plan For Recess Before Election
description: The senate of New York Uni versity rejected a proposal yes terday calling for a recess prior to the November election to en able students to work for polit ical candidates.

title: U.S. War Deaths Cut by Half in Last Year
description: SAIGON, South Vietnan, Sept. 17  American comfit casualties in the war have bean reduced by about one half in the last year, according to fig ures released today by the United States command.

title: Eban Doubtful of New Truce
description: TEL AVIV, Sept. 17 (UPI) Foreign Minister Abba Eban said today that it was unlikely that Israel would agree to an extension of the 90day Suez Canal ceasefire that began Aug. 7 unless she knew what effect a new agreement would have on her security.

title: TunneyMurphy Coast Race Is Close
description: SAN DIEGO, Sept. 17John V. Tunney, a Democrat, is 36 years old, weighs 190 pounds, stands 6 feet 3 inches tall, hasl a Dutch wife, three children, land a wide smile. He has been in the House of Representatives six years and would like to become a Senator.

title: Goodell Advises Students To Reject Violent Revolt
description: Senator Charles E. Goodell told 2,000 students at Queens College yesterday that vio lence is to be abhorredwheth er it is pursued in the name of revolution or in the name ut law and order, whether prac ticed by students or sheriff's deputies, whether perpetrated by Weathermen or Minute men.

title: Peter Mills Fiance of Miss Crow
description: RYE, N. Y., Sept. 17Mr. and Mrs. Ralph Langstaff Crow Jr. have announced the engagement of Mr. Crow's daughter, Miss Deborah Montgomery Crow, to Peter Westbrook Mills, son of Mr. and Mrs. Edward Ensign Mills of New Canaan, Conn., and Schermerhorn Landing, Thousand Islands. The wed ding is planned for January.

title: PROXMIRE CHARGES GIVEAWAY ON C5A
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 17 (AP) Senator William Proxmire says the Air Force is rewriting a contract for production of the costly C5A transport plane and has engineered one of the greatest Government giveaways ever attempted in a single stroke.

title: A Study in Pollution Control: How Seattle Cleaned Up Its Water
description: SEATTLEA few weeks ago, a Seattle newspaper carried brief article under the head line: Flow of Raw Sewage In to Elliot Bay Ends.

title: Murphy Plans Innovations for Police
description: DETROIT, Sept. 17An experimental program de signed to put more foot patrolmen into highcrime areas on a permanent basis in an effort to gain commu nity respect and cooperation may be brought to New York City by its new Police Com missioner, Patrick V. Murphy.

title: New Model, the Grand Ville, Tops 1971 Pontiac Line
description: The Pontiac Motor division of General Motors has un veiled a new prestige model called the Grand Ville to head its 1971 lineup of 36 models.

title: Chelsea Center to Present Bond's Saved in Brooklyn
description: The Chelsea Theater Center of Brooklyn will open its sixth season at the Brooklyn Acad emy of Music on Oct. 28 with the New York premiere of Ed ward Bond's Saved. Alan Schneider will direct.

title: Cambodians on Move
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Sept. 17About 1,500 Cambodian re lief troops moved today within la few miles of a 4,500man Government force stalled some 40 miles north of Pnompenh on the road to Kompong Thom, according to a military spokes man.

title: SHIELDS RACES GO TO O'NEAL AND FOX
Arthur Beerman Dies at 62; Head of DaytonStore Chain
description: DAYTON, Ohio, Sept. 17  Arthur Beerman, a leading busi nessman and philanthropist here, died of a heart attack yes terday morning in the Good Samaritan Hospital. He was 62 years old and lived at 3301 Philadelphia Drive.

title: 3 Groups Seek Rehearing On Storm King Project
description: Opponents of Consolidated Edison's proposed pumped stor age hydropower generating plant at Storm King Mountain filed with the Federal Power Commission in Washington yes terday an 8,000word applica tion for a rehearing.

title: New Director Named By Pan Am Airways
description: Pan American World Air ways, Inc., announced yester day the election of William T. Coleman Jr. to its board of directors. Mr. Coleman is a senior partner in the law firm of Dilworth, Paxson, Kalish, Levy & Coleman.

title: Mets Sell a Pitcher
description: The St. Louis Cardinals pur chased Fred Reahm, a left handed pitcher, from the Mets yesterday.

title: Second America's Cup Race Postponed by Lack of Wind
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Sept. 17  A onesided battle between 32boat Coast Guard fleet and 1,000boat spectator fleet pro vided the only America's Cup excitement here today. It was no contest, the Coast Guard winning easily.

title: U.S.Mexico Ties Seen Closer
description: Robert H. McBride, the Unit ed States Ambassador to Mexico, asserted yesterday that improved relations of this country with its southern neighbor were generating en couraging progress in economic and trade cooperation.

title: Close Down the Tombs?
description: No more devastating comment could have been made on the subhuman conditions at the Tombs than the suit filed by the Legal Aid Society to shut down that overcrowded municipal jail. The society. which has itself been criticized by prisoners on the ground that it is too much a conservative part the judicial establishment, is now convinced that conditions at the Manhattan House of Detention are so degrading as to be unlawful.

title: Munich Bishop Resigns
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Sept. 17 (Reuters) Bishop Matthias Defregger has resigned his post in the Roman Catholic Church despite a decision to drop an investigation into his role in the wartime killings of Italian villagers. Julius Cardinal Doepf ner said the former army captain gave up his position as auxiliary bichop despite en treaties from the Cardinal that he resume his religious offices.

title: U.S. SUED IN SEIZURES OF PYONGYANG FILM
description: Eldridge Cleaver, head of the Black Panther party's interna tional section, in Algiers, head ed a group of 11 persons who filed suit here yesterday de manding the return of 9,000 feet of film seized Wednesday by United States Customs agents at Kennedy Internation al Airport.

title: A COAST RIOT LINKED TO STADIUM USE BAN
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 17 (AP)The denial of a college sta dium for a rally was blamed by some today for touching off MexicanAmerican violence last night that injured 88 persons 18 days after an outburst that left three dead.

title: Back in Washington
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 17 (AP) President Nixon returned to the White House tonight.

title: British Concorde Grounded
description: LONDON, Sept. 17 (AP) Concorde 002, British proto type of the AngloFrench super sonic jetliner, has been ground ed for engine repairs. The chief test pilot, Brian Trub shaw, said that the plane would not fly again in its test flight program for at least five days.

title: Insiders Stockholdings
They Call for Protection for the Hostages
description: LONDON, Sept 17.  The British Government issued plea to Arab guerrillas today to safeguard the lives of the eight British hostages in Jordan and said that it was taking steps with other governments to pro tect all the hostages.

title: GRANT TO AID RERUNS OFSESAME STREET
description: The General Foods. Corpora tion has made a grant of $300, 000 for Saturday morning re peat showings of Sesame Street, on noncommercial tel evision stations in a number of cities across the country. Since last February the corpo ration has underwritten Satur day morning showings of the children's television workshop on New York City's Channel 13. The success of that ven ture prompted the expansion.

title: Chief Inspector Warns P.B.A. Against Polarization
description: TANNERSVILLE, N.Y., Sept. 17  In a farewell speech, George P. McManus, retiring chief insepctor of the New York City Police Department, appealed today to policemen, for unity, and warned them notl to fall victim to increasing polarization along racial or religious lines.

title: BEATRICE FOODS CITES RECORD NET
description: Sales and earnings of the Beatrice Foods Company for the quarter and six months ended Aug. 31 set records with substantial increases over last year, William G. Karnes, presi dent, reported yesterday.

title: BIG 6 MAYORS SET TO RENEW EFFORT
description: The Big Six mayors will seek more money and more home rule power from the state in an encore to their successful campaign that pressured Al bany into raising state aid this year.

title: Article 1  No Title
For the Weekend Chef, Veal Birds With Capers
description: In the menus below, dishes marked with an asterisk are followed by a recipe.

title: 1970, by Triangle Publications. Inc. (The Morning Telegraph); Thursday, Sept. 17. 16th day. Weather clear, track fast.
FRANCIS P. FLEMING
description: ALBANY, Sept. 17Francis Patrick Fleming, director of the office of public information of the State Civil Defense Com mission here for the last 10 years, drowned Monday while swimming in Bergen Lake near Troy. He was 52 years old and lived in Slingerlands.

title: Amendment Is Approved to Expand Disclosure Required of Firms
description: The board of governors of the New York Stock Exchange approved yesterday in principle an amendment to the ex change's rules and endorsed several rule changes requiring fuller disclosure of pertinent financial data by member firms.

title: Oh Henry Bars Called Possibly Contaminated
description: WASHINGTON, Sept 17 (AP)  The Food and Drug Administration said today that more than half a million Oh Henry nut roll candy bars manufactured in June were possibly contaminated with potentially hazardous bac teria.

title: SENATE REFUSES TO HALT DEBATE ON DIRECT VOTING
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 17 The proposal for direct popular election of the President was dealt a serious and probably fatal blow today when the Sen ate refused to shut off debate on the issue.

title: City Seeks to Let Buses Run on 4 Parkways
description: Officials of the Lindsay ad ministration said yesterday that the city was drawing up a plan to allow buses to operate on four local parkways where they have previously been banned.

title: Devlin's 69 Gains 3Shot Edge In Windy Alcan Golf in Ireland
description: PORTMARNOCK, Ireland, Sept. 17 (AP)Bruce Devlin, an Australian now living in Florida, managed to control his game during gale force winds today and posted a three underpar 69 for the first round lead in the Alcan Golfer of the Year tournament. He gained threestroke edge.

title: Guerrilla Radio Messages
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Sept. 17Following are excerpts from broadcasts today by the three commando radios, the Central Committee of the Palestine liberation movement, broadcasting on the Damascus radio, the Central Commitee from its own radio broadcasting from Baghdad, and Voice of Al Asifa, the radio voice of Al Fatah, the largest com mando organization, broadcasting from an undisclosed location:

title: ABBATIELLO READY TO DRIVE TONIGHT
description: YONKERS, Sept. 17  Car mine Abbatiello reported from, his home at Colt's Neck, N. J., today that he had shaken off the effects of the spill that hospitalized him last Tuesday night and would drive Ulysse Mab in tomorrow night's $50, 000 United Nations Trot at Yonkers Raceway.

title: Antiques Show Saturday
description: OLD TAPPAN, N. Y., Sept. 17The 10th annual Old Tappan Outdoor Antiques Show will be held here Sat urday. The event is under the sponsorship of the Old Tappan branch of the wom en's auxiliary of the Pascack Valley Hospital.

title: Text of the Vietcong Proposal at Talks in Paris
description: PARIS, Sept. 17Follow ing in unofficial translation from the Vietnamese is a text of remarks made here today by Mrs. Nguyen Thi Binh, head of the Vietcong delegation to the Vietnam talks, on Communist pro posals for a peace settlement:

title: Stock Margin Debt Shows $10Million Drop for Month
description: Stock margin debt fell $10 million in August to a month end total of $3.77billion, the New York Stock Exchange re ported yesterday. The decline was partially attributed to net loss of 30,000 accounts during the month, the exchange said.

title: Hussein's Wife Waits in London
description: LONDON, Sept 17She remains in a rented apart ment on Davies Street, and when she does go out, mov ing silently and quickly into a waiting MercedesBenz, she is accompanied by Scot land Yard detectives.

title: AGNEW IS ACCUSED OF MISSING TARGET
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 17 Instead of attacking rock music for spreading a drug culture among youngsters, Vice Pres ident Agnew should worry about political contributors whose corporations sell drugs, cigarettes and liquor, a Federal Communications Commission member said today.

title: A.M.A. SAYS F.D.A. HAMPERS DOCTORS
description: The American Medical Asso ciation has charged that the Food and Drug Administration is trying to make it more diffi cult for physicians to prescribe drugs under certain circum stances and thereby is attempt ing to regulate the practice of medicine.

title: Voice of the Vietcong in Paris
description: When the expanded peace talks in Paris began to take shape late in 1968 even some members of the Na tional Liberation Front's delegation hinted that Mrs. Nguyen Thi Binh's leader ship of its side would last only as long as the talks were in the preliminary stage. A man it was widely be lieved, would re place her as soon as the negotia tions got down to serious business. But Mrs. Binh has lasted. Her state ments at the talks have been as unswerving as her dark, expressionless eyes while she has faced three United States negotiators, enunciat ing, as she did yesterday, terms for a peace settlement.

title: Job Mart Attracts 6,000
description: BOSTON, Sept. 17 (AP) More than 6,000 Vietnam veter ans turned out yesterday for the first of a twoday job mart ;at the Suffolk Downs racetrack. Representatives of hun dreds of companies, as well as Government agencies and other employers are taking part in the Job Mart, aimed at :iecuring employment for jobless veter ans from New England.

title: Power Plants Waste Heat Can Be Used, Scientists Say
description: ALBANY, Sept. 17A group of 200 international scientists and industrial representatives began meeting here today to study ways of converting waste heat from power plants from a conservationist's bane into a possible ecological boon.

title: Terms Unchanged, Arab Says
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Sept. 17 A spokesman for the Pales tinian hijackers said today that the heavy shelling in Amman made no difference in the hi jackers terms for release of the 54 or 55 airline hostages presumably still held in or near the embattled Jordanian capi tal.

title: WINFIELD SUSPENDED FOR 60 DAYS BY S.E.C.
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 17 The Securities and Exchange Commission closed its case to day against Winfield & Co., Inc., and some affiliated firms and individuals with an an nouncement of the acceptance of long suspensions and other penalties by the defendants in the case.

title: McDowell Wins No. 20
description: CLEVELAND, Sept. 17 (UPI) Sam McDowell became a 20 game winner for the first time in his career tonight by scat tering seven hits to lead the Cleveland Indians to a 62 vic tory over the Detroit Tigers.

title: Decision Pleases Clay
description: MIAMI BEACH, Sept. 17 (UPI) Cassius Clay, training here for his bout with Jerry Quarry, today after learning of the New York State Athletic Commission's decision to grant him a boxing license, said: I think it's good, really, really good. I just hope I'll be in shape when the time comes for me to earn a living again.

title: Market Place:
description: In the oil exploration game, a world in which puffery is not unheard of, Charles Hann defiritely must be regarded as a lowkey op erator.

title: WILLIAM L. SANBORN
description: ST. LOUIS, Sept. 17Wil liam L. Sanborn, president of of the WiniusBrandon Adver tising Company, who was ac tive in many civic organiza tions, died Monday. He was 54.

title: Foreign Affairs: A Vietnam in Reverse?
description: WASHINGTONAn immense distinction must be drawn be tween the positions of Premier Meir and President Nixon as they meet in the White House. Mrs. Meir is negotiating for Israel's existence.

title: Insurance Rates Increased On Cargo in Middle East
description: LONDON, Sept. 17 (Reuters) Insurance rates for freight shipped to and from the Middle East were increased up to 400 per cent by the Institute of London Underwriters tonight.

title: Miss Tweedy Plans Nuptials
description: WINONA, Minn., Sept. 17 Miss Elizabeth Tweedy, a researcher with the Whitney Museum of American Art in New York, and Marshall G. Streibert, who is with the John Price Jones Company, a fundraising concern in New York, plan to be married here next month.

title: Protesters in Italy Fire on Police From Cathedral
description: REGGIO CALABRIA, Italy, Sept. 17 (Reuters)  Demon strators fired on policemen from the city's cathedral to night with pistols, rifles and submachine guns, the police said.

title: Sierra Club Loses Fight To Block Disney Resort
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 17 (AP)The Sierra Club lost its battle today to block the de velopment of the $35million Mineral King resort by Walt Disney Productions in the Se quoia National Forest.

title: CITY BOARD DELAYS THIRD AVE. REZONING
description: After a twohour hearing, the Board of Estimate post poned a decision last night on a controversial plan for re zoning lower Third Avenue for a mixture of luxury and public housing.

title: Mr. Nixon on Foreign Aid...
description: There are no surprises in President Nixon's pro posals for fundamental and sweeping reforms American foreignaid programs. The recommendations are based on the report last March of his Task Force on International Development and thus contain most of its strengths but also its shortcomings.

title: LORD SUTLER WINS 2 HUNTER CLASSES
description: LOCUST VALLEY, L. I., Sept. 17Mrs. A. C. Randolph's Lord Sutler, who has won 10 cham pionships in a row, captured two classes in the green con formation hunter division to day as the Piping Rock horse show opened for a fourday run.

title: WPIX Head Denies Knowledge Of Reports From Daily News
description: Fred M. Thrower, president of WPIXTV, testified yesterday that he was unaware that his station had used audio reports from a Daily News writer dur ing the 1968 SovietCzechoslo vak crisis, but had identified him on the air as a WPIX news man.

title: WITNESS RECALLS MANSON AS DEVIL
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 17 Danny Decarlo, who quit as leader of a motorcycle gang to join Charles Manson's fam ily, testified today that the bearded hippie leader mas queraded as the devil in the weeks preceding the murder of the blond movie star Sharon Tate and four others in August, 1969.

title: Alcindor Still Growing
description: WAUKESHA, Wis., Sept. 17 (UPI)Lew Alcindor is just a growing boy, physical reports of the Milwaukee Bucks showed today. Alcindor, who checked in at 7 feet 1 inches as a rookie with the National Bas ketball Association team a year ago, has grown threeeighths of an inch since and now meas ures 72.

title: Guide to Dining Out
description: **Fuji Restaurant, 238 West 56th Street, CI 58594. We first visited the Fuji restau rant about eight years ago (tempus, don't fugit), and we returned recently because we were told that they have a new chef from Japan. In any event, the Fuji has found its niche and it is a pleas ant, comfortable, substantial place.

title: HARMON SNAPS TIE ON SQUEEZE BUNT
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 17 The 'adventurous Pittsburgh Pirates, wasting a strong come back performance by Dock Ellis, preceded their fourgame visit to New York by losing to the Philadelphia Phillies, 32. tonight.

title: Klan Leader and 9 Accused in Carolina Of a Robbery Plot
description: SUMTER, S. C., Sept. 17 Robert E. Scoggin, former Ku Klux Klan grand dragon, was arrested by the state police to day after he and nine klan associates had been charged; with conspiracy to commit rob bery and accessory after the fact of murder.

title: WEEK'S TRAFFIC OFF ON RAILS AND TRUCKS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 17 Freight traffic on United States railroads and intercity truck tonnage in the latest week ended Sept. 12 were both con siderably below the volume in the corresponding week of last year.

title: NEW HOUSING PLAN FOR AGED PROPOSED
description: Albert A. Walsh, head of the Housing and Development Administration, yesterday called the city's record for building suitable housing for old people very poor. He pro posed that a separate nonprofit corporation be created to han dle only the building of hous ing for the elderly.

title: Prices Are Raised For Carpet Yarns By Allied Chemical
description: The Allied Chemical Corpora tion announced yesterday that) it had increased prices on its entire line of continuous fila ment nylon carpet yarn, ef fective immediately.

title: Jets Change Game Time Because of Yom Kippur
description: As an accommodation for ticket holders participating in Yom Kippur religious serv ices, the New York Jets announced yesterday that the kickoff time for their Shea Stadium opener Oct. 10 against the Miami Dolphins had been extended to 8:45 P.M.

title: Nancy Lee Parsons Will Be a June Bride
description: MUTTONTOWN, L.I., Sept. 17Mr. and Mrs. Duncan B. Parsons have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Nancy Lee Parsons, to Patrick John MacDonald, son of Mr. and Mrs. John P. MacDonald of Huntington. The wedding is planned for June.

title: F.C.C. MAN SCORES REVAMPING PLANS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 17  Nicholas Johnson, a member of the Federal Communications Commission, said today that a study group named by Presi dent Nixon had reached the wrong conclusion in proposing reorganization of Government agencies, like the F.C.C. that directly regulate business.

title: Nixon Presses Welfare Program With Members of Senate Panel
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 17 President Nixon has intervened with all the Republican mem bers of the Senate Finance Com mittee and most of the Demo crats in a lastditch effort to save his welfare reform pro gram.

title: Legacy of Indians and Mr. Bronck
description: Indians, saints and accidents of spelling are among the sources from which places get their names.

title: STATE WILL GRANT CLAY RING LICENSE
description: Surendering to a court or der, the State Athlete Com mission indicated yesterday that it would grant Muhammad All a boxer's license when he submitted an application. But relicensing will not automati cally reinstate recognition of him as the world heavyweight champion.

title: Hockey Player Recovering
description: MONTREAL, Sept, 17 (UPI) Michel Briere, a 20yearold rookie center with the Pitts burgh Penguins of the National Hockey League, was reported today in satisfactory condition following surgery to relieve pressure on his brain. Briere had been in a coma since suf fering head injuries in a car accident four months ago.

title: Nareyev Will Perform With Ballet Defector
description: MILAN, Italy, Sept. 17 (Reuters)Rudolf Nureyev confirmed today that he would dance with the Soviet ballerina Natalya Makarova for the first time later this year.

title: Aim of LeadedGas Tax Called Clean Air, Not Revenue
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 17 Officials of th. Treasury De partment and the White House insisted today that the Nixon Administration's proposed ta:: on gasoline lead additives was primarily intended to help re duce smog, rather than raise more funds, as some critics have contended.

title: U.S. TOPS ARGENTINA IN CHESS OLYMPIAD
description: SIEGEN, Germany, Sept. 17 The United States team scored 2 points against Argen tina in three games and ad journed one in the third round tonight of the 19th Chess Olympiad.

title: Film Festival: Bertolucci's Spider's Stratagem
INSURANCE BILL ON BROKERS GAINS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 17  The House Commerce Sub committee completed action today on a brokerdealer insur ance bill that is somewhat more to the liking of the securities industry than the Senate Bank ing Committee's version.

title: Palo Alto, Calif.: Changing Mood in the Universities?
description: PALO ALTO. Calif., Sept. 17 When President Nixon's tough Kansas State speech against the fist and bullet uni versity activists gets serious praise on the much more liberal Stanford University campus, it is a fairly good sign that the 1970 school year is opening on a different note.

title: Shutting Off Debate
description: If there is any good reason to support the right of unlimited debate in the Senate at all, there is certainly no good reason for a small minority to prevent a con stitutional amendment from coming up for a vote on its merits. Yet thirtysix members of the Senate yes terday joined to prevent a vote on a constitutional amendment abolishing the Electoral College and pro viding for the direct, popular election of Presidents and Vice Presidents.

title: Blind Man Beaten And His Dog Stolen In Midtown Attack
description: Two youths attacked a blind man on 42d Street at the height of the evening rush hour yesterday, took his wallet and stole his guide dog.

title: Premier Cites Border Needs
description: At a private luncheon with New York news executives yes terday, Mrs. Meir stressed Is rael's need for secure and rec ognized borders but refrained from mentioning any specific areas as nonnegotiable.

title: 3,000 CHEER CONCERT BY PHILADELPHIANS
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 17A soldout audience of 3,000 gave the Philadelphia Orchestra, under Eugene Ormandy, and Rudolf Serkin, the pianist, warm reception last night at the first gala nonsubscription concert in the orchestra's 71st season.

title: Appalled Perelman Going Eastward Ha!
description: The United States is about to suffer a total loss of one of its least expendable na tional resourcesthe humor ist S. J. Perelman.

title: Bahamas Jail New Yorker
description: FREEPORT, the Bahamas, Sept. 17 (AP)A magistrate sentenced 24yearold Paul Stephan of Port Chester, N. Y., today to three months at hard labor for attempting to board an airliner yesterday with pistol in his pocket. Mr. Stephan told the magistrate the pistol was not loaded and that he believed the gun had been cleared by customs.

title: 2 Sides in Jordan's Civil War: Hussein vs. the Palestine Arabs
description: Once again Arabs are fight ing Arabs in Jordan.

title: Varied Problems Beset Opening Of Jewish Museum's Software
description: Temporarily Out of Order was the operative phrase yes terday at Software, the Jew ish Museum's new show con cerning information processing systems. On its opening day, the exhibition was plagued by a shortcircuited computer that crippled some electronic gear. the destruction of a series of films about participating artists, and charges by two of the show's contributors that the museum had censored their work.

title: 8 Black Players List Demands in a Move To Rejoin Syracuse
description: SYRACUSE, Sept. 17 (UPI) Eight black players suspend ed from the Syracuse Universi ty football squad signed a state ment today indicating a desire to rejoin the team.

title: Policy on Credit Is Easier; Loan Demand Is Sluggish
description: The Federal Reserve Sys tem's credit policy was easy and the demand for loans at moneycenter banks was slug gish during the last two weeks, banking data published yester day showed.

title: Executive Changes
description: Jose de Varon has been appointed president the Rocky Mountain Energy Company, a subsidiary of the Union Pacific Corporation, the holding com pany that controls the Union Pacific Rail Road.

title: Retail Sales UP 1% in Week
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 17  The Department of Commerce reported today that department store sales for the latest week ended Sept. 12 was an estimated $684million, an increase of one per cent above the $677million sales for the corresponding week of last year. Total retail store sales for the latest week was an estimated $6,537,000, 000, an increase of one per cent above the $6,475,000,000 for the same period last year.

title: DRUG SPOTS ON TV TO BE TONED DOWN
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 17 The television industry and several drug companies have agreed to tone down commer cials for stimulants, depressants and sleeping aids.

title: Nelson and Mitchell Signed
description: The signing of two perform ers for two Broadway shows was announced yesterday. Barry Nelson will costar with Carol Channing in Four on Garden, the Abe Burrows comedy opening Nov. 29th at the Broadhurst Theater. Cam eron Mitchell will share star billing with James Earl Jones in Les Blancs, the Lorraine Hansberry drama, which will have its premiere Oct. 21 at the Longacre Theater.

title: Ballet: Fonteyn Takes La Scala Bows
description: MILAN, Italy, Sept. 17 Going to La Scala in Milan to see the ballet rather than the opera savors faintly of un Italian activity. As you enter the architect Piermarini's marbled entrance hall, the grizzled statue of Verdi looks at least supercilious if not ac tually disapproving, and the audience wears a collectively gpilty look. And the theater itself  apparently designed for an audience that wanted to be seen rather than to see is illfitted for anything more than opera at its most vocal.

title: Middle Ground Proposed On Bank Bill's 2 Versions
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 17 A key antitrust official pro posed today that Congress find a middle ground between the two versions of bank holding company legislation that have been approved by the House and the Senate.

title: YULIAN OKSMAN, RUSSIAN SCHOLAR
description: Yulian Grigoryevich Oksman, a Russian literary critic and social historian, died Tuesday in Moscow. He was 75 years old.

title: BASSETT, WITH 65, LEADS BY STROKE
description: ROBINSON, Ill., Sept. 17 (AP)Slender Rich Bassett of Miami, a nonwinner since he joined the Professional Golfers Association tour in 1967, took a onestroke lead today in the firstround of the $100,000 Rob inson Golf Classic. He scored birdies on eight of the first 12 holes and finished with a 65.

title: HUSSEIN'S TANKS CLEARING GUERRILLAS FROM AMMAN; U.S. ALERT IS STEPPED UP
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Sept. 17 Troops and tanks under the orders of King Hussein's new military Government swept into the capital today for showdown battle with the Pal estinian guerrillas, and by mid afternoon the army seemed to be gaining the upper hand.

title: Baudo Makes His Debut As Met Gives Hoffmann
U.A.W. SHIFTS AIM TO LOCAL ISSUES
description: DETROIT, Sept. 17Teams; of United Auto Workers and General Motors Corporation of ficials fanned out around the country today in an effort to activate bargaining on plant level problems.

title: NIXON, IN CHICAGO, AIDS SENATE DRIVE
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 17  Still buoyed by his reception yester day at Kansas State Univer sity, President Nixon bounced around Chicago today for series of appearances designed in part to help the political fortunes of Senator Ralph T. Smith.

title: Books of The Times
description: Sir Walter Scott's life resembles nothing so much as a stretch of faultless spring days or a series of youthful holidays. Every thing conspired to make his life one to envy: his unremitting successes, his family life, his standing in the community, his win ning and attractive character. He was a good neighbor, a responsible citizen, an, unsullied magistrate. As a writer he was re markable: he was completely free of literary vanity. Friendly to rivals, helpful to begin ners, considerate of publishers and printers, he was without rancor or malice. He took the praise and buf fets of reviewers with equal calm and was seldom cast down and never halted by hostile criticism. He wrote like an Addressograph ma chine turning out page after page after page of manuscript, and for 20 years was the unchallenged master in his field.

title: A Jewish Group Honors a Catholic Bishop Here
description: The American Jewish Com mittee honored the Roman Catholic Bishop of Brooklyn yesterday on his recent ap pointment as moderator of the secretariat for CatholicJewish Relations of the National Con ference of Catholic Bishops.

title: MONTCLAIR STATE WANTS TO REPEAT
description: UPPER MONTCLAIR, N. J., Sept. 17Clary Anderson gave up a most successful coaching career at Montclair High School last year to take the football coaching position at Montclair State College.

title: PENN CENTRAL'S BID ON TAXES WEIGHED
description: Judge John P. Fullam of the Federal District Court took un der advisement yesterday the petition of the trustees of the Penn Central Transportation Company to defer payment of some $45million of state and local property taxes that have become payable since June 21, or will fall due by Dec. 31.

title: I.T.T. SIGNS DEAL FOR H. M. HARPER
description: The International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation an nounced yesterday it has signed a letter of intent to acquire the H. M. Harper Company, pro ducer of corrosion resistant fasteners and stainless steel. Terms call for an exchange of 0.188 shares of International Telephone $4 convertible pre ferred Series K stock for each share of Harper common. Based on H. M. Harper com mon stock pres ently outstanding, International Telephone will issue about $17 million of its stock to acquire Harper.

title: Personal Income Climbs; Activity Lags in Housing
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 17 (AP)  Personal income rose $4billion in August to an an nual rate of $807.4billion, with wage and salary disbursements accounting for more than half of the increase, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: TRUST ACTIONS HELD BOON TO CONSUMER
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 17 (AP) Virginia Knauer, Presidential assistant for consumer affairs, said today that corporate con centration was at the heart of consumer problems and that vigorous antitrust activity may well be the consumers best friend.

title: Mrs. Meir in Washington
description: Although the news from Jordan and the violated Suez ceasefire zone may be more dramatic, the meeting of Israel's Premier Golda Meir with President Nixon today is likely to have greater longterm impact on the prospects for peace or general war in the Middle East.

title: ... and the World Bank's Role
description: The World Bank's latest report on its expanding role in assisting developing countries is both dramatic and timely. It coincides with President Nixon's pro posal to channel an increasing share of American aid through such international institutions and it provides solid evidence for the wisdom of this move.

title: All Aboard for Tour of Place Names!
description: Sudden seizures of idle curiosity about why Culdesac, Idaho, is called that, or how such places as What Cheer, R. I., or XRay, Texas, got their names need no longer go unsated.

title: Article 2  No Title
Two Nixon Aides in Japan
description: TOKYO. Sept. 17 (AP)Two of President Nixon's domestic advisers, John D. Ehrlichman and George P. Shultz, arrived in Japan today to study the transportation system.

title: Goldberg Opens RadioTV Campaign
description: A month after the start of Governor Rockefeller's radio and television campaign, Arthur J. Goldberg began this week limited radio and television campaign highlighting his new campaign theme. Leadership for a Change.

title: AMHERST IS WARY; WILLIAMS HOPEFUL
description: WILLIAMSTOWN, Mass., Sept. 17  Larry Catuzzi expressed confidence today that his Wil liams College football team would be able to play on even terms with any of its oppo nents this fall.

title: Humphrey Looks Happily to a Sweep
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Sept. 17 When Hubert H. Humphrey is up, he is very, very up. Last night he was in vintage form as he savored his victory in Tuesday's Senatorial primary election here.

title: Robison Criticizes Agnew
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 18 Representative Howard W. Robison, the senior Republican House member from New York, has warned Vice President Agnew that his recent attack on Senator Charles E. Goodell could aid the election of Democratic Senator from the state this fall.

title: Powell Officially Held Ineligible For Independent Line on Ballot
description: Representative Adam Clayton Powell, who was defeated in the June Democratic primary for his Congression seat, was ruled by the Board of Elections yesterday to be ineligible to run as an independent candidate in the November election.

title: Congressional Aides Feted By Nixon at White House
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 18 (AP)  President Nixon enter tained over 1,000 Congression al staff members at the White House late today, then took off by helicopter for a weekend at Camp David, Md.

title: STOCKS MANAGE SMALL ADVANCE
Saura's The Garden of Delights
Kolotov, Soviet Ace, Breaks Two Marks In Weight Lifting
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Sept. 18 (AP)Vasily Kolotov, a 26yearold laborer from the. So viet Union, established two un official world records today to win the middle heavyweight crown in the world weightlift ing championships.

title: Article 1  No Title
MRS. COOPERSTEIN KEEPS GOLF TITLE
description: COLD SPRING HARBOR, L.I., Sept. 18  Mrs. Walter Cooper stein of Glen Oaks defeated Mrs. Cutting Cushing of Mead ow Brook, 6 and 5, today in the scheduled 36hole final of the 15th Women's Cross County Golf Association championship at the Cold Spring County Club. Par for the 5,861yard course is 37, 3673.

title: Witness Says He Spent 6 Months With Manson in Alcoholic Daze
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 18Danny Decarlo, a prosecution witness at the murder trial of Charles M. Manson, testified today that he was in an alco holic and marijuana daze dur ing the six months that he was a follower of the hippie fam ily leader.

title: Scores on WQXR
description: Scores of lading  football games will be given over WQXR, on the 6 P.M. news broadcast and in other news reports. Please do not telephone The New York Times for scores; the calls tie up lines and interfere with the work of the newspaper and radio station.

title: Chance, Indian at Noon, Ends Day in Met Bull Pen
description: Dean Chance started his day in Cleveland, waiting for a plane to Baltimore, but finished it in Shea Stadium, waiting for a possible chance to pitch in his first game for the Mets.

title: OTTINGER MEETS WITH 15 EDITORS
description: Representative Richard L. Ottinger, meeting yesterday with 15 editors of foreignlan guage newspapers in the city, was questioned closely about his views on foreign policy by the journalists, many of whom had had firsthand experience with dictatorial regimes abroad.

title: Realty Antagonists
description: There's always some thing to be done, said Julius Hersch Borenstein as he con templated his role as presi dent of the Bronx Real Estate Advisory Board, representing the owners of 2,500 buildings in the borough.

title: PRODUCTION OF CARS PLUMMETS IN WEEK
description: DETROIT, Sept. 18 (Ap)The automotive industry pro duced its five millionth car of the calendar year this week de spite a sharp cut in auto pro duction resulting from the United Auto Workers strike against the General Motors Corporation.

title: Parade Today
description: The 13th annual Steuben Day Parade, sponsored by the GermanAmerican Com mittee of Greater New York, will be held today beginning at 2 P.M. The parade will proceed along Fifth Avenue from 61st to 86th Street, and across 86th Street to Second Avcnue.

title: HONEYWELL, G.E. IN COMPUTER DEAL
description: The stockholders of Honey well, Inc., approved at a spe cial meeting yesterday in Wil mington, Del., the merger of Honeywell's computer and com munications group with the business computer operations of the General Electric Company to form a new Honeywell sub sidiary. The new operation will be known as the Honeywell Infor ma tion Systems, I n c. Yesterday's vote was the final step in a process that started May 20 when the agreement was first announced to the surprise of most mem bers of the industry.

title: Topics: Mrs. Trollope's Hudson And Ours
description: PRINK HILL. N.Y The contrast between Amer ica of the past and of today is chastening. In the beginning the land was bright and clean; it elated the early explorers and settlers. Some of them thought it was better than any thing they knew in England or Europe.

title: STRIKING TEACHERS FREED IN NEW HAVEN
description: NEW HAVEN, Sept. 18An official of the American Feder ation of Teachers used $1,400 in national union funds today to bail out 14 members of the stri;.ting local who were jailed late Thursday after refusing to pay $100contemptofcourt fines.

title: Executive Changes
description: James E. Gibson, president of the hosiery division of J. P. Stevens & Co., Inc., has resigned. He will be succeeded by Robert J. StahIsmith, a corporate vice president who will hold the title of acting president of the hosiery division.

title: RAISE YOUR GLASS BELMONT CHOICE
description: The Belmont Futurity, which had its first running in 1888, will be contested today, with a field of 13 named for the 6furlong test. The large field will make for a gross purse of $159,800 and a winner's share of $99,320.

title: 19 Pilgrims Killed in Brazil
description: RECIFE, Brazil, Sept. 18 (UPI)Nineteen pilgrims re turning from a religious festi val in the state of Ceara in the northeast, died today and 33 were injured when the truck in which they were riding lost its brakes, veered off a hilly curve and plunged into a lake.

title: New Paltz Worries About Aid to Addicts
description: NEW PALTZ, N. Y., Sept. 18This town of 10,000 pop ulation, known for its sturdy, 17thcentury stone houses built by Huguenot settlers to fend off the Indians, is caught up in a very modern contro versy: how to treat drug ad dicts.

title: Europe Cautioned on Common Currency
description: PARIS, Sept. 18  A Chase Manhattan Bank economist warned Europeans today that their efforts to construct a common currency would be successful only if steps were taken to deal effectively with the deeply rooted differences between European nations.

title: The Policeman and the Students
description: CAMBRIDGE, MassJoseph McNamara is a New York po lice lieutenant from a family of New York policemen. His father was on the force for 26 years; his brother Michael has been there for twenty, and Joe for fourteen, a traditional New York copexcept that he has been at Harvard for a year.

title: Lowery Reports Rise in False Alarms
description: More than three of every 10 times that New York City fire men answered a call last year, they found it to be a false alarm.

title: LAURENCE W. STERN
description: Laurence W. Stern, a cotton converter and investment ex ecutive, died yesterday at the Jewish Home and Hospital for the Aged, 120 West 106th Street, where he had been stay ing for only one day. He was 83 years old and lived at 146 Central Park West.

title: BASEL BANK DENIES $68.4MILLION LOSS
description: BASEL, Switzerland, Sept. 15 (Reuters)The United Califor nia Bank in Basel, A.G., which was closed last Wednesday, to day attempted to clalify the situation surrounding its re cent losses and denied reports that these could reach 300 mil lion francs ($68.4million), in stead of the announced figure of $40million.

title: Trial of 3 in Soledad Case Transferred to San Diego
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 18 (AP)The trial of three black prisoners accused of murdering a guard during racial turmoil at Soledad prison has been moved to San Diego over de fense objections.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Exchange. The President appointed Robert McClellen, Assistant Secretary of Com merce, as a member of the President's Commission on Personnel Interchange. Mr. McClellen will replace Ken neth Davis on the commis sion, in.which Government and industry executives learn about each other's jobs.

title: Protesters in Italian City Battle Police After 2 Die
description: REGGIO CALABRIA, Italy, Sept. 18Hundreds of rioters battled with the police and built barricades today follow ing a night of clashes in which two persons died.

title: Ronan Proves to Be an Adept Painter
description: Dr. William J. Ronan, chair man of the Metropolitan Trans portation Authority, disclosed an unsuspected facet of his con troversial personality yesterday his ability as a painter.

title: Aid for Antiwar Pickets
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Sept 18, (UPI)  Photographers will be present to record any harass ment of antiwar demonstrators on a visit by Vice President Ag new next Tuesday, the Ken tucky Civil Liberties Union has announced. Three local groups plan to demonstrate while the Vice President is here to cam paign for Representative Wil liam O. Cowger.

title: INSURERS SCORED ON TERMINOLOGY
description: Roger C. Wilkins, president of the Travelers Insurance Companies, criticized the life insurance industry yesterday for talking in language that many people find difficult to understand.

title: Bottle Thief, 17, Is Freed
description: TITUSVILLE, Fla., Sept. 18 (AP)  Douglas Radcliffe, 17 years old, was released from a jail cell today, eight days after he pleaded guilty to stealing a half dozen empty softdrink bottles. Magistrate J. William Woodson ordered him released on the advice of a parole of ficer and said the youth would be sentenced later. Sherriff Leigh Wilson said the bottles would have netted the youth 18 cents.

title: TOYO KOGYO NEAR DEAL WITH FORD
description: TOKYO, Sept. 18  Toyo Kogyo, Japan's third largest automobile manufacturer, ap pears close to breaking a long impasse in delicate negotia tions for a capital tieup with the Ford Motor Company of the United States.

title: Silverstein Sues Studio
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 18 (UPI) Elliot Silverstein, the film di rector, filed a $531,000 suit against Warner BrothersSeven Arts yesterday that accused the studio of wrongfully removing him from directing Nobody Loves Flapping Eagle. In the suit, Mr. Silverstein said the company agreed to pay him $150,000. plus 5 per cent of the profits of the film for 24 weeks of work. Jerry Elder and Clair Fuffaker, the producers, were also named in tile suit.

title: A Listing of New Books
description: FICTION

title: Experts See Little Peril in Gunfire on Jet
description: There is little danger that a gunfight aboard a hijacked air liner could cause serious enough damage either to the structure or to controls to cause crash, Government and airline industry experts agree.

title: U.S. FORCE IN AREA IS HELD ADEQUATE
description: Troops, ships and planes suf ficient for effective American military intervention in support lof King Hussein of Jordan;should such action be decided uponare deployed in the Mediterranean and Central Europe.

title: Brainwave?
description: If the late George Orwell were writing a sequel to 1984 today, he would probably reject as archaic the propaganda techniques for controlling people's minds described in his famous antiUtopian classic. Today, for example, he might envisage a society which a newborn baby's first experience would be neurosurgery, an operation in which the child's brain was fitted with miniaturized radio devices connected to every major center controlling reason and emotion.

title: Space Junk Called Russian
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Sept. 18 (AP)United States Ambassador Charles W. Yost said today that four metal space objects recovered recent ly in the United States were believed to be of Soviet origin. The objects, found in the South west and Midwest around the time the Soviet Cosmos 316 satellite was scheduled to re enter the atmosphere, would be returned if Soviet representa tives confirmed the identifica tion, Mr. Yest said.

title: GAIL PHILLIPS DIES; PORTRAIT PAINTER
description: Gail Phillips, an illustrator and portrait painter, died Fri day at his home, 400 East 57th Street, after a short illness. His age was 63.

title: Dull Market Found By 2 New Stocks Issued This Week
description: The newissue market con tinued listless this week as only two companies sold their shares.

title: BLACK COMMUNITY PLANS 1,000 JOBS
description: A group of black businessmen in the BedfordStuyvesant sec tion of Brooklyn announced plans yesterday to develop 10C new blisinesses employing more than 1,000 people in the next two years.

title: Australians Protest War
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Sept. 18 More than 300 persons were arrested today as an estimated 50,000 people took part in Viet nam peace demonstrations in Australian cities.

title: Buckley Asks Disbarment of Kunstler
description: James L. Buckley, Conserva tive party candidate for the United States Senate, yester day called upon the Associa tion of the Bar of the City of New York to begin disbarment proceedings against William M. Kunstler, one of the defense lawyers in the Chicago 7 con spiracy trial.

title: U.S. Calls for a Boycott in Jet Hijackings
description: MONTREAL, Sept. 18 (AP), The United States called on member countries of the Inter national Civil Aviation Organi zation today to suspend air, services to and from countries that fail to act against hi iackers.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: MITCHELL ASSAILS STUPID STUDENTS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 18 (UPI) Attorney General John N. Mitchell was quoted today as having said that students, pro fessors and these stupid bas tank who are ruining our edu cational institutions were un informed about the issues with in government.

title: BUILDING STRIKE ENDS IN SUBURBS
description: An agreement yesterday end ed a strike by maintenance workers in apartment houses in Westchester and Rockland Counties, but the contract dis pute continued in the Bronx.

title: Senate Votes Controls on Funds Hidden Away in Foreign Banks
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 18 (UPI) The Senate passed a bill to day to stop the illegal use of secret foreign bank accounts but killed a provision intended to crack down on United States citizens who buy and sell Amer ican stocks abroad to evade taxes.

title: Corsaro's Direction Is Strength Of La Traviata by City Opera
description: The distinguishing factor in the New York City Opera's production of La Traviata is Frank Corsaro's stage direction. Its unconventionality, its atten tion to logical detail were in evidence again in the first per formance this fall of the Verdi work at the State Theater.

title: Reduced Charges Agreed in Jersey In Panther Case
description: JERSEY CITY, Sept. 18 (AP)  The prosecution in the case of three Black Panthers charged with firing a machine gun at a police station here agreed today to drop its re quest for a new trial. The de fendants agreed to plead guilty to other charges.

title: GUITAR RECITAL HAS NEW TOUCH
description: Since it is thought in some musical circles that the tradi tional conventions of concert presentation are due for an overhaul, Michael Sullivan's at tempt to do something a little different with a guitar recital may not be so farfetched as it seemed at times during his theatrical occurrence at Car negie Recital Hall on Thursday night.

title: Jordan Suspends Attacks After 2d Day of Fighting
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Sept. 18Fierce fighting persisted for second day in Amman and northern Jordan today as the Jordanian Army failed to score the quick knockout of Pales tinian guerrilla forces it had presumably expected.

title: LAST FULL PAYDAY FOR G.M. STRIKERS
description: DETROIT, Sept. 18 (UPI) Today was the last full pay day for the duration for more than 355,000 striking General Motors Corporation workers in the United States and Canada. The effects of the shutdown of the world's biggest manufac turing corporation began to mushroom.

title: M'LUCAS IS GIVEN 1215 YEAR TERM
description: NEW HAVEN, Sept. 18Lon nie McLucas, who was the first Black Panther to stand trial in connection with the slaying of Alex Rackley, was sentenced today to 12 to 15 years for joining in a conspiracy to mur der.

title: Dr. Dan M. Gordon, 63, Dies; Eye Specialist and Researcher
description: Dr. Dan M. Gordon, a leading eye specialist, died Thursday in New York Hospital, after brief illness. He was 63 years old and lived at 435 70th Street and at 78 Hampton Road, Scars dale, N.Y. His office was at 441 East 68th Street.

title: EASY MONEY WINS JUMPER LAURELS
NEW HAVEN ADDS TO EVENING RUNS; More and Faster Trains, ?? Into Service Monday
description: New schedules promising more and faster evening rush hour commuter trains from Grand Central Terminal on the New Haven division are to go into effect Monday  but with out the parallel increase in singleride and 10ride fares sought by its parent, the Penn Central, and rejected by the New York State Public Service Commission.

title: RAMS TURN BACK CARDINALS, 3413
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 18 (UPI)  Roman Gabriel topped off two long marches with short scoring passes and Alvin Hay mond sprinted 98 yards to a touchdown with the secondhalf kickoff tonight to lead the Los Angeles Rams to a 3413 vic tory over the St. Louis Cardi nals in their National Football League opener.

title: SOHIO SUED BY U.S. OVER PRICE FIXING
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 18 (UPI) The Government charged the Standard Oil Company (Ohio) today with fixing prices at ar bitararily high levels on gaso line and other products sold under the Sohio label.

title: Robinson &
description: David L. Wasser, a New York lawyer, said yesterday that he had filed a suit against the New York Stock Exchange on behalf of customers of Robin son & Co., a former member of the exchange that has filed under Chapter XI of the Fed eral Bankruptcy Act.

title: Britain Insists Israelis Exchange Some Prisoners for the Hostages
description: LONDON, Sept. 18The Brit Ash Government made itclear to Israel today that it felt some Palestinian prisoners must be freed for the airline hostages now held in Jordan.

title: Long Island Fair Opens At Old Bethpage Village
description: OLD BETHPAGE, L. I., Sept. 18The Long Island Fair opened for a threeday stay here today in the bucolic atmosphere of the Old Beth page Village Restoration.

title: Senate in Saigon Backs Some Devaluation of Piaster
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 18The South Vietnam ese Senate passed a bill today allowing President Nguyen Van Thieu to devalue the piaster for certain transactions, but it refused to give him the special economic powers that he had sought. The bill now goes back to the House of Representa tives.

title: NEW REGIME SEEN AS GUERRILLA AIM
description: BEIRUT, Sept. 18If the commandos can score a real military victory, and by that we mean forbidding an army victory, then we will be able to force our conditions, guerrilla intellectual said in Beirut today.

title: I.0.S. Receives $5Million As First Portion of Loan
description: GENEVA, Sept. 18  $5mil lion of a loan of up to $15mi1 lion being made by the Inter national Controls Corporation of New Jersey to Investors Overseas Services has been placed in escrow, an I.O.S. spokesman said tonight.

title: COUNCIL MINORITY REMAINS DIVIDED
description: The divided fourmember Liberal party City Council min ority, after a heated meeting, concluded yesterday that it would remain an ineffective legislative force.

title: NORMA AT THE MET RETAINS ITS MAGIC
description: Bellini's tlorma, the jewel of the Metropolitan Opera last season when it was given new production, was heard Thursday night at the Met for the first time this season.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Environment Center Dedicated
description: MADISON, Wis., Sept. 18Dr.. Warren Porter, a young zoologist, was overjoyed when his desert lizard emerged from its burrow at 10:23 today. It was only a minute earlier than the Professor had predicted after weeks of studying how; the slightest environmental changes affect a lizard's daily life.

title: Crew Reported Abandoning Crippled German Freighter
description: NORFOLK, Va. Sept. 18 (AP)  Atlantic Fleet headquarters reported today that the West German merchant ship Samba was listing severely and her crew was abandoning her about 600 miles west of the Azores.

title: Agnew's Political Role
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 18The scenario for Vice President Agnew's appearance at a Re publican rally in Albuquerque, N. M., the other night called for him to enter stage left and exit stage right.

title: FUND REDEMPTIONS OFF DURING AUGUST
description: Despite the bear market in stocks, mutual fund redemp tions continued to decline last month, The Investment Com pany Institute reported yester day.

title: 5 Seized in Jersey Usury Case; Victim's Family Hidden by U.S.
description: NEWARK, Sept. 18The in dictments of six men described by Frederick B. Lacey, the United States Attorney here, as members of one of the largest, if not the largest, shylocking operations in the history of New Jersey were made public here today.

title: U.S. Working Capital Up
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 18 (Reu ters)The net working capital of United States corporations rose $700million in the second quarter of 1970, compared with a $200million increase in the first quarter, the Securities and Exchange Commission reported today. Working capital, which represents business investment in current assets in excess of current liabilities, totaled $215 billion at the end of June, the S.E.C. said.

title: Sun Oil Raises Refinery Prices On SolventRefined Products
description: The Sun Oil Company an nounced yesterday that it had increased its refinery and ter minal prices on most solventre fined industrial products, in cluding industrial lubricating oils and specialty products.

title: F.D.A. Is Weighing Curbs on Saccharin
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 18 Middlelevel officials of the Food and Drug Administration are considering placing limits on the amount of saccharin that may be consumed, although they have no proof that the artifical sweetener is harmful to human beings.

title: Breaking the Traffic Noose
description: Disclosure that the Lindsay administration has ended its long indecision on the advisability of charg ing tolls on East River bridges raises hope of easing the massive traffic jams that have been making mid town streets virtually impassable in business hours.

title: Brooklyn School Seeks Racial Accord
description: After several days in which white youths had harassed and assaulted some black students at South Shore High School, officials, students and neigh borhood youths met yesterday in an attempt to ease the sit uation.

title: Open College Doors
description: The City University has kept its promise that would admit, for the first time in its history, every applicant with a June 1970 high school diploma. Its enrollment projections appear entirely accurate, far more so than those of the state and city political leadership. As a result, the university has been able to anticipate the staffing needs for an enterprise that is certain to strain to the limit the institution's ca pacity to do a nearly impossible emergency job.

title: CHARLES ROCKWOOD, PUBLICITY SPECIALIST
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., Sept. 19 Charles P. Rockwood, special assistant to the managing part. ner of Haskins & Sells, inter national publicaccounting con cern, died at his home here last evening. He was 53 years old and lived at 214 Old Army Road.

title: On the West Bank, the Mood Is Pessimistic
CORN CONTRACTS JUMP NEAR CLOSE
description: A prediction by the Illinois Farmer's Union that corn pro duction this year would fall be low the estimate of the De partment of Agriculture sent closing corn tutures prices higher yesterday on the Chi cago Board of Trade.

title: Leone Takes Oath as Brooklyn's Borough President
description: Pledging to involve com munity people in the de cisions of government and to work for better housing and more job opportunities, Sebastian Leone was form ally sworn in yesterday as the interim Borough Presi dent of Brooklyn.

title: BOSTON SEES ART OF METROPOLITAN
description: BOSTON, Sept. 18An ex hibition of 100 masterpieces from the Metropolitan Museum of Art has opened at the Bos ton Museum of Fine Arts as part of what has been described as the largest museum ex change ever undertaken.

title: CATHOLIC HUMILITY IN ECUMENISM ASKED
description: ROME, Sept. 13The Vati can called today for intensified ecumenical discussions to fos ter unity among Christians.

title: Niarchos Indictment Rejected in Greece
description: ATHENS, Sept. 18A panel of magistrates has ruled that there were no grounds for tak ing criminal action against Stavros S. Niarchos in connec tion with the death of his wife last May. The case is not closed, however, since the deci sion can be appealed to a high er tribunal. [The prosecutor plans to appeal the decision, The Associated Press reported.]

title: PANTHER AIDE HERE JAILED IN MURDER
description: In New York City, an organ izer of the New York branch of the Black Panther party was sentenced yesterday in State Supreme Court, the Bronx, to a 25yeartolife term in prison in connection with a fatal shooting last year.

title: KAPILOW ASSUMES LEAD IN TITLE SAIL
Brice Pours a Cliche Into the Wrong Bottle
description: PARIS, Sept. 18 (AP) David K. E. Bruce, head of the United States delegation to the Paris talks, scrambled the wine and the bottles yester day in talking about peace proposals presented by Mrs. Nguyen Thi Binh of the Viet cong.

title: 130 Collegians, ExDropouts, Honored at Harlem Reception
description: A group of 130 young men and women who had been high school dropouts but made comebacks and entered college were guests yesterday at graduation reception in Har lem.

title: This Earl of Lichfield Works
French B?? U.N. Admit Red China
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Sept. 18Foreign Minister Maurice Schumann of France made a strong appeal here to day for the admission of Com munist China to the United Nations and for a larger role in world affairs for France and Britain alongside the two superpowers, the United States and the Soviet Union.

title: I. C C. Approves a Merger Of Monon Line and L. &
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 18 (AP) Approving a railroad merger for the first time in more than year, the Interstate Commerce Commission today gave ap proval for acquisition of the Monon Railroad by the Louis ville & Nashville.

title: Pergamon Estimates $3.1Million Loss
description: LONDON, Sept. 18Perga mon Press, Ltd., battered and ?? by rows, litigation and a Government inquiry, estimated today that it would lose $3, 177,000 in the fiscal year end ing Seat. 30.

title: Mrs. Riordan Fiancee Of George F. Getty 2d
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept 18Mrs. Jacqueline Riordan, widow of Michael R. Riordan, founder and head of the Los Angelesbased Equity Fund ing Corporation, and George F. Getty 2d, operating chief of the Getty Oil Company here, plan to be married in the spring.

title: News Summary and Index
description: International

title: U.S. Aid Official Assures Seoul on Economic Help
THURE PETERSON, CHIROPRACTOR, 71
description: Dr. Thure Conrad Peterson, chiropractor and educator, died yesterday in the New York In firmary after a short illness. He lived in Bernardsville, N. J., and maintained an office here. His age was 71.

title: Bridge:
description: An obscure bidding situa tion arises when an opening minorsuit bid is followed by an overcall of two notrump. After a major suit it is clear that such a bid should be unusual, promising length in clubs and diamonds. Some players retain this interpreta tion after a minor suit has been bid, but such a treat ment is open to question.

title: PANTHERS TRIED 2 POLICE AGENTS
description: NEW ORLEANS, Sept. 18The New Orleans police de partment confirmed today that two of its undercover agents had been discovered and beat en by members of a Black Panther group. The beating touched off a night of violence Monday and a massive police attack on the Panthers Tues day morning.

title: LUGGAGE SEARCHES SET FOR 33 AIRPORTS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 18 (AP) Customs agents will begin within the week to search all hand luggage carried by pas sengers boarding international flights at the nation's 33 gate way airports, the Treasury De partment said today.

title: $75,000 BID BUYS WEATHERLY HERE
description: How much is a slightly used America's Cup winner worth?

title: Devlin Leads Alcan Golf by a Stroke
description: PORTMARNOCK, Ireland, Sept. 18 (AP)  Bruce Devlin salvaged a oneunderpar 71 today and clung to a diminish ing lead in the second round of the Alcan Golfer of the Year tournament.

title: Books of The Times
description: Here are two first novels that, aside from their respective primacies, share a concern with madness. In Shainberg's One on One it is the mindblowing, playful madness of the inspired ancient Zen mas ters and Chinese sages, set in a modern funhouse mirrorworld of identity and alienation. In Walker's Cruising it is the mundane madness that walks these mean streetsstrange, almost palpable, frighten ing. To their credit, neither author flinches from his subject; both plumb its depths and crevices.

title: GOODELL SCORES RIVAL ON TV USE
description: Senator Charles E. Goodell accused Representative Rich ard L. Ottinger yesterday of callous attempt to use a scheduled $1.5million televi sion advertising campaign to win a Senate seat.

title: WORLD STAMP SHOW IS OPENED IN LONDON
description: LONDON, Sept. 18Philym pia, the 1970 international stamp show, opened here today with an attendance estimated at 10.000 people.

title: Killer Sentenced to Death
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept. 18 (AP) Stanley B. Hoss Jr., 28 years old, of suburban West Taren turn, was sentenced today to die in the electric chair for the murder of Patrolman Joseph Zanella, 26, of Verona, a year ago.

title: $500 Offered for Return Of Blind Man's Guide Dog
description: A $500 reward was offered by two humane societies yes terday for the return of a guide dog stolen from a blind man who was beaten and robbed by two youths on 42d Street near Fifth Avenue at the height of the evening rush hour Thurs day.

title: Arab Students in Moscow Occupy Jordanian Embassy
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 18 (AP)Jordanian students staged a peaceful twohour sitin today at Jordan's embassy here to protest King Hussein's procla mation of a military regime and Government atrocities against Palestinian guerrillas.

title: Edith DeVoe Is Betrothed
description: HIGHLAND PARK, N. J., Sept. 18Mr. and Mrs. George W. DeVoe have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Edith Marion DeVoe, to David Charles Klink.

title: A New Think Tank Visualizes Problems
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 18A management consultant has developed a roomsize think tank for business executives. Paul G. Williams Jr. of West port, Conn., was granted a patent this week for the equipment, which he says half a dozen large corporations are Patents already using. The of the purpose of the sys Week tern described in Patent 3,528,715 is to display the many options open to management in de cisionmaking. As Mr. Wil liams puts it, I have dis covered that what is out of sight is literally out of mind.

title: Market Place
description: Suppose you decide to put your shares in a street name. These shares, held in the broker's name for the customer's account, provide ease of trading since they can be delivered by the bro ker direct.

title: BUFFALO ORCHESTRA AWARDED $360,000
description: ALBANY, Sept. 18 (AP)To day the state made its largest grant to date under the $18 million program of aid to cul tural institutions, by awarding $360,000 to the Buffalo Phil harmonic Orchestra Society.

title: Giants Rated 3Point Favorites; Browns Picked to Stymie Jets
description: The Giants are favored and the Jets are not in opening games of the National Foot ball League season. The Giants are a 3point choice over Chicago at Yankee Stadium tonight while the Jets are 3point underdogs to the Browns in Cleveland on Monday night. The game at Cleveland will mark the opening of the Monday night television series with the kickoff on Chan nel 7 at 9 P.M. Tomorrow afternoon Channel 4 will tele cast the Houston at Pitts burgh game at 1 o'clock fol lowed by the Kansas City at Minnesota contest at 4 o'clock.

title: 4,390 Economists Urge Nixon to Veto Trade Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 18A group of 4,390 economists urged President Nixon today to veto the importlimiting trade bill if it reaches him in the version now pending before the House.

title: Old Wine in New Bottles
description: The new flexibility that was promised when Am bassador David K. E. Bruce went to the Paris peace talks as chief United States negotiator was not in evidence in the hasty American reaction to Communist proposals this week.

title: NOVEL BY PAULA FOX IS SUBJECT FOR FILM
description: Frank D. Gilroy, the Pulitzer Prizewinning playwright, and Shirley MacLaine will jointly produce a screen version of Paula Fox's Desperate Charac ters, with the actress appear ing in one of the two key roles.
