Mr. Gilroy also will make his debut as a film director, work ing from his adaptation of the book. He previously adapted two of his plays for the screen, the awardwinning The Sub ject Was Roses and The Only Game in Town.

title: Ottinger's Conservation Line On Ballot Is Upheld by Justice
description: ALBANY, Sept. 18Supreme Court Justice A. Franklin Ma honey today ruled Richard L. Ottinger's Conservation party back on the ballot for the Nov. 3 election.

title: Boswell's Snipe Wins Title
description: HAMILTON, Bermuda, Sept. 18 (AP)Gary Boswell of Fort Worth, Tex., won the Western Hemisphere Snipe Class sailing championship today with a low score of 34.7 points. Axel Schmidt of Brazil was second with 35.7 points, followed by Luis Orella of Argentina, 36.7; Earl Elms of the United States, 55.5, and Steve Keary of Cana da, 67.

title: SPAIN SEEKS A ROLE IN MIDEAST ACCORD
description: MADRID, Sept. 18Spain is consulting with the United Arab Republic in an attempt to work out proposals for breaking the deadlock in negotiations for a settlement between Israel and the Arab countries, informed Spanish sources disclosed today

title: Rep. Rogers Fights Defeat
description: DENVER, Sept. 18 (UPI)Representative Byron G. Rog ers, an apparent 30vote loser in the Colorado Democratic primary last week, has taken a fight to keep his Congres sional seat to the Colorado Su preme Court. The court agreed today to hear oral arguments by attorneys for Mr. Rogers, 10term legislator, and the up set winner, Craig Barnes. Mr. Rogers has charged that there was illegal voting in several Denver precincts.

title: Newsday Rises to 10 Cents
description: Newsday announced yester day that it was raising its price from a nickel to 10 cents, effec tive Monday. The Long Island daily said it was the first in crease since 1950, and that home delivery would cost 60 cents a week.

title: MRS. MEIR MEETS NIXON AND ROGERS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 18Premier Golda Meir said to day that Israel would continue to observe the ceasefire along the Suez Canal but would not participate in peace talks until there was a rollback of missiles from the ceasefire zone on the Egyptianheld side of the canal.

title: British Strike Settled At Auto Parts Factory
description: LONDON, Sept. 18. The sixweekold strike at an automobile component fac tory that nearly crippled the British car industry was set tled today.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: To the Editor:

title: EARNINGS DECLINE AT EXCELLO CORP
Transitional Float Backed
description: LONDON, Sept. 18 (Reuters) Gabriel Hauge, the president of the Manufacturers Hanover Trust Company, advocated to day the use of the organized transitional float technique where adjustment in important currencies became necessary.

title: Film Festival: Bertolucci Equates Politics With Sex
Engine Fire Put Out on 747
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 18 (AP)  An American Airlines 747 jetliner on the way to New York with 117 passengers and a crew of 17 returned safely to San Francisco Airport today minutes after takeoff after fire broke out in one engine. The pilot, Capt. Walter Stein er, smothered the fire with an automatic fire extinguisher. No one was injured, and passen gers were transferred to anoth er plane.

title: Levitt Hired Procaccino As PartTime State Aide
description: ALBANY, Sept. 18 (UPI)State Controller Arthur Levitt's office today confirmed that Mario A. Procaccino has held a parttime $150aday state job as a hearing officer on pen sion cases since March.

title: PAUL F. MAGNER
description: NORWALK, Conn., Sept. 18 Paul F. Magner, president of the Magner Funeral Home, Inc., 12 Mott Avenue, here, died yes terday in Pompano Beach, Fla., after a long illness. He was 67 years old.

title: Foreign Minister Wary
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Sept. 18Foreign Minister Tran Van Lam of South Vietnam said here today that the Vietcong pro posal might be a trap and was in any case a propaganda move. He noted that Mrs. Binh said they would stop attack ing during the withdrawal of American troops.

title: Art: Picabia's Oeuvre
description: The French painter Francis Picabia (18791953) first came to the United States at the time of the Armory Show in 1913. His own first oneman show in this country took place at Alfred Stieglitz's 291 gallery that same year. He was already one of the legendary leaders of the mod em movement in Europe, and looked to America to take up the challenge of the highly controversial avant garde then enjoying its hey day in Paris.

title: COURT REFORM FUND WILL HONOR LAWYER
description: The establishment of a fund in memory of Edward S. Green baum, one of New York's lead ing lawyers and court reform ers, who died last June 12 in Princeton, N. J., at the age of 80, was announced yesterday.

title: Thomas Hanft to Wed Miss Mary Hammond
description: RIDGEWOOD, N. J., Sept. 18Mr. and Mrs. John Kerr Hammond have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Mary LeVan Hammond, to Thomas Patrick Hanft of the Army. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. John D. Hanft of Devon, Pa.

title: George Washington Letter Auctioned Here for $4,500
description: A total of 316 manuscripts and documents, including a letter written by George Wash ington and a copy of a 17th century book annotated by John Milton, were sold for $46,190 by the Charles Hamil ton Galleries Thursday night in an auction at the WaldorfAstoria.

title: BERNARD DROUGHT, DEAN AT ANNAPOLIS
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., Sept. 13 (AP)Dr. A. Bernard Drought, the first civilian to serve as dean of the United States Naval Academy here, died of cancer early today at Anne Arundel General Hospital. He was 55 years old.

title: Ban on Disposable Bottles Opposed by Administration
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 18 (UPI)  The Nixon Administra tion went on record today against legislation to ban dis posable beverage bottles and leans at this time.

title: AIDE QUITS H.U.D., CALLING IT BIASED
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 18Robert J. Affeldt, a civil rights official in the Department of Housing and Urban Develop ment, resigned today, charging that the Nixon Administration was encouraging and perpetu ating racial discrimination.

title: House Call Returns $24.80 In Winning Freehold Pace
description: FREEHOLD, N. J., Sept. 18 (AP)  House Call paid $24.80, $11.40 and $5.40 for $2 in win ning the Bordentown pace to day at Freehold Raceway.

title: PRESIDENT ORDERS DELAY OF 60 DAYS IN RAILWAY STRIKE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 18President Nixon acted today to ward off a nationwide railway strike that had threatened to start early next Thursday morning.

title: YANKS TRIUMPH OVER TIGERS, 50
description: DETROIT, Sept. 18  Ron Klimkowski, who had toiled most of the season in the New York Yankee bull pen, got his third starting assignment of the year tonight and tossed a glit tering threehit shutout as the Yanks solidified their hold on second place in the American League East with a 50 victory over the Detroit Tigers.

title: LOUIS N. BOOKBINDER
description: Louis N. Bookbinder, a fur trade publisher for more than 50 years, died yesterday at the Florence Nightingale Nursing Home, 175 East 96th Street. He was 78 years old and lived in Cedarhurst, L. I.

title: WARNING TO WEST
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 18The So viet Union expressed serious concern today over the situa tion in Jordan and warned out side nations that intervention could only widen the conflict.

title: Man Charged in Murder
description: A 20yearold man accused of beating a oneyearold child to death to stop him from crying was indicted yesterday by a Bronx grand jury on charges of murder and criminally negli gent homicide. The defendant. Darrell Penn of 376 Hinsdale Street, Brooklyn, was arraigned before Supreme Court Justice Brust, who ordered him held without bail for a hearing next Tuesday. Mr. Penn is accused of the slaying of Troy Longhorn in the apartment of the child's mother, Cheryl Longhorn, at 1711 Lacombe Avenue, the Bronx.

title: ALBERT R. JUBE, LAWYER WAS 82
description: Albert R. Jube, a lawyer spe cializing in estate and corpora tion work, an industrialist and until recently the president of the Palisades Interstate Park Commission, died yesterday in St. Barnabas Hospital, Living ston, N. J. He was 82 years old and lived at 226 Elmwynd Drive, Orange, N. J.

title: Nasser, With Libya and Sudan, Seeks to Halt Jordan Fighting
description: CAIRO, Sept. 18This cap ital, to which Arabs seem to look in times of strife and crisis, was trying urgently to day to halt the fighting in Jordan without giving offense, either to the Jordanians or the Palestinian guerrillas.

title: Pirates Win, 32, to Drop Mets 2 Games Back
Antiques: Lusterware of 15th Century
description: Lusterware at its best is the subject of the current ex hibition of 15thcentury His panoMoresque pottery that will be on view at the Clois ters until Dec. 1.

title: EXPOS ARE DEALT 32, 54 DEFEATS
description: MONTREAL, Sept. 18 (AP)Ron Santo hit a 10thinning sin gle, scoring Don Kessinger with Chicago's winning run tonight as the Cubs beat Montreal, 54, in the second game to complete a sweep of a doubleheader and take over second place in the National League East race.

title: ATAND INDICATED
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 18 President Nixon has under scored the strong American in terest in the survival of the Jordanian Government by say ing privately that he would be inclined to intervene in Jordan if outside countries such as Iraq and Syria were to join the fight against King Hussein.

title: Cosmetics People Join Antipollution Campaign
HOGAN'S REMOVAL FROM TRIAL URGED
description: A defense lawwyer asked a Criminal Court judge yesterday to find someone more impar tial than Manhattan District Attorney Frank S. Hogan to prosecute his client, a rabbi charged with disrupting a temple service last spring.

title: Police Seek Panther Here After Uncovering Weapons
description: The police began a citywide search yesterday for Zayd Malik Shakur, the New York minister of information for the Black Panther party, after a city mar shal with an eviction notice broke into Mr. Shakur's apart ment and allegedly found a small arsenal of weapons and ammunition.

title: ROBERTSON, PAGAN HIT HOMERS IN 7TH
description: Once again producing too little too late, the New York Mets slipped back into third place last night in the three way battle for the National League East championship by losing to the Pittsburgh Pirates, 32, at Shea Stadium.

title: NICKEL AIDE QUITS POLLUTION POST
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 18The White House announced today that President Nixon had accepted with regret the resignation of Carl L. Klein as Assistant Secretary of the In terior for Water Quality and Research.

title: Mrs. Gandhi a Surprise Victor in Kerala
description: NEW DELHI, Sept. 18Prime Minister Indira Gandhi scored a surprising victory in yesterday's state election in Kerala, where the Communists had been voted into power twice in recent years.

title: Go Out and Toil, Peking Tells Women
description: HONG KONG, Sept. 18Pointing to the exploits of a host of heroines, the Peking press has proclaimed that what men can do, can also be done by women.

title: Daughter for Aga Khan
description: GENEVA, Sept. 18 (UPI)The wife of the Aga Khan gave birth to a daughter today, a spokesman for the Moslem leader ennounced.

title: Line Wins Approval For Demonstration With the Metroliner
description: The Penn Central announced yesterday that it had obtained Federal court permission to start a formal demonstration program of the high speed Metroliner trains between New York and Washington under contract with the Department of Transportation.

title: U.S. to End Restrictions On Arms Aid for Greece
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 18The Nixon Administration has decided to resume fullscale arms shipments to Grecce, lift ing restrictions imposed in April, 1967, when the military junta seized power, informed sources said today.

title: British Bill Rate Rises
description: LONDON, Sept. 18 (Reuters) The average rate of discount at today's offering of British Treasury bills rose to 6.815 per cent from 6.813 per cent last week. Today's offering totaled 180million. Next week 200 million in bills will be offered, replacing 120million of ma turities.

title: Beame Hires Lawyer In Fight on Consultants
description: Controller Abraham D. Beame has hired an outside lawyer to help him in his legal fight with the Lindsay administration over the hiring of oustide consultants with out public hearings.

title: TIGERS FIELD GOALS DEFEAT BULLS, 1310
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Sept. 18 Tom Johansen, a Danish born Canadian citizen who graduated from Colorado Mines, kicked a field goal with 11 sec onds to play tonight that gave the Jersey Tigers a 1310 vic tory over the Long Island Bulls. The Atlantic Coast Football League game was played at Hofstra Stadium.

title: Geologist Considered for Mines Post
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 18 The White House was reportec today to have ended an un usually long and difficult searcl. for a qualified Republican tc head the United States Bu reau of Mines by selecting Dr. Elburt F. Osborn, vice presi dent for research of Pennsyl vania State University, for the job.

title: A Toledo Policeman Is Shot Dead in Patrol Car
Fuel Shortage May Force Rationing, Swidler Warns
description: ALBANY, Sept. 18Joseph C. Swidler, the chairman the State's Public Service Commission, said today that the shortage of fuel was so serious in New York State that it might be necessary to resort to rationing for the first time since World War II. Mr. Swid ler said he felt his agency would have the authority to ration oil, coal and natural gas supplies to electric pow er generating plants but not to individual homeowners.

title: JOSEPH L. KAPLAN
description: ELIZABETH, N. J., Sept. 18 Joseph L. Kaplan of 13 Tudor Court, a lawyer with offices in Newark for many years, died yesterday in Beth Israel Medical Center, Newark. His age was 63.

title: All 450 Seized by Israelis Now Free
description: JERUSALEM, Sept. 18The Israeli authorities today re leased the last of the 450 Arabs from the occupied territories rounded up last weekend in connection with the airliner hi jackings, an army spokesman announced.

title: Each in Own Way, They Tell the Time
description: About the only thing two new clocks being introduced here have in common is that they both tell time. One has numerals but no hands; the other has hands but no nu merals. The digital clock looks like a seethrough table radio with four tubes inside. When plugged in numerals to tell the hour and minutes light up in red, one in each tube. The wiring, tran sistors and min iature switches that keep the time are also visible. Designed by Mike Russ for Zarach Lim ited of London, the clock will be available for $200 at Bon nier's, 605 Madison Avenue (at 58th Street) in two weeks.

title: 30 Senators Said to Back Call for Vietnam Ceasefire
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 18The National Committee for a Political Settlement in Vietnam announced today that 16 Sena tors had joined 14 others in urging President Nixon to pro pose a ceasefire in South Viet nam.

title: New Georgia Candidate
description: MACON, Ga., Sept. 18 (UPI)  Mayor Ronnie Thompson, who has opposed nerve gas shipments and school desegre gation among other issues, an nounced today that he would offer himself as a writein can didate for Governor of Georgia. My candidacy offers conserva tives in the State of Georgia a chance to show liberals.. that they are not the barefoot hicks the liberals would have the nation believe, he said.

title: Dilemma in Chile
description: The Christian Democratic party is justified in its demand for a firm commitment to preserve Chile's democratic system before it delivers the votes neces sary to elect Senator Salvador Allende as President on Oct. 24. It may seem naive to believe that such pledge would be honored by a MarxistSocialist Presi dent, governing in harness with a disclplined,, Moscow line Communist party, but there is valid rea??. for the demand.

title: ELBRIDGE STEIN, SIGNATURE EXPERT
description: Elbridge W. Stein, a hand writing expert who had testi fied on the authenticity of sig natures and documents in lead ing court cases, died Thursday in Sarasota, Fla., where he had lived in retirement since 1950. He was 90 years old.

title: Slayer of L.I. Judge Given Life Term in Puerto Rico
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., Sept. 18A 28yearold New Yorker of Puerto Rican and Italian extrac tion today for the murder last March 24 of a Michael M. Petito, a Family Court judge in Nassau Count. L. I.

title: Janet McSorley To Be a Bride
description: ABINGTON, Mass., Sept. 18  Miss Janet Marie Mc Sorley and Kenneth S. Lea vee, 1970 graduates of Emer son College, plan to be mar ried next summer.

title: CLASHES CONTINUE AT WPIX HEARINGS
description: Continued friction between Fred M. Thrower, president of WPIX, and Pat Valicenti, a Fed eral Communications Commis sion examiner, marked yester day's session of the hearings into the challenge of WPIX's broadcast license.

title: PERRY T. JONES, TENNIS COACH, 80
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 18 (AP) Perry T. Jones, internation ally known tennis administra tor and developer of young players, died today at the age of 80.

title: Rivals for Governor Cite Drug Issue
description: Governor Rockefeller stepped up his effort to involve the Fed eral Government in narcotics control yesterday by calling for political, economic and diplo matic pressure on France and Turkey, the sources, Mr. Rocke feller said, of most of the raw heroin imported here.

title: 3,000 Relief Troops Join Cambodian Task Force
description: SKOUN, Cambodia, Sept. 18 Some 3,000 Government re lief troops and a supply convoy today linked up with a task force of about 4,500 soldiers seeking to liberate Kompong Thom from enemy encircle ment.

title: Housewives Dig for Fossils and Fun
description: LOS ANGELES  Amid pools of oozing asphalt in the heart of this sprawling metropolis, housewives, stu dents and other volunteers decked out in their worst clothing are making a con tribution to scienceand their own sense of well beingby digging into the world's richest deposit of Ice Ane fossils.

title: He Doesn't Claim to Be a Baker But, Oh, What Cheesecake!
description: WHITE PLAINS, N. Y.If there isn't enough cheese cake batter in a batch to fill the last crumblined pan, then Arthur Reid knows he has mede a mistake.

title: Miss Carroll Plans Revue
description: Vinnette Carroll's Urban Arts Corps will open its fall season with Don't Bother Me, I Can't Cope, a revue conceived and directed by Miss Carroll. It will be presented in cooperation with the State Council on the Arts. A series of citywide perform. ances will start with a 9 P.M. performance on Oct. 3 in the Central Park Mall. Micki Grant has composed the music and Written the lyrics.

title: Hart Condemns Hecklers Who Interrupted Agnew
description: DETROIT, Sept. 18 (AP) Senator Philip A. Hart, Demo crat of Michigan, today con demned youths who shouted ob scenities at Vice President Ag new in Michigan Wednesday.

title: PATMAN DENOUNCES CHASE BANK'S POLICY
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 18 (AP) Representative Wright Pat man, chairman of the House Banking Committee, today ac cused David Rockefeller of a shameful charade of tired ex cuses for failing to lower inter est rates.

title: Cup Race Abandoned Because of Fog
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Sept. 18Gretel II, the sloop the Austral ian press ridiculed as a blun derboat earlier this week, packed a lot more thunder than blunder today on the America's Cup course.

title: SCOTTO TO PERFORM LUCIA TITLE ROLE
description: The Metropolitan Opera will offer its first performance this season of Donizetti's Lucia di Lammermoor on Oct. 15 with a cast headed by Renata Scotto, in the title role, and Luciano Pavarotti, who will take the part of Edgardo for the first time with the company. Carlo Franci will conduct.

title: Basque Protester Survives Leap From Stadium Balcony
description: SAN SEBASTIAN, Spain, Sept. 18 (UPI)A man wrapped him self in a Basque nationalist flag today, set himself afire and jumped from the upper balcony of a sports stadium in this northern Spanish city, the po lice said. He is in serious con Ation in a hospital here.

title: Credit Suits May Result in Refunds for Millions
description: Millions of consumers across the country stand to gain hun dreds of millions of dollars in damage payments if a flurry of private test cases filed under the new Federal truthinlend ing law against some of the nation's largest corporations succeed in court.

title: Sports of The Times
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Sept. 18Don't you think the American people are terribly interested in the America's Cup? asked B. Devereux Barker 3d. He quickly answered his question. I think the American people are terribly in terested in the America's Cup. They prize it. America has lost a lot in recent years, here's one thing we've never lost. Even Americans who know nothing about sailing know about the America's Cup.

title: AMEX STOCKS GAIN FOR 3D DAY IN ROW
Economist Assails Reserve's Policy
description: The Federal Reserve System will have to throttle back its monetary policy in the next two or three months if the United States is to avoid a re newal of inflationary pressure later in 1971, a leading com mercial bank economist warned yesterday.

title: Judge Says Police Frequently Lie in Drug Cases
description: A Criminal Court judge here has accused city policemen of frequent lying in court to con. ceal violations of the Fourth Amendment ban on illegal search and seizure.

title: U.S. IN SECOND PLACE IN CHESS OLYMPIAD
description: SlEGEN, Germany, Sept. 18 The United States team de feated Argentina this morning when Bobby Fischer of Califor nia, playing first board, won his adjourned thirdround game with Miguel Najdorf, posting a 31 victory in the 19th Chess Olympiad here.

title: UNE DE MAI IS 2D, 1 LENGTHS BACK
DONALD MERSEREAU
description: Donald Miller Mersereau, vice president and general manager of Boxoffice Magazine, a trade publication, since 1953, died yesterday in the Veterans Hos pital on Kingsbridge Road, the Bronx. He was 74 years old and lived at 3001 Henry Hud son Park in Riverdale, the Bronx.

title: STOCKS IN LONDON CONTINUE TO GAIN
description: Prices on the London Stock Exchange registered gains for the fourth consecutive day yes terday. The advance acceler ated midway during the session on news that a 6week strike at GKNSankey, an automobile components concern, had been settled.

title: Improvement Forecast In U.S. Trade Balance
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 18 (AP)Secretary of State Wil liam P. Rogers forecasts that the United States trade bal ance might improve signifi cantly this year and could reach a surplus of $3.5bil lion, the State Department said today.

title: Rains Kill 28 in South Korea
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Sept. 18 (Reuters)  Torrential rains in South Korea have left 28 per sons dead, 35 injured and nearly 7,000 homeless, the police re ported today. More than 3,000 houses were destroyed or flooded Wednesday night and yesterday, the police added.

title: McCabe Takes Shields Class Sailing Lead
BEAR SUPERSTARS HAVE AILING LEGS
description: The Chicago Bears are one of the rare teams in profession. al football to have two legiti mate superstars in their peak at the same time. Last year, they were also one of the rare teams in pro football to win one game and lose 13.

title: Vietcong Peace Plan Rejected By Saigon as Old and Absurd
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 18The Foreign Ministry of South Vietnam today de scribed as old, oftrepeated, absurd demands the eightpoint peace program presented yes terday at the Paris peace talks by Mrs. Nguyen Thi Binh, for eign minister of the Vietcong's provisional revolutionary gov ernment.

title: Subtlety Pervades Guitar of Jim Hall, Bass of Ron Carter
description: Jim Hall, the jazz guitarist, made a concert tour of Japan a few weeks ago during which he renewed an old acquaint ance with a cellist, Isao Suzu,ki. For his current engagement at the Guitar, 10th Avenue at 51st Street, Mr. Hall had planned to team his guitar with Mr. Suzuki's cello. However, en route here from Japan, Mr. Suzuki was snapped up by Art Blakey's Jazz Messengers.

title: Article 2  No Title
BERTRAM WEAL DIES; EXHOTEL MANAGER
description: Bertram Weal, manager of the Tuscany Hotel, 120 East 39th Street, from 1938 to 1969, died yesterday after a heart at tack in New York Hospital. He lived in the Lombardy Hotel, 111 East 56th Street.

title: Carola Teegen Married Here To Guy Walton
description: Miss Carola Teegen was married yesterday afternoon to Guy Walton in the chapel of the Episcopal Church of the Epiphany. The Rev. Dr. Hugh McCandless performed the ceremony.

title: Visit to Ford's Theater Planned by President
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 18 (UPI)President Nixon plans to see a show at Ford's Theaterthe first President to do so since Abraham Lincoln was assassinated there 105 years ago.

title: TV: Two Premieres of Social Relevancy on C.B.S.
description: The Columbia Broadcasting System introduced two tepid premieres last night, symp toms of a production malaise that could be one of this season's defects. Both flirted with issues of social rela vancy but in such mild and unconvincing terms as to be hardly worth the trouble and cost.

title: OFFICIAL DISSENT TERMED LIMITED
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 18Employes of the Government do not enjoy unrestrained free dom to criticize its policies in public, a high Justice Depart ment official said today.

title: Hnueilings
description: BALBERHenri, a monument will be un veiled Sunday, September 20, MI. Golda Cemetery, Huntington, L.I., at 2 p.m No postponement.

title: Brooklyn Woman Killed
description: A Brooklyn woman was killed yesterday while playing Russian roulette with her com monlaw husband, the police reported. Kenneth Whitton, 28 years old, and Sonya Rodri guez, 26, were playing the deadly game with a 22caliber revolver in their groundfloor apartment at 303 Grove Street, shortly after 2 A.M., the police said, after drinking at a neigh borhood restaurant. Mr. Whit ton was charged with posses sion of a dangerous weapon and homicide.

title: 3 Unbeaten Streaks on Line Today
description: College football begins its first major weekend today with three highly regarded teamsPenn State, Texas and Houstonrisking winning streaks in opening games.

title: BLACK ACADEMY ADDS 8 MEMBERS
description: The Black Academy of Arts and Letters officially opened its first annual meeting yes terday with the election of eight new members, among them Imamu Amiri Baraka, the poet, playwright and author more widely known as LeRoi Jones; Ernest Crichiow, paint er, illustrator and teacher, and J. Saunders Redding, historian and literary critic.

title: 32 GALLERIES OPEN PEACE EXHIBITION
description: Thirtytwo New York art galleries and nearly a dozen out of town will stage simulta neous Art for Peace exhibi tions, beginning today and run ning through next Saturday. The shows, which will culmi nate in an auction at Parke Bernet Sept. 29, consist of work donated by artists for the benefit of Referendum 70, a national, nonpartisan organi zation which seeks to elect antiwar Congressional candidates.

title: Pro Football Luncheons To Show Game of Week
description: NFL Films Game of the Week, a 30minute color film, will he shown each Thursday at the pro football luncheons at Kenny's Steak Pub, Lex ington Avenue and 50th Street.

title: Personality:
description: BOSTONPhil D. Fine is a Bostonian with two proper concernsone for the well being of his community; the other the interests of Phil D. Fine.

title: WASH. STATE DEALS IDAHO 4416 SETBACK
description: SPOKANE, Wash., Sept. 19 (AP)  Victorystarved Wash ington State came alive in the second half with the touchdown passing of Jack Wigmore today, erases an Idaho lead and posted a 4416 victory that ?? a 10gam drought.

title: Elizabeth Jones Wed in Jersey
description: MENDHAM, N. J., Sept. 19 Miss Elizabeth Macy Jones, a former staff photographer for The Boston Globe, and Frank Landt Dennis Jr., a correspondent in the New York bureau of The Chris tian Science Monitor, were married here this afternoon in the chapel of the St. John Baptist School. The Rev. Frank Tracy Griswold 3d, rector of St. Andrew's Epis copal Church in Yardley, Pa., performed the ceremony.

title: Burnett Sets Scoring Mark As Arkansas Wins, 23 to 7
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., Sept. 19 (UPI)Bill Burnett scored two touchdowns tonight to break Doak Walker's 21 year old Southwest Conference record and lead Arkansas to a 237 victory over Oklahoma State. Burnett's two scores brought his career total to 39, one bet ter than Walker's mark.

title: GUARDS AT BUFFALO RETURN FOR ONE DAY
description: BUFFALO, Sept. 19The 42 member security guard force at the State University of Buffalo agreed under protest to pa trol the campus during today's football game between Buffalo and Toledo University, but the men refused to conduct regular campus patrols.

title: Conversation piece at breakfast; The New York Times.; Call (212) MU 70700 for home delivery. Available for a small extra service charge.
Education
Screvane, ExWagner Aide, Endorses Rockefeller
description: Paul R. Screvane, City Coun cil President when Robert F. Wagner was Mayor, endorsed Governor Rockefeller for re election yesterday, saying that Mr. Rockefeller had done more for New York City than any other Governor.

title: Miss Faith Tyldsley Affianced to Lawyer
description: MILLBROOK, N. Y., Sept. 19  Announcement has been made by Mrs. John O. Tylds ley of the engagement of her daughter, Miss Faith Patter son Tyldsley, to Francis Birt Evans Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Evans of Baldwinsville.

title: Al Unser Retains Lead in DriveroftheYear Voting
description: Al Unser of Albuquerque, N.M., a leading driver on the United States Auto Club championship circuit, has been voted the oustanding performer during the third phase of the competition for the Martini & Rossi Driver of the Year Award.

title: Chess
Injured Pitcher to Exercise
description: CINCINNNATI, Sept. 19 (UPI) The Cincinnati Reds said to day they would set up a winter exercise program for pitcher Wayne Simpson, who suffered a pulled hamstring muscle in the shoulder.

title: Litter Bags Misused
description: DETROIT, Sept. 19 (UPI) Thomas E. Kluzinger, Republi can candidate for Congress in the 17th District, recently dem onstrated his concern about water pollution by listing the items he found in a onemile section of the Rouge River. On the list were two plastic litter bags.

title: In Chemicals, a Wave of Price Rises
Denise E. Magid, Vassar '70, Fiancee of James B. Steerman
description: Miss Denise Elaine Magid, a 1970 graduate of Vassar, where she majored in drama, and James Beach Steerman, an assistant professor of drama at Vassar, plan to be married on Oct. 24.

title: Uruguay Nightclub Raided And Set Afire by Terrorists
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 19 (UPI)Terrorists believed to be members of the Tupamaro guerrilla group raided a night club on the outskirts of the cap ital today, locked three em ployes in a closet and set the nightclub afire.

title: Calendar of Dog Shows
description: TODAY

title: Spotlight:
description: The oddlot statistics cur rently look quite bullish.

title: Virginia A. Murphy Engaged to Dentist
description: MANHASSET, L. I., Sept. 19Mr. and Mrs. Robert Anthony Murphy have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Virginia Anne Murphy, to Dr. Louis A. D'Isidori of Garden City, son of Mrs. Gabriel D'Isidori and the late Mr. D'Isidori. The wedding is planned for November.

title: Alfred Outscores Brockport
description: ALFRED, N.Y., Sept. 19 (AP) Joe Cascio ran for two touch downs and Jimmy Moretti passed for two more as Alfred defeated visiting Brockport, 31 10. The game marked the open ing of Alex Yunevich's 30th year as Alfred coach.

title: CLOSE VOTE SEEN IN SWEDEN TODAY
description: STOCKHOLM, Sept. 19The future of Social Democratic rule in Sweden was in question to day on the eve of general elec tions under a new onechamber parliamentary system.

title: Miss Mary Curry Wed To John P. Zerega Kent
description: The Roman Catholic Church of St. Ignatius Loyola was the setting here yesterday morning for the marriage of Miss Mary Curry, daughter of Mrs. Charles H. O'Regan of New York and the late John F. Curry Jr., to John P. Zerega Kent, son of Mr. and Mrs. William J. Kent Jr. of Brooklyn. The ceremony, performed by the Rev. Rob ert I. Cannon, was followed by a reception at the Plaza.

title: Miss Cohen Fiancee Of Kenneth Aaron
description: Mr. and Mrs. Gerald Cohen of St. Laurent, Quebec, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Sheila Lee Cohen, to Kenneth Ed ward Aaron, son of Mr. and Mrs. Herbert L. Aaron of New York. The wedding is planned for June 6 in Montreal.

title: Medical Aid Changes Jobs
description: BOSTON, Sept. 19 (AP)The director of Boston City Hospital, John S. Gracey, is resigning to accept a position as executive assistant to Dr. Lewis H. Rohr baugh at Boston University Medical Center.

title: UMASS IS WINNER OVER MAINE, 28 TO 0
description: AMHERST, Mass., Sept. 19 Pat Scavone paced a potent ground attack today as the University of Massachusetts scored a 280 victory over the University of Maine in the Yan kee Conference opener for both squads. Scavone, a halfback, gained 105 yards in 15 attempts as well as scoring the Redmen's third touchdown.

title: Sports of The Times
description: There isn't much left to the season, said Danny Murtaugh, a man who is very good at arithmetic. What is there any way, a week and a half more at most?

title: Nancy Gail Ott Is Bride on L.I.
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., Sept. 19The marriage of Miss Nancy Gail Ott to Luke Daniel Lynch Jr. took place here this afternoon in the Garden City Community Church. The ecumenical cere mony was performed by the Rev. Edward Dahl, assisted by the Rev. James Sheridan of St. Joseph's Roman Cath olic Church here.

title: And then, there's tomato marmalade
description: Tomatoes color it red Limes color it green. But its still marmalade and good on hot buttered muffins, toast and breakfast breads. Stock the cupboard now for enjoying the fresh fruit flavor on crisp fall and winter mornings. The recipe for tomato mar malade calls for ripe plum tomatoes, because they have the best texture and flavor, but good vine ripened regular tomatoes can be substituted.

title: 100Yard Interception Run Helps West. Michigan Win
description: KALAMAZOO, Mich., Sept. 19 (UPI)Two interception re turns, the second for 100 yards, accounted for touchdowns as Western Michigan defeated Brigham Young 3517 today.

title: Council to Study Attacks on Police
description: Leaders of the City Council yesterday called for an investi gation into increased assaults on policemen, firemen and workers who serve the city's neighborhoods, such as milk men, mailmen and telephone installers.

title: The Nation
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Sargent Shriver, who is campaigning across the country this fall for Democratic Congressional candi dates, obviously hopes that poli ticians will think about him as a potential candidate for Pres ident.

title: Gibson Finds Corruption Exceeds His Fears
description: NEWARK, Sept. 19The country's newest black Mayor and his aides are discover ing that they have inherited a city government even more corrupt, more debilitated by years of fiscal mismanage ment and more thoroughly riddled with resilient forces of greed and ambition than they had expected.

title: Pirates Relief Corns Keeps Club Rolling
description: A dazzling display of what relief pitching is all about was a key element in Pitts burgh's victory over the New York Mets yesterday and a key element in the remark able battle the Pirates are making for the National League pennant.

title: Kashmir Assembly to Get Bill Legalizing Abortions
description: SRINAGAR, India, Sept. 19 The government will introduce a bill in the Kashmir state legislative assembly next month to legalize abortion as part of its birthcontrol pro gram.

title: Union Rally Turns Back Worcester Tech by 3713
description: SCHENECTADY, N. Y., Sept. 19 (UPI)Union College con verted two pass interceptions and a fumble recovery into secondhalf touchdowns today to break a 1313 halftime tie and defeat Worcester Tech, 37 13, in the season opener for both squads.

title: What's New in Art
description: In the Galleries

title: Texas Coasts to 5615 Triumph Over California for 21st Victory in a Row
description: AUSTIN, TEX., Sept. 19 (UPI)Texas stormed to three touchdowns in the first quar ter today, then coasted to a 5615 football victory over California.

title: Nixon Said to Advise Mrs. Meir Pullback of Missiles Is Unlikely
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 19 President Nixon indicated to Premier Golda Meir of Israel in their White House meeting yesterday that he was not op timistic about persuading the Soviet Union and United Arab Republic to withdraw their mis siles from the ceasefire zone on the western bank of the Suez Canal, reliable sources said today.

title: Hyman Goldberg, Writer, Dies; Prudence Penny of Food Pages
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Sept. 19 Hyman Goldberg, reporter, magazine writer and author of cook books died today in his home at 1425 Bedford Street. Mr. Goldberg, who was 62 years old, had been hospitalized recently for a heart ailment.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The Amman radio said early today that a Syrian armored brigade had crossed into Jordan and clashed with royal Jordanian troops. A communiqu issued by the Jordan ian military governors said that the attackers had been pushed back into Syria with heavy losses. The fighting continued in northern Jordan after Palestinian guerrillas rejected a Government call for a ceasefire. Intense diplomatic activity was reported in the Arab world to resolve the crisis with speculation that Egyptian pressure had been brought to bear on King Hussein to propose the cease fire, which was rejected by the guerrillas last night. [Page 1, Columns 78.]

title: BALTIMORE HEARS OF LAXITY IN CARE
description: BALTIMORE, Sept. 19In vestigations into the deaths of 25 nursing home patients fol lowing a food poisoning epi demic have uncovered viola tions of health regulations by doctors and evidence of incom petent inspections of nursing homes throughout Maryland.

title: A strangely dislocated world which takes no comfort in dying forms
description: Imagine, as you are wont to do, that you are a city. You say you're from Houston but live in Ta coma, and add, with a tremor of selfcongratulation, that you try to get to Portland (Oregon or Maine) at least once a year. Where are these places when you are being from them or in them? And where are you? You say you can show where they are on a map. Is the space which is the city in your mind the same as the space on the map? Are you on the map?

title: On Wintering the Geraniums
description: YEARS ago our grandmothers hung geraniums from the cellar rafters by their bare roots to keep the plants all winter. This worked fine in damp, unheated basements, but now most people find that modern, warm, dry basements tend to dry out the roots before spring.

title: WILLIAMS SCORES SWITCH BY GROSS
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N.J., Sept 19Senator Harrison A. Wil liams Jr., the Democratic in ??umbent, accused Neslon G, Gross, his Republican challen ger, today of irresponsibly dis torting my record and under mining his own credibility.

title: Tender Bulbs Must Be Put in Storage
description: GLADIOLUS, trigidia, acidanthera, galtonia, dahlia, canna, cala dium, tuberous begonia and gloriosa lily cannot be left in the ground over the winter. They must be dug up and stored.

title: Applications for Playoffs Are Being Accepted by Cubs
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 19 (UPI) The Chicago Cubs began accept ing applications today for tic kets to National League playoff games at Wrialev Field.

title: Marriages
description: BURGERLAITMANMrs. Esther Laitman announces her marriage to Mr William Burger on Sunday, Sept. 20th.

title: Miami of Ohio Overcomes Xavier, 287
description: CINCINNATI, Sept. 19 (UPI)  Tim Fortney ran for three touchdowns and sparked Miami University to a 287 victory over Xavier University at Riverfront Stadium today.

title: Week's College Football
description: SATURDAY

title: TIMOTHY T. VICTOR IN COLONIAL TROT
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 19 Timothy T., probably the best of this season's 3yearold trot ters and certainly the best managed, had no trouble win ning the $102,275 Colonial be fore 17,497 harness racing fans at Liberty Bell Park tonight.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: Middle East Molehills To the Editor:

title: MONTCLAIR ROUTS KING SCHOOL, 420
description: MONTCLAIR, N. J., Sept. 19 Paul Cosentino, a 190pound fullback, scored three touch downs today in pacing Mont clair Academy to a 420 rout of King School. Cosentino scored on runs of 4 and 19 yards and on a recovered punt fumble in the end zone.

title: Pop
description: SPIRIT IN THE DARK: Aretha Franklin (At lantic SD8265). I really am beginning to won der if it's possible for Aretha Franklin to make a bad re cording. It's not enough that she should turn out hit after hit, but she continues to en liven them with a vivid musi cality and rhythmic excite rnent that simply transcends most of her competition either on the pop or the soul charts.

title: VIETCONG WILLING TO TALK WITH U.S.
description: PARIS, Sept. 19 (Reuters)A North Vietnamese official re fused to comment today on a report from Washington that United States efforts to draw Hanoi and the Vietcong into private talks had not been fruitful.

title: Adigue Stops Infante in 7th
description: MANILA, Sept. 19 (AP) Pedro Adiguc, former world jun ior welterweight. champion, scored a technical knockout over Giovanni Infante of Italy in the seventh round of a sched uled 10round fight tonight. Adigue, a Filipino, weighed I46 pounds, Infante 145

title: Test on the Rails
description: It is a depressing measure of the decay of collective bargaining in the railroads that President Nixon's invocation of the Railway Labor Act to force a sixty day delay in one threat of a nationwide rail strike does nothing to remove a second threat effective at midnight next Wednesday.

title: Small Towns Left Isolated As Airlines Cut Service
description: LEWISTOWN, Mont., Sept. 17 Walter Mondale used to boast that he could live the good life in this small town in central Montana and enjoy the big cities, too. The outside world was never far away so long as the Frontier Airlines plane put down here every day.

title: House Elections Hold the Key To Democratic Leader LineUp
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 19  The day after two longtime House Democrats were de feated by young challengers last week, Representative George H. Mahon, 69 years old, appeared on the House floor wearing a brightly hued mod tie.

title: JOFFREY GROUP SETS SEASON'S PROGRAMS
description: Four new productions will be featured during the City Center Joffrey Ballet's sixweek season at the City Center, opening on Sept. 29.

title: Education Meeting Asks Steps to Help Poor Go to College
description: DAYTON, Ohio, Sept. 19A national conference on higher education for minorities de cided this week that the state of affairs as regards minority education is a sad one and called for guaranteed college admission and financial aid for the poor.

title: LOSS IS 4TH IN ROW
description: The New York Mets con tinued their tailspin yesterday when they were defeated by the Pittsburgh Pirates, 21, for their fourth straight loss and fell 3 games out of first place with only 11 games to play.

title: OKLAHOMA SINKS WISCONSIN, 217
description: NORMAN, Okla., Sept. 19 (AP)Oklahoma, held in check for a half by Wisconsin today, used superior speed and depth to rally for a 217 football vic tory.

title: Verona: More Than a stage for IllFated Lovers
description: VERONA, ItalyOn a graceful balcony (rebuilt) of a medieval building (Via Cappello 23) in this city, Juliet Capulet proclaimed /ler love for Romeo. Or so they say. The doubtful authenticity of the Capulet household aside, Verona has long been making tourist hay out of Shakespeare's play. Throughout the year, Verona is the recipient of a steady intlux of letters  addressed simply to Juliet from all over the world. At Juliet's Tomb (on Via del Pontierre), another attraction of questionable origin, thou sands of sentimental visitors are wont to leave notes for Shakespeare's heroine in a letter box in the surrounding clois ters. The Cult of letter writers has been going strong for centuries.

title: Elaine McGlone to Wed
description: NORTH PLAINFIELD, N. J., Sept. 19Announcement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. Joseph McGlone of the en gagement of their daughter, Miss Elaine McGlone, to Steven Figueiredo, son of Mr. and Mrs. Antonio Figuei redo of Garwood. Miss Mc Glone is a sophomore at Rutgers University in New ark. Her fianc, who gradu ated from Essex County Col lege in Newark, is a junior at Newark State College in Union.

title: Amman Battle Fought From House to House
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Sept. 19 Government troops domi nate Amman's streets with their armor but even with superior firepower it is a dif ficult task to dislodge com mando snipers, who have been able to infiltrate at night into the city.

title: Gretchen Rogers, '65 Debutante, Is Bride of Robert Lovat Colby
description: LITTLE COMPTON, R. I., Sept. 19  Miss Gretchen Harwood Rogers, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Sydney Harwood Rogers of Darien, Conn., was married in the United Congregational Church here this afternoon to Robert Lovat Colby, son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Carroll Colby of Montreal and Stanstead, Quebec.

title: Billy Goat Machine Sucks Up Brooklyn Heights Street Litter
description: A sidewalk vacuum cleaner that sucks up litter has at tracted attention on Montague Street in Brooklyn Heights. Eighteen merchants and 246 residents pay for the operation.

title: Nest Chester State Hands Ithaca a 560 Trouncing
description: ITHACA, N. Y., Sept. 19 (AP) West Chester State College of Pennsylvania, combined a nearperfect passing attack with a strong ground game for a total offense of 552 yards to day in crushing Ithaca Col lege, 560.

title: Greeley, Paced by Crean's 2 Touchdowns, Trounces Peekskill Eleven, 260
description: Horace Greeley High School of Chappaqua stretched its un defeated string to 13 games, the longest in Westchester, with a seasonopening 260 vic tory yesterday over Peekskill at Depew Park in Peekskill, N. Y. The Quakers, who had a perfect eightgame season last year, have 10 straight victories since a tie in their nexttolast game of 1968

title: Whitney Young: Black Leader Or 'Oreo Cookie'?; Whitney Young
description: WHITNEY YOUNG on the dais running for a plane sit ting in a Presidential commis sion... studying documents in the back seat of a limousine... boarding a plane... getting down to the nitty gritty with Henry Ford II... running for a plane.... These activities pass before the eye like frozen frames of a motion picture.... Or, Whitney Young on a summer Sunday in a white house on a winding street in New Rochelle, reclining on a white painted wicker chaise longue, with his publicrelations man at his side, smoking Multifilters and talking to a member of what he calls the white media.

title: The Metropolitan Museum of Art/Concerts/197071
description: Bach

title: Meetings Set to Foster Neighborhood Government
description: Within the next two weeks Mayor Lindsay will visit, with out any advance announce ment, one of a number of neighborhood meetings being held around town to fashion a network of local governments that some politicians call the Lindsay substitute for the old political clubhouse.

title: Club Scores Report
description: LAS VEGAS, Sept. 19The Sierra Club yesterday con demned the Public Land Law Review Commission report, is sued last June, as antien vironmental, and served notice that it would rebut the report's conclusions.

title: Car, Fueled by Natural Gas, Hits 400 M.P.H. at Wendover
description: WENDOVER, Utah, Sept. 19 (AP)The Blue Flame reached 411.55 miles an hour today at Bonneville Salt Flats in only the fourth time the natural gas racer has been fired up in attempts to break Breedlove's land speed mark of 600.601 m.p.h.

title: Traveler Nixon Not Entirely Unmindful Of Politics
description: WASHINGTONThe Associa ted Press photograph that ap peared on the front pages of most major newspapers last Thursday morning must have caused some readers to blink in disbelief. There was the President, arms outstretched in fa miliar campaign style, but what was startling were the expres sions of the faces of the young people in front of himstudents of all people, 18, 19 and 20yearolds, looking upwards with rapt attention and something close to reverential awe at this symbol not only of the older generation but also of a continuing war in Indochina.

title: Mississippi Scores, 4713, As Manning Stands Out
description: MEMPHIS, Sept. 19 (AP) Archie Manning ran for two touchdowns and passed for a third in leading Mississippi to a 4713 victory over Memphis State tonight.

title: The Pope Disarms
description: ROMEStalin growled: How many divisions has the Pope? Not even one, yet until last week Vatican City was, at least on paper, proportionately one of the most militaristic states on earth.

title: Lauraine Barnett Prospective Bride
description: Mr. and Mrs. George L. Barnett of Gerrards Cross, England, have announced here the engagement of their daughter, Miss Lauraine Pamela Barnett, to Robert Schallop, son of Mrs. George Schallop of Jackson Heights, Queens, and the late Mr. Schallop. The wedding is planned for November.

title: The Coast of Maine Is ChangingGingerly
description: TODAY THE coast of Maine is going through a period of change. The only stretch of the Northeastern Seaboard not to have been industrialized, it is adapting to the modern world in a ra ther gingerly fashion. State of Mainers are not quick to embrace the new. The old and tried represent security to them. Anybody who doesn't like the way they manage things knows what he can do about it: go somewhere else.

title: Movie Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Gard of Thanks
description: HARTZBANDMorris. Jeanne and family wish to thank the many friends for their expressions of sympathy and kindness.

title: AfroAmerican Studies
description: There is confusion in the jungles of Academe, and it is the worse confounded by some thing called AfroAmerican Studies. The confusion is idea tional, notional and, for want of a word of greater precise ness, psychocultural. No three of the academicians most in volved (and literally hundreds are involved, many against their will) agree on what AfroAmer ican Studies are, and only about one of 10 black intellectuals distinguishes between Afro American Studies and the firm ly established discipline of Af rican Studies.

title: Car Dealer Does It Gets a Horse
description: LOS ANGELES  Lee Car penter has been in and out of the automobile busi ness for most of his 55 years. Between other ven tures, he worked for a com pany that built the body for the old Dusenberg, sold Oldsmobiles in the nineteen thirties, put in a stint in the General Motors styling de partment, handled car pur chases and maintenance for the Douglas Aircraft Com pany and, in 1952, became one of the first Volkswagen dealers in the West.

title: San Francisco: The Selfish Majority
description: SAN FRANCISCOThe old est trick in politics is to iden tify your opponent with all the things the voters fear the most. For over thirty years, the Dem ocrats have been shouting that a vote for the Republicans was a vote for another Hoover Depression, and now the Re publicans are arguing that a vote for the Democrats is a vote for disorder, campus radi cals, black militants, pot, easy love and dirty pictures.

title: Border Patrol Augmented
description: MONTPELIER, Vt., Sept. 19 (AP)Faced with a growing bank robbery problem in re mote northern Vermont, the United States Border Patrol an nounced this week that it was sending six additional agents to the area for duty along the Canadian border. This will bring to 35 the number of Bor der Patrolmen assigned to Ver montCanadian duty.

title: the traveler's world
description: ONE of the more interesting phenom ena of the travel business is the way a place, a region, an island, a country seems suddenly to become the most popular place in all the world  not necessarily for one flashing season but for a halfdozen years at a time. Since I believe the jet set is a figment of the imagination of society reporters and Broadway columnists, this zooming pop ularity cannot be credited to the social antics of the Maharajah of South Rubber Boot, nor even to the fleeting presence of Jackie or bejewelled Hollywoodians. The people who follow in their wake are also a corporal's guard, not at all representative of the millions of ordi nary, noncelebrity men and women and young people who constitute the true flow of international tourism.

title: Shriver Says Rich Benefit as Agnew Divides Workers
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 19 Vice President Agnew's asser tion that he speaks for the backbone of America  the working man was attacked tonight by Sargent Shriver as an attempt to sow resentment, division and anger among tra ditionally Democratic bluecol lar voters for the advantage of the rich.

title: Marylin Gail Goodman Affianced
description: PORTSMOUTH, N.H., Sept. 19Mr. and Mrs. Bernard Goodman of Portsmouth have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Marylin Gail Goodman, to Mark Jay Mathis. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Meyer Mathis of Rockville, Md.

title: The Nation
description: Any candidate of any party who voices radical sentiments or who courts and enjoys the sup port of radical elements ought to be voted out of office by the American people, Mr. Agnew said in San Diego. If, as one Agnew adviser suggested, that meant a purge of liberal Repub lican Senator Charles E. Goodell of New York to establish credi bility for the Vice President's attack on far left Democrats, it still raised the question of how he could achieve his objec tive of a Republican Senate ma jority by picking on his own people.

title: Courses and Shows
description: THE Brooklyn Botanic Garden has started its fall schedule of cours es. A twoday course on Flower Arranging for Beginners begins on Tues day at 10:30 A.M. in the Ad ministration Building, 1000 Washington Avenue. Students are asked to bring con tainers and accessories; flow ers will be supplied. Enroll ment is limited and registra tion must be in advance. The fee is $15.

title: Miss Sally Ciancimino Is a Bride
description: NYACK, N. Y., Sept. 19 Miss Sally Ciancimino, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Salvatore Ciancimino, was married here today in Grace Episcopal Church to William Franklin Balch of New York, son of Mr. and Mrs. Richard C. Balch of Redington Beach, Fla. The ceremony was per formed by the rector, the Rev. Charles Greene.

title: Argentina Taking Over Communications Industry
description: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 19 All private communications companies will end operations in Argentina next week, when the industry will become fully nationalized.

title: Engagements
description: BRISCOESURLESMr. and Mrs Robert Glenn Surles of Brooklyn, N. Y. announce the engagement of their daughter, Ann E. to Mr. Gary T. Briscoe, son of Mr. and Mrs. William Briscoe of Avon Park, Fla. Marriage will take place in December.

title: Speaking of Books: Podunk, Hell and a Man Named Jones
description: For over four centuries Americans have been busy naming America. From beginning to end in a new land, everything in sight needed a name  cities, towns, settlements, rivers, lakes, mountains  and we were the people to give it. By our placenames are we known. They are America, reflecting the history of the American people, honoring pioneer and hero alike and the ordinary man named Jones.

title: Urban Schools
description: Plato knew it, and Rousseau, and Dewey. So does Paolo Freire, thrown out of Brazil for teaching peasants to read in six weeks by using revolu tionary words like land, property, money, power, and so do the Italian schoolboys of Barbiana who write in their Letter to a Teacher [see re view on Page 41] that school is a war on the poor. Education is polit ical: schools are political organiza tions, and schooling as an institution serves political ends.

title: Irish Return to Horse Show After an Absence of 3 Years
description: Ireland, which has been among the missing for the last three years, will be back in the international jumping competition in the National Horse Show this year.

title: Laird Doubts U.S. Troops Will Be Needed in Jordan
description: WARRENTON, Va., Sept. 19 Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird indicated today that the crisis in Jordan appeared to be easing and that barring a worsening of the situation the need for American interven tion had sharply diminished.

title: MICHIGAN BILL AIDS PREGNANT STUDENTS
description: LANSING, Mich., Sept. 19 A bill of rights for pregnant students in the public schools is on the verge of final approval by the Michigan Legislature.

title: Middlebury Tops Bates
description: LEWISTON, Me., Sept. 19 (UPI)Doug Cramphin, a fresh man quarterback, threw two touchdown passes as Middle bury defeated Bates today, 169. Cramphin threw a 33 yard touchdown pass to Lee Cartmill in the second quarter and tossed a 13yarder to Frank Cooper late in the final period.

title: Claridge, OldTime Pacer, Wins by Length at Freehold
description: FREEHOLD, N. J., Sept. 19 Claridge, an 11yearold bay gelding driven by Charley Greene, triumphed over six other freeforallers in the featured $10,000 Cliffwood Pace at Freehold Raceway today.

title: Home Improvement
description: NEW kitchen appliance just introduced is de signed to help cut down on municipal and home waste disposal problems by cutting down on the volume of trash that must be handled and subsequently disposed of. Measuring a little over 34 inches high (suitable for un dercounter installations in kitchens), 15 inches wide and 24 inches deep, the appliance compresses garbage and trash to approximately onefourth its normal size and packs it into a special plastic lined, heavy paper bag that will hold up to a week's accumu lation of garbage from a fam ily of four.

title: PRIVATE COLLEGES IN CONNECTICUT SEEK STATE HELP
description: NEW LONDON, Conn., Sept. 19Connecticut's 19 private colleges and universities, wor lried by mounting deficits on virtually all their campuses, opened a campaign yesterday to win increased public and state support.

title: Plan for Development by 1985 Studied by Politicians on L.I.
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. I., Sept. 19 Elected officials met here this week to study Long Is land's comprehensive develop ment plan for 1985.

title: North Stars Beat Canucks
description: EDMONTON, Alberta, Sept. 19 (AP)The Minnesota North Stars spoiled the debut of Vancouver's National Hockey League team last night, de feating the Cannucks, 31, in a preseason game. The winning goal came at the 17:01 mark of the third period when Bill Goldsworthy tipped in a shot off goaltender Dunc Wilson's skate. The insurance marker by Marshall Johnston came little more than a minute later.

title: Movies
description: IBADAN, Nigeria.

title: CITY BIDS TENANTS USE RENT WEAPON
description: The city's rentcontrol chief yesterday urged tenants in rentstabilized buildings hit by loss of services during the Bronx apartment strike to apply for expulsion of their landlords from the Rent Sta bilization Association.

title: What's New at the Movies
description: KES, a film directed by Ken neth Loach about a young Yorkshire lad who finds and trains (as opposed to ??es) a young kestrel, is an honorable, decent sort of movie that is, however, never quite as interesting as the people within it, a??cording to Vincent Canby. The actors, mostly non professional and semipro fessional, are, without ex ception, superb, as are in dividual scenes, seemingly improvised, that erupt with ??normous verite. Never theless, verite alone does not necessarily make great cinma. It has, in fact, a way of reducing the tragic to the merely sad, almost commonplace. Loach is not a director of notable style, nor can he often refuse the obvious shot, but he seems to have a remarkable talent for handling actors and ob taining performances that are truly memorable.

title: PHILLIES 18 HITS DOWN GARDS, 106
description: ST. LOUIS, Sept. 19 (UPI) A threerun fourth inning and a sixrun seventh carried the Philadelphia Phillies to a 106 triumph over the St. Louis Cardinals today.

title: Mount Union Wins, 6130
description: ALLIANCE, Ohio, Sept. 19 (AP)Larry Kahres and Bill Ungar passed for three touch downs apiece today and Mike DiBlasi scored three to power Mount Union College to vic tory over the University of Rochester, 6130.

title: In Memoriam
description: PASACHOFFDr. Harry D. In memory of our dearly beloved.

title: The World
description: SAIGONIt is now two and onehalf months since the Amer icans concluded their dramatic move into Cambodia and the monsoons began turning the Ho Chi Minh trail into a ribbon of mud and the Mekong Delta into a lake.

title: Giants Depth Chart
description: OFFENSE

title: HEARING TO START ON L.I. ATOM PLANT
description: SHOREHAM, L.I., Sept. 19 The Atomic Energy Commission will open a public hearing Mon day on an application to build Long Island's first nuclear pow er plant here amid a contro versy over environmental poli cy and charges that the com mission's hearing is a kanga roo court.

title: Miss Mayer Has Nuptials
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., Sept. 19Miss Barbara Elizabeth Mayer and Edward Doyle Sara Jr.. were married here this morning in St. Joseph's Roman Catholic Church by the Rev. William J. Tobin, assistant director of the Na tional Center of Religious Education in Washington.

title: HEART PATIENTS STAGE A REUNION
description: Kara Bonnet was born a blue baby 20 months ago. Her heart was the size of a walnut, the veins from her lungs were connected to it in the wrong places and doctors said she would die without a highly sensitive operation. The operation was performed when she was only two weeks old.

title: 3 Airlines Start Work On Facilities at Newark
description: Three airline tenants at Newark Airport have started their own $50million build ing program in the space they will fill in the new terminal complex, which is costing the Port of New York Authority $200million.

title: Sierra Club Will Appeal Ruling on Disney Project
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 19 In the face of an adverse court decision, the Sierra Club re solved today to continue its fight against a $35million project of Walt Disney Produc tions, Inc., in the Sierra Nevada.

title: Peonies Are Particular About a Place in the Sun
description: PEONIES are one of the most longlived and dependable perennials, n they are planted in full sun with the utmost care. Ideally, planting should be completed by the middle of this month.

title: Miss Simmons Wed in Suburb
description: WESTFIELD, N. J., Sept. 19  Miss Patricia Catherine Simmons was married here to day to Gerald Joseph Hughes, who recently returned from a year's tour of duty as an Army lieutenant in Vietnam. The ceremony in Holy Trinity Roman Catholic Church was performed by the Rev. Joseph Belatti.

title: SCHUYLKILL WINS N.Y.R.A.'S REGATTA
description: The Schuylkill Boat Club of Philadelphia won three of eight races yesterday in the fall re gatta of the New York Rowing Association on the Orchard Beach Lagoon.

title: CUBS KEEP PACE, 1 GAMES BEHIND
description: MONTREAL, Sept. 19Jim Hickman, Joe Pepitone and Johnny Callison drove in two runs each today as the Chicago Cubs kept pace with the Pitts burgh Pirates in the National League East by defeating the Montreal Expos, 84. The Cubs remained 1 games behind the Pirates.

title: Abe Weatherwise Lives
description: DUBLIN, N. H., Sept. 19 (AP) Abe Weatherwise of the Old Farmer's Almanac will be continued in the annual pub lication, which will come out next month as it has since 1872. Robb Sagendorph, who was the famous weather sage. died last July 4 at the age of 69. A spokesman for the pub lisher here said this week that Abe now passes to Rob Trow bridge, a soninlaw who has been publisher of the Almanac and Yankee Magazine since Mr. Sagendorph became ill.

title: State A.D. A. Supports Ottinger Though Goodell Shows Strength
description: Representative Richard L. Ot tinger yesterday won the en dorsement of the New York State chapter of Americans for Democratic Action in his race for United States Senator, de splte a strong showing by his RepublicanLiberal opponent, Senator Charles E. Goodell.

title: The Way Egyptians See Israel, Uncle Sam, The SAM's
description: CAIRO.

title: Bent, But Not Broken, By a Canoe Wilderness
description: GRAND MARAIS, Minn.First came the Indians, then the fur traders, then the United States Department of Agri culturewhich in 1909 established the 3millionacre Superior National Forest. A few weeks ago, I arrived on the scenein a canoe.

title: How to Modernize Our Music Theater
description: MUSICAL theater in America seems to be going through a revolution. But like the social revolution, this revolution knows what it is against without knowing what it is for.

title: Pro Football Schedule
description: FRIDAY NIGHT'S GAME Los Angeles 34, St. Louis 13.

title: GROUP WILL PRESS AID FOR MIGRANTS
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., Sept. 19 Irate over the reported living conditions of Puerto Rican migrant workers in the United States, an organization affil iated with three religious denominations has begun a committee to press the Gov ernment to protect the farm workers.

title: In the Sports Editor's Mailbox
description: The Unsung Heroes

title: Brooklyn College Nine Wins Eastern Conference Final
description: Brooklyn College won the annual Middle Eastern Confer ence baseball tournament yes terday by defeating Scranton University, 63, in the final round at the Parade Grounds in Brooklyn.

title: Lakers Erickson Is Holdout
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 19 (UPI)  Keith Erickson, who plays forward and guard for the Los Angeles Lakers, be came the first official holdout in the team's 11 years here when he missed the opening day of drills yesterday. Fred Schaus, the general manager, said Erickson would be fined $100 for each practice day he is absent.

title: Wedding Set By Mrs. Doss
description: BLOOMFIELD, N. J., Sept. 19Mrs. Betty Haslam Doss, the first vice president of the Huguenot Society of New Jersey and a descend ant of David Demarest, the French Huguenot who emi grated to Staten Island in 1663, and Kenneth Godfrey Van Auken, both of Bloom field, plan to be married early next year in the Epis copal Church of the Advent here.

title: NOTRE DAME WINS OPENER BY 3514
description: E VANSTON, Ill., Sept. 19 (UPI)Notre Dame opened its season today with an offen sive display featuring Denny Allan's three touchdown runs and Joe Theismann's field lead ership in a 3514 triumph over Northwestern.

title: Toledo's Aerial Strength Overcomes Buffalo, 276
description: BUFFALO, Sept. 19 (AP) Chuck Ealey, a scrambling quarterback, threw three touch down passes today in guiding Toledo to a 276 victory over Buffalo. It was the 13th straight for Toledo.

title: RICHARD L. LAMBORN
description: Richard L. Lamborn, former ly a member of the New York Stock Exchange and treasurer of the New York Coffee and Sugar Exchange, died yester day in Mountainside Hospital, Glen Ridge, N. J. He was 61 years old and lived in Ocean Reef, Fla., and formerly in Up per Montclair, N. J.

title: Melinda Allen, Barton Bortles Plan to Marry
description: DARIEN, Conn., Sept. 19 Miss Melinda Clark Allen and Barton Eugene Barnes plan to be married in Jan uary.

title: Joan Walsh Betrothed
description: RAHWAY, N. J., Sept. 19 The engagement of Miss Joan E. Walsh to Philip J. McGarvey, son of Mr. and Mrs. Michael J. McGarvey of Baltimore, has been an nounced by her parents, Mr. and Mrs. Joseph P. Walsh.

title: Do Movie Actors Really Act?
description: THE more films I see, the more film reviews I write, and the more film reviews I read (including a few of my own), the more I am convinced that movie acting is the most mysterious of the performing arts, and that most of the stuff written about it is utter nonsense, a complete waste of time for just about everybody. including the actor who is trying to enlarge his craft and not just his book of press clippings.

title: Canadian Review of Abortion May Yield Eased Criminal Code
description: OTTAWA, Sept. 19  In response to recent shifts in public opinion, the Justice De partment has initiated a review that may lead to the removal of abortion from the criminal code.

title: Pacific Island Territories Seek Formal Control of Development
description: SUVA, Fiji Islands, Sept. 19 Emerging Pacific island terri tories, in a politically signifi cant move here, have demanded formal authority over regional development programs now controlled by the former co lonial powers that still admin ister the small tropical de pendencies.

title: Susanna Wright Bride Of John D. Harper Jr.
description: MANHATTAN. Kan., Sept. 19 Miss Susanna Marie Wright was married here this afternoon in St. Paul's Epis copal Church, to John Dick son Harper Jr. The Rev. Earl Minturn performed the cere mony.

title: Learning How to Influence And Control The Brain
description: NEW HAVEN, Conn.  Paddy was pretty much like any active sixyearold chimpanzee, except that he recently spent a year and a half unknowingly talking to himself by computer. For deep within Paddy's brain, 100 fine steel wires poked into the depths of consciousness and relayed signals back and forth by a radio atop his head in a dra matic new experiment to test the feasibility of twoway communi cation between brain and ma chine.

title: Nuptials Held Here For Miss Brennan
description: Miss Barbara Judge Bren nan, daughter of Col. Mar tin Joseph Brennan, U. S. A., (retired) and Mrs. Brennan of the Bronx, was married yes terday to Paul Elliott Van Hook, son of Mrs. Elliott Boyd Van Hook of Bryn Mawr, Pa., and the late Mr. Van Hook.

title: Late Listings for Today's TV
description: Channel 7: Issues and Answers, with Leonard Woodcock, president of the United Auto Workers Union (part I) and an interview with Israeli Premier Golda Meir (part II), 1 P.M.

title: Serendipity In Stone: A Monumental Search
description: A MONUMENT attesting to a miracle said to have taken place more than a century ago stands today in the littleknown mountain town of Pavia in western Pennsylvania. It serves as a memorial to two children who wan dered away from their mountain home and were never seen alive again and to the bizarre search set off by their disappearance.

title: HIJACKER SETTLES FOR CUBA INSTEAD
description: MIAMI, Sept. 19 (AP)  An armed hijacker who wanted to go to Cairo settled for Cuba instead today and took an Al legheny Airlines jet and its eight crewmen to Havana.

title: The Camera World
description: THE New School of Social Research is greatly expanding the range and number of photographic courses offered in the coming year. There are. now 15 different courses listed, including introductory photography, advanced print ing, advanced 35mm, docu mentary photography, por trait photography and others. In addition, The New School is also offering an expanded film program with nine di rector's workshops and seven creative film workshops lifted. For information about any of the courses or work shops contact the Office of the Registrar at The New School, 66 West 12th Street, N.Y.C. 10011, or phone (212) OR 52700.

title: Trains in Europe Fast and Growing
description: The Western European railway scene today is a Casey Jones promised land of passenger trains by the thousands, lots of high speed on smooth, welded rails and plans for superspeed in the late nineteen seventies and nineteen eighties.

title: Mrs. King to Play on Coast In First Start Since Surgery
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 19 (AP)  Mrs. Billie Jean King, out of action since knee surgery July 22, will return to tennis in the Pacific Coast International Championships here and at. Berkeley later this month, the tournament director, Barry Mac Kay said.

title: Peking Denounces Jordanian Attack on Guerrillas
description: HONG KONG, Scpt. 19  Communist China today de nounced attacks in Jordan on Palestinian guerrillas and charged that attacks on the guerrillas by Jordanian forces had been instigated by the United States in collusion with Icrael.

title: Mary C. Miller, Ernst Schaefer To Be Married
description: PASADENA, Calif., Sept. 19 Mr. and Mrs. Peter Mac Naughton Miller have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Mary Charity Miller, to Ernst John Schaefer, son of Dr. and Mrs. Karl Ernst Schaefer of Old Lyme, Conn. A December wedding is planned.

title: WALTER D. SANBORNE
description: Walter D. Sanhorne, a retired business executive, who had lived for many years in Great Neck, L. I., died Friday in Manhasset Medical Center after a brief illness. He was 79 years old and lived at 14 Oakley Place in Great Neck.

title: New L.I. Temple Sanctuary Has Big Nevelson Sculpture
description: GREAT NECK, L. I., Sept. 19 Temple BethEl's new sanc tuary, which contains the lar gest piece of work done by Louise Nevelson, the sculptor, was dedicated here last night.

title: Son to Mrs. Kinstlinger
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Sept. 19A son was born Sept. 3 at the Harrisburg Hospital to Mr. and Mrs. Jack Kinstlin ger. Mr. Kinstlinger is Dep uty Secretary for Planning, the Pennsylvania Department of Transportation. The child has been named Jeremy

title: Football Scores
Mrs. R. C. Benson Has Son
description: WOODLAND HILLS, Calif., Sept. 19A son was born to Mr. and Mrs. Robert C. Ben son on Aug. 24 at the Valley Presbyterian Hospital in Van Nuys.

title: Dangers in Background Briefing Made Clear to Nixon in Chicago
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 18  The background briefing has long been the established, if controversial, way for Admin istrations to convey Informa tion, but occasionally it back fires, as it did this week for President Nixon.

title: MONTCLAIR STATE WINS OPENER. 166
description: UPPER MONTCLAIR, N. J., Sept. 19Montclair State Col lege opened its 40th intercol legiate football season tonight at Sprague Field before 6,818 fans by downing East Strouds burg State. 166.

title: Memorial Seruices
description: COTLOVEErnest, M.D. A memorial gather ing of the friends of Ernest Cotlove, M.D., will take place at the Washington Hebrew Congregation, Massachusetts Ave. at Macomb St. N.W., Washington, D.C., on Sunday, September 27, at 2 P.M. The family asks that expressions of sympathy be in the form of contributions to the Cotlove Memorial Fund, sent to: Academic Clinical Laboratory, Physicans and Scien tists c/o Dr. Rex B. Conn, Secretary. Treasurer, 524 Dispensary Bldg., Johns Hopkins Hospital, Baltimore, Maryland 21205.

title: Future Is Bright for Yankees After a Spell in Mets Shadow
ShopRite Stores To Sell Gasoline
description: Foodarama Supermarkets, Inc., a member of the Shop Rite group of stores, plans to build a chain of privatebrand gasoline stations under the ShopRite name. The first station is expected to open next month on route 33, Nep tune, N. J.

title: Many Splendored Tulips
description: AIANYSPLENDORED tulips can make the garden scintillate from March to May. They ac cent other spring bulbs and perennials or make a big splash on their own.

title: William Steiger, Lawyer; Westinghouse Patent Chief
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Sept. 19 William A. Steiger, who re tired in 1958 as general patent counsel for Westinghouse Electric Corporation, died to day in Atlantic City Hospital.

title: NEW CANAAN TOPS NORWALK, 32 TO 6
description: New Canaan High School, unbeaten the last two seasons, maintained its ways under its new coach, Bob Lynch, yester day by routing Norwalk, 326, for its 25th straight victory. The game was the opener for both teams in the Fairfield County Conference.

title: VILLANOVA BEATEN BY BOSTON COLLEGE
description: VILLANOVA, Pa., Sept. 19 Fred Willis, a 22yearold senior halfback, ran for 131 yards and scored two touchdowns today as Boston College opened its football season by defeating Villanova. 2821.

title: Yankees Beat Tigers, 76, With Five Runs in Ninth
description: DETROIT, Sept. 19Trailing by four runs at the start of the ninth inning, the Yankees took advantage of a throw ing error by Dick McAuliffe and chased five runs across the plate to post a 76 victory today over the Detroit Tigers.

title: Cincinnati's Ground Attack Vanquishes Dayton by 137
description: CINCINNATIC, Sept. 19 Cincinnati, mising on all 14 pasing attempts, turned to its ground game to whip Dayton, 137, tonight On a pair of first half touchdowns by Gary Cowan.

title: 2 Conservative Candidates Make Tour of Westchester
description: WHITE PLAINS, Sept. 19 Paul L. Adams, the Conserva tive party candidate for Gover nor, toured key spots in West chester County today with his running mate, Edward F. Leon ard, the party's candidate for Lieutenant Governor.

title: WATER IS UNSAFE IN MOST OF WORLD
description: GENEVA. Sept. 12  The cholera outbreak now spread ing through Asia, the Middle East and Africa underlines the fact that most of the world's population lack of a safe water supply.

title: Charles Hull Weds Cary Schuler
description: OLD LYME, Conn., Sept. 19Miss Cary Meriwether Schuler, daughter of Mr. and Mr. Stanley Carter Schuler of Lynne, was married In St. Ann's Episcopal Church here this afternoon to Charles Lewis Hull, son of Mrs. Joseph Poyer Deyo Hull of Caddo Gap, Ark., and the late Mr. Hull.

title: Maura Gaffney, Raymond Lynch Married in Rye
description: RYE, N. Y., Sept. 19Miss Maura Gaffney, daughter of the late Mr. and Mrs. Maurice Gaffney of Cedarhurst, L. I., was married here this after noon to Raymond Chauncey Lynch, an architect with the George M. Ewing Company, Philadelphia architects and engineers.

title: Austin Eleven Loses, 1913
description: MEMPHIS, Sept. 19 (AP) With 15 seconds remaining, the Southwestern at Memphis quar terback, Steven Warren, threw a 35yard touchdown pass to Ralph McDonald for a 1913 victory over Austin College, Tex.

title: Chavez Is Pressing Nationwide Boycott In Lettuce Dispute
description: SALINAS, Calif., Sept. 19 (AP)Cesar Chavez, the farm labor leader, is bringing his most potent weapona nation wide boycottto bear on all United Statesgrown lettuce that does not carry his union's label.

title: COLGATE DEFEATS BOSTON U., 2621
Sihanouk, Writing in U.S. Magazine, Predicts He Won't Rule Cambodia Again
description: From his exile in Communist China, Prince Norodom Siha nouk predicts that he will not again be the ruler of Cambodia even if the Government of Premier Lon Nol is defeated.

title: From Creative Plumbing to Lyrical Abstraction?
description: THE 1960's in American abstract painting was a period of conscien tious esthetic and technical pure research, re markable for its tireless ex perimentation with hard edged stripes, disks and poly gons of solid color.
