The avantgarde of a decade ago, having thrived during the Ab stract Expressionist 50's on seemingly slapdash pro cedures followed in an intel lectual climate of romantic assertiveness and big ideas, took with a sort of cool, evangelical passion to the new use of Tsquares and masking tape, and began to couch its selfadvertisement in impeccably dry, quasisci entific language.

title: Temple Sets Back Bucknell, 10 to 3, For Coach Hardin
description: LEWISBLTRG, Pa., Sept. 19 Temple gained its first football victory under Head Coach Wayne Hardin with a 103 de cision today over Bucknell.

title: Broad Busing Plan in Pasadena Is Implemented With Harmony
description: PASADENA, Calif., Sept. 19  Pasadena's public schools opened quietly and efficiently this week as one of the nation's most sweeping desegregation plans went into effect.

title: Study Reveals Corporate Chiefs Donated Heavily to Campaigns
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 19 Officials of 49 companies that ranked among the top de fense, space and nuclear con tractors in the fiscal year 1968 donated at least $1,235,402 to political campaigns during the 1968 Presidential election year, according to an extensive study.

title: Death Penalty Urged
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 19 (UPI)Representative William C. Cramer, Republican of Flor ida, introduced a bill this week that would provide the death penalty for killing a policeman.

title: Solving the Monetary Dilemma
description: The basic problem with which members of the International Monetary Fund will be struggling Copenhagen this month is how to improve the adjust ment process among national currencies without dis rupting the progress of European nations toward monetary integration.

title: Senate Approves $1Billion In Aid for Merchant Fleet
description: WASHINGTON. Sept. 19 (AP) The Senate has approved legislation that would pipe about $1billion into the mer chant fleet over the next decade.

title: For the young and daring
description: Stephen Burrows's world is a very special one. It includes the hard chic of black leather studded with nailheads and the youthful exuberance of bright colors that are mixed but never matched. While other designers are looking backwardto the nineteen thirties, to the Gibson Girl era, to the Old WestBurrows is very much of the nine teenseventies. The girl he designs for is young, daring, eager to experiment and in dividual. A 26yearold who served his apprenticeship in East Side boutiques, Bur rows now designs exclusively for Bendel's.

title: Bridge
Danee
description: COPENHAGEN

title: The Nation
description: DETROIT  From Fremont, Calif., to Tarrytown, N. Y., in the great industrial centers of Michi ganDetroit, Flint, Pontiacand even across the border near Montreal and Toronto, the pick ets were out last Monday mid night for the big strike of 1970 the United Auto Workers against the General Motors Corporation.

title: LIBERALS MAY ASK SUPPORT BY MAYOR
description: A Liberal party official said yesterday that Mayor Lindsay might be asked to endorse Ar thur J. Goldberg for Governor at the party's state dinner on Oct. 6.

title: CITY OPERA PLANS RODRIGO REVIVAL
description: The New York City Opera will revive Ginastera's Don Rodrigo, which has not been performed here since 1967, on Oct. 7, during the fifth week of the company's season at the New York State Theater. Salva dor Novoa will sing the title role for the first time.

title: 254Acre Tract Bought In New Canaan by RCA
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Sept. 19  The RCA Corporation has contracted to buy a 254 acre tract on Route 123 for executive offices housing more than 1,000 people, it was an nounced yesterday.

title: Are You Sure Most Great Painters Started This Way?
The Battle: Hussein's Struggle With Guerrillas Imperils All Mideast
description: Beginning at dawn last Wednesday, King Hussein com mitted his armor and his fate to an effort to crush the rival power in his realm, the Palestinian com mando movement. By the week end It appeared that he had mis calculated.

title: One reporter's Asia
description: Southeast Asia, like all of Asia, is both a macrocosm and a micro cosm. It looks upon itself as such, and nothing exemplifies this more perhaps than a Chinese Sung dynasty landscape, with the small yet distinct figures of man and his beast of bur den cast against the huge misty mountainous backdrop of nature and the universe. Dennis Bloodworth, the veteran correspondent of The (London) Observer, has written a Sung dynasty kind of book about South east Asia, which he has covered for the last 16 years, residing with his Chinese wife Ping in Singapore. It is an immensely readable though somewhat jumpy tour de force, done much in the manner of the author's earlier The Chinese Looking Glass, full of pertinently sophisticated im pressions and observations about the melange of people and nations of the area.

title: AL UNSER CLINCHES USAC DRIVING TITLE
description: SEDALIA, Mo. (AP)  Al Un ser of Albuquerque, N. M., clinched the United States Auto Club national driving cham pionship today by winning his eighth championship race of the season. The victory came in a 100mile event at the Mis souri Fairgrounds.

title: Cynthia Adams Plans Nuptials
description: BUFFALO. Sept. 19Mr. and Mrs. Welling Wyckoff Adams of Buffalo and Kenne bunkport, Me., have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Cynthia Anne Adams, to Lee Van Voorhis Dauler Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Dauler of Pitts burgh. The wedding is planned for Dec. 5 in Calvary Episcooal Church here.

title: Verbal Abuse of Police Is Outlawed inToledo
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, Sept. 19 (AP)Anyone calling police men pigs will be arrested under provisions of a new city ordinance prohibiting verbal abuse of lawenforce ment officials.

title: AIR FORCE BEATS WYOMING BY 4117
description: LARAMIE, Wyo., Sept. 19 (UPI)Bob Parker threw three touchdown passes today in di recting a wellbalanced Air Force aerial and ground attack to a 4117 victory over a young Wyoming squad.

title: Laura Katz Engaged To Samuel N. Sommer
description: Mrs. and Mrs. Sam Katz of Kew Gardens Hills, Queens, have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Laura Ellen Katz, to Samuel N. Sommer, son of Mr. and Mrs. Paul Sommer of Bay side Hills, Queens. The wed ding is planned for June.

title: BISHOP SCAIFE
description: BUFFALO, Sept. 19 (UPI) The Right Rev. Lauriston L. Scaife, retired Bishop of the Episcopal Diocese of Western New York, died here today after a long illness. He was 63 years old.

title: A book by kids who flunked out
description: For a decade now, as the inadequacies of our schools have proved more and more difficult to conceal, those who operate them have been the target of critics from all levels, up to and including our last two Presidents. But never to my knowledge have a group of school failures joined forces andof all incredible revenges written a book!

title: Vehicles Outpacing Human Population
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 19 The number of cars, trucks and buses registered in this coun try is increasing twice as fast as the human population, ac cording to figures released by the Department of Transporta tion.

title: RICHMOND CRUSHED BY W. VIRGINIA, 4910
description: MORGANTOWN, W. Va., Sept. 19 (AP)West Virginia rolled up 641 yards on total offense, a school record, in crushing Richmond, 4910, in football today.

title: Belmont Jockeys Carry Their Own Colors And Styles When Reporting for Work
description: Though stylishly dressed men and women have long been identified with Belmont Park, there is a morning fashion parade that the pub lic seldom sees. It takes place shortly before noon each rac ing day when the jockeys re port. shortly before noon each rac ing day when the jockeys re port.

title: CHARLES N. DEROSE
description: WATCH HILL, R. I., Sept. 19 (AP)Charles N. DeRose, pub lisher of The Daily Hampshire Gazette in Northampton, Mass., died today in his summer home lat the age of 63.

title: Gardens
description: CITY gardeners whether pocketed in a back yard or perched on a penthouse find they must keep plantings in scale. This is why small spring flowering bulbs deserve high priority.

title: Letter
description: Private Trucking

title: Mediterranean Warning
description: President Nixon's projected visit to the Mediter ranean reasserts American interest in that crucial area. It also warns Moscow, which has joined Cairo in violating its ceasefire pledges to the United States, not to take Washington's efforts for peace as a sign of weakness.

title: Bridgeport Triumphs by76
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., Sept. 19 (AP)Bridgeport recovered an American International fum ble and scored when the game was two minutes old, then staved off an A.I.C. drive late in the final quarter for a 76 victory tonight. Jeff White's ex tra point turned out to be the winning margin.

title: First of Boston, a Giant in Its Region
description: The City of Boston is a proud town, proud of its traditions, and proud of its institutions. It is a town where a rich cultural and architectural heritage min gles uneasily with the futurewhere the striking abstraction of the new Boston City Hall sits cheek by jowl with the preRevolutionary facade of Faneuil Hall, where a Yankee establish ment maintains its hegemony uncer tainly in the face of the upward push by the Irish, the Italian and, increas ingly today, the black communities.

title: Toyota Gains In Auto Output
description: TOKYO, Sept. 19 (Reuters) Japan's Toyota Motor Com pany ranked as the fourth largest car maker in the world in regard to number of cars turned out during the first half of this year, ac cording to Toyota.

title: Hard Line Remains on Hairline In Some Pro Football Quarters
description: Pro football may be going soft. For one thing the haz ing of rookies is all but over. Not only did rookies once have to wait on the older hands, they had to stand on chairs and sing their college songs.

title: Prices and Trading Pace on Amex sand Counter Move Higher
description: Speculation that a general reduction in the bank prime rate was in the offing helped most issues traded on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market move slightly higher last week.

title: CLEMSON DEFEATS VIRGINIA BY 2717
ASIANS TO SET UP WELFARE AGENCY
description: MANILA, Sept. 19Govern ment ministers responsible for social welfare in 18 Asian na tions met this week and de cided to establish a permanent secretariat to help direct re gional cooperation on im proving the wellbeing of individuals.

title: Dance to Aid L.I. Family Service
description: LOCUST VALLEY, L. I., Sept. 19A white and yel low tent with matching can opy will be the setting on the grounds of the Piping Rock Club for the eighth annual dinner dance for the benefit on Sept. 26 of the Family Service Association of Nas sau County. Lester Lanin and his orchestra will provide the music, with cocktails at 8 o'clock and dinner to follow.

title: Four Indy 500 Victors to Drive In Trenton Grind Next Sunday
description: Lloyd Ruby has been doing a lot of fine racing this sea sonup to a pointthe one at which his machine quits functioning. He was the sen sation of the early laps of the Indianapolis 500, and was in front at the recent California 500. However, his cars tailed to last even half way through ei ther of the races. Next Sunday at Trenton Speed way, he will have a chance to win a special championship along with the firstplace purse and a lot of accessory money. The New Jersey track has put up a trophy and $1,000 for the driver who accumulates the most points in its two United States Auto Club national championship races. The first was the 200 run in April and won by Ruby, and the second is the 300.

title: Rutgers Trounces Lafayette, 4116, as Yancheff and Robertson Pace Attack
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., Sept. 19Mike Yancheff, who sat in the shadow of Rich Poli castro for two years, emerged as a fine quarterback in his own right today in guiding Rutgers to a 4116 opening game football triumph over La fayette before 13,000 fans.

title: Who Were the Bad Guys?
description: IN 1864, a troop of Col orado Voluntary Infan try, commanded by a United States Army col onel, attacked the peaceful Indian village at Sand Creek.

title: SO. CAROLINA ROUTS WAKE FOREST, 437
description: COLUMBIA, S.C., Sept. 19 (UPI)Tomtny Suggs tossed two touchdown passes and Bill Dupre booted three field goals tonight to lead South Carolina's defending Atlantic Coast Con ference champions to a 437 rout of Wake Forest.

title: MISSOURI DOWNS MINNESOTA, 3412
description: COLUMBIA, Mo., Sept. 19 (UPI)Joe Moore ran for three touchdowns and Mel Gray streaked 36 yards for another as Missouri roared back in the second half today to whip Min nesota, 3412, in a regionally televised game.

title: Negro at Harvard College Named Dean of Students
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass. Sept. 19 (AP)Archie Epps has been ap pointed dean of students at Harvard College.

title: Kempton WaterSki Victor
description: MILTON, Ontario, Sept. 19 (AP)The United States domi nated the first day of the Cana dian Masters waterskiing championships yesterday as Alan Kempton of Tampa, Fla., captured the men's title after winning the preliminary slalom and jumping events. The meet is being held at the Kelse con servation area near here.

title: Lack of Pilot Proficiency Blamed in 2 Air Crashes
description: BOSTON, Sept. 19 (AP) Two fatal airplane crashes in which three persons were killed last summer were attributed to the pilots lack of proficiency, in a report by the Massachu setts Aeronautics Commission.

title: Business Index Falls in Week
description: The New York Times Weekly Index of Business Activity fell last week to 359.0 from 393.9 a week earlier. A year ago it was 350.4.

title: State Rights Chief Joins Syracuse Football Rift
description: Robert J. Mangum, State Commissioner of Human Rights, says he has been asked to intervene in the dis pute involving black football players at Syracuse Univer sity.

title: Article 5  No Title
Dinner to Help Restore SquareRigger
description: The restoration of one of the last American squareriggers will be aided by a dinnerdance to be held Friday at the Nation al Maritime Union Upgrading and Retraining Center, 100 Ninth Avenue, at 16th Street. The gathering will also benefit American seamen.

title: NURSING PROGRAM SOUGHT IN SUFFOLK
description: AMITYVILLE, L. I. Sept. 19 A few years ago, Mrs. Mil dred Williams was scrubbing floors in a hospital here. To day, she is in the same hospi tal, but she has exchanged her housekeepers uniform for that of a licensed practical nurse.

title: Conquest of Cholera
description: This season of the year has! often been described in country parlance as dog days. It is a peak time for certain infec tious diseases, some of which, like poliomyelitis, have been lit tle understood or preventable until recently. Today the No. 1 headliner in this group in inter national health news is cholera.

title: N. CAROLINA TOPS N. C. STATE BY 190
description: CHAPEL HILL, N.C., Sept. 19 (UPI)Don McCauley, a tail back, scored one touchdown to day and his breakaway running set up two other North Carolina scores as the Tar Heels blanked North Carolina State, 190.

title: Point of View
description: There is danger that ex panded activities of Federal and quasiFederal agencies will change the role and sig nificance of private financial institutions in the housing market. They could become mere consults Ter the chan neling of funds from Federal agencies to mortgage bor rowers, while builders could become mere ordertakers for federally supported housing.

title: EXHIBITIONS
description: METROPOLITAN MUSEUM OF ART The Rise of an American Architecture, 18151915, photos and architectural dis plays; adults $1. students 50 cents. Through Oct. 3. Hours, 10 to 5, Monday through Saturday; Tuesday to 10 P.M.; Sunday 1 to 5.

title: Central Conn. Golf Victor
description: PLATTSBURGH, N. Y., Sept. 19 (AP)  Central Connecticut State College took firstplace honors today at the Plattsburgh State invitation golf tourna ment at the par72 Bluff Point Country Club. The Connecticut team won with a record score of 295. Plattsburgh State was second with 319, while Albany was third with a 320.

title: HormoneLike Chemicals Seen As Ideal Birth Control Method
description: About 500 scientists from around the world gathered here last week to discuss a mysteri ous group of naturally occur ring, hormonelike substances that may give mankind the con traceptive it has been waiting fora safe, effective, inexpen sive, onceamonth, morning after means of fertility control.

title: s
description: Q:

title: British Football Results
Chilean Army Stays Neutral in Allende Controversy
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Sept. 19 The Chilean Army stepped high through its annual Army Day parade here today, ignoring civilian appeals to take sides in the political maneuvering that has followed the plurality vote given to a Marxist, Dr. Salvador Allende, in the presi dential election.

title: S. R. KAPLAN
description: Simon R. Kaplan, a retired businessman and a onetime Russian revolutionary, died yes terday at his home after a long illness. He was 83 years old and lived at 360 West 22d Street.

title: Maxims Are Cut Down By English Economist
description: LONDON  The orthodox economic view that man has been put on earth to Increase the gross national product and multiply consumer choices is challenged by a small number of economic prophetsJohn Kenneth Gal braith at Harvard, Staffan Burenstam Linder at the Stockholm School of Econom ics, Edward Joshua Mishan at the London School of Economics.

title: A Bachelor, 79, Leaves $500,000 to Borough
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept. 19 (UPI)George Uhlinger, a bachelor who died last year at the age of 79, left $500, 000 to the borough of Spring dale, where he had operated a real estate business for 50 years.

title: Headliners
description: No one can say that Agatha Christie isn't timely with her mys tery writing. Last week, with attention still fixed on the airplane hijackings in the Middle East, Miss Christie came out with Passen ger to Frankfurtwhich just happens to include four hijackings. It is her 80th book, and publication helped her celebrate her 80th birthday. Though Miss Christie has been made wealthy by her books over the last 50 years, she is not too happy about modern sales methods. Noting that she now sees her novels in supermar kets next to the baked beans, she lamented last week, They'll soon be having these things at the butcher's.

title: KANSAS IS DEFEATED BY TEXAS TECH, 230
description: LAWRENCE, Kan., Sept. 19 (UPI)Texas Tech unleashed its hardrunning backs, led by Miles Langehennig, for 370 rushing yards and a 230 vic tory over Kansas today.

title: STEWART TAKES GRAND PRIX POLE
description: ST. JOVITE, Quebec, Sept. 19 (AP)Jackie Stewart, the world driving champion, set a quali fying record today in a Tyrrell Ford to win the pole position for tomorrow's $156,300 Cana dian Grand Prix.

title: Learning the Ropes
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Sept. 19 Gretel II is obviously a very competitive challenger in this remarkable America's Cup series. Bill Ficker and his Intrepid men must feel re lieved to have the single race which has been decided safe ly on their scoresheet.

title: A CORRECTION
description: An article in the July 26 issue erred in saying that Bailie F. W. A. Thorn ton of Arbroath, Scotland, was one of the persons who stole the Stone of Scone from Westminster Abbey in 1951. In fact, Mr. Thornton was one of those whoafter the stone had been stolen from Westminster by othersreturned it to the authorities. The error, in which the article's author, Peter Bloxham, had no part, is sincerely regretted.Ed.

title: The New Late Hodges
description: JOHNNY HODGES: Three Shades of Blue (Flying Dutchman 120). A Trib ute to Johnny Hodges MGM 4715). Less than Iwo months before John ny Hodges death on May 11. 1970, he took two days off from his travels with Duke Ellington's band to make a record for Flying Dutchman that, in view of his death, takes on unusual value. With Ellington, Hodges was usual ly heard playing two or three specialties over and over again. His own record ing sessions, normally with small group's and often with Wild Bill Davis, the organ ist, followed a relatively pre dictable, cutanddried pat tern (although anything Hodges cuts and dries inev tably has its own unique qualities).

title: Israel Joins In Appeal
description: GENEVA, Sept. 19Israel joined the United States, Brit ain, Switzerland and West Ger many tonight in an appeal for the transfer of the airliner hos tages to safe places, presum ably another Arab country. The five governments said they would not agree to negotiate for their exchange for Arab guerrillas unless this were done.

title: Europeans Lead U.S. In Return Diving Meet
description: BOLZANO, Italy, Sept. 19 (UPI)Europe took a slight early lead today over the United States in a diving meet held as a return match after the United States won a similar meet last April in Fort Lauderdale, Fla.

title: Legal Cases Test Exchange Form
description: The fundamental structure of the New York Stock Exchange may ultimately he changed as a result of a court decision in Milwaukee that has become the talk of Wall Street.

title: Stratford Tops Detroit, 32, To Keep U.S. Softball Title
description: CLEARWATER, Fla., Sept. 19 (UPI)For the second year in a row, Stratford, Conn., is the national men's fastpitch softball chamnion.

title: Sanders's 3 Tallies Help Nyack Crush Nanuet Squad, 480
description: Nyack made a successful start toward its fifth straight Rockland County Public Schools football championship by rout ing Nanuet, 480, yesterday. In other openingday results, Suf fern edged Pearl River, 2724; Ramapo beat Clarkstown, 147, and Tappan Zee upset Spring Valley 166

title: Gunfights in Birmingham
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Sept 19 Gunfights have marked the first incidents of trouble be tween the police and the heav ily black population of this Southern city.

title: New Code Troubling Small Builder
description: After nine months of experience with New York City's monumental new building code, the architects and builders of onefamily and twofamily houses in Queens, Brooklyn and Staten Island are expressing dismay verging in some cases on despair.

title: Demonstrators End Sitin At Bronx High School
description: A group of parents ended a thirtyseven and onehalf hour sitin last night at Christopher Columbus High School, 925 As tor Avenue, the Bronx, but said they would mount further pro tests until the Board of Educa tion changed a boundary regu lation that compelled their chil dren to attend another high school.

title: BEMAN, ARCHER TIE FOR LEAD AT 134
description: ROBINSON, Ill., Sept. 19 (AP) Deane Beman, with a 32, 33 65, and George Archer, with 34, 3367, tied today for the secondround lead with 134's in the $100,000 Robinson open golf tournament.

title: Crisis in the Classroom
description: What are schools for? The tradi tional answer comes in two parts: Schools convey knowledge and skills to the young so that some day they can get good jobs; and schools intro duce the young to their cultural heritage so that they can participate in the country's social and political life.

title: MOSCOW CAUTIONS ON JORDAN AGAIN
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 19The So viet Union, in a statement ap parently directed to Syria and Iraq, warned tonight that it could not put up with any for eign intervention in the Jor danian conflict.

title: Springfield 2112 Victor
description: CORTLAND, N. Y., Sept. 19 (UPI) John Curtis hauled in four passes today for 108 yards, including a 67 yard scoring jaunt, to lead Springfield Col lege to a 2112 victory over cortiand State University.

title: Thai Piane Hijacked
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Sept. 19 (AP)  A Thai charter plane, hijacked yesterday by an American with a prison rec ord in Arizona, was hit by ground fire over Laos before it landed the hijacker in North Vietnam, the pilot said today.

title: Devlin Cards 70 for 54Hole 210 and Extends Alcan Golf Lead to 3 Strokes
description: PORTMARNOCK, Ireland, Sept. 19 (UPI)Bruce Devlin of Aus tralia, despite poor luck with his wedge, shot a twounderpar 70 today for a 54hole aggregate of 210 and a threestroke lead in the Alcan Golfer of the Year championship on the 7,117yard Portmarnock course.

title: Osage to Get $13Million For Land Bought by U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 19 (AP) The Justice Department has announced that the Osage In dian Nation of Oklahoma will receive $13,250,000 as final set tlement for lands purchased by the United States.

title: COLORADO DOWNS INDIANA BY 16 TO 9
description: BLOOMINGTON, Ind., Sept. 19 (AP)Colorado bulled its way past a scrappy Indian team, 169, today before 42 471 spectators in the Indiana Stadium.

title: In the Forsytes Footsteps
description: IN AN INTRODUCTION to The For syte Saga, Mrs. John Galsworthy recalls a letter her husband once re ceived from a reader who had just returned from London. There he had met a man whom he seemed to know intimately but could not name; only later had he realized that the well known stranger had been that figment of Galsworthy's imagination, Soames Forsyte.

title: Dr. Robert Haight Weds Miss Marian Jenner Rea
description: RECTOR, Pa., Sept. 19 The marriage of Miss Marian Jenner Rea, a 1970 graduate of Goucher College, to Dr. Robert Cameron Haight, a nuclear physicist at Los Alamos, N. M., took place here at noon today.

title: Jets Depth Chart
description: OFFENSE WRGeorge Sauer, Eddie Bell.

title: Harness Race Drivers Vote Award to Writers
description: The Winner's Circle Award for 1970 has been voted to the United States Harness Writers Association by the National Association of Har ness Drivers, Del lnsko, pres ident of the drivers group, announced.

title: DELAWARE SUBDUES GETTYSBURG BY 347
description: GETTYSBURG, Pa., Sept. 19 (AP)  Breaking loose for 28 points in the second half today, the University of Delaware rolled to a 347 victory over Gettysburg.

title: Franklin Rubenstein to Wed Ronnie Feuerstein of Yale Law
description: Dr. and Mrs. Sidney S. Feuerstein of New York and Atlantic Beach, L. I., have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Ronnie Feuerstein, a Yale University law student, to Franklin D. Rubenstein, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Albert Rubenstein of Stamford. Conn.

title: F.B.I. Still Has No Clues In Disappearance of Girl, 5
description: The Federal Bureau of Inves tigation said yesterday that it still had no clues to the dis appearance on Sept. 10 of Leah Sarachik, 5 years old, of 201 West 86th Street.

title: The Week in Finance:
description: ONE factorbeyond all others in a noteworthy week stood out as the dominant influence in the perform ance of the financial markets last week. It was the widely held conviction that, before very long, there will be a general move among the nation's major banks to cut their prime lending rate.

title: Observer: The (Other) Eternal City
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 19It is wonderful to get back to Washington after a long ab sence. Everyone dripping with perspiration. Odor of decaying moss suffusing the subtropical damp. Everything reassuringly the same.

title: Eaton Asks Goodwill Act
description: CLEVELAND, Sept. 19 (AP) The industrialist Cyrus S. Eaton says that the United States should sell 50,000 breed ing beef cattle to the Soviet Union as an act of goodwill from the American people.

title: Saudi Arabia Gives Yemen $20Million Aid, Mostly Cash
description: SANA, Yemen, Sept. 19 Saudi Arabia has granted Ye men nearly $20million in aid, mainly in cash, according to informed sources.

title: Peru Sets Currency Curb
description: LIMA, Peru, Sept. 19 (AP) Peru's military government im posed a 10 per cent tax today on purchases of foreign cur rency by Peruvians wishing to travel abroad. It also ruled that the limit on foreign currency purchases may be doubled by travelers willing to pay a 50 per cent tax on the second half.

title: Would It Have Been Better to Ignore Arrabal?
description: AREVIEWER'S problems are his own. They're his to solve, and he has no business passing them along to the general public. But there is one problem that has cropped up for almost all reviewers In recent seasons that may take a bit of talking about, if only because of the multiple cries of outrage that filled the Drama Mail bag of this section several weeks ego.

title: Bridal Held for Eileen K. McGuirl
description: SOUTH YARMOUTH Mass., Sept. 19The Roman Catholic Church of St. Pius X was the setting at noon today for the marriage of Miss Eileen Kathryn Mc Guirl and Theodore Joseph Swedock Jr. The Rev. James J. Murphy, director of the Newman Club at the Uni versity of Pennsylvania, of which the bridegroom is a graduate, performed the ceremony.

title: In Brief: Education
description: BENEFITS, COSTS, AND FINANCE OF PUBLIC HIGHER EDUCATION. By W. Lee Hansen and Burton A. Weisbrod. Markham Publishing Com pany, 3322 W. Peterson Ave., Chi cago. $4.95. An unassuming little book with a gray titleone of several economic analyses of education pub lished over the past yearcontain ing the fascinating message that in California public support of higher education tends mostly to benefit students from relatively highincome families. Thus does the blue collar subsidize the education of the white collar. Hansen and Weisbrod, both economists, conclude that such in equity suggests that more attention be given to public subsidy of alterna tive forms of higher education, spe cifically outside collegesapprentice ships, vocational training, even in vestment in small businesses. Need less to say, the attacks on their find ings have already begun.

title: KINGS POINT DOWNS NORWICH TEAM, 73
description: NORTHFIELD, Vt., Sept. 19 The Merchant Marine Academy pushed across a touchdown in the final three minutes today to defeat Norwich, 73, in the football opener for both teams.

title: Photography
description: IN a tiny whitewashed cellar near Holland Park in London, three men and a girl are plotting revo lution. The men are Bill Jay, 30, editor of Album, a new photography magazine, and his two publishers, Aid an Ellis, 26, trained account ant, poet and painter, and Tristram Powell (pronounced pole), 31, a film director on BBC2. The girl, Sally Har greaves, 20, does everything for Album that the editor and publishers do not do, and proudly displays a re port card from London Col lege of Printing on which she got a zero in Creative Pho tography.

title: Is Pound Like Waiting for Godot'?
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Criminals At Large
description: Only a handful of series detective creations has been cel ebrated in more than 50 hard cover volumes by a single au thor. Heading the list is Erie Stanley Gardner's Perry Mason (83), followed fairly distantly by such as Christopher Bush's Ludovic Travers (67), Carolyn Well's Fleming Stone, Lee Thayer's Peter Clancy (61) and John Creasey's Toff (the 52d is covered below). George Simenon's Inspector Maigret, having long since surpassed Mason in other respects, is his most serious challenger numer ically: as nearly as can be de termined from Simenon's com plex bibliography, MAIGRET'S BOYHOOD FRIEND (Harcourt Brace Jovanovich, $4.95) is the 73d volume of the Inspec tor's cases. As usual, here is Maigret with a problem well mated to his unique talents, one in which his perception of the human condition is more re vealing than physical evidence. Florentin, with whom Maigret once long ago went to school, brings along a story of mur der: the woman with whom he lives, and who had four other steady customers, is dead of a bullet in the neck. Quickly the matter resolves itself in Maigret's mind into a choice of one of the five: Florentin, con genital liar and lifelong failure, or one of two successful and vulnerable businessmen, or the proper civil servant, or the young insurance salesman. Simenon's Inspector Maigret, having long since surpassed Mason in other respects, is his most serious challenger numer ically: as nearly as can be de termined from Simenon's com plex bibliography, MAIGRET'S BOYHOOD FRIEND (Harcourt Brace Jovanovich, $4.95) is the 73d volume of the Inspec tor's cases. As usual, here is Maigret with a problem well mated to his unique talents, one in which his perception of the human condition is more re vealing than physical evidence. Florentin, with whom Maigret once long ago went to school, brings along a story of mur der: the woman with whom he lives, and who had four other steady customers, is dead of a bullet in the neck. Quickly the matter resolves itself in Maigret's mind into a choice of one of the five: Florentin, con genital liar and lifelong failure, or one of two successful and vulnerable businessmen, or the proper civil servant, or the young insurance salesman.

title: Ann Sandlass Wed in Jersey
description: RUMSON, N. J., Sept. 19 Miss Ann H. Sandlass, daugh ter of Mrs. Henry J. Sandlass and the late Mr. Sandlass, was married today to Michael Morgan Le Coney, son of Mr. and Mrs. Horace M. Le Coney Jr. of Dallas. The Rev. Joseph MacAvoy performed the cere mony in the Holy Cross Roman Catholic Church.

title: Anne C. Daly To Be a Bride
description: RIDGEWOOD, N. J., Sept. 19Mr. and Mrs. Austin James Daly have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Anne Christina Daly, to Paul Andrew Bara bas, son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Paul Barabas of Rutherford.

title: Thomas Dozier And Miss Childs Married on L.I.
description: ROSLYN HARBOR, L. I., Sept. 19St. Mary's Roman Catholic Church here was the setting this afternoon for the marriage of Miss Jacqueline M. Childs to Thomas M. Dozier. The Rev. Francis A. Bain performed the cere mony.

title: Duke Beats Maryland, 1312, on Wright's 45Yard Field Goal in Last Second
Widow Wins 3Year Fight Over $200Million Estate
description: DALLAS, Sept. 19  After three years of a bitter court fight, Mrs. Pearl Choate Birch has won control of a $200mil lion estate left to her by her husband, Albert Otis Birch, California oilman.

title: Caryn Vigoda Engaged
description: NEWTON, Mass., Sept. 19 Mr. and Mrs. David W. Vigoda have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Caryn Sue Vigoda, a sophomore at Hofstra Uni versity, to Jeffrey I. Rich, a graduate of Case Western Reserve University, who plans to study medicine at the Downstate Medical Center in Brooklyn, New York. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Irving Rich of East Rockaway, L. I., where his father is a chiropractor. Mr. Vigoda is president and gen eral manager of the Norfolk Electric Company in Boston.

title: SOVIET WINS TITLE IN WEIGHT LIFTING
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Sept. 19 (UPI)Jan Talts retained his heavyweight championship to night to give the Soviet Union four consecutive titles and the team championship in the 1970 world weightlifting champion ships.

title: Beyond the Equinox
description: The sun now rises almost due east, sets almost due west. This is the week of the autumn equinox when, briefly, daylight and darkness are almost equal. Then the nights begin to lengthen in a steady pro gression that leads to the winter solstice, to official winter, to January.

title: Western Authors Win Wide Acclaim in the Bookstores of Riga
description: RIGA, U.S.S.R., Sept. 18  Across the swanbedecked ca nal next to Riga's baroque opera house sprawls Padomin Boulevard where store after store displays two signs: Gra mata in Latin script and Kniega in Cyrillicthe word for books in Latvian and Russian. respectively.

title: Coins
description: THE Republic of Liberia has announced that it will issue 1970 proof sets and that the coins for these will be produced by the United States Mint in San Francisco. This will mark the third time that this African nation has issued such items especially for collectors.

title: Auto Strike: Slow Grind On Economy
description: DETROITNot fast, like a rail strike that can stop everything quickly and bring immediate court injunctions and Government bans.

title: Pennsylvania Golfers Win
description: WILLIAMSTOWN, Mass., Sept. 19 (AP)  Pennsylvania's 10 man amateur golf team won the 57th Lesley Cup international competition today with a two day score of 44 points, fol lowed by Metropolitan New York with 37, and Quebec 31.

title: Religion
description: BRUSSELSThe first Vatican Council broke up in 1870 with the forces of Garibaldi marching on the Papal States, end it took 90 years to convene a new coun cil. Last week, on the fifth an niversary of the close of Vatican II, most of the major active theologians of the Roman Catho lic church gathered here to talk about the future, and it was evi dent that the next council will probably be a lot sooner in com ing.

title: OHIO U. TURNS BACK. KENT STATE, 24 TO 14
description: KENT, Ohio, Sept. 19 (UPI) Ohio University combined the passing of its quarterback, Steve Skiver, and the running of Bill Gary for a 2414 victory over Kent State today.

title: West Seeks Hussein's Views on Freeing Hostages
description: London, Sept. 19Western diplomats, worried about the survival of King Hussein's government, have asked the King for an exchange of views about efforts to free hostages held by Palestinian guerrillas.

title: Jordan at a Glance
description: HISTORYThe Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan was the result of an awkward marriage of the barren Bedouin kingdom of TransJordan and what was left of Palestine after the 1948 partition. Historically the Jordan River divided the nomadic, illiterate Bedouins living in the desert from the orchards and grainfields of the cultured Pales tinian Arabs on the west bank of the river.

title: Coin Flip Elects Sheriff
description: DURANT, Okla., Sept. 19 (AP)Sheriff Joe Brimmage of Bryan County is still sheriff today, thanks to the flip of a coin. Sheriff Brimmage was challenged in Tuesday's pri mary by 0. W. Highfill, and official vote totals showed that the outcome was a tie. The men agreed to flip a coin, with the winner becoming sheriff and the loser, under sheriff. Mr. Highfill called heads. He is Bryan County's new under sheriff.

title: Article 2  No Title
Pornography Contest
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md., Sept. 19 (AP)A pornographic writ ing contest is being conducted by Argus, the studentpublished magazine at the University of Maryland. Dave Bourdon, 28yearold editor of the magazine, said that the printing of win ning entries in the October is sue would serve as a test of the autonomy of studentrun publi cations.

title: Polo Postponed Until Today
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Sept. 19  The semifinal round of the Governor's Cup polo champion ship between Fairfield No. 1 and Skaneateles, N. Y., and Fairfield No. 2 and Myopia, Mass., was postponed today because of wet grounds at the Fairfield County Hunt Club. Both games were re scheduled for tomorrow  Fair field No. 1Skaneateles at Fair field and Fairfield No. 2Myopia at the Ox Ridge Hunt Club in Dairen. Conn.

title: Consulting Firms Faced With InBetween Time When Business Is Difficult
description: Some years ago Stanley Fenvessy, considering a ca reer in the management con sulting field, asked one of its senior citizens, the late Mark W. Cresap Jr., about the se curity it offered.

title: SLIGHT TO YOUTH IS CITED BY JEWS
description: ELLENVILLE, N. Y., Sept. 19 The suburban synagogue is bad theater. Jewish youngsters find that it has too much iden tification with the caterer and not enough with those Judaic ethics and values that are sup posed to give answers to con temporary probleans.

title: Diane Farnsworth Bride of R. G. Corin
description: DARIEN, Conn., Sept. 19 Miss Diane Victoria Farns worth, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Merton H. Farnsworth of Darien and Miami, was married here today to Roger Gilbert Corin, son of Mr. and Mrs. Jerome Y. Corin of Coral Gables, Fla. The Rev. Harry T. Cupp performed the cere mony in the chapel of the Noroton Presbyterian Church.

title: WEST GERMAN SOCCER
description: F.C. Cologne 2, Borussia Dortmund 2. Bayern Muenchen 2, Borussia Moenchen gladbach 2.

title: Jeannie M. Hong Becomes Bride Of Dr. C. T. Yun
description: Miss Jeannie M. Hong, daughter of Sung Wook Hong, Korean consul general here, and Mrs. Hong, was married in the Fifth Ave nue Presbyterian Church yesterday afternoon to Dr. Chongsun T. Yun, a den tist here. He is the son of T. C. Yun, former Korean Ambassador to Britain and Turkey, and Mrs. Yun of New York. His father is retired.

title: MOSCOW
description: WHETHER you are a manicured Park Avenue liberal, hairy New Left radical, Birchbound banker or simply a nonsound of the silent majority, come to Moscow to see for yourself how much the Communists have achieved in a mere 52 years in power, or how little they have managed to do in more than half a century.

title: Susan Kross Plans Bridal
description: Mr. and Mrs. Martin Kross of Little Neck, Queens, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Susan Harriet Kross, to Bruce David Rosen, son of Mr. and Mrs. Gerald Rosen of South Orange, N. J. The wedding is planned for June.

title: U.C.L.A. IS VICTOR OVER PITT, 2415
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept. 19Sud denly this city has a pennant race and two exciting quarter backs.

title: F. Lee Bailey, Headhunter
description: AT 7,500 feet in the cabin of a Cessna 401, a somewhat short, stocky man squints into the bloodred sunset that sends streaks through the clouds, making them appear like a ghastly, inedible marble cake. He slowly nudges off his loaf ers, and a faint odor starts to fill the cabin. Squinting more intensely, he drinks from a plastic cup and mulls the question over again. F. Lee Bailey doesn't usually mull; he is used to the sharp and quick retort, the parry, the thrust. When he final ly answers, the reply is also un typical Bailey: I just don't know. He had been asked a dual question: Why do you run so hard; what do you want out of life anyway?

title: Frontier Fort: Small Feet for Indian Fighter
description: LIGONIER, Pa.Inside Fort Ligonier, a reconstructed 18thcentury British fron tier fort that is structurally a contempo rary of the Holiday Inn up the road, are exhibited the leftovers from stews that were on the boil around 1758, re mains including bones of rattlesnakes, squirrels, bear, groundhogs and other critters. Excavated from what was most probably the fort dump, those leftovers are part of what might be the most remarkable collection of French and Indian War artifacts in North America.

title: Italian City Is Paralyzed By Sixth Day of Turmoil
description: REGGIO CALABRIA, Italy, Sept. 19Undaunted by down pours and the arrival of new police forces, rioters again built barricades and attacked gov ernment buildings here for the sixth consecutive day.

title: Action Near O'Reilly
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 19 (Reuters)American helicopter gunships attacked North Vietnamese troops in northernmost Quangtri Prov ince early this morning and killed 18 with heavy machine guns, a United States spokes man said today.

title: Anniversaries
description: DONANGELLadl Sang Ponca and San Juan Warmest regards and best wishes for many more years of happiness on this the cele bration of your golden wedding anniversary. September 113, 1970. May the sense of love, devotion and Integrity that has guided you both these many years, not only as individuals but for over 40 years as the President and his Lady of Banco Creditoy Ahorro Ponceno be an Inspiration for us all. GERDTS

title: 2 in Suffragette's House Find Their Place Is in Her Home
description: BATTENVILLE, N.Y.The white brick house with five chimneys where the nineteenthcentury women's rights leader Susan B. Anthony lived as a teenager has changed hands dozens of times since her day.

title: A Principal Backs Son In Defying Dress Code
description: ROSEVILLE, Mich., Sept. 19 (AP)As a junior high school principal, Ralph Erick son enforces the school dis trict's dress code among pupils.

title: CATHOLIC SCHOOLS PRAISED IN STUDY
description: ST. LOUIS, Sept. 19A study of Roman Catholic school stu dents in the St. Louis archdio cese has concluded that the quality of education in Catholic schools is probably equal to that of public schools even though it is costing less.

title: Central Michigan Triumphs
description: MOUNT PLEASANT, Mich., Sept. 19 (AP)Central Michi gan University used a passing attack that accounted for 98 yards and two touchdowns, and a ground game for 237 yards to crush Northern Iowa, 279, to day.

title: Nation
description: Arthur J. Goldberg told a joke last week. He had heard that some people thought he was too pompous and aloof, he said, and so he asked his wife Dorothy whether he was really like that. He said her answer was: I don't think so. Mr. Justice.

title: Convict Sues to Void Rules Concerning Hair in Prison
description: THOMASTON, Me., Sept. 19 (AP)  A convicted murderer who says he wants to appear in the image of God has filed a court petition against Maine State Prison officials who want him to shave his mustache and beard and cut his hair.

title: Kentucky Upsets Kansas State, 163, as Interceptions Lead to 2 Touchdowns
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Sept. 19 (AP) Kentucky's crushing de fense overwhelmed Kansas State's highly touted passing attack today as the Wildcats scored a 163 football upset.

title: FLORIDA CRUSHES MISS. STATE, 3413
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla., Sept. 19 (UPI)John Reaves passed for 272 yards and two touchdowns today as Florida routed Missis sippi State, 3413, in the first Southeastern Conference game of the year.

title: The World
description: WASHINGTONIt all began in June, in a mood of extrava gant optimism and with high hopes of resolving what Presi dent Nixon had described as the most dangerous crisis confront ing the world today.

title: Fayorecidian Takes Boardwalk Handicap by 2 Lengths on Atlantic City Turf
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Sept. 19 (AP)Hickory Tree Stable's Favorecidian, racing as an en try with Buzkashi, won the $30,000, 1 116mile Boardwalk Handicap on the turf by two lengths at the Atlantic City race course today.

title: U.S. SIDE DROPS BACK AT CHESS OLYMPIAD
description: SIEGEN, Germany, Sept. 19 The United States team lost ground in the fourth round of the 9th chess Olympiad here today when it played the last place Canadian aggregation.

title: FINKLE TRIUMPHS IN SOUTH BAY SAIL
description: AMITYVILLE, L. I., Sept. 19 Bill Finkle of Wantaugh, L. I., captured the Great South Bay Mariner Class championship to day, posting two first and a second. A total of 16 skippers competed in the series and Sid Greene of Massapequa, L. I., was the runnor up

title: Special Education Supplement
description: Will the campus blow again? Can the White House or the Unrest Com mission or anybody on earth devise a cooling strategy that works? What should be done to close the gap be tween distraught students  gradu ates, undergraduates, highschoolers and the citizenry at large?

title: L. I Horse Farm and Riding School That's a Family Venture
description: SAGAPONACK, L. I.On a stretch of Daniels Lane here, one comes upon an idealized landscapetall grass under blue skies, cream and russet horses, and, riding them, a gaggle of beautiful children, long hair flying. The landscape belongs to the Warren G. Toppings, whose riding school and horse farm breaks up the sameness of Eastern Long Island's flat potato fields.

title: Television This Week
description: 12:30 P.M. Meet the Press: Elliot L. Richardson (4)

title: Susan Ann Litwer Of N.Y.U. to Wed
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., Sept. 19Miss Susan Ann Litwer, a senior at New York University, and Frederick Steven Schiff, who was grad uated last year from N. Y. U. and is attending the Colum bia Graduate School of Busi ness, have become engaged.

title: Request for Police Studied In Buffalo School Incidents
description: BUFFALO, Sept. 19  Mayor Frank A. Sedita and police offi cials planned to meet this week end to discuss the possibility of stationing uniformed city po licemen in 20 of Buffalo's 100 public schools to guard against a recurrence of clashes that dis rupted three schools Thursday and yesterday.

title: PENN STATE BEATS NAVY IN 557 ROUT
description: UNIVERSITY PARK, Pa., Sept. 19Penn State used just about every play from coach Joe Paterno's book of X's and O's and carried them out to near perfection in crushing Navy, 557, for the Nittany Lions  23d straight victory today.

title: CAMBODIAN BRIDGE IS BLOWN UP AGAIN
description: SKOUN, Cambodia, Sept. 19 Enemy troops burned down a bridge last night virtually in the midst of a Government column stalled on the road to Kompong Thom. This morning, an expect ed advance toward the enemy stronghold of Tangkok, 50 miles north of the capital, did not begin.

title: Japanese Volcano Erupts
description: TOKYO, Sept. 19 (AP) Mount Komagatake, a volcano 300 miles north of Tokyo, erupted yesterday for the first time in eight years sending columns of flames and smoke 200 yards into the sky, the meteorological agency reported today. There were no casualties or damage.

title: Daphne vom Baur Wed in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 19. In St. Mary's Chapel in the Cathedral of SS. Peter and Paul here this afternoon. Miss Daphne de Blois vom Baur, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. F. Trowbridge vom Baur, became the bride of Patrick William Green. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Edward Henry Tinniswood Green of Itchenor Park, Eng land.

title: DIXIE GOVERNORS TO ARGUE BUSING
description: BILOXI, MISS., Sept. 19 Governors from 15 Southern states began gathering here today for what has developed into an annual paper war be tween the states over school desegregation.

title: Linda W. Paine Becomes Bride In S.I. Church
description: Miss Linda Westall Paine, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Lewis Compton Paine Jr. of West Brighton, S.I., was mar ried yesterday afternoon to David Lawrence Langston, son of Mr. and Mrs. Douglas Haig Langston of Hopewell, N. J. The ceremony in Christ Episcopal Church, New Brighton, SI., was performed by the Rev. Frederick P. Lefebvre.

title: Study Calls Public Schools Oppressive and Joyless
description: In an unusually outspoken indictment of the nation's pub lic schools, a threeandahalfyear study commissioned by the Carnegie Corporation has found that most schools not only fail to educate children adequately but also are op pressive, grim and joyless.

title: Lebanon Orders Inquiry Into Production of Hashish After Political Scandal
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Sept. 19  hashish scandal that led to allegations against prominent Lebanese politicians has prompted the Government to announce an investigation of the illegal harvesting and smug gling of hashish.

title: McCabe Captures National Shields Class Sailing Crown
description: LARCHMONT, N.Y., Sept. 19 Lance McCabe, a 20yearold helmsman from Newport Beach, Calif., was heaved overboard this afternoon. The reason: He won the national championship in the Shields Class sailing in the morning.

title: Old Movie Houses Never Die
description: IT all began with Adam and Evil, a silent film starring Lew Cody and Aileen Pringle, and a stage show headed by Ted Lewis. What was begun was the existence of the Penn Theater in Pittsburgh on Sept. 6, 1927. Like many another opulently decorated movie palace, it fell on hard times in the era of television, and it might have succumbed to a wrecking crew if the Pittsburgh Symphony had not bought it three years ago.

title: Secession, the reason why
description: The crisis of fear that is the subject of Steven Channing's book began in October, 1859, when old John Brown, selfap pointed avenging angel of the Lord, attacked the _ Federal ar senal at Harper's Ferry, Va., in an attempt to free the slaves. When it came to light that Brown's plans embraced the whole south, that MS support ers were highlyrespected intel lectuals and that his sympathiz ers were legion throughout the North, many white Southern ers were reaffirmed in their conviction that there was no safety in the Union for slavery, the social institution they firm ly believed stood between them and chaos.

title: Foreign Affairs: The Sage of Sandy Spring
description: SANDY SPRING, Md.Dean Acheson, probably the most successful and distinguished practitioner of American diplo macy during the last twenty years, is now an old man (77), retired to his books, his memo ries and the acres of his rolling Maryland farm, but this does not mean he has withdrawn from the agonizing problems of a deteriorating world.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Pursuing the Muskellunge
description: CASS LAKE, Minn.  For three consecutive years, a band of highly motivates anglers have journeyed to Cass Lake in September to pursue North America's larg est pike, the obstinate, un predictable muskellunge.

title: In Retailing, a Midi Mishap?
description: Andrew Goodman, who has a few midilengths to sell these days, tells this story about a young lady for whom he gave a wedding dinner the other night at Cote Basque.

title: WASHINGTON TOPS MICH. STATE, 4216
description: SEATTLE, Sept. 19 (AP) Sonny Sixkiller, a Cherokee In dian, fired 59, 37 and 5 yard touchdown passes today, lead ing Washington to a 4216 foot ball victory over Michigan State.

title: 12 Chilean Convicts Escape
description: ANTOFAGASTA, Chile, Sept. 19 (Reuters)Twelve convicts escaped from the city jail here today through a 30yard under ground tunnel, dug with fin gernails and table knives, the police reported. They added that the prisoners had taken months to carve out the tunnel.

title: Harvard Tied in Scrimmage
description: DURHAM, N. H., Sept. 19 (AP)  New Hampshire held Harvard scoreless for the first halif and then rallied to tie the Crimson, 2121, on Bob Hop kins's pass to Kyle Kucharsld and a twopoint pass conversion today in a preseason football game scrimmage.

title: Mary Robinson Lambert Is a Bride
description: Miss Mary Robinson Lam bert, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Adrian Lambert of New York and Old Black Point, Conn., was married here this afternoon to William von Raab, son of Mr. and Mrs. Frederick von Raab of Ros lyn, L.I. The Rev. Dr. David H. C. Read performed the ceremony in the Madison Avenue Presbyterian Church. A reception followed in the Cotillion Room at the Pierre.

title: Fordham Beats Seton Hall In CrossCountry Opener
description: Fordham opened its cross country season yesterday by de feating Seton Hall, 2043, over the fivemile Van Cortlandt Park course. Tom Winters of Seton Hall was the individual winner in 27 minutes and 12 seconds. He was followed across the finish line by seven Ford ham harriers.

title: Spending Limit in Oregon
description: SALEM, Ore., Sept 19, (AP) Oregon's governorship candi dates have agreed to a limit of $118,000 each for campaign ex penditures.

title: Henry Charles Bayer Marries Miss Janice Madaline Briddell
description: In the Unitarian Church of All Souls yesterday, Miss Janice Madaline Briddell, who is with the research de partment of CBWLHayden Stone, stockbrokers, was mar ried to Henry Charles Bayer, an arbitrage dealer with L. F. Rothschild & Co., stock brokers. The ceremony was performed by the. Rev. Dr. Walter Donald Kring.

title: BASENJI IS BEST IN OX RIDGE SHOW
description: DARIEN, Conn., Sept. 19 The Ox Ridge Hunt Club was the site today as Ch. Reveille ReUp, a 4yearold redand white Basenji took his 11th bestinshow award in a field of 1,954 dogs at the Ox Ridge Kennel Club fixture.

title: An English Lesson for America
description: In 1967, a British government body called the Central Advisory Council on Education published Children and Their Primary Schools, which is us ually called the Plowden Report. This remarkable official document called attention to the fact that English pri mary schoolswhich are very much the Cinderellas of the educational system, ignored in policy debates and shortchanged in budgetsare on the way toward establishing certain con ditions for learning on a fairly large, national scale.

title: Miss Diana Mansfield Dennison Is Married to Colin L. M. Smith
description: Miss Diana Mansfield Den nison, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Ethan Allen Dennison Jr., was married here yester day afternoon to Colin Louis Melville Smith.

title: Arab Students Still Occupy Jordanian Embassy in India
description: NEW DELHI, Sept. 19 (AP) Arab students remained in con trol of the Jordanian Embassy here today, vowing to stay until a new government is formed in Jordan.

title: Speeder Goes 126 M.P.H.
description: SKOWHEGAN, Me., Sept. 19 (AP)A 24yearold Canadian has paid a $90 fine in District Court here for what the state police say is probably the most flagrant speeding violation ever recorded in Maine. Ronald Bedard of St. Come, Quebec, pleaded guilty in a written waiver here Wednesday to speeding 126 miles an hour in a posted 60mile zone.

title: Wichita State Routed, 5314
description: WICHITA, Kan., Sept. 19 (AP) Arkansas State University rolled up a 407 halftime lead over Wichita State and went on to win, 5314, in the Shockers home football opener today.

title: CAR PRICE RISES ANTICIPATE PACT
description: DETROIT, Sept. 19Newcar prices have already been raised to cover the pay increase the United Auto Workers are ex pected to win this fallthough the size of the raise is not known, and the workers will not get the money for months.

title: Tulane Field Goal Helps Forge Upset Of Georgia, 1714
description: NEW ORLEANS, Sept. 19 (UPI)  Lee Gibson, a sopho more attempting his first col legiate field goal, kicked a 26 yarder tonight to give Tulane a 1714 upset victory over the Georgia.

title: Leeds Is 10 Victor Over Southampton
description: L ONDON, Sept. 19 (Reuters)  A penalty goal kept Leeds United at the top of the English Soccer League First Division today, but second place Man chester City stepped up the pres sure with a four goal display.

title: State College Republican Unit Endorses Buckley for Senator
description: A group of students repre senting an organization known as the New York State College Republicans yesterday endorsed James L. Buckley, Conservative candidate for the United States Senate.

title: TULSA TURNS BACK IDAHO STATE, 3813
description: TULSA, Okla., Sept. 19 (AP) Tulsa University's defense scored more points than the opposition today, as Idaho State was routed, 3813, before 15,250 spectators at Skelly Stadium.

title: ALABAMA THRASHES VIRGINIA TECH, 5118
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Sept. 19 (AP)  Alabama ended a threegame losing streak to night with a 51.18 drubbing of Virginia Tech.

title: PIRATES TOP METS, 2 TO 1
description: The Chicago Bears won only; one game in 1969 but they equaled that output last night in Yankee Stadium. Their vic tims were the Giants, by the score of 2416, in the opening game of the regular season for both teams. Last year's losers adjusted their defenses in the second half and came up with several big plays, including a 95yard kickoff return early and a 33yard pass on a fake punt in the fourth period.

title: LANDS ACQUIRED FOR PRESERVATION
description: The Nature Conservancy, a national nonprofit conservation organization, has acquired for preservation during the last year 62,000 acres of land in 133 projects in 23 states.

title: UTAH STATE DEFEATS BOWLING GREEN, 3314
description: LOGAN, Utah, Sept. 19 (AP) Utah State scored three touchdowns in the final quarter, two on long punt returns, to defeat Bowling Green, 3314, today in an intersectional game.

title: Nader's Sister Is a Quiet Crusader
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Sept. 19 (AP)  We were taught to be lieve that you took from so ciety, said Laura Nader, and you have to give to society. That may explain, she says, the Nader commitment to social re form.

title: Jersey Gardener's Hoe Disrupts Phone Service
description: Longdistance service be tween New York and some parts of the South was inter rupted momentarily yester day after a weekend gardener in western New Jersey dam aged an underground cable with a hoe.

title: BLACK PANTHER AIDE SURRENDERS HERE
description: Zayd Malik Shakur, the Black Panther information min ister in New York, was booked yesterday on charges of crim inal possession of deadly weanons.

title: U. S. Is Cautioned by Egypt Against Any Attempt to Intervene in the Jordanian War
description: CAIRO, Sept. 19The United Arab Republic warned today that any intervention by United States troops in Jordan would be a hostile act against all Arabs.

title: Trying To Read Meaning Of Allende Victory
description: WASHINGTONA new chap ter in LatinAmerican politics and United StatesLatin Ameri can relations will open on Nov. 4, when Salvador Allende Gossens is expected to assume the Presidency of Chile. Wash ington's studied silence on Dr. Allende's feathe is the first Marxist to be voted into power in the Western Hemisphere In a free democratic electionreflects the profound uncertainty that is felt in this capital as to what the new chapter will contain.

title: Rockefeller to Be Honored
description: Governor Rockefeller will be honored at a luncheon of the Touchdown Club of New York at The Lambs, 128 West 7 Street, at 12:30 P.M. Wednes day. The chairman of they State Athletic Commission, E. B. Dooley, will present the club's Leadership Award plaque to the Governor.

title: TENNESSEE WINS FROM S.M.U., 283
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., Sept. 19 (UPI)Curt Watson scored two touchdowns today, as Tennes see scored a 283 victory over Southern Methodist.

title: The Merchant's View:
description: Retailing activity slowed last week, but there was evidence of stronger buying sentiment even though con sumers are still showing cau tion in their purchases. Dol lar retail volume is on the plus side, and the picture from the standpoint of units is also brighter.

title: Seals Shut Out Sabres
description: OSHAWA, Ontario, Sept. 19 (AP)  The Oakland Seals coasted to a 60 victory last night over the Buffalo Sabres in a National Hockey League preseason game. Norm Fergu son scored twice for the Seals, playing their first exhibition contest of the season.

title: Manhattan Sets Back St. Francis, 256
description: Manhattan College, with 35 returning letter men, opened its club football season yester day with a 25.6 victory over St. Francis College of Brooklyn at Gaelic Park.

title: Fort Snelling Depicted
description: FORT SNELLING was quite an establishment. For some time now, the State of Minnesota, in which it is located, has been restoring what, to the Indians of its day, must have been the greatest teepee ever. The 150th anniversary of its establishment is being commemorated postally on Oct. 17.

title: MURPHY DRAWING ON ACTING SKILLS
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 19 Senator George Murphy's re election campaign style avoids long interviews with reporters, steers clear of large news con ferences and concentrates In stead on speeches to friendly audiences and personal ex changes with strangers on the street.

title: STANDARDS URGED FOR MEDICAL AIDS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 19A Government study panel rec ommended today some steps toward better regulating the safety and performance of med ical devices.

title: Music
description: PROGRAMS for the 1970 71 season have just been released by the New York Philharmon ic, and if this Is a little la ter than usual, one can only guess what the organization has been going through. The death of George Szell meant a lastminute search for con ductors whose schedules al lowed them to come to New York this season. Programs had to be revised or com pletely changed. The lights were burning late in the Phil harmonic offices last month.

title: Miss McNeil Wed To Martin King Jr.
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y.; Sept. 19Miss Charlotte McNeil, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John J. McNeil of Mamaro neck, was married here this morning in the Roman Catho lic Church of SS John and Paul to Martin E. King Jr. He is a son of the late Mr. and Mrs. King. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Joseph Boyd of Katonah.

title: Advertising:
description: It was Wednesday morning and since he had spent Tues say in Detroit with his Buick clients in the gloom of the General Motors strike, you couldn't expect Robert S. Marker to be a bundle of laughs. But he was extremely pleasant and that couldn't have been too easy, con sidering.

title: Alaska Air Crash Laid to Turbulence And Metal Cracks
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 19 (UPI)Metal fatigue and clear air turbulence combined to rip off the wing of an airliner and plunge it into a frozen Alaskan bay Dec. 2, 1968, killing 39 persons, according to an in vestigation by the National Transportation Safety Board.

title: THE NEW TV SEASON PART TWO
description: TODAY

title: Dutschke, Ordered to Leave, In Epileptic Attack in Britain
description: LONDON, Sept. 19 Rudi Putschke, the German revolu tionary student who has been ordered to leave Britain by the end of the month, suffered an epileptic attack today.

title: Illustration by Peter Spier for The Erie Canal.
description: If there is any doubt about small children responding viv idly to rhythm, try putting one of those driving Bach Branden burg Concertos on your record player when your 4yearold is around. Or try reading him a picture book that uses a folk song as its text.

title: On Hudson In Jersey, Rents Rise
description: WEST NEW YORK, N. J.In this area overlooking Manhattan's West Side, developers are expanding their offerings and increasing their rents in response to the demands for apart ments by several thousand families discouraged by the high rents and the apartment shortage in New York City.

description: THE MYSTIQUE of northern California wine makinga blend of ancient lore, modern technology, hard economics and soft sellis on full display these days in the sunlit, greengold Sonoma and Napa Valleys.

title: Palisades Agency Elects
description: BEAR MOUNTAIN, N.Y., Sept. 19 (AP)Laurance S. Rocke feller, chairman of the Rocke feller Brothers Fund and broth er of Governor Rockefeller, has been elected president of the Palisades Interstate Park Com mission, it was announced yes terday. Mr. Rockefeller, who had been a member of the com mission since 1939 and was serving as its vice president, succeeds Albert J. Jube, of Or ange, N.J., in the presidency. Mr. Jube, who died yesterday, retired last June.

title: Yanks,'27Vintage,Top 61 Variety on Homer
description: Lou Gehrig's twoout home run off Whitey Ford in the 10th inning earned the 1927 New York Yankees a 53 victory over the 1961 New York Yankees to win the final round of NBCTV com puter baseball tournament presented yesterday.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: Yeshiva University will dedicate its new 20story Belfer Graduate School of Science this fall on the Washington Heights campus. Erected at a cost of $20million, the center affords com manding views of upper Manhattan and the New Jersey Palisades from its loca tion on Amsterdam Avenue at 184th Street. Designed by Armand Bartos & Associates, the center has a facade consisting of tall shafts of brick separated by narrow shafts containing dark framed windows. The Bartos firm also designed the university's new Mendel Gottesman Library. The science building will contain laboratory and classroom space for physics, mathematics, nuclear research, chemistry, biophysics and as trophysics, and will have a computer center and a 50,000volume library. sisting of tall shafts of brick separated by narrow shafts containing dark framed windows. The Bartos firm also designed the university's new Mendel Gottesman Library. The science building will contain laboratory and classroom space for physics, mathematics, nuclear research, chemistry, biophysics and as trophysics, and will have a computer center and a 50,000volume library.

title: Brown Stars as Vanderbilt Routs The Citadel, 52 to 0
description: NASHVILLE, Sept. 19 (AP) Vanderbilt scored the first four times it had the ball tonight and, aided by a spirited de fense, walloped The Citadel, 520.

title: CONFLICT CONDONED IN CAMPUS SURVEY
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Sept. 19 (UPI)Eighty per cent. of the graduating seniors on 10 diverse college campuses across the country believe confrontation tactics  ranging from non violent mass demonstrations to physical violence  are neces sary to bring social change, two University of California re searchers have reported.

title: Science
description: The future of pest control will depend less and less on nonselective chemicals that pollute the environment and poison desirable organisms and more and more on such selective approaches as se duction with sex lures, in voluntary birth control, jammed radar, enforced celi bacy and germ warfare.

description: CHAPEL HILL, N. C., Sept. 19James Kern Kyser, the bandleader who, as Kay Kyser, headed his own Col lege of Musical Knowledge, and Mrs. Kyser have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Kimber ly Ann Kyser, to Beauchamp Coppedge Carr, son of Mr. and Mrs. Julian Shakespeare Carr of Atlanta.

title: School Days for Dogs Are Here Again
description: It was back to school for youngsters In New York last week. This week new school terms are beginning for the learners in the dog world.

title: Illinois Hearing Chairman Asks Moves to Fight Student Unrest
description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill., Sept. 19 Stringent measures to com bat student unrest have been advocated by the chairman of a special legislative committee that studied the problem this week.

title: ATHENS PLANNING A LIBERALIZATION
description: ATHENS, Sept. 19  The proposed resumption of full scale United States military aid to Greece later this month would coincide with a series of measures described here as liberalization of the military backed regime.

title: Can It Happen Here?; Is It Already Happening?
description: DURING the campus rebellions of last May, striking students at one Eastern college ar ranged a mass meeting with the col lege's custodial and administrative employes to explain the strike's goals. As the usual question period began, one of the skeptical employes stood up and asked, in a voice quiv ering with hostility, Don't you know that the clenched fist you're painting all over the campus was a symbol of Fascism?

title: CardCarrying Americans Crowd the Rails of Europe
description: AMERICANS of all ages, who won't go near a train in their native land, are taking to the rails of Europe with wild abandon. Before the year is done, some 80,000an increase of 45 per cent over 1969are expected to en train, clutching the little redandwhite card called Eurailpass.

title: In the Jewish ghetto and the ghetto of the mind
description: In a Warsaw Yiddish writers club: While we were eating, Bam berg came over to our table. He was a little man, emaciated as a consumptive, bent over and bow legged. He was wearing patent leather shoes, and spats. On his pointed skull lay a few gray hairs. One eye was larger than the other red, bulging, frightened by its own vision. He leaned against our table on his bony little hands and said in his cackling voice, Jacques, yester day I read your Kafka's Castle. Interesting, very interesting, but what he is driving at? It's too long for a dream. Allegories should be short'

title: Some Foreigners in Vietnam Find Themselves Under Its Spell
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 19Is there something special about South Vietnam that lures foreigners here and keeps them under a spell?

title: Aide Says Vietcong Consults Contacts In Saigon Regime
description: PARIS; Sept. 19 (Reuters) Mrs. Nguyen Thi Binh, chief negotiator for the Vietcong at the Paris peace talks, said to day that peace proposals she presented this week had been worked out after contacts with other groups in South Vietnam, including officials of the Sai gon Government and members of the army.

title: Stamps
description: STAMP collecting's world is centered here this week. Thousands of collectors from almost every corner of the world, in cluding more than 1,000 Americans and Canadians, have converged on this an cient capital to attend Phil ympia 1970 which opened last Friday. This year's international stamp exhibition at Empire Hall, Olympia, in cludes more than 100 Ameri cans among the almost 700 exhibitors from many nations in the competition for covet ed prizes.

description: Today Piping Rock, Piping Rock Club. Locust Valley, L. L Championships in all divisions except ponies and amateurowner jumpers. 8 A.M.

title: H. L. Walkers Repeat Vows in Religious Rite
description: COLD SPRING HARBOR, L.6 I., Sept. 19.Howard Lee Walker Jr. and the former Miss Lydia MacKenzie Schill ing, who were married June 13 in a civil ceremony in Northport, were united in a religious ceremony in St. John's Episcopal Church here this evening. The Rev. Wil liam Spilman officiated.

title: Found: a voice to illumine the avantgarde
description: John Lahr is Bert Lahr's son: there is much to ponder in that fact. It underlines, to start with, the contrast between the world of the twenties and that of the seventiesthat dis tant epoch, vulgar, genuine, vital and totally unreflective; and ours, self conscious, tormented with doubt, in tellectualizing on itself, constantly striving to fathom the social and political significance of its own ac tions while they are still in progress.

title: Parker's 3Run Double in 7th Enables Dodgers to Triumph Over Astros, 65
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 19 (UPI) Wes Parker's basesloaded dou ble chased home three runs in a seventhinning rally that enabled the Los Angeles Dodg ers to beat the Houston As tros today, 65.

title: Kenyan Athletes to Compete In U.S. During 1971 Tour
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Sept. 19 lAish Jeneby, executive officer lof the Kenya Amateur Athletic Association, has announced that 12 Kenyan athletes would tour North America, the Carib ibean and South America next summer.

title: fascism, n.
description: The original Italian name of fascismo is derived from the Latin fasces, bundles, denoting in ancient Rome a bundle of rods with an ax, borne before Roman magistrates as a symbol of authority.  Encyclopedia Britannica.

title: The Wartime Journals of Charles A. Lindbergh
description: In 1937 Charles A. Lindbergh be gan keeping a diary and he continued it into 1945. The journals therefore cover the preWorld War II period, when the celebrated flier was in Europe surveying military aviation; the battle between President Frank lin Roosevelt and the isolationists, during which Lindbergh stumped the United States as the star speaker of the antiinterventionists and charged that the British, the Jewish and the Roosevelt Administration were the chief forces pressing America into the conflict; the war years when, denied an Air Corps commission, he served as a civilian aeronautical ex pert in private industry and in the Pacific, also managing to work in 50 combat missions; and the weeks just after the Nazi surrender, which found him again in Europe, attached to a Naval Mission studying wartime de velopments in plane design and mis siles. Lindbergh wrote the diary with out thought of making it public. Now, at age 68, he has published it, cut by onethird but with its substance rigorously preserved.

title: Julie C. Lewis Becomes Bride
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept. 19 Miss Julie Currier Lewis, daughter of Mrs. Oliver Blair of Pittsburgh and Ligonier, and Henry Calvin Place, son of Mr. and Mrs. Henry Coe Place of Wynnewood, were married here this afternoon in St. Paul's Roman Catholic Cathedral. Msgr. Andrew J. Pauley performed the cere mony.

description: BREINDEL, IrvingHappy birthday dearest You left so quietlyno goodby. Time does not heal. M.

title: How Our Girl Made Good in Movies

So natur ally she first had to take all kinds of lessons. She studied voice projection, posture con trol, fencing and lots more technical stuff.

title: Goldberg Urges Nonpartisan Panel to Draw Legislative Districts
description: The shifting of responsibility for redistricting from the Leg islature to a nonpartisan com mission was proposed yester day by Arthur J. Goldberg, the DemocraticLiberal candidate for Governor.

title: Sandhogs and Families Attend Memorial Mass Here at Site Where 68 Fellow Workers Died in 1890
description: More than 300 sandhogs and their families worshiped yester day at an outdoor memorial mass for fellow workers who died in Past years.

title: First Decimal Stamps of Jersey
description: THe Bailiwick of Jersey's first decimal stamps are due Oct. 1 in denomina tions of 10, 20 and 50 new pence. These will re place existing 2 shilling 6 pence, 5shilling and 10shil ling stamps. Excepting the decimal denominations, p replacing d (denarius) for the old pence; and 7 rep resenting shilling, the designs are unchanged. As with Brit ish decimal stamps, some of which have appeared, they will be in use along with cur rent denominations. Decimal currency becomes official on DDay, next Feb. 15. The decimal stamps (from designs by Victor Whiteley and print ed by Courvoisier of Switzer land) show Jersey airport (10p); Jersey's legislative chamber (20p), and the Royal court (50p). The gray border on the earlier 10shilling stamp will be green on the 50p.

title: Barney Signs Lion Pact For $42,000 a Year
description: DETROIT, Sept. 19 (UPI) Lem Barney signed a twoyear contract today with the Detroit Lions, that starts at an estimated $42,000  pre sumably making the allpro cornerback the highest paid defensive back in the history of football.

description: RIDGEFIELD, Conn., Sept. 19 Kathy Malloy rode Mr. Zee to the regular working hunter championship at the Spruce Ridge Farms Stable's horse show today after the race for the title had finished in a four way ite. Mr. Zee. Dunga Din, Bangle and Big Red collected five points apiece.

description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 19 (UPI)  Having obtained 60 days breathing time in the railroads wage dispute, the Nixon Admin istration today asked both sides to resume negotiations in the dispute over firemen.
