description: The Phillips Petroleum Com pany announced yesterday that it had discovered oil in the British sector of the North Sea about 25 miles west of the large Ekofisk field in Norwegian waters.

title: Executive Is Suing Long Beach Over Arrest in Antiwar Protest
description: LONG BEACH, L. I., Sept. 21 A 48yearold publishing ex ecutive here, charged with vio lating a city ordinance against handing out leaflets, filed $250,000 lawsuit against the city and two officials on the ground that his Constitutional rights were violated.

title: New Strict NoParking Rules Appear to Speed Traffic in Financial District
description: Strict noparking rules went into effect in Lower Manhattan yesterday as the city strove to relieve traffic congestion in the narrow streets of the bustling finan cial district.

title: Racial Unrest in Louisiana City Leads to a State of Emergency
description: BATON ROUGE, La., Sept. 21 (UPI)Gov. John J. Mc Keithen declared a state of emergency in Houma, La., to day following a weekend of mounting racial tension in two coastal Louisiana parishes.

title: Doctors Warn A gainst Aspirin Late in Pregnancy
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 21 (AP) Pregnant women should avoid taking aspirin as the time ap proaches when they are to give birth, two doctors advised to day.

title: Market Place
description: It's a story everybody has heard at one time or another. Perhaps you heard it at a club function. The meeting is over and everybody has re tired to the bar.

title: Buckley Endorsed by Procaccino For Senate as Only Alternative
description: Former City Controller Mario A. Procaccino dropped the oth er shoe yesterday and an nounced his expected endorse ment of Conservative party candidate James L. Buckley for the United States Senate seat now held by Republican Charles E. Goodell.

title: Motion on Roan Denied
description: The United States District Court has denied a motion by a complainant to enjoin distri bution to former shareholders of Roan Selection Trust of cash and securities in a reorganiza tion plan. The reorganization plan was consummated on Aug. 15 following the approval of the High Court for Zambia. Un der the plan Roan Selection Trust became a subsidiary of American Metal Climax.

title: STUDENTS RETURN TO WISCONSIN U.
description: MADISON, Wis., Sept. 21The lines were long in the bookstores at the edge of cam pus today as students at the University of Wisconsin cra dled armloads of the stiff new texts and clean spiral notebooks that have traditionally symbol ized the beginning of the fall semester.

title: Fiddler Begins 7th Year
description: Fiddler on the Roof, the longrun musical costarring Paul Lipson and Peg Murray, begins its seventh year tonight at the Majestic Theater. The United States companies of the Harold Prince produced and Jerome Robbins directed musi cal have grossed $45,689,500 to date. The show has a book by Joseph Stein based on Sholem Aleichem's Tevye stories, music by Jerry Bock and lyrics by Sheldon Harnick.

title: Madison Ave. Sidewalk Bears Design by Calder
description: Pedestrians are watching their steps these days as they stroll along Madison Avenue between 78th and 79th Streets, the better to see and appreciate the blackand white terrazzo sidewalk de signed by Alexander Calder.

title: Related Developments
description: Leaders of the Arab world called a conference for today in Cairo to deal with what the United Arab Republic termed the deteriorating situation in Jordan. King Hus sein, it appeared, will be represented by his Premier, and Cairb was reported to be putting pressure on Yasir Arafat, the commando leader, also to attend.

title: Agnew and Student Leaders Hit Impasse in TV Debate
description: Vice President Agnew, wran gling with student leaders here last night, said it was under standable that construction workers attacked antiwar dem onstrators.

title: JAMES R. FISHBURN
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., Sept. 21 James R. Fishburn, a televi sion sales executive, died today in Lawrence Hospital here after a short illness. He was 49 years old and lived at 25 Prescott Avenue.

title: Workers in Nevada Vote To End Atomic Test Strike
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Sept. 21 (AP)Workers at the Nevada test site voted today to end strike that has crippled the nation's nuclear testing pro gram for almost four months.

title: Nixon Plans Montana Visit
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 21 (AP) President Nixon plans to visit Glacier National Park and two river dam projects in north western Montana next year, Senator Mike Mansfield said today. The Senate Democratic leader said he would make ar rangements for the visits to the park and Hungry Horse and Libby dams.

title: Balloon With 3 on Atlantic Hop Feared Down at Sea
description: Two men and a woman at tempting the first transAtlan tic crossing in a balloon were caught in a heavy rainstorm 500 miles east southeast of St. John's Newfoundland, last night and radioed for assistance, say ing they were preparing to ditch into the sea.

title: BLACK ACADEMY LOOKS TO FUTURE
description: If there ever were any ques tions as to what the role of the Black Academy of Arts and Let ters should be, they were an swered repeatedly last week end during the academy's first annual meeting, which ended early yesterday morning.

title: Bottles of Water Upstate Embargoed During Study
description: ALBANY, Sept. 21  The State Department of Health to day requested bottlers of Nor manskill Water to remove all containers from store shelves, pending further bacteriological studies.

title: INFANTRY READY
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 21The United States alerted in fantry and paratroop units in this country and in Europe today for possible movement to Jordan, apparently after re ceiving a Jordanian appeal for military help.

title: Builders of Machine Tools Display Wares
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 21  The world's biggest, most costly and most advanced machine shop  some of it verging on science fiction  went into operation here today. It will all be dismantled again in two weeks because the machine tools. worth about $40mil lion, some of them taking the space of a twocar garage and weighing nearly 100 tons, are here only for demonstra tion at the Machine Tool Show.

title: SOUTHPAW WALKS ONE MAN, FANS 9
description: OAKLAND, Sept. 21 (UPI)Vida Blue, a rookie lefthander, deprived of a nohitter only 10 days ago, pitched hitless ball against the Minnesota Twins tonight as the Oakland Ath letics triumphed, 60.

title: SYRIAN TANKS KEY
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Sept. 21King Hussein's battered forces fought retreating battles today against Palestinian commandos reinforced by tanks rolling down from Syria. All the cities of northern Jordan except the capital, Amman, appeared to be in the guerrillas hands.

title: Tito Declares a Collective Body Will Replace Him as President
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Sept. 21President Tito, who is 79 years old, said today that the question of who would succeed him as head of state would be solved with the creation of a collective presidency.

title: News Summary and Index
description: American military units In the United States and in Europe were placed on alert yesterday after an apparent appeal by Jor dan to the United States for help. The White House emphasized that the President had not made any decision to intervene. From all indications in Washington, the American move seened designed as show of force to increase the pressure on Syria to end her intervention and as a warn ing to other militant Arab states contem plating intervention. [Page 1, Columns 58.1

title: CAMBODIAN CHIEF VISITS THE FRONT
description: SKOUN, Cambodia, Sept. 21  The Premier of Cambodia, Gen, Lon Nol, and his top mili tary leaders flew by helicopter today to visit the column of troops stalled for more than a week by enemy positions on the road to Kompong Thom, a pro vincial capital 85 miles north of Pnompenh.

title: MRS. FRANK J. MARTIN
description: NEPTUNE, N. J., Sept. 21Mrs. Alice M. Martin, a former analyst with the Investors Ad visory Service in Montclair and a retired executive of Walston & Co., member of the New York Stock Exchcange, died of cerebral thrombosis last eve ning in the Jersey Shore Medi cal Center Fitkin Hospital here. Mrs. Martin, who was 79 years old, was the wife of Frank J. Martin,

title: Comics Find Negro Heroes
description: For more than 40 years, American children have watched Tarzan alternately bamboozle and bedevil the black cannibals who cavort through the jungles on the comic pages of the nation's newspapers.

title: Jacobs's Play Bows Nov.10
description: The Evil That Men Do, a first play by Ed Jacobs, will be presented at the Bouwerie Lane Theater on Nov. 10 by the producing company of Mendo Productions. Loren Andrews will direct and Larry Reehling will design the scenery. The work describes the interrela tionships of five men and a girl that result in two murders. The action is set on Fire Island.

title: City's Record of Hiring Women Assailed by Mayor at Hearing
description: Mayor Lindsay disclosed yes terday the results of a survey that shows that women con stitute 26 per cent of all New York City government employes earning $10,000 a year or more.

title: Baker, Turner Sign With Jets
description: CLEVELAND, Sept. 21The Jets opened their season tonight with three unsigned but not unwilling players. Pete Lammons, Verlon Biggs and Jimmy Jones had not signed 1970 contracts. How ever, each exercised the op tion clause in last year's con tract so as to be able to play. None indicated he was about to play out his option and join another club as a free agent after May 1.

title: Hydrologist, $5.60, Victor in Stymie
Bus Hits Tree, 50 Hurt
description: HANOVER, Mass., Sept. 21 (UPI)About 50 persons were injured, six seriously, today when a commuter bus ran off Route 53 and hit a tree. The bus, operated by the Plymouth and Brockton Street Railway Company, was headed from Plymouth to Boston.

title: ROBERT FITZGIBBON
description: BEDFORD, N. Y., Sept. 21Robert E. FitzGibbon, a New York public relations executive, died at his home here today after a long illness. He was 65 years old and lived on Indian Hill Road.

title: 8 Brothers in Jersey Win $100,000 Lottery
description: Eight brothers from New Jersey, a couple from upstate New York, and a resident of Pennsylvania were winners of $100,000 prizes in the New York State lottery yes terday.

title: FREIGHTER SENDS SOS OFF IRELAND
description: The Coast Guard Search and Rescue Center here reported early today that a cargo ship identified only as Martha En deavour had sent an SOS off the western coast of Ireland and was taking on water.

title: Caution in Ocean Hill
description: Earlier this yearamid threats of harassment and disruption from the militant former leaders of the Ocean HillBrownsville demonstration school districtthe chairman of the new community board of District 18, Assemblyman Samuel D. Wright, promised an orderly school opening. This month he made good his pledge. Local confidence in his promise to give the district's children the best possible education sent the schools off to a peaceful start, without reliance on police.

title: Italy Had July Trade Deficit
description: ROME, Sept. 21 (Reuters)Italy's balance of payments in July was $6.3million in deficit, figures published by the Bank of Italy here showed today. This compared with a surplus of $43.3million in July of 1969. In the first seven months of 1970, Italy had a deficit of $581.9million, down from a deficit of $854.6million in the yearearlier period.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Signings. The President signed a bill authorizing the Secretary of Interior to re imburse the Ute Indian tribe for an irrigation project. He also signed a bill to clarify the promotion system for re serve officers of the Coast Guard.

title: A Japanese Youth, 15, Lectures Sato on Pollution
description: UTSUNOMIYA, Japan, Sept. 21  Premier Eisaku Sato pledged to a 15yearold high school boy today that he would not permit industrial growth at the cost of polluting the envi ronment and spoiling the lives of the people.

title: Hijacked U.S. Passenger Sues Swissair for $75,000
description: A 23 year old Brooklyn teacher who was hijacked to Jordan Sept. 6 sued Swissair for $75,000 damages yesterday under terms of a 1966 agree ment with the United States Government signed by more than 85 airlines.

title: The Screen: Quiet Days in Clichy
ROCKEFELLER FAILS TO CITE GOODELL
description: ROCHESTER. Sept. 21Gov ernor Rockefeller kicked off the 1970 Republican campaign up state tonight in a joint appear ance with Senator Charles E. Goodell and did not once men tion his running mate by name.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Congress Is Different in an Election Year
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 21Electionyear politics hangs like a pervasive smog over the capital this hot Septem ber. Breathing this special atmosphere, the members of Congress comport themselves in ways they did not in 1969 in order to be able to return in 1971.

title: Bronx Election Appeal Lost
description: ALBANY, Sept. 21The Sta?? Court of Appeals held today that there was no reason to conduct a new Democratic primary in the 78th Assembly District, in the Bronx. The ap peal to state's highest court was filed by Assemblyman Edward A. Stevenson, who finished sec ond in a threeway primary for the Democratic Assembly nomi nation. The winner of the pri mary was Louis Nine, who re ceived 715 votes, Mr. Stevenson 6.12, and Albert Brooks 502, but 263 balloting irregularities were found.

title: CHICAGO DEFENDANT QUITS TEACHING POST
description: EUGENE, Ore., Sept. 21John R. Froines, who was ac quitted at the Chicago Seven conspiracy trial, resigned today as an assistant professor of chemistry at the University of Oregon.

title: 2 Possible Actions in Jordan Seen for U.S. Troops
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 21Senior American military plan ners said tonight that United States forces were being alerted for either of two possible mili tary actions in Jordan.

title: Books of The Times
description: Reynolds Price is one of the few young American writers worth worrying about, and there's reason to be worried. Mr. Price began working too hardon his materials, his language and, especially, himselfin his third novel, Love and Work (1968). The strain is manifest in Permanent Errors, new volume of stories. Somehow, his ex cavations of memory, situation and event fail to yield the ore he's looking forguilt, I suppose, and forgivenessand so he ends up insisting instead of demonstrating, defining instead of proving. The writer as subject, and his craft as redemption, come to tyrannize, as though no other vessel could quite contain his consciousness; as though the world outside his skull (even the symbols he foists on it) were insuffi cient to suggest the pain inside. Finally, too often, he is reduced to telling the reader what he is trying to do, rather than doing it convincingly.

title: ExCORE Official Found Dead at Plane Wreckage
description: GEORGETOWN, S. C., Sept. 21A former New York direc tor of the Congress of Racial Equality and a woman com panion have been found dead beside the wreckage of a light plane five miles northwest of here.

title: Bronx G.I. Is Killed in War
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 21 (UPI) The Defense Department to day listed Specialist 4 Thomas P. Coffino of the Army, from The Bronx, as having been killed in the war in Indochina.

title: Israeli Says Balance Is Now Tipped Against Hussein in North
description: JERUSALEM, Sept. 21Isra el's leading military commenta tor said tonight that a Syrian armored force representing 200 to 300 tanks had entered Jor dan and tipped the balance against King Hussein's forces in the north.

title: Economist Urges Program to Battle Trade Challenge
description: A private economist told the 83d annual meeting of the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants here yes terday that the time had come for the United States to meet foreign competition with a co ordinated program of coopera tion among industry, manage ment and labor.

title: Bomb Threat Delays Flight
description: BALTIMORE, Sept. 21 (AP)  A bomb threat message prompted officials to order an Eastern Airlines 727 jet to land at Friendship International Air port today so that the plane could be searched. The New YorktoMiami flight was de layed an hour and was allowed to resume when a search un covered nothing.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: President Nixon spoke here at Kan sas State University on Sept. 16, sup posedly narrowing the gap between himself and American students. In fact, an experiment was carried out by the President. What he learned was that appeals to the recognized prejudices of a crowd will bring tremendous ap plause.

title: CITIES SERVICE ACTS TO CLEAN LINDEN AIR
description: TRENTON, Sept. 21 (AP)The last of nine companies cited by the state for polluting the air in Linden agreed today to begin installing devices that may clean up the stench along the New Jersey Turnpike.

title: Bond Interest Yields Drop; Builders Cheer Prime Cut
RANGER HOLDOUTS VETO ARBITRATION
A Monetarist's Glossary
description: COPENHAGEN. Sept. 21To the uninitiated, nothing is more esoteric than an annual meet ing of the International Mone tary Fund and the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development, such as the one now going on in this city of schnapps, fairy tales and por nography. Among the masses of paper gushing forth from the mimeograph ma chines here, there is, unfortunately, no glossary of terms. This is a considerable handicap not only for newspa per readers, leftwing demon strators, and wives and children of delegates, but even for quite a few delegates themselves.

title: NEW CHINESE ENVOY FLIES TO EAST BERLIN
description: BERLIN, Sept. 21  A new ambassador from Peking ar rived in East Berlin today, marking the formal resumption of full relations between Com munist China and East Ger many.

title: City Is Drafting Stricter Rules For Warranties on Used Cars
description: Simon Lazarus, general coun sel for the city's Consumer Affairs Department, said yes terday that the agency was drafting a regulation that would bring dealer warranties on secondhand automobiles under the city's Consumer Pro tection Act.

title: THREE GO ON TRIAL IN L.I.R. ASSAULT
description: Three Long Island Railroad policemen went on trial in Criminal Court here yesterday, charged with the thirddegree asault of a commuter who died a few hours after the aleged beating.

title: HICKEL SEES BREACH OF INDIANS RIGHTS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 21 (AP)  Secretary of the In terior Walter J. Hickel said to day that the Federal Govern ment often lost sight of its ob ligation to protect American Indians rights because it cov eted Indian lands and waters.

title: Electoral ReRuns
description: Botched electoral procedures and inordinate judicial delays have combined to produce several rerun primary elections today in the Bronx, Brooklyn and Queens. Some of these races concern only party leadership posts. Two, however, involve Democratic nominations for State Assemblyman and have an importance that transcends their district lines.

title: Amman Women Dodge Bullets In Search of Food in the Streets
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Sept. 21The army briefly lifted its order to shoot on sight today and the women of Amman went into the streets, dodging sniper fire, to find food.

title: Michael Reagan, Governor's Son, To Marry Miss Pamela Putnam
description: ATLANTA, Sept. 21Mi chael Reagan, son of Gov ernor Reagan of California, and Miss Pamela Putnam, daughter of Duane Putnam, line coach for the Atlanta Falcons football team, plan to be married.

title: Madison Ave. Becomes A Mall Once a Week
description: Madison Avenue, from 61st Street to 79th, will be con verted into a pedestrian mall tonight and livened with special events, including pavement painting and stroll ing singers, from 7 P.M. to 10 P.M.

title: Football Ratings
description: The top 20 teams with points figured on a 201816141210 987654321 basis for first through 15th places (firstplace votes in parentheses) and won lost??ied records:

title: RAILROADS AGAIN BID FOR A 15% RATE RISE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 21 (AP) Eastern and Western rail roads renewed their request today for a 15 per cent rise in freight rates as the Inter state Commerce Commission prepared to begin a nationwide investigation of railroad reve nues.

title: Melba Taylor, an Evaluator For Sesame Street, 30
description: Mrs. Charles Taylor, associ ate director of research and evaluation of the Children's Television Workshop, producer of Sesame Street, died yes terday in New York Hospital after a brief illness. She was 30 years old and lived at 252 West 85th Street.

title: U. S. OFFERS PLAN FOR EASING TRADE
description: GENEVA, Sept. 21  The United States announced today plans to assist the world's de veloping countries by expand ing earlier proposals to facili tate the entry of their prod ucts onto the American mar ket.

title: STOCKS RETREAT AS VOLUME DIPS
description: One of Wall Street's favorite rumors of recent weeksan impending cut in the prime rate by major New York banksbegan to crystallize yesterday. As a result, the stock market turned downward as investors and traders followed the maxim of selling on the news.

title: MALAYSIA SHIFTS RULERS QUIETLY
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia, Sept. 21Abdul Halim Muaz zam, the Sultan of Kedah, be came Paramount Ruler of Ma laysia today amid the boom of cannon and ruffles and flour ishes, but with public interest limited largely to school chil dren waving paper flags issued to them.

title: Hogan on E.C.A.C. Team
description: John Hogan was named today to head the Division I college football team selected by the Eastern Collegiate Ath letic Conference. Hogan, who was also named sophomore of the week, completed 29 of 47 passes for 299 yards in Pitts burgh's 2415 loss to the Uni versity of California, Los An geles on Saturday.

title: CONTRACT LOWS HIT BY PLATINUM
description: Platinum futures dropped again yesterday to new lows for the life of the contract.

title: Ailey Dance Theater Leaves for Soviet Tour
description: The Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater left for Mos cow yesterday to begin a sixweek tour of the Soviet Union under the auspices of the Cultural Exchange agree ment between the United States and the Soviet Union.

title: Prisoners'
description: LEAVENWORTH, Kan., Sept. 21 (AP)The ninth an nual art show and sale at the Federal penitentiary here brought in $21,600, about $3,000 more than last year's event.

title: AUSSIE PRESS HITS AT CUP DECISION
DAVE DANFORTH, PITCHER, WAS 80
description: BALTIMORE, Sept. 21 (AP)Dave Danforth, a former Amer ican League pitcher credited with originating the controver sial shine ball, died Saturday at the age of 80.

title: Wide  Tax Cheating Is Laid To Medical Plan Doctors
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 21More than one doctor out of every three who has received substantial income from treat ing patients under the Medicare and Medicaid programs appears to he cheating on his income tax, a Treasury official told Congress today.

title: Ribicoff Tours New York Slums
description: Senator Abraham A. Ribi coff toured a slum area in the Brownsville section of Brooklyn yesterday and immedi ately labeled it a national disaster.

title: CHARLES T. CAROW, PRIEST ON L.I., 62
description: The Rev. Charles T. Carew, who led a successful sixyear fight in the 1940's to free bowling from racial discrimina tion, died of a heart attack Sunday in the rectory of his church, SS. Phillips and James in St. James, L. I. He was 62 years old.

title: Johnson Wax Elects
description: Johnson Wax has announced the election of Howard M. Packard as vice chairman, a new position at the company.

title: Margaret A. Preston Is Betrothed
description: LAKE FOREST, Ill., Sept. 21Mr. and Mrs. Charles Drury Preston have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Margaret At water Preston, to Mark Bis bee McCormick, son of Mr. and Mrs. Brooks McCormick of Chicago.

title: U.S. PLACES MORE UNITS ON ALERT AS HUSSEIN'S SOLDIERS FALL BACK; GUERRILLAS SEIZE CITIES IN NORTH
Protested Cup Race Is Given to Intrepid
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Sept. 21The New York Yacht Club Race Committee, in a historic decision today, took away Australia's stunning America's Cup victory yes terday and gave it to In trepid, the United States de fender.

title: Stella D'oro Will Make Chinese Almond Cookies
description: Stella D'oro, maker of Italian cookies, is diversify ing into Chinese almond cookies. And in an effort to outdo the original it will top each and every cookie with several almond slices instead of the traditional one. Darn clever, those Italians.

title: Soviet Asserts U.S. Is Charging Imaginary Mideast Violations
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 21The So viet Union accused the Nixon Administration today of using imaginary Egyptian violations of the MiddleEast ceasefire to conceal Israel's unwilling ness to accept a peaceful solu tion.

title: DIXIE GOVERNORS SHUN BUSING ISSUE
description: BILOXI, Miss., Sept. 21The moderate governors tried to avoid a fight over school de segregation at the Southern Governors Conference today by keeping the focus of the meeting on the mutual prob lems of the future instead of the rancorous divisions of the past.

title: Kipnis Laces Mime With Full Measure Of Social Comment
description: Except for its most original manifestationin silent films mime has never been thought of as an American art form. It is a comment upon the inade quacy of words as felt by the young today that they have been responsible for the resur gence of interest in mime in this country. In almost all cases, the popular mime troupes are linked to social activism, down to those, in socalled guerrilla theater, who make no claim upon art.

title: A Correction
description: In an article about the wedding of Miss Janice M. Briddell to Henry C. Bayer in Sunday's New York Times, the bridegroom's father, Mer win Bayer, was incorrectly identified as president and chief executive officer of the Arnold Corporation. It should have read Arnold Constable Corporation.

title: Heavy Air at Newport: Bitterness and an Embarrassed Regret
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Sept. 21 It happens all the time at race tracks  a foul is claimed by one jockey against another, the inquiry sign lights up on the tote board and the stewards study the films of the race.

title: West German Held for Extortion In Threat to Bomb Alaska Plane
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Sept. 21 (AP)A citizen of West Ger many was arrested here yes terday and charged in connec tion with a bomb threat extor tion of $25,000 from Western Airlines in Anchorage, Alaska, the Federal Bureau of Investi gation said.

title: Upsala Coach to Depend Again On Players Doing Double Duty
description: EAST ORANGE, N. J., Sept. 20 Upsala College is not a power in football. The Vikings' coach, John Hooper, has to juggle as if he were a circus, performer flipping hot irons in the air 22 at a time.

title: Lawyers Groups Fighting Proposed Plan to Decentralize Legal Aid to Poor
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 21Representatives of leading law yers organizations have started a fight against a proposed re gionalization of the Federal program of legal services for the poor.

title: Ballet: Nureyev's The Sleeping Beauty Caps Festival in Milan
description: MILAN, ItalyThe big at traction of the ballet festival at La Scala is clearly Rudolf Nureyev's staging of The Sleeping Beauty, a produc tion that shows the La Scala company in a better light than any of the other programs. Yet a fairly wide repertory was given, offering a fair insight into the com pany's standards.

title: Witness at Manson's Trial Links Weapon to Ranch
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 21A firearms expert testified today that he found on the Spahn Ranch north of Los Angeles 15 shell casings that had been ejected from the.22caliber re volver used in the five killings at the home of Sharon Tate in August of 1969.

title: Company Security Systems Are Shown
description: The manufacturers of the goods and services that com panies use to protect their premises and personnel put them on display at the New York Hilton Hotel yesterday before an interested audi ence.

title: A. T. Lubrano to Wed Joan Albertson
description: Miss Joan Albertson, a senior at Albany State Uni versity, and Alfonso T. Lu brano, a senior at Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute, have become engaged.

title: RIGHTS UNIT JOINS SYRACUSE DISPUTE
United States and Asia: II
description: Contrary to every shortrun political and personal interest, three successive American Presidents decided over the past decade that the events set in mo tion by a prompt withdrawal of our forces and commitment from Vietnam and the Asian mainland would risk larger war there and create dangerous instability elsewhere.

title: Cookies With Mushrooms and Carrots
2 PRIMARY RERUNS IN BROOKLYN TODAY
description: Two Democratic primary con tests will be rerun today in Brooklyn's 44th and 51st As sembly Districts. The special elections were ordered by the State Supreme Court because of irregularities during the June 23 primary.

title: High Stakes in Jordan
description: President Nixon's preparations for possible military intervention in the Middle East underscores the gravity of the international crisis created by Syria's armed in trusion into Jordan's internal conflict. In view of the wider explosion that could be touched off by continued deterioration of the situation in Jordan, the President has no alternative but to prepare for the worst in an area where American lives and other important Ameri can interests are at stake.

title: Angry at 2 Holdouts, Patriot Coach Cuts Them From Roster
description: The conflict between man agement and players over pro football's riches exploded in Boston when Clive Rush, the rash Patriots coach, suspend ed two defensive backfield regulars, John Charles and Larry Carwell, minutes be fore Sunday's game after they refused new contract offers. Taks off your uni form You're not playing to day, said Rush. Art McMahon and Clarence Scott played instead and the Patriots upset the Miami Dol phins and Bob Griese. The Dolphins quarterback said, It probably was the worst game I've ever played.

title: Westchester Scout Leader Indicted on Morals Charges
description: WHITE PLAINS, Sept. 21 (AP)  Sheldon Selikoff, 44 years old, a Boy Scout leader, was indicted today by a West chester County grand jury on eight counts of morals viola tions stemming from operation of what the police called clearing house for pornog raphy.

title: NASA Chief Praises Soviet Moon Flight as a Major Achievement
description: WASHINGTON. Sept. 21 The acting bead of the United States space program congratu lated the Soviet Union today for obtaining a sample of lunar matter from a part of the moon not yet explored by man.

title: ASHE IS EXTENDED IN BEATING SEGURA
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 21 (UPI) Arthur Ashe had to go all out today to beat 49yearold Pan cho Segura, 76, 64. in a first round match at the $50.000 Pacific Southwest open tennis championships today.

title: Rates for Treasury Bills Drop at Weekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 21 Treasury bill rates declined at today's auction from last week's levels, the Govern ment reported late this after noon.

title: Bomb Blast in Bronx House Heavily Damages Apartment
description: A small bomb exploded next to the door of an apartment in a sixstory house in the Bronx one block from the Fordham University campus last night, the police said. No one was in jured.

title: 263,500 Workers in City Called Eligible for Welfare
The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Six Policemen Plead Guilty To Misconduct in Sex Case
description: FREEHOLD, N. J., Sept. 21 (UPI)  Six of seven Long Branch, N. J., policemen charge with conducting an orgy with the teenage daughter of an area minister pleaded guilty to reduced charges today. The seventh man is still standing trial.

title: Crowd Beats a Policeman During Arrest in Harlem
description: A patrolman was severely beaten by a Harlem crowd yes terday as he arrested a teen ager who, the police said, had a hypodermic needle in his arm.

title: Leslie Worthington Weds Miss Hubbard
description: Leslie B. Worthington of Pittsburgh, retired president of the United States Steel Corporation, and Miss J. Ber nice Hubbard, his former sec retary, were married Friday in Winchester, Va.

title: New I.C.I. Unit Formed
description: Imperial Chemical Industries, Ltd., announced yesterday that it had formed a wholly owned subsidiary, I.C.I. North Amer ica, Ltd., to provide overall supervision and coordination of the interests of the I.C.I. group in the United States and Can ada. The new company, with headquarters in New York City, will be headed by W. B. Dun can, chairman of I.C.I. America, Inc.

title: U.S. Aides Assert Vietcong Rule Population of 184,700
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 21 (AP)The revised hamlet evaluation system used by United States officials to meas ure pacification in South Viet nam indicated today that as of Aug. 31, 92.8 per cent of the country's population was under government control, and only 184,700 people were under Viet cong control.

title: Malamood, Pleasing Pinkerton, Makes Debut With City Opera
description: Herman Malamood, who made his United States operatic debut on Sunday night in the New York City Opera's third Madama Butterfly of the sea son, came to the stage by a welltraveled path. Like Jan Peerce, Richard Tucker and a number of other tenors, Mr. Malamood is a product of the cantorial tradition (New York City born, he officiates at a Catskills resort hotel during the high holidays).

title: JUICE PRICE IS CUT BY WINTER GARDEN
description: The Winter Garden Citrus Products Cooperative, one of the largest suppliers of pri vate label frozen orange juice concentrate to supermarket chains, announced yesterday it would follow price cuts initi ated by other producers.

title: Ottinger Believes Buckley Could Win
description: Representative Richard L. Ottinger said yesterday that massive Republican defec! tions from Senator Charles Goodell gave James L. Buckley! a respectable crack at win1 ning the threeway United States Senate race.

title: JOHN H. BOLAND
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., Sept. 21John H. Boland, a retired accountant for the Mobil Oil Corporation, died yesterday in New Rochelle Hospital. He was 64 years old and lived at 1299 Palmer Avenue.

title: JUNE VOTE DISCLOSED BY OPEN MARKET UNIT
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 21 (Reuters)The Federal Reserve Board's Open Market Commit tee unanimously voted to main tain a moderate growth in money and bank credit at its June 23 meeting, it was dis closed today.

title: PETERSON NOTCHES HIS 18TH TRIUMPH
description: Added ammunition for New York Yankee fans who are awaiting the opportunity to harass Met fans over the win ter was provided last night by Fritz Peterson as he pitched a 52 victory over the Washing ton Senators at Yankee Sta dium.

title: TARGET DATE SEPT. 30 IN GUILDPOST TALKS
description: Negotiations between The New York Post and the New York Newspaper Guild con tinued yesterday with a target date of Sept. 30 for achieve ment of a new contract.

title: AMEX PRICES SLIP AS VOLUME LAGS
description: The American Stock Ex change turned in its first loss in four sessions yesterday as the list declined in slower trading.

title: Investigator of the Mafia Is Kidnapped on Sicily
description: ROME, Sept. 21A spate of kidnappings in Sicily and Sar dinia is confronting the Italian police with an old dilemmahow to hunt gangsters without endangering their hostages.

title: Senate Panel to Open Hearings on Health Insurance
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 21The first Congressional hearings in 20 years on national health in surance, a plan to cover the medical needs and costs of all Americans, open Wednesday amid uncertainty as to the Ad ministration's stand.

title: 4 Wounded in East Village In Argument on Garbage
description: Four persons were seriously wounded in the East Village section last night by shotgun blasts in what the police said had begun as an argument over garbage disposal.

title: Malaria Up Sharply in Nation; Most Cases Traced to Vietnam
description: Malaria cases diagnosed in this country increased by al most 50 per cent last year over the figure for 1968; and pre liminary data for 1970 show further sharp rise, the Center for Disease Control has re ported.

title: Tough NixonBacked Crime Bill Cleared by House Subcommittee
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 21 (AP) A stringent anticrime bill backed by President Nixon to curb organized crime and bombings was approved today by a House Judiciary subcom mittee.

title: SHORT INTEREST DROPS SHARPLY
JOSEPH W. RAO
description: MOUNT KISCO, N. Y., Sept. 2IJoseph W. Rao, founder and president of the Rao Elec trical Equipment Company of New York, died at St. Agnes Hospital in White Plains yester day. He had been stricken earlier with a heart attack while playing golf at the West chester Country Club.

title: Bronx Landlords to Get A Hearing on Rent Cuts
description: Organized landlords yesterday obtained a State Supreme Court hearing, which will be held this morning, in an effort to stop the city administration from taking over services in buildings affected by the week old Bronx apartment strike.

title: 3 COUNTIES OPPOSE RUNWAY EXTENSIONS
description: The heads of the three coun tiesNassau, Queens and Kingsadjacent to Kennedy International Airport came out yesterday in opposition to pro posals to increase the airport's capacity by extending runways into Jamaica Bay.

title: SANTOS TO OPPOSE WEST HAM TONIGHT
description: Soccer's greatest scorer, Pele, meets up with the game's finest defensive player, Bobby Moore, when their clubs meet tonight at Randalls Island at 8 o'clock.

title: Bridge:
description: Ira and Linda Ewen of Flushing, Queens, and Robert and Sara Lee Bowers of Kings Park, L. I., were the winners of the knockout team championship Sunday night in the Long Island regional tournament at Roosevelt Raceway, Westbury, L. I.

title: The Meat Market
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 21  It will be obvious to all who have witnessed the marketing of politicians on tele vision recently that the Constitution of the United States must be amended Quickly. At present, and even a South ern lawyer would have to agree on this, a product must be human in order to qualify for Congress or the Presidency. (Even the VicePresidency is not exempt from the qualification.)

title: Arab Leaders Will Convene in Cairo Today to Discuss the Fighting in Jordan
description: CAIRO, Sept. 21Arab lead ers will convene in an emer gency meeting in Cairo tomor row morning to seek a solu tion to the deteriorating situ ation in Jordan, the United Arab Republic announced to day.

title: Palme to Press Policies Despite Setback
description: STOCKHOLM, Sept. 21De spite a shift to the center in yesterday's general election, Olof Palme, Sweden's Social Democratic Premier, was ex pected today to press forward with his program of spreading more social benefits to the poor and increasing the role of the state in private industry.

title: DOLLARS ABROAD CAUSE A PROBLEM
description: COPENHAGEN, Sept. 21The managing director of the International Monetary Fund told the world's finance minis ters today that from now on the United States should settle a good part of its balanceof payments deficits by paying out gold and other monetary reserves rather than by having other countries pile up dollars.

title: 3 State G.O.P. Candidates Offer Antipollution Plans
description: Three of the state's major Republican officeholdersGov ernor Rockefeller, Senator Charles E. Goodell and Attor ney General Louis I Lefko witzturned their attention to environmental problems yester day as they continued their election camnaiens.

title: Advertising: Burnett Leads in Dairy Race
description: In Chicago, advertisings second city, there is a lot of breathholding going on right now over where the Ameri can Dairy Association is go ing to deposit its advertising account. There are a lot of billings involved and there is tremendous growth poten tial.

title: GIANT ARE ANGRY ABOUT BEARS'
description: Only one game into a new season, the Giants are already talking of getting themselves together again, as a result of Saturday's 2416 loss to Chi cago.

title: N.A.A.C.P. Syllabus Focuses On Minorities Role in History
description: A new syllabus for teaching American history in secondary schools that emphasizes the role of such minorities as Ne groes, Puerto Ricans, Indians and Mexican Americans was published yesterday under the auspices of the National Asso ciation for the Advancement of Colored People.

title: Some El Al Strikers Return; Normal Schedules Expected
description: TEL AVIV, Sept. 21 (AP)More than half the striking Israeli El Al Airlines ground employes returned to work to day and officials expected flight schedules to return to normal.

title: Murray Bernays, Lawyer, Dead; Set Nuremberg Trials Format
description: Murray C. Bernays, a New York lawyer who planned the prosecution of Nazi war crim inals after World War II, died Saturday in Harkness Pavilion of ColumbiaPresbyterian Hos pital, after a long illness. He was 75 years old.

title: SCHOOLS UNREST LAID TO OFFICIALS
description: A study of the attitudes of almost 7,000 students suggests that most of the tensions and conflicts in junior and senior high schools arise from the governance of the institutions.

title: Stolen Art Found in London
description: LONDON, Sept. 21 (AP)Scotland Yard, directed by an anonymous telephone call, re covered stolen paintings today valued at $86,400. They had been taken from Mayfair art galleries and left in a telephone booth.

title: Arms for the Greek Colonels
description: Ambivalence and timidity have marked American pol icy toward Greece's military rulers since their seizure of power in April 1967. The decision to resume fullscale arms shipments to the Athens regime symbolizes the bankruptcy of that policy.

title: Federal Rule of Car Insurance Is Attacked by Head of Allstate
description: MIAMI BEACH, Sept. 21In one of the strongest public attacks ever made by an in surance company executive against Federal regulation, Jud son B. Branch, chairman of the Allstate Insurance Company, assailed the Government today for seeking to move into the automobile insurance business.

title: LUNA 16 PICKS UP ROCKS FROM MOON, HEADS FOR EARTH
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 21The So viet Union's Luna 16 started back today on the first return voyage to the earth by an un manned spacecraft from the lunar surface, after scooping up samples of rock.

title: Mortgage Interest Rate Sets Mark
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 21 (UPI)The mortgage interest rate for the purchase of new homes rose to a record aver age of 8.51 per cent in Au gust, the Federal Home Loan Bank Board reported today. The July average was 8.49 per cent.

title: Cheryl Simons Plans Nuptials
description: BIRMINGHAM, Mich., Sept. 21The engagement of Miss Cheryl Ann Simons to Thom as Joseph McGee Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. McGee of Chest nut Hill, Philadelphia, has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Walter J. Simons of Birmingham and North Haven, L. I., parents of the future bride.

title: Nader Demands Notice by Ford Of a Defect in 4 Million Cars
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 21Ralph Nader asked the Trans portation Department today to require the Ford Motor Com pany to notify owners of what he said was a safety defect in more than 4 million cars.

title: Hearing on Atom Power Plant On L.I. Called Major Test Case
description: ROCKY POINT, L. I., Sept. 21 The Atomic Energy Commis sion opened a hearing today in this small Long Island village that could affect all future nuclear plants in the country.

title: At Show's End, He Married the Model
description: As a fashion show, yester day afternoon's event wasn't particularly unusual. A beau tiful setting on the terrace of a Tudor City penthouse. Taped ballet music. Models flitting like butterflies to show the fluidity of Jon Haggin's newest resort and spring designs. And, at the end, a beautiful bride in all her starryeyed glory.

title: Chamber Associates to Meet
description: Chamber Music Associates will hold its first meeting of the season tomorrow at 8 P.M. at the 92d Street Y.M.Y.W.H.A. The 19yearold organization gives amateur musicians the opportunity to play chamber music, with professional coach ing. Joseph Wolman is the mu sic director.

title: Above Thy Darkling Plain
description: Some years ago Robert Warshaw wrote that so much of official American culture has been cheaply optimistic that we are likely almost by reflex to take pessimism as measure of seriousness. We in this context meant for the most part New York cultural elite primarily in volved with literature, but not less caught up in the politics of the age, especially as these involved the inter pretation of texts.

title: To the State, It's a Historic Trust,. to 2 Young Boys, It's Home
description: KATONAH, N.Y. Lino and Lucian couldn't care less about the ghosts that some people say have been rattling around for years in the John Jay Home stead here.

title: MRS. DOUGLAS SLOANE
description: RINDGE, N. H., Sept. 21Mrs. Sibyl Sanderson Sloane, wife of Dr. Douglas Sloane, died here today.

title: 9 Charges of News Distortion Put to WPIX President in 1968
description: Fred M. Thrower, president of WPIX, testified yesterday that Nancy McCarthy, a former WPIX news writer, had re ported to him at least nine in stances of what she considered news misrepresentation by the station in the latter part of 1968.

title: New Train Times Confuse Commuters
description: Confusion reigned at Grand Central Terminal during the evening rush hour yesterday as new zone and timetable schedules went into effect on the New Haven division of the Penn Central.

title: Court Ends Picketing Ban On Union's Pier Protests
description: A court order barring the International Longshoremen's Association from picketing six Manhattan piers was rescinded yesterday. The union opposes the city's plans to utilize the piers for cultural and recrea tional activities.

title: Avnet Profit Drops on Record Sales
description: Avnet, Inc., engaged in elec trical, electronic and automo tive products, had a sharp earnings decline for the fiscal year ended June 30 on record Sales, the annual report dis closed yesterday.

title: Pamela Tenney Engaged to Wed Keith Simpson
description: LOCUST VALLEY, L. I., Sept. 21Mr. and Mrs. Daniel G. Tenney Jr. of Locust Val ley and Paul Smiths, N. Y., have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Pamela M. Tenney, to Keith E. Simpson, son of Mr. and Mrs. J. Leonard Simpson of Richmond, England.

title: Early Corn Crop Revision Promised by Government
description: WASHINGTON, Sept 21 (AP) Secretary of Agriculture Clif ford M. Hardin announced today that the Government would issue on Oct 2 a specially re vised estimate of 1970 corn production.

title: Puerto Rican Agency Seeks End Of Exploitation by Employers
description: We have about 1,000 people a week coming into our office looking for jobs and help. They're serious people, they want work not welfare, Manuel A. Casiano Jr., national executive director of the Puerto Rican Labor Department's mi gration division said yester day.

title: 3Month Treasury Bills Show Sharp Decline
description: Interest rates throughout the money and capital markets declined yesterday in the wake of the Morgan Guaranty Trust Company's decision to cut its minimum lending rate.

title: Jascha Heifetz Plays and Conducts for French TV
description: PARIS, Sept. 20A single figure under the white glare of three batteries of spot lights on the naked stage slowly raises a violin to be gin an impeccable perform ance of Bach chaconne. Jascha Heifetz plays for tele vision.

title: Bache &
description: Bache & Co., Inc., the na tion's secondlargest brokerage house, indicated yesterday that it had stemmed a tide of heavy internal losses. At the same time, it called for speedy pas sage of legislation to protect customers of financially troubled securities firms.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: CASS LAKE, Minn.  A northwest wind buffeted our cottage at Birch Villa shortly after midnight, and in the morning it was still blowing strong out of the same quar ter.

title: U.S. Chess Team Loses to Russians, Drops to 3d Place
description: SIEGEN. Germany. Sept. 21 The United States team dropped to third place after losing to the Soviet team by the score of 21/ to 1 in the sixth round of the 19th chess Olym piad.

title: MRS. J. LOUIS LEMPERT
description: RUTHERFORD, N. J., Sept. 21Mrs. J. Louis Lempert, the last surviving daughter of Archibald McLees, a reporter for The New York Times in the 1850's, died at her home here today. She was 85 years old and lived at 25 West Gouver neur Avenue.

title: The Initiative That Went Wrong
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 21 The re markable Mrs. Meir has now departed and much of the strain in Israeli American relations seems to have been eased. But that does not mean that the substantive damage of the summer has been rectified or that the dangers it brought have been removed. Instead, the American initiative that opened the period in June has been reduced to a tenuous ceasefire across the Suez Canal, and the situation in general appears more threatening than ever.

title: CITY BARS CHANGE IN CORONA SCHOOL
description: The city is standing by controversial decision that the site for a new high school in Queens should remain at Lewis Avenue and 100th Street in Coronaa site that will re quire the demolition of 69 homes and the eviction of 135 families.

title: Two New Diphtheria Cases
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Sept. 21 (AP)Diphtheria cases reached a total of 101 today in the worst epidemic of Ihe danger ous throat disease here since 1935. Two new cases were con firmed. There were also 28 un, confirmed cases. In 1935, 127, persons contracted the disease, and 23 died.

title: Damage Halts Speed Runs By NaturalGasFueled Car
description: BONNEVILLE SALT FLATS, Utah, Sept. 21 (UPI)  Speed runs of the Blue Flame rocket car were stopped today because of damaged injector nozzles and repairs were expected to take another day.

title: Indiana Teacher Strike Ends
description: HAMMOND, Ind., Sept. 21 (UPI)A strike by hundreds of Hammond teachers against the city's school system ended to day. Members of the Hammond Teachers Association agreed to return to work after Superin tendent of Schools Robert L. Medcalf said that $700,750 would be added to the teachers' salary schedule index.

title: American Forest Products And Bendix Clear Merger
description: Shareholders of the American Forest Products Corporation and the Bendix Corporation ap proved at separate meetings yesterday the merger of Ameri can Forest Products into subsidiary of Bendix.

title: 5 Nobel Peace Laureates Call for End of Arms Race
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Sept. 21Five recipients of the Nobel Peace Prize, in a joint declaration, called on the Soviet Union and the United States to day to halt and reverse the nuclear arms race.

title: BATTLES CO ON IN JORDAN, ARMY CLAIMS SOME GAINS; U.S. STRESSING DIPLOMACY
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Sept. 22Amman underwent its sixth day of fighting today as both sides ignored the new ceasefire pro claimed by King Hussein in the Jordanian civil war.

title: Uruguay Still Won't Ransom Hostages
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 22  The Uruguayan Govern ment today reiterated its re fusal to offer ransom of any kind to Marxist guerrillas hold ing a United States soil expert and a Brazilian diplomat as hostages.

title: REST OF BIG BANKS FOLLOW RATE CUT
description: The cost of money dropped across a broad front yester day.

title: CITY ROLE UPHELD IN BUILDING STRIKE
description: Supreme Court Justice Thomas C. Chimera refused yesterday to grant an organized landlords petition for a tem porary stay to stop the city from taking over services in struck Bronx apartment build ings.

title: To Anouilh, Completed Play Is Only a Beginning
description: PARIS, Sept. 22I write plays as a chairmaker makes chairs. Chairs are made to be sat on and plays are made to be played to give actors work and the public entertainment, said Jean Anouilh. But aside from practical purposes a play, like a chair, may be designed with artistry. Styles in plays change as they do in furni ture, but one thing in the theater never changes: The avantgarde. It is just where it was in 1896 when Jarry wrote UbuRoi.

title: Russians Hail Their Latest Space Feat as Luna 16 Continues on Earthbound Course With Moon Rocks
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 22The un nanned Luna 16 spacecraft, carrying a cargo of moon rock, continued on its return voyage toward earth today as the So viet Union exulted over its most significant space accomplish ment in several years.

title: 2 Moderates in Georgia Runoff Today
description: ATLANTA, Sept. 22Geor gians go to the polls tomorrow to settle a runoff campaign for the Democratic gubernatorial nomination.

title: DR. MEAD BACKS WOMEN'S RIGHTS
description: Dr. Margaret Mead, the an thropologist, yesterday called for changes in society's atti tude toward the role of women.

title: Cambodian Troops Try to Flank Village
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Sept. 22 (Reuters)Cambodian troops pushed slowly through flooded rice paddies and heavy under growth today in an attempt to surround some 3,500 Commu nist troops blocking the route to the strategic provincial capi tal of Kompong Thom, accord ing to military spokesmen here.

title: Eakins Exhibition: A Belated Tribute
description: A Thomas Eakins exhibi tion opened yesterday at the Whitney Museum of Ameri can Art. It could be faulted here and there, no doubt, if you tried, but the thing to do is to applaud, to cheer and to get there before it closes on Nov. 22.

title: PAN OCEAN MOVES TOWARD MERGER
description: The Pan Ocean Oil Corpora tion announced it had agreed in principle to merge with Unit ed Bata Resources, Ltd., of Cal gary, Alberta, through an ex change of stock. At current market prices the transaction would be worth approxi mately $54mil lion. Both com panies are en gaged in oil and gas explora tion and production.

title: NEWS MISLABELED, WPIX CHIEF SAYS
description: Fred M. Thrower, president of WPIX, conceded yesterday that he was aware of instances in which his station had mis labeled news reports in the lat ter part of 1968.

title: Books of The Times
description: Ultimately, this is a sad book. Sad. be cause the figure emerging from its pages is a man of honor, courage and intelligence; and yet a victim. And not only a victim of the press he loatheswho wouldn't loathe the vampires who broke into a Tren ton morgue and ripped off the coffin lid to photograph the murdered Lindbergh. baby?but a vic tim as well of the century he has failed to under stand. In these pri vate diaries of the years 193S1945 there are passages of surpassing poi gnancy on nature, on flying, on rais ing children; and passages of narra tive power on ex ecutive infighting at the Ford Motor Company during the wag men in combat in the South Pacific. Ther is metrial of scholarly importance about the America First movement. And there is every evi dence of a lively conscience, however se lectiveFranklin Roosevelt in this account comes out looking considerably worse than Adolf Hitler.

title: East GermanCuban Pact
description: MIAMI, Sept. 22 (AP)East Germany and Cuba have signed a new agreement for economic and scientific cooperation, the Havana radio said today. The pact was signed in Havana, said the broadcast, monitored in Miami.

title: Bridge:
description: The European champion ship to be contested in Esto ril, Portugal, next month will be a particularly interesting event for two reasons: For the first time in a decade Italy must win the European title to qualify for the Ber muda Bowl world champion ship event; and Pierre Jais and Roger Trzel of France, one of the world's greatest partnerships, will reappear after a lengthy absence from the international scene.

title: Credit Unions Deny Pledge To Aid Strikers at G.M.
description: DETROIT, Sept. 22 (UPI)The Michigan Credit Union ]League and the Council of Gen eral victors Credit Unions] ;denied yesterday a published report that Flint credit unions had pledged $500 in financial support to 56,000 striking G.M. workers in Flint.

title: Panther Lawyers Request Douglas for Stay of Trial
description: A renewed attempt to obtain a United States Supreme Court order staying their trial has been filed by lawyers for 13 Black Panthers accused of plot ting to bomb public places.

title: Arab Chiefs Put Off Talks, Send 4 Envoys to Jordan
description: CAIRO, Sept. 22Arab lead ers put off today the emergency conference on Jordan that they had scheduled and sent a four man delegation to Amman to confer with King Hussein and Yasir Arafat, the Palestinian guerrilla leader.

title: Intrepid Beats Gretel II by 1 Minute 18 Seconds for 30 Cup Lead
description: NEWPORT, R.I. Sept. 22Intrepid showed the cynics she could fight her own battles by outslugging Gretel II of Aus tralia today in an 18knot sou'wester.

title: Nixon ObscenityUnit Man Sues to Block Calcutta!
description: CINCINNATI, Sept. 22 (UPI) Charles H. Keating Jr., Presi dent Nixon's only appointee to the Presidential Commission on Pornography, filed suit yester day to block the closedcircuit televised showing of the musi cal Oh! Calcutta! at the Shu bert Theater here.

title: Berkeley Hills Fire Destroys 40 Homes
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Sept. 22A winddriven fire, believed to have been set by arsonists, roared out of the Berkeley hills today, destroyed about 40 woodland houses, left hundreds homeless and forced the evac uation of a wide area, includ ing four schools.

title: SONGS FROM WEST HEARD IN CONCERT
description: Two states that have not been prominent in the annals of American song, Utah and Idaho, got a smidgen of atten tion thrown their way Monday night at the Washington Square Church, 135 West Fourth Street.

title: Battle Replays Decision On Punt That Sank Jets
description: Sitting sadly in the rear of the chartered airliner. Mike Battle wasn't accepting sym pathy.

title: Tough New CleanAir Bill Passed by Senate, 73 to 0
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 22 The Senate, by a vote of 73 to 0, approved tonight a clean air bill far broader in its reach, and far tougher in its dead lines and penalties, than any of its three predecessors.

title: MONDAY NIGHT FIGHT
description: San Francisco Cesar DeSiga, 120 pounds, Mexico. knocked out Billy Brown, 122, Philip pines, 4 rounds.

title: Sandor Concert to Commemorate Bartok's Death
description: Twentyfive years ago, Gy orgy Sandor stood in front of the house at 309 West 57th Street and watched as medi cal attendants lifted a slight, whitehaired man into an am bulance that was to take him to a hospital. Bela Bartk, ill with leukemia, was leaving for the last time the two room apartment that had been his American home. A few days later, on Sept. 26, 1945, he died at the age of 64.

title: Cigar Maker Seeking New Agency to Handle Muriel
description: Muriel is moving on Oct. 15. Because of the recent as signment of a new cigar product to Lennen & Newell by Lorillard, Consolidated Cigar has decided to move its Muriel brand to a new agency. It bills about $2.5 million.

title: Mills Says Administration Will Seek Delay in Tax Cut
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 22 Wilbur D. Mills the chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee, predicted today that the Administration would ask for postponement of some of the income tax reductions scheduled to go into effect in 1972 under legislation passed last year.

title: REPUBLIC CORP. CITES PROFIT DIP
NASKRA, LOUD TOP STAKE FIELD TODAY
description: I won with the colt in the Everglades early this season and finished second with him in the Fountain of Youth, said Johnny Rotz at Belmont Park yesterday. Who knows? May be I can win with him again.

title: Hearing on L.I. Atom Plant to Admit Ecological Data
description: ROCKY POINT, L. I., Sept. 22 An Atomic Energy Commis sion hearing board opened the door a little wider here today to allowing environmental dan gers to be considered in licens ing the controversial Shoreham nuclear power plant.

title: AURELIO CALLED ABSURD BY BEAME
description: Controller Abraham D. Beame accused Deputy Mayor Richard R. Aurelio yesterday of nonsensical and patently absurd statements in the con troversy over the city's con tracts with consultants.

title: British Confer on Hostages
description: LONDON, Sept. 22The Brit ish Cabinet discussed in a two hour meeting at 10 Downing Street today the fate of the airline hostages being held in Jordan.

title: PRESIDENT SEEKS U.S. INTERVENTION IN CAMPUS TERROR
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 22President Nixon asked Con gress today to authorize prompt Federal intervention in cases of bombing or arson on university or college campuses.

title: Vote on SST Funds Put Off
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 22The Senate's vote on the $290 million appropriation to con tinue development of the su personic transport, which had been scheduled for Thursday, has been postponed. But sources close to the Senate's Democratic leadership said they still expected the SST to be voted on before the November election.

title: E.E.C.SET TO TEST NEW PARITY BAND
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, Sept. 22Leading European countries expressed differing views today on the issue of more flexibility in exchange rates among currencies but moved closer to an actual ex periment in narrowing the fluc tuations within Europe itself.

title: Ky Is in Tokyo en Route to Paris and U.S. Rally
description: TOKYO, Sept. 22 (Reuters) Vice President Nguyen Cao Ky of South Vietnam arrived here from Saigon today en route to Paris and Washington.

title: Trust Attacks on Exchanges Hit
description: Ralph S. Saul, president of the American Stock Exchange, cautioned yesterday that strict application of antitrust con cepts to the securities markets might he adverse to the inter ests of small investors.

title: YANKEES WIN, 21, FOR FIFTH IN ROW
description: A splendid running catch in right center by Bobby Mitchell supplied the final out and sealed a 21 victory for the New York Yankees over the Washington Senators at Yan kee Stadium last night.

title: Harris Rehired by Braves
description: ATLANTA, Sept. 22 (UPI)Luman Harris has been rehired as manager of the Atlanta Braves for the 1971 season with a handsome raise in salary, the club announced tonight. The 55yearold Harris is finish ing his third full season as the Braves' manager.

title: SENATE ASPIRANTS DEBATE IN JERSEY
description: SHORT HILLS, N. J., Sept. 22 The Republican and Demo cratic candidates in New Jer sey's campaign for United States Senator agreed here to night that President Nixon should seek Congressional ap proval before committing Amer ican military forces to war in the Middle East.

title: Girls and Boys League To Benefit From Party
description: The Girls and Boys Service League, founded in 1908, will benefit from a party Monday evening at the Monk's Inn, 35 West 64th Street. The party, sponsored by the Jun ior Committee, will feature live rock music by a group called Whisper as well as in ternational ski championship films.

title: ALICE HAMILTON,101, PHYSICIAN, TEACHER
description: Dr. Alice Hamilton, a re tired physician who pioneered in occupational medicine, died yesterday in her home in Had lyme, Conn. She was 101 years old.

title: TENNIS FAN, 75, ATTACKS HEWITT
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 22 (AP) Bob Hewitt, the husky, 30yearold South African tennis star, was reported today in good condition with a slight concussion after having been knocked unconscious yester day by a 75yearold fan apparently angered by his court conduct at the Pacific Southwest tournament.

title: FishingBan on Virginia River
description: RICHMOND, Sept. 22Vir ginia's Health Commissioner imposed today an emergency ban on fishing in the North Fork of the Holston River be cause hazardous levels of poisonous mercury were dis covered in fish samples. The order, by Dr. Mack I. Shan holtz, affects an 80mile stretch of the Virginia river between Saltville in Smyth County and the Tennessee line.

title: STOCKS IN LONDON MOVE UP SHABPLY
description: The London stock market moved ahead strongly yester day for the second successive day, although trading was less active than on Monday.

title: JOHN J. MEEHAN
description: SPRING LAKE, N. J., Sept, 22John J. Meehan former Tax Commissioner of Hudson County and formerly an assist ant corporation counsel in Jer sey City, died yesterday in New York after having collapsing on the street. His age was 71 and his home was at 33 Worthing ton Avenue here.

title: ECONOMIST CALM AMID G.M. STRIKE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 22Herbert Stein, a member of the President's Council of Eco nomic Advisers, forecast today that the strike against General Motors would not affect the overall course of the economy very much.

title: Mayor Says He Plans to Leave Political Life When Term Ends
description: John V. Lindsay said yester day he was now planning to retire from political life when his term as Mayor ended in December. 1973.

title: War Casualties
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 22 (UPI)  The Defense Department to day announced the names of the following servicemen from the New York area as having been killed in the war in Viet nam:

title: AUTO UNION PARES PAY OF OFFICIALS
description: DETROIT, Sept 22  The United Automobile Workers tightened its own belt today for a long strike against the General Motors Corporation, cutting the salaries of its offi cials sharply.

title: Thurmond Given a Raise In 2Year Warrior Pact
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 22 (UPI)Nate Thurmond signed a twoyear contract with the San Francisco Warriors today at an undisclosed increase in salary.

title: COLUMBIA GEORGE UNLUCKY IN DRAW
Fishermen Get $2,000 for Pollution Case Help
description: The Federal Government gave the Hudson River Fisher men's Association a check for $2,000 yesterday for its help in obtaining a conviction of the Penn Central railroad for pol luting the river at Harmon, N.Y.

title: Frankfurter Buns by the Million
description: Frankfurter buns rushed out of the tunnel oven the rate of 100,000 an hour in the new automated bakery, as Harry L. Gilman reminisced about his 42 years in the business. Hot dogs sold for five cents when I started, and you got a tree root beer said Mr. Gilman, the board chairman of Marathon En terprises, Inc. The company, he said, turns out more than two million rolls a day. In the Depression, he ran street corner frankfurt er stands to stimulate sales for the rolls he baked in a Delancey Street basement.

title: Elderly Sought to Help At Food Stamp Centers
description: The city announced yesterday that 80 old people would be hired to accept applications for food stamps at the 58 centers for the elderly operated by the Department of Social Services.

title: ADDONIZIO GIVEN A 10YEAR TERM
description: TRENTON, Sept. 22Former Mayor Hugh J. Addonizio of Newark was sentenced to 10 years in prison and fined $25,000 in Federal Court here today for conspiracy and ex tortion.

title: Suspect Safe in Blast
description: A homemade pipe bomb ex ploded early yesterday outside) the fourth floor apartment door, in the Bronx of an alleged) underworld figure under indict ment for operating a $14,000 aday policy and bookmaking ring. While the bomb blew in the door and damaged the in terior of the apartment at 2505 Lorillard Place, neither Morris Barra, 64 years old, nor his wife were hurt.

title: LAURENCE FAIRFAX, FINANCIAL ANALYST
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., Sept. 22 Laurence W. Fairfax, a lawyer and financial analyst, died to day in Lawrence Hospital here. He was 66 years old and lived at 5 Thomas Place.

title: Zanzibar, Though Heavily Dependent on Chinese Communist Aid, Maintains Independent Policies
description: ZANZIBAR, Tanzania  On this tropical spice island, part ner with the former Tangan yika in the union of Tanzania, Communist influence is more evident than it is on the main land, but even some foreign Communists have had their troubles here, and the United States is increasingly popular.

title: News Summary and Index
description: A new ceasefire proclaimed in Amman by King Hussein of Jordan was ignored by both sides yesterday as fighting continued in Jordan's capital. Commando sources said that King Hussein's troops were making last effort to defeat the Palestinians before guerrilla forces and tanks from Syria reached the city. However there was no sign that the tanks had moved beyond the Irbid region toward Amman. [Page 1, Columns 68.]

title: Soviet Hints It Is Pressing Syrians to Pull Out Troops
description: WASHINGTCW, Sept. 22The United Staotes put its em phasis today on diplomacy with the Soviet Union rather than military preparations in its ef fort to prevent the Jordanian conflict from expanding.

title: On the Nobility of Old Age
description: Having found very few answers among the great men of the world, I have been interviewing my mother recently about the pointless miseries of the human race. I think she's news because, unlike most mortals, she has never been plagued by doubts, and the older she gets the surer she is of her answers. I should explain that she will be 94 on the 9th of October, lives in Santa Cruz, Calif., and is almost in good enough shape to play tight end for the Los Angeles Rams.

title: CHANGES WEIGHED FOR ABERCROMBIE
description: William E. Humphreys, who has bean president of Aber crombie & Fitch since Sept. 1, told the annual meeting here yesterday that he was not happy with the chain's adver tising and that he would do his best to discontinue the store's famous remnants sales because the man who buys an item for 99 cents isn't our customer.

title: CHURCH UNIT BACKS TV ABORTION REPORT
description: The Council of Churches of the City of New York said yes terday that a WCBSTV news cast on abortion on Sept. 14 was an attempt at informing the public in a responsible man ner.

title: Urgent Meetings in London
description: LONDON, Sept. 22  Amid mounting confusion and con cern, the British Government held urgent meetings through the day on the crisis in Jordan.

title: U.S., Citing Trend to Democracy in Greece, Ends Curb on Arms
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 22The United States formally an nounced the resumption of full scale arms shipments to Greece today, but said it remained fully committed to a return to parliamentary democracy in that country.

title: Two Assembly Primaries Are Rerun in Brooklyn
description: Two Democratic primary con tests were rerun yesterday in Brooklyn 44th and 51st As sembly Districts. The special elections were ordered by the State Supreme Court because of irregularities in the June 23d primary.

title: Malaysia Installs a New Leader
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia, Sept. 22Abdul Razak succeed ed Prince Abdul Rahman as Prime Minister of Malaysia to day and voiced hope for the fu ture in a Southeast Asia whose peace and neutrality would be guaranteed by the United States, the Soviet Union and Communist China.

title: Fight Body Suspends Feld, Boxing Referee
description: Dave Feld. the boxing ref eree who was ejected from Madison Square Garden be fore last week's Floyd Pat terson Charlie Green bout, after he refused to leave the ring, was indefinitely sus pended yesterday by the State Athletic Commission.

title: Wallace's Black Rival Opens Drive for Funds
description: Dr. John Cashin, the black candidate for Governor who is running against George C. Wallace in Alabama. opened yesterday a financial drive that he hoped would take. Mr. Wallace out of national poli tics.

title: A Mile of Madison Ave. Becomes a Mall for the Night
description: Hordes of people swarmed last night along a stretch of Madison Avenue that is usual ly somnolent at that time. The change came at the start of another civic experiment in returning the streets to the people. With vehicular traffic banned from 60th to 79th Street between 7 P.M. and 10 P.M., scores of shot's that normally close toward the end of the day extended their business hours, as they will each Tuesday for the indef inite period of the traffic ban. Mayor Lindsay, accompanied by his wife and his son John Jr., 10 years old, snipped a red ribbon across the avenue at 61st Street to open the festivities and walked up the avenue for nearly half a mile to an enthusiastic reception. After nearly an hour, the Mayor ended his visit by ex pressing his pleasure. From what I could see, he said, it looked busy, crowded and the people happy. So I guess it's getting off on the right foot.

title: M'CARTHY GRANTED A PLACE ON BALLOT
description: BUFFALO, Sept. 22 (AP) Justice Walter P. Mahone of State Supreme Court today or dered the name of Representa tive Richard Max McCarthy. running for reelection as an independent, placed on the November ballot.

title: U.S. ENVOY URGES RERUN OF 2D RACE
description: PERTH, Australia, Sept. 22 (AP)Walter L. Rice, the Unit ed States Ambassador to Aus tralia, said today the American yacht Intrepid should decline the award of the second race in the America's Cup series.

title: Easing the Credit Market
description: There was little surprise this week when a number of the nation's largest banks announced that they were cutting their prime interest rate from 8 per cent to 7.5 per cent. It has long been common knowledge that demand for bank loans was sluggish and that the Federal Reserve System has been working energetically to ease credit by expanding bank reserves.

title: Fanny May Results Listed for the Week
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 22Interest rates showed a sharp decline today at the Federal National Mortgage Association's biweekly auction of mortgage purchase commitments.

title: A NoMan's Land of Shadows
description: WASHINGTONThe world is drift ing into the most dangerous confronta tion since the 1962 cold poker played by President Kennedy and Chairman Khrushchev. The stakes remain the sametotalbut there are more play ers and some of them are mad.

title: HUNT FOR BALLOON PRESSED AT NIGHT
description: After searching thousands of square miles of choppy seas off New foundland, the Coast Guard said last night that it had found no trace of two men and a woman who disappeared Monday while trying to cross the Atlantic in a huge balloon.

title: F.B.I. Identifies Hijacker
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept. 22 (AP) The Federal Bureau of Inves tigation has identified the man who hijacked an Allegheny air liner to Cuba Friday as Rich ard D. Witt, a 19yearold for mer marine living with relatives in suburban Glenwood.

title: MONDAY FOOTBALL A SUCCESS ON TV
description: Pro football was a success in its debut as a regularly scheduled primetime television commodity. Initial ratings for Monday night's exciting game between the Cleveland Browns and the New York Jets were strong, indicating that the American Broadcasting Com pany had made a good start in its gamble with Commis sioner Pete Rozelle's plot.

title: A Listing of New Books
description: Europe After the Rain, by Alan Burns (John Day, $4.95). A man wanders through a postcat astrophe world.

title: Franklin E. Devlin Dies at 72; Headed Monticello Raceway
description: Franklin E. Devlin, formed president of Monticello Race way and the Harness Tracks of America and most recently the president of harness racing's Grand Circuit, died Monday night at St. Francis Hospital in Port Washington, L. I. He was, 72 years old.

title: Burger Out of Hospital
description: PORTLAND, Me., Sept. 22Warren E. Burger, the Chief Justice of the United States, was discharged from the Maine Medical Center today after having been treated for a sprained back.

title: Soviet Orbits Cosmos 364
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 22 (UP1)The Soviet Union orbited today) an unmanned earth satellite in its Cosmos series, the official press agency Tass said. The satellite, Cosmos 364, was hurled into an orbit ranging from 198 miles to 131 miles above earth, Tass said, and was making one revolution every 89.6 minutes at an angle of 65.4 degrees to the Equator.

title: Urban League Aide Asks Census Recount of Blacks
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 22Despite the efforts of private black organizations, black citi zens were seriously undercount ed in the 1970 census, Whitney M. Young, executive director of the National Urban League tes tified today.

title: Potlatch Lists Outlays
description: Potlatch Forests, Inc., an nounced in San Francisco yes terday that it would spend $45.4million to increase pulp capacity at its Cloquet, Minn., sulfate pulp mill, and $9.6mil lion to improve air and water pollution controls at its pulp mill in Lewiston, Idaho.

title: Scherer, Miller First In 2 Catamaran Races
description: ROWAYTON, Conn., Sept. 22Otto Scherer of Laurel, Md., and Gene Miller of An napolis, Md., the North Amer ican champions for three of the last four years, went after the world championship for Class C catamarans today and won the two races that began a sevenrace series.

title: WILLIAM SCHONFELD, CHILD PSYCHIATRIST
description: Dr. William A. Schonfeld, a specialist in child and adoles cent psychiatry, died Monday of a heart attack at Bard Hall of Columbia University. He was 64 years old and lived at 918 Parkway, Mamaroneck, N. Y.

title: SmootHawley Revisited
description: COPENHAGEN Sept. 22 Representatives of the central banks and finance ministries of 115 countries, assembled here for the annual meeting of the International Monetary Fund and World Bank, are looking anxiously toward Washington as the Congress takes up a bill that would reverse three and one half decades of United States support for freer international trade. The bill adopted by the House Ways and Means Committee, which now goes to the floor of the House, would fix import quotas on textiles, shoes, oil, mink, glycerin and, in all probability, a long list of other goods from abroad. Proponents of the bill contend that it would protect the jobs of American workers, safeguard American industries from lowwage foreign compe tition, and strengthen the United States balance of trade.

title: Hope Ball Was Glittering But Diamond Was Glass
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 22Original plans called for Mrs. Emil Mosbacher Jr. to wear the real Hope Diamond to the 10th anniversary Hope Ball tonight, a benefit for the hospital ship Hope. Mrs. Mosbacher is the benefit chairman and the wife of the Chief of Protocol.

title: Miss Edwards, James Diamond To Be Married
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Sept. 22Mr. and Mrs. Knight Ed wards have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Barbara McKay Ed wards, to James Alan Dia mond of Arlington, Mass., son of the late Mr. and Mrs. Jerome Diamond of Roches ter. N. Y.

title: METS TO ACCEPT ORDERS FOR SEATS
description: Plans for a mail order sale of box and reserved seats to possible National League Cham pionship Series at Shea Sta dium were issued yesterday by the New York Mets.

title: MRS. ARTHUR CANTOR
description: Mrs. Deborah Cantor, wife of Arthur Cantor, the theatrical producer and publicity man, died yesterday in New York Hospital after a long illness. She was 48 years old and lived at 1 West 72d Street.

title: 2 IN SENATE RACE DISCUSS VIOLENCE
