description: Senator Charles E. Goodell and his Democratic rival, Rep resentative Richard L. Ottinger, focused on the subject of youth ful violence yesterday in sepa rate appearances in upstate New York and Washington.

title: Borman Gives Grim Report on P.O. W.'s
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 22The House and Senate held an unusual joint meeting today to hear a former astronaut, Frank Borman, plead for greater at tention to the plight of Ameri cans held as prisoners of war in Vietnam.

title: New Disturbance Erupts In Washington Ghetto
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 22 (AP) Rock and bottle attacks on the police broke out for the second straight night tonight in a gheto area about a mile from the White House.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Disaster. The President de clared Arizona and Colorado major disaster areas because of extensive damage caused by heavy rains in early Sep tember. Money allocated through the Office of Emer gencies Preparedness from the President's disaster fund as a result of today's action may be used to assist the states in relief activities.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: A Copper Find in Arizona Reported by KerrMcGee
description: The KerrMcGee Corporation announced yesterday that it had found significant copper mineralization in four of five recently completed deep dia mond drill holes on its Red Mountain property near Pato. gonia, Ariz.

title: Politics and Campus
description: In the aftermath of Cambodia and Kent State last May. Princeton University decided that it would shut. down for two weeks before the November elections to give students and faculty every opportunity to work for the candidates of their choice. The recess is to be offset by extension of the academic year.

title: I.C.C. Orders Emergency Measures in Rail Threat
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 22 Confronted with the possibility of a nationwide rail strike at 12:01 Thursday morning, the Interstate Commerce Commis sion ordered emergency meas ures today to move people and goods by bus and truck.

title: Cape Fear for Sale
description: There is no substitute for a seashore. Men cannot man ufacture one. They can admire it, walk on it, swim, sail and fish off it, share its solace and partake of its life giving qualities. Or they can mess it up, befoul it with oil, drain its marshes, level its dunes and pave it in con crete. But whether men are decently respectful of its works or ruthlessly egocentric, nature is inimitable. There is nothing like a seashore.

title: TV Review
description: The New York office of A. C. Nielsen, Inc., the re search PoohBah of televi sion, reports that in the metropolitan area the Mon day night game between the Cleveland Browns, and New York Jets walked off with 33 per cent of the available audience, handily outdistanc ing the entertainment shows on rival chains. Heretofore, the American Broadcasting Company has been a Monday night straggler.

title: Cubs Get Wilhelm, 47, To Help in Stretch Run
description: ATLANTA, Sept. 22 (AP)The Chicago Cubs purchased Hoyt Wilhelm, the 47yearold knuckleball pitcher, from the Atlanta Braves on waivers today.

title: Palme's Setback in Sweden
description: Despite the loss of his overall majority in Sunday's election, Sweden's Premier Olof Palme evidently intends to push ahead with the Social Democratic program for expanding social security and increasing state interven tion in industry. This will mean depending on Commu nist votes to insure a working majority in the new Parliament, but earlier Social Democratic governments employed this tactic without compromising themselves seriously.

title: Gore Joins Receiving Line for Agnew
description: MEMPHIS, Sept. 22When Vice President Agnew's cam paign jet landed at a remote corner of the Memphis Airport today, there was Senator Albert Gore, the man the Vice Presi dent had come to demolish, elbowing his way into the Re publican receiving line.

title: Israelis Offer Aid, With Restrictions, To Injured Arabs
description: JERUSALEM, Sept. 22  Is raeli health authorities today offered medical treatment to noncombatants wounded in the fighting tin Jordan if they were allowed across the bridges spanning the Jordan River, the border between Jordan and the Israelioccupied west bank.

title: Unusual Secrecy Set At U.S. Base in Turkey
description: ISTANBUL, Turkey, Sept. 23 (AP)  Unusual security precautions were reported early today at the United States Air Force base at In cirlik.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: THE CAPITAL GETS MAN IN CONGRESS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 22President Nixon signed into law today a bill giving the nearly threequarters of a million peo ple in the District of Columbia a single nonvoting Delegate in the House of Representatives.

title: Giants Cry for SpecialtyTeam Help
description: Jim Garrett is a peppery little chap who scouted for the Dallas Cowboys last sea son and is now coaching the specialty teams for the New York Giants.

title: Con Edison Asks P.S.C. for Rise in Gas Rates Effective Oct. 22
description: The Consolidated Edison Company filed a request with the Public Service Commission yesterday for an increase in gas rates effective Oct. 22 that would affect 1,230,000 custom ers in Manhattan, the Bronx, Westchester and parts of Queens.

title: Executive Changes
description: Earl D. Hilburn has been elected president of the Western Union Telegraph Company, the principal operating subsidiary of the Western Union Corpo ration. Russell B. McFall, who had been president, will continue as chairman in addition to his posts as chairman and president of the parent corporation.

title: ROTHSCHILD &
description: N. M. Rothschild & Sons, the merchant banking house found ed in 1804 in London by Nath an Mayer Rothschild, has decided to cease operating as a partnership and incorporate as a private company, effec tive Sept. 30. The new concern, will be a limited liability com pany and will operate under the name N. M. Rothschild & Sons Limited.

title: Conferees Agree on Loans For GrainSupport Plans
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 22 (UPI) A Senate House conference committee tentatively agreed today on most key portions of proposed new wheat and feed grain support programs, includ ing rigid support loan floors under grains from 1971 through 1973.

title: Kibbutzim Hear Firing, But It's Not Their War
description: KFAR RUPPIN, Israel, Sept. 22The sun set in the Biblical hills of Gilboa to the west; from the east came the intermittent pounding of artillery fire tonight between Arab forces on the heights of Irbid a few miles away.

title: FABIAN M. CRYSTAL, A FORMER BUILDER
description: Fabian M. Crystal, a retired builder and realestate opera tor, died on Monday as a result of a fall from the roof of the Kaufmann building of the Young Men'sYoung Women's Hebrew Association, Lexington Avenue at 92d Street, where he was visiting. His age was 71.

title: Sillman Completes Casting Of Hay Fever Revival
description: Leonard Sillman has com pleted casting for his revival of Noel Coward's comedy, Hay Fever, which opens at the Helen Hayes Theater on Nov. 9.

title: Pirates Accepting Orders For World Series Tickets
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept. 22 (AP) The Pittsburgh Pirates said today they are accepting mail orders for World Series tickets in the event they become the National League champions.

title: THEODORE GRANIK OF FORUMS DEAD
description: Theodore Granik, the radio and television broadcaster and lawyer, died of a heart attack Monday in his office here. He was 63 years old.

title: Powell Files Election Suit
description: Representative Adam Clayton Powell, who lost the Democrat ic primary election last June to State Assemblyman Charles B. Rangel, filed suit in Federal Court yesterday in an attempt to invalidate the close election.

title: MRS. ANSON J. FOWLER
description: MORRISTOWN, N. J., Sept. 22Mrs. Hazel Osterhoudt Fowler, a descendant of early Dutch settlers, died here to day. She was 82 years old and lived with her soninlaw, and daughter, Mr. and Mrs. Philip Azoy, at 537 Mount Kemble Avenue.

title: Artists Vote for Union and a Big Demonstration
description: A motion to form an artists union, or guild, was passed Monday evening at an open meeting attended by some 300 artists from throughout the city. The artists also elected to stage a major demonstration Oct. 20 at a major museum in the city, in collaboration with simultaneous artists demon strations abroad for a new and greater role for the artist in society.

title: Lava Pours Into Pacific From Volcano in Hawaii
description: VOLCANO, Hawaii, Sept. 22 (UPI)  Molten lava poured down the side of Kilauea Volcano and across a barren flatland into the Pacific Ocean today, send ing clouds of steam into the sky.

title: Midtown Agency Will End Ads Promising Bit Parts
description: A midtown agency headed by a former television actor will discontinue advertising that promises aspiring actors and actresses bit parts in films and TV commercials, it was announced here by State At torney General Louis J. Lef litowitz.

title: Sikorsky Displays Helicopter in 2d Bid for Contract
description: STRATFORD, Conn., Sept. 22Sikorsky Aircraft dem onstrated today a helicopter that it hopes might give it a second chance to win a Pentagon contract potential ly worth more than $300 million.

title: Bills on Job Equality Panel Held Periled by Labor
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 22A threat by organized labor to withdraw its support for two bills designed to strength en the enforcement powers of the Equal Employment Oppor tunity Commission has jeop ardized passage of the bills, proponents said today.

title: BRIEFING ON CHILE DISTURBS LATINS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 22 White House speculation that Argentina, Bolivia and Peru might join Chile if she turned Communist has deeply dis turbed LatinAmerican diplo mats here, who fear that such statements may be playing into the hands of revolutionaries as well as military dictatorships in the hemisphere.

title: Busy Season for Auto Racing: Drivers Win and Lose Crowns
description: The last weekend was a busy one for those mythical persons who place crowns on racing drivers heads and de throne those who have lost themcrowns not heads. Foremost of the new cham pions is Al Unser of Albuquerque, N. M., who clinched the United States

title: ASSIGNEDRISK POOLS ASSAILED BY INSURER
description: MIAMI BEACH, Sept. 22B. P. Russell, president of the Crum & Forster Insurance Companies, asserted here to day that the profitability of in surers was being seriously threatened by what he called the creeping cancer of insur ance pools imposed on the in dustry by Federal and state regulators.

title: Poverty Wages in New York
description: More than a decade ago New Yorkers were jolted discover that factory pay scales here had slipped to next to last place among the twenty cities with more than 100,000 factory workers. That disclosure brought a flurry of official promises to step up public programs for combating exploitation of the working poor.

title: General Dynamics Corp. Adds Two New Divisions
description: General Dynamics Corpora tion announced yesterday the iormation of two new divisions Convair Aerospace and Elec troynamic.

title: Puffin May Be First Born in Zoo
description: The first known hatching of a tufted puffin in captivity was reported yesterday by the Bronx Zoo.

title: Theater: Three by Ferlinghetti Opens
MACHINISTS SETTLE WITH 4 CITY PAPERS
description: The Machinists Union has reached tentative agreement with the city's four major daily newspapers on the terms of a new contract to replace the one that expired March 30, the par ties announced yesterday.

title: AMEX PRICES FALL AS TRADING EASES
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange ended mostly lower yesterday in slower trad ing although some steppedup buying in the afternoon man aged to reduce some of the earlier losses.

title: Jordanians Put a Price On the Head of Habash
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Sept. 22 (Reuters)Jordan put a price of $11,000 today on the head of Dr. George Habash, the head of the Popular Front for hte Liberation of Palestine. A similar reward was announced by the Amman radio for the capture of a second guerrilla leader, Nayef Hawatmeh, head of the Popular Demo cratic Front for the Libera tion of Palestine.

title: Lybrand Sets Large Settlement On Role in Mill Factors Failure
description: Lybrand, Ross Brothers & Montgomery, one of the na tion's largest public accounting firms, has tentatively agreed to settle for $4.95million the claims arising from its role in the collapse of the Mill Factors Corporation almost two years ago.

title: Judge Studies Army Plea
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 22 (UPI)  Federal Judge Howard F. Corcoran took under advise ment today a motion by the Army to switch the location of a hearing in the case of a News week magazine reporter, Henry P. Lieferman, who says he was called to active duty and or dered sent to Vietnam in re taliation for articles he wrote. The Government asked that the case be moved to South Caro lina because the reporter is stationed at Fort Jackson.

title: The U. N. Responsibility
description: The failure of the attempted Arab summit in Cairo imposes a solemn responsibility on the United Nations, and especially on the Big Four members of the Security Council, to act in the Jordanian crisis.

title: Mets Down Phils, 76, on 2 in 9th
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 22The New York Mets rekindled their pennant hopes in out rageous fashion tonig,ht, reduc ing the Pittsburgh Pirates lead by half a game to three, when they scored two runs in the ninth inning to defeat the Phil adelphia Phillies, 76, just after the Phillies had scored four in the eighth.

title: Teamster Union Aide Slain Near Home in Jersey City
description: JERSEY CITY, Sept. 22 (UPI) A Teamster Union official was shot dead on a street here this morning as he stepped into a truck on his way to work.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Oleo Label Bill Backed
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 22 (UPI)The House Commerce Committee approved a Bill today to require restaurants that serve oleomargarine to let their clients know they are lot getting butter.

title: LIBYA LIFTS COSTS FOR MARATHON OIL
description: The oil industry began brac ing for a major upheaval in world oil prices as the Mara thon Oil Company announced yesterday an agreement with the Libyan Government calling for sharply higher tax pay ments to the Arab country.

title: Restore Ball to Aid Culture in Brooklyn
description: Restore Ball, a dinner dance to aid the cultural affairs of the BedfordStuyvesant Res toration in Brooklyn, will be held Monday in the Imperial Ballroom of the Americana. Mrs. Robert F. Kennedy and Mrs. John V. Lindsay are co chairmen.

title: CITY DETECTS RISE IN LEAD POISONING
description: Dangerous levels of lead poisoning, the debilitating ail ment that afflicts slum children, have been found in nearly 1,800 youngsters so far this year, city health authorities reported yes terday.

title: Conservative Candidate Labels Rockefeller Drug Policy Failure
description: SYRACUSE, Sept. 22  Dr. Paul L. Adams, the Conserva tive gubernatorial candidate, made a oneday campaign swing through this stanch conserva tive city today, banging away on his themes of the failure of Governor Rockefeller to deal with the state's drug problem and his refusal to debate him on television.

title: JOB SAFETY BILL PUSHED IN HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 22 The House Rules Committee voted today to send a compre hensive occupational health and safety bill to the floor for debate.

title: Chile's Reds, Backing A Ilende, Built Party on the Soviet Model
description: SANTIAGO. Chile, Sept. 22 For those Chileans frightened by the prospect of a Marxist President what is most worri some is the Communist party, the core of the coalition that carried Dr. Salvador Allende to his leading total in the elec tion on Sept. 4.

title: Casper Beats Jacklin
description: DALMAHOY, Scotland, Sept. 22 (UPI)Billy Casper's putting was the difference as he beat Tony Jacklin by three strokes in an 18hole, $1,200 challenge match today. Casper shot a 68 on the par72 Dalmahoy course to the Briton's 71.

title: Shriver Suggests Agnew Tour the Nation With Ky
description: WINDSOR LOCKS, Conn., Sept. 22 (AP)Sargent Shriver called Vice President Agnew a radical rightist today and suggested that Mr. Agnew make a nationwide tour with Vice President Nguyen Cao Ky of South Vietnam.

title: Maximilian's Young Silhouettes
description: The most militant mini skirt advocate will be hard put to resist Maximilian's new collection that makes the short fur coat look as dated as the tea cozy. Fabric hemlines are still open to question, but fur is not. It is to the manor born, skim ming boottops by day or plummeting to floorlength at night.

title: United States and Asia: III
description: What is Asia?

title: White Panthers'
description: DETROIT, Sept. 22 (AP) Federal Judge Damon Keith to day set Jan. 20 as the trial date for three members of the radi cal White Panther party in connection with the 1968 bomb ing of a Central Intelligence Agency office in Ann Arbor. The defendants are Lawrence Plamondon, 22 years old, John Sinclair, 28, and Jack For rest, 21.

title: Article 1  No Title
Rockefeller Cites Achievements, But Shows Ineptitude as Painter
description: NIAGARA FALLS, N. Y., Sept. 22 If cars seem to waver as they pass in front of the Moose House at 32 Ellicott Street in Batavia, do not blame the Department of Transporta tion, blame Governor Rockefel ler.

title: TaxFree Issue Sold For Wallkill Project
description: Wallkill, N. Y. a small town near Middletown in Orange County negotiated the sale last nit of .44.5 million of taxexempt indus trial development bondsbelieved to be the first such issue sold in New York State.

title: Police Decoys Cut Cab Holdups 75%
description: Robberies and assaults against taxicab drivers have decreased sharply since the Police Department's new taxi surveillance unit started cruising the streets in mid summer in decoy cabs, the fleet owners said yesterday.

title: PITTSBURGH STAYS 2 GAMES IN FRONT
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept. 22The Pirates had to settle for their second straight split of a double header tonight, but the perform ances of two pitchers from their sorearmed brigade seemed to dissolve any concern they might have had over the first game loss.

title: Common Market's Talks With Norway Hit a Snag
description: BRUSSELS, Sept. 22 The European Common Market fin ished its first round of talks today with three candidate members, Ireland, Denmark and Norway, and found that, of the three, Norway's entry might be the most difficult.

title: Glen Cove School Chief Conducts a Rolling Seminar
description: GLEN COVE, L. I., Sept. 22 Commuters from this North Shore community who are often too tired after a day's work in New York City to at tend local school board meet ings had an opportunity to engage in a speakout on school problems with the local Superintendent of Schools while traveling on the Long Island Railroad this morning.

title: Child Abuse Laid to Father
description: A Bronx grand jury accused a 35yearold man yesterday of criminal abuse of his five chil dren. Jose Rios of 1000 East 173d Street was charged in 12count indictment with as sault, possession of a weapon and endangering the welfare of his children. The children, all boys, aged 2, 3, 4, 8 and 9 have heen taken to children's shei icrs. The whereabouts of the mother was not known, accord ing to Bronx District Attorney Burton B. Roberts.

title: Schenectady Council Votes To Permit Offtrack Betting
description: SCHENECTADY, N. Y., Sept. 22 (AP)The City Council voted last night to permit off track betting, under the state law passed by the 1970 Legis lature, to help increase local tax revenues.

title: SOME POWER OUT IN EASTERN AREAS BECAUSE OF HEAT
description: Electric power blackouts were imposed for the first time on hundreds of thousands of peo ple in the metropolitan area and in the Middle Atlantic States yesterday as a final sum mer heat wave and generator failures caused the worst power crisis of the season.

title: U.S. TIED FOR SECOND IN CHESS OLYMPIAD
description: SIEGEN, Germany, Sept. 22 The United States team de feated West Germany 2 to 1 in the adjourned seventh round games of the finals of the 19th Chess Olympiad this morning.

title: Nixon Nominates Marland As U.S. Education Chief
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 22President Nixon announced to day that he would nominate Dr. Sydney P. Marland Jr. of New York to be Commissioner of Education. The post has been vacant for more than three months.

title: Letter to a Student
description: MISSOULA, MONT. Dear Waiting Student:

title: POLICE TESTS GET BROADER REVIEW
description: Mayor Lindsay announced yesterday a new procedure to review protests regarding the fairness or correctness of ques tions and answers on Police De partment examinations for pro motion.

title: TREASURY CLOSES FINESILVER SALE
description: The United States Treasury is not offering any more of the finest refined silver, or that known as grade 999, at its weekly auctions, it was learned yesterday. According to the General Services Adminis tration, which conducts the auc tions, this type of silver has been offered in small amounts at various times since the sale was started in July, 1968. Gov ernment auctions of all types of silver will cease on Nov. 10.

title: Fears Voiced in Berne Over Fate of the Hostages
description: GENEVA, Sept. 22  The Berne coordinating committee, consisting of representatives of five countries whose nationals are being held hostage in Jor dan, displayed concern today over the possibility that some of the hostages might disap pear without a trace.

title: Bond Yields Show A Further Decline On PrimeCut News
description: Interest rates again moved lower yesterday under the con tinued impact of the primerate reductions announced by ma jor banks this week.

title: STOCKS RETREAT FOR SECOND DAY
description: The stock market retreated yesterday for the second day in a row as investors kept a wary eye on the tense military situa tion in Jordan.

title: Fairfield No. 1 Team Wins Governor's Cup Polo Title
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Sept. 22 The Fairfield County Hunt Club's No. 1 team captured the Governor's Cup polo champion ship today with an 1110 vic tory over the Fairfield No. 2 squad.

title: Mrs. Binh Repeats 2 Demands U.S. and Saigon Have Rejected
description: PARIS, Sept. 22Two basic Communist proposals rejected up to now by the United States and the Saigon Government as conditions for a settlement of the Vietnamese war were re iterved today as legitimate demands by Mrs. Nguyen Thi Binh, foreign minister of the Vietcong's provisional revolu tionary government.

title: HIGH COURT URGED TO SHUN WAR ISSUE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 22 The Justice Department urged the Supreme Court today not to rule on the constitutionality of the Vietnam war, warning that if the Court should order a sudden end to the war, dis astrous military and diplomatic results could follow.

title: K9 Retirement Urged
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 22 (UPI)Noting that many mili tary dogs are killed when they outlive their usefulness, Rep resentative John E. Moss., Dem ocrat of California introduced today a bill to return K9 dogs from overseas duty for retain ing or retirement in humane shelters in 'ie United States Mr. Moss said that since 1966 about 10,000 German Shep herds have been shipped to South Vietnam and other over seas postts. The use of dogs in combat areas, he said, re duces human casualties by 65 per cent.

title: Nixon's Stand on Campus Disorders
description: WASHINGTON. Sept. 22 President Nixon has now ?? three times about cam pus disordersmost recently in yesterday morning's news paperseven though no wide spread campus disorders have yet occurred in the new school year.

title: Sports of The Times
description: The shuffle in personnel has been con siderable since the New York Jets won the Super Bowl as the climax of an extended 1968 season. Almost half the heroes have since departed and yet Weeb Ewbank didn't hedge in giving an estimate of his current squad. The pudgy coach of the Jets said it could be superior to the Super Bowl champions. Joe Namath has begged to differ with his boss, but Namath is rebel by nature and probably agrees only with himself on any given topic.

title: CHABAN'S VICTORY CHEERS GAULLISTS
description: PARIS, Sept. 22Alain Pey refitte, former Gaullist Minister of Education, predicted at a meeting of Gaullists last week that we can be in power for 30 years if we don't do any thing stupid.

title: AN ATHEIST IN ISRAEL LOSES SUIT ON LABEL
description: TEL AVIV, Sept. 22  The District Court here today re jected an atheist's application to change his entry in the na tional population registry from Jew by nationality to Israeli. The decision will be annealed.

title: J. A. Staman to Wed Miss Tucker
description: WEST ISLIP, L.I., Sept. 22  Dr. and Mrs. Benjamin Tucker have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Daiva Jody Tucker, to James Arnheim Staman, son of Dr. and Mrs. Harry Staman of Uniontown, Pa.

title: Market Place
description: Do you take perverse pleasure in baiting the poor banker? If you do, you are a target for John P. LaWare, senior vice president of the Chemical Bank New York Trust Company and a defend er of the bank credit card.

title: OSTERMAN ACQUIRES THE LUNTFONT ANNE
description: The Coronet Theater Corpo ration, of which Lester Oster man is president, ha,s leased the LuntFontanne Theater, 205 West 46th Street, for one year with, options for a renewal in the second year and pur chase in the third year.

title: GOLDBERG OPENS DAYCARE CENTER
description: Arthur J. Goldberg opened children's daycare center at his campaign headquarters yes terday to symbolize a program to eliminate child neglect.

title: Information Here Meager
description: Such meager information as the families of Americans held hostage in Jordan have been receiving has come from the State Department, Trans World Airlines and newspaper reports.

title: Computer Issue Is Sold
description: An underwriting group led by Lehman Brothers sold yes terday 500,000 shares of Digi tal Equipment Corporation common stock at $76.50 a share. The company, situated in Maynard, Mass., makes com puters.

title: EXGOV.J.J.HICKEY OF WYOMING DIES
description: CHEYENNE, Wyo., Sept. 22 (UPI) Judge J. J. Hickey, who had been Governor of Wyoming and a United States Senator, died today at Memorial Hospital here. He was 59 years old.

title: Smut Hearing Planned
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 22 (AP) A Senate hearing has been scheduled for tomorrow on a forthcoming report of the Com mission on Obscenity and Por nography. Senator Thomas J. Dodd, Democrat of Connecti cut, chairman of the Senate juvenile delinquency subcom mittee, said today he was shocked by a report that the commission may call for the elimination of legislation cur rently on the books.

title: HARD WINTER DUE, TAXING OIL SUPPLY
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 22Federal officials forecast to day that the coming winter would be colder than normal along the East Coast and warned that a shortage of fuel oil for heating and electric power gen eration was almost inevitable.

title: KIDNAPPING SUSPECT FOUND DEAD IN AUTO
description: MONKTON, Vt., Sept. 22 The body of a New York City governess was found here to day but there was no sign of the missing 5yearold girl she was suspected of having kid napped.

title: Excerpt From the Mayor's Conference
description: Following is an excerpt from Mayor Lindsay's news confer ence yesterday dealing with his political plans:

title: CAPITAL PROTEST HITS POVERTY CUTS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 22Several thousand antipoverty workers and poor people from New York State gathered here today to protest a $3.6million cutback in Federal aid to anti poverty programs. The cuts are scheduled to go into effect Oct. 1.

title: Militant Syrian Leader Nureddin alAttassi
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Sept. 22 The liberation of Palestine passes through Amman, President Nureddin alAttassi of Syria proclaimed more than three years ago.

title: Actress Mixes Altruism and Business
description: First Vanessa Redgrave marched for peace. Then Jane Fonda worked for peace, American Indians and Black Pantners. Now Yvette Mimieux is selling fashions made by poor Haitian women.

title: 3 POLICEMEN INJURED IN HARLEM FRACAS
description: Three patrolmen were in jured last night when a mob of 200 to 300 people attacked them in a Harlem street after one of the policement had tick eted a doubleparked car.

title: 22,143 at Randalls Island See Santos and West Ham Play 22 Soccer Draw
description: Attracted by Pelts, who is probably the sports world's greatest attraction, a crowd of 22,143 jammed Downing Sta dium on Randalls Island last night for an exhibition soccer game between Santos of Brazil and West Ham United of Eng land. The fans were not dis appointed.

title: EUROPE ASSURED ON ROLE IN SPACE
description: VENICE, Sept. 22Discus sions in Washington between European space officials and representatives of the United States appear to have removed a major obstacle to largescale European participation in the American postApollo program.

title: Columbia Will Open Tomorrow, but the Belt Is Tighter
description: Although Columbia Univer sity still managed to wash its 8,000 windows and repaint 990 bedrooms in Wedgwood blue or sand, its annual endofsummer housekeeping operations were curtailed this year by a severe finan cial crisis.

title: Jury Trials in Misdemeanors Are Manageable, Judges Find
description: Judges, lawyers and prose cutors who had been more than a little pessimistic when they heard last June that the city's Criminal Court would have to give jury trials, admitted yes terday that they had been wrong. The court already had more work than it could handle, they warned, and now, with an added burden. its chaos and clutter might be come complete.

title: 200 at Wellesley And at Dartmouth May Be Exchanged
description: HANOVER, N. H., Sept. 22Dartmouth and Wellesley Col leges are considering an annual exchange of up to 200 students and five or more faculty mem bers, beginning next fall

title: TIMELY MANEUVER CITED BY PICKER
description: NEWPORT, R. L, Sept. 22The New York Yacht Club Race Committee must have breathed a sign of relief today when Intrepid and Gretel II crossed the finish line. It was the first race of this America's Cup series that did not have protest, postponement or abandonment.

title: HERBERT E. BAILEY
description: ELIZABETH, N. J., Sept. 22 Herbert E. Bailey, assistant treasurer of Johnson & John son in New Brunswick, died Saturday at the Alexian Broth lers Hospital in Elizabeth. He I was 51 years old and lived at 642 Norman Place, Westfield.

title: Syria Denies Intervention
description: CAIRO, Sept. 22 (Reuters)President Atassi of Syria strong ly denied to Arab leaders meet ing here that Syria had made any armed intervention into Jordan, delegation sources said tonight.

title: Henry Ford 2d, 25 Years Later, Keeps Rolling
description: DETROIT, Sept. 21A quar ter century ago a 28yearold Henry Ford 2d seized control of his grandfather's crumbling empire.

title: Southern Governors Adopt Antibusing Resolution Urging Uniform Policy for U.S.
description: BILOXI, Miss., Sept. 22The Southern Governors Conference adopted today an antibusing resolution that fell far short of the position some of its more conservative members had championed.

title: Syracuse Reinstates Eight Black Players
description: SYRACUSE, Sept. 22 (AP) Eight black athletes sus pended from the Syracuse University football squad will be reinstated immediately on the recommendation of Floyd Ben Schwartzwalder, head coach.

title: Advertising: Ally Getting Travelers Corp.
description: Carl Ally, Inc., has landed the Travelers Corporation ac count with its some $3mil lion in billings.

title: Twins Top A's to Clinch Western Division Title
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Sept. 22 (AP) The Minnesota twins scored a 53 victory over the secondplace Oakland Athlet ics tonight, clinching the American League West title for the Twins.

title: NEW POSSIBLE PLANS FOR TAXES OUTLINED
description: Edwin S. Cohen, Assistant Secretary of the Treasury for tax policy, outlined yesterday several areas of possible tax reform under consideration for introduction next year, includ ing a concept known as the valueadded tax.

title: Colorado Court Dismisses Challenge to Vote Returns
description: DENVER, Sept. 22 (UPI)The Colorado Superme Court, saying it lacked jurisdiction, has dismissed a challenge of the results in Denver's Democratic primary election by Represent tive Byron G. Rogers.

title: Egypt Seeks Rescue Flight For 100 Newsmen in Amman
description: CAIRO, Sept. 22  The Unit ed Arab Republic is making ef forts for a special flight to Jordan to rescue more than 100 correspondents besieged in the Jordan Intercontinental Ho tel in Amman, Mohammed Has sanein Heykal, the Minister of Guidance, reported today.

title: PRICE CUTS SLATED BY REVERE COPPER
description: Revere Copper & Brass, Inc., said yesterday that it had re duced its price to distributers for standard sizes of sheet, roll and strip copper by four cents a pound.

title: RearFaced Seats Asked For Buses
description: The Board of Education's transportation director op posed yesterday a City Coun cil bill that would mandate seat belts in school buses. In stead he suggested that school buses have seats fac ing the rear.

title: Allen Praises Choice
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Sept. 22 (AP)Dr. Allen told national leaders of the ParentTeacher Association today that he was delighted over President Nixon's appointment of Dr. Marland.

title: SMALLCAR TREND SEEN CONTINUING
description: EDGARTOWN, Mass., Sept. 22 The president of Volks wagen of America, I. Stuart Perkins, predicted today that the trend toward small cars would continue for at least the next five years.

title: ISRAEL ANALYZES AIR WAR IN JORDAN
description: JERUSALEM, Sept. 22Jor dan's decision to use her tiny air force against two armored brigades invading from Syria was seen in Israel tonight as a significant move that could alter the magnitude of battle in northern Jordan.

title: Guards at State U. Yield After Demanding Firearms
description: BUFFALO, Sept. 22 Security guards at the State University at Buffalo resumed their patrol duties on the campus today under protest after the university administra tion had refused the guards demands that they be permitted to carry firearms.

title: Gen. Howard Snyder, 89, Dies; Eisenhower's Medical Adviser
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 22 (AP) Maj. Gen. Howard McCrum Snyder, who served President Dwight D. Eisenhower as medi cal adviser and physician, died today at Walter Reed Hospital. He was 89 years old. The cause of his death was not disclosed.

title: Hypocrisy on Desegregation Charged
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 22Senator John L. McClellan ac cused the Federal Government today of monumental hypoc risy in forcing Southern schools to desegregate to a level that he said was intoler able in the North.

title: Atheist's Plea Is Rebuffed
description: NEW ORLEANS, Sept. 22 (UPI)The United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Cir cuit disagreed today with a contention by Madalyn Murray O Hair, an atheist, that Bible reading and prayer by astro nauts in space is unconstitu tional. The court affirmed a dicision by a district court in Texas that prayers and bible readings by Apollo 8 and Apollo 11 astronauts were not unlawful.

title: 2 Deputies Testify Manson Proposed Alliance With Police to Fight the Panthers
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 22Two men who took part in a police raid on Charles M. Man son's hippie hangout last sum mer testified at the Tate mur der trial today that Manson had urged the police to join with his band to fight the Black Panthers.

title: Miss Greenspan Engaged to Wed Richard B. Lind
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., Sept. 22The engagement of Miss Karen Greenspan to Richard B. Lind has been announced by Dr. and Mrs. Ezra Green span, parents of the future bride. Her fianc is the son of Daniel Lind of Riverdale, the Bronx, and Mrs. Charles Rubenstein of New York.

title: POWER RATIONED AS HOT WEATHER CONTINUES IN EAST
description: The city and most of the Northeast were brought to the brink of a massive electric blackout yesterday as a pro longed hot spell strained pow er supplies that were running perilously low.

title: and Soviet Credited at U.N. With Easing of Jordanian Crisis
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Sept. 23Informed diplomats said here today that concerted action by the United States and the Soviet Union had been the key factor in easing the Jordanian crisis.

title: U.S. STILL IN SECOND IN CHESS OLYMPIAD
description: SIEGEN, Germany, Sept. 23 The United States team split the points in its match with Yugoslavia, 22, in the ad journed games of the eighth round of the 19th Chess Olym piad this morning.

title: CONTROLS AVERT POWER BLACKOUTS
description: Just before 4 P.M. Tues day, a systems operator punched two buttons in Consolidated Edison's Energy Control Center at West End Avenue and 65th Street.

title: Toledo Teachers Ask Talks
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, Sept. 23 (UPI)The Toledo Federation of Teachers asked the board of education today to abandon its negotiating committee and bar gain directly in hopes of end ing a threeweek salary dispute.

title: ExWhite House Aide Wins Wisconsin Race in Recount
description: KENOSHA, Wis., Sept. 23Leslie Aspin, 32 years old, a former White House aide, won a recount today to become the Democratic nominee for the First District House seat held by Henry C. Schadeberg of Burlington, a Republican.

title: Overburdening Welfare Reform
description: Time is running out for final Congressional action this year on President Nixon's most imaginative domestic proposal, reform of the socially destructive welfare system.

title: Mrs. Wilson's Poems a Big Hit in Britain
description: LONDON, Sept, 23  The fastestselling book in Britain today is by Mary Wilson, poet, the wife of Harold Wil son, politician.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
U.S. Cardinal Learns Vatican Job Away From Desk
description: ROME, Sept. 23  John Joseph Cardinal Wright, the highestranking American in the Vatican, is learning his job in Rome by staying away from his desk.

title: COMMODITIES DIP AFTER EARLY RISE
description: All three major commodities futures traded on the Chicago Board of Trade showed strength on the opening yes terday but corn futures weak ened, wheat futures closed rel atively unchanged and soy beans finished unchanged to up moderately.

title: GAIN IS REPORTED BY GENERAL MILLS
description: General Mills, Inc., realized a 10.9 per cent increase in earnings for the 13 weeks ended Aug. 30 on a sales gain of 10 per cent, both establish ing records for the period, the report of the packaged con sumer foods producer disclosed yesterday from Minneapolis headquarters.

title: HEAD OF READING SELLS HIS STOCK
description: The Reading Company's chairman, William R. Daley, has liquidated his interest in the railroad, it was disclosed yesterday in the New York Stock Exchange's insiders list.

title: WIDE HOUSING BILL VOTED BY SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23The Senate, by a 59to2 vote, approved tonight a comprehen sive, $4billion housing bill that includes a new Democratic sponsored program for develop ment of new cities outside urban centers.

title: CARTER CAPTURES RUNOFF IN GEORGIA
description: ATLANTA, Sept. 23  For mer Gov. Carl E. Sanders of Georgia was decisively de feated today in a primary election bid for a comeback against Jimmy Carter, a wealthy liberal whose tough campaigning won him some of this state's large Wallace vote.

title: MRS. GUSTAVE L. HERZ
description: Mrs. Edith Flammerschein Herz, widow of Gustave L. Herz, an automobile, engineer, died on Monday in Kilchberg, Switzerland, at the age of 78. She resided at 59 East 75th Street.

title: HOSTAGES PROVE HARD TO CONTACT
C.A.B TOLD TO ACT ON CUT IN ROUTES
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23The Just ice Department de manded today that the Civil Aeronautics Board hold public hearings before acting on a proposal by three major air lines to reduce air service on 15 major air routes.

title: NIXON AIDE SCORES TEACHERS GROUPS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23A high Nixon Administration of ficial accused officers of na tional teachers groups today of trying to obstruct educational reform experiments in order to preserve bureaucratic power.

title: GONZALES VICTOR BY 76, 36, 76
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 23 (UPI) Pancho Gonzales, seeded fifth, advanced to the third round of the $50,000 Pacific Southwest open tennis cham pionships today by beating Dick Crealy of Australia in a close battle, 76, 36, 76.

title: Texas Instrument Staff Cut
description: DALLAS, Sept. 23 (UPI)Texas Instruments, Inc., an nounced today it was reducing its working force in the Dallas areas by 1,210 persons because of a weak market for semi conductors.

title: Governors Name Chairman
description: BILOXI, Miss., Sept. 23 (AP) The Southern Governors Con ference yesterday named Gov. John Bell Williams of Missis sippi as its 1971 chairman and Gov. Luis A. Ferr of Puerto Rico as vice chairman.

title: City Planning Unit Bars Mill Basin Development
description: The City Planning Commis sion last night rejected a rezoning plan that would have cleared the way for a major regional shopping cen ter, marina, boatel and ca bana club on a 77acre site in the Mill Basin section of Brooklyn.

title: Bronco Publicity Aide Quits
description: DENVER, Sept. 23 (UPI)The Denver Broncos announced today that their dirqctor of pub lic relations, Dick Mullins,. had resigned.

title: Senate Approves Curbs On Political TV Spending
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23The Senate, over token Re publican opposition, completed Congressional action today on, legislation design'ed to restrict the growing political costs of campaign advertising on television and radio.

title: Ecuadorian Chief of Staff Quits in Rift With Velasco
description: QUITO, Ecuador, Sept. 23 (UPI)The armed forces chief of staff, Gen. Edmundo Baquero Salgado, quit today in a dispute with President Jose Marfa Ve lasco Ibarra over the reshuffl ing of high armed forces com mands by the President.

title: 1,800 More Police Sought for Subway
description: John T. Maye, president of the Transit Patrolman's Benevo lent Association, called on Mayor Lindsay yesterday to add 1,800 men to subway duty because daytime subway crime had skyrocketed.

title: South Africa Presbyterians Turn Down Vorster Demand to Quit World Council
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af rica, Sept. 23  The Presby terian Church of Southern Africa has defied a warning by Prime Minister John Vorster to withdraw from the World Coun cil of Churches.

title: Louisiana Tech Player Killed
description: RUSTON, La., Sept. 23 (UPI)  Ronnie Dark, 18yearold member of the Louisiana Tech football team was killed by freight train yesterday while he and two friends were jog ging. The authorities said Dark apparently did not see or hear the Illinois Central train that hit him.

title: Sports of the Fimes
description: Many years ago, in 1976, a band of daredevils from the Kangaroo Flying Club of Melbourne decided to fly their 11man helicopter to Washington to help celebrate the United States bicentennial. But their ship, named the Aus tralia, ran out of beer and fuel so they set down, and, over network television, challenged any and all American 11man helicopters to a match race above the sands southern California. From dozens of replies, the Kan garoos shrewdly accepted as their first opponent the plush and ponderous copter, Singing Acres II, used by a local real estate developer to transport prospective clients.

title: SEASON'S PLAYS SET BY YALE REPERTORY
description: The Yale Repertory Theater of New Haven opens its fifth anniversary season Oct. 8 with Story Theater Repertory, based on Isaac Bashevis Sing er's Gimpel the Fool, Gustav Flaubert's Saint Julian the Hospitaler and Olympian Games, a new version of Ovid's Metamorphoses.

title: T.V.A. Gives AllisChalmers Second $7Million Contract
description: The Tennessee Valley Author ity announced yesterday the award of a second contract for powermaking equipment at its Raccoon Mountain pumped storage plant to the Allis. Chalmers Manufacturing Com pany. Yesterday's award, valued at $7.7million, is for generator motors for the project which is under construction near Chat tanooga.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The importance of the Safeguard ABM tests lies in the fact that proto type hardware and software are being exercised and proved. It may be true that eight years ago the tests con ducted were simple and assured in their success, but this does not neces sarily apply to current tests.

title: School Board Scores Own Report on Addicts
description: A Board of Education re search staff report on drug ad diction among high school stu dents here has come under crit icism from top board officials who said that the document contained statistical errors.

title: Jets'
description: At least publicly, the New York Jet coaches are avoid ing the Jim Hudson issue.

title: Kling Kling Wins $57,400 Lawrence Realization at Belmont and Returns
description: Kling Kling, the established grass campaigner owned by John M. Schiff, withstood the closing rush of William Haggin Perry's Loud and won the $57, 400 Lawrence Realization at Belmont Park yesterday.

title: LongMoribund Insurance Plan For PoorArea Investment Stirs
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, Sept. 23A longmoribund plan for an international system of insurance for private investment in the lessdeveloped countries has suddenly come to life. Both public speeches at the annual meet ing here of the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development, or World Bank, and private assessments by officials involved indicate that there is now a fair chance that the plan can be negotiated.

title: PROMISE IS KEPT. IN HOUR CONCERT
description: One Hour of Chamber Mu sic is the nameof the new lateafternoon concert series under the direction of Jens Ny gaard that began at Carnegie Recital Hall on Tuesday, and the first event fulfilled the pro mise. It began at 5:30 and went straight through without inter mission to end at 6:30.

title: Coast Savings Units Plan $500Million For Budget Homes
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 23The California Savings and Loan League is asking its 221 mem bers to provide some $500mil lion to finance lowcost housing in the state.

title: Rerun in the 21st
description: After an inexcusable delay, the Supreme Court Queens has handed down an inexplicable opinion. Yes terday, three months after the June party primaries and one day after rerun races in several boroughs, the court ruled that former President of the Borough of the Bronx Herman Badillo would have to undergo a rerun contest in his quest for the Democratic Congressional nomination in the city's new triborough 21st Congres sional District.

title: ADS ON ENZYME SOAP HELD FALSE BY F.T.C.
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23 (AP) The Federal Trade Commis sion accused the three major manufacturers of enzyme de tergents today of false adver tising in claiming their prod ucts are effective against all stains.

title: 3 Democratic Economists See Nixon Policies Leading to Creeping Paralysis
City Opera Facing Musicians Strike On Sunday Night
description: The New York City Opera Orchestra voted yesterday afternoon to go on strike against the New York City Opera following the perform ancl of Massenet's Manon on Sunday night if an employment contract between the orchestra and the company has not been nezotiated by that time.

title: YANKEES WIN, 64, CLINCH 2D PLACE
description: A clubhouse celebration more spontaneous and less inhibited than their predecessors used to produce in winning pennants was staged by the New York Yankees last night after a 64 decision over the Washington Senators at Yankee Stadium had clinched second place for them in the American League's Eastern Division.

title: SeaAir Search Continues For 3 Missing Balloonists
description: Search teams from the United States and Canada continued vast sea and air hunt yesterday for two men and a women who disappeared off Newfoundland Monday while attempting to cross the Atlantic in a huge orange balloon. The searchers said they had seen no sign of the missing balloonists.

title: Legal Aid Lawyers Score City on Prisoner's Suicide Attempt
description: Legal Aid Society lawyers blamed the city, Bellevue Hos pital and the Manhattan Dis trict Attorney's office yesterday for the attempted suicide last Friday of a 21yearold inmate of the Tombs.

title: Elephant's Solitary Ends
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 23 (AP)Ziggy, a sixton elephant that had been chained to an indoor house at Brookfield Zoo since 1941 because he once attacked a trainer, took his first walk in the fresh air in 29 years today. Dr. Peter Crowcroft, the zoo director, said, We coaxed him out with some bananas. One of the persons coaxing Ziggy was George Lewis of Seattle, the man attacked by the ele phant at a Portland, Ore., cir cus in 1939.

title: U.S. ACTS ON UNION IN PARCEL STRIKE
description: The United States. Attor ney's office began criminal contemptofcourt proceedings yesterday against the union that refused to obey a court order and kept United Parcel Service drivers off the job for two weeks here last month.

title: JORDAN PRESSES ATTACK IN NORTH; SYRIAN TANKS SAID TO WITHDRAW; U.S. CHARTERS EVACUATION PLANE
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Sept. 23The Jordanian Army and Air Force counterattacked Arab guerrillas in the north today, and the tanks backing the guerrillas retreated toward the Syrian border.

title: Mrs. Mitchell Becomes A Cover Girl for Life
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23 (UPI)Mrs. John N. Mitchell has made the cover of next week's Life magazine, much to her delight.

title: Underground Editor Freed
description: ELKHORN, Wis., Sept. 23 (AP)Mark Knops, editor of the Madison underground news paper Kaleidoscope was re leased from jail today after an Assistant Attorney General said he had purged himself by testifying before a Walworth County grand jury. Mr. Knops had been in custody since Aug. 30 on charges of contempt after he refused to answer questions about campus violence.

title: A VICTORY MEANS U.S. RETAINS CUP
Senate Finance Committee Ends Long Welfare Hearings
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23 (AP)  The Senate Finance Committee concluded today its monthslong hearing on major Welfare reform and Social Se curity bills. More than 200 witnesses were heard, and committee members remained unattracted to President Nix on's welfare plan.

title: Advertising: RumrillHoyt Is Restructured
description: Because of the growing pressure from the independ ent companies that offer var ious facets, of traditional agency service, RumrillHoyt has restructured its opera tion.

title: A NEW COMPUTER UNVEILED BY I.B.M.
description: The International Busi ness Machines Corporation an nounced yesterday a new com puter system that for the first time in the history of general purpose computers utilizes semiconductor circuits for the entire main memory of the machine.

title: Banker Seized in Robbery
description: LINCOLN, R.I., Sept. 23 (AP) A masked gang kidnapped the manager of a branch bank today and held five members of his family hostage while they took an estimated $50,000, the police said. The men seized Richard DiMase outside his home, forced him to open the branch of the Industrial National Bank.

title: Where Has OldFashioned Fun Gone?; A Considered Plea For Jokes and Japes And a Jig or Two
description: Do New Yorkers ever have fun any more, plain old fun? Are there any adults left who actually play? We all know the catechism: No, of course not. Why? Because New Yorkers are hard ened, while fun and play are properties of innocence.

title: AGNEW HAS DOUBT ABOUT VISIT BY KY
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Sept. 23 Vice President Agnew said to day that he did not believe the impending visit of Vice President Nguyen Cao Ky of South Vietnam to Washington is going to serve a useful pur pose. He said that such a visit may be a mistake.

title: ADOLPH ULBRICH
description: CRANFORD, N. J., Sept. 23Adolph Ulbrich, a lawyer in Elizabeth and a former Mayor of Rahway, died yesterday at his home. He was 79 years old and lived at 30E Parkway Vil lage here.

title: Pnompenh Reports Gain Near Tangkok
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Sept. 23  The Cambodian military spokesman said today that government troops had occupied several villages near the enemy stronghold of Tang kok.

title: Ground Broken for Stadium
description: FOXBORO, Mass., Sept. 23 (AP)  After 10 years of series of nightmares, a dream has come true, Bill Sullivan, president of the Boston Path ots, said today as ground was broken for the 60,000 seat Schaefer Stadium. The Patriots will play their home football games in it next season.

title: Screen: Tora! Tora! Tom! Recalls Pearl Harbor
Queens Court Voids Victory by Badillo
description: Former Bronx Borough Presi dent Herman Badillo's Demo cratic nomination for Congress in the new threeborough 21st District was voided yesterday on the ground of irregular votes. A Queens Supreme Court justice ordered a new primary to be held Oct. 8.

title: CLENDENON WINS GAME ON A HOMER
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 23The New York Mets insisted again tonight that reports of their demise were greatly ex aggerated.

title: Silurians Honor Raskin
description: A. H. Raskin, assistant editor of the editorial page of The New York Times, has been awarded the QuarterCentury News Achievement Award by the Society of the Silurians, it was announced yesterday. Mr. Raskin, who joined The Times's staff in 1934, has been a mem ber of the editorial board since 1961 and assistant editor of the editorial page since 1964. The award, to be presented at the Silurians dinner Oct. 19, is giv en for 25 years or more of dis tinguished journalistic achieve ment.

title: MARKET ADVANCES ON A BROAD FRONT
description: The stock market, respond ing to favorable reports from troubled Jordan, surged for ward along a broad front yes terday to register its best ad vance in three weeks. The Dow Jones industrial average rose 6.91 points to finish at 754.38.

title: Negro Candidate Succeeds Too Well
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Sept. 23Ronald V. Dellums has an un usual political problem. He did so well in the primary June 2 that it might conceivably cost him victory in November.

title: C. L. M'KENDRICK, 59, CORRECTIONAL AIDE
description: WALLKILL, N. Y., Sept 23Charles L. McKendrick, super intendent of the Wallkill Cor rectional Facility, formerly the Wallkill State Prison, died yesterday in Horton Memorial Hospital, Middletown. He was 59 years old.

title: AUGUST JOB TOTAL SETS RECORD IN CITY
description: Employment increased and unemployment decreased in both New York City and the state last month, the New York State Department of Labor re ported yesterday.

title: Hospital Head Weds Marie Smith
description: Miss Marie Smith, Wash ington Post staff writer and the author of three books, was married Sept. 4 to Arnold Schwartz of New York, presi dent of the Brookdale Hospi tal Center in Brooklyn. The marriage was announced by her sister, Mrs. Ralph E. Mac Donald of Winfield. Ill.

title: Drug Said to Suppress Bone Disease
description: Three Chicago doctors have reported that a bacteriakilling antibiotic drug can benefit some patients with severe cases of a bone disease, common among middleaged people, that is not caused by bacteria.

title: Books of The Times
description: Whether it's cricket, I'm not sure, but in 9 cases out of 10, when one reads a novel (or any book, for that matter) one experiences along the way what might be called a moment of extraesthetic in sight. It is that moment when one thinks one glimpses the author; when, halfcon sciously, one's radar locks onto an image of the writer, or at least the face he is presenting. The moment usually occurs early in the book, and it tends to determine how seriously one is going to take the work, how much one is willing to give in return for the writer's effort.

title: Alston Signed Again
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 23 (UPI)The Los Angeles Dodg ers announced today the sign ing of Walt Alston as manager for the 1971 season, his 18th with the club. All five Dodger coaches also have been signed to 1971 contracts.

title: 100 Americans Scheduled To Be Flown Out Today
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23The United States, feeling that the most acute phase of the Jor danian crisis has apparently passed, announced tonight that it would attempt to evacuate peacefully more than 100 Amer icans from Jordan tomorrow aboard a chartered commercial airliner.

title: CONTINENTAL OIL CO. JOINS LIBYA ACCORD
description: The Continental Oil Company fell in line yesterday by an nouncing an agreement with the Government of Libya call ing for sharply higher tax pay. ments to the North African na tion.

title: Teacher to Marry Miss Halpern
description: WESTBURY, L I., Sept. 23 Mr. and Mrs. William J. Halpern have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Sharyn Denis Hal pern, to Gary Michael Kevin, son of Mrs. Mac Chase of At lantic Beach.

title: Man Killed in Falls Leap
description: NIAGARA FALLS, N.Y., Sept. 23 (AP)How would you like to see a man go over the falls without a barrel? tourists said the man  unidentified  had asked. Then the man stepped into the water and plunged to his death over the American Falls yesterday. His body was not recovered.

title: GROWTH IS SLUGGISH FOR BUSINESS LOANS
description: Business loans at large banks across the country increased scant $177million in the week of Sept. 17, when corporations normally borrow large amounts to pay Federal income taxes, the Federal Reserve Board re ported yesterday. By contrast, in the similar week of 1969, business loans increased $966 million.

title: CONSUMERS TURN MORE CONFIDENT
description: A turnabout In consumer confidence was apparent in July and August, the National Industrial Conference Board said yesterday. Optimism con cerning the business outlook improved for the first time in more than a year, as shown in an increase in buying plans for automobiles and new homes.

title: EXPOS SCORE, 32 ON MORTON'S 17TH
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept. 23Carl Morton and Mike Marshall brought out the worst in Pitts burgh's hitting again tonight, and the result was a 32 Mon treal victory that further tight ened the torrid Eastern Division race.

title: U.N. Receives 5Volume Set From Carnegie Endowment
description: A fivevolume set, Issues Before the General Assemblies of the United Nations (1946 1965) was presented yesterday morning to Secretary General U Thant by Joseph E. Johnson, president of the Carnegie Endowment for International Peace.

title: Now, Loch Ness Insurance
description: LONDON, Sept. 23 (UPI)Lloyd's of London today in sured the leaders of an expedi ?? seeking the Loch Ness monster in Scotland against bodily injury caused by physi cal contact with the monster. Jack Ullrich said that the $12,000 policy covering him and Dr. St. Clair Strong, a microbiologist, was the first of its kind. The premium, he said, is $30 for each man for three week's coverage.

title: Melinda Menzies Planning Nuptials
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 23 Mr. and Mrs. John Menzies have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Melinda Menzies, a merchan dising director for Modern Bride magazine in New York, to Nathan Mobley Jr., a can didate for a Ph.D. degree at Columbia University. He is the son of Mr. Mobley of Greenwich, Conn., and the late Mrs. Eleanor Smith Mobley.

title: Congress Rushes Nixon's Crime Bills
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23With law and order emerging as perhaps the key campaign issue, the Democraticcontrolled Congress moved swiftly today to give President Nixon the anticrime and drugabuse legis lation he has long sought.

title: AUTUMN ENTERS, BUT IN DISGUISE
description: Autumn arrived yesterday, thoroughly disguised in the trappings of midsummer.

title: Scimitar First in Catamaran Sailing
description: ROWAYTON, Conn., Sept. 23 The three boats that fared best in the two opening events of the world championship for Class C catamarans yesterday fared best again today. Among them, Scimitar was the winner once more.

title: House Clears a Reduction In Mutual Fund Charges
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23The House of Representatives, with little debate and no roll call vote, passed legislation aimed at reducing, at least somewhat, some of the charges paid by investors in mutual funds.

title: Crime Bill Introduced
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23 (UPI)Representative Richard D. McCarthy, Democrat of up state New York, introduced legislation today to make at tacks on policemen and fire men a Federal crime. The bill would provide a maximum pen alty of life imprisonment.

title: Confusion on Extent of Integration
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23Every autumn in recent years there has been some confusion about how much desegregation has been achieved in Southern schools. The trouble arises from the complexity of the subject and conflicting interpretations by those involved.

title: POLICE IN HOUSTON CLEARED IN SLAYING
description: HOUSTON, Sept. 23A grand jury has cleared the police in the slaying of Carl Hampton Jr., the leader of a black militant organization who died after threehour gun battle with au thorities here July 27.

title: Japanese Report Decline in Chemical Fiber Industry
description: TOKYO, Sept. 23  The Japanese chemical fiber in dustry Is feeling the first warning signs of a downturn after a long, heady boom dur ing which production, invest ment and exports soared and the industry rejected Ameri can pleas for voluntary export restraints.

title: TOUGHER RULE FACED IF FIRMS QUIT BOARD
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23 (UPI)The Securities and. Ex change Commission today pro posed a tougher reporting rule for brokerdealer firms that withdraw from membership in national security exchanges.

title: MINNIEAR IS CUT FROM TAXI SQUAD
description: BROOKVILLE, L. I., Sept. 23 When the Dallas Cowboys released Otto Brown a couple of weeks ago, the 6footlinch, 190pound defensive back had an idea that maybe the New York Giants could use him and he was right.

title: Koch Says Much Special Delivery Mail Gets No Special Treatment
description: Sixtyfive per cent of special delivery mail in Manhattan's business districtsouth of 59th Streetis being, delivered only along with regular mail, Repre sentative Edward I. Koch said yesterday.

title: Nixon's School Nominee
description: As long ago as the early nineteen fifties some edu cators and Federal officials marked down Dr. Sidney P. Marland Jr., who was then superintendent of schools in Darien, Conn., as a corner in his field. On Tuesday Pres ident Nixon nominated him to become the 19th United States Commis sioner of Educa tion.

title: TV Review
description: Anthony Quinn, the com pelling actor with a face compared to the proverbial relief map of the Alps, and Peggy Lee, the sultry singer, were paired last night on the Kraft Music Hall over the National Broadcasting Com pany network. Kraft, which actually is more adventurous in TV than many other spon sors, can concoct quite a salad.

title: Charts of Races at Belmont
Panel Votes Canal Park Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23 (AP)The House Interior Com mittee approved today a bill to establish the Chesapeake and Ohio Canal National His torical Park. The park would include the historic 185mile canal route extending from the District of Columbia through parts of Maryland and West Virginia.

title: Ottinger Calls for a Reform of the Tax Laws to Help Mothers Who Work
description: Representative Richard L. Ot tinger yesterday called for re form of the tax laws to end what he said was longstanding discrimination against women, especially working mothers.

title: EXHIBITION BASKETBALL
description: Last Night

title: Landlords Warned of More Takeovers by City
description: The city administration stepped up its pressures yester day on Bronx landlords whose employes are on strike. It re ported 65 more notices of po tential city takeovers of build ing services to end health haz ards, for a total of 328 so far. It also reported 50 more warn ings of rent cuts, for a total of 184.

title: L.I.U. Nine Tops St. Francis And Wins Redmen's Tourney
description: The Redmen's Centennial tournament came to a close yes terday, with L. I. U. downing St. Francis, 1110, for the title.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Poverty: The President an nounced the appointment of 18 persons to serve as mem bers of the National Advi sory Council on Economic Opportunity. The council will be headed by John E. Robson, a lawyer in the Dis trict of Columbia.

title: The ForkedTongue Phrase Book
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23How to translate our campaigning politicians:

title: Gasoline and Sulphuric Acid Spilled Off Staten island
description: Some 3,000 gallons of gas oline and sulphuric acid spilled into Arthur Kill as the liquid was being loaded on a tanker off Carteret, N. J., early today, and tides threatened to wash the spillage onto nearby Staten Island, the Fire Department said.

title: Syracuse White Players Rebel Over Reinstatement of Blacks
description: Rebellion over the rein statement of eight blacks to the Syracuse football squad broke out last night among some of the white players who said they would not compete in Saturday's home opener against Kansas.

title: HEALTH AID PLAN SCORED BY H.E.W,
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23 The first Congressional hearing on national health insurance in 20 years opened in controversy today and halted abruptyl 102 minutes later.

title: City Has Island for Sale and Is Asking Only $1.1,Million
description: Anyone willing to pay $1.1 million to the city can be in the running for the owner ship of some 20 acres of is land in the East River that is heavy with maple trees, thick with wild plants, whirring with pheasants and dappled with stone buildings and a bit of history.

title: Dames at Sea Docks At Plaza 9 Music Hall
description: The freshest, funniest and most endearing entertainment crew in town moored at a cabaret Wednesday night. Dames at Sea, glory be, is back intact, after its original OffBroadway smash and sev eral other ports of call. Has the bloom zone? Heck, no.

title: RACE IS CANCELED AT YONKERS TRACK
description: YONKERS, Sept. 23  The New York State Harness Rac ing Commission ordered the eighth race canceled tonight at Yonkers Raceway, marking the first time in the 21yearold history of the Westchester track that a race was called off on a regularly scheduled pro gram. Yonkers opened in 1950.

title: Maine to Use Freshmen
description: ORONO, Me., Sept. 23 (AP)Freshmen at the University of Maine will be allowed to play on varsity teams in all sports except football and basketball, the school announced today.

title: Edging Back From the Brink
description: The reported withdrawal of Syrian forces from Jordan and the apparent growing ascendancy of Jordanian troops over the extremist Palestinian revolutionaries give a new lease on life to the tottering regime of King Hussein and, more important, to the hope that a major war can be avoided in the Middle East. The planned evacuation of Americans from Amman by com mercial aircraftrather than by military interventionis another hopeful step back from the brink of a new catastrophe.

title: Mitchell Assailed On a Rights Stand
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23At torney General John N. Mitchell has permitted a new Mississippi election law to go into the stat ute books, reportedly despite advice from his civil rights staff that the law is designed to pre vent the election of Negro can didates.

title: Arab Envoys Return to Cairo With Guerrilla Aides
description: CAIRO, Sept. 23A delega tion from the Arab leadership conference under way here re turned to Cairo tonight from Jordan, accompanied by four members of the Central Com mittee of the Palestine guer rilla movement, following the announcement of an agreement with King Hussein to end the weekold conflict in Jordan.

title: Trial Opens for Nazi Doctor Charged in 14,549 Killings
description: BONN, Sept. 23  Dr. Horst Schumann, a Nazi concentra tion camp doctor, went on trial in Frankfurt today, charged with the killing of 14,549 men tal patients under Hitler's so called euthanasia program.

title: MRS. ROBERT ROYCE, RESTAURATEUR, 64
description: Mrs. Trinette Dewey Royce, president of the Gage & Tollner restaurant at 374 Fulton Street, Brooklyn, died Tuesday of heart attack in Perth Amboy (N. J.) General Hospital. She was 64 years old and lived in Matawan. N. J.

title: Swain Signed by Bulls
description: The Long Island Bulls of the Atlantic Coast Football League announced yesterday they had signed Bill Swain, a sevenyear National Football League line backer. A former Giant he was released by the Detroit Lions 10 days ago.

title: Regional Plan Unit Seeking SpeedUp In Land Purchases
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23The president of the Regional Plan Association warned today that at the current rate of ex pansion for the acquisition of open space it would take 350 years to acquire the open space that the association believes necessary for the 70 million persons who will be living along the BostontoWashington corridor by the year 2000.

title: Cazzie Returns Tonight To Scene of His Prime
description: FARMINGDALE, L.I., Sept. 23The New ,York Knicks had just completed practice today at the State Univer sity Argicultural and Tech nical College and Cazzie Russell opened a letter, read it and smiled.

title: 5 Quakes Jolt Los Angeles
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 23 (UPI)Five light earthquakes jolted the Los Angeles area to day during the early morning, awakening residents but caus ing little damage. Startled sleepers called police depart ments in the suburbs of Tor rance. where seismologists said the quakes were centered, and Inglewood. The temblors were felt from Santa Monica to Hollywood and to the northeast area of Los Angeles County.

title: Mayor, Citing Fuel Supply Peril, Asks Control by One U.S. Board
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23Mayor Lindsay, citing warnings that New York City faced the threat of fuel rationing, said to day that the Nixon Ad ministration lacked a coherent national fuel policy.

title: Picking Up Where Ivy League Left Off
description: John Weitz is feeling strangely out of things these days. You know, oldfash ioned. One of the first de signers of women's fashions to seek to revolutionize men's clothes, he's not much in favor of peacocks or dandies. He advocates color, strong prints and a cheer ful, healthy disposition, which is a far cry from ruf fles and beads for men.

title: Nixon Plays Piano And Toasts Official At a Country Club
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23 (AP)President Nixon, appar ently on the spur of the mo ment, drove to a suburban country club tonight and wound up playing For He's a Jolly Good Fellow on the piano.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Oh, for the Life of a Muskie
description: CASS LAKE, Minn.  It is only proper that as a man approaches the halfcentury mark his thoughts turn to immortality.

title: Hyland Is Promoted To Racing Steward
description: Nathaniel J. (Bud) Hyland of Garden City, L. I., was named steward for the New York Racing Association yes terday, succeeding the late Earl Potter. The appointment, made by the N. Y. R. A. board of trustees, was ap proved by the New York State Racing Commission.

title: A CeaseFire for Culebra
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23In 1899 census of the island of Culebra found 704 inhabitants. Seventyope years later the population of the 7,000acre island off the eastern end of Puerto Rico still is only 743. No wonderlast year alone, the United States Navy and ships of at least six other navies fired rockets at Culebra on 228 days, airtoground missiles on thirteen days, naval shells on 123 days and strafed it from the air on 114 days.

title: GIBBON 21 VICTOR ON A TWOHITTER
description: ST. LOUIS, Sept. 23 (AP)Bob Gibson stopped the Chica go Cubs on two hits in the first game and Jerry Reuss scattered seven hits in the second as the St. Louis Cardinals swept a doubleheader by identical 21 scores tonight and dealt a dam aging blow to the Chicagoans title hopes.

title: MAYOR ASKS AID TO SOHO ARTISTS
description: Mayor Lindsay urged the City Planning Commission yes terday to legalize the quarter ing of artists in loft buildings in a 40block area in lower Manhattan.

title: Market Place:
description: Ripples from the liquida tion of the First Devonshire Corporation continue to fan out from Wall Street to in volve customers of other brokerage houses and even retired people in Miami Beach, Fla.

title: BOND RATE DROP RUNS INTO SNAGS
EDWARD TRENKMANN
description: Edward Trenkmann of Spring Lake, N. J., and Delray Beach, Fla., director and treasurer of A. Trenkmann Estate, Inc., realestate concern of 187 La fayette Street, died Tuesday in Jackson General Hospital, Mia mi, after an operation. His age was 77.

title: Exposing the President
description: LONDONIt is hard to realize, but it is still less than ten years since Presidents of the United States did away with the last safety controls over their words to the people of the United States and to the world.

title: Philadelphia Coke to Raise Foundry Prices on Oct.
description: The Philadelphia Coke divi sion of the Eastern Associated Coal Corporation announced yesterday that it would raise prices of foundry coke from $42.75 a ton to $49.75 a ton, effective Oct. 1. The increase was attributed to higher costs.

title: Senate Debate in 12th Day
description: WASHINGTON. Sept. 23 (UPI)  The Senate today entered its 12th day of debate on a proposed constitutional amendment for direct election of the President. Senator Birch Bayh. Democrat of Indiana, in sisted that the Senate stick to consideration of the amend ment proposal. Since debate began Sept. 8. the Senate has worked twoshift sessions, the first shift devoted to the pro posed, amendment and the sec ond to other business.

title: 14 IN LEGISLATURE ENDORSE BUCKLEY
description: ALBANY, Sept. 23  Four teen Republican legislators, led by State Senator John J. Marchi, today formally en dorsed James L. Buckley, the Conservative party candidate for Senator, over Senator Charles E. Goodell, the Repub licanLiberal nominee.

title: 6,300 MORE IN U.A.W. TO JOIN G.M. STRIKE
description: DETROIT, Sept. 23 (AP)The United Automobile Workers said today that 6,300 more workers would be called out on strike against the General Mo tors Corporation tomorrow, raising the number made idle by the strike in the United States and Canada to 373,437.

title: Stern's Is Opening Store in Jersey Today
description: Stern Brothers, which suf fered the severest blow in its 102year history when it closed its big New York store last year, will open its first new store in seven years today in the Willowbrook Mall in Wayne, N. J.

title: PROFIT OUTLOOK CUT AT WESTINGHOUSE
description: The Westinghouse Electric Corporation toned downward yesterday earlier projections of a record earnings year. Don ald C. Burnham, chairman and chief executive officer, issued a statement after the close of trading on the New York Stock Exchange in which he said that thirdquarter earnings are ex pected to fall short of last year's third quarter.

title: Promising Jobs, Governor Admits Edifice Complex
description: Governor Rockefeller cam paigned among construction workers and former football players yesterday, promising the workers thousands of new jobs and announcing to the former athletes that he was creating an Empire State Medal for Excellence in Sports.

title: Kung Peng, Press Spokesman For Chou Enlai, Dies in Peking
description: HONG KONG, Sept. 23 The death of Kung Peng, for many years a close associate of Premier Chou Enlai and highranking functionary in Communist China's Foreign Ministry, was announced today by Hsinhua, the Chinese press agency.

title: Football Transactions
description: BUFFALOClaimed on waivers Clyde Glosson, receiver, from Kansas City. Waived Jlm McFarland, tight end.

title: Governor Also Appeals
description: ALBANY, Sept. 23 (UPI)Governor Rockefeller said to day he had asked President Nixon to help avert a major shortage of heavy fuel oils in New York State during the coming winter. He said his let ter to the President urged emergency actions now.

title: Customs Checks in Privacy
description: CAIRO (UPI)Persons arriv ing at Cairo airport who are embarrassed to display the contents of their luggage in the main customs hall will be al lowed to use special facilities screened from other arrivals, customs officials. announced.

title: SID TRACEY
description: Sid Tracey, a vaudeville per former, died on Monday in Los Angeles of complications result ing from a fall. He was 70 years old.

title: BOURVIL, 57, STAR OF FRENCH FILMS
description: PARIS, Sept. 23  Bourvil, the comic actor who for two decades delighted French and international movie audiences with his subtle portrayals of the innocent everyman or the not allthatdumb yokel from the countryside, died here today of an undisclosed ailment. He was 57 years old and had been in poor health all through the shooting of his latest picture to be released next month, The Atlantic Wall of Marcel Camus.

title: Personal Finance
description: Champion boxer Sugar Ray Robinson had a bout with the Internal Revenue Service some years ago, and he won what could be called a tech nical knockout. It also turned out to be a victory for many other taxpayers.

title: STOCKS IN LONDON CONTINUE TO RISE
But Increase Here Is Put at Double That of Rate for Whole Country
description: The Bureau of Labor Sta tistics reported yesterday that consumer prices here last month rose at twice the na tional rat0.4 per cent com pared with 0.2 per centand faster than in three other major cities.

title: Blackouts and Brownouts
description: The public utility companies of the Middle Atlantic states are not responsible for the hot and muggy weather that has plagued the region these past two days. But they are surely responsible for the poor plan ning and the equipment deficiencies that produced this week's power crisis and its blackouts and brownouts.

title: Magazine Loses Libel Suit
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 23 (UPI)Elmer Gertz, a Chicago lawyer, was awarded $50,000 in a libel decision today from Robert Welch Inc., publisher of the Magazine American Opinion. The magazine, which has been linked with the John Birch So ciety, which Robert Welch heads, carried an article in its April, 1969, issue that said Mr. Gertz was a member of Com munist front organizations.

title: Thai Asks Big Four Talks on Indochina
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Sept. 23  Thailand proposed today that the Big Four pow ers together seek to restore peace in Southeast Asia.

title: 2 Sopranos and Tenor Win Flagstad Awards
description: Two sopranos, Patricia Guthrie and Kirsten Huehn, and a tenor, Daniel Nelson, have been awarded the 1970 grants of the Kirsten Flag stad Memorial Fund.

title: BIG CAR THEFT RING SMASHED IN BRONX
