description: The destruction of what was described as the largest and most successful auto theft ring ever to operate in New York City was announced yesterday by Bronx District Attorney Bur ton B. Roberts.

title: South Sea Isles Ready to Change But Want to Retain Style of Life
description: SUVA, Fiji, Sept. 23South Sea Island leaders meeting here are concerned with a struggle to meet the demands of youth without eroding the traditional dreamy existence that has en chanted Western travelers for two centuries or more.

title: War Songs Losing Favor in Israel
description: TEL AVIVEight of the 20 songs in this week's He brew Hit Parade are from army shows.

title: LEOPOLD RYBB
description: A funeral service will be held today for Leopold Rybb, princi pal second violinist of the New York Philharmonic, at the Louis Suburban Chapel, 1301 Broad way, Fair Lawn, N. J., at 1:30 P.M. He was found dead at Fort Lee, N. J., on Tuesday. The police listed his death as suicide. He was 46 years old.

title: Connell Wins in U.S. Golf
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 23 (UPI)Truman Connell of Del Ray Beach, Fla.. defeated Curtis Person of Memphis, twice champion, 2 and 1, today in the opeening round of the 1970 United States Senior Amateur Golf Championship.

title: SCRANTON WARNS CRITICS OF UNREST
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23 The chairman of President Nix on's Commission on Campus Unrest said today that public figures who tried to win po litical profit by criticizing stu dent dissenters were risking further turmoil and diminishing the chances of a reconciliation between the younger generation and its worried elders.

title: Quebec Premier Plans to Seek U.S. Investments for Province
description: QUEBEC, Sept. 23Premier Robert Bourassa of Quebec will visit California and. New York early in October to seek new investments for this largely FrenchCanadian province and to talk about its plans for a huge hydroelectric project on the eastern flank of James Bay.

title: Joseph Puro, 51, President Of Down Products Corp.
description: Joseph Puro, president of the Purofield Down Products Cor poration, died Tuesday of heart attack in his office, 319 Fifth Avenue. He was 51 years old and lived at 46 Hawthorne Lane, Great Neck, L. I.

title: U.S. TEAM LEADS CUP GOLF BY SHOT
description: MADRID, Sept. 23 (AP)Tom Kite of Austin, Tex., fin ished with three birdies on the last four holes for a 71 today that gave, the United States a onestroke lead over South Af rica in the first round of the Eisenhower Cup world amateur golf championship.

title: Chess
description: Modern Opening Chess Theory, No. 100 in the chess players series originating in England, is now available from the United States Chess Federation in Newburgh, N. Y., at $2.95.

title: Amman Diary: Window on the War
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Sept. 23 "There's coffee for break fast today! cries, a telephone operator named Nasser, who flinches only a trifle as a detonationprobably from a mortar shellsounds outside.

title: Cambodian Villagers Tell About Their Night of War
description: DEY ETH, Cambodia, Sept. 23The war came to Dey Eth the day before yesterday at 7 P.M.

title: Inaugural in Lebanon
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Sept. 23 (AP)Suleiman Franpieh was inaugurated today as Lebanon's fifth president. He succeeds Charles Helou.

title: A Cook Gets Rave Reviews From Great Names of the Theater
description: The guests who have dined and doted on the food of Ruth Dove read like a Who's Who of the international theater, and there is a menu book with recipes to prove it.

title: ISRAEL WELCOMES JORDANIAN GAINS
description: JERUSALEM, Sept. 23  Is raelt authorities today welcomed the Jordanian Government's gains over forces from Syria but they said they believed that King Hussein had won only a battle in his internal struggle against Palestinian Guerrillas.

title: Executive Changes
description: Albert L. Nickerson, retired chairman of Mobil Oil Corporation, has been elected a director of the Raytheon Company.

title: Memorial Seruires
description: FORDMrs. William Henry (Victoria), widow of British diplomat living here at 2 Beekman PI., with her daughters. Mrs. Nancy H. Ford and Mrs. John Ewart; died Southampton, L. I., Sept. 7, 1970, aged 90. Interment will take place Decem ber 1970, at Waldlngham Park, Walding tiam, Surrey, England. Memorial services will be held at St. Ignatius Loyola Church, Park Ave. and 84th St., Sept. 74, at 6 P.M. The Rev. C E. F. Hoefner, S.J., will officiale.

title: Vikings'
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Sept. 23 (UPI)Jim Vellone, a start ing guard, underwent an appen dectomy today, the Minnesota Vikings announced. Physicians did not estimate when he could rejoin the team.

title: Executive Changes Set For Dillingham Corp.
description: The Dillingham Corpora tion has announced that Low ell S. Dillingham will assume the positions of chairman and chief executive officer effec tive Jan. 1, 1971. At the same time, Herbert C. Cornuelle will succeed Mr. Dillingham as president from executive vice president but will re main chief operating officer.

title: RED CROSS NAMES AIDE FOR JORDAN
description: GENEVA, Sept. 23  The International Committee of the Red Cross today appointed Kai J. Warras, a Finnish relief ex pert, to head a new committee for the coordination of its relief program in Jordan.

title: ROBERT L. BRADDOCK, INSURANCE OFFICER
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Sept. 23  Robert L. Braddock, pres ident and a director of the Gen eral Reinsurance Corporation of New York City, died Mon day in Greenwich Hospital after a brief illness. He was 58 years old and lived at 6 Vista Avenue, Old Greenwich.

title: Hallelujah Lassies of Salvation Army Reenact Its Arrival Here 90 Years Ago
description: Seven Salvation Army hal lelujah lassies dressed in blue and red claimed America for God yesterday in a re enactment of the army's ar rival in this country 90 years ago.

title: CUBAN UNITS REPORT KILLING 8 RAIDERS
description: MIAMI, Sept. 23Cuba an nounced today that her mili tary forces had killed one and captured eight armed merce naries who came from the Unit ed States and landed in Ori ente Province on Sept. 14.

title: 10 Seized as Disturbances Flare Again in Washington
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23 (AP) Roaming bands of youths set several fires and threw rocks at cars tonight in northwest Washington, the police report ed. It was the third consecu tive night of violence here.

title: Bridge
description: New York enthusiasts are suffering from a surfeit of regional championships this month. Four days after the close of the Long Island Re gionals, the New YorkNew Jersey Conference Regional begins today at Grossinger's in the Catskills.

title: HARRY D. EDWARDS, EXWORKS ENGINEER
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., Sept. 23 Harry D. Edwards, who re tired as a works engineer for the Linde Division of Union Carbide Corporation in 1946, died today at his home, 6 West Avenue. His age was 84.

title: CONGRESS IS ADVISED TO JUNK SMUT STUDY
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23Two dissenting members of the Commission on Obscenity and Pornography urged Con gress today to disregard the commission's forthcoming ma jority report.

title: A Panther Pleads Guilty to Assault In Rackley Case
description: NEW HAVEN, Sept. 22George Edwards, one of the seven Black Panthers facing trial here in the murder of Alex Beckley, pleaded guilty today to two counts of aggra vated assault.

title: Controller of WPIX Tell F.C.C. He Fought Shift of News Shows
description: There was some tactical re grouping at the WPIX license hearings yesterday, occasioned by the unexpected absence of Fred M. Thrower, president of the station.

title: Harbor Tour Dramatizes Need to Clean Up Hudson
description: JERSEY CITY, Sept. 23With the Manhattan skyline dimly visible in the smoggy sunlight across the Hudson, an Army Corps of Engineers sur vey boat left her temporary, oilfilmed mooring at Harbor side Terminal today to show how the New York harbor waterfront needed care and cleaning up.

title: Israelis Find Guerrillas Gone From Area Near the Frontier
description: JEBEL ROS, IsraeliOccupied Syria, Sept. 23The guerrilla stronghold known as Fatahland, where Palestinian irregulars roamed the slopes of Mount Hermon to shell and harass Is raeli settlements in the valley below, seems to be broken um

title: Opposition in Bonn Walks Out In Parliament Budget Debate
description: BONN, Sept. 23  The West German Parliament's annual budget debate got off to a tumultuous start this morning, when Finance Minis ter Alex Moller, a Social Dem ocrat, likened the opposition Christian Democrats to the ru lers of pre1945 Germany.

title: Stevenson Faces Surgery
description: CLEVELAND, Sept. 23 (AP) Rick Stevenson, a rookie de fensive back, will undergo sur gery over the weekend for knee injury, the Cleveland Browns said today.

title: Blacks Appeal to Burger
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23 (AP)  Attorneys for blacks in Charleston, W. Va., today asked Chief Justice Warren E. Burger to delay construction of Interstate 77 in the city pend ing their appeal to the Supreme Court for review of a decision denying relocation housing as sistance to Negroes in the path of the highway.

title: RAILROAD STRIKE PUT OFF 2 WEEKS; TALKS WILL GO ON
description: WASHINGTON, Thursday, Sept. 24Secretary of Labor James D. Hodgson announced this morning that a strike had been averted for the present on the nation's railroads.

title: Anueilings
description: RIVKINMorris. Unveiling of a monument in memory of Morris Rivkin will be held Sunday, Sept. 27 at 12 noon at Mt. Amarat Cemetery, Farmingdale, N.Y.

title: ParkeBernet Shows New Copy Of Declaration of Independence
description: A newly discovered copy of the first printing of the Declaration of Independence, one of the broadsides that on the night of July 4, 1776 and July 5 was rushed to patriots on horseback and by stage, is on exhibition today and to morrow at the ParkeBernet Galleries, 980 Madison Ave nue.

title: Man Dies in Subway Fall
description: A 56yearold man died yes terday morning when he fell to the Brighton subway line's tracks at the Cortelyou Road station in Brooklyn, the police said. The man, identified as Jo seph Grenadir of 400 East 17th Street, Brooklyn, was waiting for a northbound train, the po lice quoted his wife as saying, when he fainted and fell to the, tracks.

title: Fire Races Out of Control In California Redwood Area
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 23 (UPI)An uncontrolled forest fire destroyed hundreds of acres of timber today in a re mote section of Northern Cal ifornia's redwood forests.

title: COCOA CORNER SEEN IN BASEL BANK LOSS
description: BASEL, Switzbrland, Sept. 23 (AP)An unsuccessful attempt to corner the world cocoa mar ket, or at least part of it, ap pears to have caused the loss of perhaps $40million by the United California Bank in Basel, A.G., Swiss officials and trade spokesmen said today.

title: LUNA 16 TO LAND IN KAZAKH STEPPE
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 23The Soviet Union announced today that the unmanned Luna 16 spacecraft was due to land in Soviet Kazakhstan at 8:20 A.M. tomorrow Moscow time (1:20 A.M. Thursday, Eastern day light time) with the rock sam ples it dug from the lunar sur face.

title: Pails'
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 23Dick Selma of the Philadelphia Phillies was fined $500 today for his angry outburst charging that last night's game between the Phillies and New York Mets had been fixed by the um pires.

title: State Employe Kills 4 CoWorkers and Himself in Albany Office
description: ALBANY, Sept. 23An of fice employe at the State Labor Department got up from his desk this morning, unwrapped a rifle and shot to death four secretaries. He then killed him self.

title: Disney on Parade Unfolds at Garden
Tickets for Chamber Music
description: Single tickets for concerts of the Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center are now on sale at Alice Tully Hall. Single tickets, priced at $5 and $6 for orchestra seats, are available for all 24 concerts, which will begin on Oct. 16 and run through May 4. Subscriptions, priced at $27 and $33 for a series of six concerts, may still be purchased. Onequarter of the seats for all concerts will remain open for purchase on a nonsubscription basis.

title: In Memoriam
description: COHENLouis. Papa, darling, loving morno ries are treasured treasures. SalllePhvllls

title: U.S. INDICTS AGENT OF JERSEY UNION
description: NEWARK, Sept. 23A Fed eral grand jury that is investi gating organized crime in New Jersey today indicted John Rig gi, a reputed lieutenant in the Mafia family headed by Simone Rizzo (Sam the Plumber) DeCavalcante, on charges of violating Federal labor statutes.

title: Police Raid Warehouse Said to Hold $6Million in Stolen Goods
description: A Manhattan warehouse said by the police to be filled with stolen goods worth about $6 million, much of it apparently taken from shipments at John F. Kennedy International Air portwas uncovered early yes terday during a police raid.

title: Disney World Appoints Eastern Official Airline
description: Not content to merely be the Wings of Man, Eastern Airlines has now arranged to become the official airline of Walt Disney World. The wonderful news came yester day from Miami Beach, where a joint DisneyEastern news conference was held. The Disney Magic King dom is now under construc tion near Orlando, Fla., and should open in a year. East ern said it would develop special advertising geared to the new vvacation site, while Disney World also plans a major ad campaign both here and abroad.

title: Bruins Tie Rangers, 22, With 2 Goals in 3d Period
description: KITCHENER, Ontario, Sept. 23 (UPI)  Two goals in the third period by Ken Hodge gave the Boston Bruins a 22 tie with the New York Rangers in a Na tional Hockey League exhibition game tonight.

title: Death Penalty Asked
description: Leo J. Kesselring, Conserva tive party candidate for State Attorney General, called yester day for a mandatory death pen alty when a murder victim is a policeman or fireman perform ing his duty. He charged that his two opponents, Adam Wal insky, Democrat, and Louis Lef kowitz, Republican were un characteristically silent about the recent wave of attacks against policemen and firemen.

title: Pope Issues a New Plea For CeaseFire in Jordan
description: ROME, Sept. 23 (AP)Pope Paul VI appealed for a truce in Jordan before the fighting led to incredible catastrophes. He offered his help in any peace initiative.

title: DOMESTICS CALLED MOST EXPLOITED
description: The domestic household work er was described yesterday as the most exploited woman in America because she is ineli gible for protection of the mini mumwage laws, has no health insurance or job security and often receives less than $60 for a 60hour week.

title: MOST HAPPY FELLA BRINGS $1MILLION
M'KNEALLY TAX DATA FOR 195867 MISSING
description: NEWBURGH, N. Y., Sept. 23 The Internal Revenue Serv ice disclosed in Washington today that it had no records of tax returns from Repre sentative Martin B. McKneally over a 10year period, includ ing two years he served as national commander of the American Legion.

title: Vote for Swiss Women Approved by Upper House
description: GENEVA, Sept. 23  The Council of States, the upper house of the Swiss Federal Parliament, approved without opposition today a Government proposal to give women. the vote in national elections.

title: Esteban Bilbao of Spain, ExPresident of Cortes
description: MADRID, Sept. 23 (Reuters) Esteban Bilbao, a leading government figure who served for 22 years, until 1965, as pres ident of the Cortes (parliament), died today at the age of 91.

title: Sayers Doubtful Starter
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 23 (AP)The Chicago Bears announced today that Gale Sayers was doubtful starter for Sunday's football game against the Phila delphia Eagles, because of a leg injury.

title: Sports Today
description: Yonkers Raceway, Central and Yonkers Avenues, 8 P.M.

title: Health Aide Urges Nixon to Sign Bill for U.S. Vaccination Drives
description: WASHINGTON. Sept. 23 Warning that several major preventable diseases are in creasing sharply, Dr. Paul B. Comely, president of the Amer ican Public Health Association urged President Nixon today to sign a bill authorizing fed erally supported vaccination programs.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Tanks from Syria were reported retreat ing in northern Jordan yesterday after counterattack by Jordanian troops and planes. In Amman, four captured Palestinian guerrilla leaders were said to have agreed to an arrangement with King Hussein that would amount to a guerrilla capitulation. But the agreement, and a subsequent call for a ceasefire, were repudiated by the guer rillas Central Committee. [Page 1, Cols. 58.]

title: A Neutral Nixon Is Reported To Favor Buckley Over Goodell
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23 The White House appears to have sent subtle signals to New York Republicans that it would not be disheartened by  and indeed might prefer  the election in November of James L. Buckley, Conservative party candidate for the Senate seat now held by Charles E. Goodell, Republican.

title: Inventive Furniture in Settings to Match
description: A walking table? That's what Barbara D'Arcy of Bloomingdale's calls it. The store's decorator knows full well that the table actually rolls on casters. But, she in sists, it looks like it's walk ing, Anyway, the casters are not visible. They are hidden from view under a boxlike. blackplastic cover that forms the base of the 21by30inch ta ble. The table glides phantom like from behind a motorized smoked acrylic panel, makes its way unassisted, traveling in a straight line behind the sofa, executing a 90degree turn and rolling merrily along until it comes to rest, when shoppers can see that there is coffee in the cups on the table's bronzed plastic top.

title: 2 Hypertension Researchers Cited
description: Dr. Irvine H. Page, 69 years old, former director of research at the Cleveland Clinic, and Sir George Picker ing, 66, of Oxford University were named yesterday to share equally the $50,000 Stouffer Prize for research in heart disease.

title: Searchers For Girl, 5, Use Copter
description: MONKTON, Vt., Sept. 23Federal agents, state troopers and local sheriffs trudged through thick underbrush as a National Guard helicopter hovered overhead in an in tensive search today for 5yearold LeahSarachik, who has been missing from her New York home since Sept. 10.

title: STUDENTS PROTEST WORLD BANK SESSION
description: COPENHAGEN, Sept. 23The rather staid annual meet ing of the World Bank and its sister organization, the Inter national Monetary Fund, has provoked an unusual series of demonstrations by leftwing Danish students who say the institutions are instruments of neocolonialism.

title: Witness Says Tate Defendant Talked of Slayings
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 23A witness in the Charles M. Man son murder trial testified today that she overheard one of the defendants tell a friend some of the details of the slaughter on Aug. 9, 1969, at the home of Sharon Tate, the movie actress.

title: Groups of Elderly Form Bloc to Seek Legislative Action
description: The mobilization of senior powerthe 1.4 million people in the state over 65 years of age who voteto get local, state and national governmen tal action meeting the needs of the aging was begun yes terday at 10 older Americans forums around the state.

title: Berger Is Player of Week
description: BOSTON, Sept. 23 (AP)The Boston Patriots 6foot8inch, 285pound end, Ron Berger, called The Whopper, was de signated by The Associated Press today as the National Football League's defensive player of the week for his play against the Miami Dolphins.

title: A Ray of Cheer
description: The Nixon Administration has reason to be cheered by the official announcement yesterday that living costs rose only twotenths of 1 per cent last month. No single month provides a reliable guide to price trends, but the August report on consumer costsespecially when coupled with the simultaneous decline of fourtenths of 1 per cent in the wholesale price indexdoes represent the strongest evidence thus far that inflationary pres sures are easing.

title: GOLDBERG PUSHES FOR RURAL VOTES
description: MIDDLEBURG, N. Y., Sept. 23Arthur J. Goldberg carried his Democratic campaign for Governor into this active ag ricultural community today with a prediction that he and local candidates would win in a sweep.

title: 3D JUROR CHOSEN IN PANTHER TRIAL
description: An unemployed elevator op erator who has lived on the Lower East Side all his life was sworn in yesterday as the third juror in the trial of 13 Black Panthers accused of plot ting to bomb public places.

title: Business in Queens Declines Along With Power
description: Miss Angie Oramas had only herself to beautify. She sat in her beauty parlor yesterday afternoon idly drumming her fingers on a desk, her blond locks wrapped around several pink curlers.

title: A Confident Hussein Feels That the Worst Is Over
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Sept. 23King Hussein flashed a Vfor Victory sign last night and de clared: I believe the brunt of the problem is over.

title: March of Dimes to Open Drive With Luncheon Oct.
description: The New York March of Dimes will open its annual fundraising campaign Oct. 19 with the 16th annual luncheon and fashion show of the Nelson Rosenthal Group in the Grand Ballroom at the WaldorfAstoria.

title: TV System to Aid 17 TriState Areas In Enforcing Law
description: Law enforcement officials in 17 tristate municipalities will be able to exchange immediate ly visual and audio information when a new regional television system goes into operation next spring. Photographs, finger prints and actual suspects will be available for immediate in spection by police officials, and training techniques can be shared by all participants.

title: Mr. Bull Terrier Finds Breed Vastly Improved on Visit Here
description: When the Bull Terrier Club of America held its annual specialty at the Ox Ridge Hunt Club in Darien, Conn., last week, there were 104 representatives of the breed from as far isCalifornia and Canada, the largest number ever, assembled on this con tinent.

title: White House PleasedSees Inflation Policy as Right Course
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23Consumer prices posted the smallest rise in nearly two years last month. The White House promptly hailed the de velopment as proof that Presi dent Nixon's antiinflationary strategy was working.

title: Daily Forward Names Editor
description: Simon Weber, a former man aging editor of The Jewish Daily Forward, has been elected the new editor of the Yiddish language daily. Mr. Weber joined the staff of The Forward 30 years ago, and has held a variety of positions, including those of feature writer, city editor and Sunday editor.

title: AMEX REGISTERS A BROAD ADVANCE
description: The American Stock Ex change made a broad advance yesterday as the exchange's price index closed, at its best level in almost five months in active trading.

title: The Summaries
description: 1, Scimitar, Olio Scherer and Gene Miller (11112; 2, Yankee Flyer, Greer Ellis and Warren Ackerman (32217; 3, Red Roo, Bill Hoiller and Bruce Geddes (233)8; 4, Weathercock, Chuck Milliken and George Patterson (445)13; 5, Patient Lady, Jerry Hubbard and Tony DiMauro (664)16; 6, Gamecock, Bill Sieane and Dave Hubbard (756)18; 7. Thunder Gary Kahn and Clark DuBois (5DNF7)21; 8, Albatross, Skio Banks and Warren Dar re, (8DNS8)26: DisabledSprinter, Herb Mu!queen and Keith Hord.

title: Worcester Priest is Slain
description: WORCESTER, Mass., Sept. 23 (AP)The Rev. John F. Sulli van, pastor of St. Joan of Arc Church, was found stabbed to death today in his office on the second floor of the church rec tory. The police later arrested Paul W. Listovicz, 30 years old, of Worcester and charged him with murder and armed robbery.

title: Philharmonic Benefit Concert Starts Off Buoyantly
description: As usual, the Pension Fund Benefit Concert of the New York Philharmonic preceded the opening of the subscrip tion season by two days. The Pension Fund Concert, which netted $30,000, took place on Tuesday evening in Phil harmonic Hall with Leonard Bernstein conducting, and the Russian pianist Alexander Slobodyanik as soloist.

title: Europeans Ask U.S. Assurance On Keeping Joint Space Effort
description: VENICE, Italy, Sept. 23American space officials were asked today for assurance that, if the West European nations scrapped their space programs in favor of a joint effort with the United States, the latter would not, in an economy move, back down.

title: SovietChinese Trade Pact Signed by Border Provinces
description: Soviet and Chinese provincial officials have signed an agree ment for local trade across the Amur River frontier in the Far East, the Soviet Government newspaper Izvestia reports.

title: Rabbi Morris Lieberman, 61; Led Baltimore Congregation
description: BALTIMORE, Sept. 24 (AP)Rabbi Morris Lieberman, active in civic affairs and spiritual leader of the Baltimore He brew Congregation since 1937, died yesterday at Sinai Hospi tal. He was 61 years old.

title: DECAVALCANTE IS FOUND GUILTY
description: NEWARK, Sept. 24Simone Rizzo (Sam the Plumber) De Cavalcante, reputed boss of a New Jersey Mafia family. was convicted by a Federal jury with two codefendants here tonight of conspiring to extort money from the operators of an illegal dice game.

title: East Harlem Block Sits for a Family Portrait
description: Serena Saunders was sit ting on a doorstep on East 101st Street yesterday with her 7monthold daughter, Deirdre, cradled in her lap. As soon as she saw Bruce Davidson she called out, Hey, will you photograph me and the baby?

title: James L. Gilbert, 87, Dies; Former McGrawHill Aide
description: WEST BROOKFIELD, Mass., Sept. 24 (AP)James L. Gil bert, a former vice president of the McGrawHill Publishing Company in New York, died yesterday at Mary Lane Hos pital in Ware after a long ill ness. He was 87 years old.

title: INKSLINGER SETS BELMONT RECORD
2d $1Million Lottery. Due, Starting Oct. 1
description: ALBANY, Sept. 24 (AP)The State will conduct a sec ond milliondollar lottery this year, the Tax Department announced today.

title: Adams Asks Chance To Tell His Views To State Labor Unit
description: Paul L. Adams, the Conser vative party candidate for Gov ernor, asked the New York State A.F.L.C.I.O. yesterday to hear his views before deciding on which candidate to endorse.

title: Articulate PopularVote Advocate
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 24If Senator Birch Evan Bayh Jr. has a full understanding of the art of the possible, as a political friend once said, he may yet win the fight for. Senate approval of his con stitutional. amendment for election of the President by nonular vote.

title: Goodell, at FundRaising Party, Declares I Need lt Desperately
description: Senator Charles E. Goodell made an appeal for cam paign contributions last night by telling a group of financial contributors: I need it desper ately.

title: Finch Tours Newark Slum, but 10 Black Democrats Charge That Visit Was to Aid Gross
description: NEWARK. Sept. 24Robert H. Finch, a personal counselor to President Nixon, toured a predominantly black slum neighborhood of Newark today, but some black Democrats ac cused him of making the tour in order to campaign for Nelson Gross, the Republican Senato rial candidate.

title: RESERVE PURSUES CREDIT EXPANSION
description: The Federal Reserve con tinued to pursue an expansive credit policy during the latest two weeks, banking data pub lished yesterday disclosed.

title: TV Review
description: Neil Simon, whose com edies have clicked on Broad way and in films, added to the serenity of the Internal Revenue Service by author izing embellishments of The Odd Couple and Barefoot in the Park as new situation comedy series on the Ameri can Broadcasting Company network. Both opened last night.

title: F. B. I. on Campus
description: President Nixon's call for Congressional action authorize Federal intervention in the wake of campus bombings or arson is so patently redundant that its motives as well as its effects raise serious questions.

title: APPEALS COURT BARS RACE BY M'CARTHY
description: ROCHESTER, Sept. 24 (UPI) A fivemember Appellate Court panel ruled unanimous ly today that Representative Richard Max McCarthy could not run for reelection in his 39th Congressional District under the Conservation party banner.

title: MEANY VOWS AID FOR HEALTH PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 24George Meany, head of the country's largest labor or ganization, told a Congressional committee today that national health insurance would inevitably become law even though the Administration was hostile to it.

title: MISLABELED NEWS HELD EXPERIMENT
description: Walter D. Engels, former news manager of WPIX, testi fied yesterday that during the Soviet invasion of Czecho slovakia in 1968 a news report on his station had represented a telephone report from Vienna as coming from Prague.

title: 15 Minutes to Zero
description: WOODS HOLE, Mass. Erasmus, the sage of the Early Ren aissance, distinguished between calm and tumultuous periods of history. The tumultuous ones were the periods of transition. The steeper the transition the greater the tumult. Never has man kind gone through a more turbulent period than ours, and never has man kind's fate hung, senselessly, on such a thin thread, as it does today. All our institutions have become outdated and ageold ideas fade out overnight. We have reached the maximum of inse curity and the ultimate biological ab surdity of preparing to wipe out life created by nature over billions of years.

title: Guerrilla Resistance Is Reported Collapsing in North as Fighting Ebbs in Amman
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Sept. 23 (AP)Palestinian guerrilla re sistance was reportedly col lapsing today in northern Jor dan before a Jordanian Army attack, and King Hussein ap peared to be regaining control of the country.

title: Nixon Aide Disputes Recession View
description: One of the Nixon Adminis tration's top economists reject ed yesterday a characteriza tion that the economy had been in a growth recession dur ing 1969 and 1970.

title: ExMayor Francisco Batista, Brother of Cuban Dictator
description: MIAMI, Sept. 24 (AP)Francisco Batista Zaldivar, brother of Fulgencio Batista, the former Cuban dictator, died here today of a heart attack. He was 59 years old.

title: Jackson to Lead Columbia Tomorrow
description: Another sophomore has won a starting quarterback job. This one is Don Jackson, who will make his varsity debut at Baker Field tomor row when Columbia opens its 1970 football season against Lafayette.

title: Envoy Uses Armored Car To Pay a Call on Hussein
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Sept. 24 (Reuters)  The new United States Ambassador to Jordan, L. Dean Brown, drove in an armored personnel carrier to present his credentials to King Hussein this morning at the Iroyal palace at Humar, 18 miles northeast of Amman.

title: HOLDERS FILE A SUIT ON GENERAL TIME TIE
description: A group of 15 stockholders, claiming ownership of 3,700 shares of the General Time Cor poration prior to its merger into Talley Industries, Inc., through their lawyer, William. Klein 2d, brought a $62.5 million damage suit yesterday charging fraud against Talley, Peat, Marwick, Mitchell & Co., Smith, Barney & Co., Inc., Lehman Brothers and the Amer ican Investors Fund.

title: Nation's Gold Stocks Also Declined
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 24 (AP)  The nation's imports rose to a record last month while exports fell, reducing the favorable balance of trade to its lowest point since April, the Commerce Department report ed today.

title: ... Unless, Like Everyone Else, You're Insecure...
Maynard, Prodded by Ewbank, Stars in Drill
description: The mysterious case of Don Maynard's inconsistency in practice sessions has Weeb Ewbank puzzled as to the wide receiver's status for the New York Jets game against the Patriots in Boston on Sun day.

title: G.M.RAISES PRICES ON CARS 4 TO 6%
description: DETROIT, Sept. 24  The General Motors Corporation today sharply raised its prices on 1971 cars and warned that another price increase might be ??.

title: JEANNE FOSTER, 86, EXLITERARY EDITOR
description: SCHENECTADY, N. Y., Sept. 24Mrs. Jeanne Robert Ollivier Foster, a leading figure in inter national literary circles from 1910 to 1930, who earlier had been a model and who later be came a social worker, died yes terday at the age of 86.

title: Safeway Profits Set Records In Quarter and 9Month Period
Mayor, in Bronx, Asks Information On Police Killer
description: Mayor Lindsay and other city officials coupled groundbreak ing ceremonies yesterday for new Bronx police station with a plea to residents in the Wake field section for information in the knife slaying Wednesday of a 23yearold offduty patrol man.

title: Sports of The Times
description: While 23 other bigleague managers gnawed at their fingernails last spring and worried about the season that was soon to begin, Earl Weaver of the Baltimore Orioles lolled in the Miami Stadium dugout and smiled a smile of seraphic contentment. All he he had to do was count his blessings.

title: Seaver Finds Slump Has a Mental Side
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept. 24Win or lose, the New York Mets will remember 1970 as the year they learned some harsh lessons, and No. 1 is that pitching is a fragile com modity.

title: SAILOR IN HIJACKING IS ILL IN CAMBODIA
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Sept. 24One of the two American seamen who hijacked an am munitions ship and won asylum in Cambodia six months ago is now confined in a mental hos pital near Pnompenh, according to United States officials fol lowing his case.

title: HOLTZMAN GAINS 17TH VICTORY, 11
description: ST. LOUIS, Sept. 24 (UPI)Ken Holtzman, aided by a sec ondinning homer by Joe Pepitone kept the Chicago Cubs in the thick of the Na tional eCague East race to night by stopping the St. Louis Cardinals on seven hits in 71 victory.

title: Victoria Tarpley Bride of Broker
description: Miss Victoria Goree Tarp ley and Gilbert Pierson Scha fer Jr., a partner of Pershing & Co., stockbrokers here, were married yesterday after noon in the Chapel of the Fifth Avenue Presbyterian Church by the Rev. Donald C. McFerren.

title: NEW POSTAL AIDES REPORTED CHOSEN
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 24 (UPI)A rancher, a former pro fessor, a labormanagement consultant and the heads of, several big businesses were re ported today to be among nine men who will be nominated by President Nixon to run the new United States postal service.

title: RIESSEN DEFEATS ROCHE ON COAST
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept 24 (UPI) Tony Roche of Australia, the thirdseeded player, was ousted, today by Marty Riessen of Evanston, III., 26, 62, 63, in a thirdround match of the 44th annual.$65,000 Pacific South west onen tennis tournament.

title: Changes in Rail Passenger Bill Held Unlikely to Delay Passage
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 24Key sources within the Nixon Administration and the Senate indicated today that they would have no difficulty accepting the House Commerce Committee's additions to the Federal loan guarantees for the preservation of rail passenger service.

title: Advertising: Guide to Research Services
description: The rise of the computer has helped to bring about matching increase in the number of research compa nies offering syndicated serv ices to the worlds of market ing and advertising.

title: 3 L.I.R. POLICEMEN CLEARED OF ASSAULT
description: Three Long Island Rail Road policemen who had been ac cused of beating a commuter who later died were acquitted yesterday by the unanimous vote of a threejudge Criminal Court panel.

title: Yiddish Theater Moves to Broadway
description: Mat staple Ot Second Ave nue, the Yiddish theater, will be denied to that region this season for the first time in many years.

title: G.M. Negotiations Go On But at a Leisurely Pace
description: DETROIT, Sept. 24 (UPI)Contract talks between the striking United Automotive Workers and General Motors moved at a leisurely pace today while both sides put pressure on local units to resolve their unsettled differences.

title: Criminal Laws Called Discriminatory to Women
description: Provisions in the State Cor rections Code that allow longer prison sentences for women than men for the same crime were among the many discriminatory practices ex amined yesterday at a public hearing on the status of wo men.

title: Big Savings and Loan Unit Cuts Rates for Mortgages
description: GLENDALE, Calif., Sept. 24 (AP)One of, the nation's larg est savings and loan associa tion; Glendale Federal, has announced an immediate cut in the prime interest rate it charges for home mortgages, saying it will provide a much needed stimulus to the real es tate market.

title: WEEK'S TRAFFIC OFF ON RAILS AND TRUCKS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 24Freight traffic on United States railroads and intercity truck tonnage last week were both below the volume in the cor responding week of 1969.

title: Pentagon Panel on Rights Arrives in West Germany
description: HEIDELBERG, West Ger many, Sept. 24 (AP)A Depart ment of Defense Panel on civil rights moved into West Ger many today to study growing racial tension at United States military bases.

title: Rates for U. S. Treasury Bills Show Drop at Weekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 24Treasury bill rates declined at today's auction from last week's levels, the Government reported late this afternoon.

title: Mrs. Noble, on 157, Leads In Jersey Golf by 9 Shots
description: WEST CALDWELL, N. J., Sept. 24Mrs. James Noble of Morris County shot a 37, 3976 today for a 157 total and the secondround lead in the 10th annual Garden State Women's Golf Association 54hole medal play championship at the Moun tain Ridge Country Club. Her margin is nine strokes.

title: DRUG ABUSE WINS DOCTORS'INTEREST
description: The experts who were invited to speak used such phrases as explosion of drug use and de scribed drug abuse as spread ing around the world like forest fire.

title: SCIMITAR RAISES CATAMARAN LEAD
description: ROWAYTON, Conn., Sept. 24 While adversity struck four of the other contenders and compelled their withdrawals, Otto Scherer and Gene Miller sailed blithely toward the world Class C catamaran champion ship today.

title: Gretel II Takes America's Cup Race
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Sept. 24The pallbearers were waiting at sea for Gretel II's America's Cup burial today, but the Australian challenger in the world's most celebrated yacht competition refused to be buried.

title: Lawsuit Challenges Exams for Principals as Discriminatory
description: The N.A.A.C.P. Legal De fense and Educational Fund, Inc., filed suit in Federal Court here yesterday to block tests determinging who would be eli gible to serve as principals of hundreds of city elementary schools in the next five years or more.

title: Racial Protest Halts C.C.N.Y. Project
description: Construction or a city um lege building was halted yester day because of fear of a con ?? between, workers anti picketing black and Puerto Rican construction workers, who demanded jobs on the project.

title: NEWS ANALYSIS
description: These newsanalysis articles reflect how the events in Jordan are interpreted in Cairo, Jerusa lem and Washington. National interests and vary ing factual information have produced different conclusions, including these on key factors in the crisis:

title: Dinner Oct. 13 to Aid Brandeis
description: Brandeis University of Waltham, Mass, has ar ranged a dinner dance here at the Plaza Hotel for Oct. 13 in behalf of its, scholar ship and fellowShip pro grams. Dwight Yellen of Deal, N. J., is chairman.of the event, of which S. O. Shapiro of New York is vice chairman.

title: G.E. SETS EXPANSION FOR TIMESHARING
description: The General Electric Com; pany let the world know yester day that it was still in the com puter business by announcing a major expansion of its com puter timesharing network.

title: Dr. John Toll of Stony Brook And Miss Taintor Betrothed
description: PORT JEFFERSON, L.I., Sept. 24  Dr. and Mrs. Charles Taintor have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Deborah Ann Taintor, to Dr. John Sampson Toll, son of Oliver. Wolcott Toll of Chevy Chase, Md., and the late Mrs. Toll. The wedding is planned for this fall.

title: Most Happy Fella Takes Little Brown Jug Before 45,111
description: DELAWARE, Ohio, Sept. 24  The Little Brown Jug, the timehonored pacing stake, that traditionally has been kind to favorites, wound up today with the prerace choice, Most Happy Fella, the victor after three onemile heats at the Dela ware County Fairground.

title: Jerusalem: The King's Army Is Now in Command
description: TIBERIAS, Israel, Sept. 24Israeli analysts believe that King Hussein's power is shat tered and that the real strong men in Jordan today are the army commanders, mostly Bed ouins, who have led the fight against the Palestinian guerril las.

title: Bruce Says Hanoi and Vietcong Haven't Shifted Basic Position
description: PARIS, Sept. 24David K.E. Bruce, chief of the United States delegation at the Viet nam peace talks, told delegates of the other side today that their proposals of last week had not changed their basic position.

title: 4 Charged With Murdering Boston Policeman at Bank
description: BOSTON, Sept. 24 (AP)The police obtained today war rants charging two women identified as students at Bran deis University and two men with murdering a policeman during a $26,000 holdup yes terday at a branch bank.

title: Cuba Returns Hijacker to U.S. In the First Action of Its Kind
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 24The Cuban Government, in the first action of its kind, returned an American airplane hijacker to the United States today.

title: HOUSE APPROVES STIFF DRUG CURBS BY 341406 VOTE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 24 The House passed tonight bill designed to crack down on narcotics traffic and use, but with reduced penalties for lesser drug violations. The vote was 341 to 6.

title: Weapons Testing Curbed Around Culebra by Navy
description: WASHINGTON, Sept 24 (AP) The Navy told the Senate to day that it was sharply restrict ing weapons exercises around the island of Culebra off Puerto Rico.

title: Chief of Relocation Named to Succeed Suspended Official
description: A member of Mayor Lindsay's staff was appointed Relocations Commissioner yes terday, succeeding an official suspended uspended When city authorities learned that he had been in dicted for alleged immigration law violations.

title: Venezuelan Students Fight Police Over School Reforms
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, Sept. 24 (UPI)Students protesting a governmentsponsored uni versity reform touched off street fighting in four cities today. The Education Ministry described the disorders as the work of a minority without moral authority.

title: DANIEL O'CONNELL, CITY HEALTH AIDE
description: Dr. Daniel J. O'Connell, Di rector of the Health Depart ment for Manhattan, died Wednesday of a heart attack in Montefiore Hospital. He was 59 years old and lived at 3260 Perry Apenue, the Bronx.

title: Gulf &
description: A company headed by Zsa Zsa Gabor, Miss Hungary of 1936 and a reigning queen on Broadway and television, may soon be swallowed up by a conglomerate. She is altogether happy about the prospect.

title: Egypt's Missile Offer
description: Now that Jordan seems to be calming down, the con tinuing buildup of Egyptian and Soviet SAM missiles the Suez truce zone in flat violation of the ceasefire agreement demands urgent attention as the chief ob stacle to revival of hope for peace negotiations between Israel and the Arabs.

title: Subdued Ali Applies for License Here
description: Muhammad Ali, shorn of both his boxer's license and his heavyweight championship 3% yeaks ago when he refused in duction into the armed services, made a formal and subdued application for a license yes terday at the offices of the New York State Athletic Com mission.

title: Greene Cards 5UnderPar 65 and Leads Green Island Golf by Shot
description: COLUMBUS, Ga., Sept. 24 (AP)Bert Greene, hampered since May by bursitis in his left shoulder, sank a 35foot birdie putt on the first hole today and carded a fiveunderpar 33, 3265 for the opening round lead in the $60,000 Green Island open golf tournament.

title: Staff and Course Cuts Ordered By Columbia in 28 Departments
description: Columbia University has or dered a reduction in teaching staff and the elimination of signficant number of courses in its 28 academic departments of arts and sciences.

title: Crime Fight Here Aided By a Grant
description: ALBANY, Sept. 24  The State Crime Control Planning Board has awarded $4million of Federal funds for combat ing crime to New York City, including nearly half a mil lion for eliminating delay and inefficiency in the Criminal Courts.

title: BADILLO SAYS JUDGE BARRED TESTIMONY
description: Herman Badillo said yester day there was only a oneina billion chance that irregular votes could have affected his victory in the June 23 primary iri the 21st Congressional Dis trict, but that a Queens Su preme Court justice prevented introduction of testimony to this effect before voiding Mr. Badillo's nomination.

title: Stock Prices Climb As Trading Surges
description: The stock market moved de cisively along the come back trail yesterday as volume on the New York Stock Exchange whooshed to 21.34 million shares in the second heaviest trading day on record.

title: Provost Is Promoted to 7th President of Stanford
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., Sept. 24Stanford University's trustees today named, the institution's secondranking academic offi cer, Dr. Richard W. Lyman, as Stanford's seventh president, succeeding Dr. Kenneth S. Pit zer.

title: Theater: Bob and Ray
Stowe Quits as Coach Of Columbia Oarsmen
description: Bill Stowe, an Olympic goldmedal winner in 1964, has resigned as Columbia's heavyweight crew coach, position he has held since 1967.

title: FRANK H. HIBBARD
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., Sept. 24Frank H. Hibbard, a former engineer with Bell Laboratories in Whippany, N.J., died here Monday at the age of 79.

title: Despite G.O.P. Wooing, Labor's Funds Still Go for Democrats
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 24 Despite economic troubles and reported conservative leanings, the nation's workers are send ing more money to union political organizations than in 1968.

title: Power Is Reduced For Third Day; Hot Weekend Due
description: Voltage cuts were imposed for the third successive day in the metropolitan area and the Middle Atlantic states yesterday as a hot, muggy blanket of smoggy air again led to a strain on the narrow reserves of electric power.

title: PARLEY TO ORGANIZE A STUDENTS'
description: WASHINGTON. Sept. 24 (AP) College presidents and stu dent government presidents from nearly 400 campuses be gin a weekend conference here tomorrow to organize a nation wide forum to improve the stu dent's image.

title: Books of The Times
description: What emerges from this painstaking, objective biography, which carries Douglas MacArthur's career up to Pearl Harbor, not so much how the general differed from his colleagues and coworkers, but how much he fit the mold of the conventional warrior. Those whose impressions of Mac Arthur gate from Wore! War ti will thinK of him as an offi cer or persona! style, noticeable in dividuality and charismatic leader ship. But they are likely to be more than a little abashed by the picture presented here. It is not one that diminishes his stature necessari ly, but it certainly takes away a good deal of the god head. MacArthur always had his own touch. No one, for example, is go ing to confuse his around speecnes witn the simple state ments of Dwight Eisenhower. But you will find that the Army career as divorced from the public hero in this part of the rec ord is hardly memorable.

title: Hardin Not Leaving Post, Aide Says, Denying Rumors
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 24 (AP) Despite a flood of rumors, Agriculture Secretary Clifford M. Hardin does not, plan to quit his job to take over as head of Purdue University or any other institution, one of his top assistants says.

title: Blender, at 80, Wants To Hold Senate Record
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 24 (AP)Senator Allen J. El lender, who has been in the Senate 33 years, said today, on his 80th birthday, that he wanted to serve longer in that chamber than any other man.

title: Ottinger Agrees to TWO More TV Debates
description: KIANIESHA LAKE, N. Y., Sept. 24Representative Rich ard L. Ottinger said today that he had agreed to two more tele vised debates with his Republi can and Conservative rivals for the United States Senate.

title: Photos Transform Experience Into Art
description: The great strength of pho, tography as an art often lies in its concreteness, in its power to isolate, define and ennoble a subject that, to the naked eye, is simply part of some larger and undiffer entiated mass. The camera eye of an astute photo graphic artist is not like the eye or me COM mon observer. Whereas the lat ter may bring an unfocused sym pathy to bear on certain subjects, the former is able to translate this sym pathy into a concrete visual perception.. The difference is between raw experience and experience expressed as art.

title: Teacher Dismissal Over War Protests Upheld by the State
description: ALBANY, Sept. 24The State Education Commissioner ruled today that a local school board had acted properly in dismissing a teacher for wear ing a black armband to class in support of last year's Viet nam moratorium activities.

title: Deborah Schoen Engaged to Wed George M. Stern
description: Miss Deborah Nan Schoen plans to be married in June to George Stern, who is Preparing for the rabbinate at the Hebrew Union College Jewish Institute of Religion in New York.

title: Luna 16
description: The successful accomplishment of Luna 16's mission in bringing to the Soviet Union its first samples of lunar soil is a magnificent achievement of which Russian sci entists have reason to be proud. Inevitably, comparisons are being made in the Soviet Union with the American manned flights to the moon, the Russians pointing out that an unmanned lunar materialretrieval device such as Luna 16 is cheaper than an Apollo spaceship, and can obtain samples of the moon without endangering human lives. Both points are correct; but it is also true that Apolloborne visitors to the moon can accomplish far more in covering wider areas, selecting samples material and obtaining greater knowledge of the moon.

title: GUERRILLAS COOL ON HOSTAGES'
description: A New York representative of the Palestinian guerrilla movement brushed aside as ir relevant yesterday the ques tion whether the 54 or 55 hi jacked hostages under its con trol were alive and well.

title: Possible Violations Indicated Among Penn Central Insiders
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 24 (AP) Available evidence strongly indicates that insiders of the moneytrouble Penn Central Railroad may have violated Federal securities laws, Repre sentative Torbert H. Macdon ald, Democrat of Massachusetts said today. He emphasized, however, that he was not taking the position that viola tions had actually occurred.

title: JACKLIN TAKES LEAD IN SCOTLAND ON 132
description: DALMAHOY, Scotland, Sept. 24 (AP)  Tony Jacklin, the United States Open champion, captured the lead from the United States Masters winner, Billy Casper, at the halfway point of the $24,000 Wills golf tournament today with sevenunderpar 65 that equaled the course record.

title: Optimist at the State Department
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 24Secretary of State Rogers is by nature an opti mistic man. No amount of deception by Moscow, or disappointing news from Saigon, or anarchy in the Middle East seems to depress his spirit. And while he has been criticized for under estimating the tangle of problems in Israel and the Arab world, he still remains hopeful that the ugly battles of the last few days have actually improved the chances of reviving the Peace talks in that area.

title: Wanted for Nixon Visit to Ireland: One Millhouse
description: DUBLIN, Sept. 24United States Embassy officials here have been scouring the Irish countryside for distant cOusins to meet President Nixon and Mrs. Nixonthe former Patricia Ryanduring their forthcoming visit here.

title: Pirates Win, 80, and Lead by 2 Games
China Reopens Universities, Shut 4 Years
description: HONG KONG, Sept. 24Three weeks ago a weary, dustcovered contingent of young men and women, some carrying hoes and shovels to symbolize their peasant origin, arrived on foot at Peking's Tien An Men Square after hav ing walked 50 miles from Tien tsin in four days.

title: Information System Begun on L.I.R.
description: A new centralized public ad dress system, designed to tell passengers when trains are run ning late, went into operation yesterday at all Long Island Railroad stations.

title: More Than You Wanted to Know About Those Hemlines..
description: Fashion and protest are no strangers to each other, but never has a new fashion encountered as much hostility or been embroiled in as much contro versy as the midi hemline, a length that hovers around the calf.

title: GUERRILLA CHIEF AGREES TO MEET ARAB DELEGATION
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Friday, Sept 25 Yasir Arafat, the Palestinian guerrilla leader, agreed early today to receive delegation representing Arab governments that are seeking to end the civil war in Jordan, now in its 10th day.

title: Paris Said to Reject a Brief Visit by Nixon
description: PARIS. Sept. 24  The White House was understood today to have proposed that President Nixon start his European trip a day earlier with a visit here Saturday, apparently in a ges ture to President Pompidou.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Activities. The President had breakfast with freshman and sophomore Republican Congressmen. He met with the Yugoslav Ambassador, Bogdan Crnobrnja, and later with Vice President Agnew. He also conferred with Jo seph Farland, Ambassador to Pakistan.The President signed a bill that adds the Secretary of Transportation to the Na tional Aeronautics and Space Council. Mr. Nixon declared the week of Oct. 25 as Amer ican Education Week.

title: Nation's Rail. Firemen Believe Their Job Is Vital
description: DETROIT, Sept. 24  Leo Walsh, a fireman on the Penn Central Railroad, believes. that firemen still have a vital job in keeping the nation's railroad runnine safely and efficiently.

title: CONFEREES VOTE ABM LIMITATION
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 24The antiballistic missile debate in Congress was ended today with a decision to restrict the Safeguard ABM system, to the protection of Minuteman inter continental missile bases.

title: Books of The Times
description: Ah, The Real Majority. What's a re viewer to do? John P. Roche, who once played Chingachgook to Lyndon Johnson's Natty Bumppo, growled out loud a month ago in The Washington Post about the credentials and orientation of critics likely to comment on this book. Mr. Nixon is known to have recommended it to his janissaries. Mr. Agnew is reputed to be acting on its substance. The syndicated columnists, Evans and Novak, suggest that it has contributed to the purgeGalbraith mood of the Democratic National Commit tee. Mr. Scammon, one coauthor, is a pub lic opinion consultant for Newsweek, which quotes him constantly. Mr. Wattenberg, the other coauthor, has gone to Minnesota to assist in the rehabilitation of Hubert Humphrey. Thus The Real Majority is a genuine pseudoevent. Reviewing it is like trying to use a smogball as a punching bag, while all the boys at the National Press Club bar go heehaw.

title: SUPPORT OF NIXON CITED BY BUCKLEY
description: MONTICELLO, N.Y., Sept. 24  James L. Buckley de clared today that he was the only choice New York voters had this year if they were interested in having a United States Senator who can work lin cooperation with the Nixon Administration instead of lob bing hand grenades at it.

title: The Screen: Sunflower
Aussies Hear Peal of Victory And This Time It's Not Hollow
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Sept. 24 Sourness turned to wine in Newport today. Heartburn gave way to smiles and bells chimed in the tower of the 17thcentury Trinity Church overlooking the harbor as victorious Gretel II entered a mob scene of hornblowing party boats.

title: COUNCILMEN ASSAIL EDUCATION BOARD
description: The Board of Education was accused yesterday of defiance and deceit in not supplying the City Council with a report on narcotics addiction in city schools.

title: FIELDS SEARCHED FOR MISSING GIRL
description: MONKTON, Vt., Sept. 24Two determined New York par ents stood vigil near an apple orchard here today while spe cial teams of state troopers completed.a futile field by field search for 5yearold Leah Sarachik.

title: TIMES GUILD VOTES SANCTION TO STRIKE
description: Members of The New York Times unit of the Newspaper Guild voted overwhelmingly yesterday to authorize guild of ficers to call a strike against the newspaper.

title: ... Or You Belong to One of the Protest Groups
description: They sound like names for crunchy new breakfast foods. And when you lump them all together, they look like the remnants at the bottom of a bowl of alphabet soup: SMACK, SOCK, POOFF, STEMS, MOXIE, WHIM, GAMS, FADD, MAMMA, BALL.

title: Rites for Dr. Alice Hamilton, Last of Three Noted Sisters
description: HADLYME, Conn., Sept. 24 (UPI)A funeral service for Dr. Alice Hamilton, who was a pio neer in the field of industrial medicine in the United States, was held today at her home here.

title: UNITED STATES EXPORTS AND IMPORTS
STOCKS IN LONDON CONTINUE TO GAIN
description: The London stock market continued to advance yesterday in active trading after absorb ing light profit taking.

title: STATE P.S.C. AIDE QUITS IN PROTEST
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 24Morton L. Simons, who has been Washington counsel for the New York State Public Service Commission for nine years, resigned today because of what he termed a drastic change in the commission,'s stand on consumerprotection issues.

title: Executive Changes
description: Andrew Lozyniak has been elected president and chief executive officer of the Dynamics Corpora tion of America. Walter E. Dennis, partner of Paine Webber Jackson & Curtis, was made a director and chairman of the finance committee.

title: I.O.S. Management, Ltd., Declares Quarterly Payout
description: GENEVA, Sept. 24  The board of Investors Overseas Services Management, Ltd., de clared today a thirdquarter dizidend of 20 Canadian cents.

title: Japanese Gesture on U.S. Trade Hinted
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, Sept. 24Signs have been re ceived by American officials that the Japanese Government is considering making an im portant gesture toward the United States that would im prove the trading climate be tween the two nations, it was learned today.

title: Irving J. Louis Sr. Dies at 86; Senior Vice President at Bache
description: Irving J. Louis Sr. a senior vice president of Bache & Co., Inc., international investment bankers, died yesterday at his home, 75 Central Park West. His age was 86.

title: 2 PIPELINE UNITS AGREE ON MERGER
description: The Panhandle Eastern Pipe Line Company announced yes terday it has agreed to acquire the Missouri Kansas Pipe Line Company through an exchange of stock worth about $24 million. Directors of both corn panies hive approved the agreement.

title: EDNA F. GELLHORN 91, EXST. LOUIS OFFICIAL
description: Mrs. Edna Fischel Gellhorn, a former Civil Service Commis sioner in St. Louis and widow of Dr. George Gellhorn, a noted gynecologist and member of the medical faculty of Washiington University, died yesterday in St. Louis, where she lived. She was 91 years old.

title: HUSTACE HUBBARD, EXCOTTON BROKER
description: W. Hustace Hubbard, a re tired New York cotton broker and former member of the board of managers of the New York Cotton Exchange, died Wednesday in Elizabethtown, N. Y., where he lived. His age was 89.

title: Ford Ends CutRate Rents On Cars for Congressmen
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 24 (UPI)The Ford Motor Com pany, prompted by a Senate ethics Committee admonition to legislators, announced today that it was abandoning its practice of leasing Lincoln Con tinentals and other luxury automobiles to members of Congress at heavily discounted rates.

title: Three Views of the Middle East Situation Cairo: The Israelis Remain the Major Enemy
description: CAIRO, Sept. 24The death, destruction and suffering in Jordan during the last week are viewed in Cairo as an in evitable result of the overall Arab need to end the dead locked conflict with Israel.

title: NonStop Rail Strike Deadlines
description: Train timetables are getting thinner and thinner these days, but the one thing never in short supply on the railroads is an impending strike deadline.

title: PENTAGON TO CUT 3 ARMY DIVISIONS IN NEXT 9 MONTHS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 24The Defense Department plans to cut three more divisions from the standing Army over the next nine months, bringing the number of divisions to the lowest point in more than 10 years. Additional cuts are under consideration.

title: Chilean Official Reports an Economic Crisis in Wake of Election
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Sept. 24  The Chilean economy went from expansion to recession al most overnight, according to the outgoing Government, after the election early this month that made a Marxist the prob able next President.

title: WOMEN NET REBELS PLANNING OWN TOUR
description: HOUSTON, Sept. 24 (UPI)The women tennis stars who bolted the United States Lawn Tennis Association to play in this, week's Virginia Slims invi tation tournament plan to make their break with the U.S.L.T.A. permanent and form their own tennis tour, Mrs. Billie Jean King said today. She said they hoped to start the tour with a series of tournaments on the West Coast, Texas, Boston and in Florida next January and February.

title: Goldberg Links Governor and Buckley
description: Arthur J. Goldberg said yes terday that Governor Rocke feller supported the White House in its reported accept ance of, if not preference for, James L. Buckley for the United States Senate.

title: INDUSTRYDEFENDS LEAD IN GASOLINE
description: Lead industry officials strongly opposed yesterday proposed law that would ban the sale of leaded gasoline. in the city by January, 1974.

title: SONGS BY D. NZOMO HIT UNIVERSAL NOTE
description: Several notes of universality were struck on Wednesday evening by D. (for David) Nzomo, a singer and guitarist from Kenya, in a concert at the Folklore Center, 321 Avenue of the Americas.

title: WATSON BEACH DAY
description: LITCHFIELD, Conn., Sept. 24 Watson Beach Day, who re tired in 1954 as chairman of the board of the Clark Estates, Inc., 30 Wall Street, New York, a management company, died] yesterday at his home on South Street. His age was 88.

title: Soviet Lifts Quarantine
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 24 (AP)The cholera quarantine im posed on the Caspian port of Astrakhan seven weeks ago has been lifted, it was an nounced today.

title: Bill to Ban Drilling Planned
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 24 (UPI)With legislation to can cel offshore oil leases in the Santa Barbara Channel dead for this Congress, Representative Charles M. Teague, Representa tive of California, said today he would introduce a new bill call ing for a temporary halt to drilling.

title: RentCut Hearings On Bronx Buildings Postponed by City
description: Rent reduction hearings scheduled in the Bronx as a re sult of the impact on services of a building workers Strike were postponed yesterday until 24 hours after the conclusion of a State Supreme Court hear ing that begins today on landlords challenge to the city's powers.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Recent events in the Middle East should do much to dispel many myths. Among them:

title: Feld, Replaced as Referee, Plans Suit and Asks Inquiry
description: Davey Feld, who was re placed as referee for the Floyd PattersonCharlie Green fight less than an hour before the bout on Sept. 15 and bodily ejected from Madison Square Garden by special policemen, said yesterday he planned to sue everyone responsible.

title: Market Place:
description: The last time traders took a ride on shares of Energy Conversion Devices was late in 1968.

title: LABOR CALLED BALKY ON NONWHITES'
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 21 (AP)  Arthur A. Fletcher, As sistant Secretary of Labor for Wages and Standards, accused labor unions today of exerting heavy influence in Congress to avoid fully opening their mem bership to nonwhites.

title: NATION RESTATES RESERVES POLICY
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark Sept. 24Secretary of the Treasury David M. Kennedy reasserted today the United States policy of converting foreignheld dollars into reserve assets such as gold, but noted that the United States is in passive positioh on this issue.

title: Realty Equities Reports Deficit Of $13,157,905 for Fiscal Year
description: The Realty Equities Corpora tion, a diversified real estate company also engaged in enter tainmentoriented businesses, reported yesterday a loss of $13,157,905, or $5.17 a share, after provision for recoverable taxes for the year ended March 31, 1970.

title: TREASURY BONDS DECLINE IN PRICE
description: Government bond prices de clined yesterday for the first time in two weeks as the trend toward lower interest rates lost some of its momentum.

title: ACTRESS'S STORY STIRS BOOK FAIR
description: FRANKFURT, West Germany, Sept. 24To moviegoers and buyers of her popular records, Hildegard Knef (Neff in the United States) is the sadeyed actress and huskyvoiced sing er of biting Berlin chansons that celebrate love and satirize society in the tradition of Lotte Lenva and Marlene Dietrich.

title: Ugly Clouds in the South
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y.As if the United. States were not sufficiently beset by problems in Southwest and Southeast Asia, it is about to enter new time of troubles in Latin America. Already two points of possible and probable danger are discernible.

title: U.S. and Soviet Ships Wait in Mediterranean
description: ABOARD U.S.S. INDE PENDENCE, in the Mediter ranean, Sept. 24Clustered around two aircraft carriers, the bulk of the United States Sixth Fleet is cruising 150 to 300 miles off the Mediterra nean Sea's east coast, capa ble of striking far inland.

title: GOVERNOR BACKED BY SANITATIONMEN
description: Governor Rockefeller was endorsed for reelection yester day by the Uniformed Sanita tionmen's Association as the union's president, John J. De Lury, repeatedly praised the Governor for refusing to call up the National Guard during the city's 1968 garbage strike.

title: Giant Scout Carries the News: Cowboys Boast Plenty of Guns
description: BROOKVILLE, L. I., Sept. 24As the New York Giants director of profes sional personnel and super scout it is part of Jim Trimble's job to stay one up on the opposition.

title: STOCKS ON AMEX SHOW ADVANCES
description: The American Stock Ex change came alive yesterday as prices made brisk advances in the heaviest trading of the year.

title: Nelson Play Marks Return of Rattigan To London Theater
description: LONDON, Sept. 24  Absent from the theater for seven years, Terence Rattigan returns with a piece that joins the growing list of middlebrow his tory plays with which the Westi End is rallying its old public.) A Bequest to the Nation at the Haymarket Theater is about Nelson and Lady Hamilton, and, apart from Zoe Caldwell's loose language as the hero's disrep utable consort, it could have been written at any time since Pinero.

title: Manson Witness Tells of Her Illness
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 24A prosecution witness who testi fied that she had overheard Susan Denise Atkins giving de tails of the murder of Sharon Tate said today that she had been in a mental hospital with in the last two weeks.

title: The Purchase and Use of Heroin A Common Sight at City College
description: With the same openness that some students hurl Frisbees and do homework on the major lawn of the City College cam pus, others congregate there to buy and use heroin.

title: Israel Cautions Hussein Against New Attacks
description: TEL AVIV; Sept. 24The Israeli Deputy Premier, Yigal Allon, warned King Hussein of Jordan tonight that his decisive military victory Meant he must accept full responsibility for guerrilla, actions along the ceasefire line with Israel.

title: PEABODY INSTITUTE NAMES 5 TRUSTEES
description: BALTIMORE, Sept. 24 (AP)Veronica Tyler, a soprano with the New York City Opera, and a Baltimore music educator were named yesterday as the first black members of the Pea body Institute's board of trus tees.

title: Nuptials Held for Miss Haiblum and Charles Hulten
description: Miss BurMa Haiblum and Charles Reid Hulten were married here last evening by Rabbi Hershel Levin at he Hampshire House.

title: Plummer to Get Honor and Regal Role
description: Christopher Plummer, who stopped here briefly on his way to Canada, where he will receive today his coun try's highest medal, will star this fall as Frederick the Great in a London production by Robert Whitehead.

title: Suspect's Death in Police Station is Under Study
description: The Manhattan District At torney's office is investigating the death of a man who was arrested by the police on Aug. 31 and died the next morning after spending the night in the 14th Precinct station.

title: Texas Swimming Coach Bars LongHaired Star
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Sept. 24 (UPI)Frank Salzhandler, University of Texas swim ming star, will appeal to the school administration the coach's edict that his shoul derlength long hair must be cut by Monday or he would be ruled off of the team.

title: STEPHEN E. FOLEY
description: Stephen E. Foley, a pressman for The, New York Times, died yesterday at his residence, 90 51 51st Avenue, Elmhurst, Queens. He was 72 years old.

title: WALKER SUBDUES EXPOS ON 7 HITS
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept. 24The New York Mets must have thought it was all a practical joke. They had heard that the Pittsburgh Pirates, the team they'll try to overtake this weekend, suddenly had forgot. ten how to reach home plate, and some of them came tonight to see such a funny sight.

title: Refugees Flown From Jordan Include Woman and 4DayOld Daughter
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Sept. 24About 60 Americans and other foreigners were evacuated from Amman today while shots rang out in the battered city around them.

title: TALKS RESUMED IN RAILS DISPUTE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 24Union, railroad and Govern ment officials resumed negotia tions today in the firemen's dis after agreeing early this morning to postpone a strike threat for two weeks.

title: Yonkers Tests Rule Out Drugging, but Not Doubts
description: YONKERS, Sept. 24The bizarre case of last night's mysterious eighth race, which was canceled because seven of the eight starters were listless and sweaty and ap peared to have been drugged, remained unsolved at Yon kers Raceway today when blood, urine and saliva tests of the eight horses came back negative.

title: Columbia Sets Fees for Facilities To Protect TaxExempt Status
description: Dr. William J. McGill, the president of Columbia Univer sity, has issued a set of rules on campus political.activity to avoid jeopardizing the taxex empt status of the university.

title: DR. ELSIE KENGLA
description: Dr. Elsie Regina Kengla, pro fessor emeritus of education at Hunter College died Wednes day at Flushing Hospital in Queens at the age of 71. A resi dent of Flushing, she had been on the Hunter College faculty for 39 years before her retire ment in 1962.

title: New Chairman Named at Irving Trust
description: Gordon T. Wallis, the 51yearold vice chairman of the Irving Trust Company, has been named the new chairman and chief executive officer of the bank, effective Dec. 13, it was announced yesterday. He will succeed George A. Murphy, 64, the present chairman and chief executive officer, who will retire on that date.

title: Anne Campbell, Michael T. Ryan Plan Marriage
description: ANN ARBOR, Midi., Sept. 24Miss Anne Carlisle Campbell, who expects to re ceive a master's degree in art history from the New York University Institute of Fine Arts next month, plans to be married in November to Midhael Timothy Ryan, who is studying for a Ph.D. in history at N.Y.U.

title: Bridge:
description: The old idea that it is mistake for husbands and wives to play bridge together may be due for revision, judging by some recent tour nament results. Several young married couples, most of them little known in expert circles, have captured major team titles in the New York metropolitan area during the last year.

title: Bayh, Seeking Vote on Electoral Plan, Ties Up Senate
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 24Senator Birch Bayh's campaign to force a Senate vote on the merits of electoral reform opence now gear today with no immediate prospect of suc cess.

title: EDUCATOR DOUBTS FULL INTEGRATION
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 24Complete integration of schools is neither legally required nor practically possible so the na tion should try other ways to improve the education of poor children, a Yale University law professor testified today.

title: 3 YOUTHS ARRESTED IN WILD CAR CHASE
description: Three youths riding in an unregistered car were arrested on the Lower East Side last night after a stopandgo chase An which they allegedly ran two red lights, sped away from two pairs of foot patrolmen who had halted them and col lided with a police carall in the space of four blocks.

title: Luna 16 Returns to Soviet With Rocks From Moon
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 24The So viet Union's Luna 16 landed successfully today in Soviet Kazakhstan, completing the first round trip flight by an un manned spacecraft to the sur face of the moon.

title: BOMB EXPLODES NEAR 2 MISSIONS
description: A 10inchlong pipe bomb ex ploded in a women's rest room yesterday near offices of the Japanese and Kuwait Govern ments at 235 East 42d Street. No one was injured in the blast, which demolished a toilet and shattered tile.

title: Call of the Sea
description: There is nothing new about corporations evading the statutes governing campaign contributions, which are notorious for being nine parts loophole to one part law. Figures compiled by the Citizens Research Foundation show that 49 companies heavily involved in production for defense and space exploration put up $1,235,402 the elections of 1968, much of it through the numerous evasions invited by the Corrupt Practices Act.

title: 52 U.S. War Deaths for Week Equal Lowest Toll Since 1966
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 24 (UPI)  The United States command said today that 52 Americans were killed in the Vietnam war last week and 333 were wounded. The number killed, the same as reported for the week ended Aug. 22, was the lowest in nearly four years.

title: Jury Recommends Death
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 24 (AP)A Circuit Court jury has recom mended the death penalty for Charles H. Connolly, 26 years old, convicted of fatally shoot ing a Chicago policeman and wounding his partner. Judge Robert J. Downing set Oct. 21 for sentencing and hearing post trial motions.

title: The Visit of General Ky
description: Vice President Nguyen Cao Ky is a nimble politician but he cannot bring off his pose of wideeyed innocence about his trip to Washington to address a winthewar rally next week. He is coming to help his extreme right wing sponsors pressure the Nixon Administration to scrap its policy of Vietnamization, with gradual American withdrawal, and revert to a delusive victory strategy. He is coming to help undermine whatever chance there may be for negotiating a Vietnam settle ment in Parisan effort to which his own Government, as well as the United States is officially committed.

title: Assailed on ATests, French Quit Session in Fiji
SOYBEAN FUTURES ADVANCE BRISKLY
description: Soybean futures took the spotlight yesterday on the Chi cago Board of Trade as buying bec,ame brisk shortly after the, opening and improved steadily until the last half hour, when profit taking set in.

title: Soviet Honors Original Stakhanovite
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 24Alek sei G. Stakhanov, the coal miner whose name became the catchword for the super worker in the nineteen thirties and forties, has been restored to public attention by being designated a Hero of Socialist Labor the high ect civilian honor.

title: Black Roots, a Film on Racial Concern
description: Black Roots, a documen tary of racial concern, which Lionel Rogosin, the director producer, presented in the special events portion of the New York Film Festival, had its official theater opening yesterday at the downtown Bleecker Street Cinema. For all the burning sincerity of this picture, and its fine blues numbers, the effect is frag mentary and unforceful.

title: Three Shot in Guatemala
description: GUATEMALA, Sept. 24 (Reu ters)Two policemen and man believed to be a deserted from the proCastro Rebel Armed Forces were shot to death today in two separate in cidents.

title: Sophia Loren Scores Hit in Mass Interview
description: Sophia Loren, standing alone on the Music Hall's vast stage, scored a personal hit in a mass interview with about 100 newspaper, radio and television reporters and a capacity audience of 6,000 before the first showing yes terday morning of Sun flower, her latest film.

title: U.S., CZECHOSLOVAKIA SPLIT CHESS ROUND
description: SIEGEN, West Germany, Sept. 24The United States and Czechoslovakia split their game, points, 22, in the fourboard ninthround match here this morning, when all adjourned games were completed. Thus the United States team has posed 20 of a possible 36.

title: MRS. FERDINAND PECORA
description: Mrs. Florence Waterman Pe cora, wife of Ferdinand Pecora former State Supreme Court Justice, died yesterday in St. Clare's Hospital. She was 88 years old and lived at 15 West 72d Street.

title: San Diego Cleans Up OnceDirty Bay as Model for U.S.
description: SAN DIEGOIn this sea washed city where the sun shines an average of 353 days a year and the mean high tem perature of the coldest and warmest months varies by only 14 degrees, autumn comes im perceptibly.

title: 3 Editors Sworn In as Jurors In Trial of 13 Panthers Here
description: Three editors were sworn in yesterday as members of the jury that will try 13 Black Panthers for plotting to bomb public places. They bring the total chosen to six.

title: MacDonald Is Appointed Canadian Defense Minister
description: OTTAWA, Sept. 24Donald S. MacDonald, a 38yearold Toronto lawyer who has won election in the House of Com mons four times, became Can ada's Defense Minister today. succeeding Leo Cadieux, now Ambassador to France. He is known to support Prime Min ister Pierre Elliott Trudeau's retrenchment policies.

title: Massachusetts vs. Laird
description: These are excerpts from the Govern ment brief filed Sept. 22 in the U.S. Supreme Court replying to Massachu setts challenge of the legality of the Vietnam war. It was signed by Solici tor General Erwin N. Griswold and Assistant Attorney General William D. Ruclzelshaus:

title: Stock Prices Rise As Volume Surges
description: Stock prices climbed yester day as trading volume on the New York Stock Exchange soared to 21.4 million shares the secondhighest turnover on record.

title: Japan Is Told B52's to Quit Okinawa
