description: TOKYO, Sept. 24The United States took an important step toward removing a major ir ritant in relations with Japan today by notifying the Japanese Foreign Ministry that it would soon remove B52 bombers from Okinawa.

title: ALFRED IDDLES, LED BABCOCK &
description: BOZEMAN, Mont., Sept. 24Alfred Iddles, the former presi dent of the Babcock & Wilcox Company, a supplier of conven tional and nuclearpower sys tems and components, died here yesterday. Be was 80 years old.

title: Dance Projects Granted $148,976 By Endowment
description: The National Endowment for the Arts has awarded $148,976 in dance fellowships for the creation of 18 works by 16 choreographers. The total grant to each choreog rapher will encompass a set fee and funds for dancers salaries for a fourweek re hearsal period.

title: Fishing and Boating Outlook for This Weekend
South Carolina Jury Chosen to Hear Riot Case
description: ORANUEBURG, S. C., Sept. 24A jury of nine whites and three blacks was selected in tightly guarded courtroom here today to hear riot charges against Cleveland L. Sellers Jr.

title: F.C.C. Stands BY Its Ruling Ordering G.O.P. Broadcast
description: WASHINGTON Sept. 24The Federal Communications Commision declined today to reconsider its ruling that the Columbia Broadcasting System must let the Republican Na tional Committee respond to the loyal oppositian broad cast last July by Lawrence F. O'Brien, the Democratic chair man.

title: Store Sales Up Last Week
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 24The Department of Commerce reported today that department store sales last week rose to an estimated $733million, an increase of 7 per cent above the $684million sales for the corresponding week of last year.

title: Stevenson Eyes Suburbs For Key Vote in Election
description: OAKLAWN, M., Sept. 22Outside the new splitlevel house on the new, largely tree less block, a sign proclaimed: This Home Is a Stevenson for Senitor Home Headquarters.

title: Home Calls on the U.N. to Act in Mideast Crisis
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Sept. 24The British Foreign Secretary, Sir Alec Douglas Home, called today for urgent United Nations action to end the horrifying series of events in the Middle East. However, he ruled out the idea of foreign intervention.

title: 3 Charged in Fire at Office Of Draft Board in Cortland
description: CORTLAND, N. Y., Sept. 24  Two young men and a young woman were arrested late last night and charged with setting a fire last Thursday that heav ily damaged a building contain ing the local draft board of fices.

title: Pirates Are 27 to Win East Crown
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Sept. 24 Jimmy (The Greek) Snyder doesn't think much of the Mets chances to catch Pitts burgh in the National League East baseball race.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Yasir Arafat, the leader of the Palestinian guerrillas fighting the Jordanian Army, said early today that he would be willing to meet with the President of the Sudan, who heads an Arab mission seeking to end Jordan's civil war. The agreement came after the resignation and disappearance yesterday of Jordan's Premier, Brig. Mohammed Daoud, in Cairo. [Page 1, Column 8.]

title: BRISTOL IS REHIRED AS BREWERS'
description: MILWAUKEE, Sept. 24 (UPI)  Dave Bristol, who was dis charged a year ago after pilot ing Cincinnati to third place in the National League, was re hired today as manager of the Milwaukee Brewers of the American League  a fifth place team.

title: 2 Railroaders Die in Crash
description: ZWOLLE, La., Sept. 24 (AP) Two railroad men were killed last night when their freight train rammed the rear of pulpwood train standing on the mainline track. The dead were identified by the Sabine Parish authorities as Marion L. Har well, the engineer, and Ross A. tar well. both of Shreveport.

title: Washington: The First Round Goes to Hussein
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 24The President, the Secretary of State and the Attorney General went off golfing at Burning Tree this afternoon (with, of all people, George Meany, the labor leader) to celebrate the end of the most nerveracking week of the unending crisis in the Middle East.

title: U.S. GOLFERS KEEP LEAD IN MADRID
OBJECTOR CADET NOW ENLISTED MAN
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., Sept. 24 (AP)A United States Mili tary Academy spokesman said today that Cary Donham, the cadet who tried to leave the academy as a conscientious ob jector, had formally departed as an enlisted man on leave.

title: 205 Wounded Jordanians To Be Sent to West Bank
description: JERUSALEM, Sept. 24Red Cross officials here have ar ranged for the transfer of 205 wounded Jordanians tomorrow to hospitals in the Israelioc cupied west bank.

title: Master of Gypsy Violin to Play Here
description: The greatest gypsy violin ist of all Hungary, in the opinion of many connoisseurs of the gypsy violin, is Sandor Lakatos, and he would not strenuously disagree. I hope you realize, he cautioned a visitor during a rehearsal break in the Abbey Victoria Hotel ballroom, that this is not the average level of gyp syviolin playing in Hun gary.

title: Erich Maria Remarque Is Dead; Novels Recorded Agony of War
description: GENEVA. Sept. 25Erich Maria Remarque, the German born author who attained world fame with his World War I novel All Quiet on the Western Front, died at noon today of a heart collapse at the Sant Agnese clinic at Lo carno, Switzerland. He was 72 years old.

title: Disputed Oil Estate Held Almost Worthless
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 25 (AP)The estate of the late oilman A. Otis Birch, reputed toi be worth $200million and the object of a threeyear court battle, may be almost worthless, according to at torneys in the case.

title: Laurie Hand To Be Bride
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 25Mr. and Mrs. Jack Cookrnan Hand have announced the en gagement of their daughter, Miss Laurie Lee Hand, to Richard Louis Baggelaar of New York, son of Mr. and Mrs. Richard L. H. Baggelaar of Roslyn Estates. L. I.

title: GRAHAM PRESENTS PROGRAM FOR PIANO
description: A program that was well balanced and intelligently planned received playing of the same order from Dania Graham, a pianist who gave his first local recital in Car negie Recital Hall on Thursday night.

title: WISE'S 5HITTER CHECKS CHICAGO
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 25 (AP)Successive home runs by Tim McCarver and Don Money in the sixth inning helped the Philadelphia Phillies post a 53 victory tonight over Chicago, jolting the tubs National League Eastern Division title hones.

title: GUERRILLAS HOLD 3 TOWNS IN NORTH
Copper Mine Caves In, Trapping 80 Zambians
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, Sept. 25 More than 80 copper min ers were feared dead tonight after being trapped by mil lions of tons of sand, water and mud that collapsed on them early today at Zam bia's Mufulira copper mine. It was the worst mine dis aster in Zambia's history.

title: Americans Get 111 Stamp Awards in London
Angelo Rizzoli Is Dead in Italy; Publisher and Film Producer
description: MILAN, Italy, Sept. 25Angelo Rizozli, the publisher and film producer who headed a communications empire, died last evening at the Columbus Clinic here. He was 80 years old.

title: BULLS LOSE, 2414, TO BRIDGEPORT JETS
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Sept. 25 Harry Theofiledes, a quarter back, combined with Roger Mi lici, a wide receiver, on two long touchdown pass plays in the second half tonight to carry the Bridgeport Jets to a 2414 victory over the Long Island Bulls. The Atlantic Coast Foot ball League game was played before a nearsellout crowd of 7,428 at Hofstra Stadium.

title: DEPOSITS FLOWING INTO THRIFT UNITS
2 PANTHERS PLEAD IN RACKLEY CASE
description: NEW HAVEN, Sept. 25 Two women members of the Black Panther party pleaded guilty to reduced charges to day in the slaying of Alex Rackley, opening the way for the trial of the Panther na tional chairman, Bobby G. Seale, and another woman member of the party.

title: Stanton, Toscano Card 136 to Share Green Island Lead
description: COLUMBUS, Ga., Sept. 25 (AP)Bob Stanton of Australia and Harry Toscano of New Cas tle, Pa., young golfers without victory on the pro tour, fired par 70's today and tied at 136 for the halfway lead in the $60,000 Green Island open tour nament.

title: U.S. WARNS SOVIET NOT TO BUILD BASE FOR SUBS IN CUBA
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 25The White House, recalling the MoscowWashington under standing that ended the Cuban missile crisis of 1962, warned the Soviet Union today against building a strategic submarine base in Cuba.

title: Stockholdings Of Insiders
Music: Bernstein Leads Sze11 Tribute
Mayor, Scoring I. L. A. Pickets, Moves Pier Fete to Central Park
description: Mayor Lindsay announced yesterday that the picketing of a West Side pier by longshore men had forced the city to shift the locale of a major experi mental recreational program away from the waterfront. He called it nothing less than an outrage that the Manhattan 1. L. A. has interposed its will against the people of this city.

title: In Amman Hospital, Wounded Cry for Bread and Water
description: AMMAN, Sept. 25  The first reporters to visit a Jor danian hospital since the out break of civil war found jammed with almost triple its capacity in wounded patients, moaning and crying out for water and bread.

title: HENRY WALDMAN, 95, CHILD BENEFACTOR
description: Henry Waldman, a retired lawyer and a founder of the Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Children, died Thurs day at the Florence Nightin gale Nursing Home. He was 95 years old and lived at 1199 Park Avenue.

title: Drugs: Case for Legalizing Marijuana
description: It is possible to stop most drug ad diction in the United States within very short time. Simply make all drugs available and sell them at cost. Label each drug with a precise description of what effectgood and badthe drug will have on whoever takes it. This will require heroic honesty. Don't say the marijuana is addictive or dangerous when it is neither, as mil lions of people knowunlike speed, which kills most unpleasantly, or heroin, which is addictive and difficult to kick.

title: 9 WOMEN PLAYERS DRAW U.S.L.T.A. BAN
description: HOUSTON, Sept. 24 (UPI) Mrs. Billie Jean King and the eight other women who joined her tennis rebellion were ex peled today from the United States Lawn Tennis Associa tion for becoming contract pros.

title: Hendrix Died Without Will; $500,000 Estate to Father
description: Jimi Hendrix, the rock gui tarist, died without leaving will disposing of his estate es timated at $500,000, aocordini to a petition filed yesterday it Surrogate Court.

title: Open House
description: The House of Representatives has made progress opening up its procedures to public scrutiny. The reform bill which the House debated in desultory fashion for two months before the August recess and has now passed overwhelmingly puts an end to unrecorded teller votes. It also eliminates an occasion for hypocrisy which members secretly voted one way on critical amend ments and the other way publicly on final passage.

title: PRODUCTION Of CARS REPORTED FOR WEEK
description: DETROIT, Sept. 25 (AP)Following are the weekly auto mobile production figures:

title: Jewish Museum's Software Confusing
description: A bit more ready for criti cal viewing than it was at this time last week, Soft ware, the new show about information processes at the Jewish Museum, turns out to be less of an art show than a confusing, capricious and sometimes fascinating educa tional display. It certainly will put some old brains (like me) less in touch with new art, however, than with memories of futuristic ex hibits in old World's Fairs and museums of science and industry.

title: Soviet Hints It Got Cooperation of U.S. In Jordanian Crisis
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 25Soviet officials have indicated to senior Western diplomats here that the Kremlin's effort to persuade Syria and Iraq not to intervene in the Jordan crisis were aided to a considerable degree by the American mili tary buildup in the eastern Mediterranean

title: LAYER TOPS SMITH IN COAST TOURNEY
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 25 (UPI) Rod Laver of Australia, who is topseeded, won the final five games of the third set to beat Stan Smith of Pasadena, Calif., 63, 46, 61, today and ad vanced to the semifinals of the $65,000 Pacific Southwest open.

title: HOLLINGS ATTACKS NIXON ON DISCORD
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 25Senator Ernest F. Hollings of South Carolina accused the Nixon Administration tonight of feeding upon the disunity, of the nation.

title: Kathy Kusner Gets License
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Sept. 25 (UPI)The Jockey Club of South Africa granted a temporary license to day to permit Kathy Kusner of Arlington, Va., to ride in this country. Miss Kusner has been booked to ride in five races Saturday at the Fontein track.

title: Yugoslavia After Tito
description: At 78, President Tito is still remarkably vigorous. Nevertheless it has become increasingly evident that is much preoccupied with sparing his country the agonies of a prolonged succession strugglesuch as that which shook the Soviet Union after Stalin's deathonce he has passed from the scene or been incapacitated.

title: Phil Foster Denies Charge of Lying in Furniture Deal
description: NEWARK, Sept. 25 (UPI)Phil Foster, the comedian, pleaded not guilty today to charges that he lied to a Fed eral grand jury about how much he paid for furniture from a reputed leader of or ganized crime. He was freed on $2,500 personal recogni zance bond. Mr. Foster re mained silent while his lawyer entered the plea of not guilty to each of the five counts in the indictment.

title: Floods Ravage Dahomey
description: COTONOU, Dahomey, Satur day, Sept. 26 (AP)Torrential rains and floods have made thousands of people homeless in this west African state in the last few days and destruc tion of crops threatens thou sands more with famine, Oov ernment officials said today.

title: Nixon to Name U.N. Delegate
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 25 (AP) President Nixon announced Friday that he would nominate Christopher H. Phillips to be deputy United States repre sentative to the United Nations, succeeding William B. Buffum, who has become ambassador to Lebanon. Mr. Phillips, 49 years old, has been deputy representa tive to the Security Council since last year.

title: UR GOLFERS LEAD WITH A 640 TOTAL
description: MADRID, Sept. 25 (Reuters) The United States team con tinued to play steady, unspec tacular golf today and increased its lead in the Eisenhower Trophy world amateur team championship to nine strokes with one round to play.

title: Pilots Ask F.A.A. For Bulletproofing On All Big Planes
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 25 (AP) The Air Line Pilots Associa tion asked the Federal Avia tion Administration today to require installation of bullet proof cockpit doors and bulk heads in all large passenger planes.

title: BETTER SEAT BELTS FOR PLANES ASKED
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 25The National Transportation Safety Board said today that it had urged the Federal Avia tion Administration to promul gate strict new restrictions af fecting the design of airliner seat belts, stowage of life vests and emergency warnings to passengers.

title: 400 IN GAY PROTEST DISPERSED BY POLICE
description: The police fired at least one shot in the air last night to disperse a chanting crowd of 400, persons, many of them homosexuals, who had gathered in Greenwich Village to protest the refusal of New York Uni versity to let them hold a dance in a dormitory.

title: DEMOCRATS DECRY A NIXON TELECAST
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 25The Democratic National Com mittee demanded today that the Justice Department investigate four corporations for sponsor ing rebroadcasts in 14 cities of President Nixon's televised speech last week on campus un rest.

title: Apartment Union and Owners In Dispute Over Pacts Signed
Armco Plans Cut for Steel Pricing
Refund Is Sought By Letter Carriers In Special Delivery
description: A union of letter carriers asked a Federal Court yester day to declare that there was no longer anything special about the United States Post Office's special delivery mail, and to order the Government to refund to mail users $5mil lion in extra postage.

title: ADAMS HIGH SCORES OVER CLINTON, 120
description: Ken Smith, one of the lead ing football scorers in Queens last season, scored both touch downs yesterday to pace Adams to a 120 Public Schools Ath letic League victory over Clin ton at Wilson Field, Ozone Park. Oueens.

title: German and Polish Aides Hold TwoHour Talk at U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Sept. 25  Foreign Minister Walter Scheel of West Germany and Deputy Foreign Minister Josef Winiewicz of Poland met for two hours today in an effort to speed negotiations on the normalization of relations be tween their countries.

title: Retrial of Huey Newton Is Scheduled for Jan. 11
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Sept. 25 (UPI)Superior Judge Harold B. Hove today set Jan. 11 as the date for the second man slaughter trial of Huey P. New ton in the 1967 killing of an Oakland policeman.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: THE PRESIDENT

title: Bond Rally Listed Today
description: A special United States Sav ings Bonds rally will be held at Yankee Stadium at 1:30 P.M. today, before the New York YankeeDetroit Tiger baseball game. It is part of the Fan Appreciation Day ceremonies. Nine $25 bonds will be given away, one after each inning.

title: Antioch Orthodox Church Elects a New Patriarch
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Sept. 25 (AP)Bishop Elias Muawad of Aleppo, Syria, was elected to day the 163d patriarch of the Greek OrthodoxChurch of Antioch and the entire East. He will reign as Patriarch Elias IV.

title: Stuff of Arab Legends
description: He does not look to be the stuff of which legends are made.

title: Antiques: Glass of an Era
description: Glass collectors are willing to pay a premium for the American version of Bohemi an glass, so it is important to be able to distinguish it from European work.

title: China Terms U.S. Restless
description: HONG KONG, Sept. 25 (Reuters)  Communist China, in a dispatch by the official press agency,. Hsinhua, said to day that President Nixon was as restless as a hen on a hot griddle and denounced what the dispatch described as United States saberrattling in the Middle East. Commenting on a United States troop alert linked with the Jordanian situ ation, the dispatch said the troop deployment and saber rattling of the Nixon Adminis tration can by no means cover up United States imperialism's feeble nature of a paper tiger.

title: Cambodians Report Capture of Tangkok as Enemy Troops Retreat
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Sat urday, Sept. 26  Cambodian troops captured the enemy stronghold of Tangkok late yes terday after they had been stalled for two weeks, a Gov ernment spokesman announced this morning.

title: DR. JOHN G. GLOVER, TAUGHT AT N.Y.U.
description: Dr. John George Glover emeritus professor of manage ment at the New York Uni versity School of Commerce, died Wednesday in Presby terian Hospital, Newark. HE was 75 years old and lived at 22 Fairway Drive, West Orange, N. J.

title: Intersectional Battles Top Day's Slate
description: Woody Hayes brings Ohio State out of hiding, Syracuse tries to solve a sensitive problem, Penn State takes its winning streak into the Rockies and Purdue climbs its annual mountain against Notre Dame.

title: Senate Votes Veterans Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 25 (AP) The Senate approved legisla tion today extending veterans educational and homeloan benefits to the wives and chil dren of American servicemer missing in action or known to be prisoners of war. The meas ure was sent to the House.

title: Nightmare for Parents
description: ALBANY, Sept. 25 (AP)For Mr. and Mrs. Eliot Saxe, the parents of Susan Saxe, last night was a nightmare that dragged on and on.

title: BIG BOARD ASSIGNS BLAIR LIQUIDATION
description: The New York Stock Ex change announced late yester day that it had appointed a liquidator for Blair & Co., one of its most troubled member firms, and disclosed that the exchange's Special Trust Fund probably would be used in, the concern's liquidation.

title: Mrs. Larkin Wins Golf Final
description: LOCUST VALLEY, L. L., Sept. 25Mrs. Vincent Larkin, Nas sau, wonthe 42d annual Wom en's Long Island Golf Associa tion matchplay championship today by defeating Lynn Bol lenbach, Southward Ho, 1up, in a 36hole final at the Creek Club.

title: Public Office, Public Trust
description: Former Mayor Hugh J. Addonizio of Newark has been convicted and sentenced on sixtyfour counts of extor tion and conspiracy. The new Mayor, Kenneth A. Gibson, has discovered that Newark was paying about ten per cent more than it should have been paying on virtually every contract to cover the cost of kickbacks to city officials.

title: Frankfurt, a Clean City, Still Relies on Broom
description: FRANKFURT, West Ger many, Sept. 9Often nick named Little New York be cause of its hectic pace and milling crowds, this ancient city on the sewageblackened Main River has managed to preserve a high standard of street cleanliness.

title: Insurers'
description: A major segment of the in surance industry declared here yesterday that crime in the cities had reached such stagger ing proportions that the cost, of providing burglary and theft coverage should be borne by the Federal Government.

title: Japanese Rocket Fails
description: UCHINOURA, Japan, Sept. 25 (AP)Japan's first satellite designed to gather data on space failed. to go into orbit today when its fourth stage apparently did not ignite. Scien tists said they lost track of the 77foot rocket 16 minutes after blastoff from the Uchinoura space station.

title: Brush Fires Destroy 100 Coast Homes
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 25 At least 100 homes were de stroyed tonight and several hundred more were badly dam aged as two windwhipped brush firesswept out of control across the tinderdry hills of Loc Angeles County.

title: PARIS ORCHESTRA DESIGNATES SOLTI
description: PARIS, Sept. 25Georg Solt] will take over from Herbert von Karajan as conductor of the Orchestre de Paris in November of next year.

title: Scores on WOXR
description: Scores of leading football games will be given over WQXR, on the 6 P.M. news broadcast and in other news reports. Please do not telephone The New York Times for scores; the calls tie up lines and interfere with the work of the newspaper and radio station.

title: Girl Denied Spot on Boys'
description: A 16yearold high school girl filed a complaint with the City Commission on Human Rights yesterday charging the Board of. Education with arbitrary and unreasonble discrimina tion in refusing to allow her to play on a boys tennis team.

title: Walinsky Endorses Badillo
description: Adam Walinsky, Democratic candidate for State Attorney General, yesterday endorsed Herman Badillo, former Bronx Borough President, in the spe cial primary election to be held Oct. 8 in the 21st Congressional District. Last Wednesday, Queens Supreme Court justice voided Mr. Badillo's nomination in a sixway primary held June 23 because of alleged irregular votes. Mr. Badillo has said he plans to appeal the decision.

title: P. B. A. Offers Reward
description: The Patrolmen's Benevolent Association offered a $5,000 reward yesterday for informa tion leading to the arrest and conviction of the man who killed Patrolman Michael Paolillo in the Bronx Wednes day morning. Mr. Paolillo had 17 stab wounds when he was found in a hallway at 3040 Cruger Avenue. Anyone with information on the slaying is asked to call 2313818.

title: 102 Flown Out to Beirut, 22 of Them Americans
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Sept. 25 (AP)Planes evacuated 102 refugees from Jordan to Beirut today. Twentytwo of them were Americans.

title: End of R.O.T.C. Unit Urged
description: WORCESTER, Mass., Sept. 25 (AP)A special facultystudent committee at Holy Cross has recommended gradual elimina tion of the Air Force Reserve Officers Training Corps over threeyear period.

title: Ensemble Seeks Musicians
description: A chamber orchestra open to qualified amateur instrumental ists is being organized by Brooklyn Center of Long Island University under the direction of Stephen Gunzenhauser. The orchestra will rehearse on Tues day evenings from 7:30 to 9:30 beginning Tuesday. Those in terested can obtain information by calling 8346215 or by writ ing to the Music Department. Brooklyn Center, Long Island University,Brooklyn, N. Y., ??.

title: General Reported Seized
description: SKOUN, Cambodia, Sept. 25 (Reuters)  A Vietcong major general has been captured in the vicinity of Tangkok, a Cam bodian battalion commander, Capt. Thau Chay, said today. The general was not identified.

title: Mary E. Carroll Engaged to Wed John P. Cosgriff
description: Miss Mary Estelle Carroll, an assistant editor in the publications department at the Famous Artists Schools, International, here, and John Peter Cosgriff, a student at the Boston College Law School, plan to be married in June.

title: LIQUIDATION HITS SOYBEAN FUTURES
description: Soybean futures, which ad vanced sharply Thursday, fel yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade.

title: Catamaran Series Crown Goes To Scimitar Despite First Loss
New Issues Show Signs of Emerging From Slump
description: The newissue market dis played signs this week of emerging from nearly a year long slump as half a dozen companies made first public offerings of their shares, and trading activity picked up sub stantially.

title: AGNEW DEPLORES PERMISSIVENESS
description: MILWAUKEE, Sept. 25Vice President Agnew described for a Republican audience tonight his political mission for 1970: to arouse Americans to a desire for stronger national selfdis cipline and to help elect candi dates who oppose the trend toward permissiveness.

title: Terms of CeaseFire Assailed by Mrs. Meir
description: TEL AVIV, Sept. 25 (Reu ters)  Premier Golda Meir said tonight that Israel viewed as very grave King's Hussein's reported offer to allow Arab guerrillas to station themselves along the JordanianIsraeli frontier as part of the terms of the ceasefire reached today.

title: Mayor Backs Lefkowitz, But Wonders if It'll Help
description: Mayor Lindsay warmly en dorsed Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz yesterday but added that he did not know how much his support was worth, in Mr. Lefkowitz's race for reelection.

title: The Hemline Issue Surprises Visiting Princess Alexandra
description: Even at Gracie Mansion, the talk is of hemlines. No sooner had Princess Alexan dra, a cousin of Queen Eliz abeth, arrived for lunch with Mayor Lindsay and his wife yesterday, then she was asked if the dress she was wearing constituted her endorsement of the midi length.

title: flICKEL DENOUNCES DIVISIVE RHETORIC
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 25 (AP) Secretary of the Interior Walter J. Hickel spoke out to day against the rhetoric of polarization.

title: CUT IN PHONE RATE DELAYED 2 WEEKS
description: The state Public Service Com mission yesterday gave the New York Telephone Company two more weeks to put into effect a $12.4million reduction in rates. The reduction is from $136.7million interim rate in crease approved last February.

title: New Books
description: FICTION

title: Greece Expels 2 Arabs
description: ATHENS, Sept. 25  Two Lebanese arrested in Athens three weeks ago and charged with illegal possession of ex plosives were expelled today aboard a Beirutbound airliner. Ibrahaim Hotait, 26 years old. and Morset Shebo, 22, said they were members of the Erl, trean Liberation Front strug filing for Eritrea's secession from Ethiopia.

title: Pope Gives $50,000 for Aid
description: ROME, Sept. 25 (Reuters)Pope Paul VI has made a per sonal gift of $50,000 to help victims of the civil war in Jor dan, the Vatican announced to night. The money will go to the Roman Catholic relief organiza tion, Caritas international.

title: How Dina Merrill's Hives Started It
description: Her husband irreverently calls it the grease business, but Dina Merrill doesn't mind. She no longer breaks out in hives, and that's one reason she accepted the presidency of the newest entrant in the cosmetics industry. The 44yearold actress and so cialite (her mother is Mrs. Marjorie Merri weather Post, the breakfast food heiress) intro duced her new line, Amaranthe, at a luncheon for 50 at B. Altman & Co. the other day during the store's twoweek This Is Altman's celebra tion. I'm very happy to be on Broadway  the Broad way of the retail business, she said, referring to the store's Fifth Avenue loca tion.

title: Kheel Backs Goldberg, Who Campaigns Upstate
description: Arthur J. Goldberg, the Dem ocraticLiberal candidate for Governor, yesterday receives the endorsement of Theodor( H. Kheel, the labor mediator and then took his campaign to Poughkeepsie and Monticello.

title: Books of The Times
description: A middleaged professor with ?? good looks sits in his study late one nigh thinking back to his youth in a small town in west central Texas, when he and his friend Billy Breedlove canoed on the stil surface of Whitewater Lake and claimed an island there as their own. They were both then in the last of their high school years, and the time was autumn, when the day's heat was turning into evening cool, and the stars of the low heavens were slowly trem Wing their un known messages ti) earth. One be g i n s Whitewa ter meekly, even aopefully. Paul Horgan is a re spected man of letters who has already won most of the literary prizes. With this, his 13th novel. he has won the pot of gold too: a hefty paper back advance and selection by three boot clubs. Nothing wrong with that. It ha; happened to good books.

title: Dow Jones Golf's Deficit Causes 1971 Cancellation
description: Because of a deficit of al most half a million dollars, the Dow Jones open, the richest event on the 1970 pro golf tour, has been canceled for 1971 but may return to the schedule in 1972.

title: Stock Prices Climb; Volume Stays High
description: The stock market, which entered the week like a lamb, exited yesterday looking more like a lion. There were small gains in the popular averages, but Wall Street analysts re garded as far more significant the apparent rebound investor confidence: This, in turn, stemmed from encour aging reports on the military situation in Jordan, as well as the improved flow of economic and antiinflation devel opments on the home front.

title: Suspect Yields in Hijacked Sailboat
description: SEATTLE, Sept. 25 (UPI)A young man alleged to have robbed a bank in Canada and shot two policemen sailed into United ,States waters on a hijacked sailboat with three hostages today and sur rendered to the Coast Guard.

title: Corena Will Sing the Title Role In Met's Don Pasquale Revival
Jets Favored to Down Patriots; Giants Are Underdogs in Dallas
description: Both the Jets who are fa vored, and the Giants, who are not, appear on local tele vision tomorrow afternoon. The Jets play the Patriots in Harvard Stadium at Boston starting at 1 P.M. on Chan nel 4. The Giants begin one hour later in Dallas against the Cowboys on Channel 2. The Jets' contest will be followed by the Browns 49ers game from San Francisco, also on Channel 4. Here is a preview of the games with wonlost records in parentheses:

title: Raymond Keiser, 67, Dies; ExAssociated Press Aide
description: PELHAM, N. Y. (AP)Ray mond J. Keiser, a former Asso ciated Press editor and bureau chief, died today at his home here. He was 67 years old and had retired in 1968 after a 35year career with the news agency in New York, Detroit and Phoenix, Ariz.

title: Jim Perry Wins 24th, 10
description: KANSAS CITY, Sept. 25 (UPI) Jim Perry posted his 150th major league victory and his 24th of the season with a two hit shutout tonight as the Min nesota Twins scored a 10 victory over the Kansas City Royals. Mike Cuellar of Bal timore won his 24th yesterday.

title: City College to Take Hard Line on Hard Drugs
description: Dr. Robert E. Marshak, presi dent of City College, expressed his determination yesterday to eliminate hard drugs from the college's campus, where heroin is being bought and used open ly.

title: Nixon's Former Law Firm Here Prospers Amid Unwanted Public Attention
Drugs: In a Nether World
description: LONDONJust before Christmas last I emergid from the London drug scene for the last timeat least for the presenthaving spent practically every spare inoment among the street addicts, the end result of those who tread the dangerous road of drugs misuse. After eighteen months I was still no wiser than when I started as to why they do it.

title: R. H. Macy's Sales Set Record But Earnings Register Decline
News Summary and Index
description: International Fighting between Jordanian troops and Palestinian guerrillas stopped yesterday after the announcement of a ceasefire agreement believed to have been negotiated by Presi dent Gaafar alNimeiry of the Sudan. The ceasefire was said to provide for the with drawal of the guerrillas from all cities and towns. [Page 1, Columns 68.]

title: TV: Agnew and Students Make Smooth Discussion
description: A constructive use of tele visionseen at 8:30 on Chan nel 5 in New York and at other hours in different sec tions of the country, was the taped discussion last night between Vice President Agnew and four college students highly critical of the Admin istration's domestic and inter national policies.

title: STOCKS ON AMEX CONTINUE TO GAIN
WPIX Aide Recalls Use of Daily News Reporters
description: Walter D. Engels, former news manager for WPIX, ad mitted at a Federal Communi cations Commission hearing yesterday that he had author ized the identification of three reporters for The Daily News as WPIX newsmen during the Democratic National Conven tion in August of 1968.

title: New Action Threatened
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Sept. 25 The spokesman of the Pop ular Front for the Liberation of Palestine said today that its commandos had released some of the hostages in Amman presumably because they could not feed them. It aoes not matter, said Ghassin Kanafani, editor of the guerrilla newspaper Al Haraf. We will soon have wellfed hostagesnew onesif they do not let our people go.

title: POLICE ON STAND IN CAROLINA TRIAL
description: ORANGEBURG, S. C., Sept. 25 Two top police officials testified today that the only violation of law they saw Cleve land L. Sellers Jr. commit in racial clashes here in 1968 was failure to disperse immediately when an order was given.

title: Newsprint Consumption Down 4% During August
description: Consumption of newsprint during August declined 4 per cent from the yearearlier level, the American Newspaper Pub lishers Association reported yes terday.

title: WILLIAM J. WATTS
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., Sept. 25William J. Watts, a senior media buyer at SSC & B, Inc., an international advertising agency, died yesterday at the New Rochelle Medical Center. He was 66 years old and lived at 40 Robins Crescent.

title: Names of Hostages
description: AMMAN, Sept. 25 (Agence FrancePresse)Jordanian mili tary authorities gave the names of the 15 hostages freed today 8 Britons, 5 Swiss and West Germansas A.S. Janos fia, J.J. Hans Sticher, Horst Jerosch, Fries Schreiber, Nor bert Kuster, Ernst Vollenwem mer, Peter Jeschke, Eric Deye, Robert Dare, Ernest Hartill, John Lindsay, Richard Dunn, Cyril Goulborn (pilot of the B.O.A.C. plane), John Wallis and Fawkes N. Potts.

title: Barbara Rush Rewed
description: BALTIMORE, Sept. 25 (AP)Barbara Rush, the actress, was married here yesterday to Jim Gruzalski, a sculptor.

title: DR. ROBERT BEAROR, MAINE RADIOLOGIST
description: PORTLAND, Me., Sept. 25Dr. Robert A. Bearor, a promi nent radiologist, died in the Maine Medical Center here today of cancer. He was 48 years old and had been an asfi sociate radiologist at the hos pital since 1960.

title: Swiss Militia to Help Guard Zurich and Geneva Airports
description: GENEVA, Sept. 25  The Swiss Government announced today that it was calling on the nation's army of militiamen to help guard its two major inter national airports.

title: IRVING C. MARCELL
description: RIDGEWOOD, N. J., Sept. 25 Irving C. Marcell, who retired as president of Marsales, Inc., of New York, makers of sur gical dressings, died yesterday at his home, 399 Glenwood Road. His age was ??.

title: War Casualties
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 25 (UPI) The Defense Department an nounced today that the follow ing servicemen from the New York area had been killed in Southeast Asia:

title: FLARE IN DISPUTE ON BLACKS FEARED
MRS. M. MILTON GLASS
description: Mrs. Ruth M. Goodman Glass, wife of M. Milton Glass, archi tect and former chairman of the City Board of Standards and Appeals, died Thursday in Montefiore Hospital. She lived at 33 East 208th Street, the Bronx.

title: Teachers Strike Upstate
description: WAPPINGERS FALLS, N. Y., Sept. 25 (AP)Members of the Central School District Faculty Association here struck the dis trict's 14 schools today, forcing cancellation of most morning classes and a short school day for 14,000 students.

title: International Controls Head Joins I.O.S. Board
description: GENEVA, Sept. 25  laves tors Overseas Service an flounced tonight the appoint ment of Robert L. Vesco, presi dent of the International Con trols Corporation to the boar( of its parent company.

title: STOCKS ADVANCE ON LONDON BOARD
U.S. Indicts 15 in Detroit For Fraud in Bankruptcy
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 25 (AP)  Attorney General John N. Mitchell announced today the indictment of 15 Detroit area men, seven of whom have been identified as Mafia fig ures, on Federal bankruptcy fraud charges.

title: Britons Express Relief
description: LONDON, Sept. 25The res cue of all eight British hostage: in Jordan today brought gen eral relief here and some feeling of satisfaction in the Government.

title: Red Cross Visits Hostages
description: GENEVA, Sept. 25The In ternational Committee of the Red Cross announced tonight that its representatives had visited the 15 rescued airliner hostages and found that their health and morale were good. It did not disclose their names or where the Jordanian Army had taken them. It said, how ever, that they would be evac uated very soon.

title: Jetliners Are Ordered
description: Lufthansa German Airlines announced yesterday it was ordering four DC10 jetliners for delivery in 1974. The new trijets will be used initially for the development of routes be tween Europe and the East Coast of South America.

title: Furniture intheraw
description: An astonishing sales promotion.

title: Rights Unit Agrees Reluctantly To Back Labor on 2 Job Bills
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 25  A civil rightsorganized labor coa lition has agreed to oppose pending legislation that would strengthen the Equal Employ ment Opportunity Commission if provisions desired by labor are not added.

title: AUGUST SALES UP FOR CHAIN STORES
description: Despite the slowdown in re tail sales, leading chain anc mailorder companies achieved a gain of 6.1 per cent las (month over the level of sales in August, 1969.

title: Football Transactions
description: NATIONAL CONFERENCE

title: CAMERON HAIGHT, THROAT SURGEON
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Sept. 25 Dr. Cameron Haight. a lead ing thoracic surgeon who ini tiated several operating tech niques, died today. His age was 69.

title: New Haven Police Find Some Clothes Of Missing Girl, 5
description: NEW HAVEN. Sept. 25 Policemen scouring the western portion of this city on the fifth day of an intensive search for a missing 5yearold girl re ported today that they had found several items of the child's clothing.

title: Art
description: The rose is a venerable subject in the history of painting but there are no roses to be found in this history quite like those that appear in the paintings of Bert Carpenter, whose one man show is now installed at the Zabriskie Gallery, 699 Madison Avenue at 63d Street.

title: WASTED CHANCES AGAIN MARK LOSS
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept. 25The New York Mets lived through the Perils of Pauline without the luck of Pauline tonight when they were defeated by the Pittsburgh Pirates, 43, in Round One of the battle for first place.

title: U.S. Carriers on Move
description: ABOARD THE AIRCRAFT CARRIER INDEPENDENCE, Sept. 25The United States carrier Saratoga has left the eastern Mediterranean to par ticipate in a review for Presi dent Nixon scheduled for next week, temporarily leaving the Independence as the only float ing air base off Lebanon and Israel.

title: Publisher of ProNazi Books Is Ousted by Frankfurt's Fair
description: FRANKFURT, Sept. 25Offi cials of the Frankfurt Book Fair voted tonight to close the ex hibit of a small rightwing pub lisher after finding that the concern's books celebrating Hit ler and Nazism violated West Germany's Constitution.

title: Knicks Check Late Rally To Beat Pistons, 107103
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, Sept. 25 (UPI) The New York Knicks fought of a last quarter rally by the Detroit Pistons tonight to gain their second straight National Basketball Association exhibi tion victory. 107103.

title: Bridge
description: Standard bidding methods often run into trouble when a very strong hand, short of a forcing opening, faces a very weak one. A case in point is the diagramed deal, played earlier this week on the S.S. Santa Rosa during a Caribbean cruise.

title: Aussies'
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Saturday Sept. 26 (AP)The New Yorl, Yacht Club Race Committee re jected early today the Aus tralian bid to reopen a protest that had led to Gretel II's dis qualification after beating In trepid in the second race of the America's Cup.

title: U.S. FALLING BEHIND IN CHESS OLYMPIAD
description: SIEGEN, Germany, Sept. 25 The United States team lost to Hungary, 2 to 1, in their adjourned games in the next to the last round of the 19th Chess Olympiad today.

title: Grand Union Company
description: Record sales and earnings were attained by the Grand Union Company in the 13 weeks and fiscal halfyear periods ended Aug. 29, Charles G. Rodman, president of the food and general merchan dise retailing chain, reported yesterday.

title: Ottinger Calls for a Meeting To Ease LI. Unemployment
description: Representative Richard L. Ottinger, Democratic candidate for the Senate, asked Governor Rockefeller today to call a con ference to deal with mounting unemployment on Long Island.

title: HANOI SAID TO ORDER MORE CONSCRIPTION
description: HONG KONG, Sept. 25 (UPI) North Vietnam has ordered increased conscription and re cruiting for its armed forces, according to Western analysts specializing in Communist af fairs.

title: Chicanery Is Charged To Ontario Bet Shops
description: TORONTO, Sept. 25 (Cana dian Press)  The Jockey Club, after an investigation by its security agents, said today it had banned employes of offtrack betting shops from its tracks in Ontario and had called for prosecu tion of the shops by Federal and provincial authorities.

title: Swede Gets Food Award
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Sept. 25 (AP)Dr. Eric von Sydow, di rector of the SWedish Institute for Food Y'reservation Research at Goteberg, was presented the 1970 UnderwoodPrescott Award yesterday at Massachu setts Institute of Technology. The award was for outstanding work in the field of food tech nology.

title: ExSpy for Sheriff On Hobart Campus Seeks Police Work
description: CANANDAIGUA, N. Y., Sept. 25Thomas Tongyai, also known as Tommy the Travel er while working as an under cover agent for the Ontario County sheriff, is studying po lice science in college here.

title: No U.S. Visa for Batista
description: LISBON, Portugal, Sept. 25 (AP)The United States will not grant a visa to the former Cuban dictator, Fulgencio Ba tista, to go to Florida for his brother's funeral, a United States Embassy official said to day.

title: Airman Gets 12 Years In 2 Bombings in Ohio
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Sept. 25 (AP)Lieut. William L. Harris of the Air Force re ceived a 12to65year prison sentence after confirming in court yesterday that he had bombed two department stores as a diversion for rob bery. No money was taken, but 13 persons were hurt.

title: Miss Osborg Will Marry Oct. 17
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., Sept. 25Dr. and Mrs. Hans Osborg have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Amires Elvira Os borg, to Eugene Wisner Hutchinson, son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles W. Hutchinson of Hadley. Mass. The wed ding is planned for Oct. 17 in Boston, where the future bridegroom is on the public relations staff of the New England Conservatory of Music.

title: U.S. Delegates to I.M.F. Have a Busy Week
description: COPENHAGEN. Denmark, Sept. 25  As the annual meeting of the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development and the Inter national Monetary Fund end ed today, the large United States delegation also ended a very busy week.

title: MILITARY GUARDS TO RIDE AIRLINERS WITHIN ONE WEEK
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 25 The first specially trained military guards to prevent hijackings will start riding commercial airliners within a week, the Nixon Administra tion announced today.

title: Memory Film Invented
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 25Stanford R. Ovshinsky, the Michigan inventor who at tracted attention with his electronic switches made of amorphous, glassy materials, was granted broad patent this week for a re lated producta memory film. The film, called Ovonic after its originator, may be applicable for use in computers, displays, print ing and office copying ma chines and cameras.

title: Good on You, Gretel
description: Not many weekend sailors can dream of crewing for or even getting intothe New York Yacht Club, but everyone in American sporting circles knows whom to root for: the underdog. That is why landlubbers who wouldn't know a tiller from a spinnaker are cheering the victory of Australia's Gretel II over the America's Cup defender, Intrepid, after three successive losses (one on a heartbreaking, disputed technicality).

title: Miss Kruger Is Fiancee of Banker
description: ROCHESTER, Mich., Sept. 25Mr. and Mrs. Thomas Eduard Kruger have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Juliane Eve Kruger, to Robert David Bailey, resident vice presi dent of the First National City Bank in Mexico City. Mr. Bailey is the son of Mr. and Mrs. William Wood Bailey of St. Thomas, Virgin Islands.

title: 2 Prosecutors Rule Out A McCarthy Investigation
description: BUFFALO, Sept. 25 (AP) State and county prosecutors decided today to drop an in vestigation into charges that Representative Richard Max McCarthy had offered the Dem ocratic candidate for his seat a judicial nomination and a $10, 000 campaign contribution.

title: BUCKLEY ASSAILS CAMPUS REVOLTS
description: James L. Buckley yesterday urged the explusion of all col lege and university students who committed criminal acts or violate the rights of others.

title: Elections and a Free Press Pledged by Allende in Chile
description: SANTIAGO; Chile, Sept. 25 (Reuters)  Senator Salvador Allende, a Socialist who led the presidential balloting Sept 4, said in an interview today his Government would not bE Socialist but multiparty and pledged that tree elections and press freedom would continue.

title: 15 Hostages of Hijackers, None Americans, Rescued
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Sept. 25The Jordanian Government announced today that it had rescued! 15 British, German and Swiss hostages held by Arab commandos since Sept. 6, when airliners on which they were traveling were hijacked.

title: Sports of The Times
description: People are concerned about these athletes who get college scholarships, bonuses to turn pro, taxsheltered benefits, large salaries and then need a huge pension, says Dominick E. Piledggi, who claims to represent the concerned people. The money has to come from some where and it comes from the silent majority of the sports worldthe fan. We feel that the fanthe one who buys the tickets, the concessinns and the sponsor's producthas been largely ignored in the everlasting battle for share of the snorts dollar.

title: KISSINGER SEEKS TO DETER KY VISIT
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 25Henry A. Kissinger, President Nixon's adviser on foreign pol icy, has scheduled a Paris meeting tomorrow with Vice President Nguyen Cao Ky of South Vietnam to try to per suade him not to attend a March for Victory rally here next week.

title: U.S. ORDERS TESTS ON SOAP ENZYMES
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 25The Federal consumerprotec tion authorities called on soap manufacturers today to sponsor immediate tests on the pos sible harmful effects of using laundry detergents containing enzymes.

title: Most in Regime Reds, Sihanouk Says
description: PEKING, Sept. 25 (Agence FrancePress)  Prince Noro dom Sihanouk said today that majority of his governmentin exile now were members of the Khmer Rouge rebel movement and the power already belongs to the Cambodian Communist party.

title: Bank of Norway Picks Chief
description: OSLO, Norway, Sept. 25 (Reuters)The Norwegian Gov ernment said today it had ap pointed Knut Getz Wold new president of the Bank of Nor way. On Nov. 1 he will succeed Erik Brofoss who announced his resignation for private rea sons earlier today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The irresponsible move by the City University to establish an open en rollment policy when neither the physical means nor longrange pro grams exist to insure its implementa tion has now been aggravated by the irresponsible proposal of City Univer sity Deputy Chancellor Seymour Hy man to send some of the new students to private colleges and pay their tui tion.

title: Construction Blasting Wrecks Nerves and Windows
description: Mrs. Mattie Muller was sitting quietly in her fourth floor office at 750 Third Avenue yesterday morning when a warning whistle blew at the construction site across the avenue near 47th Street.

title: Goodell Calls 2 Nixon Aides Extremists
description: Senator Charles E, Goodell charged yesterday that men of the hard right have infiltrated the White House staff and are trying to influence President Nixon to support James L. Buckley, the Conservative party candidate fOr the United States Senate.

title: Helen Neuman Plans Nuptials
description: ST. LOUIS, Sept. 25Miss Helen Neuman and Duncan Lawrence Marshall sr., se niors at Boston University, plan to be married in May.

title: Joe Namath (the Horse) Wins; 10 to Go in Belmont Matron; 3YEAROLD FIRST BY HALF A LENGTH; French Steak Runs Second  Clear Ceiling Favored in Filly Race Today
Space Shuttle Pact With U.S. Expected to Unite Efforts in Western Europe
description: VENICE, Italy, Sept. 25If the views that dominated conference of space officials and industrialists there this week prevail, Europe will soon have its counterpart of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration and will com mit itself to a significant role in development of the next generation of American space vehicles.

title: Status Quo Affirmed As I.M.F. Talks End
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, Sept. 25The annual ineetirq of the World Bank and the International Monetary Fund con, cluded today with almost unanimous support for the present international monetary system in all its main essentials There was also agreement, in which the lessdeveloped countries concurred, that inflation was the major world economic problem. The poor countries made it clear that they were dissatisfied with inflation in the rich countries, which is a relatively new attitude for them.

title: FUND DEMAND SEEN OUTPACING SUPPLY
description: The total demand for long term funds over the next five years will reach $418billion, ;leading commercial bank econ omist said yesterday, but the estimated supply available to meet those needs will only total $325billion.

title: ARAFAT COMPLIES
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Sept. 25King Hussein's Government and the Arab commando lead ership agreed on a ceasefire today and silenced their ar mies guns.

title: 6 HURT IN JERSEY IN STUDENT MELEE
description: JERSEY CITY, Sept. 25 (AP) Three policemen and three youths were injured today after a dispute over money lost in luncheonette jukebox turned into a street brawl.

title: FIGHTING ENDED IN JORDAN UNDER CEASEFIRE ACCORD; KING DUE TO GET U.S. ARMS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 25A top Administration official de clared today that the United States was prepared to give Jordan weapons to replace those lost in the fighting there.

title: Record Heat Leads to a Power Cut Again
description: The hottest Sept. 25 on rec ord prolonged the power crisis yesterday, forcing voltage cuts in the metropolitan area for the fourth consecutive day.

title: Estelle Liebling Dies Here at 90; Was a Leading Operatic Coach
description: Estelle Liebling, singer and teacher of singers, died last evening in her home in the Hampshire House, 150 Central Park South. She was 90 years old.

title: STATE IS ACCUSED OF PUSHING COOPS
description: A City Councilman and the State Attorney General clashed yesterday over the alleged role of the Attorney General's office in the conversion of rental apartments to cooperatives.

title: Miss Bevilacque Prospective Bride
description: BROOKVILLE, L. I., Sept. 24Mr. and Mrs. Alfred F. Bevilacque have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Barbara Ann Bevilacque, to William Joseph McElligott, son of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph F. McElligott.

title: Satellite Launching Put Off
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Sept. 25 (UPI)The launching of the third in a series of Stargazer satellites was indefinitely post poned today because of a pos sible electrical problem in the spacecraft. The twoton Orbit ing Astronomical Observatory had been scheduled for launch ing into the earth's orbit Oct 15. The space agency said that the shot would be rescheduled when the problem was diag nosed and corrected.

title: U.S. Copters Reported Hit
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept 25 (AP)  United States heli copters carrying South Viet namese infantrymen into com bat six miles south of the de militarized zone today flew into a hail of enemy smallarms fire, and about 10 of the air craft were hit, field reports said.

title: Talley Comments on Suit
description: Talley Industries, Inc., said yesterday that a $62.5million damage suit filed against the company here on Thursday in the Federal District Court was completely without merit. The action was filed by 16 former stockholders of the General Time Corporation, which Talley acquired through a merger earlier this year.

title: Rockefeller Vows to End Car Junk Yards in State
description: MONTICELLO, N. Y., Sept. 25Governor Rockefeller said today that if he was reelected, he would propose legislation to eliminate automobile junk yards and to clear abandoned cars from city streets.

title: DEBRIS IS SPOTTED IN BALLOON HUNT
description: The Air Force said last night that search planes had sighted what appeared to be an empty raft and part of a large balloon floating 100 miles apart off Newfoundland.

title: U.S. Anticrime Strike Unit Stirs Doubts From Within
description: The Federal Joint Strike Force against organized crime here is now well into its sec ond year, with a record of arrests and indictments of more than 100 defendants and six convictions so far but one of its biggest cases is one it made against one of its own members.

title: WITNESS TESTIFIES TO FEAR OF MANSON
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 25A teen age prosecution witness in the Sharon Tate murder trial ended her testimony today with a declaration that she fled from Charles M. Manson's hip pie family in the late sum mer of 1969 because she had come to fear Manson.

title: STUDENTS HUNTED IN POLICE KILLING
description: BOSTON, Sept. 25The po lice in three states were hunting today for two men and two women who the authorities said were wanted in a bank rob bery, a murder and the looting of a National Guard armory that the Boston police have linked to revolutionary student activities.

title: Market Place
description: Followers of the sticky ne gotiations between major oil companies and the Libyan Government have been won dering why Royal Dutch Shell hasn't settled, thereby follow ing the lead of its Libyan partners.

title: Hussein Said to Charge He Was Misled by Aides
description: PARIS, Sept. 25 (Reuters) King Hussein was quoted here today as having said that he had been misled by Jordanian intelligence offi cials about guerrilla strength and that there were Pales tinian commandos among his palace servants

title: Plessey and B.S.R. Resume Dickering
description: Directors of the Plessey com pany, Ltd., announced yesterday day that they are resuming earlier discussions, which were ended last November, to ac quire all of the issued share capital of British Sound Repro duction, Ltd., one of the world's largest makers of rec ord changers and record players. The num ber of shares in volved in the transaction and the possible pur chase price were not disclosed. A spokesman for Plessey said that the merger talks were broken off last No vember because the companies could not reach agreement on terms.

title: MANSFIELD FILES CLOSURE PETITION
description: WASHINGTON. Sept. 25 (UPI)The Senate Democratic leader, Mike Mansfield, sought for the second time today to shut off debate and bring to a vote a proposed constitutional amendment calling for direct popular elections of Presidents.

title: Gasoline Fire Is Contained on Brooklyn Waterfront
description: A gasoline fire of poten tially dangerous proportions in the Greenpoint section of Brooklyn was brought under control quickly yesterday by a large force of firemen and equipment.

title: HERBERT KEMPTON, ATHLETIC COACH, 78
description: YANKEETOWN, Fla., Sept. 25Herbert M. Kempton, a for mer college football player and prepschool athletic coach, died Wednesday. He was 78 years of age.

title: Dear Mr. Vice President
description: Dear Mr. Vice President: Congratulations on your coolness and quick articulation under fire from the four student critics on the David Frost show. I watched you tape the program, and I was impressed.

title: In Capital, Givenchy Shows Fashions, and Audience Debates
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 25The 1,490 women had come to see Hubert de Givenchy's boutique collection and they wore their most fashionable clothes to the event.

title: DETECTIVE DENIES ACCEPTING BRIBE
description: The lawyer for a New York detective accused of having ac cepted a $500 bribe said yes terday that the money had been planted on his client by the chief prosecution witness.

title: JAPAN AND E.E.C. END TRADETALK STAGE
description: BRUSSELS, Sept. 25  The Executive Commission of the European Economic Community announced today it had ended preparatory discussions with Japan on a nonpreferential trade treaty, which would be the first trade agreement the Common Market as a whole would have with Japan.

title: JUSTICE GEORGE VINETTE
description: SYRACUSE, N. Y., Sept. 25 (AP)  State Supreme Court Justice George H. Vinette died yesterday in a hospital here at the age of 65.

title: QUOTA ON IMPORTS SCORED IN SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 25 (AP)  The pending import quota bill is part of a danger ous wave of United States eco nomic isolationism that could hurt American shippers, manu facturers and consumers, Sen ator Walter MondaIe said to day as Senate opposition to the measure began to take shape.

title: First, Ask Them If Luigi's There
description: The restaurants reviewed on this page are rated four stars to none, based on the relationship of food and serv ice to cost. Credit cards are honored where indicated.

title: Westmoreland Sees Truman
description: INDEPENDENCE, Mo., Sept. 25 (AP)  Gen. William West moreland stopped in Independ ence today for a brief visit with former President Harry S. Truman. The former comman der of American forces in Vietnam was to deliver a clas sified address at the Command and General Staff College at Fort Leavenworth, Kan.

title: Broad Bill on Job Safety Approved by Senate Panel
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 25The Senate Labor and Public Welfare Committee approved today legislation giving the Federal Government broad new poweis to establish indus trial safety standards. Thus the stage was set forone of Idle most intense laborman agement battles in Congress in recent years.

title: S.L.A. Names Official
description: The appointment of German Ramirez as deputy commis sioner and assistant chief executive officer of the State Liquor Authority was an nounced yesterday by Thomas F. Ring, chairman. Mr. Ramirez, who will receive $16,960 a year in his new position, succeeds Michael P. Seniuk as assistant chief executive officer. Mr. Seniuk, who is also a deputy commissioner, will head the trial examiners bureau, the prosecutive arm of the liquor control agency.

title: The GoodBad Drug Bill
description: The drug abuse bill passed overwhelmingly by the House this week reflects the slow national realization that there is no single answer to the drug problem and that present laws imposing the same penalties on pushers of hard narcotics and on users of soft hallucinogens must be modified.

title: Fanny May Planning Offerings Of $750Million in Debentures
DR. L. W. HANLON, OF CORNELL, DEAD
description: Dr. Lawrence W. Ianlon, as sociate dean of the Cornell Uni versity Medical College, diec yesterday at New York Hospi tal. He was 55 years old anc lived at 445 East 68th Street.

title: 4 Harlem Businesses Started With Goal of Local Ownership
description: Four businesses worth more than $250,000 were opened in Harlem yesterday with the goal that they will be owned by Harlem residents within a year.

title: Sound Choice for Education
description: Sidney P. Marland Jr., who has been nominated by President Nixon to be United States Commissioner Education, has the administrat've skill and toughness the Office of Education needs.

title: Tranquilizer Theory Grows at Yonkers
description: YONKERS, Sept. 25A State Harness Racing Com mission spokesman said to day the commission's investi gation into the strange behav ior of seven horses scheduled to start in the same race had led up a blind alley, with no leads uncovered.

title: Assembly Democrats Accuse Republicans of Using Newly Formed Subcommittees for Party Politicking
description: The reform of State Assem bly committees implemented last yearreducing them from a total of 38 to 21has since been followed by the creation of 47 subcommittees, which Democrats contend exist mainly for Republican politicking.

title: FURNITURE PLAN IS GIVEN BACKING
description: Favorable producer reaction has been received to a coor dinated drive by 25 of the country's largest furniture and departmentstore chains this week to limit the home furnish: ings industry's two fashion in troductions a year to only one in the spring.

title: Nasser Charges Amman Aides Violate Terms of the CeaseFire
description: CAIRO, Saturday, Sept. 26President Gamal Abdel Nasser, after having heard a report from the mission of Arab lead ers to Jordan, sent a strongly worded telegram to King Hus sein early today. He accused the Jordanian authorities of violating ceasefire promises and of carrying out a plan to liquidate the Palestinian resist ance.

title: Drugs: The Sacred Mushroom
description: Not long ago The New York Times carried a dispatch from Mexico tell ing about the descent of hippies on Huautla de Jimenez in quest of the sacred mushrooms. With the dis patch appeared a photo of a priestess of the rite, Maria Sabina.

title: Alleged Mafioso Convicted Of Tampering With Jury
description: BUFFALO, Sept. 25 (AP)Salvatore Pieri; identified by the Federal Bureau of Investi gation a former boss of Mafia operations in the Buffalo area, was convicted today in United States District Court of tamper ing with the jury.

title: HOME VOICES HOPE FOR MIDEAST TALKS
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Sept. 25Jordan's success in repelling troops from Syria has eased Middle East tensions enough to give new hopes for peace efforts, Sir Alec Doug lasHome, the British Foreign Secretary, said here today. At a news conference, he ex pressed hope for quick resump tion of the ArabIsraeli peace talks led by Dr. Gunnar V. Jarring as special representative of Secretary General Thant. The alternative, Sir Alec said, would be an increase of arma ments that could bring about a war of much greater dimen sion.

title: Holland in Senate 24 Years
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 25 (AP) Senator Spessard L. Holland, Democrat of Florida, rounded out 24 years as a Senator to day. There was a celebration in his office. Senator Holland will retire at the end of the current session.

title: Red Cross Given Access to 10,000 P.O.W.'s in Jordan
description: GENEVA, Sept. 25  The International Committee of the Red Cross announced tonight that its representatives had re ceived permission to visit 10, 000 prisoners of war in Jordan.

title: U.S. Clergyman Tells of 8 Days In Guerrilla Redoubt in Amman
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Sept. 25An American clergyman who was trapped in a guerrillaheld section of Amman for eight days came out yesterdayand gave an account of discord, fear, bravado and courtesy on the part of the commandos.

title: Something to Celebrate
description: The New York Yankees won 103 games in the 1954 season, an inordinately high total. What gave it so much shock value, though, was that the Cleveland Indians produced 111 victories that year, a record. So the somewhat stunned and disbelieving Bronx Bombers finished in second place. It was to cause a temporary domestic problem in the home of Charlie Silvera, the nonplaying substitute for Yogi Berra as Yankee catcher.

title: Zambian Leader Visits Mine Where 89 Men Are Trapped
description: MUFULIRA, Zambia, Sept. 25 (UPI)  President Kenneth D. Kaunda inspected the site of what is feared to be Zambia's worst mining disaster today as rescue teams continued their ef forts to save 89 miners trapped 3,000 feet underground by mil lions of tons of mud.

title: Itinerary for President On His European Trip
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26Following is the itinerary of President Nixon's European trip:

title: REVIVALS
Patti Zeuthen Fiancee Of L. J. Spagnoletti
description: Mr. and Mrs. Ralph Zeu then of New York have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Patti Lynn Zeuthen, to Leonard Joseph Spagnoletti, son of Mr. and Mrs. Fred Spagno letti of Rego Park, Queens, and Fayson Lakes, N. J. The wedding is planned for No vember.

title: COLUMBIA DOWNS LAFAYETTE, 239
description: Columbia marked its football centennial yesterday, then de voted the rest of the afternoon to administering a 23to9 de feat to Lafayette.

title: Howe, 42, Signs Pact; Ace to Get $100,000
description: DETROIT, Sept. 26 (UPI) Gordie Howe, 42 years old, signed a twoyear contract today with the Detroit Red Wings of the National Hockey League, putting him, with Bobby Hull, as a $100, 000ay earman.

title: Bridge
Frostburg Edges Trenton
description: TRENTON, Sept. 26 (AP)Frostburg (Md.) State, was out played but still managed to de feat Trenton State today in football, 76. All the scoring occurred in the first period. Trenton controlled the ball for most of the game after than and gained 301 yards to 199 for Frostburg.

title: WISCONSIN IS TIED BY T.C.U., 14 TO 14
description: MADISON, Wis., Sept. 26 (UPI)Texas Christian stopped three fourquarter drives by Wisconsin and earned a 1414 tie today.

title: Booklet Has Information On Forming Boat Club
description: If you're a boater who would like to enjoy boating with others but don't really know how to get others in terested, the booklet How to Organize for More Fun Afloat was made for you.

title: Workers Switch Unions
description: BOSTON, Sept. 26 (AP)Traffic workers at the New England Telephone Company voted Thursday to he repre sented by the International Brotherhod of Electrical Work ers. The workers voted out the past representative, the Inde pendent Fedeation, 5,226 to 3,048.

title: News of the Rialto
description: LIKE Tipperary, June's a long, long way off. And, who knows what's going to happen to money? But, on the face of it, and strictly in terms of numbers, even the most con firmed Cassandra will have to concede that things may not look so bad after all. True, the season's getting off slow ly but there does seem to be a brisk fluttering in the wings, a renewed en ergy among the dreamers of dreams. Indeed, go down to Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz's office, talk to his amiable aidedecamp for Broadway af fairs, David Clurman, and you'll come away with the distinct impression that the theater's pace for 197071 may be a gallopespecially on Broadwayas compared with last year's crawl.

title: AVERAGE U.S. TAX PUT AT $380 IN '69
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 26 (AP)Americans paid an average of $380 in taxes in the fiscal year 1969 to state and local govern ments, $42 more per person than in the previous year, the Commerce Clearinghouse has reported.

title: WHISK'S LATE RUSH WINS AT HAWTHORNE
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 26 (AP)Whisk, owned and bred by Mrs. Russell L. Reineman of Chi cago, charged from last place at the top of the stretch to win the $59,900 Hawthorne Juvenile Stakes by 1 lengths at Haw thorne today.

title: Mrs. Gaines Wed To Stephen Ely
description: SOUTHAMPTON, L. I., Sept. 26  The marriage of Mrs. Susan LeFevre Barclay Gaines to Stephen Ely, vice president of the investment advisory department of Kuhn, Loeb & Co. in New York, took place here this afternoon. The ceremony in St. John's Episcopal Church was performed by the Rev. Malcolm L. Foster and at tended by members of the immediate families of the couple.

title: the traveler's world
description: Aviation Critics Are Off Course

title: BONN ECONOMIC AIDE MEETS WITH KOSYGIN
description: MOSCOW, Sept. (AP)  Pre mier Aleksei N. Kosygin told Economics Minister Karl Schiller of West Germany today that the Soviet Government favored an expansion of trade with West Germany.

title: ALOIS SCHIESEL
description: PLAINFIELD, N. J., Sept. 26 Alois Schiesel, for 55 years in the building supervision de partment of Pease Elliman, New York realestate concern, died today in Muhlenberg Hos pital. Mr. Schiesel, who retired five years ago, was 82 years old and lived at 673 East Front Street here. He leaves a son, Alois F., a sister and a grandson.

title: The Home
description: The seventies are emerging as a decade of involvement. Concern for a better environ ment, social and physical, is having its impact on the home. Goneor goingis the static house that echoes hollowly the latest trend. In its place is the home that mir rors a lifestyle. We contrast the homes of young antiques and art collectors with a modern environment creat ed out of the bones of an old brownstone. In each case, the modes of expression are as strikingly different as their owners. But the important ingredientgetting involved is constant. The tools for shaping a personal environ ment are with us; some of the best are highlighted here.

title: U.N. RELIEF TEAM GOING TO AMMAN
description: JERUSALEM, Sept. 26The first United Nations convoy to assist refugees in the Jordanian civil war is expected to leave Jericho in the Israelioccupied area on the west bank of the Jordan River tomorrow for Amman.

title: Sellout Crowd Assured For '71 U.S. Golf Open
description: The 1971 United States Open golf championship, to be played over Merion's East Course in Ardmore, Pa., June 14 through 20, appears headed for a sellout.

title: REVIVALS
description: Classics: 1. Satinwood tilttop table has par quetry top rimmed by a brass gallery. W & J Sloane. $340. 2. Arms of Edwardian bench end in delicate scrolls. Altman's. $295. 3. Venetian chair features trompe l'oeil decoration in terra cotta and yellow. W & J Sloane. $295.

title: Van Duyne, Haarstick Keen Perfect Marks in Olympic Class Sail
description: RYE, N. Y., Sept. 26Carl Van Duyne of Mantoloking, N. J., representing the United States Naval Academy Sailing Squadron at Annapolis, Md., in the singlehanded Finn Class, and Steven Haarstick of Ithaca, N. Y., in the Star Class, each won two races on Long Island Sound today.

title: Lassiter to Turn Fury on Jets Today
description: BOSTON, Sept. 26Short ly after the Boston Patriots upset the Miami Dolphins last Sunday in their Ameri can Conference opener, Ike Lassiter was heard to shout:

title: Students Seeking to Avoid a Backlash as They Enter Congressional Drives
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 26As college campuses opened across the country this week, thousands of student political activists were preparing to take an important role in about 70 elections for House and Sen ate seats.

title: ORIOLES WIN, 74, SCORING 3 IN 11TH
description: CLEVELAND, Sept. 26 (UPI)  Frank Robinson's tworun homer capped a threerun 11th inning rally today as the Balti more Orioles ran their winning streak to six games with a 74 victory over the Cleveland In dians.

title: AIR FORCE DOWNS MISSOURI BY 3714
description: ST. LOUIS, Sept. 26 (UPI)Brian Bream scored on three 1yard plunges and Bob Park er connected with Ernie Jen nings on touchdown pass plays of 44 and 67 yards today in leading the Air Force Academy to a 3714 football victory over Missouri in Busch Stadi um.

title: Berkeley Divinity's Dean Opposes Plan for Merger
description: NEW HAVEN, Sept. 26The Rev. Michael Allen, as he was installed here today as dean of the Berkeley Divinity School, pledged that his seminary would never, never participate in any merger plan to reduce the number of Episcopalian semi naries from 11 to 5.

title: East Faces Fuel Shortages
description: The Eastern United States  now worrying about elec tricity outages because of the heat  ought to start think ing a bit about how to keep warm this winter, according to an authoritative study of the present fuel oil situation.

title: Art
description: THE Thomas Eakins exhibition that opened at the Whitney Museum last Tuesday is a quiet block buster of a show  Eakins was never a noisy painterand is po tentially the most important show in the Whitney's history. It is also the most overdue. Eakins, as America's greatest painter, would have made the perfect subject for the inaugural exhi bition of a museum of American art. At that time, forty years ago, the ex hibition would also have been a revela tion, since Eakins (who was born in 1844 and died in 1916) had not yet been widely recognized in his full stature.

title: Retired Greek Colonel Says King May Return in January
description: ATHENS, Greece, Sept. 26 (Reuters)A member of the army group that seized power in April, 1967, said today that King Constantine might return in January.

title: Late Listings for Today's TV
description: Channel 5: President Nix on's Address at Kansas State University (repeat broad cast), 11 P.M.; David Suss kind Show, 11:30 P.M.; Bar bara McNair Show, 1:30 A.M.

title: Richard L. Brown 2d Weds Susan Carson
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 26 Miss Susan Ellen Carson, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John Nevin Carson Jr., was married here this afternoon to Richard Lindsay Brown 2d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Richard A. Brown. Both families are from Philadel phia. The Rev. Dr. Aaron Gast performed the cere mony at the First Presby terian Church in German town.

title: As Forecasters See It
description: National Association of Business Economists (poll of 194 economists): Gross national product$1.042trillion; Federal Reserve Board index of industrial production (1957 59=100)175.4; unemployment rate5.0 per cent; cor porate profits, pretax$87.9billion; plant and equipment spending$81.1billion.

title: Palme Loses Ground in Sweden
description: STOCKHOLMFor 38 years Social Democrats have run the Government in Sweden, con structing a prosperous, welfare state society that has long been held up as a model for social democracy elsewhere on the con tinent.

title: A Portion of Pegler's Estate Is Appraised at $399,000
description: TUCSON, Ariz., Sept. 26(AP)Westbrook Pegler, the columnist, who died June 24, 1969, at his home here, left an estate partly appraised at $399,682.66, according to pap ers filed in Pima County Su perior Court.

title: Barbara E. Cushing Is Wed in Virginia
description: MIDDLEBURG, Va., Sept. 26 Miss Barbara Ellen Cush ing, daughter of Mrs. Edward Harvey Cushing of Washing ton and Chatham, Mass., and the late Dr. Cushing, a phy sician, was married here this afternoon to Charles Haskell Gibbs Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Gibbs of Charleston, S.C. The bridegroom and his father are lawyers.

title: Finch Says Nixon Blocked Major Mideast Outbreak
description: PUTNEY, Vt., Sept. 26 (UPI) Robert H. Finch, a counselor to President Nixon, said tonight that Mr. Nixon took calculated risks this week to avoid an other major outbreak in the Middle East.

title: Martha Holden Engaged to Wed O. L. Loring Jr.
description: MONTPELIER, Vt., Sept. 26Dr. and Mrs. A. John Holden Jr. have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Martha Jane Holden, to Oliver Leland Loring Jr. He is the son of the Right Rev. Oliver L. Loring, retired Episcopal Bishop of Maine, and Mrs. Loring of Milton and South Dartmouth, Mass.

title: I.C.I. Develops Plastic Process
description: Imperial Chemical Indus tries, Ltd., announced last week that it had developed a manufacturing process that it said could produce composite plastics capable of competing with metals in a wide range of consumer goods.

title: BEVERLY SILLS ADDS SURPRISE AS MANON
description: The New York City Opera's first performance this fall of massenet's Manon, given Fri day night at the New York State Theater, had a familiar cast, and the interpretation given under Julius Rudel's musical direction was, in general, of the quality the company has established for this work.

title: Study Links a PreCancer Condition and Users of Pill
description: A study of 2,400 women in Los Angeles indicates that the higher incidence of cervical cancer believed to exist among users of oral contraceptives may he caused by preexisting differences in the women and not to the pill itself.

title: Music
description: 0N Saturday evening, at Hunter College, the International Piano Library is sponsoring a benefit for itself. At least 10 prominent pianists will foregather to play singly and in combination, proceeds (hope fully) to go to the I.P.L., thereby fur thering its desire to carry on with its collection, its bulletins, its scholarly work, its reissues of incredibly rare rec ords of great pianists of the past. And thereby hangs a tale.

title: 2dString Tailback Paces Arkansas 497 Rout of Tulsa
description: FAYETTEVILLE, Ark., Sept. 26 (UPI)John Richardson, a secondstring tailback scored two touchdowns, and the Ar kansas Razorbacks gained 522 yards in total offense today to beat Tulsa, 497.

title: F111's Are Called Sound
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26 (UPI)  The Defense Depart ment has told Congress that the controversial F111 swing wing fighterbombers, grounded last December after a wing broke off, are structurally sound and should last five years longer than the original specifications called for.

title: HEALTH SPENDING IS TRIPLED BY U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26The Federal Government backs the world's most farflung and varied collection of medical and health programs. They include care for Palestinian refugees, and Cuban expatriates; train ing nurses in Samoa; birth con trol information for Vietnam ese; ridding Iran of Malaria, and operation of dental clinics in the Panama Canal Zone.

title: Picabia's Dada Holiday
