description: IN an interesting article entitled Hello and Good bye, Francis Picabia, in the current issue of Art News, Philip Pearlstein re counts the vicissitudes of his research into the work of this legendary figure some 15 years ago and its ef fect on his own develop ment as a painter. Mr. Pearl stein wrote a master's thesis on Picabia at New York niversity!s Institute of Fine Arts  a work that has re mained an important item in the Picabia literature. But his immersion in this subject one of thekey subjects in the history of modernist art signaled his break with the very tradition Picabia rep resents.

title: West Coast Brush Fire Spreads Out of Control
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 26A massive brush fire, fanned by strong winds off the Mojave Desert, spread out of control northwest of Los Angeles to day, driving men and animals before it.

title: The Nation
description: MEMPHIS, Tenn.If the party can't reelect Albert Gore in Ten nessee, a national Democratic leader said not long ago, the day of the liberal Democratic Senator from the Southern and border states is over. Whether they're Democrats or Republi cans, we'll be in for a long plague of bollweevils.

title: PRESIDENT'S PANEL WARNS SPLIT ON YOUTH PERILS U.S.; ASKS HIM TO FOSTER UNITY
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26 The President's Commission on Campus Unrest appealed to President Nixon today to lead Americans back from the brink of what it described as a chasm in society so dangerous that it threatened the survival of the nation.

title: Jobbins Captures Title In Contender Sailing
description: LONDON, Sept. 26Rich ard Jobbins of Britain has captured the first Contender class world sailing champion ship.

title: A Critic Crosses Over
description: TO write criticism isn't neces sarily to be an artistmanqu, although a great many people like to think it is. At its best, criticism is the exercise of perception and judgment on behalf of others whose own exercise of these qualities is limited by time, circumstances, back ground or, though it goes against one of our central grains to admit it, capa city. To be able to judge justly and per ceive with accuracy, or to work toward that, is rare and valuable enough to have earned its place in civilization, even though most of us rightly think that to be able to create is a higher potency still.

title: SIXTH FLEET LIFE: DRILLS AND NEWS
description: ABOARD U.S.S. INDEPEND ENCE, off Israel, Sept. 25Training alerts aboard this 80, 000ton aircraft carrier, one of the largest warships afloat, oc cur around the clock, often at 3 A.M.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: Fergus

title: Nixon's British Factfinder Visits Pnompenh Briefly
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Sept. 26Sir Robert Thompson, the British expert on counterin surgency, arrived here yester day for a 24hour stopover dur ing a factfinding visit of sev eral weeks to South Vietnam for President Nixon.

title: CHARLES URSCHEL, OILMAN, IS DEAD
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Sept. 26 (AP)Charles F. Urschel, an oilman and a philanthropist who was kidnapped by the MachineGun Kelly gang in 1933 and ransomed for nearly $200,000, died at a local hospi tal today. He was in his 80's.

title: Births
description: ALDEWERELDBruce and Ellen (nee Gans) of Long Beach, N.Y. joyfully announce the birth of their second daughter Melissa Sims Sept. 9, 1970 at Long Beach Memori al Hospital.

title: POLIDI IN DEBUT AS VIOLIN SOLOIST
description: Thousands of people have heard Edward Polidi play the violin without realizing ithe is assistant concertmaster of they New York City Opert orches tra. On Friday night, a capacity audience at Carnegie Recital Hall had a chance to concen trate on Mr. Polidi as a soloist, in his New York recital debut.

title: MICHIGAN DOWNS WASHINGTON, 173
Sister Attends Leslie B. Wilcox At Her Nuptials
description: LIGONIER, Pa., Sept. 26Mrs. Leslie Brooke Wilcox, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George L. Wilcox of Pitts burgh and Rector, was mar ried here today to Nicholas Serenyi of Pittsburgh, son of Mrs. Nicholas Serenyi of Bos ton and the late Mrs. Serenyi.

title: Sparemblek Updates Gluck With His Choreographic Patterns
description: We are all bizarre victims of our personal circum stances. It so happens that the last time I saw Gluck's Orfeo ed Euridice it was at London's Covent Garden, staged by Frederick Ashton, and with Kathleen Ferrier, just a tragic four per formances before her death, as Orfeo. Of course it has a magic in remembrance that few present performances could hope to emulate.

title: EASY ELEGANCE
description: The tasteful and unobtrusive foyer (above) of a home in Greenwich, Conn., is the key to the character of the whole interior. Soft yellow plaid wall paper, rising up the stairwell and continuing into the adjoining sitting room (right), plays down the formal architecture. DeL signer David Laurence Roth's choice of subdued, youthful patterns for walls, rugs and upholstery met the owners wish for an ambiance where both dinner jackets and sports clothes are at home.

title: Miss Mulford, 70 Debutante, Becomes Bride
description: BRYN MAWR, Pa., Sept. 26  Miss Margaret Biddle Mulford, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John Mulford of Haver ford, was married here this afternoon to John Calvin Hover 2d, son of Mr. and Mrs. John Curry Hover of Short Hills, N.J. The cere mony was performed in the Episcopal Church of the Re deemer here by the Rev. Timothy Pickering.

title: Thriving Society Legend: Serge Obolensky at 80
description: Serge Obolensky, who was, born a prince and plans to die a public rela tions man, sat cavalryofficer erect in his Third Avenue office one day last week as he spent a reflective afternoon in review before charging into the ninth decade of his life.

title: Paper's Offices Damaged By Bombing in Guatemala
description: GUATEMALA, Sept. 26 (Reu ters)Several terrorist bombs shook this capital city last night, causing major property damage but no casualties, a po lice spokesman said.

title: Larchmont Skippers Win World Title for Tempests
description: PORT HALIGUEN, France, Sept. 26 (AP)John and James Linville of the Larchmont (N.Y.) Yacht Club, sailed Beasto to the World Tempest Class cham pionship, after six races on Ouiberon Bay.

title: John White to Wed Miss Joan Duncan
description: DEVON, Pa., Sept. 26Miss Joan Duncan, a teacher in Boston, and John Francis White a doctoral candidate in chemistry at the Massa chusetts Institute of Tech nology, plan to be married in November.

title: Hong KongChina Border Draws Busloads of Foreign Tourists
description: HONG KONG, Sept. 26The border between Hong Kong and Communist China has become one of the main attractions in this crown colony, where tour ism is big business.

title: U.S. Amateur Golf Team Takes Eisenhower Trophy by 12 Strokes in Madrid
description: MADRID, Sept. 26 (Reuters) The United States team ran away today with the 1970 Eisenhower Trophy, symbol of world amateur golf supremacy, with a sevenunder par total of 857, which was 12 strokes bet ter than New Zealand, the run nerup.

title: NEWARK EAST SIDE TRIUMPHS. 24 TO 6
description: Newark East Side scored a major intersectional victory yes terday when it visited Passaic County and posted a 246 tri umph over Patterson Eastside, with a powerful offense and effective defense.

title: Warfare Against Virus
description: It is now more than a generation since penicillin, streptomycin and other antibiotics first revolutionized the medical treatment of bacterial infections. In con trast, the search for similarly powerful antivirus drugs has until recently had only limited success.

title: PITT RALLY HANDS BAYLOR 1510 LOSS
Integrating Negroes with black people
description: I seek integration of Negroes with black people, writes Don L. Lee. As the credo of a black poet, the statement is an ade quate metaphor for the func tion of black poetry at the pres ent time. The poet is called upon to show black people what they have been, what they are now, and what they must be come. He must strip away their Americanism, reduce them to skeletons and plant flesh of beauty and substance upon their bleached white bones. Out of their joys and pain, hopes and frustrations, he must cre ate new forms and project new visions. In so doing, he must suffer certain consequences, one of which will be that his works will not be found in poetry anthologies designed for the academies.

title: Black stands out
description: In the nights ahead when many women will be dressed as Indians or Berber princesses, the woman in black will stand out as seductively feminine. The look is softjersey or knit or panne velvetand the color is black for women who don't want to take the fantasy route.

title: CRIME IS UP BY 11% IN FIRST HALF OF '70
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26 (UPI)Attorney General John N. Mitchell reports that serious crime in the nation climbed 11 per cent in the first half of 1970 over the first six months of last year.

title: AnzusPact Parties Begin Annual Review of Security
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26 (UPI) The United States, Australia and New Zealand today began their 20th annual review of in ternational security in the western Pacific and Southeast Asia. The study is being con ducted by the Council of the Anzus Security Treaty.

title: Religion
description: The Protestant churches of South Africa and the country's Government were on a collision course last week with the possibility that churchmen might share the fate of athletes and other elements of South African society  isolation from the world community.

title: DARTMOUTH SINKS MASSACHUSETTS
description: HANOVER, N. H., Sept. 26Two touchdowns by the de fense turned the tide for Dart mouth in the final two minutes of the third period today as the Indians opened their football season with a 270 victory over the University of Massa chusetts.

title: Horse Show Calendar
description: TodayEastern States, East ern States Exposition, West Springfield, Mass. Championships in all divisions. 8:45 A.M.

title: Springfield Team Victor Over Weak Amherst, 4714
description: AMHERST, Mass., Sept. 26Springfield rolled over a weak Amherst football team today, 4714.

title: Locust Valley Tops Jericho in Overtime
Miss Hobbs Fiancee Of Divinity Student
description: LANSDOWNE, Pa., Sept. 23Dr. and Mrs. Albert Hoyt Hobbs have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Deborah Joan Hobbs, to James Lawrence Andre son, son of Dr. and Mrs. Lawrence Andreson of Lex ington, Mass.

title: Fog Bars 5th Race For America's Cup
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Sept. 26Fog forced postponement today of the fifth race in the 21st America's Cup offense and as sured this resentmentfilled se ries of breaking the cup record for longevity.

title: JEFFERSON BEATS BROOKLYN TECH, 300
description: Thomas Jefferson opened its P.S.A.L. season yesterday with an impressive 300 victory over Brooklyn Tech at Lincoln Field. Barando Paez, the quarterback, paced the winners with a touch down and a scoring pass. Paez Started tne scoring when he and Ed Lofton teamed on a 40 yard passrun play in the open ing period. He scored himself in the third period on a 2yard sneak and tallied twice on 2point conversions.

title: Opening of BedfordStuyvesant TheaterOffice Building Planned in Month
description: Two nonprofit corporations trying to develop the Bedford Stuyvesant section of Brook lyn hope to start moving next month into a building on Ful ton Street near Marcy Avenue that will serve as headquar ters for a complex of business, community and cultural facil ities.

title: Buckeyes 5613 Victors
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Sept. 26Ohio State's powerful offense scored the first three times it had the ball today and a shat terproof defense set up three thirdperiod scores on two fumble recoveries and a pass interception as the Buckeyes walloped Texas A. & M., 5613.

title: Despite Increase in Autos in Europe, the Trolley Clangs On
description: VIENNA  Clang, clang, clang went the trolley, but long, long ago for most Amer icans. Yet here in Europe the street car still thrives and more often than not in a streamlined version.

title: The Nation
description: Hundreds of thousands of res idents of the Middle Atlantic states went without electricity last week as summer officially bowed out in a sizzling heat wave. They were victims of what William G. Kuhns, president of the General Public Utilities Cor poration, described as a fantas tic coincidence.

title: 3 Are Appointed to Board For State Offtrack Betting
description: ALBANY, Sept. 26Governor Rockefeller appointed three members today to the new State Offtrack Parimutuel Bet ting Commission.

title: Henry Pickering Weds Leila Jahncke
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Sept. 26  The marriage of Miss Leila Dickerman Jahncke to Henry Benson Pickering took place in the Round Hill Com munity Church here this afternoon. The Rev. Jurjen Hoomans performed the cere mony, which was followed by a reception at the Round Hill Club.

title: Fighting Erupts in Belfast; One Dies and 47 Are Hurt
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Sunday, Sept. 27 (AP)Police men and British troops battled crowds of Protestants and Ro man Catholics for 10 hours last night and early today. One man died of an apparent heart at tack, and 47 persons were in jured, including 34 policemen.

title: A world of nonverbal communication and creative silence
description: We all think as we wait: Will he have arms and legs, fingers and toes; will the heart leak, the lungs rasp; will he see and hear; will he (ultimate fear) be brain damaged? They do all sorts of things to them immedi ately after they are born, test ing this and thatand then they tell you whatever it is they tell you. If it is a normal baby, you take him home in a few days. You do not expect to dis cover two years later that your child was bor deaf.

title: Barge Is Home for Two Nondrifters
description: Early in the summer Larry Harris and Gordon Eis vacated their undistinguished apartment on Lexington Avenue for new qauarters in North Bergen, N. J.

title: A critic's own brand of cinema vrit
description: It has seemed to me ever since I started reading his regular film column in The Village Voice seven or eight years ago that no American has ever written better film criticism than Andrew Sarris; and in the past two or three years it has become clear that none has had a more profound influence on those who came after him to a serious contemplation of the movies.

title: CITY WILDLIFE AREAS LISTED IN PAMPHLET
description: August Heckscher, adminis trator of the Parks, Recreation and Cultural Affairs Adminis tration, yesterday announced the availability of a pamphlet, Wildlife Refuges and Sanctu aries of New York City's Parks.

title: Peripatetic Author In Search of a Novel
description: ON A SILVERY morning in early sum mer I was sitting at the Zoo Cafe in Berlin when this earnest American came in and asked me to help with the re unification of Germany.

title: Resort in Fiji Due in Late '71
description: An 84room resort hotel on Fiji's main island of Viti Levu, to be built by Canadian and British interests, will be oper ated by a subsidiary of Amer ican Airlines. The threestory, $2.3million hotel will be lo cated at Deuba, 32 miles west of Suva, when it is finished in late 1971.

title: Looking at the cold facts
description: Despite all the efforts of edu cators, it remains true that most citizens are poorly in formed about the scientific work that has generated so much of the goodand evilof the modern world. It re mains for science writers, such as Lucy Kavaler, to bridge this information gap. Freezing Point is an excellent exam ple of the virtues of good science writing about a fascinating scientific subjectthe impact of cold on man and other living things. It also illustrates the inadequacies of reporting which mirrors the tight specialization of science.

title: Mrs. Wertenbaker Wed
description: PETERBOROUGH, N. H., Sept. 26Mrs. Lael Tucker Wertenbaker, widow of Charles Christian Werten baker, was married here today to the actor, Bram well Fletcher. The ceremony was performed at the home of Mr. and Mrs. James Carter by the Rev. Noel Sokoloff of the Dublin Com munity Church. The bride, a resident of Nelson, is an author and former member of the staffs of Time and Life magazines. Mr. Fletch er's last appearance in New York was in his oneman show Bernard Shaw.

title: Business Index Rose in Week
description: The New York Times Weekly Index of Business Activity rose last week to 359.1 from 359.0 a week earlier. A year ago it was 345.9.

title: A High Draft Number Protects One Twin but Not His Brother
description: HIGHLAND, Mich., Sept. 26 (AP)Draft lottery No. 246 was good enough to keen Mike Carrier free of the draft, but not his twin brother, Steve. Now Mike is trying to get Steve out of the Army on the ground of erroneous induction.

title: Government Makes A $27,054 Mistake
description: DENVER, Sept. 26 (AP) Prentise Sykes, 60 years old, who makes $3.94 an hour as a Government mechanic, opened his mail last Sept. 12 and found a $27,054.49 Gov ernment check made out to him.

title: In the Flaming Streets of Amman
description: Lucky the man who speaks last to the King. His Majesty will sleep with his dream."A CURRENT JORDA NIAN PROVERB.

title: Scientist Says Mystery of Polywater Has Been Solved: Russian's Test Samples Contained Sweat
description: Polywatera controversial form of water thought by some scientists to be new and dras tically different and by others to be simply a very fancy form of tainted waterhas finally been explained, according to an American scientist.

title: Engagements
description: BARAKKRAUSMr. and Mrs. Ralph Kraus announce the engagement of their daughter, Marilyn Patricia to Tony Barak of Tel Aviv, Israel, son of Mr. and Mrs. Maurice Barak.

title: PLAYFUL SOLUTIONS
description: The children's rooms that architect Owen Beenhouwer creates are a joy for kids and an easycare pleasure for parents. By means of uninhibited angles of plywood, tackboard and Formica he manages to pack two bunks, a desk, drawers and shelves, plus six closets, into an I8by13 foot room. The largest, a threeway closet, forms the base for the bunk aerie. For a teenager (below), the architect uses the same materials and geometry for spatial excitement. He built in cabinets below the window, shelves and closets on facing wallsputting every inch of wall to work for storage, sleeping, play and display.

title: SHORTY GETS LEAD FOR JUMPER TITLE
description: CHERRY HILL, N. J., Sept. 26  Nancy McLure's Shorty captured one class and finished second in another today to take the lead for the open jumper championship at the Cooper Hospital Horse Show.

title: W. VIRGINIA WINS 9TH IN ROW, 4710
description: MORGANTOWN, W. Va., Sept. 26 (UPI)Bob Gresham and Pete Wood combined to score five touchdowns today and lead West Virginia to its ninth straight victory, a 4710 rout of Virginia Military Insti tute.

title: Shoe Plants Hurt by Imports
description: BOSTON, Sept. 26 (UPI)Thirteen shoe manufacturing plants in New England have closed since January because of competition from foreign im ports. The New England Foot wear Association said Thursday that 2,645 persons had lost their jobs because of the closings.

title: NATURE SUBSTITUTES
description: Geometric designs by Victor Vasarely are abstract versions of natureof forests, lakes, meadowswhich he sees threatened by the pollution of civili zation. They stem from his desire to restore nature, if only in abstract form, to cities and homes alike. Large structures for city squares, below, are de signed to remind deprived urbanites of their dwin dling natural landscapes. Plastic rectangles and tall pillars, right, are Vasarely's way of bringing the forest into the living room. Rugs, below right, are his newest designs. At Arras Gallery next month.

title: Recordings
description: TCHAIKOVSKY subtitled Eugene Onegin lyric scenes in three acts. He did not think of it as an opera, although it is assuredly that. Lyric, how ever, is the word that best characterizes this work, and it is one of the most appeal ing scores to be heard in an opera house. Its steady flow of rich Tchaikovskian melody, which still manages to characterize the people in Pushkin's poem, and its vital choruses and dances make it the best Russian opera after Boris Godunov. While the Metropolitan has a quite handsome production of it around, it is not on view as often as it should be. Conse quently, the first adequate re cording of it to be released is one of the best things that has happened this fall.

title: Benefits
description: Tickets for the following events may be obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicated:

title: UNDEFEATED NYACK TOPS SUFFERN, 296
description: Undefeated Nyack suddenly, got as hot as the temperature, which was near 95 degrees on the playing field, and scored three touchdowns yesterday in the second half and wallop Suf fern, 296, for its second straight. victory.

title: Robert Richter to Marry Arlene Madsen
description: HILLSDALE, N. Y., Sept. 26Miss Arlene Madsen, a junior at Quinnipiac College in Hamden, Conn., and Rob ert Richter, a Quinnipiac senior have become engaged.

description: LONDONThe image Richard Nixon sought to project when he assumed the Presidency  of calm resolution and the low pro filemay be a bit tattered in American politics. But it still commands a good deal of belief and support on this side of the Atlantic.

description: TEANECK, N. J., Sept. 26A goal by George Sielecki with 14:41 left to play broke a 11 tie between Fairleigh Dickinson University and Kings Point and Fairleigh Dickinson went on to post a 31 soccer victory.

description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Sept. 26 (UPI)Here in Damascus, the oasis capital of a nation with a large desert area, soldiers are everywhere, and the Govern ment radio broadcasts impreca tions at Jordan.

description: THE civil war in Jordan, like the hijacking and destruction of four international airliners by Palestinian refugees following the Maoist line, grew out of the fact that after, 22 years the world has failed to find a solution to one of its thorniest problems: how to provide justice for the Palestinian refugee.

title: BELMONT FEATURE TO BONNIE AND GAY
description: Bonnie and Gay, virtually un noticed through the running, flashed across the line at the last stride to finish ahead of Patelin in the $109,130 Matron Stakes at Belmont Park yester day.

title: Field Of Travel
description: THE GREAT DANBURY (Conn.) State Fair moves into its second century on Satur day, Oct. 3, when its 101st annual exposition gets under way. It will run through Mon day, Oct. 12 (Columbus Day) 10 days this year instead of the usual nine.

title: Article 90421775 -- No Title
description: COOPERLouis. The family of the late Louis Cooper wish to thank their relatives, friends and business associates for their kindness and expressions of sympathy.

description: AUGUSTA, Me., Sept. 26 (AP)John Huard, former Maine football star from Lewiston, will spend his in jury furlough from the Den ver Broncos working for the reelection of Gov. Kenneth NT. Curtis, a Democrat.

title: In a Time of Urbanization, Bear Is Still Fair Game
description: RUIDOSO, N. M.  Early one recent morning, with a fall chill clinging to the mountain hollows and a pack of haying dogs leading the way, Stanley Armstrong of Lordsburg, N. M., set out on horseback to bag his first hear. Within an hour and a half he had succeeded.

title: Stocks on the Counter And Amex Advance
description: A lessening of tensions on the military front in Jordon buoyed most stocks suffi ciently on the American Stock Exchange and on the overthecounter market to enable them to finish in the win column last week.

title: Will He Still Wow Em in 1990?
description: WHEN Rudolf Bing opened his first season as general manager of the Metropolitan Opera, in 1950, he introduced a handsome 27yearold Italian bass as Philip II in Verdi's Don Carlo. He was Cesare Siepi, who became one of the company's most durable and admired artists and this season will tackle his first Wagnerian role, Gurnemanz in Parsifal.

title: To Catch a Hijacker Texas Concern's Goal:
description: GARLAND, Texas, Sept. 26The potential airline hi jacker, armed with gun, knife or bomb, may miss his plane in the future, due to GammaII, a new weapons detection device currently under development by a small electronics concern here.

title: BULTERMAN VICTOR IN EASTOFRYE SAIL
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Sept. 26 Jacques 17. Bulterman, at the tiller of Onrust, beat Arthur H. Boyltree's Bonito by two seconds in a sixmile Luder16 Class race off Indian Harbor Y. C. today in the third regatta of the annual fall series for Yacht Racing Association fleets based east of Rye.

description: COHNSidonia. Urveiling of monument will take place at Washington Cemetery, Bklyn., at 2:15 P.M. Sept. 27.

description: Carmine Lombardozzi, a re puted Mafia figure on trial on two charges of conspiring to defraud the Internal Revenue Service, was acquitted on Fri day of one count before Judge John Cannella in Manhattan Federal Court.

description: WILLIAMSTOW, Mass., Sept. 26 (AP)Williams College has issued guidelines on the limits of political activity on its cam pus, requiring that no political activities can be carried out in the name of the school.

description: PARISIt was the hest of times and the worst of times in France last week, depending on whether one was in the Govern ment majority or in the opposi tion.

description: Mr. and Mrs. Sam Katz of Kew Gardens Hills, Queens, have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Laura Ellen Katz, to Samuel N. Sommer, son of Mr. and Mrs. Paul Sommer of Bay side Hills, Queens. The wed ding is planned for June.

description: SEOUL, South Korea, Sept. 24The South Korean Gov ernment awarded the Wen dell Phillips Oil Company of Honolulu today an oil ex ploration concession in an East China Sea area that overlaps a block claimed by Japan, near Japan's Kyushu Island.

title: .Alabama Conquers Florida, 4615, Aided by 22Point Surge in 4th Quarter
description: TUSCALOOSA, Ala., Sept. 26 (AP)Alabama overpowered Florida with 22 points in the fourth quarter today to score a 4615 Southeastern Confer ence football victory.

description: Robert Frost

title: The Daisy Named Michaelmas
description: HARDY asters bridge the blossom gap between phlox and chrysan themums with beautiful flowers. They are also good companions for dahlias, gladiolus, zinnias and mari golds.

title: A.D.A.BarsBacking To Wooers of Right
description: The national board of Ameri cans for Democratic Action adopted a resolution yesterday refusing to support candidates who move to the right.

title: Goodell Advocates Greater Pressure For Health Reform
description: Declaring that most Ameri cans cannot pay for available sophisticated medical care, Sen ator Charles E. Goodell yester day urged groups advocating a national health insurance plan to coalesce and press for swift Congressional action next year.

description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Ashland Plant Set
description: Ashland Oil Canada, Ltd., in which Ashland Oil, Inc. holds an 89 per cent interest, has; announced last week that it will build a 40million poundayear carbon black plant in St. David Levis Coun ty, Que.

title: Sharon Katzman to Wed
description: NEW HAVEN, Sept. 26Mr. and Mrs. Albert Katzman have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Sharon Lynn Katzman, to Kenneth A. Sherman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Harold D. Sher man of Brooklyn, New York. The future bride is a gradu ate of the University of Miami in Coral Gables, Fla. Mr. Sherman is a prelaw student at the University of Miami. A November wedding is planned.

title: Deborah Dickson Wed to Officer
description: HASTINGS ON HUDSON, N. Y., Sept. 26In the First Reformed Church here to day, Miss Deborah Florence Dickson, daughter of the Rev. and Mrs. Robert G. Dickson, was married to Cant. Victor Gerard Barnes, U.S.A.F. He is a son of Dr. Benjamin F. Barnes, a former Mayor of Yonkers, and Mrs. Barnes of Water Mill, L. I.

title: Suffield's 1670 Ancestry Goes On 1970 Parade
description: SUFFIELD, Conn.  The parade will stretch from one end of town to the other, filling the main streets for two and onehalf hours with movement, color and the music of some 50 bands and fife and drum corps. Sixty floats will depict the early history of Suffield. And at the head of it all will ride a modernday standin for Oliver Phelps,. itinerant peddler and thinker and the Colonies most successful real estate speculator.

title: Photography
description: I DO not think it possible, at this juncture, to come to anything approaching a full and balanced as sessment of the work of Harry Callahan.

title: Moon Dust Brought Back by Luna 16 Described as Grayish Brown
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 26The moon dust brought back to earth by the Soviet Union's un manned Luna 16 spacecraft looks grayish brown, Izvestia said today.

title: War Against Waste Escalates
description: Manufacturers of products that end up as part of the nation's solid waste and lit ter problem are stepping up their efforts to reclaim ma terials that went into the original products.

title: A whydunnit in qsharp major
description: Thirty four year old Lise has worked in an accountant's office for 16 years. She has five girls under her and two men. Over her are two women and five men. In the midst of such symmetries and in spite of the severities and restraints of which she is constituted, Use is subject to fits of uncontrollable laughter. Every one at the office agrees that she is in need of a good holiday. I'm going to have the time of my life, she says.

title: Easier Money Seen as Fuel For Fresh Economic Gains
description: The economy enters the home stretch for 1970 this week, buffeted by power ful opposing forces. The strike against General Motors, which according to some estimates is lopping $1billion from the nation's total output every week that it lasts, will certainly depress the nation's economic performance during the fourth quarter. Unemployment will be higher than it would otherwise have been, while production and profits will be lower.

title: LIGHT AND LIVELY
description: Cold, uninviting, sterile, those argu ments leveled against modern design in its infancy have been deflated. This con temporary environment by architect Ste phen Jacobs carries its own brand of ele gance. Spaces are sculptural, flowing and light, due partly to the exposed windows one (above) is 24 feet high, hung with strands of mirrored disksand partly to the minimal furnishings that concentrate attention on vibrant color accents. Jacobs gutted the building, stripping away the hodgepodge of Victorian and Empire trim. It was built speculatively in 1887, and the stylistic elements were a horror, he says. I used space as a negative, pure back ground; and color as art. Even the heat ing system became a design element (above). Radiators hung on steel hangers were recessed in the wall with slits above and below to allow air to circulate. New stepped planters, banister and brick floor ing give the remodeled entry a Mediter ranean flavor and delicacy of detail.

title: TEMPLE IS VICTOR OVER HOLY CROSS
description: WORCESTER, Mass., Sept. 26 (UPI)The Temple University defense blocked one Holy Cross punt, partially blocked another and turned both into touch downs today to defeat the Crusaders, 2313.

title: It Is Easy To Bemoan Rock and Pot
description: A YOUNG man, aged 20, told me about his going to a record store during the Christmas rush and selecting two LP's of Beethoven's Music and two of the Beat les's. The salesman to whom he handed his purchase, as suming that they represented two separate gifts, proceeded to wrap them separately, until my young friend inter rupted these labors to say that all four records could go into one parcel and never mind the gift wrap since it was for himself that he had bought the two B's.

title: Wisconsin Draft Board Ends Protest Moratorium
description: STURGEON BAY, Wis., Sept. 26 (AP)Door County Selective Service Board No. 16 has ended its monthlong refusal to order any men for induction into the armed services.

title: Flawed quest for the beauty beyond banality
description: In Whitewater Paul Horgan has PhilUpson Durham, the hero, reflect that even the great lives of long ago were, once colloquial; and then the sense of their agitation makes him feel the tug of the familiar, the un evaluated time of his own youthnames, places, allas though it too must be historically precious: the commonplace become legendary.

title: Screening of Employes Urged To Tighten Trucking Safety
description: A trucking executive urged the industry last week to change its thinking about car go security at a time when crime losses are running at $1 billion a year.

title: In Memoriam
description: DONDavid. In fond and loving memory of a beloved husband, adored father and dar ling poppy, on Sept. 28, 1962.

title: U.S. TO GIVE JORDAN $5MILLION IN RELIEF
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26 (AP) President Nixon ordered $5 million in emergency relief for Jordan's civilian casualties to day, and he indicated that Jor dan would also receive some arms shipments from the Uni ted States.

title: SUPERSTAIRS
description: Superstairs were architect Dennis Holloway's solution to squeezing living essentials into a small apartment and out of a small budget. He designed and built three trilevel boxes of plywood (total cost: $200) that offer 36 arrangements for seating, sleeping, lounging and working. Five of the possible setups are shown here. Foam rubber bolsters and mattresses, sliced into thirds for cushions, determined the mod ules dimensions and the depth of the steps. Line up Superstairs and, voila, three single guest beds at three different levels. Pull up a stool to the hollow back end, and highest surface works as a desk. Open the hinged lid of each step to find storage space. The sky (a touch of whimsy) was copied by a grid laid over a photograph and transferred squareby square to the ceiling, like painting by numbers.

title: 3 Former Panthers Acquitted of Conspiracy to Rob
description: Three former Black Panthers charged with conspiracy to commit robbery were acquitted last night after the jury ended four days of deliberation.

title: Mitchell Offers Forum for Students
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26 (UPI) Attorney General John N. Mitchell said today that the Justice Department would strive to open a dialogue with college students by offering to send representatives to major cam puses.

title: Steel Maker's Only Luxury Is Profit
description: STERLING, Ill.For most of the steel industry, the strike against the General Motors Corporation, which consumes about 9 per cent of all this country's steel output, has been the worst single development of a generally disappoint ing year. But for the Northwestern Steel and Wire Company, the direct and im mediate impact of the G.M. walkout has been zero.

title: The Szechuan way
description: The cuisine of Szechuan is a brilliant freak that breaks all the rules and gets away with it, according to Hsiang Ju Lin and Tsuifeng Lin in their book Chinese Gastronomy (Hastings House). The cuisine of this province in South west China is frealdsh, because hot peppers and a certain oiliness are char acteristic. One is shocked by the first taste, the authors note, then one begins to see... a different logic. New Yorkers have become increasingly attracted TO this different logic during the past decade. The really excellent Szechuan dishes for which recipes are given at left and on the following page were served re cently in the home of Michael Tong, of the Shun Lee Dynasty restaurant.

title: A Carolina colonel in the Civil War
description: This is a likable booksober, honest, unpretentious for the most partabout a North Carolina colonel and his brigade during the Civil War, chiefly and climactically at the Battle of Gettysburg. Mr. Ehle has published five other novels. and three books of nonfiction, and it should come as no surprise that his narrative has a certain sharpness and assurance about it. There's a wealth of rustic detail here, closely observed; a potentially arresting conflict be tween two brothers in love with the same girl; gory battle scenes; famous generals (Lee and Jackson in particular).

title: Peruvian Workers Striking Key Iron and Copper Mines
description: LIMA, Sept. 26 (AP)Peru's two largest copper mines and her most important iron mineall controlled by United States companies  were idle today because of strikes involving about 19.000 miners, members of a Communistdominated la bor union.

title: An antihero turned inside out
description: Many lovers of books about the sea will find this one, though it chronicles failure rather than success, much the most engrossing of recent ac counts of longdistance small boat solo voyages. Neither Francis Chichester nor Robin KnoxJohnson, no more than Joshua Slocum years ago, re veals himself in depth. Ger bault's philosophizings are metaphysical, not selfdirected. But in this instance, two top London newspapermen have teamed together for what amounts to a virtuoso demon stration of the soul's anatomy. They turn their antihero in side out. And as horror mounts, fascination keeps pace.

title: BROWN PINS LOSS ON RHODE ISLAND
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Sept. 26 Bob Flanders, a senior start ing at quarterback for the first time, and Gary Bonner, a sopho more, helped Brown Univer sity's football team stop the University of Rhode Island, 21 14, this afternoon at Brown Stadium before 15,000 fans.

title: Helicopter Brings Supplies To. Remote Arctic Colonies
description: On Aug. 21 the Fort St. Louis, a 4,000ton cargo ship, steamed into Resolute Bay, deep in the Arctic, with a Sikorsky S64E Skycrane lashed to her deck.

title: Miss Krauss Is Bride Here
description: In the Lady Chapel at St. Patrick's Cathedral yester day, Miss Suzanne Joyce Krauss, daughter of Mrs. William Frederick Krauss of Short Hills, N. J., became the bride of John William Bloom, son of Mr. and Mrs. James Robert Bloom of Davenport, Iowa. The ceremony, per formed by the Rev. Robert Moher, was followed by a re ception at the Metropolitan Club.

title: Peters Is Calm Over the Lull In Renting
description: The ebulliently blunt pres Meat and chief executive officer of Cushman & Wake field, Leone J. Peters, has this to say to the young real estate man: You must learn how to lose a deal. Any idiot can make them.

title: Memphis State Edges V.P.I. In Final 45 Seconds, 2120
description: BLACKSBURG, Va., Sept. 26 (UPI)  Jay McCoy, a senior tailback, went over from the twoyard line for the tying touchdown with 45 seconds re maining today and then kicked his third conversion to give Memphis State a 2120 victory over Virginia Tech.

title: Campos RockThrowing Held Down by Novel Plan
description: URBANA, Ill., Sept 26 (UPI)Officials of the Uni varsity of Illinois wanted to make the campus look pretty, with rocks set in the proper places. But they did not want the rocks to he used for throwing. So, they glued them down.

title: Letters
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: NEW DIRECTIONS
Yankees Down Tiers, 21, as Peterson Registers 19th Victory on 5Hitter
description: Fritz Peterson's dream of a 20victory season hung in the muggy air over Yankee Sta dium yesterday.

title: Hussein Wins the Battle but Price Is Very High
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  A parox ysm of carnage, Arab against Arab, drew to a bitter close in Jordan this weekend. There was a victor on the battlefield, King Hussein's army. And there were the vanquishedthe commandos, with their leadership and ranks decimated and their power base in Jordan crippled, but still hold ing out in much of Amman and in the northern cities. Above all, there were the dead and wounded in the tens of thou sands, mainly noncombatants, the aged, the women and the children.

title: The Unknown Who Leads The Walter P. Reuther Memorial Strike
description: DETROIT, Mich.

title: French Petroleum Concerns Entering Plastics
description: PARISFrench petroleum companies owned all or in part by the state have de cided to consolidate and ex pand petrochemical output in a major move shaping the country's No. 2 group in the field of plastics.

title: Eleanor Yoa Wed To Merrill Ayers
description: SUMMIT, N. J.. Sept. 26In St. Teresa's Roman Catho lic Church here this after noon, Miss Eleanor Marcella Yoa, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George F. Yoa, was married to A. Merrill Ayers, son of Mr. and Mrs. Alvin D. Ayers of Falls Church, Va. The Rev. John P. McGovern performed the ceremony.

title: Dinner Dance Will Aid Manhattan School of Music
description: The Manhattan School of Music, which is in the midst of a $9.5million expansion program, will spur its fund raising drive on Oct. 14 with $100aperson benefit dinner dance and show at the Wal dorf.

title: Interne to Wed Mary J. Roney
description: ROCHESTER, Sept. 26Miss Mary Jane Roney, who teaches at the School for Language and Hearing Im paired Children in New York, and Dr. John C. Madigan Jr., an interne at the Presbyterian Hospital in New York, plan to be married on Jan. 2.

title: A Polo Match Today To Aid Addiction Fight
description: A team from Jamaica in the West Indies will meet a Fairfield, Conn. team on the polo field of the Fairfield County Hunt Club today at 3 P.M. for the Skakel Memor ial Trophy.

title: PENN TRIUMPHS OVER LEHIGH, 240
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 26A dazzling 84yard brokenfield run with a punt return by Ste ven Solow led Penn to a 240 victory over Lehigh today in opening its 94th season before 10,406 fans at Franklin Field.

title: Coop Conglomerates Advocated
description: In the face of criticism from a good many of the residents of buildings it manages, the United Housing Founda tion, one of the nation's largest co operative housing organizations, is spreading the gospel of cooperative conglomerates.

title: White House Names Aide To Recruit New Officials
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26President Nixon announced to day the appointment of Fred eric V. Malek, the Deputy Under Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, to be a special assistant to the Pesi dent.

title: Nigeria Asks U.S. to Bart Groups Seeking Funds for Biafran Relief
description: Nigeria has asked the United States to suppress as fraudu lent two charitable founda tions collecting funds for the former secessionist territory of Biafra.

title: Hussein Expected to Join Cairo Conference Today
description: CAIRO, Sept. 26King Hus sein of Jordan is expected in Cairo tomorrow to take part in discussions of Arab leaders on the bitter conflict in his coun try, a United Arab Republic spokesman said tonight.

title: Unusual Hardy Bulbs For Spring Surprises
description: GARDENERS who delight in grow ing the unusual can have a field day with fritillaries, cyclamens, camassias and erythroniums. Pro ducing displays varying from three inch es to three feet in height, these hardy bulbs bloom in spring, summer or early fall All can be planted now.

title: CZECH ISSUE FADES AT LITERARY FAIR
description: FRANKFURT, West Germany, Sept 26Just before Soviet tanks put an end to Czecho slovakia's liberal reforms on Aug, 21, 1968, Czech writers and publishers who had been in the forefront of the move ment burst upon the Frankfurt Book Fair like political and lit erary heroes.

title: MAILVOTE TREND IS AGAINST PAM
description: STOCKHOLM, Sept. 26  A stronger than expected trend against the Government in the absentee vote in last Sunday's general election has injected note of uncertainty into the future political coarse in Sweden.

title: KANSAS CONQUERS SYRACUSE BY 3114
description: SYRACUSE, Sept. 26Syra cuse University preserved order around Archbold Stadium to day with maximum security measures, but Kansas ran wild on the football field en route to a 3114 victory over the Orangemen.

title: Statue of Dr. King Urged
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26 (AP) A bill to put a statute of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. in the Capitol was introduced Thursday by Representative Jonathan B. Bingham. Democrat of Manhattan.

title: NIXON OFF TODAY ON EUROPEAN TRIP
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26President Nixon leaves tomor row on a European tour during which he will display the mili tary might of the United States Sixth Fleet in the Mediterra nean Sea.

title: BROWNIE CAPTURES TWO BLUES AT SHOW
description: MIDDLETOWN, N. Y., Sept. 26Brownie, owned and pi loted by John Sindt, took two blues, was second in two other classes and third in another to win the regular working hunter championship today at the Mid dletown Rotary Horse Show.

title: Shopping Centers Spread At a Sharply Slowed Pace
description: Twenty years ago, the con temporary American shop ping center boom that has reverberated around the world was set off by the opening of the first two ma jor centers at opposite ends of the country.

title: U.S. REFUSES AID TO CITY FOR U.N.
description: The Federal Government has refused to reimburse the costs imposed upon New York City as host to the United Nations, Controller Abraham D. Beame disclosed yesterday.

title: At Daitch: Dairy's In a Name
description: Imagebuilding sometimes can be overdone in the opin ion of Herbert B. Daitch and Martin Rosengarten, Chair man of the board and presi dent, respectively, of the Daitch Crystal Dairies, Inc.

title: DUKE SETS BACK VIRGINIA BY 177
description: DURHAM, N. C., Sept. 20 (AP)  Duke missed on five scoring chances today before they came from behind on the passing of Leo Hart and de feated Virginia, 177, in an Atlantic Coast Conference game.

title: Alfred's Big Last Quarter Downs Rensselaer, 4430
description: TROY, N. Y., Sept. 26Alfred University, scoring 20. points in the last period, beat Rensselaer Poly, 4430, today before 3,200 fans. It was R.P.I.'s first losing home opener in five years.

title: SST Delay Is Requested By Airports Over Noise
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26Airport operators who have borne the brunt of community complaints about jet aircraft noise, have asked the Nixon Administration not to build the supersonic transport unless it can meet the stringent noise standards being applied to new subsonic designs.

title: Edwards Defeats Dederick By 1 Up in Crump Cup Golf
description: CLEMENTON, N.J., Sept. 26 William Edwards of Mineola, L. I., defeated Dr. Jerry Dede rick of Oradell, N.J., I up, in gaining the semifinal round of the George Arthur Crump Me morial Cup Tournament at the Pine Valley Golf Club today.

title: REVSON EARNS POLE FOR TODAY'S CANA4
description: BRAINERD, Minn., Sept. 26 (AP)Peter Revson of New York edged the New Zealand fers, Denis Hulme and Chris Amon, today and gained the pole position for tomorrow's S83,000 Minneapolis Tribune CanadianAmerican Challenge Cup race at Donnybrooke Speedway.

title: Banks See Rise In Acceptances
description: Outstanding bankers ac ceptances rose slightly last month to the fifth consecu tive monthly record, but bills created to finance third country trade fell sharply, the Federal Reserve Bank of New York reported last week.

title: Miss Marilyn Scott Doty Fiancee of Charles Troy Shaver Jr.
description: FAIRFIELD, Conn., Sept. 26  Mr. and Mrs. Leete Parmelee Doty have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Marilyn Scott Doty, to Charles Troy Shaver Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Shaver of Orlando. Fla.

title: Lawrence Subdues Sewanhaka, 20 to
N.Y.A.C. Rowers Defeat Manhattan In 8Oared Shells
description: The New York Athletic Club's eightoared shell defeated Man hattan College today in the In dian Summer regatta of the New York Rowing Associa tion. Ten races were held on the calm waters of the Orchard Beach Lagoon.

title: Ohio Senate Contest May Turn On Outcome of Governor's Race
description: DAYTON, Ohio, Sept. 26When the candidates for the United States Senate showed up at the Y.W.C.A. to debate last week, it was Froward M. Metzenbaum, the liberal Demo crat, rather than Robert Taft Jr., the conservative Republi can, who wore an American flag on his lapel.

title: For Travelers: A Garden That Tends to Itself
description: THE two hobbies of gardening and travel can coexist. I've proved it.

title: A bloodandthunder hero who disliked Arabs
description: Richard Meinertzhagen grew up in the evocative English set ting of an old and famous coun try house complete with ghosts and the finest troutfishing. Victorian nurseries like his produced hundreds of young men whose sense of privilege was fed by ferocious ideals.

title: Peace Garden Bill Backed
description: George Hartzog, the director of the National Park Service, has urged passage of a bill in creasing the appropriation for the International Peace Garden in North Dakota. The bill would increase authorized funds for the garden by $925,000.

title: Newcombe, Laver Advance to Final In Pacific Tennis
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 26 (AP) John Newcombe, the Wimble don champion, defeated Tom Gorman of Seattle in two tie breaker sets today to advance into tomorrow's final against topseeded Rod Laver in the Pacific Southwest open tennis championships.

title: NEW DIRECTIONS
Bravo, Bantlel!
description: THERE is a scene toward the end of Tristana, the new, quintes sential Luis Bufiuel film at the Lincoln Art Theater, that has led some critics to suspect that this extraor dinarily selfcontained director, whose work makes practically no reference to the movies of anyone else, has gone as positively sentimental as the late Leo McCarey as he enters the eighth decade of his life.

title: Prisoners Of War: You Talk To the Rats
description: WASHINGTON  The worst part of captivity is the isolation.

title: U.S. SETS BACK SPAIN IN FINALE OF CHESS
description: SIEGEN, Germany, Sept. 26 The United States team de feated Spain, 21, in the 11th and final round of the 19th Chess Olympiad today and finished fourth in the tourna ment. The Americans had a score of 2419.

title: NEW DIRECTIONS
Agnew and Kennedy Set Dates For Connecticut Campaigning
description: HARTFORD, Sept. 26Vice President Agnew and Senator Edward M. Kennedy of Massa chusetts will campaign for their respective parties in Connecti cut next month, according to state Republican and Demo cratic leaders.

title: Andrews Defeats Ferrie For U.S. Senior Golf Title
description: SOUTH SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 26 (UPI)Gene Andrews of Whittier, Calif., sank a 20 foot birdie putt on the 18th hole today to beat Jim Ferrie of Indian Weels, Calif., for the United States senior amateur golf championship.

title: Fla. State's 4 Field Goals Down Wake Forest by 19.14
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Sept. 26 (UPI)Frank Fontes kicked four field goals soccerstyle to night to help Florida State re cord a 1914 victory over Wake Forest.

title: Orfianized Crime in City Bleeds Slums of Millions
description: When several hundred Puerto Rican youths ran through East Harlem on the night of June 14, smashing store windows and setting rubbish fires after a rally to protest the arrest of a Young Lords leader, almost every store between 105th and 116th Streets suffered some damage.

title: Speaking Of Books: Dashiell Hammett
description: This is going to be what would be called in French un hommage to its subject. Perhaps the best kind of critical tribute one can give a writer is a meditation on his work, usually on some kind of memorial occasion. It is just short of a decade since Dasthiell Hammett's death, and just past 35 years since his last novel was published. What occasions these paragraphs was not a public event (like an anniversary) but a domestic one; not a literary moment, in fact but a cinematic sance. A film or dramatization of a novel usually, leads one away from its author's art. In this case, the irony is that it not only brought me close to Hammett, but close to the prob lematic quality of his famethe transparency of his literary personal ity, and the ubiquity of his influ ence.

title: Wellbeloveds Have Son.
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Sept. 26A son was born on Sept. 14 at St. Joseph's Hos pital in Stamford to Mr. and Mrs. Robert S. Wellbeloved. The child has been named Blair Douglas. Mrs. Well beloved, the former Miss Barbara Travers, is the daughter of Mrs. Frederick Travers of Manhasset, L. I. Mr. Wellbeloved is the di rector of scheduling of the data processing division of International Business Ma chines in White Plains.

title: Rescuing the Iron Horse
description: WASHINGTONThe House Com merce Committee approved this week an expanded version of a bill already passed by the Senate that would go a long way toward preserving and improving railroad passenger service in America. Limited as the measure still is, it nevertheless could become a landmark of the Nixon Administra tion, much as the Interstate Highway System was a major achievement of the Eisenhower Administration.

title: Malaysian Cabinet Named By the New Prime Minister
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia, Sept. 23 (Reuters)  The new Prime Minister, Abdul Rezak, announced his Cabinet today, retaining the key posts of for eign affairs and defense for himself.
