description: Bold graphics: Convex mirror, at top, framed by smoke and black plastic, has impact of a stoplight. $115. W & 1 Sloane. Canvas pil lows are appliqutsd in bright jockeysuit col ors. Tsao. $8 for 14 inch squares. Available at Gold Mine Shop.

title: Outbursts of Fighting in Amman After Truce Suggest a Breakdown of Authority
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Sept. 26Outbursts of fighting after yes terday's general ceasefire an nouncement have confirmed the widespread fears here that more than a week of civil war has gravely undermined the stability of the country and King Hussein's regime.

title: Job Changes:
description: The United States Steel Corporation has announced two major appointments in its finance department, ef fective Oct. 1.

title: REVIVALS
MINNESOTA RUNNING DOWNS OHIO U., 497
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Sept. 26 (UPI)Employing a devastat ing ground attack, Minnesota overwhelmed Ohio University, 497. today.

title: Giants Triumph Over Padres, 7 to 6, With ThreeRun Rally in 9th Inning
description: SAN FRANCISCO. Sept. 26 (UPI)Ron Hunt's pinch single following a tworun single by Ken Henderson in the ninth in ning today drove in the decid ing run and gave the San Francisco Giants a 76 victory over the San Diego Padres.

title: Wow! This Certainly Has Been a Fun Interview!
description: LATELY, I've become aware of celebrity in terviewing as it's com monly practiced on TV's midnight and midday talk shows, as opposed to how we in the press go about it, and I'm forced to conclude that our whole newspaper ap proach is wrong.

title: House Panel Sets '78 Goal For Interstate Highways
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26 (UPI)The House Public Works Committee has approved legis lation that would set a new 1978 target date for completion of the nation's interstate high way program at an added cost of some $25billion.

title: PATTERNED FLAIR OF THE REGENCY
description: Regency pieces are becoming increasingly scarce both IN England and America, while the taste for pattern6onpat tern and chinoiserie accents has become a well established trend. Designer Mario Buatta, who designed the interior of this town house, is the first to admit that he was born in the wrong century; his love is the ebullient English Re gency period and most of the things surrounding him are choice examples of the early 19th Century. He is not alone, however, in favoring the furnishings popular just prior to the onset of Victorian. Here he has brought to gether the richness of pattern, texture and eccentric shapes that made the period deservedly memorable. For all their variety, these rooms are genuinely pleasing.

title: Quiz No. 114
WALKER'S CAL48 WINS IIISCOE SAIL
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Sept. 26 Sidney V. Walker Jr.'s Cal 48 sloop, Wandelaar, of the host club fleet, won the His coe Trophy on Long Island Sound today in the Belle Haven Y.C. annual yacht race.

title: Deborah Hirsch Engaged to Wed G. C. McNamee
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Sept. 26The engagement of Miss Deborah Lawrence Hirsch to George Cooley McNamee has been announced by her mother, Mrs. Lawrence M. Hirsch. Miss Hirsch is a daughter also of the late Mr. Hirsch, who was a lawyer in New York.

title: Yale Beats Connecticut, 100, as Jauron Scores and Rushes for 116 Yards
description: NEW HAVEN, Sept. 26In 98 years of playing football, Yale has had a lot of memora ble players and another one came into view at The Bowl today when the Elis finally wore down Connecticut to win, 100.

title: Miss Thornquist Bride of Broker
description: CHESTNUT HILL, Mass., Sept. 25  Miss Karen Thornquist of Boston and John Walker MacDuffie were married here this afternoon in the Unitarian First Church in Chestnut Hill by the Rev. Joseph A. Bassett.

title: Textiles: PayIssue One in Many
description: The failure of J. P Stevens & Co., Inc., the nation's sec ond largest textile producer, to go along with a general increase in wages, points up some of the difficulties that the giants of the industry have been going through.

title: Jenmist Dougal Captures 5th BestinShow Award at Suffolk County Event
description: LAKE GROVE, L, I., Sept. 26  Ch. Jenmist Dougal, a Sealyham terrier owned by Mrs. Henry Sutliff Jr. of Rich mond, Va., was named best in show in a field of 1,113 dogs at the 32d annual fixture of the Suffolk County Kennel Club.

title: Boy Scouts in Brooklyn Joining Campaign Against Drug Abuse
description: A group of Boy Scouts in Brooklyn has been encouraged to use the Scout tradition of a daily good deed to help drug addicts.

title: Merchant's View:
description: An unseasonable spell of hot weather has cut into re tail volume and it is being felt not only in the stores on Main Street but in and around the environs of Sev enth Avenue as well. Manu facturers of women's apparel are still waiting for the big buying signal and so far it hasn't come.

title: NEW DIRECTIONS
Lovina Stratton Will Be Bride Of Grant Edward Friday Jr.
description: CHATHAM, Mass., Sept. 26 Mr. and Mrs. Daniel E. Stratton, formerly of Pelham Manor, N. Y., Pittsburgh and Chicago, have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Lovina Ruth Strat ton, to Grant Edward Friday Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Fri day of Fox Chapel, Pa.

title: OF PAST AND PRESENT
description: Some people collect art, but we prefer to collect antiques, says the distaff side of a youthful couple whose Manhattan apartment is a gallery tour of 18thcentury English design. Far from exuding any stuffiness, the rooms sparkle with the personal touchesaccessories, choice of colors, contemporary floor plan, and flair for texturesthat could derive only from the exuberant owners. They searched out every piece as fastidiously as art collectors and sought technical advice from designer Carol Ann Hayden and architect Allen Buchs baum. There are fine examples of Early Georgian (the rare set of dining chairs). Chippendale, Hepplewhite (the delicate arm chairs in the living room), English rococo, and, in the kitchen (see cover), the rustic cottage styles of the time. Joining past to present is the garden room (above). Sheathed in mirrors and alive with plantings, it is blessed with a bay window that commands a splendid river view.

title: Dictionary of Scientific Biography
description: A readily available source of accurate information about the lives and achievements of scien tists has been on the wanted list of writers, teachers, stu dents, and general readers for decades. The Dictionary of Scientific Biography, to con sist of 13 volumes, has been designed to make available the professional lives of those in dividuals whose contributions to science were sufficiently dis tinctive to make an identifiable difference to the profession or community of knowledge. The two first volumes have now ap neared.

title: Rosemary Casals Defeats Mrs. Dalton for Net Title
description: HOUSTON, Sept. 26 (UPI)Rosemary Casals of San Fran Icisco won the $5,000 Virginia Slims invitation tourney today by beating Mrs. Judy Dalton of Australia, 57, 61, 75.

title: Movies
description: FIVE EASY PIECES has been called a road picture, the latest in a genre begun by Easy Riderwhich leaves out of account the fact that maybe a third of all American mov ies are road pictures to some degree, part of the great store of road novels, road poems, road music and road art whose very ubiquitousness in our culture rather camouflages their corn mon identity. The sensation or traveling, of rootlessness, of the strangeness of strange and even of familiar native places, of the look and feel of empty streets and highways or, on another vel, the simple sense of all that ter rific, lonely space out there, crisscrossed in the night by rivers and trucksconsti tutes a good deal of what might loosely be called the American spiritual experi ence. The tack of recent road"oriented movies is nostalgic rather than revel atory, exploiting rather than illuminating a set of respon ses instilled by thousands of previous, less selfconscious artifacts.

title: The Long Trail Into Tribal Lands Of the Havasupai
description: PEACH SPRINGS, Ariz.  While most tribes were being pushed off their lands by the westward expansion of the white man, the Havasupai Indians of northern Arizona managed to remain in the can yon where their ancestors had lived for about 800 years.

title: 5 ExWorld Champions to Race in Watkins Glen Grand Prix Sunday
description: The Grand Prix of the United States, the only event that gives American fans a chance to see the best of the road racers in action, will have five former world champions going for the $50,000 first prize at Wat kins Glen, N. Y., next Sun day. The five are Jack Brabham of Aus tralia, Graham Hill of England, Denis Hulme of New Zealand, Jackie Stewart of Scotland and John Surtees, a Briton living in Switzerland. Stewart is the most recent to acquire the former cham pion title, since he failed in last week's Canadian Grand Prix to pick up any points toward retaining the cham pionship he won in 1969.

title: VICTORIAN FRIVOLITIES
description: Now that the Metropolitan Museum has honored I9thcentury Americana with a centennial exhibition, Victorian furniture is creeping out of closets to be viewed in a more flattering light. Freshened with bright yellow upholstery, Victorian settee and side chair present a quaint femininity in this attic bedroom tucked under the eaves of an older home. Other Victorian frivolities are gingham prints and granny frills on the pillows that plump the guest bed. Designed by Wood & Renkert.

title: Pope Is 73 Years Old; Plans No Celebration
description: ROME, Sept. 25 (AP)Pope Paul VI became 73 years old today, but for the second year in a row he planned no birthday celebra tion.

title: Mets Sweet September Song Hits a Sour Refrain This Year
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept. 26Gil Hodges sat in a sweat shirt behind the manager's desk in the visiting team's clubhouse in Three Rivers Stadium tonight and said wearily: It's been a long, long, long season.

title: LEAD IS 4 GAMES
CARLTON OF CARDS STOPS EXPOS, 72
description: MONTREAL, Sept 26 (UPI) Joe Torre drove in two runs with a triple and Steve Carlton tossed a threehitter as the St. Louis Cardinals defeated Montreal by 72 in a game in which four Expos were ejected.

title: Mrs. W. Averell Harriman Dies; Former Governor's Wife Was 67
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26Mrs. Marie Norton Harriman, wife of W. Averell Harriman, former Governor of New York and a former Under Secretary of State, died today after a heart attack in George Wash ington University Hospital. She was 67 years old and lived in Georgetown.

title: Warren to Give Lecture
description: MANHATTAN, Kan., Sept. 26 (AP)Former Chief Justice Earl Warren will deliver the second Landon lecture of the academic year on Oct. 21 at Kansas State University. Presi dent Nixon deliv??? the first Landon lecture re 197071 on Sept. 16.

title: ENVIRONMENT UNIT SHIFTING EMPHASIS
description: The Lindsay administration made a change in the city's En vironmental Control Board last week that shifted the board's approach from a scientific one toward one of political acti vism.

title: Goldberg in Queens and Bronx Predicts Victory by Big Margin
description: Arthur J. Goldberg took his campaign for Governor into heavily populated areas of Queens and the Bronx yester day and repeatedly charged that Governor Rockefeller had failed to meet the state's needs in narcotics control, mass tran sit and education.

title: Marriages
description: JACOBSROSSINSKY. Mr. and Mrs. Samuel Rossinsky announce the marriage of their daughter, Etlen, to Mr. Barry Jacobs, son of Mrs. Carl Jacobs.

title: DECK WITH A DARING DESIGN
description: Architect Leonard Perfido add ed a modem deck bristling with outspoken geometry to a tradi tional house in Mamaroneck. The daring design came about when the owners, wanting to enjoy their outdoor spaces more fully, approached the architect with a rough sketch. Their deck would have floated on stilts above the lawn, enhancing nei ther the house nor the setting. Instead Perfido suggested a plan to link yard, deck and house. The deck rises from the lawn by two broad staircases to a sunny outdoor room, a terrace area with windbreakers on two sides. Another staircase joins it to the house.

title: Miss Stephanie Spaulding Is Affianced
description: BURLINGTON, Vt., Sept. 26  Mr. and Mrs. Albert Clark Spaulding have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Ste phanie Spaulding, to David Fauver Bischoff, son of Mr. and Mrs. Ralph F. Bischoff of Westport, Conn., and Or ford, N. H.

title: Trinity Surprises Williams On Passing of Sophomore
description: HARTFORD, Conn., Sept. 26 A sophomore quarterback, Erich Wolters, came off the bench today, threw three touch down passes and sparked Trin ity College to a 3528 upset vic tory over Williams. Wolters threw 4 yards to Whitney Cook with 40 seconds remaining for the decidine score.

title: Article 3  No Title
A Radical Student View
description: Following are excerpts from an editorial that appeared last week in The Daily Cardinal, the student newspaper at the University of Wisconsin.

title: Oregon State Tops Favored Oklahoma, 2314, on 3 Passes
description: NORMAN, Okla., Sept. 26 (UPI)  Steve Endicott, the quarterback, threw three touch down passes and Oregon State runners gained 253 yards today to upset 13thranked Okla homa, 2314.

title: Jews in occupied Poland
description: The Jacob Street the Bader family lives on is in Cracow and the time of their living there is the year 1940. The Baders are Jews and Cracow is in that part of Poland occupied by the German Army. So this novel is not (as the title sug gested to the reviewer) some thing warm and droll in the style of Shalom Aleichem, but considerably grimmer. Still, as holocaust literature goes, it is not all that grim. At the end of the book Samuel and Amelia Bader and their daughter, Ha lina, are still alive and fairly well fed. And hopeful about their prospects of continuing in that condition.

title: Guerrillas Accuse Hussein
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Sept. 26 (AP)The Palestine Liberation Organization said here today it had decided to charge King Hussein of Jordan with geno cide. A spokesman said We are serious about the trial. We ex pect to topple him soon and in this case he will he tried and condemned in Jordan. If that is not possible, he said, a tri bunal representing all Arab countries would try the King in absentia, possibly in Libya, Syria or Iraq.

title: On trial at a ghostly family picnic
description: Brian Moore comes from the mid dleclass sector of the submerged and currently beleaguered Catholic mi nority of Belfast in Ulster. Like many Irish writers before him, he has fol lowed the path of voluntary exile in managing a successful career as a novelist and is the only writer I know of who has lived and worked, and collected a number of impressive lit erary credits and prizes, in no less than four Englishspeaking countries Ireland, England, Canada and the United States. There are obvious risks in so much mobility. Most imag inative writers need a home base to avoid dispersal of their imaginative energies. Of course deep dedication to one's craft, as the careers of Joyce and Nabokov have demonstrated, pre vents such dispersal, however widely a writer wanders; and it helps too if one is a writer of pronounced auto biographical bent who keeps making books which arrange confrontations between the temporally dispersed and separated parts of one's own life his tory.

title: The Week in Finance:
description: IF THERE was any doubt about the underlying inclina tions of the financial markets, it should have been destroyed by the powerfully buoyant performances they gave last week.

title: Cocteau
description: The nearly simultaneous publica tion of these two books is a curiously happy eventcurious for the reason that no autobiographer is less reliable than Jean Cocteau and few as myopic, and that no biographer is more re liable than Francis Steegmuller and few as knowledgeable and perceptive; happy for the reader who in his left hand can hold Cocteau's fancies and concealments and in his right, Steeg muller's facts and insights, and ob serve the relation of the two, how they can sometimes merge, more often blur, frequently diverge. The only possible sadness in this pub lishing event comes from the fact that Francis Steegmuller, even while correcting or questioning it, uses a good deal of the material that Mr. Phelps uses, and the need for Mr. Phelps's book, therefore, ceases to be exactly pressing.

title: Calendar of Motor Sports Events
description: TodayUnited States Auto Club Trenton 300 at Trenton (N. J.) Speedway. Practice: noon; time trials: 1:15 P.M.2:45; 300 mile race at 3:15 P.M.

title: There May Be Gold in All That Talk But How to Find It?
description: I JUST finished writing a book about Clifford Odets. From 1935, when his revolutionary strike play, Waiting for Lefty, became the talk of New York, until 1963, when he died while he and Richard Boone were putting to gether a TV repertory theater, his name was constantly in newspapers and mag azines. I spent days going through clip files and scrapbooks, turning up casual items, bits of fact or gossip that sud denly threw new light on the man or on one of his plays or movies. A friend of mine, holding copy while I checked the bibliographic notes, said suddenly, This is a list of the dead.

title: Dance
description: MILAN

title: NEW DIRECTIONS
Cowboy Hayes to Sit Out Giant Game
description: DALLAS, Sept. 26Bob Hayes, who owns a chain of men's clothing stores, may soon need one of his tailors to reenforce the seat of his Dallas Cowboy football uni form. Bullet Bob is doing a lot of sitting these days.

title: Space
description: The Soviet Union now has some moon soil of its own, and the way it was plucked from the Sea of Fertility and returned to earth by Luna 16 last week is being hailed as a significant mile stone in space exploration.

title: U.S. Acts to Make Local Areas Adequately Fund Poor Schools
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26The Government has taken the first step under a new law to ward requiring the nation's school districts to put as much state and local resources into schools in poor neighborhoods as they do into others.

title: Arcaro and Nicklaus Named To President's Fitness Unit
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26 (AP)Four sports figures have been named by President Nixon to the President's Conference on Physical Fitness and Sports, Senator Edward J. Gurney, Re publican of Florida, said yes terday.

title: Medicine
description: Malaria is still a scourge of much of the world despite at tempts during recent decades to eradicate this parasitic disease. Progress has been made in some countries. But biological condi tions such as resistance of the mosquito to some insecticides and some strains of the parasite to drugs, administrative prob lems such as the lack of ade quate numbers of trained per sonnel, and political turmoil are among the factors that have limited malaria control in most underdeveloped countries.

title: Soviet Is Still Making Payments for LendLease
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26, (Reuters)  The Soviet Union is still making regular pay ments to the United States for material supplied under the LendLease program following World War II, the Treasury has announced.

title: Hawaii Ombudsman Says Job Is Sound
description: HONOLULU, Sept. 26 Herman Doi, the nation's first ombudsman, has found after a year in office that the com plaint system provides solid governmental and sociological values.

title: Panaretos, in Hydroplane, Sets Mark in West Virginia
description: NEW MARTINSVILLE, W. Va., Sept. 26 (UPI)Ten Pana retos of Detroit drove his 225 cubicinch hydroplane to a rec ?? hour in a regatta today.

title: L.I.U. Nine Turns Back Post, 75, and Rider, 3.1
description: The Long Island University varsity baseball team swept a doubleheader yesterday edg ing C. W. Post College, 75, and downing Rider College, 31, at the winner's field in Brook lyn.

title: GETTYSBURG DOWNS KINGS POINT, 2815
description: KINGS POINT, L.I.. Sept. 26 Gettysburg defeated the Mer chant Marine Academy, 2815, today before 3,000 sweltering fans.

title: Point of View
description: Clarence Osterna, a New York mortgage broker, was a pioneer market maker in the stock of the Federal Na tional Mortgage Association when its shares first began to trade in the overthe counter market in 1956. His views in the following article are in response to a recent Times article on Fanny May, as the association is known. Fanny May is the nation's central mortgage bank; its function is to borrow money in the private market to buy housing loans from mortgage originators.

title: The Necessity for Trust
description: The United States and the Soviet Union narrowly escaped a longdreaded confrontation in the Middle East last week when Syrian tanks withdrew from Jordan; but the peril of a wider war remains acute. It will re quire the utmost in restraint and cooperation on the part of the big powers to contain a conflict fed by ram pant extremism both inside and outside Jordan and to prod the recalcitrant Middle East nations once more toward a settlement of the ArabIsraeli dispute.

title: John Gawsworth. 58, Poet And King of Tiny Island
description: LONDON, Sept. 26 (AP)John Gawsworth, an itinerant poet who assumed the mythical throne of a tiny Caribbean is land but abdicated after living for 20 years as a vagabond here, died Wednesday. He was 58 years old.

title: Randi Sue Wollman Is Married on L.I.
description: CEDARHURST, L. I., Sept. 26  Miss Randi Sue Woll man, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Harold Wollman, was married here today to Sgt. Morton Harold Jacobs, U.S.A.F., son of Mr. and Mrs. Max J. Ja cobs. Both families are of Valley Stream. Rabbis Harold Saperstein and Jerold Bob row performed the ceremony in the Sephardic Temple.

title: Lease Holdings For Oil Increase
description: HOUSTON, Sept. 26 (AP)The domestic petroleum in dustry increased its produc tive and nonproductive lease holdings by more than 11.2 million acres in 1969.

title: Safety Violations Reported In Half of Interstate Buses
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26 (AP) At least half the nation's 25,000 interstate buses appear to violate Federal safety stand ards, Government officials said today.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Thirtytwo hijacked airline passengersall Americanshave been freed and were being protected by the Jordanian Army, the Am man radio announced yesterday. Earlier, an Egyptian Embassy spokesman speaking for the Palestinian guerrilla group that was holding the passengers, had said that all 38 remaining passengers would be freed with out any conditions. [Page 1, Columns 24.]

title: Plutonium BuildUp Blamed For British Nuclear Alarm
description: LONDON, Sept. 26 (AP)A buildup of plutonium residue began an unplanned nuclear re action and rang the safety alarm at Britain's Windscale Nuclear Power Plant, an inquiry has revealed.

title: ART OF THE ACCESSORY
description: Accessories are the darlings of the decorating world. It is hardly enough to own the precious antiques, the rare Aubussons and oriental rugs or art, accessories are essen tial. The handpicked collection of curiosthe more eso teric the better, slavishly attended to, and costing a fortune to acquireis the present favorite of the fash ionables. The rest of us can get by with objets culled from the seashore, field and garden (or sidewalk flower stand) and the myriad of city shops. Crystal in geometric or fanciful forms, like the sculpture on the tea table (above); minerals on or off tiny metal stands; brass and chrome, objects in interesting shapes make striking arrangements. Pillow fashions include needlepoint, stitched grosgrain ribbon or embroidery in joyous pat terns and colors. Despite a precarious status due to swift fashion shifts, accessories and theirarranging can be a satisfying exercise in artistic ingenuityalmost as much fun to do as to view. These vignettes in the home of Priscilla Lawrence use accessories from the Obelisk Shop.

title: James Torrey to Wed Miss Hayes
description: ROCKPORT, Mass., Sept. 26 The engagement of Miss Marcia Audrey Hayes to James Alexander Torrey, a stockbroker with Wood, Walker & Co., in New York, has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Clement Hayes, parents of the future bride. Her fianc is the son of Clare Morse Torrey of New York and the late Mrs. Susan Con roy Torrey.

title: Rochester Beats Hamilton With a Late Pass, 20 to 15
description: ROCHESTER, Sept. 267Bill Standera tossed a 30yard touchdown pass to Rich Parrin ello with 1 minute and 30 sec onds remaining today to give the University of Rochester a 2015 victory over Hamilton College.

title: Jimi Hendrix 19421970
description: I could sit up here all night and say thank you, thank you. thank you, you know... I just waist to grab you, man, and just anon kiss S!ou, but, dig, I just can't do that... so what I want to do. I'm going to sacrifice something right here that I really love... don't think I'm silly doing this. cause I don't think I'm losing my Mindlast night, 000 whew. but, wait, wait, today I think everything is all right, you know, so I'm not losing my mind. This is just. for every body here, this is the only way I can do it, okay?... Don't get mad, don't get mad. no.

title: Replica of Old Plane Crashes
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Sept. 26 (UPI)  A replica of a 1920 Army Curtis Oriole biplane crashed today after climbing only 200 feet on takeoff at In ternational Airport here, cri tically injuring the pilot and navigator. The craft, which took members of the 33d Mili tary Airlift Wing two years to construct, was to retrace a flight from Minneapolis to Washington that was made 50 years ago by Capt. Ray Miller, a Minnesota aviator.

title: New York: a city going to the dogs?
description: NEW YORK is going to the dogs at the expense of its children. The parks are the city child's back yard, where todd lers crawl on the grass, youngsters play ball, fly kites, climb trees or simply sit in the shade and day dream. At least, that's the theory. In fact, the parks have become toilets for the city's dogs, who number more than half a million at this point.

title: BOSTON U. TROUNCES VERMONT SQUAD, 486
description: BUIZLINGTION Vt., Sept. After falling behind, 60, early in the first quarter, Bos ton University posted an im pressive 486 triumph over Ver mont at Centennial Field.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: PORTAUPRINCE, HaitiThe profes sor's wife stopped short, almost spilling her drink. Like many of our other friends, she couldn't believe we were going to Haiti on our honeymoon.

title: MIAMI DEFEATED BY GEORGIA TECH
description: ATLANTA, Sept. 26 (AP)Brent Cunningham, a tailback, scored two touchdowns on pass receptions and ran for a third today as Georgia Tech downed Miami, 3121, in a football bat tle of major Southern inde pendents.

description: TORSHAVN, Faeroe Islands, Sept. 26 (AP)  An Icelandic airliner believed to be carrying 30 passengers and crew mem bers crashed against a moun tainside in the Faeroe Islands today, the police announced.

description: IOWA CITY, Iowa, Sept. 26 (UPI)  Southern California, displaying the offensive strength that has carried the Trojans to their No. 5 national ranking, rolled over Iowa today, 480.

description: DENVER, Sept. 26One of the largest cities outside the Deep South to have had racial balance and forced busing ordered by a Federal Court, Denver is moving cautiously, into its second year of expand ing public school integration.

description: Talk, Sports, Events

description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26In advance of the publication of the report of the Presi dent's Commission on Cam pus Unrest, the Republican National Committee issued its own poll today showing that the American people support ed President Nixon's forth right stand against violence on the campuses.

title: Tufts SubduesBates, 2927, As Watson Gains 205 Yards
description: MEDFORD, Mass., Sept. 26Tufts University opened its football season today by top ping Bates, 2927, as Bates failed twice on 2point conver sions in the last quarter. Pete Watson gained 205 yards in 30 carries for Tufts and Carl Fitz gerald scored 20 points for Bates on three touchdowns and one conversion on a pass.

title: Laurie Hughes Will Be Wed
description: Miss Laurie Jean Hughes and Charles David Leach, Bucknell graduates whose fathers are New York bank ers, have become engaged.

title: ARTHUR L. STEMLER
description: CLEARWATER, Fla., Sept. 26 Arthur L. Stemler, once of Douglaston. Queens, New York, and formerly treasurer of Blair & Co., brokers, and vice presi dent of Empire Electric Brakes Company, both of New York, died yesterday. His age was 81.

title: MINE DEATHS LAID TO FEDERAL LAXITY
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Sept. 26The author of a detailed study of the coal industry in West Virginia asserted today that the Nixon Administration was responsible through lack of safety enforcement for need less accidental death among miners in this largest coal pro ducing state.

title: CAMPUS UNREST LAID TO PERMISSIVENESS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26 (AP) A report on campus unrest issued by a conservative stu dent group attributes student disorders to permissiveness and a revolutionary cadre on col lege campuses.

title: Chess
description: GRANDMASTER Robert Byrne of Indianapolis captured first prize in the recent 1970 Atlantic Open at the McAlpin Hotel in Man hattan. Scoring 71, Byrne topped 394 competitors, the largest turnout ever for an open tourney in the United States.

title: Dragnet Widens for Two ExConvicts and Two Coeds in Robbery of Boston Bank and Slaying of Policeman
description: BOSTON, Sept. 26State, local and Federal officials spread a widening dragnet to day for two exconvicts and two university coeds wanted in connection with a Boston bank robbery and the shooting death of a Boston policeman.

title: ANIMATED BY ART
description: This sophisticated Manhattan apartment reflects its owner's avid interest in art and design. Carl Levine, an executive in home furnishings whose business takes him abroad several times a year, never returns emptyhanded. He planned the apartment's back ground to recall the stuccowalled, white beamed cottages of the south of France. Against the cool assurance of such a background, things rustic and things polisheda sculptural steel chair by French designer Pergay and Louis XV arm chairscoexist without conflict. His serious collection is an impressive group of preColumbian art that enlarges on the room's theme of natural accents, such as fur rugs and pillows and suede on the chairs. The primitive quality of preColumbian art is almost contemporary in feeling, he notes.

title: Apollo 13 Astronauts To Visit 5 Countries
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26 (AP)The White House has announced that the Apollo 13 astronauts will visit Iceland, Switzerland, Greece, Malta and Ireland next month as President Nixon's personal representatives.

title: MEDICAID LEADERS TRYING NEW IDEAS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26The Federal leadership of Medicaid is quietly trying to use some of the multibilliondollar leverage of the medical assistance pro gram to test new ideas for the provision of American health care.

title: Terrific Trees for Small Properties
description: SMALL gardens need small trees. There are many excellent trees under 20 to 30 feet in height which can be selected for their shade or ornament or both. Many have fruits which will bring birds into the garden. Many are oldtime favorites like the dogwoods, crabapples, and hawthorns.

title: MIDDLEBURY ROUTS WESLEYAN BY 4921
description: MIDDLEBURY, Vt., Sept. 261 Barry Metayer, a quarter back, threw four touchdown passes to Lee Cartrnill and ran, for a fifth today as Middlebury, College routed Wesleyan, 4921.

title: Tighter Advertising Bans On Federal Land Proposed
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26 (AP) The Secretary of the Interior, Walter J. Hickel, proposed to day to ban billboards from almost all of the 460million acres of Federal land adMin istered by the Bureau of Land Management.

description: TO THE EDITOR:

description: KEARNY, N. J., Sept. 26 Miss Patricia Anne Thuring and Peter N. Gilbreth plan to be married June 26.

title: Truth and Consequences
description: Diplomacy in the Middle East tends to be governed by three factors: pas sionately held irrational beliefs, the continuing need to pay for past mis takes, and the knowledge that if you don't know where you're going any road will get you there.

title: SENATORS BEATEN NINTH TIME IN ROW
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26 (UPI)Carl Yastrzemski crack ed two hits in his quest for the batting title tonight as the Bos ton Red Sox tagged the Wash ington Senators with their ninth straight defeat, 62.

description: Representative Richard L. Ot tinger, the Democratic candi date for Senator, urged yester day that United States econom ic aid to South Vietnam be con ditioned on Saigon's willingness to institute governmental re forms.

title: A Treatment Center for Drug Addicts Is Facing a Financial Crisis
description: Samaritan Halfway Society, a large private drug rehabilita tion center in Queens, is facing a serious financial crisis.

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: Contracts for future con struction in the New York metropolitan area declined in value by 10 per cent last July from the level of July, 1969. The steepest decline was in nonresidential proj ects.

title: A Tourist's Calendar for October
description: 1 Gulf Coast Deep Sea Fishing Rodeo, Destin, Fla. Until Oct. 31.

title: Slippage Delays Con Ed Plan To Restore Indian Point Plant
description: A hopedfor return of the Indian Point nuclear power plant, which supplies 3 per cent of the Consolidated Edison Company's electric generating capacity, has been delayed from tomorrow until probably midOctober.

title: Home Improvement
description: ACOMPARATIVELY new, still littleknown, kind of ball cock valve that can be installed in al most any existing toilet tank in place of the old unit promises to eliminate most of the headaches that afflict many of the old fashioned mechanisms (whose design has remained largely un changed for generations).

title: Greece to Establish 5 Colleges to Train Needed Technicians
description: ATHENS, Sept. 26Greece's militarybacked regime is tak ing action to fill a major educational gap by setting up five technical and professional colleges to train experts needed for the country's longterm economic and social develop ment.

title: GEORGIA CRUSHES CLEMSON BY 380
description: ATHENS, Ga., Sept. 26 (UPI) James Ray, a sophomore quarterback, passed for one touchdown and engineered three other scoring drives to day to lead Georgia to its first victory in seven games, a 380 rout of Clemson.

title: FROM THE INSIDE OUT
Best Seller List
The Vivid Maples
description: As the color begins to appear in the woodlands it becomes obvious how much October's brilliance owes to the maples. Especially, here in the Northeast, to the red or swamp maples and to the sugar maples. Without them, the autumn color spectacle would lack an essential dimension.

title: Denver's Historic Mint: No Place for Souvenirs
description: DENVER, Colo.Line Up Here for the Mint, instructs the sign on the iron fence outside the blockbig, fivestory granite fortress at Cherokee and West Colfax Streets in midtown Denver. They've been turning out 1970dated coins for more than eight months, and I figure that by now they might have enough on hand so that I can pick up a few samples as souvenirs of visit.

title: Texts of a Call to the People and Recommendations of the Campus Unrest Panel
description: The crisis on American campuses has no parallel in the history of the nation. This crisis has roots in divi sions of American society as deep as any since the Civil War. The divisions are re flected in violent acts and harsh rhetoric, and in the en mity of those Americans who see themselves as occupying opposing camps. Campus un rest reflects and increases a more profound crisis in the nation as a whole.

title: Lomas &
description: DALLAS, Sept. 19  The Lomas and Nettleton Finan cial Corporation is well on its way toward becoming the biggest real estate fi nancing company of its kind in the nation.

title: Jacklin 7Shot Victor, Shooting a 69 for 267
description: DALMAHOY, Scotland, Sept. 26 (AP)Tony Jacklin, United States Open golf champion, finishing with two birdies, won first prize of $4,800 by seven strokes to day in the Wills Open golf tournament.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: MANISTEE, MichLower ing a 10pound lead ball 70 feet into the windchurned waters of Lake Michigan, Capt. Bob Hecht, who keeps his 35foot ChrisCraft, Misty II, at Manistee, promised us a Coho salmon.

title: Quarterback Sneak of 76 Yards Makes Landry a Top Rusher
description: As the pro football season swings into its second Sun day of games today, the two leading ground gainers in the American Conference are Jess Phillips of Cincinnati and Matt Snell of the Jets while in the National it is Calvin Hill of Dallas and Greg Landry of Detroit. Landry? Isn't he a quarter back? Yes, he is. While Hill carried the ball 25 times to gain 117 yards last Sunday, Lan dry carried once and gained 76. In the final minutes of De troit's rout of Green Bay Landry, the second quarter back had replaced Bill Mun son. It was third and two at the Lions 13. Landry called a sneak to gain the first down. He wound up on the Packer 11 yard line and it was the fifth longest run from scrim mage in Lion history, the longest since 1951.

title: ISRAELIS CAUTION ON BORDER RAIDS
description: JERUSALEM, Sept. 26Is raeli leaders have begun campaign to prepare public opinion for increased severity of military responses if the Arab guerrillas, as expected, resume activity along Israel's hordprs.

title: City Weighing Overhaul in Rules On Evictions
description: The city administration is moving toward a revision of rules governing eviction for rehabilitation or demoli tion in an effort to restrain what officials regard as abuses by owners.

title: Kathy Kusner Captures 2 South African Races
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Sept. 26 (AP)Kathy Kusner of Arlington, Va., rode to victory twice in five races today as the first woman jockey in South Af rican turf history.

title: BOSTON COLLEGE TOPS NAVY, 2814
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., Sept. 26Making thi ngs easy for the statisticians and tough on the opponents, Fred Willis, Boston College's senior running back, duplicated his rushing statistics of a week ago while leading the Eagles to their second vic tory in as many outings, 2814, over Navy.

title: Bluebird, Official State Bird, Is Added to List of '20 Most Rare
description: The state's list of 20 most rare and endangered species of birds, mammals, fish and rep tiles has been expanded to include New York's new offi cial bird, the bluebird.

title: Soviet Sets Firms U.S. Style
description: A Soviet managerial revo lution is gaining momentum and promises to change radi cally the administrative struc ture and operations of So viet industry.

title: Ky Not to Attend Washington Rally
description: PARIS, Sept. 26  Vice President Nguyen Cao Ky of South Vietnam has decided not to attend a rightist win thewar rally in Washington next Saturday.

title: 3 TEENAGERS DEAD IN SPEEDBOAT CRASH
description: FAIR HARBOR, L. I., Sept. 26 The bodies of three teenage boys, missing after a collision between two speedboats last night in Great South Bay north of this Fire Island community, were recovered this morning by Suffolk County police marine units.

title: Criminals At Large
description: In his two excellent proce dural series John Creasey de liberately paints Superintendent West and Commander Gideon larger than life, deeply con cerned with the welfare of their men. In All Leads Negative (1967), written under the pseu donym of Peter Aiding, he took if anything a more persuasive tack with the constabulary of the British town of Fortrow, showing the men, though con scientious officers in the main, beset by the demons of ambi tion, fear and inexperience. The appearance now of MURDER AMONG THIEVES (McCall, $4.50) brings with it a strong regret that Mr. Aiding waited so long between books. This time round, on the solid basis of Fortrow police characteriza tion, he builds a plot sizably more intriguing than in his for mer effort.

title: POLLUTION CURBS PLANNED BY BONN
description: BONN, Sept. 26The Gov ernment has announced an emergency program for com bating pollution in West Ger many, with stress on water purification and reduction of air impurities from automobile exhaust.

title: So. Carolina Ties No. Carolina State In Last Period, 77
description: RALEIGH, N. C., Sept. 26 (UPI)  North Carolina State held heavily favored South Carolina to a 77 football tie Pat Kenney found a big hole in the South Carolina line with 4:25 left in the first period anc ran untouched 29 yards foi North Carolina State's score.

title: Dilemma For Arabs: How to Damp Down Conflict
description: CAIROThe dilemma con fronting the leaders of the Arab world in the wake of the bloody strife in Jordan is how to work out a solution without under mining either King Hussein or the Palestinian guerrilla move ment. Harsh accusations raised against the King at an emer gency Arab summit meeting here last week made achievement of this objective uncertain.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: TRIAL OF MANSON ENTERS 16TH WEEK
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 26The Tate murder trial will go into its 16th week on Monday and prospects are that it will not be completed before Thanksgiving. Some estimates are that the trial will last past New Year's.

title: Theresa Farese to Wed
description: UNION, N. J., Sept. 26Mr. and Mrs. Louis R. Farese have made known the en gagement of their daughter, Miss Theresa Farese, to Lieut. Steven R. Kramer, U.S.A.F.

title: Dr. Spock, Denying Permissiveness, Says Agnew's Gibes Are a Compliment
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26Dr. Benjamin Spock, the pedi atrician, said today that he was taking as a compliment the new term Spockmanship, that has been coined and used by Vice President Agnew.

title: War Delays Cremation of King of Monks for Year
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Sept. 26A year ago, the king of the monks, His Holiness Chuon Nath, died of a heart attack in his 87th year.

title: BLOCKER POSTS 69, LEADS BY 2 SHOTS
description: COLUMBUS, Ga., Sept. 26 (UPI)Chris Blocker shot bird ies on the 16th and 17th holes today to post his third straight belowpar round and gain a twostroke lead at the 54hole mark of the Green Island open.

title: Mrs. Belmont Timmerman Of Prominent Family Dies
description: Mrs. Bessie Belmont Timmer man, a member of a prominent New York family, died Friday in her home at 116 East 63d Street. Her age was 63.

title: Personality:
description: He is the heir to Japan's oldest brewery, but he doesn't drink. He is the land lord of the Tokyo Maxim's de Paris, but the Western food he really savors is rare roast beef. He learned his English from a Japanese teacher who didn't speak English  and his conversa tion betrays it.

title: Back to Cuba and the Cold War
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26Some thing very serious and dangerous is now happening between the leaders of the United States and the Soviet Union. They are clearly misjudging one another in Southeast Asia, the Middle East and Cuba, and this could be tragic for them and for the peace of the world.

title: Social Democratic Party in Bonn Is Accused on Women's Rights
description: KIEL, West Germany  A mother of four with the decep tive appearance of a beauty contest winner is the first wo man to undertake a thorough going and cogent challenge to male supremacy in the political institutions of West German society. So far she has had little support in the Social Democratic party, of which she has been a member but with which she is at odds.

title: PIRATES BEAT METS, 43, AND CLINCH TIE FOR TITLE; COLORADO WHIPS PENN STATE, 4113
description: BOULDER, Colo., Sept. 26Penn State, riding the heights of a 23game winning streak and a 31game unbeaten string, went a mile high to Folsom Field today where the power ful Colorado football team brought them down with a sound, 4113 triumph.

title: Calendar of Dog Show Events
description: TodayWestbury K.A. all breed and Nassau Dog Training Club trial, C.W. Post College, Northern Boulevard, Brookville, L. I.; 1,707 entries; 9 A.M.

title: Television
description: THE Columbia Broadcasting System and the National Broadcasting Company, normally the two power houses of commercial television, have led off the new season with a re sounding and tiresome ho hum. In the first week of premieres, running Sept. 13 through 19, there were but two bright spots: Flip Wilson, with the for midable assistance of David Frost, in an entertaining hour of variety on NBC, and Storefront Lawyers, a pro fessionally rendered CBS series that might go somewhere. Otherwise, the two networks essentially played pat hands with carryovers from the past.

title: Freshened Breeze Brightens Race for Mayor's Cup

title: STARSTRUCK ENVIRONMENTS
description: A growing number of architects and designers are approaching the design of their living spaces with an impetuosity that verges on virtu osity. Charles Moore, dean of the School of Architecture at Yale, (seated crosslegged on his terrace, left, with its Vasarelystyle fence and trompe l'oeil intruder peeking in) was living in a startling environ ment of his own design. But one day he decided to refurbish. Beneath his paint brush the bed (opposite) traded in stripes for bright stars and out of the top popped a Renaissance dome (a photostat of an archi tectural drawing). An enormous fluorescent 42 soon appeared amid the cutaway walls of his kitchen (top, left) to commemorate his 42d birthday and 42d Street. Architect Hugh Hardy's environment (above) grew in the same way. In the altogether respectable living room, Alice Lyndon,, wife of the dean of architecture at MIT, and Hugh improvised a sculpture of stove pipes (designed by Alice with Hugh adding the lights). A billboard promoting VISTA was cut up to become a ceiling of onlooking graduates; the billboard's lettering (hung upside down) marches around the room. Frivolous as it may appear, such spontaneous design stems from a serious premise: There are new ways of approach ing, exposing and solving any problem., It is an exercise that we give to students, says Charles Moore. Take a set thing; by the applica tion of paint and graphics, make something different out of it. The result is an entirely new idea. Design is never static; it thrives on change.

title: A scientist's casual reminiscence that packs a surprising wallop

And every now and then as they say in baseball, a game he likes, he comes through with his high hard one, a very simple trust in very plain English thrown right at the selfserving argument and right through the conventional wisdom.

title: Vehicle Group Names Tofany

title: EastWest trade: a hopeful crack in the cold war monolith
description: The political leadership of the world's major powers is today in capable of seizing the vast, com pletely new opportunities that exist to make peace. Chained by the memory of stale antagonisms, wedded to the rituals of oldfashioned diplo macy, obsessed by the idea that arms can offer security, they will stop production of no weapons they do not already have in abundance. They will sign no treaties that involve any risks. They will make no concessions without asking greater ones from their adversaries. How to take peace making out of the hands of govern ments and put it into the hands of the people thus becomes the great issue of our time.

title: The Play's The Thing Of Give And Take
description: EVERY once in a while in Enid Bag nold's enchanting Autobiogra phy there is a cry from the heart against the theater's mas sive and unending demand for collabo ration. The theater, is a gross art, wails the author of those far from gross plays The Chalk Garden and The Chinese Prime Minister. The theater built in sweeps and overemphasis, and compromise is its second name. A writer writes; what the writer has written is then handed over to pro ducers, directors, designers, actors, each of whom inevitably, helplessly, humanly alters the stir of the words on the page. What I do, Miss Bagnold says in her straightforward way, cannot easily be remade in the bodies, move ments, voices of human beings. Ah, if I had known the delicate and bitter labor far far ahead....

description: Exchange Rates

title: Can Hair Be Taught To Hate?
description: MY visit the other night to Flair, which recently attained its 1,000th performance in New York, was my first, I being one of those New Yorkers who are crazy about the arts in general but for some reason  too expensive, too much both er, too bourgeois (or something)  al most never go to the theater. I did not feel, however, exactly a stranger to the play, which for three years has been filling the common cultural atmosphere with its vapors; I knew about the extent of its international success and about the ubiquitousness of its influence on theatrical manners and mores; I was aware of all the controversy it has kicked up, and I was familiar with the terrific hit songs that have been lifted from its score.

title: News of the Camera World
description: DESIGNED for use with all Super 8 movie cam eras, a compact Sun Gun movie light re cently introduced by Sylva nia Electric Products comes with a 5year guarantee against defects in material and workmanship. Called the Model SG9, it draws only 350 watts but with its 2inch deep reflector provides ex posure values that are equi valent to that of a 650watt movie light. The new unit weighs only Ill ounces ana comes with three adaptor brackets to fit it to most Su per 8 cameras. It is designed so that the reflector and tung stenbalogen lamp are perma nently assembled as one unit; when the lamp, which has an average life of 25 hours, burns out, the entire unit is dis carded. If the lamp burns out prematurely during the 5year period, the consumer returns it, with $2 for handling, and gets a new lamp.

title: American Notebook
description: At a time when the frustra tion of antiwar elements either erupts in bombed math build ings or sinks into ritualized protest, it is pleasant to report that some people are still using their heads. Such a group is the Council on Economic Priorities, a nonprofit research outfit formed last year in Washington. The Council's first book; Ef ficiency In Death: The Manu facturers of AntiPersonnel Weapons, has been published by Harper & Row in paperback.

title: 2 Escaped Lions Shot
description: WETUMPKA, Ala., Sept. 26 (AP)Two circus lions were shot and killed near here today, after they escaped from their trailer when it crashed into a utility pole. They had been loose about an hour when they were killed after attacking a dog.

title: DOCTORS WARNED ON VEIN INFUSIONS
description: A medical journahas called attention to potential dangers that can result from mixtures of drugs added by physicians to fluids that are pumped into patients  veins.

title: New and Recommended
description: FICTION

title: HOFSTRA ENDS SLIDE, BEATING MAINE, 4820
description: ORONO. Me., Sept. 26Hofstra University broke an 11game losing streak today by downing the University of Maine, 4820 at Alumni Field.

title: Nixon Renominates Two On Subversive Control Unit
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26 (AP) President Nixon said today he was renominating John William Mahan, the chairman, and Otto F. Otepka for new terms on the Subversive Activities Control Board.

title: SEARCH ABANDONED FOR 3 BALLOONISTS
description: The Coast Guard discontin ued late yesterday an air and sea search for the missing bal loon The Free Life and its three occupants. The balloon ists took off from Long Island Sunday in an attempt to make the first transAtlantic balloon voyage.

title: Miss Helene Singleton Mueller Wed to Dr. Francis Minot Weld
description: Miss Helene Singleton Mueller, nurse consultant in the department of human ecology at Cornell Medical College, was married yes terday afternoon to Dr. Fran cis Minot Weld, chief resi dent., in internal medicine at the New York Hospital.

title: Miss Elizabeth A. Cotter Betrothed
description: CHATTANOOGA, Sept. 26 Announcement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. Ernest Robert Cotter of the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Elizabeth Alverson Cotter, to Robert Gerard McGroarty. He is a son of Justice John Courtney McGroarty of the New York Supreme Court and Mrs. McGroarty of Brooklyn. New York.

title: CITY SEEKS GRANT FOR SEWAGE TEST
description: The city has applied for a 51.5million Federal grant to build an experimental addition to the Owl's Head waste treat ment plant on Wakeman Place and Shore Parkway in Brook lyn, according to Maurice M. Feldman, the city's Commis sioner of Water Resources.

title: INDONESIAN REBELS STORM HAGUE PRISON
description: SCHEVENINGEN, the Neth erlands, Sept. 26 (AP)About 200 Indonesian rebels today stormed The Hague Prison, where 33 of their colleagues are being held in connection with the occupation of the In donesian Embassy last month.

title: Miss Howland, Airline Hostess, Married to Peter Norris Pund
description: DARIEN, Conn., Sept. 26The Noroton Presbyterian Church was the setting here today for the marriage of Miss Judith Briggs Howland, a hostess with Trans World Airlines, to Peter Norris Pund, who is a technical rep resentative with the Union Carbide Corporation in Chicago. The Rev. Dr. Law rence MacColl Horton per formed the ceremony.

title: Guion Fountain, 81, Official Of Doctors Hospital, Is Dead
description: Guion H. Fountain, vice pres ident in charge of operations of Doctors Hospital, 170 East End Avenue, died yesterday. He was 81 years old and lived at the hospital and at Long Hill, Chat ham Township, N. J.

title: For Young Readers
description: How did that song golight up the sky with love? Bernard Waber lights up the nightsky pages of his newest picture book with some pretty spec tacular displays. There are bursts and curls and Pollacklike swirls, clusters of color that you might see in a 4th of July night sky. And the source of all thisother than Mr. Waber? Torchy, a firefly, starts out as a little flicker but when he grows and glows his brightness has all the nocturnal woodland animals thinking they're on the dayshift. Even night crawlers scramble for cover when Torchy turns on. Happiness is twink ling, but Torchy's output is just too much. Against a background of city lightsand here is Mr. Waber's peak performanceTorchy has a fling at not hiding his light under a bushel and gets it all out of his system.

title: Keep the Future Green
description: In an age that lives fiercely for the day, it is vital to have somebody thinking a generation ahead. While most of the world is preoccupied with the awesome problems of the moment, the Regional Plan Association and its president, Dr. John P. Keith, are trying to assure East Coast Americans of the open space they will need thirty years from now if they are to survive with any humanity in the megalopolis.

title: CITY PLANS COURSE FOR HOUSEKEEPERS
description: The city will help to train and provide housekeepers for sick and elderly relief recipients under a program announced yesterday by the Community Development Agency.

title: CONFUSION CLOUDS UNION CONVENTION
description: The controversy over the New York State A.F.LC.I.O.'s endorsement of Governor Rockefeller is heating up as union supporters of the Gover nor and of Arthur J. Goldberg prepare for a new confronta tion when their convention is reconvened Oct. 14.

title: Disclosure Is Made by Amman Radio
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Sept. 26The Amman radio announced tonight that 32 more airline hostages had been freed and lwere under the protection of the Jordanian Army. All were Americans.

title: Lawrenceville Triumphs, 60; The Hill Downs Germantown
description: LAWRENCEVILLE, N. J., Sept. 26  Two brilliant goalline stands by Lawrenceville in the fourth quarter enabled the home team to take a 60 foot ball decision today from Penn Charter. It was the frist game for both schools.

title: Gale Warnings Are Hoisted Along South Florida Coast
description: MIAMI, Sept. 26 (AP)Gale warnings were hoisted along 200 miles of the south Florida coast tonight as a tropical storm, Greta, developed quickly over the Bahamas and moved on a course that would bring it inland south of Miami.

title: UPSET IS SCORED BY PORT CHESTER
description: Alert defensive play was the key as Port Chester rallied from a 120 deficit to upset White Plains, 1312, in a scho lastic televised game at Parker Stadium in White Plains.

title: Utah State Gets 5 Scores In 4th Period to Win, 4229
description: LARAMIE, Wyo., Sept. 26 (UPI)Utah State, trailing by 15 points going into the fourth quarter, got five lastperiod touchdowns from Paul Reuter and John Strycula to rout Wyoming, 4229.

title: Urban problemsonce over lightly
description: Edward Banfield has written a book that totally absolves institutions now in power. His largely theoretical tract treats the city and its people as though they existed in a vac uumas though the increasing conflicts between people and power are irrelevant to an understanding of the city. This blindness is significant because Mr. Banfield has an important voice these days in the Nixon Administration's planning of its urban policies, as a colleague of Daniel Patrick Moynihan and as chairman of the Presi dent's task force on the Model Cities Program. He is Henry Lee Shattuck Professor of Ur ban Government at Harvard and author of a number of books on city politics and gov ernment. We may assume that this book is a part of the think ing now going on within the Nixon Administration.

title: OKLAHOMA STATE UPSETS HOUSTON
description: STILLWATER, Okla. Sept. 26 (AP)Dick Graham ran a kick off back 85 yards for one touch down and set up the clinching score with a 35yard punt re turn today to spark Oklahoma State to a 2617 upset over 11thranked Houston.

title: ERIC BURDON BOWS WITH NEW GROUP
description: The British bluesrock singer Eric Burdon tried out his new Dand, War, at Felt Forum of Madison Square Garden Friday, and they're magnificent.

title: The Metropolitan Museum of Art/ Lectures /Fall 1970
description: Great Museums

title: GREENPORT OPENS WITH 300 VICTORY
description: Greenport and Southampton, Eastern Suffolk County's two grid powers, opened their cam paigns yesterday with impres sive triumphs. Greenport handily defeated William Floyd, 300, and Southampton brushed by Comsewogue, 370.

title: Barbara J. Schulz Engaged to Cleric
description: Miss Barbara Jane Schulz, a columnist for The Rock ford (Ill.) Morning Star, and the Rev. John Milton Larson, rector of St. Patrick's Epis copal Church in Eleu thera, the Bahamas, plan to be married in November.

title: S. W. Simon Fiance Of Ellen Berkowitz
description: UTICA, N. Y., Sept. 26Dr. and Mrs. Gerald Berko witz have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Ellen Berkowitz, to Steven Wolfe Simon, son of Mr. and Mrs. Sol Simon. Both families are from Utica, where Miss Berkowitz's fath er is a dentist.

title: Plunkett Sets Mark As Stanford Beats Oregon, 33 to 10
description: EUGENE, Ore., Sept. 26 (UPI)Jim Plunkett, overcom ing a shaky first half, threw three touchdown passes and scored once on a run today in a recordbreaking performance to lead Stanford to a 3310 victory over Oregon in a Pacific Eight football game.

title: A Montefiore to Be Consecrated As Anglican Bishop on Tuesday
description: CAMBRIDGE, EnglandHugh Montefiore, who comes from a prominent AngloJewish family, becomes an Anglican bishop on ??

title: New FireFighting Group
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26 (AP) A Joint Council of National Fire Service Organizations de signed to improve the na tions fire services was formed Thursday.

title: Met Games This Week
description: TodayAt Pittsburgh.

title: NATIONS IN PACIFIC CRITICIZE U.S. RULE
description: SUVA, Fiji, Sept. 22American colonialism seems to me to be more the French than the British type, Sir Kamisese Mara, the Chief Minister of this British colony, soon to be inde pendent, told a visitor from the United States recently.

title: Buchanan Rallies to Outpoint Laguna for Lightweight Title in Puerto Rico
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., Sept. 26(AP)Ken Buchanan of Scot land rallied in the final rounds today and wrested the world lightweight boxing title from Ismael Laguna of Panama on a split decision in a 15round bout.

title: Amman's List of Hostages
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Sept. 26 (AP)The Amman radio broad cast a list of 32 names of hi jacked airline hostages today who it said had been released by Palestinian guerrillas in Amman. All were believed to be Americans.

title: HARVARD VICTORY 72D FOR YOVICSIN
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Sept. 26 Rod Foster, a sophomore quarterback, moved Harvard to two thirdperiod touchdowns and one in the fourth period to lead the Crimson to a 287 vic tory over Northeastern in the first football meeting between the two institutions at Harvard Stadium today.

title: HUSSEIN APPOINTS NEW GOVERNMENT LED BY A CIVILIAN
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Sept 26King Hussein formed a new militarycivilian Government today, but a Palestinian com mando spokesman in Damascus said the commandos would ac cept nothing less than the King's downfall.

title: Clay Shaw Is Touring Colleges Lecturing on Erosion of Rights
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26Clay L. Shaw, the man once accused by New Orleans Dis trict Attorney Jim Garrison of conspiring to murder former President John F. Kennedy, is touring college campuses to warn students of what he calls a creeping erosion of individ ual rights in this country.

title: Tigers Trounce Rutgers As Plummer Stars, 4114
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Sept. 26Princeton, seeking revenge over Rutgers after last season's shutout defeat in the Cen tennial Game of college football, smashed the Scarlet to a 4114 defeat today in swelter ing Palmer Stadium before 32,000 summerclad fans.

title: A FISHING DISPUTE EXPANDS ON COAST
description: TACOMA, Wash., Sept. 26A continuing dispute between the Puyallup Indians and the state conservation authorities over fishing rights expanded this week at a court hearing.

title: L.I. Seeks PoliceCommunity Rapport
description: ROOSEVELT, L.I., Sept. 26A federally financed pilot proj ect has been started here to foster a better understanding between the residents of this predominantly black community and the Police.

title: Miss Colette Gratz to Marry Nov. 7
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26 Mrs M. Alford Gratz has announced the engagement of her daughter, Miss Colette Audrey Gratz, to Benjamin Baker Wellington, son of Mrs. John Wallace Goodrich of Chestnut Hill, Mass., and William Stanwood Welling ton of Greenwich, Conn., and New York.

title: HOUSES
description: Neo Federal house, sandwiched between modern highrise apart ments and a seedy section of Washing ton, was renovated by the architect owner, Fred Klein, into an in comeproducing prop erty. Leaving the fa cade unchanged, he remodeled the interior to gain houses within a house for himself and two tenants (his own is a triplex).

title: It's hunger that makes men damned
description: I have always been decently skeptical of a novel whose parts are introduced by Impor tant Quotations; it is as though the story cannot carry its own burden of meaning. (A thought: lesser writers quote great writ ers, while the great simply quote themselves.) As though, too, we are being given keys to rooms that could not otherwise be enteredafter all, an open door is not as inviting as a locked one. In Pierre Schoen doerffer's case, I find the skep ticism well placed. Malraux. SaintJust. Kipling. The Apoca lypse. You know you are going to be confronted with Great Happenings, really fundamental questions of Life and Death. What a pity to discover the rooms merely ringing with echoesof Kipling, of Conrad, of Robert Louis Stevenson.

title: Coins
description: THE Hammond Museum in North Salem, N. Y., has been named dis tributor in the United States for an English medal struck to commemorate the martyrdom of Thomas (known as Becket), Archbishop or Canterbury.

title: Advertising:
description: A group of student radicals not too long ago invaded a meeting of the Rutgers Uni versity board of governors, so the story goes. They were denouncing the university's president with a chant that went Mason Gross is a pig.

title: Tartan Filly Has Victory in Her Blood
description: PARIS, Sept. 26Europe is a buyer's market for race horses, Johnny Nerud has discovered.

title: Miss Rose Is Engaged To a Student at Pace
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., Sept. 26Mr. and Mrs. Stanley H. Rose of Larchmont have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Eliza beth Ann Rose, to William Frederick Carey 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. William Carey, also of Larchmont. The wedding is planned for January.

title: BUCKLEY CHEERED ON STATEN ISLAND
description: James L. Buckley, the Con servative party candidate for United States Senator, was en thusiastically applauded today by 300 Staten Islanders, among them Republicans and Demo crats as well as Conservatives.

title: Bar Chief Says the Public Holds Key to Court Reform
description: DETROIT, Sept. 26 (AP)The public must be aroused to the problems facing the Ameri can court system if solutions are to be found, the president of the American Bar Associa tion says.

title: World Trade Held Threatened
description: LONDON, Sept. 26 (AP)Abnormally rapid price in creases in Western industrial nations, mainly a result of big wage rises, is threaten ing world trade, an authori tative British research insti tute reports.

title: CORNELL DOWNS COLGATE, 17 TO 7
description: HAMILTON, N. Y., Sept. 26 Ed Marinaro, Cornell's soph omore of the year in 1969, picked up where he left off to day as the Big Red downed Colgate, 177, in their opener. Marinaro scored both Cornell touchdowns while gaining 151 yards on 30 carries.

title: Members of Campus Unrest Panel
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26Following is a list of the members of the President's Commission on Campus Un rest:

title: REICHHELM LEADER IN ATLANTIC CLASS
description: SOUTHPORT, Conn., Sept. 26George Reichhhelm of Ce dar Point Yacht Club, West port, a former North American junior sailing champion, held the lead today in the Atlantic Class invitation regatta at Pequot Y. C.

title: NOTRE DAME PUTS PURDUE TO ROUT
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind., Sept. 26 It's going to take a while be fore Purdue fans talk about their domination of Notre Dame, after the way the Irish trounced Purdue today, 480.

title: Miss Griffis Is Fiancee Of Jeremiah Milbank 3d
description: Miss Elizabeth Hethea Grif fis, a senior at Vassar Col lege, and Jeremiah Milbank 3d, who was graduated this year from Trinity College and is a staff assistant at the White House, plan to be mar ried late next spring.

title: Reviving the Paris Talks
description: The Vietnam peace negotiations in Paris again show welcome signs of life. For almost a year, there has been nothing to talk about and, for most of that time, no one to talk to. Now, with all four participants again repre sented by highlevel delegates, new proposals have been made formally by the Communists and informally by Saigon and there are indications that private talks are getting under way again.

title: THIRTIES REBORN
description: Oriental exotica, mirrors, fur and the dusky colors of the 30's are re appearing along with fat, over stuffed upholstery that pronounces slim Scandinavian lines dead as a dodoin some decorating cirdes. These trends emerge in a pied a terre designed by Californian Jay Steffy for a client in Madrid. The small viewless room looks inward for interest; windows are hung with shirred curtains left open at the top for light. Mirrors are handled with dexterity, positioned either to reflect other mirrors or to heighten dramalike the bear rug reflected in the mirrored table (far right). Walls are lacquered the color of wine; the pattern of the rose vel vet upholstery is repeated in the stylized design of the carpet.

title: Morris Hills Defeats Montclair, 170, on Running of Sheehan and Lusardi
description: Jay Sheehan, a quarterback whose forte is supposed to be passing, turned into a runner yesterday as Morris Hills high defeated Montclair, 170, at Woodman Field, Montclair, in a major upset.

title: MISSISSIPPI TOPS KENTUCKY, 2017
description: JACKSON, Miss., Sept. 26 (AP)  Archie Manning threw two touchdown passes to Floyd Franks today as Mississippi scored a 2017 football victory over stubborn Kentucky.

title: Susan Mikkelsen Becomes a Bride
description: MANHASSET, L. I., Sept. 26Miss Susan Anne Mik kelsen, daughter of Mrs. Charles Clifford Duncan and the late George Mikkelsen, was married here this after noon in St. Mary's Roman Catholic Church to John Penny Curtis. He is a son of Mr. and Mrs. A. Dudley Curtis of Roslyn Heights. His father is president of Curtis Associates, Inc., com mercial art designers and packagers in New York.

title: A:
description: A:

title: Miss Wright Wed to Jeffrey Smith
description: Miss Heather Douglas Wright, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Winslow Woodbury Wright of Seattle, was mar ried in the chapel of the Fifth Avenue Presbyterian Church yesterday to Jeffrey Jay Smith, son of Mr. and Mrs. Herman Jay Smith of Massapequa, L. I. the cere mony was performed by the Rev. Kenneth O. Jones.

title: PESCE TRIUMPHS IN P.S.A.L. RUN
description: Joe Pesce of Port Richmond High, who weighs 118 pounds, survived the heat at Van Cort landt Park yesterday to post the fastest clocking in the Pub lic Schools Athletic League group run, which opened the local crosscountry season.

title: Texas Tech Is Victim
description: LUBBOCK, Tex., Sept. 26No. 1 ranked Texas, its offense performing sluggishly for two quarters, got a spark from Billy Dale and Jim Bertelsen, half backs, tonight and beat Texas Tech, 3513, extending the na tion's longest winning streak to 22 games.

title: PinkShoed Quarterback Helps E. Paterson Rout Passaic, 410
description: Chris Kriselwicz of East Pat erson wears pink shoes and shaves his head bald as a way of inciting his football team to greater efforts.

title: Jockeys Win Increase In Finger Lakes Pact
description: CANANDAIGUA. N. Y. Sept. 26 (AP)Jockeys and horse owners at Finger Lakes Race Track reached agree ment today in their pay dis pute.

title: N.Y.U. SHOWS WAY IN CROSSCOUNTRY
description: Joe Barbary and Jim Schin dler moved across the finish (line together to lead New York University to crosscountry vic tories over City College and the United States Merchant Marine Academy yesterday at Van Cortlandt Park in the Bronx.

title: SCHOOLS SEEKING 300 MORE GUARDS TO CURB DISORDER
description: The Board of Education will ask the city's Criminal Jus tice Coordinating Council for $1,541,593 to hire 300 addi tional guards to deal with stu dent disorders and other dif ficult situations.

title: LURES OF RESORTS SCORED BY RABBIS
description: Orthodox Jews have been urged by their two topranking leaders to worship in their home synagogues during the coming High Holy Days and to shun the flimsy attractive ness of holiday resorts and their substitute services.

title: Milija Rubezanin Is Dead at 69; Retired Merrill Lynch Executive
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Sept. 26Milija Rubezanin, a retired ex ecutive of Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, collapsed and died at the RutgersPrinceton football game here today. He was 69 years old and lived at 62 Brookside Drive. Plandome. L. I.

title: Happy Intellectual Wins Atlantic City Handicap for Third Victory in Row
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Sept. 26 (AP)  Cleverly handled by Carlos Astorga, the Happy Val ley Farm's Happy Intellectual scored a mild upset in the $29 375 Atlantic City Handicap at Atlantic City today.

title: 1,707 to Compete for Best in Show at Westbury Today
description: The Show of Distinction, as the Westbury Kennel As sociation calls its annual event, takes place today at C. W. Post College, Northern Boulevard, Brookville, L. I. Because of space limitations the club, headed by Mrs. Ramona Van Court, planned an entry list of 1,650. Actu ally there will be 1,707 dogs, since all entries re ceived by noon, Sept. 9, were ac cepted. Westbury, holding its 48th annual show, always has been known for its lavish awards. This year is no exception. Mrs. Edwin A. Holbrook's trophy com mittee has planned hand somely.

title: Headliners
description: It wasn't too many months ago that Mrs. Edward M. Kennedy, the attractive blonde wife of the Senator, caused some raised eyebrows at the White House when she wore a striking minidress while pass ing down a Presidential receiving line. Last week Joan did it again at a reception for the wife of Philippines President Ferdinand Marcos. Only this time she wore a seethrough blouse with blue brassiere, a wetlook midiskirt and black boots. The outfit created quite a stir among the 117 guests, but Mrs. Richard M. Nixon insisted she had not noticed.

title: Education
description: President Nixon appears to have decided that benign neg lect is not what the American campus rebellion needs.

title: Q:
description: Q

title: For Some Americans, Blowing Things Up Isn't Revolutionary It's Just a Job
description: GEORGETOWN, Colo.Dynamite is a workaday thing for Robert (Shorty) Gallegos. The roar of explo sions, the daily headaches that reach up from his shoul ders and pound at his tem ples, are as familiar to him now as the noise and discom fort of a subway to an urban commuter.

title: PULLOUT FAVORED BY MOST IN POLL
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Sept. 26 A majority of the United States public favors the Hat fieldMcGovern plan, which would end troop involvement in Vietnam by the end of 1971, according to the findings in the most recent Gallup Poll.

title: Rally by Rome Reds Protests President's Visit Today
description: ROME, Sept. 26Some 10, 000 persons attended a Com munist party rally today to protest President Nixon's sched uled visit here tomorrow.

title: NEW TERRORISM SEEN IN URUGUAY
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 25The Latin American spring has begun to warm the air over the beautiful beaches, and the Tupamaro guerrillas, in common with everyone else in Uruguay, apparently want to take a few months off.

title: Lersch of Phils Subdues Cubs With SixHitter, 71
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 26Frank Lucchesi, the Phila delphia manager, was too ill to come out of the clubhouse today, but it was the Chicago Cubs who looked sick as they submitted meekly to the Phil lies, 71. Coupled with Pitts burgh's triumph over the Mets, the Cubs losstheir fifth in the last six games meant they can do no better than tie for first in the East ern Division. That, however, was a remote possibility since they must play the Mets four times after tomorrow's game with Philadelphia.

title: The New Movies
description: TRISTANA Is discussed by, Vincent Canby on Page 1.

title: GOOD NEWS FOR GOURMET COOKS
description: The trend to gourmet cooking that began almost a decade ago is ob viously no passing fad. Each visit to cookware shops finds a tantaliz ing array of new warescarts, trays and wall units to help the cook in dozens of ways; familiar items up dated in new materials; oddities from grandmother's day that are staging a comeback. Mixed in with this exciting assortment are hand crafted pots and bowls that charm by their unpredictable colors and shapes. Here's a short sampling: 1. Yesteryear's canning jars have rub ber gaskets, wire clamps, to pre serve homemade delights. Bonniers, $2 and $1.50. 2. Antique chocola tera from South America once made hot chocolate over open flames; now it's a pretty accessory. La Tienda, $25. 3. Copper fry pans assist in making omelets and crepes by giving even heat distribution. Gimbels, $19, set of three. 4. Juicer eliminates twisting the orange; crank rotates the squeezer. Altman's, $7. 5. Porcelainized iron pot with removable handle specializes in slow, even simmering. Blooming dale's, $23.50. 6. Salad bowls are made of zingy neon Plexiglas. Alt man's, $50, set offive. 7. Wire stand holds eggs, lemons or squat candles. Altman's, $17.50. 8. Mobile work center has Formica shelves, overhead rack, for cramped city kitchens, or, in the country, for terrace cookouts. Bloomingdale's, $600. 9. Galvanized tin canisters store staples; seal out moisture. Alt man's, $6.50, set of four. 10. Colombian pottery bowl serves punch or sangria. La Tienda, $10. 11. Fish poacher handles super size fish. Altman's, $37.50. 12. Porous earth enware broiler cooks without added fat; seals in natural flavors. Alt man's, $10. 13. Plexiglas cocktail table holds four bottles of liqueurs. Altman's, $225. 14. Peasant water jug is a centerpiece that serves wine. La Tienda, $12. 15. Foldaway teak table is an extra serving surface. Bloomingdale's, $52.50. 16. Tin milk pail revives an old French design. Altman's, $21. 17. Wall All keeps track of small necessities at pointofuse. Georg Jensen, $39.95. 18. OVersized spoons could pass peanuts with cocktails. La Tienda, $3 each. 19. Halfcrown rack hangs pots and pans in ready. reach. Altman's, $20. 20. Solid copper beating bowl helps egg whites to stiffen and expand. Abraham & Straus, $18. 21. Wire basket carries fresh fruit and vege tables from market. Altman's, $14.50. 22. Maker claims that Val lauris clay pot enhances flavorsimilar to monosodium glutamate. Macy's, $10. 23.0Idtime butcher's block makes a useful work island. Gimbels. $130. 24. Wine rack of sixbottle units stacks tall as need ed. Bloomingdale's, $6 each. 25. Demijohn for decanting wine has a handwoven basket. Bloomingdale's, $30. 26. Scale weighs roasts and fowl for estimating cooking times. Gimbals. $19.99. 27. Restaurant ware steel fry pans are good for fast browning, then slower cooking. Longhandled model keeps cook out of the smoke. Altman's, $7 and $7.50. Linens by Vera at Altman's.

title: WhiteRuled Neighbors Lose Zambian Markets
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, Sept. 15They have taken Portuguese sardines and South African wines off the hotel menus, and there is no more Rhodesian beef on the market.

title: Songmy Informant Back In Vietnam as a Reporter
description: CHULAI, South Vietnam, Sept. 19There are a lot of people in the Army who would like to get you, Ron, Maj. Wil liam Gabella, information offi cer for the Americal Division, said.

title: GOVERNOR SCORES CAMPUS ANARCHY
description: Condemning mindless an archy and violence, Governor Rockefeller proposed stiffer penalties yesterday for posses sion of explosives on college campuses and for destroying campus buildings.

title: CUBS BEAT PHILS, 53, TO NO AVAIL,
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 27Each time Larry Hisle of the Philadelphia Phillies came to bat today, the organist played a few bars of the traditional wedding march in honor of Hisle's forthcoming mar riage. The organist, however, showed compassion and re frained from playing a funer al dirge in memory of the Chi cago Cubs.

title: Chess:
description: A form of the Classical De fense to the Ruy Lopez is: 1 PK4, PK4; 2 NKB3, NQB3; 3 BN5, NB3; 4 00, BB4. It is a good change of pace for the second player, if he is so inclined. Though not in vogue, the line is adventur ous and, judging by the rec ords, may grant better chances than the usual pat terns, which give White the overall edge.

title: CeaseFire on Campus
