description: The President's Commission on Campus Unrest has issued an impassioned plea to lift the controversy that divides the country out of the morass of political exploi tation. The virtue of this appeal is that it combines humane cry of conscience with a sensible, even tough, mandate to all parties for a return to reason and decency. It joins the students abhorrence of the war and social injustice, but avoids the cliche that peace abroad and utopia at home are the only preconditions for cam pus tranquillity.

title: JEWISH AID GROUP OPENING '70 DRIVE
description: To help your fellow man to help himself.

title: Advertising: A Typographics Supermarket
description: Herb Lubalin and Aaron Burns, two of the better known men in the fastchang ing field of typography, have joined forces to create what they believe to be the first of a new wave of independent advertising services.

title: The Making of a Park
description: Edward Burling Sr., cofounder of the great Washington law firm of Covington & Burling, drew deep pleasure and strength from the wilder ness. He had his own 336 acres of primeval forest and waterfalls on the Virginia palisade of the Potomac 12 miles from downtown Washington.

title: International Loans Listed for Week
News Summary and Index
description: International King Hussein of Jordan, Yasir Arafat, commander of the Palestinian guerrillas, and leaders of eight Arab nations agreed yester day on the terms for a settlement of the crisis in Jordan. The accord, which seemed victory for the guerrillas, involves a cease fire, withdrawal of Jordanian troops from Amman, release of all prisoners taken dur ing the fighting, civilian administration of internal security and the creation of a three man committee to oversee the restoration of order. [Page 1, Columns 78.]

title: Agnew Shuns Politicking To Praise an Old Friend
description: BALTIMORE, Sept. 27 (UPI) Vice President Agnew hon ored an old friend tonight in speech in his home town that did not mention politics or the Nixon Administration.

title: Dreydl Makers in City Preparing forWhat's a Dreydl? You Shouldn't Ask
description: There are only 68 shipping days left till Hanukkah.

title: Rudolph Scores 64 in Rain for 274 to Take Green Island Open
description: COLUMBUS, Ga., Sept. 27 (AP)Mason Rudolph tapped in short birdie putts on the last two holes today in steady downpour, closing with a sixunder par 64 to win the $60,000 Green Island open tournament. Chris Blocker, who had a twostroke lead after three rounds, wasted fourshot lead on the last seven holes.

title: Briton to Expound New Learning Approach on TV
description: The time for a child to learn to read, according to Dr. Caleb Gattegno, is soon after he learns to speak.

title: BRONCOS DEFEAT STEELERS, 1613
Pollution, Safety Jobs Exempted in G.M. Strike
description: DETROIT, Sept. 27 (Reu ters)The United Automo bile Workers has agreed to let striking General Motors workers return to their jobs to continue projects in air pollution and safety.

title: Streaks End for Houston, Penn State and Wesleyan
description: Joe Paterno said Penn State was outcoached, outplayed, outhit, and outscored, Bill Yeoman thought his Houston players forgot to remember, and Don Russell said Wes leyan scored too early, too easily.

title: Creative Chief Leaving Leber Katz Paccione
description: Onofrio (Patch) Paccione, creative chief and executive vice president of Leber Katz Paccione, is leaving the agency.

title: All Quiet
description: Author of at least ten books, Erich Maria Remarque will be remembered for just one of them, All Quiet on the Western Front. Published a decade after World War I, it chronicled from the German side the destruction of a generation. Its autumnal mood of loss, pathos and quiet grief left a lasting impression on a legion of readers. Because its subject was warall warand the pain and waste that accompany it, the book breathed an air of conciliation welcomed among those who had been the enemy. There are some books, like Uncle Tom's Cabin and The Grapes of Wrath, that sum up moment of passionate yearning. These books are beyond criticism; All Quiet is one of that company.

title: City Is Bracing for a Revenue Loss of $100Million
description: Warnings of a potential drop of $100million to $150million in the city's projected tax col lections for the current fiscal year have caused Mayor Lind say to order a quick report on possible ways to cut spending.

title: Vandals Toss Glass And Trash Baskets Into Park Bears'
description: Vandals threw glass bottles and five wire trash baskets in to the dens used by the bears at the Central Park Zoo Sat urday night Or early yesterday morning.

title: 49ERS TOP BROWNS ON 61YARD SCORE
Safety Expert Optimistic
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 27 (AP)The president of the National Safety Council, Howard Pyle, says he is optimistic that the nation's traffic deaths can be reduced considerably with monetary help from the Federal Government. Mr. Pyle said progress had been made in re ducing deaths on highways, but that the tight money situation has prevented the Government from adequately financing the Traffic Safety Act passed by Congress in 1966.

title: 11NATION UNIT SETS PACT ON TERRORISM
description: RIO de JANEIRO, Sept. 27An interAmerican committee completed today the draft of a convention to discourage ter rorism, the kidnapping of diplo mats and the hijacking of air craft.

title: Charles Coleman Honored For ColorVideo Inventions
description: Charles H. Coleman has been named winner of the David Sarnoff Gold Medal by, the Society of Motion Picture and Television Engineers for his inventions in the color video tape field.

title: Intrepid, Gretel Resume In America's Cup Today
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Sept. 27 The chilling theory that Intrepid might be in danger of coming apart in a heavy breeze added a new element of intrigue to the 21st Amer ica's Cup defense today as the Defender and Gretel II of Australia awaited tomor row's fifth race.

title: New Top Management Expected at Helena Rubinstein
description: Helena Rubinstein, Inc., a multinational cosmetics manu facturer, is expected to an nounce today a major realign ment of top management, in cluding the election of a new chairman and a new president. It is probably the most im portant management change since the death in 1965 of the concern's founder at the age of 94.

title: Zurich Voters Take Step To Shut Airport at Night
description: GENEVA, Sept. 27  The voters of the Canton (state) of Zurich approved a bill to day that would permit the banning of night flights from Kloten International Airport on the edge of Zurich.

title: Resegregation: A Problem in Urban South
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., Sept. 27 This fall's reopening of schools has made it clear that resegregation by race is begin ning to occur in many South ern cities.

title: Packers Down Falcons, 2724; Vikings Win, 260 ,F From Saints
description: GREEN BAY, Sept. 27 (UPI) Don Horn, substituting for the injured Bart Starr, hit Car roll Dale with an 89yard touchdown pass today midway through the fourth quarter to pull the Green Bay Packers from behind to a 2724 victory over the Atlanta Falcons.

title: NEW TOOL ORDERS SAGGED IN AUGUST
description: New orders for machine tools, a closely watched indi cator of future spending by in dustry, plunged 40 per cent in August, compared with the July level, and 56 per cent from or ders in the comparable 1969 month.

title: Jamaica Sets Back Fairfield In Charity Polo Match, 64
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Sept. 27 Harry Miller's four goals led the Jamaica Polo Club to a 64 victory over Fairfield today at the Hnnt Club.

title: Interest Rate Unchanged
description: The average rate of interest charged by large New York City banks on shortterm business loans was 8.24 per cent dining the first half of August, the Federal Reserve Bank of New York reported over the week end. This was unchanged from the result shown by the pre ceding quarterly survey con ducted in the first half of May but was down from 8.65 per cent from the first half of August, 1969.

title: Kathleen Blake, E. V. Curry Jr. Marry on S.I.
description: Miss Kathleen Margaret Blake, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Vincent Patrick Blake of Great Kills, S. I., was married in Richmondtown, S. I., yesterday to Edward Vincent Curry Jr., son of City Councilman and Mrs. Curry of New Dorp. S. I.

title: Church Rejects Negroes
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Sept. 27 (UPI)A Negro woman and her 11yearold daughter were rejected for membership in the allwhite First Baptist Church of Birmingham today, prompting the resignation of the minister and a staff mem ber and a massive walkout of church members from the morning worship service.

title: KY CALLS CEASEFIRE FIRST STEP TO PEACE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27South Vietnam's Vice President, Nguyen Cao Ky, declared today that a ceasefire in Vietnam was the first step toward peaceful solution of the war. But he did not elaborate.

title: Heat, Hail, Rain, Chill; All Within 15 Minutes
description: Five days of lingering tor por came to a sudden end yesterday as a cold front swooped down on the met ropolitan area and doused the city's heated streets with more than half an inch of rain in 15 minutes.

title: OPPORTUNITY SEEN FOR WEST BANK
description: JERUSALEM, Sept. 27  Is raeli leaders believe that the Jordanian civil war may have opened the way for a solution to the status of the occupied west bank.

title: Big Board. Slates A Live Pilot Test Of Electronic Book
description: The New York Stock Ex change will initiate today a live pilot test of the Specialist Electronic Book, a computer ized display device to store in vestors buy and sell orders that have been left with the specialist for execution.

title: TRUSTEES PRAISE BREWSTER'S RULE
description: NEW HAVEN, Sept. 27The trustees of Yale University an nounced today that they had completed a sevenmonthlong review of Kingman Brewster Jr.'s tenure and unanimously agreed that he should continue as president of the university.

title: Harold Kohn, 76, Lawyer, Served Optometry Groups
description: Harold Kohn, a lawyer who was counsel to several opto metric groups, died yesterday in Beth Israel Hospital following a heart attack. He was 76 years old.

title: In Defense of the IND
description: Along with the environment, the telephone company, and Spiro T. Agnew, the New York subway system has lately come under bitter attack. While I am willing to admit that we could improve all these things, I think a word of caution should be sounded to the people who are assailing the subways. I'm a peculiar kind of an expert on subways. I've been a resident of them in my time.

title: Violence Panel Urged
description: BOSTON, Sept. 27 (AP)AtIrs. Louise Day Hicks, chairman of the City Council's Public Services Committee, said to day she had recommended that the school committee establish a commission to investigate wave of violence in Boston schools. Mrs. Hicks is the Demo cratic candidate for Congress from the Ninth Congressional District.

title: For Those Chilly Days at the Stadium
description: Those thin but warm blan kets and ponchos that play ers on the 26 teams of the National Football League wrap themselves in while on the sidelines are being trans lated into a new item for streetweara stylized cape poncho that comes in four sizes to fit anyone in the family from years of age to an adult 6 feet tall. Called t he DEC Space Con cho (the space comes into it because it's made of the same aluminized polyethylene used in astro nauts suits, with the silvery lining that is said to be ca pable of radiating 80 per cent of the body heat back to the wearer), the cape will be available in three solid colors, blue, red and olive. Shop Talk

title: SHOP AND A MISSION TO U.N. ARE BOMBED
description: Two pipe bombs exploded early yesterday, one at the Rockefeller Plaza shop of the French Book Company and the other outside the United Na tions mission to the Ivory Coast a former French terri tory. Both bombs caused dam age but no injuries.

title: Buckley Urges U.S. to Cut State and Local Aid
description: James L. Buckley called for sharp decrease in Federal grants to state and local governments yesterday, saying that such funds have detrimental effects on local officials.

title: Hudson River Group Aide Quits in Protest on Seeger
description: NEWBURGH, N.Y., Sept. 27 Donald R. Presutti has re signed as vice president of the Hudson River Sloop Restora tion Committee, Inc., after failing in an effort to oust the folk singer Pete Seeger, of Beacon, from the organiza tion's board of directors.

title: Sports of The Times
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept. 27At night the steelmill flames lick at a sulphurous sky, a vision of hell. The Mets, fore warned but predestined, arrived 24 hours early and watched the Pirates beat lastplace Montreal. The game was other wise so poorly attended that letterstotheeditor writers complained that Pittsburgh did not deserve its pennant bound Bucs. But this is a sophisticated sports citYthere are oldtimers here boating on corners who remember run ning alongside horsedrawn buses to spit on John McGraw's Giantsand the fans saved their money for the last home weekend of the sea son, three games in which the Pirates could lock up or lose their Eastern Divi sion lead.

title: Lakatos and Gypsy Musicians Bring a Bit of Romany to Hunter
description: Hunter College Assembly Hall bears little resemblence to an intimate Hungarian bistro and even less to a Romany camp fire. But for two hours or so, at least on Saturday night, those who were inclined could close their eyes and imagine the proper setting as Sandor Lakatos, an authentic gypsy violinist from Hungary, and his fellow musicians conjured up rich musical atmosphere of sobbing violins and clattering cymbalons.

title: Scientists Criticize Curbs On Heated Water Into Lake
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 27 (AP)Six scientists, testifying on behalf of the Commonwealth Edison Company, have said that a proposed Federal limit on the temperature of water discharged into Lake Michigan is unnecessary.

title: Goodell and Buckley
description: I guess we can't ignore Buckley too much longer, said a member of Senator Charles E. Goodell's staff last week in al most plaintive tones. That com ment ma not come until it be came public knowledge that the White House was pointedly, refusing to endorse Mr. Goodell in letters to influential New York Republicans who had asked whether President Nixon favored the Republican Senator or his Conservative party challenger, James L. Buckley.

title: 11 at Radio Station Seized
description: ST. LOUIS, Sept. 27 (UPI)Detectives raided a home next to XDNAFM early today and arrested 11 persons, including the raidio station's manager, on suspicion of illegal possession drugs. Those arrested included Jeremy Lansman, 27 years old, the manager, and Kenneth Wal lace, 43, a disk jockey at the station. The nine others were men and women aged 17 to 40. The police said most were em ployes of the station.

title: Murals Boost Morale on Israeli Front
description: TEL AVIVTwelve Israeli artists have been moving from position to position on the Suez Canal front paint ing murals and canvases to decorate fortifications, bunk ers, messes and recreation facilities.

title: SST NOISE CALLED LOWER THAN 707'S
description: SEATTLE, Sept. 27 (AP)A Library of Congress report that says the supersonic trans port will make less noise dur ing takeoffs and landings than the Boeing 707 was released here yesterday by Senator Hen ry M. Jackson and Senator Warren G. Magnuson, both Washington Democrats.

title: Fall River Line Cruise Salutes a Forgotten Era
description: FALL RIVER, Mass., Sept. 27 (AP)A reenactment of trip on one of the country's most famous inland steamship lines, the Fall River Line, has been staged as a remembrance of the 90yearold line that shut down 17 years ago.

title: Susan B. Naiman Is Wed to Ivan Arnold Funk
description: At Temple Israel here yes terday, Miss Susan Barbara Naiman, an administrative assistant to Sid Davidoff, an assistant to Mayor Lindsay, was married to Ivan Arnold Funk, a vice president of the National Savings Life Insur ance Company of Tennessee in Nashville. Rabbi Martin Zion performed the ceremony:

title: Hulme Gains 4th Victory In CanAm Race Series
description: BRAINERD, Minn., Sept. 27 (Reuters)  Denis Hulme of New Zealand took the lead at the start and never relinquished it today as he drove a McLaren Chevrolet to his fourth victory in the CanadianAmerican Challenge Cup series.

title: ANDRE IMPRESSIVE IN TRUMPET RECITAL
description: Maurice Andre, the French trumpeter who played at Town Hall yesterday afternoon, is an extraordinary virtuoso on his instrument and a sensitive mu sician as well.

title: MONETARY GOALS MAYBE EXTENDED
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, Sept. 27  A strange melting pot of Eurodollars, Special Drawing Rights, wider bands for currencies and the develop ment of the poor countriesin themselves not directly re latedhas emerged here as a possible center of international monetary negotiations over the next two years.

title: Romansky Wins A.A.U. Walk
description: STONY BROOK, L. I., Sept. 27Dave Romansky of the Delaware Track and Field Club won the National Amateur Ath letic Union 25kilometer walk today. His time was 1 hour 59 minutes 5 seconds.

title: Retiring Transit Aide Leaves a Legacy of Change
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27 James D'Orma Braman, an as sistant secretary of transporta tion who made the tiny new Office of Environment and Ur ban Systems a watchdog on the giant highway lobby, retires from Government service this week.

title: 8 Black Syracuse Football Players Continue Boycott
description: SYRACUSE, Sept. 27Eight black football players at Syra cuse University announced to night that they would con tinue to boycott the team in an attempt to end what they called racist behavior on the part of the coaching staff.

title: CABBIES PLANNING DAY OF MOURNING
description: The New York City Taxi Drivers Union announced last night that it had asked its members and independent own erdrivers to observe a 24 hour mourning period for a slain cabby, beginning at mid night tonight.

title: Matawan Lottery to Decide Who Gets Parking Space
description: MATAWAN, N.J., Sept 27 (AP)  This shore resort is resorting to a lottery for park ing space at the railroad sta tion.

title: New State Law Restricts Unsolicited Credit Cards
description: A new state laW taxing er fect Thursday will make it a misdemeanor to send an un solicited credit card to a New York State resident, Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz said yesterday.

title: Some Industries Become Issues In Political Debates on Ecology
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept 27 We got Ralph Yarborough and we'll get you!

title: Housing Fund Rise Urged
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27 (UPI)  The United States would have to increase its total afnnual investment by about 40 per cent if it were to achieve its housing goals for the 1970s, the head of the Federal Hous ing Administration said today. The commissioner, Eugene A. Gulledge, said, however, that we have the capacity to ac complish the 10year goal of 26 million new and renovated dwellings set in 1968 by Con gress.

title: Books of The Times
description: Rich Man, Poor Man, Irwin Shaw's big sixth novel, the one he was finally going to make a comeback with, is bad, bad. It's especially bad because it looks for a while as if he's going to pull it offit's like great old fighter who shows the great old fighter who shows the great old moves in the early rounds and then begins to fall apart, swinging gracefully off tar get, staggering when he hasn't been hit, and finally collapsing from sheer exhaus tion. Rich Man. Poor Man is fi nally so bad that one even begins to wonder if the great old fighter ever had it at all, whether we weren't taken in by the play Bury the Dead, the good short stories of the thirties, and the novel The Young Lions. Unfair, no doubt, but still one wonders.

title: CHARGERS RALLY, TIE RAIDERS, 2727
Article 1  No Title
11Story Building Dedicated By Yeshiva U. for Women
description: Yeshiva University dedicated an 11story classroom building for Stern College for Women yesterday. The $4.5million structure, on Lexington Avenue at 35th Street, is connected by passageways to the existing fivestory building, which has been in use since the school's establishment in 1954.

title: Big Board Refuses to Help Firm's Customers
description: The willingness of the New York Stock Exchange to pro tect investors in memberfirm insolvencies has been cast into doubt by the collapse of a Philadelphia brokerage house and the subsequent refusal of the exchange to stand by the firm's 8.000 customers.

title: Worse Shortage of Heating Fuels Feared
description: Fuel suppliers, spokesmen for public utilities and officials in a number of areas across the Northeast and Middle West say that the nation's tight supply of heating fuels appears to be growing steadily tighter and that no immediate relief is in sight.

title: New Computer System
description: Systems Engineering Labora tories, Inc., announced over the weekend a new small computer system called the Systems 82. Earlier in the month, the com pany introduced Systems 72, giving the company three en tries in the competition for the computer systems market.

title: 7 Killed in Lebanese Crash
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Sept. 27 (AP)Seven Lebanese women were killed when a bus carry ing them to a shrine in north ern Lebanon overturned, smash ed into a utility pole and hit a house, the police said today. Thirty others, mostly women and children, were injured.

title: Lisbeth Smith Wed to C. B. Golson
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Sept. 27 Miss Lisbeth Margie Smith, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Virgil Milton Smith, was married here this afternoon to Charles Bernard Golson, son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles E. Golson of Washington. The Rev. John Akers per formed the ceremony in St. Mark's Episcopal Church.

title: SLOOP VAIGER FIRST ON CORRECTED TIME
description: Five or the 10 starters in the Douglaston Yacht Squadron's sixth annual Windjammers Race for vintage yachts ran for shelter yesterday when violent squall with winds up to 40 knots lashed Long Island Sound.

title: Ruth B. Smith Bride Of Martin Markowitz
description: At the Flushing (Queens) Jewish Center yesterday, Miss Ruth Brooke Smith, a June graduate of the State Univer sity of Stony Brook, L. I., was married to Martin Marko witz, a doctoral candidate in sociology at Stony Brook. Rabbi Paul Hait performed the ceremony.

title: Pirates Clinch Division Crown by Topping Mets, 21, for Sweep of Series
Tony Bennett Shines at Philharmonic
description: Tony Bennett is one of the continuing wonders of the pop music world. At a time when he is surrounded by extravagantly exaggerated and highly amplified per formers, he goes along in his genial, lowkeyed way, still filling Philharmonic Hall, as he did Saturday night, and winding up with ovations and girls  or women  rushing hopefully toward the stage as he takes his bows.

title: Kennedy's Senate Opponent, Short on Strategy, Running a Race Against Time
description: BOSTON, Sept. 27At time when most politicians fighting for Senate seats are flailing away at issues or per sonalities, the Republican chal lenger to Senator Edward M. Kennedy is still groping for campaign strategy.

title: ALLENDE'S STANCE IS SAID TO SHIFT
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Sept. 27  Since he came out ahead in Chile's presidential election, Dr. Salvador Allende has be come, in public at least, stead ily less of a Marxist.

title: HIGH COURT TO RULE ON BEARDBIAS CASE
description: The New York State Division of Human Rights said yesterday that the case of an orthodox Muslim who complained that he was discriminated against be cause of his beard would be heard this fall by the Court of Appeals, the state's highest court.

title: U.S. Official Cautious By HEDRICK SMITH
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27De spite immense relief over the release of 32 American airline hostages, United States officials cautioned today that the epi sode was not yet closed.

title: Mungo Jerry Plays Progressive Rock In Debut at Fillmore
description: In the scheme of progressive rock, is there room for kazoo?

title: SUBWAY FLOODED BY A BROKEN MAIN
description: A threefoot water main burst at the Avenue of the Americas and 43d Street yes terday, causing a 16by60foot section of pavement to col lapse and disrupting subway and auto traffic for more than three hours.

title: Personal Finance: CarStereo Theft
description: Since the Ford Motor Com pany offered stereo tape play ers as optional equipment in its cars five years ago, the market for taped music on wheels has been zooming. At prices from $80 to $350, sales of tape players this year are expected to reach more than $400million.

title: Theresa Named Doctor of Church, First Such Honor for Woman
description: ROME, Sept. 27Pope Paul VI proclaimed St. Theresa of Avila a doctor of the church in a solemn ceremony in St. Peter's Cathedral today.

title: INTERBORO BALLET IN Y,W.C,A. DEBUT
description: The civic ballet company or the regional company has be come almost a fixture outside New York.City as interest in dance has leaped across in grands jetes throughout the nation. It is from these groups that the major companies have drawn much of their talent and some cities their own pro fessional troupes.

title: Black Panther Injured
description: SEATTLE, Sept. 27 (UPI)A Black Panther leader, Aaron Dixon, wes in satisfactory con dition today after being injured when his 12gauge shotgun ex ploded yesterday.

title: GOTBAUM ASSAILS LABOR RIGHTISTS
description: The head of the city's largest public employe union called yesterday for a revolt within the labor movement against what he said were the rightist positions of the leaders of the A.F.L.C.I.O.

title: Highway Ramp to Close
description: PLEASANTVILLE, N. Y. Sept. 27 (UPI)The East Hudson Parkway Authority has an nounced the permanent closure tomorrow at noon of the ramp connecting the Hawthorne Cir. cle and the adjacent state high ways, NY9A and 100. Raymond Radzivila, the authority direc tor, said that the ramp was be ing closed to facilitate con struction of the Saw Mill River Parkway approaches to the threelevel Hawthorne inter change.

title: Principles Chief Is Chosen By Accountants Institute
description: The American Institute of Certified Public Accountants an ?? over the weekend the appointment of Philip L. De fliese, managing partner of Lybrand, Ross Bros. & Mont gomery, as chairman of the in stitute's Accounting Principles Board.

title: Supplementary OverCounter List
Merchant Marine Library Closes Branches in 3 Ports
description: The American Merchant Marine Library has raised finan cial storm warnings.

title: St. Peter's Beats Manhattan
description: St. Peter's defeated Manhat tan in club football Saturday night, 137. The Peacocks took a 130 lead before Manhattan tallied late in the fourth quar ter. The Jasper score came en 57yard pass from Nick Ricci to Ray Brooks.

title: House Unit Says 6th Fleet Is at a Substandard Level
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27 (UPI)The United States has let the Sixth Fleet in the Medi terranean Sea run down to substandard level despite in creasing tensions in the Middle East and a buildup of the So viet fleet there, a House armed services subcommittee said today.

title: Prisoner Found Hanged
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Sept. 27 (AP)  John Kouimanis, 21, years old, of Freeport, who had been arrested Friday on a pety lar ceny charge, was found hanged in his cell in Nassau County Jail today.

title: Freedom for the Hostages
description: The international community of civilized nations has won an important victory now that most of the hostages held by the Arab guerrillas are free. There were many desperate moments these past three weeks when such happy outcome seemed most unlikely, first because the extravagant demands of the aerial hijackers and then because the hostages became helpless victims caught the center of Jordan's bloody civil war. In the end, was the military defeat, at least for the time being, the Palestinian commando forces by King Hussein that made the rescue possible. There is every reason suppose that if the bitter fighting had brought victory to the guerrillas, all the hostages would still be prisoners and there would be no foreseeable end to their ordeal.

title: Sewage Pipes, Shacks and Caves Are the Poor's Homes in Jakarta
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Sept. 10In Merak Park they sleep in large sewage pipes imported from France long ago and never installed; in the fashionable Menteng district they live in caves dug into the sides of a canal the Dutch built or on a platform under the span of a bridge.

title: Deadlock on Job Safety
description: The labor unions and the Nixon Administration are on a collision course on the job safety bill.

title: DOLPHINS PASSES SINK OILERS, 2010
HEAVY SCHEDULE OF BONDS LOOMS
Jets Beat Patriots, 3121, on Running of Boozer and Snell
description: BOSTON, Sept. 27  In chess game created by Clive Rush's determination to smoth er the New York Jets wide receivers, Joe Namath used his running backsEmerson Booz er and Matt Snellas the pri mary pieces today in a 3121 victory over the Boston Patriots.

title: A Voznesensky Poem of Death Answers Grieving Father's Plea
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 27Andrei Voznesensky has written long, rather pessimistic poem in reponse to a plea from the father of a 20year old girl who froze to death after trying to keep alive by reciting Mr. Voznesensky's poetry.

title: Esso Raises Posted Price Of Crude Oil From Libya
description: An affiliate of the Standard Oil Company (New Jersey) an nounced yesterday an increase in the posted price of some Mediterranean crude oil. The posted price of foreign oil is the price on which taxes are based; for a number of years it has been considerably above the actual market price of the crude.

title: LATE FIELD GOAL AVERTS SHUTOUT
Bridge:
description: The role of the captain of a bridge team in a big event can vary widely according to circumstances. When the team is an international one, the captain is always a non playing one, whose chief duty is to decide which players play at any particular mo ment.

title: Nixon, in Rome, Pledges A Mediterranean Presence
description: ROME, Sept. 27President Nixon pledged today to main tain a sufficient military pres. ence in the Mediterranean tc deter any wouldbe aggressors.

title: Liebling Rites Today
description: A funeral service for Estelle Liebling, singer and vocal coach, will he held today at 1 P.M. at Frank E. Campbell's Madison Avenue and 81st Street. Miss Liebling, who had coached many leading singers, died on Friday at her home in the Hampshire House, 150 Cen tral Park South.

title: DUTCH MASS IS READ BY MARRIED PRIEST
description: AMSTERDAM, the Nether lands, Sept. 27 (Reuters)  A married Roman Catholic priest offered mass here today in de Ifiance of Dutch bishops.

title: Concert Commemorates Bartok's Death
description: Although Bela Bartok re ceived little of the acclaim due him during his lifetime, he is said to have been certain that glory would one day be his and even to have written in his will of the time when plazas and !other public places would be named for him.

title: 40 Hurt in Rail Crash
description: EVANSTON, Ill., Sept. 27 (AP)About 40 persons were injured slightly today in a col lision of two Chicago Transit Authority elevated trains in Evanston, a northern suburb of Chicago. The authorities said most of the injured were foot ball fans on their way to the game between the Chicago Bears and Philadelphia Eagles at Dyche Stadium on the North western University campus.

title: Brown Wins 4Mile Run
description: Barry Brown of the New York Athletic Club won the fourmile crosscountry run sponsored by the Road Runners Club of New York yesterday at Van Cortlandt Park in the Bronx. Brown triumphed in 19 minutes 57.4 seconds, 280 yards ahead of Joe Boyle of the Long Island Athletic Club. Boyle's time was 20:48. Art Coolidge, unattached, was third in 21:13.

title: Cabinet Sets Priorities
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Sept. 27 (Reuters)The new Jordanian Cabinet decided at its first meeting in Amman today to give priority to reopening the city's water and electricity supplies, the Amman radio re ported. A special committee was formed to channel aid to the wounded.

title: OTTINGER CHARGES AN OIL MONOPOLY
description: Representative Richard L. Ot tinger, Democrat of Westchesz ter, yesterday accused the Nixon Administration of permit ting the oil industry to monop olize the nation's fuel supplies and drive un prices.

title: Southern California Fires Still Spread as Flames Reach San Diego Outskirts
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept, 27At least 50 more homes were burned in firestorms in South ern California this afternoon, and the fires were still spread ing tonight.

title: ORDERS FOR STEEL CONTINUE TO LAG
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept. 27A sharp swing in steel shipments appears to be developing.

title: Black Activist Appears Winner Over Rep. Friedel in Maryland
description: BALTIMORE, Sept. 27Final but still uncertified returns in the Sept. 15 Democratic pri mary show that Parren J. Mitchell, a black civil rights activist, defeated Representa tive Samuel N. Friedel in the Seventh Congressional District.

title: In Memoriam
description: QUEENEvelyn, forever in loving memory of a beloved sister.

title: Baumritter Chairman
description: The Baumritter Corporation has announced that Nathan S. Ancell will succeed Theodore Baumritter, founder of the furniture company, who is re tiring as chairman. Mr. Ancell will continue to serve as presi dent and chief executive of ficer.

title: Art: Major Exhibition of Mary Cassatt
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27A major exhibition of paint ings by Mary Cassatt, the expatriate painter who was invited to show her work in the historic series of exhibi tions by the French Impres sionists in the years 1879 1886, opened today at the National Gallery of Art. Con sisting of 100 works  oils, pastels and graphic artthe exhibition is the largest ever to be devoted to the work of this extraordinary American woman who won a place for herself in the ranks of the French avantgarde at a time wh'en the esthetics of impres sionism were still a distaste ful mystery to even the most informed of her countrymen.

title: Returning Home at 16
description: The youngest of the 32 hostages released yesterday, Barbara Mensch, will come home today to a belated 16th birthday party.

title: FOOD CHAIN PLANS 2D MAMMA LEONE'S
description: Restaurant Associates Indus tries, Inc., operator of 160 food service units, from the de luxe Four Seasons and the Forum of the Twelve Caesars, to cafe terias and Zum Zum snack bars, is planning to open its second Mamma Leone's Restau rant.

title: Fuibright Urges Diplomacy In Handling Soviet in Cuba
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27 (Reuters)  Senator J. W. Ful bright cautioned the Nixon Ad ministration today against nuclear brinkmanship in trying to prevent the Soviet Union from establishing a submarine base in Cuba, urging instead diplomacy.

title: EXHIBITION HOCKEY
description: SUNDAYS'S GAMES

title: U.S. Hostages on Cyprus, Worn Out but Relieved
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, Sept. 27Thirtytwo American hostages released by the Palestinian guerrillas were flown here to day after three harrowing weeks of captivity in battletorn Jordan.

title: Sports Today
description: Nets vs. Chicago Cubs, at Shea Stadium, Roosevelt Avenue and 126th Street, Flushing Meadow, Queens, 8:05 P.M.

title: Modern Perils Distress Old Village
STEEL UNION GOAL BIG RISE IN WAGES
description: ATLANTIC CITY. Sept. 27Top officers of the United Steel workers of America made I clear today that substantia wage increases would be major objective in next year negotiations with management

title: Women's Hurdle Mark Tied
description: BERLIN, Sept. 27 (AP) Teresa Sukniewicz of Poland equaled the women's world record for the 100meter hur dles today with a 12.7 clocking. according to the East German news agency. She shares the record with Karin Balzer of East Germany.

title: In Minnesota, the Issue Is Who Will Keep the Waters Sky Blue
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Sept. 24Question: How do you make pollution control a major politi cal issue when, like mother hood, hardly anyone will take the negative?

title: FoodPoison Tests Planned
description: BALTIMORE, Sept. 27 (UPI) A Maryland state health offi cer, Dr. Donald Roop, said to day that laboratory tests would be run to determine the cause of the food poisoning that affected 48 persons at a church festival Friday in sub urban Essex.

title: Judy Rankin Wins by Shot With a 217 in Coast Golf
description: ALAMO, Calif., Sept. 27 (UPI) Fighting off several chal lenges by Kathy Whitworth, little Mrs. Judy Rankin hung on for a onestroke victory and the $3,450 firstplace money in the Alamo open at the Round Hill Golf Club today.

title: The Bowery Follies Folds In Last Vaudevillian Fling
description: Sammy's Bowery Follies, the nationally known Gay Nineties saloon where drunks and swells, drifters and celebrities, the rich and the forgotten have mingled for 36 years in rowdy laughter and melancholy song, closed its doors for the last time at 3 A.M. yesterday.

title: Security Bank Head Disagrees With Abacus Over Heller Deal
description: The longsmoldering dispute between Patrick J. Clifford, the volatile chairman of Long Island's Security National Bank, and his biggest stockholder flared up yesterday over the termination of merger talks with the Walter E. Heller In ternational Corporation.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Much of what has been written and said about the recent victory of Salva dor Allende in the Chilean Presiden tial election has seemed more the product of emotion than of cold anal ysis of the facts. Perhaps a recitation of a few of the relevant facts would be in order.

title: HUSSEIN,ARAFAT SIGN ARAB PACT TO END CLASHES
description: CAIRO, Sept. 27The Arab leaders conferring here on the crisis in Jordan tonight signed a 14point agreement that calls for an immediate ceasefire and the appointment of a threeman committee to restore order in the country and oversee mili tary and civilian affairs.

title: Bryant Park Flower Show to Hold Preview Oct. 7
description: The Women's Council of the Bryant Park Flower Show has arranged a preview of the show for Oct. 7, the eve of its opening, in a striped tent that will cover most of the park. The show will con tinue through Oct. 13.

title: Mets Now ExChampions
description: The New York Mets lost their world baseball cham pionship yesterday by losing to Pittsburgh. 21. By win ning, the Pirates took the National League Eastern Division championship. (De tails, Page 57.)

title: Mrs. Meir's Visit to the U.N. Is Expected in MidOctober
description: JERUSALEM, Sept. 27 (Reu ters)Premier Golda Meir will leave here in midOctobcr to attend the 25th anniversary celebrations of the United Na tions, well informed sources said here today.

title: Nixon Will Meet Today With Colombo and Pope
description: ROME, Sept. 27President Nixon will spend most of to morrow conferring with Ital ian officials in Rome, will call on Pope Paul VI in the afternoon and then fly by helicopter to the carrier Sara toga, where he will spend the night.

title: TV's SoCalled New Season
description: WASHINGTON  To critique the new television season reminds me of the hesitant reaction of the fellow presented a harem on his twentyfirst birthday. It's not, he said, that don't know what to do. It's that don't know where to begin.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: DR. RICHARD F. ROBEY
description: CRANFORD, N. J., Sept. 21  Dr. Richard F. Robey, senior research associate of Standard Oil Company (New Jersey), Linden, died Friday, apparently of a heart attack, while attending an Esso con ference in Colorado Springs. He was 58 years old and lived at 409 Orange Avenue here.

title: St. Louis Rector Ties Himself To Pulpit in Protest of Racism
description: ST. LOUIS, Sept. 27 (UPI)) A religious service in con junction with St. Louis's first fall festival was canceled to day when the Rev. William L. Matheus chained himself to the pulpit of Christ Church Cathedral to protest racism.

title: Fire Kills Three Mexicans
description: SAN LORENZO TELUCIA. Mexico, Sept. 27 (UPI)A fire and explosion damaged the stateowned Petroleos Mexi canos gasoline refinery today, killing thre workers and injur ing one, the police said. The fire was confined to the plant at this village, 75 miles north east of Mexico City.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Ch. Ancram's Simon, English Cocker Spaniel, TakesTop Honor at Westbury
description: BROOKVILLE, L. I., Sept. 27 Ch. Ancram's Simon,.owned by Joyce ScottPaine of An cramdale, N. Y., the topwin ning English cocker spaniel in America, added to his laurels today on the grounds of C. W. Post College. He was named best in show in a field of 1,703 dogs at the Westbury Kennel Association fixture for the sec ond year in a row.

title: CALDWELL DISPLAYS MUSICALITY AT PIANO
description: Emmanuel Caldwell, a young pianist with bachelor's and master's degrees from the American Conservatory of Music in Chicago, came to Town Hall late Saturday after noon to play a program con sisting of Handel's Chaconne in G, Brahms's Sonata in F minor, three of Debussy's Images and Scriabin's Son ata No. 4.

title: Seton Hall's Football Club Rallies to Beat lona, 2013
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N. J., Sept. 27  Seton Hall University's club football team rallied twice today to defeat the Iona Col lege club, 2013, on rainsoaked Setonia Field.

title: Leslie J. Brickner Bride of R. J. Roth
description: Miss Leslie J. Brickner, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Merol E. Brickner of Glovers ville, N. Y., was married here yesterday afternoon to Rich ard J. Roth, son of Aaron A. Roth of New York and the late Mrs. Eleanor Roth.

title: Nixon's Trip: Symbolic Journey
description: ROME, Sept. 27The White House describes it as a symbolic journey, so President Nixon's foray into the Mediterranean area began with a helicopter ride from a secluded military airport to a barricaded Govern ment palace.

title: Adam Smith Revised
description: Adam Smith, that classic theorist of the free market, might find him self baffled by some of the twists cur rent labor disputes are giving to the principles of a competitive economy. The right to strike is regularly hailed by labor and industry as a hallmark of economic freedom, a test of strength in which economic pressures eventu ally oblige one side or the otheror bothto give way.

title: Black G.I. Activists in Germany Will Boycott Pentagon Inquiry
Theme of Nonviolence Pervades Kent State as New Term Opens
description: KENT, Ohio, Sept. 27At this point, Craig Mor gan, the Kent State Univer sity student president, was saying this morning, I'm getting a little more optimis tic about school staying open.

title: LAVER VANQUISHES NEWCOMBE IN FINAL
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 27 (UPI) Rod Laver beat John New combe, 46, 64, 76, to capture the $65,000 Pacific Southwest tennis open today.

title: Fire on R.A.F. Cargo Plane Causes Minor Damage Here
description: A British Royal Air Force cargo plane with 11 crew members on board caught fire on takeoff at Kennedy Intert national Airport yesterday, causing minor damage to the aircraft but not iniuries.

title: Plaza Suite to End Run
description: Plaza Suite, Neil Simon's comedy, will end its Broadway run on Oct. 3 after 1,097 per formances at the Plymouth Theater. A new play by Mr. Simon, called The Gingerbread Lady, starring Maureen Staple ton, will open at the Plymouth on Dec. 2. Saint Subber is the producer. Robert Moore will direct.

title: FUND EVENTS AID BLACK CANDIDATES
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27Conscious of their increasing political potential, Negroes are integrating black power with green power through fundrais ing partiesa new phenomenon for blacksto help elect black politicians across the country.

title: SECOND HEARING SET FOR 2D AVE. SUBWAY
description: Assemblyman Stephen C. Hansen said yesterday that he would hold his own public hear ing on the number of stops on the proposed Second Avenue subway because he had been getting the runaround from the city and the Transit Author ity.

title: Numata Knocks Out Rojas In Fifth Round in Tokyo
description: TOKYO, Sept. 27 (AP)Knocked down once and appar ently helpless, Yoshiaki Numata of Japan suddenly landed a right uppercut and knocked out Raul Rojas of San Pedro, Calif., in the fifth round tonight. He kept the World Boxing Council's ver sion of the world junior light weight title.

title: SURCHARGE URGED TO RATION POWER
description: Senator Charles E. Goodell yesterday called for higher rates for commercial and industrial users of electricity during pow er shortages in order to ration the supply.

title: Moose Killed in Portland
description: PORTLAND, Me., Sept. 27 (AP)A search for a moose that had been roaming the streets of Maine's largest city ended today when the animal was shot by the police. After unsuccessful attempts over two weeks to subdue the beast with a tranquilizer gun, the police tracked it down to west end dump and, finding it to be injured, decided to de stroy it.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming Passenger and Mail Ships

title: London Readers Idled
description: LONDON, Sept. 27 (Reuters) Londoners went without their Sunday newspapers today be cause of a ban on overtime by packers and delivery drivers.

title: Cab Driver and Passenger Killed in Queens Collision
description: Two persons were killed yes terday and four others injured when a taxi jumped a divider on the Grand Central Parkway in Astoria, Queens, and collided headon with another car.

title: Convicts'
description: SAN QUENTIN, Calif., Sept. 27 (UPI)  Convicts at San Quentin Prison were paid more than $33,000 for their works during the 16th annual prison arts and crafts show held over the weekend at the penitentiary on San Francisco Bay. The in mates received threefourths of the purchase price for their works, with the remaining 25 per cent going into a welfare fund.

title: Two Feline Performers Retained for Colette
description: Two nonEquity performers with a reputation for scene stealing have been retained for the cast of Colette, the Elinor Jones play reopening Oct. 14 at the Ellen Stewart Theater after a twomonth suspension.

title: Undermining the I.L.O.
description: When the Soviet Union and France refused to pay their share of the costs of United Nations peacekeeping missions, the United States properly pointed out that such selective use of money power as a lever for political pressure undermined hope for a world society built on law. The World Court formally upheld that view in decision requiring nations to honor their financial obli gations as members of the U.N. and its constituent agencies.

title: Pair With 5 Guns Arrested Boarding Jetliner for Israel
NADER URGES STUDY OF TOBACCO CONTENT
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27 (AP) Ralph Nader, the consumer advocate, called today for an immediate Federal investigation of what he called the tobacco industry's use of possibly haz ardous foreign matter in ciga rettes, cigars and cigarettesize cigars.

title: ClosedEnd Funds
3 Vietcong Attacks on Villages, Causing 8 Deaths, Are Reported
description: SAIGON. South Vietnam, Sept. 27 (AP)Vietcong forces attacked three villages this weekend, military spokesmen reported today. They said the attacks had been directed against the Government's pac ification program.

title: Guns Heard in Amman Despite CeaseFire and Announcement of a New Cabinet
description: AMMAN. Jordan, Sept. 27Occasional shots and bursts of machinegun fire sounded in Amman last night and early this morning despite the cease fire and the announcement of a new, largely civilian Cabinet.

title: Eastern Leases 3 Big Jets
description: Eastern Airlines has an nounced that it has leased three Boeing 747 jets to provide daily service during the winter from New York and Chicago to Mi ami and from New York to San Juan, P. R. The first jumbo jets will be delivered by Pan Ameri can Airways to Eastern on Dec. 1 and two more on Jan. 1.

title: TAIWAN BUILDING ZONES FOR TRADE
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Sept. 27The Government in Taipei, en couraged by the striking suc cess of its export processing zone at Kaohsiung, in the south, is constructing two more such industrial areas to attract capital and increase exports.

title: She Takes a Stand Against Liberation
description: Helen B. Andelin, a 50yearold housewife from Santa Barbara, who looks considerably younger than her years, is a selfappointed spokesman for the silent majority of American women who believe that women's place in the home.

title: MARJORIE NICHOLS OF STAGE IS DEAD
description: Mrs. Marjorie Jones Nichols, an actress known as Marjorie Nichols, who was often cast as a redhaired, pretty, youthful grandmother, and who had ap peared in more than 100 televi sion shows, died Saturday in Roosevelt Hospital. She lived at the Surrey Hotel, 20 East 76th Street.

title: Rangers, 4 Stars Out, to Face Bruins
description: The leading caracters in the morality play that last appeared at Madison Square Garden in Aprilthe Rangers and the Boston Bruinswill play an exhibition tonight with many of the protago nists missing.

title: Two on Nixon Panel Term College Deaths Unjustified
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27The killing of six students in Ohio and Mississippi by the law enforcement authorities last May was completely unjusti fied, two members of the President's Commission on Campus Unrest said today.

title: U.S. and Britain to Start Flying Field Hospitals to Jordan Today
description: GENEVA, Sept. 27The United States plans to start fly ing two field hospitals, com plete with staff and medical supplies, to Amman tomorrow and Britain will fly a field hos pital from Cyprus. Arrange ments were completed by the two governments with the In ternational Committee of the Red Cross today.

title: Executive Director Is Chosen by Board Of U.S.RightsGroup
description: The board of directors of the American Civil Liberties Union announced yesterday the election of Aryeh Neier as executive director of the civil rights organization. The announcement was made at the board's bimonthly meet ing in the Belmont Plaza Hotel.

title: Simple Cholera Treatment, a Salt Drink, Developed
description: Many victims of cholera can be cured by drinking copious amounts of a special salty water instead of receiving similar fluids through their veins, researchers have re ported. Previously, doctors used such oral fluid treatment for cholera but only combined with intravenous fluid therapy, not as a primary treatment alone.

title: YANKS WIN FINALE AT STADIUM, 42
description: Demonstrating the skills that management believes will make them a future pennant contend er in the American League East, the Yankees ended their home season yesterday with a 42 victory over the Tigers before 10,761 hardy fans at Yankee Stadium.

title: Two Airports in Paris Are Hit By 3 Explosions in 25 Minutes
description: PARIS, Sept. 27 (Reuters)Three explosions went off with in 25 minutes at two Paris air ports today.

title: Myrdal Terms Drug Addiction Big Threat to Human Survival
description: FRANKFURT, West Germany, Sept. 27The Swedish political economist Dr. Gunnar Myrdal today added the epidemic pro portions of drug addiction to his grim catalogue of social and natural ills mankind must con trol if it wanted to survive.

title: Tropical Storm Weakens; Center Nears Key West
description: MIAMI, Sept. 27 (AP)Trop ical Storm Greta weakened and broke apart today as its center approached Key West, which had battened down for near hurricane winds.

title: An OldAge Center Where They Know They'll Find Affection
description: They arrive at her office all day long. Faces sad. Movements nervous. Problems magnified by having no one at home to share them with. Often their troubles are heartbreakingly insoluble. But al ways they come out smiling.

title: The Week's Votes In Congress
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27Following are the votes of the delegations from New York, New Jersey and Connecticut on the major rollcalls in Congress during the week ended Friday:

title: Suspect in Boston Slaying Is Captured
description: GRAND JUNCTION, Colo., Sept. 27 (AP)Stanley R. Bond, one of four fugitives described by the police as revolutionaries sought in a bank holdup and machinegun slaying of a Bos ton policeman, was arrested by an agent of the Federal Bureau of Investigation today as he at tempted to board a plane here.

title: BOXING COMMISSION GIVES ALI A LICENSE
description: As expected the New York State Athletic Commission vot ed unanimously yesterday to restore the license of Muham mad Ali the former heavy weight boxing campion. The threeman commission is head ed by Edwin B. Dooley, the chairman.

title: ... and Channing and Burrows Plot Straight Fun
description: The idea that Carol Chan ping is a souffl of vagaries and bewilderments, a notion that her countenance con tinually supports, is dashed very soon after she starts talking about her work.

title: Marriott Corp. Reports Increase In Earnings for the Fiscal Year
description: The Marriott Corporation which is engaged in the opera tion of restaurants, cafeterias and motor hotels as well as air line catering and institutional feeding services, reported yes terday a 24 per cent increase in its earnings for the fiscal year ended July 31 on a sales gain of 22 per cent.

title: West Virginia Is Leader In Lambert Trophy Voting
description: West Virginia, back in the Eastern College Athletic Con ference for the first time in many years, led the balloting in the first week of voting yes terday for the Lambert Trophy, awarded for outstanding per formance by a major Eastern college football team.

title: J. E. BRINCKERHOFF, INDUSTRIAL OFFICIAL
description: James E. Brinckerhoff, former vice president in charge of the refractories division of the Babcock & Wilcox Company, makers of industrial products, died on Sunday at his home in Livingston, N. J. He was 77 years old.

title: Peak Rates Seen
description: LONDON, Sept. 28 (Reuters) Donald M. Graham, chair man of the Continental Illinois National Bank and Trust Com pany, said today that he ex pected prime lending rates in the United States to continue at historically high levels over the next few years.

title: Intrepid Wins Series, 41, And Keeps America's Cup
description: NEWPORT, R.I., Sept. 28 The longest series in 100 years of America's Cup challenges came to a desperately dramatic close today with Intrepid com pleting a 41 conquest of Gretel II.

title: NIXON POSTAL AIDE BACKS SMUT LAWS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept 28Postmaster General Winton M. Blount reinforced today the Nixon Administration's stand against removing legal re straints on pornography. He also admonished the nation's courts for allowing the spread of smut.

title: TV: New Black Journal
description: The program entitled Black Journal, the award winning presentation that is the only hour on television solely dedicated to news of interest to blacks, returned last night for another season of monthly showings on Na tional Educational Television (Channel 13).

title: Swidler Urges Central Control Over Plans for Power Facilities
description: A unified power planning system for the whole of New York State to assure adequate electricity supply on an envi ronmentally compatible ba sis was urged yesterday by the chairman of the state's Public Service Commission.

title: Madison Ave. Closing Tonight
description: Declaring that the first of the Tuesday night Madison Ave nue mall experiments last week was a triumphant success, Mayor Lindsay yesterday urged New Yorkers to visit the ave nue tonight to enjoy the shops, galleries, museums and restaur ants. Madison Avenue will be closed to traffic between 61st and 79th Streets tonight be tween 7 and 10 o'clock. How ever, tonight the avenue buses will travel their regularly north erly route, replacing the mini trains.

title: Text of the Arab Accord on Jordan
description: CAIRO, Sept. 28 (Reuters)  Following, in unofficial translation front the Arabic, is the text of the agreement signed here last night by nine Arab countries and Yasir Arafat head of the Palestinian guerrillas, to end the conflict in Jordan:

title: Rangers Beat. Bruins, 40, in PenaltyMarred Exhibition
description: Playing without one regular center from last year's squad, and using only two healthy regular defensemen the Rang ers, clawed their way to a 40 victory over the Boston Bruins last night while the clubs amassed a total of 28 penalties.

title: The Great Boot Boom of '70: Expense, It Seems, Is No Object
description: If they can walk, they're buying boots, said Harold Kaplan, buyer for I. Miller Shoes.

title: Notables Around World Voice Sorrow
description: Government officials of many nations expressed grief and concern yesterday at the death of President Gamal Abdel Nas ser of the United Arab Repub lic.

title: John Dos Passos Is Dead at 74; Acclaimed for U.S.A. Trilogy
description: BALTIMORE, Sept. 28John Dos Passos, the novelist of the postWorld War I generation who wrote more than 30 books, including the trilogy U.S.A., died today in his apartment.

title: GIANTS AFFLICTED BY 2DHALF WOES
description: Maybe it would be better the Giants just got pushed around, quarter after quarter, week after week. Then they could accept the fact that they were just not a good football team.

title: SCHOOL IN SYRACUSE CLOSED BY VIOLENCE
description: SYRACUSE, Sept. 28One city high school will remain closed here tomorrow and the Mayor threatened students with felony arrests for inciting to riot if they continued the ra cial violence that sent 12 stu dents to hospitals and closed two other schools today.

title: Ale, Reputed Mafia Figure, Faces Jail in S.E.C. Case
description: Vincent Alo, who was de scribed on a Justice Depart ment list last year as a cap tain 1 in the Mafia organization controlled by the late Vito Genovese, will be sentenced by Federal Judge Constance Baker Motley Oct. 27 for his convic tion on two counts of giving false and evasive answers to questions asked by the Securi ties and Exchange Commission.

title: Plea by Cohen Denied
description: KANSAS CITY, Sept. 28 (AP) Mickey Cohen, an alleged underworld figure serving a sentence for income tax eva sion, lost a plea for freedom today. United States District Judge William H. Becker de nied a petition for a writ of habeas corpus.

title: PORT UNIT SCORED ON MASS TRANSIT
description: Senator Harrison A. Williams Jr. asserted yesterday that the Port of Nevi, York Authority had failed to meet its responsibili ties to help New York and New Jerseysobie their prob lems of mass transportation.

title: Bonn and Moscow Sign ScienceExchange Pact
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 28The So viet Union and West Germany today signed an agreement on scientific cooperation as part of an improvement in relations envisaged in last month's Bonn Moscow treaty, which re nounced force and accepted Europe's postwar frontiers as inviolable.

title: A Malaysian State Expels Correspondent of The Times
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia Sept. 28 (Reuters)  Henry Kamm, a correspondent of The New York Times, was orderec tonight to leave the eastern Malaysian state of Sarawak by noon tomorrow.

title: Malpractice Suits Reported Soaring
description: Witnesses at a State Senate public hearing testified here yesterday that a steep rise in medical malpractice suits was forcing physicians to practice defensive medicine, shirk haz ardous modes of treatment that could be of benefit to patients, and pass along the costs of sky rocketing insurance premiums to patients.

title: Florida Voters Will Pick Winners Today in 3 Runoff Primaries for Governor and Senator
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Sept. 28The trend toward new faces in Southern politics will get a major test tomorrow in Florida primary runoff elec tions.

title: Dominick &
description: Dominick & Dominick, Inc., a major brokerage house, an nounced yesterday that it had terminated merger discussions with Clark, Dodge & Co., Inc., another leading securities con cern. Myron A. Wick Jr., chair man of Dominick, said the con cern had chosen to proceed independently.

title: For 18 Years Nasser Had Almost Hypnotic Power in His Leadership of Egyptians
description: Nasser! Nasser!, Cairo crowds cried out in anguish on the June night in 1967 when Gamal Abdel Nasser announced that, after 15 years in power, he had decided to resign as President of the United Arab Republic.

title: LONDON STOCKS FINISH DAY MIXED
Primary in Hawaii Threatens to Divide Democrats
description: HONOLULU, Sept. 28 Next Saturday's primary elec tion here, the nation's last this year, may divide beyond re pair this state's Democratic party, which has been in pow er throughout Hawaii's first decade.

title: Tremor Felt in Chile
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Sept. 28 (AP)A slight earth tremor shook an area of 315 miles in and around this capital city early today. There were no re ports of damage or injuries. The tremor had an intensity of 3 on the Mercali scale of 1 to 12.

title: Lombardi Is Named For Football Award
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., (AP)Vincent Lombardi was named today the third recip ient of the National Football Foundation and Hall of Fame's Distinguished Service Award. The posthumous award will be presetned to Lombardi's son at the group's 13th annual awards dinner Dec. 8.

title: WPIX Aide Defends Use of Dated Film To Illustrate News
description: Walter D. Engels, former news manager of WPIX, said yesterday that in two instances in midNovember 1968 his sta tion's news programs used old film to illustrate fresh news, but he maintained that the prac. tice was not improper.

title: A Tribute to Youmans Is Unveiled Near Park
description: A bronze plaque marking the site on which the late Vincent Youmans was born 72 years ago was unveiled yesterday on the marble corner of Stampler's restau rant at 61st Street and Cen tral Park West. The plaque is the gift of friends and ad mirers of the composer of such hit songs as Tea for Two. Sometimes I'm Hap py, More Than You Know, Time on My Hands and Without a Song.

title: An Issue of Social Justice
description: Economists have pointed out that in the next ten years the U.S. will in crease Its income by 50 per cent and that the GNP in 1979 at constant prices will be $500 billion greater than in 1969,

title: Miss Linda Frances Cicalese Is Betrothed to Ian C. Rickard
description: Mr. and Mrs. Michael Cicalese of Paris, formerly of New York, have; announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Linda Frances Cicalese, to Ian Charles Rickard, son of Mr. and Mrs. Ronald E. Rickard of Saw bridgeworth, Hertfordshire, England.

title: Israelis Foresee a Prolonged Stalemate in the Peace Efforts in the Middle East
description: JERUSALEM, Tuesday, Sept. 29A senior Cabinet Minister, hearing of President Gamal Ab del Nasser's death, said last night that Israel faced the pros pect of a prolonged stalemate on the decision for war or for peace in the Middle East.

title: Aleksandr Tomsky Dead; Bolshoi Ballet Director
description: MILAN, Italy, Sept. 28Alek sandr R. Tomsky, director of the Bolshoi Ballet Company, died of a heart attack here yes erday, shortly after the Bolshoi troupe of more than 100 mem bers arrived here for a season at La Scala Opera House.

title: 6th Ave. Work to Take Week
description: It will take about a week to repair a 60foot hole in the street on the Avenue of the Americas at 43d Street, the Department of Water Resources said yesterday. Traffic on the avenue was restricted to two lanes yesterday as a section of a burst water main was re placed. Traffic below 42d Street on the Avenue of the Americas was backed up as autos chan neled into two lanes.

title: 5 Civil Court Judges Named By Mayor to Interim Terms
description: Mayor Lindsay appointed five judges yesterday to serve interim terms until Dec. 31 in the Civil Court.

title: Books of The Times
description: Kobo Abe seems never to rewrite himself, to worry an old bone. Each new novel translated into English, exploiting and dis carding fictional forms like clutches of Kleenex, comes as a surprise and a provo cation. The Woman in the Dunes (1964) was a shooting script for Hiro Teshigahara. The Ruined Map (1969) was a meta physical detective story. Inter Ice Age 4 is science fiction, complete with computers predicting the future, submarine colonies and the usual apocalypse.

title: EGYPTIAN STRUGGLE FORESEEN BY EBAN
description: Foreign Minister Abba Eban of Israel commented yesterday that the death of President Gamal Abdel Nasser might pro duce an internal struggle for power that could reduce Egypt's international activities.

title: Motorola Recalling Radios
description: Motorola, Inc., announced yesterday at Chicago that it was recalling about 1,500 models of a digital clock radio that under certain conditions has a shock hazard. The radio, designated the, model TC7OGU, has been found to possess potential shock hazards although company spokesmen said that no prob lems had been reported to date. Consumers owning such models were urged to return them for inspection to the store from which they were purchased. Safety modifications will be performed by Motorola service personnel without charge.

title: Japan Will Press Large Underwater Tunnel
description: TOKYO, Sept. 28A project to build the world's longest tunnel by linking Japan's big underdeveloped northern island, Hokkaido, with the main Island of Honshu moved closer to real ization this month. The Railway Construction Advisory Council recommended that the 38.6 milelong tunnel be upgraded from a test undertaking to a regular construction project.

title: Jewish Leaders Voice Regret And Emphasize Hope for Peace
description: Jewish leaders here reacted with expressions of regret yes terday to the death of Presi dent Gamal Abdel Nasser of the United Arab Republic and emphasized that the new leadership must give first priority to a lasting peace be tween Arab states and Israel.

title: Walinsky Says Lefkowitz Fails In Actions on Factory Mishaps
description: Adam Walinsky, the Demo cratic candidate for Attorney General, charged yesterday that Louis J. Lefkowitz, his Repub lican opponent has failed to prosecute in cases where viola tions of labor law have been found to lead to accidents re sulting in the deaths of workers.

title: PACKER ABANDONS 2DRAGE PROTEST
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Sept. 28Amid foghorn blasts, cheers and fireworks that saluted Gretel II's spirited but futile try for the America's Cup, a bitter after taste lingered in the mouth of Sir Frank Packer, head of the Australian syndicate.

title: Slow Train
description: Two statistics tell the story of topsyturvy Federal transportation policy. In the fiscal year that ended on June 30, the Federal Government provided $2.2 billion for urban highways. All programs for urban mass transit the coming yearbus lines, subways, commuter railroads total $214,000.000. less than onetenth as much.

title: PRICES OF BONDS SHOW A DECLINE
Campus Radicals Opposed
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 28 (AP) The Young Americans for Freedom announced today that its members would distribute blue buttons on campuses na tionwide to show majority sup port on campus for firm action against radical extremists who seek to destroy education.

title: America as a Character
description: It probably galled John Dos Passos to notice that his name was inevitably linked to a posi tion he had repudiated. For no matter how proletarian or left wing writing was defined, his name was always called up in connection with it. It was not merely that he had giver him self to left wing causes and that he had helped deflate the swollen jingoism of World War I in Three Soldiers, but that his most signifi cant work, the trilogy U.S.A., supported the doctrinaire analy sis of radical critics that Amer ica was on the edge of a break down.

title: REV. FINIAN SULLIVAN
description: YONKERS, Sept. 28The Very Rev. Finian Sullivan, pas tor of the Roman Catholic Monastery Church of the Sa cred Heart died yesterday. He was 56 years old.

title: Jewish Center Is Blasted
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 28 (AP)A metal encased bomb was thrown through the window of a North Side Jewish community center early today and blasted a hole in one wall, the police said. Nobody was injured although six persons were in the build ing at the time.

title: Burroughs Ends Patent Suit
description: DETROIT, Sept. 28 (UPI)The Burroughs Corporation an nounced today the settlement of a patentinfringement suit against the Raytheon Company and the Newark Electronics Corporation, a Raytheon dis tributor, concerning the manu facture and sale of numerical indicator tubes. The terms of the settlement license Raytheon to manufacture and market the tubes under Burroughs patents.

title: COLTS TROUNCED BY CHIEFS, 4424
City Gives Spain Week But Takes Away a Day
description: It was, according to relia ble sources, Oct. 12, 1492, when Christopher Columbus landed on a small island in the Bahamas to discover the New World, but Mayor Lind say yesterday proclaimed the week of Oct. 4 through 11 Week of Spain to com memorate Columbus's arrival.

title: A GESTURE BY U. S.
description: ABOARD U.S.S. SARATOGA, in the Mediterranean, Tuesday, Sept. 29President Nixon last night ordered cancellation of today's exercises of the United States Sixth Fleet in the Medi terranean because of the death of President Gamal Abdel Nas ser of Egypt.

title: Zsa Zsa Deal Ruled Out
description: Gulf & Western Industries Inc., denied yesterday published reports that it intends to ac quire Zsa Zsa, Ltd., a cosmetics concern. Gulf & Western's con sumer products group had looked at Zsa Zsa, Ltd., recent ly, but rejected it as an acqui sition possibility.

title: Sketches of President's Hosts in Italy
description: President of Italy... right wing Socialist and stanch advocate of nonCommunist principles... nevertheless was elected in 1964 as Italy's fifth postwar President with help of Communist votes.. as Foreign Minister and So cial Democratic leader was known as Hamlet of Italian politics for reluctance to make up his mind... has been called unpredictable, impul sive, doctrinaire, but in fight ing Fascism or Communism or making stand for democ racy has displayed rocklike firmness... name is of Span ish origin, but his branch has been traced to Sardinia ... born in Turin Sept. 19, 1898, son of a lawyer... trained to be a bank clerk . left early in nineteen twenties under the Fascists and returned in 1943... jailed by Nazis but freed soon after by Partisans.. in 1946 became president of Constitutent Assembly that framed republican Con stitution... founded anti Communist Socialists in 1947 . serves in four Cabinets and stood unsuccessfully for the presidency in 1962.. reading his only hobby... a widower since 1961, his daughter, Ernestina, acts as official hostess.

title: MRS. MANGRAVITE
description: Mrs. Frances T. Mangravite, wife of Peppino Mangravite, Professor of Painting at Colum bia University, died yesterday in the Harkness Pavilion of the ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center. She was 67 years old.

title: 4 Die in Fights in Manila Jail
description: MANILA, Sept. 28 (AP)Four prisoners were killed in fights and six seriously wounded to day in the deathrow section of Muntinlupa National Peniten tiary a prison spokesman said.

title: WOMAN CAPTAIN SUES OVER AIR FORCE RULE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 28 (AP) A woman captain in the Air Force filed a Federal court suit today alleging sex discrimina tion in a military regulation that prohibits her from taking an 8yearold son to a foreign assignment.

title: MURTAGH SCORES PANTHER LAWYER
description: Panther defense lawyers were rebuked yesterday by Su preme Court Justice John M. Murtagh for their method of questioning prospective jurors and directed to be more law verlike.

title: Chevron Offers Gasoline Designed for Cleaner Air
description: The Chevron Oil Company announced yesterday that would introduce to the East gasoline containing a new ad ditive designed to reduce air pollution.

title: Edna Goodman Plans Nuptials
description: FORT LEE, N.J., Sept. 28  Mrs. Jesse Goodman has made known the engage ment of her daughter, Miss Edna Kottler Goodman, to H. Paul Burak, son of Mrs. Harry Burak of New York and the late Mr. Burak.

title: NIXON ECONOMICS ASSAILED BY ABEL
description: ATLANTIC CITY, N. J., Sept 28The president of the United Steelworkers of America, I. W. Abel, apparently seeking to dispel any illusions that his big union was leaning toward the Republicans, sharply at tacked the Nixon Administra tion's bluecollar strategy yesterday and condemned what he called its dismal economic failures.

title: Stokes's Caucus Endorses An ExOpponent of Mayor's
description: CLEVELAND, Sept. 28 Seth C. Taft, a Republican who ran against Mayor Carl B. Stokes three years ago and now a candidate for Cuyahoga County Commissioner, was en dorsed today by a group formed by the Mayor.

title: In Amman, They Cry Water! Water!
description: AMMAN, Jordan Sept. 28  Water! Water! Water! little boys pleaded. Palestin ians fought for sacks of flour from a relief truck while panicky soldiers near by fired shots into the air to keep from being mobbed.

title: Symbol of the Dream
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 28To millions of Arabs from Morocco to the Persian Gulf, Gamal Ab del Nasser was the symbol of the lost dream of Arab great ness, a proud challenger to the Goliaths of the West.

title: 50,000 FLEE BLAZE IN SAN DIEGO AREA
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 28The largest brush fire in Cali fornia history raged today through mountain canyons near the Mexican border, driving thousands of persons from their homes as the flames advanced.

title: School Administrators Sought From Other Fields
description: A consortium of five univer sities has begun a federally funded experimental program to recruit candidates from other professions for training as public school administrators.

title: SIHANOUK'S ALLIES WATCH PARIS TALKS
description: PARIS, Sept. 28The fol lowers of the deposed Cam bodian Chief of State, Prince Norodom Sihanouk, are closely watching the Vietnam peace talks here as the possible key to political victory in Cam bodia.

title: ISRAEL SEES PERIL IN JORDAN ACCORD
description: JERUSALEM, Sept. 28Is raeli officials are taking a dim view of the accord ending the Jordanian fighting.

title: Economy Held Crossing Into Growth Stage
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 28A top Treasury official said to day that the economy clearly has moved past a crossover Point towards expansion.

title: Arab Truce Observers Arrive In Generally Peaceful Amman
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Sept. 28One hundred foreign Arab of ficers arrived here today to serve on the peacekeeping ob server teams that will be de ployed in Amman under the agreement reached yesterday in Cairo to end hostilities be tween the Jordanian Govern ment and the Palestinian commandos.

title: David Callan Rowe to Wed Miss Patricia Anne Thuma
description: WINCHESTER, Mass., Sept 28Col.Richard R. Thuma Jr., U.S.A., retired, the Build ing Commissioner for Boston, and Mrs. Thuma, both of Winchester, have announced the engagement and forth coming marriage of their daughter, Miss Patricia Anne Thuma, to David Callan Rowe, son of Mr. and Mrs. George A. Rowe, also of Win chester.

title: Buckley Opposes ImportQuota Bill As Reactionary
description: TROY, N. Y., Sept. 28 (UPI)  James L. Buckley, the Con servative party candidate for United States Senator, said today he opposed a bill pending in Congress to put quotas on some imported goods and fa vored the gradual elimination of tariffs.

title: Executive Changes
description: Edgar G. Grant has been appointed president ITT Communications Equipment and Systems Divi sion of the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: MarineOswegoTrinity Group Will Be Purchased by GATX
description: The directors of the General American Transportation Cor poration approved yesterday the acquisition of the maritime ship ping business of Marine Oswego Trinity Group, New York. While the purchase price, which involves a combination of cash and common stock, was not dis closed, trade sources estimated it at upwards of $50million.

title: U.S. Now Bleak to a Laborite Friend
description: BLACKPOOL, England, Sept. 28One of the stanchest pro Americans in British politics suggested today that it was time for Britain to stop look ing across, the Atlantic for help and incpiration.

title: GERMAN BOOK FAIR REJECTS NEW PURGE
description: FRANKFURT, West Ger many, Sept. 28The Frankfurt Book Fair council rebuffed at tempts today to purge the ex hibition of works defending the Government of Greece, Spain and Portugal.

title: Philbin to Practice Next Week; Jets'
description: As the New York Jets began to prepare for Sunday's game against the Buffalo Bills, they received a mixed medical re port yesterday on Steve Thompson, John Schmitt and Gerry Philbin.

title: FOOD STAMP PLAN ATTACKED IN SUIT
description: Officials of the Feueral Food Stamp Program were ordered yesterday to show next Mon day why their procedures are not illegal. A suit filed by three poor persons here contends that applicants are being illegal ly turned away when they ap ply for the stamps.

title: Tropical Storm Dwindles
description: MIAMI, Sept. 28 (UPI) Downgraded from a tropical storm to a tropical depression, Greta wandered westward to day into the Gulf of Mexico, where it was expected to break into minor squalls.

title: War Casualties
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 28 (AP) The Defense Department an nounced today the names of the following servicemen from the New York area as having been killed in Southeast Asia:

title: Goldberg Urges Hometown Peace Corps
description: Arthur J. Goldberg said yesterday that he would create, if elected Governor, hometown peace corps to fight drugs, teach preschool children, organize community projects and prove that the state was not sunk in despair and cynicism.

title: House Approves Nixon Plan For Environmental Agency
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 28 (Ap) The House approved today President Nixon's plan to center Government activities dealing with environment in a new En vironmental Protection Agency.

title: Booz, Allen and Salomon Fill Key Positions
description: Booz, Allen & Hamilton, Inc., worldwide consulting and engineering organiza tion, announced yesterday the promotion of three top officers with a combined total of 70 years service to head the new management team, effective Thursday.

title: Queens Area to Get More Police In a Project to Prevent Crime
description: The Police Department is planning a pilot project in a lowcrime area in North Queens to prevent the escalation of crime, a department spokesman said yesterday.

title: Market Place:
description: The death of Egypt's Ga mal Abdel Nasser won't cause the stock market, to go into tail spin, in the opinion of a class of men who are charac teristically optimistic in the face of unsettling news.

title: Davits Pitches In at Goodell Rally Here
